review_text_1: I am a tough customer but this camera is outstanding in every aspect. It's picture is clear and sharp, not fuzzy or grainy. The night vision is fantastic, I have mine set on color mode. The LED flood lights light up a large area and are very bright, a great feature and can be turned on or off. Day or night, the camera view distance is impressive, I can see all 4 acre's of my property and well beyond that. I am still learning about the motion detection sensitivity, playing with that now to adjust to my liking. The siren is another great bonus along with the voice communication. Each of those can be turned on or off. Don't bother paying hundreds of dollars on other cameras, this camera exceeded my expectations in every way. I hope to add photos and video when I have more time. I highly recommend the BOAVISION PTZ camera. UPDATE 2/2021; this is one tough camera! It fell off mount from second story of my house (my own fault) and still works perfectly
review_text_2: I can't say enough great things about this camera! Great picture night or day. Digital zoom, LED lights for color night vision and lights my way too. It tracks me from the vehicle to the house or anything else that goes past. The App is decent as well. Price was good and it exceded my expectations.
review_text_3: We ordered 2 of these cameras prior to going on our vacation so we could watch and talk to our fur baby while we were gone, as well as a little more security for our son that house sat for us. I was kinda hesitant because they were fairly cheap and didn't think they would work well especially if we were out of state trying to watch but to my surprise THEY WORKED VERY VERY WELL!! We were able to talk to our fur baby "Dezi" shes our dog, and listen to her lol... We are definitely going to be buying a few more now that we know they work so well. We have also told alot of our family and friends how good these cameras work!!! We give these BOA Vision cameras 5 stars!!!!
review_text_5: What will I say it‚Äôs still in the testing stages now and they work fine in the winter weather and it clear at night and I do love the zoom on it and the WiFi connection is also great,I bought a different brand before these and I have been having pure problems with it,these have never cut out or need rebooting etc and I will buy one more to replace the different brand that I bought first because it just not working as it should and there is no support website for that brand,I do hope Amazon work with me to refund me or something

review_header_1: Great security camera at a value price!
review_header_2: Good price, larger than expected,  video picture could be better at 30 feet.
review_header_3: Nice, clear videos and sound - all with motion tracking
review_text_3: I am most impressed by this camera's motion tracking capability. As I move around, the camera keeps pointing to me.When I followed the instructions in the enclosed user manual, the setup went quickly. I hooked up a network cable attached to my PC to the camera which seemed to speed up the setup process. Once setup and sync'd to my phone, I was able to unplug the camera from the PC and put it in various rooms in our house. Eventually, I put it in our garage to monitor our cars and tools. I did notice that the higher up I put the camera, the better it was at following any motion and alerting to sounds.Their phone app works great. It allows complete control over the camera. Via the phone, you can adjust where the camera is pointing; rotate the image; set a time for the camera to go on and a time for it to go off; adjust the motion and sound detection sensitivity; and sync it with Alexa/Echo Show.It's built-in microphone and speaker allows for 2-way audio as well as 24/7 viewing and recording. It's night vision can be set for color (via it's led lights), or just black and white. You can choose to have its recording sent to the SD card or to their subscription cloud service.It's a sturdy, well built indoor/outdoor waterproof camera that can be mounted in various positions with the included mounting base.
review_text_5: Easy setup camera that can work with a cloud subscription or a Micro TF card.Let's start with the setup. You will have to download the YI IoT app ANS can then connect via numerous options. I used the wifi option and it literally took a couple of minutes with the account ID/PW setup included.You will scan a QC barcode with the camera and it will process the test of the steps on its own. As simple as I've seen and I have numerous cameras with different functionalities.The camera itself is a tilt and pan with a 180 degree view. Best to be setup high as it can detect motion below as well. You can also zoom in on the view via the app and pinching the picture with two fingers.Very good picture quality both in normal lighting and in dark mode. Pictures include one in each mode and it's hard to tell which one was in the dark.The camera also includes two way audio and I am impressed with the quality. My main outdoor cameras are a bit muddled but this speaker was crystal clear.You can add multiple cameras and the cloud subscription is good for up to five cameras.Good camera, can be used indoor or outdoor, good picture and sound quality, and gives your everything you need for a solid security camera.

The image quality is superb and I can even zoom in closer on the image. My dog walks around in the house and jumps to the sofa sometimes. It did follow her movement automatically thanks to its motion tracking feature. I can see her all day long. Absolutely love this camera!
review_text_2: Ok let me just start out by saying OH MY GOODNESS is this camera amazing!! 360 degrees to keep a watchful eye on my babes! Also, remote access so that my sweet parents can also watch her when they can‚Äôt be around her (hence this quarantine)!The price!!!!! Well worth it and reasonable! The last monitor I had was over $100 and it died just short of its warranty and could not be sent back. Very very VERY pleased with this product.This product also is easy to mount! No weird angle that you need to attach to the wall then screw in the cams!! NOPE attach then click in the cam! Wonderful!
review_text_3: I have the Nooie 1080P indoor camera and I've been quite happy with it so I had to give this 360-degree model a try. It takes the features of the static camera and adds the ability to pan and tilt the camera either manually or you can enable motion tracking easily through the app. I wrote a review for the static camera and many of the features carry over including its great video quality so if you've read that review, some of this will seem familiar.Setup -Setup was very simple using your phone or tablet, running the free Nooie Cam app. You first need to verify that your phone is connected to the 2.4Ghz access point in your home where you will be using the camera. You then simply start the Nooie Cam app and select the +Camera button. You select the Nooie Cam 360 option and it will walk you through the remaining, simple steps. Basically, you assure the camera is on, enter the password for the wireless access point/router your phone is currently connected to (this is the same one you will be connecting the camera to), click Next, and a QR code appears on the screen of your phone. You now hold the screen of your phone in front of the Nooie camera's lens and it provides an audible tone and LED light indicator when it is finished reading the QR code. The app will now inform you that it is pairing and will begin a countdown. When complete, the app will inform you that pairing has completed. It's that simple.Use -Now that the camera has been added, you simply select it to view the camera. To hear audio from the camera, you select the speaker icon within the app and now you are able to see and hear what's going on around the camera. The camera also has a built-in speaker that allows you to press the microphone button within the app and then speak through it. This is very useful and/or just fun depending on where you locate the camera. For example, I have the camera in my living room where my cat typically spends a good part of her day. If you have cats, I'm guessing yours is similar where she doesn't have one place that she always lays within a room. She instead has multiple locations that she'll randomly select. With this 360 degree camera, either from home, from work, a restaurant, wherever I have WiFi or cellular access I can pan the camera from left to right and up or down. It's range is great where you can literally place the camera in the center of the room and, from the app, turn it from it's left side behind it all the way around front, through to the right side behind it just by swiping across the screen with the camera's image live the whole time. You can pan it around to see the entire room. Beyond this, you have the ability to tilt the camera up and down from the app as well by swiping up and down on the camera's image live. I can scan the room for my cat, locate her, and then touch the microphone to talk to her. Being a cat, she chooses whether she wants to respond or not. Sometimes her ears just perk up and she whines (which you can hear through the camera's built-in microphone), but other times she'll choose to walk over to the camera and give it some love. :)If you choose to use the Motion Tracking feature, if your cat, or anything really, moves in front of the camera's lens, the camera will follow it. As the moving option moves close to the edge of the camera's current visibility, the camera will move to center the moving object within it's vew and continue doing this until the moving object either stops moving or moves behind something where the camera can no longer see it. One thing to note with automatic Motion Tracking is the camera can pan 360 degrees. If something moves and the camera ends up pointing in a different direction than the next moving object. The next moving option must move in front of the lens at some point for the camera to see it and start tracking it. Depending on where you mount the camera and your use, this may be fine or it may not. So, definitely think about this before placing the camera if you plan to enable Motion Tracking.Video and audio can be recorded to either a microSD card or to the cloud. Cloud storage is a paid service. Given my usage, microSD recording is fine for me so I haven't tried the cloud storage option. MicroSD recordings are easily accessed through the app via a scrollable tape across the bottom of the screen. You select the day and then scroll through to the time you would like to view. If at any time you are viewing live video or recorded video from the app and you would like to save the video to your device, you simply press the camera icon on screen to set the start point, continue watching the video as it plays, and press the icon again when you'd like to stop and the video will be saved to your device. It's VERY easy!Like other security cameras, you can also setup notifications based on sound and/or motion. This too is easy to configure by selecting None, Low, Medium, or High for each option and then selecting the timeframe that you would like to receive notifications. Note that you can enable disable notifications by day, but each day only has one start time and one end time that can be selected. Meaning, you cannot setup notifications from 8am-5pm and then again 10pm to midnight for the same day. You could do one or the other, but not both. I don't see this as a problem for me, but it's worth noting depending on your use case.There are a few additional notable settings. First is the ability to enable/disable audio recording. I haven't done much testing with this, but I'd imagine this could save some space on your microSD card, allowing you to possibly record more video if disabled. Second is the ability to enable/disable the small LED light on the camera. If you placed the camera in a visible location in your home, you may want to disable the LED to avoid the distraction of it. Last, there is a Rotate Image option. So, if you need to mount the camera under an overhang, cabinet, etc., you can simple tap this button to flip the image for mounting the camera upside down and now viewing it live or recorded video will display right-side up.Customer Service -I reached out to Nooie's customer service prior to purchasing my previous camera as I had a number of questions. I received quick, thorough responses the same day, shortly after I had sent them. I worked with Julia who was great to work with. Very friendly, personable, and understanding. Julia's customer service was great and made the decision to purchase this camera a complete no-brainer. As I'm sure many of you know, when you have questions or something goes wrong you really find out what a company is made of. I'm happy to say Nooie's support is great! Regarding this camera, I had a few questions for Nooie support prior to purchasing it and received the same great, prompt responses. This proved even moreso that their support is great! It wasn't just a one time fluke with the first camera.Summary -This camera works great and has clear video. The two-way communication capability is an added bonus and could open up its use to more than just a security camera. It's ability to automatically track motion as well as it's ability to turn 360 degrees while automatically tracking motion and/or by manually swiping the screen coupled with it's low price point of under $40 makes this a great buy in my book! I am definitely glad that I added this camera to my home. It will work well keeping track of not only the cat, but I can see when my teenager comes and goes when I'm not home.

review_text_1: Camera very easy to configure in addition to having the possibility of not charging the battery thanks to its very good solar panel, the battery was almost fully charged at the factory but once the solar panel was installed in a few hours the configuration was fully charged with the The application is very easy and compatible with the cameras of the same brand that I have installed in my house, its images are very clear both in video and in photographs that are programmed at a specific time if you want automatically the price-quality ratio and operation are reasonable and satisfactory the highlight that makes me very happy is not worrying about having to be connected the power every time its battery level drops since the solar panel is very practical and effective the application to access the camera is very nice . pets in my yard I recommend to anyone who wants to protect and increase their security this camera for its price and quality I will continue to try it to make an update of its operation and recommendations in general I feel safer with my family and confident in its good operation and as a novelty angles of movement that I can use remotely.
review_text_2: Last yeah, we actually saw moose in our ER for the first time. Since then, because of cobit I believe, many wildlife has been out and about in our area. We also have a birdhouse where we get various animals and luckily we don't have black bear so far but it's very interesting to see different animals with this camera.The installation is very easy and the setup is simple with the app, the camera was up and running within a few minutes. The solar panel seems to be charging the camera even during cloudy days and we have not had any issue with charging the internal battery.It has me several times already and had snow for the first time the other day but camera works beautifully in the PTZ control works amazingly well!
review_text_3: Definitely like these cameras. 3 cameras covered my whole house. Like the pan tilt feature,and the intercom on it. Picture quality is very good night and day. Definitely 5 stars from me.
review_text_4: This is a solar powered camera, the app to download is called CloudEdge and it‚Äôs was an easy set up, the motion sensor picks up everything, the images is clear, you can talk true this as well, a bonus is that the camera can pan and move around so you really don‚Äôt need two cameras to see the front of your house!
review_text_5: The camera was fairly easy to set up. It took several tries to pair it with the Wi-Fi but every device I have ever added like this requires several attempts to pair. Customer service was excellent I used the chat to communicate with customer service. They were very patient and helpful. I had a problem with the wording they used to instruct you to create a password. The technician directed me and sent me a sample password to use to login and from there he checked back with me several times to make sure that the set up was complete and I had no more questions. I do not know what time zone they are in but the customer service rep that I was chatting with was up with me until almost midnight. If you buy as many gadgets as I buy that need technical support I can tell you that the customer support is most definitely excellent. I purchased this camera because I bought a beach house in Mexico and it is made out of concrete. There is nowhere to run cables so this is just perfect there are no cables so all you need is the sun and a Wi-Fi connection and you are good to go

review_header_2: Great Camera and features  for the price
review_header_4: Awesome outdoor PTZ camera for the price.
review_text_1: This is not my first Hosafe cam, for a reason. These guys make great cams, and they have great customer support. I needed a cam for my back deck but I also needed a new porch light. This jewel solved both problems.The cam was easy to set up, just make sure you are on the 2.4 wifi. Simple to follow the instructions and you will be up and running in about 5 minutes. I use Ispy connect to monitor my cameras at home but I have the app on my phone when away.The camera is very customizable see photo 4 Using the HiCam app on your phone you can find the ip address of the camera ; go to settings>Device Info and the IP will be displayed. Type that IP into IE and you have access to lots of settings see photos. They have great customer support. I have NO, and I do mean ZERO complaints about any Hosafe cam I own. They have proven to be very reliable, I have had the outdoor cam for about 4 yrs + , the indoor ptz cam for about 3yrs and even though it has taken some abuse because of being in a chicken coop it works great. I highly recommend any Hosafe produce you may be interested in. Did I mention, they have great customer support.
review_text_2: This is one of several Hosafe cameras I have in use at my home and business. Hosafe customer service has always been excellent and quick to respond. That said, this latest and newest camera they are offering is a good value for the price.The many features are very appealing, but their execution needs some development. More on that later. First, when taken out of the well packed box I was surprised that the camera is very light and made of mostly plastic (assume the UV rays of South Florida don‚Äôt deteriorate the material as some plastics in the sun) and lighter weight to install. While the large dongle of wires (mostly the RJ 45 LAN connector) that usually are protruding out the bottom of the mounting base, this wire bundle exits out of the side of the base making wire management a bit more tricky if you want to hide them and protect their connection points. With the quicker set up on these newer cameras not requiring a hard wire to the router initially, I think the RJ 45 connector could be eliminated assuming you are only going to use the wifi connection which in reality is why you buy a ‚Äúwifi‚Äù camera! That would eliminate the need to drill a ¬Ω or larger hole to run those wires. As I have with the past 3 installations, I choose to mount my cameras on an outdoor plastic electrical box to terminate the wires and ease of attachment to the building. But this time instead of a large hole in the box cover under the base of the camera, I had to route the wire into the side of the box as shown in the photo. A bit tricky to keep it weather tight with a grommet.Now the features: The LED light source that comes on with motion is pretty bright and a welcome addition to illuminating the subject area and obtaining full color pictures at night. There is also an audible alarm but I am not using that for a good reason‚Ä¶ the sensitivity of motion adjustment is adjustable but even at the lowest setting in the app, it is triggered with least bit of wind movement and even insects at night. So, the light is triggered often (that is ok with me) and that alarm would be a nuisance. The same problem comes into play with the other cool feature; motion tracking of the pan and tilt mechanism. Great feature and as stated, not real quick for fast moving objects but with the ultra-sensitive motion detection, it moves much too frequently. Also the range is pretty limited so as the subject moves out of the range (about 10 meters) the camera returns ‚Äúhome‚Äù and the subject is now out of the picture. Again, a great feature, but a bit of a delay upon motion ending and much broader sensitivity setting would be big improvement on these new features.Overall, the image is very clear and adequate resolution. Night vision (without the LED light on) is very good as expected. Wifi with the dual antenna is about average for me. I am only getting 60% on an outside, side wall about 15 meters line of site (through the house). My other cameras on the front side which are about half the distance are 100% signal strength with only 1 antenna. Your results may be better as there are many variables controlling wifi strength from inside to outside.The other great feature and the main selling point for me is you not only can use an SD card for image and video capture, but it is also ONVIF compatible to use the many camera security monitoring programs like Blue Iris and others. I am still experimenting with camera control on Blue Iris as it is registering with ‚Äúgeneric‚Äù camera and all the features do not seem to be accessible so far.Lastly, the two-way audio works well and is another great feature for an inexpensive camera like this. I would buy it again.
review_text_3: This camera is quite impressive for its price. This is my first IP camera I have bought since 2008 and wow. The technology has sure quickly advanced.This camera has HD video and Audio. It does look very nice. The camera set up was so easy! I got confused at first, but then I read the instructional book and it put me back on track. Wifi set up was a breeze. Don‚Äôt forget to buy a microSD card for it, so you can record and store video. The auto tracking is impressive, the PTZ function is so fluid.Overall, very impressed. You will be too.Thanks HoSafe!
review_text_4: I've been hunting around for a decent, inexpensive outdoor PTZ camera. Other models I'd tried claimed to have ONVIF compatibility but never did. So far, this camera exceeds the requirements I put in place with only some minor caveats.First off, the design. The shell is made of plastic and is generally very light. While I'd prefer a metal case, the light weight of the case should make it easier to mount. The connections are all on a pigtail coming out the right side of the base. I'd prefer for them to be say receesed in the base or something, but nothing we can't work around! Other than that, the design is what you'd expect from a dome camera.Next, configuration. Power comes from a 12v 1A transformer with a 5.5mm jack. The cord provided is very short but it's a common size and will be easy to replace with something longer. Plugging it up and connecting it to my network brings me to my next point I highly recommend this camera. Unlike others that require some APP to configure the camera, this one just works. It's assigned an IP address and then you can log right into it and begin configuring it as needed. While an APP is available for both Apple and Android, just log into the camera! Through the web config, it only takes a few minutes to enable WIFI and connect it to your network. I want to mention how this camera is truly ONVIF compatible. Some other cameras claim this but aren't. In the case of this camera, it's instantly picked up using ONVIF Device Manager and can be configured this way. Massive thumbs up from me!Image quality is good and about what I expected from the camera. During the day, it's a little over saturated and too sharp. Tweaking tweaking the settings slightly improved the image greatly. Though what really sets this camera apart from similar models is the inclusion of flood lights. I've included a quick comparison of no lights, flood lights and then standard IR lights. Both uses of lights provide good images in the dark. Flood lights give you color at a shorter range with IR being black and white but showing more detail further out.The PTZ control is very good too. My other indoor PTZ cameras have always been very choppy and nearly impossible to make minor changes. This camera on the other hand is much smoother and allows for very minor bumps in adjustment. It also will remember it's last location if power is lost! Something none of my other PTZ cameras seem to do (without additional settings).All in all, I'm happy with this camera. I think my only real complaint is the how short the power cable is. But given the going price for this camera, you can add an extension still keep the price around if not lower than some similar cameras.
review_text_5: We bought two of these to install one by our front door and one over the garage door. I liked the quality so much,I bought a third to use in our back yard. Great for a security camera, but I'm thinking this might captured images of all the birds that visit. Already plugged in and working. For those buying this item, the included manual is a bit small to read easily, but it does explain installation. The app "Camhipro" is necessary for install, and I can control all three from one device. I used an old smart phone for the cameras so I left the app off my active phone! That way one has complete control, access to all the images, mic and speaker work fine, but does not interfere with voice or text communication. GREAT DEAL, QUALITY PRODUCT AT A GREAT PRICE!

review_text_2: The camera arrived promptly. Installation is easy. Just need to make sure you have good WIFI connection at the location where you put the camera.The base and the body is white and it is harmonious with all different environments when putting on furniture, window, etc.Streaming is fast, you can select different video quality. The motion detect function comes with a wonderful feature named "Motion verfication", when enabled, it just sends warning when detecting human figure.The night vision is very good. This camera comes with a Micro SD Slot, you can insert Micro SD card to save video on. It also has microphone and speaker, which you can use it to communicate with the person who is around the camera.
review_text_3: After receiving it, I installed it immediately and installed it in the baby's bedroom. I could view all the baby's activities in real time. The image was really clear and gave me a feeling of safety, which was really great
review_text_4: We'd tried 3 different indoor and outdoor surveillance camera brands, we stayed with one brand for a week, didn't like the way it dropped wifi connection every 20mnts, we purchased another brand and we have it for almost 7 months now, we need 4 more and purchased this brand just to check how it works and we like it a lot that we ordered 3 more that are coming today 2/15/21.Easy to setup, no need to go into settings as soon as night comes to change to night vision, it does it by itself and stays with color view.2 way talk mode sounds it's almost perfect both way.We have the camera looking outside our front door window for deliveries as you can see in the pictures, taken day and night.The only thing that it needs, it's a rotating head, we had to set it in a way to see our door and persons coming with deliveries.There is a PC/Mac application but it needs BlueStacks to get it to work, for me it does not work, even thou I'm running W10, 32gb of ram, it freezes when I open it to setup the camera, if anyone knows a better way to run the app, please let me know, thanks.I'll post later with the new cameras in case I run into any problems.Without a doubt I recommend this camera.
review_text_5: I wanted an outdoor camera but didn‚Äôt want the hassle of installation so I bought this indoor camera to sit in the window. Nice wide angle. Great night vision. At first couldn‚Äôt install due to WiFi being 5G in my house but the next day tried it again and with my mobile phone right next to the camera it connected. Great camera for the price!

review_header_1: Very good coverage, low latency and wide coverage
review_header_5: great HD clarity. Good night vision
review_text_1: This IMOU camera has very good coverage with pan-tilt control in the smartphone. I cannot hear any noise when doing the pan-tilt movement. One surprise is that this camera has one privacy cover that can be controlled via smartphone. Another advantage is the super low video latency (almost less than 1/4 second). The sound latency is normal around 1s.I always want to have one camera with pan-tilt control that can cover the whole room without using multiple cameras. I purchased one Samsung SMARTCAM A1 (only can pan the camera up to 350¬∞ not tilt) before, however, the software is very hard to use and cost me more than $200. I also checked other famous brands like Ring and Arlo, but they just do not have any camera that supports pan-tilt control. Mi has one pan-tilt control camera, but I have some problems with the night vision of other Mi cameras. There is a clear "click" sound when the night vision is switched on. When the room has some light and not full dark, the camera's night vision will switch on and off frequently and causing lots of "click" sound. So far, I did not notice the "click" sound problem in this IMOU camera. I did experience one connection error in the initial setup, but I retried again and it works smoothly. I think the initial connection problem is caused by the permission issues in the iPhone. The IMOU camera can automatically connect to the device's wifi without letting you go to the Setting and manually switch wifi. This feature requires the permission in iOS to allow the device to access the local network, after I accepted this permission, the connection is very smooth.
review_text_2: What a value for the money. Delivers on everything it advertises and more. The picture quality for both day and night settings is great. The app is packed with features and easy to use. I will be ordering more.I had settled on this/these camera rather than a full ip camera (NVR) system due to the major price difference. I was willing to sacrifice the ip streaming and local recording in order for ease of setup and to save a few bucks. I was poking around in the settings and come to realize this camera supports RTSP (realtime streaming protocol) which allows setup with most security camera software. I am impressed by this capability in such an affordable camera.My only gripe (and it is a small one) is that the motors that move the camera were virtually silent when I received the cameras, however now that I have had them mounted (inverted/upsidedown) for several days, you can hear every time the camera tracks motion. I am not sure if this is a result of me mounting the cameras upside-down or not, however I assumed this was alright to do since the settings give you the option to invert the output stream. Clearly this was not big enough of a deal for me to take away a star on the rating.
review_text_3: I love this camera. I got it because I have a lot of house deliveries and they come inside the house. Where I have the camera it catches the front door, back door, and my windows. I can see everything on my phone. It even accommodates my two cats.
review_text_4: Set up was a bit dicey but once I figured it out, what a great camera. I can share with my family and even talk to them. Exceeds what I wanted from this device. Excellent choice!
review_text_5: I like it but I'm just no happy that I have to use another app to open it. I have another camera but it won't combine with another app.

name: Amcrest 4MP Outdoor PTZ POE + IP Camera Pan Tilt Zoom (Optical 32x Motorized) UltraHD POE+ Camera Security Speed Dome, People and Vehicle Detection AI, 492ft Night Vision POE+ (802.3at) IP4M-1083EW-AI
review_header_3: I cannot find anything I don't like about this camera
review_header_4: Best security camera I have used
review_text_1: The Amcrest 4MP Outdoor PTZ POE + IP Camera Pan Tilt Zoom (Optical 32x Motorized) UltraHD POE+ Camera is a great high resolution camera with optical elements that are unique to this equipment. Starting with a rugged, dependable build and ending with cutting edge electronics, the Amcrest Amcrest 4MP Outdoor PTZ POE + IP Camera offers a range of features most other cameras don‚Äôt. Below are a list of pros and cons, followed by some suggestions for potential improvement.Cons:No speaker for talkback includedNo microphone included for the listen function (there is wiring in place to connect external speaker and microphone, but such accessory is not included and would have to be purchased separately; also a quick search on amcrest.com does not find such accessory, maybe a third party/).Camera switches to nighttime even as light appears to be sufficient and abundantHaving trouble focusing when zooming in, faces are out of focus, blurred and with apparent image ghostingLarge and heavyFisheye and privacy mode not availableAuto-Tracking not available in mobile appWhen on the mobile app, image ratio is either squeezed (portrait mode / vertical) or stretched (landscape mode / horizontal)Cloud app is laggy, with pan tilt relatively responsive but the image is significantly lagging behind with anywhere between 3 to 10 seconds delayExpensiveProsVery solid built, sturdy, all the components included, reliable hardware, screws and bolts, rubber washers - all to ensure a watertight installation (even gloves are included)Minimum lag on Amcrest View app (not the cloud app)Very responsive PTZGreat POE+ power function, No need for additional 24 V power or 110V power plug, just pull an ethernet cable connected to a POE+ switch, plug in the camera, scan the camera bar code with the app, and installation is done!Easy setup top with the existing appLocal storage and SSD card for up to 256GbGood iris control, good iris range - the iris opens very well allowing plenty of light.Potential improvements:Software:Improve software to coordinate zoom focus and Iris in a way that allows for better image clarity and less Image ghostingImprove mobile app (Amcrest Cloud) to display real size image (rather than stretched or squeezed)Hardware: ‚Ä®If possible reduce size and weight. On a large commercial property this may not be an issue, but on smaller residential buildings this camera may stand out.Include speaker/microphone for two way communication
review_text_2: Amcrest PTZ POE outdoor camera is build like a tank. Very well constructed with metal double enclosure (for protection from heat of the sun I suppose) and sturdy and thick aluminum mount. This surveillance camera is a serious business with 32x optical zoom and motorized dome. You can control pan with full turn 360¬∞ angle and 90¬∞ tilt. Camera can move quickly or slowly and is completely silent all the time. It uses a very good motor for sure. Picture quality is stunning and you can see every smallest detail on your property in Ultra HD resolution. To connect camera you will need just Ethernet cable connected to POE+ switch. You also need to download the App and get the camera to your network. You can watch and control video on a phone, iPad, computer or NAS.It can be connected to NVR as well which I actually did. I connected the camera to my existing surveillance system Hikvision NVR via ONVIF protocol and it started working immediately. Even PTZ control works well from my NVR. Amazing compatibility. It also has paid cloud storage support or you can just record video or events to onboard microSD card. Camera has a nice web UI with lots of settings. You can program camera movement as you wish, there are many features and functions here. Night vision works pretty good and camera focus works well enough.Highly recommend product if you have large property.
review_text_3: I've been waiting on Amcrest to step up their game and offer a new high-end ptz cam. Here it is. 32x optical zoom plus you can turn on 16x digital zoom. The latter is kinda buried in a menu but it IS there. This cam is like having a several thousand dollar Axis camera as one of my Blue Iris cams. Yes, it connected up to B.I. easily with no hassle. Great night and day vision. I have not dealt with the AI yet so I can't comment on that aspect. The zoom/ptz interaction works like a high end cam should. When you're zoomed way into something, the ptz is still easy to manage. You can add a 256gb card into it if you wish. Going to buy a 2nd one of these and retire an existing Amcrest 18x older ptz to some other duty. Oh, another thing: It's quiet. Even when you are next to it (and I was for several hours installing it), it's silent, even when doing a ptz move. This feature may be very useful for some of you. I've seen a lot of noisy ptz cams. This one is not. I have not turned on the defog option yet, so I'm unsure if that introduces any fan noises or not.
review_text_4: This is a very solidly built POE Camera.The installation of this camera was a breeze. I already had the Amcrest View Pro installed (for my other camera from Amcrest). So installing this camera as an additional device was very simple. The fact that it works using POE made my installation very easy as I didn't have a power connection near the garage where I have installed this camera. But, since I already had an ethernet wire running there, I was just able to connect it to the existing ethernet wire and connect the other end to the POE Converter that I had bought earlier.This is a security camera that I have installed outside my garage in a spot that is kind of hidden so that no one can see the camera.The camera supports 256GB of memory. This will allow me to store a lot of recordings without having to delete occasionally.The zoom of this video is great. I was able to pan/zoom to see every minute detail of the person's face who was standing like 20 ft from the camera.The Camera price seems to be high. But, for the quality of this camera it might be worth it. I will know if I can use this to monitor any security intrusion at my house like the one I had earlier, when someone tried to break into my car parked outside the garage. But, we were not able to find out who it was as the face was hardly clear in the night mode with my existing security camera.Any integration with Alexa or similar services would be helpful.It is also nice that the camera can be broadcast live using RTSP so that it can be shared with anyone.The application also allows sharing the camera with other family members. That's a big plus. When I am out of home or do not have internet connectivity, my wife can monitor itOverall, I would give this a 4.7 out of 5 rating.
review_text_5: This camera is hands-down the best built camera I‚Äôve ever personally used or tested. The quality of the materials is second to none. The camera is heavy as you would expect it to be due to the high end components. The starlight sensor in it is incredibly accurate and detailed in low light. The night vision reach that I‚Äôm able to get with it is quite incredible. It‚Äôs easily almost twice the distance that most other more consumer oriented cameras have. The PTZ motors and components are whisper quiet and fast. There are no weak, shaky or dead spots in the camera travel. I can set it to a position I need with incredible ease. The 32x optical zoom is also pretty fantastic and leaves nothing to be desired. It will go super far. I didn‚Äôt find myself feeling the need to turn on the additional 16x digital zoom. I also love that it has two sub streams in addition to the main stream. That is incredibly helpful in more complicated blue iris setups. The AI seems to be working well also. This camera is incredibly smart and fast. It isn‚Äôt held back by buggy firmware. It reacts quickly and smoothly. This camera is a great ‚Äúeye in the sky‚Äù type of camera. I can get tag numbers and critical details reliably due to the excellent specifications of this camera. The included mounting hardware and cables are all excellent quality and instructions are concise and clear on how to get it all mounted and hooked up with ease. The multiple options for powering the camera are nice as well. Another welcome addition is the trip wire hookup. That isn‚Äôt something you typically see on the smaller, cheaper cameras. My only request would be that the camera have a small speaker and microphone built in for situations in which hooking up an external mic and speaker aren‚Äôt feasible. However, amcrest has many other options for these use-cases as well. I‚Äôm incredibly happy with amcrest as a company and this camera is nothing short of amazing.

name: TETHYS Wireless Security Camera 1080P Indoor [Work with Alexa] Pan/Tilt WiFi Smart IP Camera Dome Surveillance System w/Night Vision,Motion Detection,2-Way Audio,Cloud for Home,Business, Baby Monitor
review_header_2: Security camera with clear picture, 350o views, and audio
review_header_3: Totes mah goats worth the money
review_text_1: I have to admit I‚Äôm pretty impressed with this camera considering the cheap price. I was looking for a camera to put in my son‚Äôs room so that I don‚Äôt have to follow him upstairs all day long but can still keep an eye on him.The night vision works great. So far the pictures have been very clear. I also really like the fact that you can use this camera live, so you don‚Äôt necessarily need an SD card, unless you want to record and don‚Äôt want to buy the cloud service. I do plan on buying another camera for my living room so I will be inserting a micro SD in that camera.I will admit I had a very difficult time connecting the camera to my router. I have dual band WIFI through XFinity. The first time I tried to connect the camera it didn‚Äôt work. So I did some research and managed to separate my Wi-Fi into the two separate bands: 2.4 GHz and 5 GHz. (I had them together under one name and password.) I attempted to connect the camera to the router several more times after that but it still wouldn‚Äôt connect. I ended up spending an hour trying to connect the camera to no avail.Finally I noticed in the little instruction booklet that it says you can connect your camera directly through the modem (a modem cable is included in the box the camera came in.) Lo and behold I was able to connect the camera within just a few minutes. I then went into the app and changed the setting from modem to WIFI. I sincerely wish I had tried this method within the first few minutes of failing to connect through the Wi-Fi because it would‚Äôve saved me a lot of time and effort. (There was no need to separate the two bands. Ugh!)I hope this helps anyone else who may be having a difficult time connecting their camera.Overall, great little piece of equipment!
review_text_2: I was a little intimidated about setting up this camera. But I followed the directions slowly and calmly, one step at a time, and everything worked with ease. What fun. The picture is really clear. It is cool that you can move your fingers on the camera screen, wherever you are, and the camera head will rotate accordingly. So you can scan the whole room (350o rotation). And the fact that it includes audio is awesome. So it could also be used as a baby monitor or to hear if your dogs are barking, etc. Or you could talk to the baby, dogs, other adults in the room. One drawback is that the camera has to be connected to USB/power. That greatly limits where I can use it. The instructions are very good for setup, but then it is lacking in real directions on how to use it in everyday use. Most things you can figure out for yourself. Although I have an Alexa device, I was not able to use it with Alexa because it requires an Alexa screen device as well. But overall, I like this camera.
review_text_3: Well this little beauty is sweet. It came within 24 hours (thanks Amazon Prime) and in a nice little box and set up was a breeze (iPhone user). Once you download the application via the App Store, the instructions walk you through set up step by step. You do need your WiFi login, and it does not support 5G WiFi. The sound it makes is a little weird during pairing with WiFi/router connecting but it‚Äôs temporary, so you‚Äôll get over it, your sleeping newborn- maybe not so much. Once your set up is complete, you can change the settings for motion detection notification and also sensitivity. I tried stealth mode of moving really slow and also trying to play flash lightening and it caught me on both and sent a notification to my phone of said sloth intruder or lightening McQueen in the house. It has a two way speaker so really nice to be able to yell at the dogs or scare the bejeezus out of your roommate. I‚Äôm shocked at the picture quality. I was going to upload a picture of myself in it, but the quality is good that I needed a filter- maybe on their next update. Also, kind of cool that nightmode has its own settings (and throwing it back to the 40s with no color to set the Friday the 13th ambiance) so just in case you want to catch ghosts on camera, I‚Äôm sure you can set it to Orb sensitivity. Overall, really great quality product and totally worth the money.
review_text_4: Alright so first off, the price. At 30fps and 1080 with all the extra features. It seemed to good to be true. With that being said, I was eager to play with this one. It comes nicely packaged and about the size of a soda can. Has a two hole mount that can be screwed on many surfaces, walls, ceilings. The mount is an easy twist on so the camera can be taken down with ease. The Picture quality honestly blew me away for a 1080. There‚Äôs a lot of 1080s out there that just plain suck. Tethys is true to their word on this one. The night vision is slightly under what they say it can do (32ft I believe) but it‚Äôs still plenty of range for your buck. The camera movement is smooth as well. You just swipe down to go up and left to go right and so on. The set up was a little bit of a pain until I realized the manual said something different than what the app tells you to do. Basically just have the camera and your phone right next to the router and it hooks up in seconds. Took me a few tries to realize this. The interface on the app is Fairly easy and any beginner can figure it out. The cloud service does cost money I‚Äôm not sure how much. All in all this thing is hard to beat for the price and features packed into it. In the photos in my living room there is a sign way back by the kitchen. The next photo is the camera zoomed in on it to show the quality.
review_text_5: Unit was defective when received. Was asked to move to different locations to see if it would help. I did that and after many tries, it still refused to work wihout the irriataing beep,beep either immediately, or after several ours or days.They want me to pay the return shipping. I won't buy from them again!UPDATE:Original Purchase date Nov.30 2019. Today Feb. 24 2020.I finally did get a replacement and this one works very well. Tethys did send the replacement at no cost and sent a prepaid return label to return the defective camera. They are nice cameras. I bought 2 the first time and only one worked, but after several email exchanges, Tethys made good on their warranty and paid the shipping both ways. Tethys truly seemed to wanted to do the right thing after our email conversations, so I am changing my rating to five stars, 4.5 would be more accurate as it did take longer than it should have to resolve the issue. I do belive the product is a quality item, and I just received a defective one the first time. And I would now buy again from them.

description: eufy Security Solo IndoorCam P24 Protects You, Your Family, and Your Privacy Every eufy Security product is engineered to ensure your security data is kept private. Have peace of mind that you will have a secure record of everything that happens around your home. Know When You Are Needed The built-in AI notifies you of excessive noise levels so you know when your little one needs some attention. Activity Zones Only receive the alerts that matter. Customize the area in which detection takes place to suit your home. Sight at Night Advanced night vision allows you to keep an eye on any room, even in low light. 360¬∞ Check-Up Get a full view of the entire room at the press of a button. What‚Äôs Included: 1x eufy Security Indoor Cam Pan & Tilt, 1x USB Adapter, 1x USB Cable, 1x Mounting Bracket, 1x Screw Pack, 1x Quick Start Guide Notes: Non-Waterproof HomeBase not compatible Requires MicroSD card (not included) Only supports 2.4GHz Wi-Fi connections Upgrade firmware to v.2.0.6.9 or newer When opening HomeKit, users must add the device in the eufy Security app and then complete the activation process. Does Solo IndoorCam P24 connect to eufyCam HomeBase? No, it is a standalone product which connects to the user's home Wi-Fi network.

review_header_1: This is the Wyze killer you've been waiting for but one security caveat
review_header_2: Nothing matches if for the price
review_header_4: Compact and well designed, love the HomeKit integration!
review_header_5: Great Bang for your Buck without Sacrifice
review_text_1: I've got and love 7 wyze cams and have setup another dozen+ at friends and family homes but they have started to falter with their services and I've had a few of them brick themselves during a firmware update and corrupt SD cards beyond repair.This Eufy has a far superior picture quality, better wifi reception (it has a full or strong signal where Wyze cams are weak or medium strength), the person and pet detection is built into the camera's AI instead of you having to pay for a cloud service, the notifications are FAST even on LTE with hardly any cool down at all. It also features NAS recording built in without having to fool with a custom firmware (which may be fixed now) but record to a NAS is easily setup in the recording menu of the EUFY and works perfectly.I do have 2 gripes with the camera...The main one is that there is no 2 factor authentication for my Eufy account. This is concerning because despite not being able to directly view footage or feed from a website, if you use a weak password, someone can theoretically login to the eufy app on their own smart phone and gain access to your camera. Fair enough so use a strong password right? What happens if a hacker decides they want to contact support posing as me and gives them a different email address and has customer support reset the password? I've experienced this and 2FA saved me. What security protocols does Anker support have to follow to ensure that they don't unknowingly unlock my account to someone else?Germany and Canada just recently got 2FA so hopefully the US is close behind. I will not be buying more of these until they get it and will be sticking with wyze until they implement 2fa. If they don't have it by the end of the year, I will update my indoor cams with something else, which may be a shame because right now, no one offers anything NEAR this good of image quality for the price. Maybe ring and Arlo will have an affordable 2k camera by then if Eufy/Anker don't get 2FA established for US customers.Gripe number 2 is that I wish the tilt could tilt a little lower. I tested the cam on a bookshelf and my mantle and it seems like it should be able to look down further than it does so you'd have to prop it up with something under the camera or something like that to get a better look if it's high on a shelf.Honestly, all cloud devices run a risk of some form of security breach. Nothing is bulletproof. I think that I'd be comfortable sticking these in the garage, a workshop, patio, etc.. somewhere outside but nothing on the inside of my home just yet until I know for sure that Anker support couldn't be socially engineered to give access to my account to someone besides me.
review_text_2: I have two of these cameras along with an Eufy doorbell and they are unmatched in my opinion. The A.I. can be set to only send notifications for people. When set for people it ignores cars, moving branches, lightning and animals. It really works as advertised. I have tried many brands of cameras and video doorbells and none can match the Eufy ability to reognize people and not be mislead by other movement. Try one and you will not regret it.
review_text_3: Best bang for your buck camera on the market. I own the 2k doorbell, vacuum and now indoor pan and tilt camera from eufy. They have exceeded my expectations. For a similar price you can find other cameras on amazon however I believe this camera paired along with the app is well worth it. I own outdoor cameras from another company and although the quality is good the app support is awful. That is why I believe eufy‚Äôs security line may be my future outdoor setup. The pan and tilt features are easily controlled with the app, notifications are instantaneous and quality is great and you have the ability to use local storage. Looking forward for this company to keep adding and improving their products.
review_text_4: The camera is compact and well designed, setup is super easy. The 2K images are impressive and the two-way audio is great. The smart AI been very good just sometimes individual false detections(I understand it is difficult to be 100% accurate).I‚Äôm Apple HomeKit user, this camera's HomeKit function works fine, and even supports HomeKit Secure Video! I am very satisfied with getting so many features at such a great price.
review_text_5: The image and build quality at this price point is truly hard to believe. This camera has both human and pet detection, either one can be turned on or off. The human detection is accurate, as is the pet detection. The really cool feature is that it snaps a face shot of whichever animal, human or pet, and has it as the icon on that particular event it was detected for a quick and easy determination of who set off the camera alert.There‚Äôs no going wrong with this camera. You‚Äôll need a micro sd card if you want to save events, or pay for cloud storage. Otherwise, use it for live viewing and there‚Äôs no additional costs.

review_text_1: I have not owned these cameras for very long but so far, they have been functioning very well. The picture quality is great, but you do lose some details when you zoom in. The microphone feature is nice to have, and the vocal clarity is great. I am currently trying a new location for one of the cameras, as I have decided to face it out the front window, but I can remotely move the field of vision back inside the house if desired.
review_text_2: I love these cameras! I have two of them in my house and would love to get a couple more! Some of the things I love about this camera are: (1) the ability to select which portion of an image (see photo) I want to receive notifications on, (2) the ability to save a preset view so that if I move it around, I can click the preset and go back to where I want it to stay, (3) the ability to talk through the camera, (4) the ability to turn off notifications for sound, and (5) NO MONTHLY SERVICE FEE! Although this one isn't made for outdoor use, I placed it inside my house looking out my front door and I'm able to spy on my packages and whenever someone approaches the house. I often use my camera to also talk to my kids when I can't get a hold of them. Ha ha! All in all, a GREAT device and will DEFINITELY be buying more for our home in the future!
review_text_3: The blurams cam was recommended by many you tubers and is hands down one of the best cameras I have purchased. We have it installed upside down and use it as a baby monitor. Installation was easy and fast, and the picture quality is great during the day and night time. I just still need to figure out how the SD card storage works.
review_text_5: I wanted to be able to keep an eye on my place when I'm not around especially when I travel. I've seen different devices but this one popped up on my screen so I decided to give it a try. It was very easy to set up. Let me tell you I highly recommend this camera it has night vision and can rotate from left to right there is also a button to talk which is awesome.

review_header_1: Easy installation, configuration , the quality of the videos exceeded my expectations.
review_header_2: Impressive High Quality Solar Powered Camera
review_header_3: Good outdoor camera system with solar recharging.
review_text_1: This solar panel wireless outdoor camera doesn't need home electricity to operate and function. The camera battery that is rechargeable can sustain a very long time without needing recharged. Installing it outside was super easy, three screws to your base and then put camera on it and tighten down with little screw tabs. Even the hookup is simple, the phone reads the QR info from the camera lens, the app takes you through it step by step.The 1080p HD video is excellent, both in live view and playback. Color night vision is also very good. The quality of the videos exceeded my expectations. I like the fact the camera can be panned remotely from your phone which allows a full panoramic view of our driveway and property. The voice intercom is an added feature and works very well.If someone comes to our side entry door we can pan to see who it is and use the speaker (two way speaker) to ask any questions before deciding whether we should open the door. Of course it's also great to see if Amazon or other vendor packages have been delivered. (Panning is done through the use of an icon on your mobile device) If you are looking for a camera but not wanting a huge investment or complicated installation, this one is perfect for that! I highly recommend it!
review_text_2: I have been wanting to add a ptz camera to the front of my house for a long time now. I wanted a solar charged unit so I did not have to hard wire the camera or climb a ladder to change or charge batteries frequently.The Ubox app has made things easy for sure, especially when it comes to pairing. You can hold out your phone in front of the camera with the QR code displaying and it will pair up. This worked first try for me. Picture quality is very clear, and the addition of the LED lights really help with night vision. No issues here.You can move the camera around from the app which is really cool and if you put it in the right place you can cover a ton of area. The solar panel holds 8 batteries. The motion detection is spot on and starts quickly, works much better than my old camera. Overall awesome high end security camera. Highly recommend it.
review_text_4: I have been trying out various Point Tilt Zoom (PTZ) cameras for years, and this one finally does everything it says! They are accessible everyday, and alert me to any visitors I get. I am able to mount these wherever I want outside without any cables or power runs!!I have found that you have to make sure you get a good sun angle or the batteries may not last all day. Once I find the right sun angle and position, they work seamlessly.The app is easy to use and intuitive. It works 98% of the time I access it.There are SD and HD options. If your SD card gets filled, it will automatically write over the oldest saved videos, so that is a nice feature if you don't have time to remove the videos yourself. We are very happy with this purchase so far.Really excellent product, would buy again! (and may still buy another 1-2 for the home)

review_text_1: I could not test it out, it could not be configured. I owe several Blurams cameras and this one was impossible to set up. I followed all troubleshooting steps, called Amazon, emailed Blurams (no response). So. I am returning it.Update 11/24 - Blurams support team provided good support.
review_text_2: Works great! Notifications slightly delayed, but not bad. This is a value for the good quality.
review_text_3: I love this camera. My only complaint is it has quite a few motion false alarms. There will be absolutely zero motion and I‚Äôll get a motion alert so I‚Äôve had to turn alerts off to only when someone appears and set it to low sensitivity. The night vision is great, the siren is nice and loud, and the install was ridiculously easy.

Equipped with 1080P full HD high definition real-time video quality and 4X digital zoom, Peasec helps you observe the details more clearly. At night, Peasec outdoor camera will auto-switch to night vision mode and accurately detect 33ft away motion.,AI Human Motion Detection With Siren; Adjustable 10 levels of motion sensitivity is designed for different needs. Smart AI humanoid algorithm helps Peasec catch human motion more precisely and avoid false alarms caused by inserts, branches, etc. Sound alarm mode has to been turned on manually to save more power. Under this mode, this wireless camera will sparkle and ring the alarm bell once motion is detected. Prompt sound alarm scares away the thief and protects your property promptly!,Solar-Powered, 100% Wireless; Peasec outdoor camera is solar-powered and battery-powered. With the solar panel, Peasec security camera almost supports 365 days of continuous power; even on cloudy or rainy days, the security camera can be powered by the battery and keeps working. No power cable is needed. 9.8Ft panel cable helps you install it anywhere like the garage, front door, etc. If you know nothing about security cameras, don‚Äôt worry! A detailed guide will be shown step by step in the App.,Two-way Audio, IP65 Waterproof; Peasec PTZ security camera supports 2-way audio with built-in noise cancellation speaker & MIC. When you are absent, you can still talk with postmen or friendly neighbors via this outdoor camera. Or install it in the backyard to monitor your young children when they are playing outside in case of an accident. IP65 waterproof certification makes it can be used outdoors. This solar camera works under -4‚Ñâ to 122‚Ñâthat it still works on rainy, scorching and snowy days.,Encrypted Information, Share with Your Family; Peasec battery camera supports Max 128G SD card storage and cloud service(7-day free trial). This outdoor camera has passed ISO27001 and ISO27701 certification. You can share the device with your families without worrying about information disclosure that they can access the security camera and watch the real-time video with you anytime anywhere. review_header_1: This was really easy to setup and get everything working great!
review_header_2: Better than the swann surveillance cameras thats for sure.
review_text_1: I have received this camera a week ago, so this may somewhat a preliminary opinion on it. I only had one problem in setting it up, and that was realizing that was indeed an user manual stored in the packing, inside the box. Once I found this it was simple to set up and put into operation. I had charged it prior to doing the setup. The user manual stepped me through the instillation of the software and connecting to my wireless network and I was up and running. I found the images to be crisp and clear, the PTZ functionality worked great. I have initially just used it in my inside living area and have not decided on its permanent hope yet. But I have to say the sending out alarms with pixel change works great, the night/dark camera recording is good as well. All of the mounting hardware you need to install it is included. I give it 5 stars as the only problem I had was finding the user‚Äôs manual and that was me not the camera or the packaging. I think the value for the price point is spot on and I look forward to having this setup outside to help watch over our home.
review_text_3: I like how easy it was to attach to our house and use. We don‚Äôt have a lot of outdoor outlets and we rely a lot on solar powered things. I will have to update some other time to see how it continues to work for us. We live in an ‚Äúinteresting‚Äù neighborhood, so we will see how it continues to work. I‚Äôm glad we found this product! Picture is clear that transmits to phone. Happy overall!
review_text_4: We have been using different cameras for years to monitor our dogs when we aren‚Äôt home. We always end up having to hard wire as the connection isn‚Äôt reliable. This camera was not only super simple to install, but also has a great connection distance! We have the camera placed over 100 feet away from the nearest router and it works like a charm. I love that I can change motion detection to not detect animal activity, but human activity. With so many dogs, we have to turn off motion detection as we end up with continual notifications. With this camera we see way fewer and much more accurate notifications. This is especially nice when we are away from home and can track if someone enters the kennel without our knowledge. We live in ND so I‚Äôm a little worried about the cold temperatures in the dead of winter, but I‚Äôm hopeful that if we keep it tucked in the corner by a building it will offer it enough shelter.
review_text_5: Came packed together beautifully! The video and audio are excellent. I am very satisfied with this purchase! We have it set up inside our home now but plan to move it outside in the future. We can speak through the camera and hear everything perfectly. The video is clear and the camera moves around to show so much more than I expected. I love love this buy!

review_header_1: Get it! This camera is awesome!

review_header_5: HiSeeu has improved again with a new camera with even more features...
review_text_1: First off, let me say this.... this company strives off customer service/satisfaction. I have never dealt with a company that goes over the top to help their customers. I wish every company had customer services like this company. Yes their products are great, but their customer service is even better. I love this company and will continue to use them for years to come!
review_text_2: Bought the camera a few weeks ago and I am so happy with my purchase. I am someone who is terrified of using power tools or any type of home improvement but I was able to hang the camera above my garage all by myself with no issues. Hooked it right up to the internet and set up was a breeze. I love that I can look down both sides of the street whenever I want and the picture is clear and night vision is awesome. It also picks up audio very well. It has a feature that allows you to switch the night vision from normal black and white to actual color which is awesome. I will be purchasing another for my backyard. I feel much more safe with it. I have included a picture of the actual camera & a screen shot of my driveway. If I were smarter, I'd post an actual video but I can't figure out.I will admit that if you give a 5 star review, you get a free prize but honest to goodness, my review is totally legit and has nothing to do with the prize which is why I waited a few weeks to give my review so I could have time to really feel it out.
review_text_3: I was originally quoted $1,256 for a system with 4 cameras, from a local dealer. It was too expensive for my budget, so I bought the 4 camera expandable system they have.Before ordering I had some questions about it, so I emailed Mr. Johnny from the company, and he responded within an hour, and answered everything I had concerns with. Tell me, which company answers customer emails within an hour??After testing and playing with that system, and finding out that it is so easy to set up, it is LEGIT plug-and-play. Since I wanted to be able to talk to someone at my front door, so I ordered the dome camera. I just played with this camera, and wow it is beyond good. I can CLEARLY talk to and listen to anyone, from their free app. This dome camera can also be controlled and rotated automatically through the app. And the floodlight is so bright it can light up the whole place.I played around with the cameras in the dark, in the light, with sounds, the microphone, etc. Overall, this system is as good or better than the professional systems that cost thousands that I have had in the past.This system is so good that it actually has AI face and body detection, and also notifies your phone each time it detects something.If you want a really good single camera or want to add on to your existing system, that is easy to use, and really well priced, legit get this system.
review_text_4: We added this to our existing NVR system. We feel even more secure with the 2 way audio. We were planning on purchasing a ring by Amazon before, but with this camera, the ring is no longer needed.Pros:- connects to our existing NVR system- works well on the app- able to view more with the PTZ viewing control.- 2 way audio should deter people from doing questionable activities- we placed it close to our motion sensor light so it will have great visibility even at night.Cons- a little bulky- I had a little trouble getting the video to show on our NVR system. Connection was easy. Video playback just took me some further looking into.Despite the cons, I still give it a 5-star since I was able to find a solution and the bulkiness isn't that big of a deal.
review_text_5: Notable upgrades in this latest release include FULL COLOR night vision using white LED's or more traditional IR night vision. Two way audio, built in siren, though I have not even tried that as I am scared of false alarms being a nuisance. If you are looking for an outdoor security camera you want it to handle as many functions as possible in one unit. By allowing for pan and tilt, I can have this mounted where I can look out in many directions and see many things in the front and side of the property. Equally versatile is you can use this camera with the App (including on your computer) or hook in with your Hiseeu NVR if you go that route. Customer service from these folks is always top notch.

description: Of the 126 million homes in America, only 20% have home security. At SimpliSafe, we're changing that. Our goa is simple: to make homes safe for everyone, and not with false security, but with real protection. Our frustration-free DIY home surveillance system bundles have precise sensors to know the difference between a family pet and an unwanted intruder, and are designed with long range sensors for entire home protection. Simplisafe is for homes of all sizes and is built with unprecedented safeguards to keep your home protected against power outages, downed Wi-Fi, cut landlines, and physical attacks from hammers, bats, and more. This easy-to-use wireless system is full of surveillance products small enough to disappear into your home and provide blanket protection. Breathe easy with proper protection at a safe and reasonable price. The 9-piece wireless Security bundle provides 24/7 security with a smash safe keypad that is soft to touch, easy to use during the day and night, and requires no plug (meaning you can place it anywhere), and will alert the police in case of attack. The base station is like your personal security guard: It sends alarm signals to the monitoring center with a built-in cellular connection, 24-hour battery backup, and a 95dB siren. Each entry sensor (4 total) protects your doors and windows and is designed to disappear and blend into the background. The 2 motion sensors are designed for human detection, no pet detection. The simplicity gives you flawless HD video and audio streaming as well as a 120¬∞ field of vision day and night. Enjoy effective, contract-free 24/7 professional monitoring, and make sure your home is the safest place on earth.

review_header_2: Easy to install with straightforward operation
review_header_3: Buy now and secure house today!!
review_text_1: Just got the product (2018 edition) about a week ago. Hooked everything up, had to call their customer service group a few times for clarification on a couple of questions. Got great service, polite, helpful, professional. Highly recommend this system (the latest version) to anyone looking for a self-installed home system.
review_text_2: Guessing that a lot of these purchases are event driven and mine certainly is. We have a cabin and a barn on a 6 acre piece of property. The barn is where we park the tractor and store the supporting tools and supplies. The barn was recently broken into and everything of value was taken. While that is deeply disheartening, it really only affects me. If the cabin were to be robbed and ransacked like the barn was, I have several young children that would likely never want to go/stay there again.I do consider myself handy when it comes to mechanical and electronic projects. I also believe that I am a good researcher and analyst. I found that there are a lot of great alarm systems available at very affordable prices today including DIY professional systems. Several of the professional systems now have videos on installation and configuration‚Äîconfiguration used to be the tough part of installing one of those.In my case, I was looking for a balance of price, ease installation and options for monitoring. Given the recent break-in, I also wanted to get this project started and completed quickly as the cabin is just as vulnerable as the barn.This next statement may make you question my research, or at least, reading abilities. While I did plan to have the system monitored, I didn‚Äôt realize until after I purchased my SimpliSafe system that you can‚Äôt monitor the system remotely at all with the app without one of the SimpliSafe plans, and, at the time of this writing, March, 2021, you have to have the $25/mo. plan to do any serious monitoring. I would have putt off having the system monitored for a while if that were not the case. Perhaps it is better that I was forced into a plan earlier than I wanted. As an aside, SimpliSafe gives you 3 days of ‚Äòpractice‚Äô use after you activate your system. This means they won‚Äôt contact local law enforcement if the system detects and alarm. On the one hand I wanted my system monitoring to start immediately but, do understand the logic of giving me time to learn to use the system without causing false alarms.The installation was truly easy. Once you plug in the basestation and pull the battery tab on the keypad, you are off to a great start. Installing any of the sensors is as easy as removing a paper battery tab, using the keypad to tell the basestation that you are installing a new device and naming it from a list once the basestation announces that a new device has been detected. The preinstalled double sided tape makes mounting the sensors easy. Our cabin has numerous unfinished roughhewn wood surfaces and I decided to mount sensors that had to be on those surfaces with the included screws. I didn‚Äôt try the included self-adhesive on the roughhewn wood which, may have worked perfectly.SimpliSafe tells you how far away you can mount sensors like the glass break and motion sensors but it was less clear about how high to mount them given the space I was working in or, for the glass break in particular, the angular range that it could work with. For example, if you have windows on opposite sides of a room with no option to mount the sensor in the middle, can it detect glass breaking behind it or beside it?SimpliSafe sensors are relatively inexpensive, and, as such, perhaps an extra sensor or two isn‚Äôt a bad thing.The App is easy to set up and use and definitely slanted to the easy side rather than the comprehensive side. That said, if a sensor were to drop off the app will alert you to that. I am not looking forward to changing batteries but would rather that to running wires through an older structure.SimpliSafe has done a great job making system purchase, installation and operation easy and straightforward. They even sent me an e-mail letting me know that the county where my cabin is located requires a form and payment to be completed and sent to authorize monitoring and, more specifically, response. Not only did they tell me about it, they sent me the exact link to the form. They also let me know that no paperwork or fee was required for the fire monitor.The cabin can be a relatively harsh environment with high humidity in the summer and relatively cold nights. I am hoping the sensors, base station and keypad are rugged enough to function for years to come.If you are looking at one of these systems, read all you can to understand what you can and can‚Äôt do with and without SimpliSafe‚Äôs monitoring options. Watch or read about sensor placement and plan your own install. I don‚Äôt think you have to become an alarm expert but each install has its own challenges. I found plenty of good information available from a lot of sources on the Internet to address those challenges. I have not interacted with SimpliSafe‚Äôs customer service at this point and can‚Äôt comment on that aspect of the product.Overall, I believe I made a good decision for my family and have only positive things to say about the installation and operation of my SimpliSafe system.
review_text_4: Excellent security system! Easy to install .The best thing is the ability to monitor system with the phone app and receive text and email alerts and ability to arm/disarm.Customer service is the best with virtually no wait and talented reps. (Jay) Yet to replace batteries in any sensors in 7 years. I replace batteries in keypad and sirens yearly as needed. Just installed new generation system in second home and even more user friendly!I upgraded the battery backup to last for weeks instead of a day or so with a bit of ingenuity.
review_text_5: Love this system! Everyone talking about non exsitant customer support, but I‚Äôve called em twice now and both time was on hold for less than a minute to be connected to helpful ppl speaking English perfectly!

features: 1080P HD indoor, plug-in security camera with motion detection and two way audio that lets you monitor the inside of your home day and night.,Get alerts on your smartphone whenever motion is detected or customize motion detection zones so you can see what matters most.,Store events conveniently and securely in the cloud with a 30-day free trial of the Blink Subscription Plan or locally with the Sync Module 2 and a USB flash drive (USB sold separately).,See, hear, and speak to people and pets in your home on your smartphone with Blink Mini‚Äôs live view and two-way audio features (live view is not continuous).,Sets up in minutes ‚Äì just plug in the camera, connect it to wifi, and add it to your Blink app.,For additional ease of use, pair Blink Mini with a supported Alexa-enabled device to engage live view, and arm and disarm your camera, and more using just your voice.
