review_header_2: Easy to install only took 5 min!
review_header_4: Easy set up and great image quality
review_text_1: I‚Äôm a Blink XT user with three cameras on the exterior of my home. The set up of the mini was FAR EASIER than the outside cams. I had this thing set up in less than 5 minutes. Picture is good. Sound is LOUD which is what I was looking for.The app however needs some work to support this style of camera. The app works decently for the BlinkXT cameras and functionality, which is motion for most users. As in you get a notification that there is motion, it records, and you watch the recording or live as you please. but it is clunky to get into the Blink Mini for the purpose of continuous viewing which is my intention for this camera, like a baby monitor. Like many other Americans now working from home with a full house of kids, I wanted to use this to assist with keeping an eye on the kids as I worked and record those cute moments. I wanted to use this to visualize a blind spot that I can‚Äôt see from the office. I tried mounting it from the ceiling and realized you can‚Äôt rotate the video. Mounting on the wall was a little problematic, I couldn‚Äôt quite get the right angle needed.Another quirk to the app is if you switch to another app and then come back to the Blink app, you have to hit the play button to resume viewing.All in all, these are minor issues specific to my use of the camera which is why I have it five stars anyway.Hey amazon/Blink, it would be an awesome feature if you‚Äôd allow the integration of this camera with Alexa so we can ‚Äúdrop in‚Äù and talk through the Echo Dot. Just saying.
review_text_2: I love this lil camera!! Easy to install! Only took 5 min and it works great!! Highly recommend this!!
review_text_3: Great price and product. Connected very easily to my existing Blink system. I am not happy with having to pay for storage after trial ends.
review_text_4: This is a great little camera monitor. Pros: easy set up, easily managed with your smart phone, clear image quality with motion detection. Can be set up to arm and record at any time. I bought this to use in my master bedroom by my desk where I keep sensitive information.Cons: if you are using it with another Blink product and you arm 24/7 then the other Blink unit also needs to be armed which is an issue because my other unit uses 2 AA batteries. There is no timer on the app to set up a time to arm which would by useful because I sometimes forget to arm at night. It has good night vision quality. It needs to be plugged in so is a problem if you put it in a place (i.e. bedroom closet) if there is no outlet. Because of this, it is difficult to make the camera more hidden (if you are looking for a nanny camera for example).Overall it is easy to use and I would recommend it for a basic home security camera.
review_text_5: SO...I rarely write reviews but was so amazed by this camera I wanted to let others know. I bought the camera after using the Ring indoor camera for twice the price and it made a constant clicking noise with the filter adjustment to light in the room that was a known issue Ring told me and not a defect. I've tried all the other brands out there WYZE, etc and disappointed with all. Then I tried the Blink Mini which I thought was a good price. The setup was a breeze, up and running in 30 seconds. The app is responsive and user friendly. My wifi is sloooow but it still loaded a 1080p HD quality view w hen I accessed it from my mobile app. My favorite feature is the night vision. All my previous cameras just showed a dark room or shadows but this camera shows a clear and crisp picture in pitch black darkness. Very pleased with this and you can't go wrong here. My 2 year indoor camera journey has come to an end here.

I spent alot of time and returning other items because of the hassle of different things needed to have a complete system we felt at ease with and this is is. 1 doorbell and 2 cameras, it was easy and no finding out later you needed other add-ons to make them work (like with Ring, no joke soent $200+ and had 8 pieces and couldn't get them all to sync or work fluently together). review_text_3: I‚Äôm very please with my purchase of two Toucan Wireless cameras. Installing them was as easy as finding a spot for the magnetic base. Installing the app and connecting the cameras were also super easy. The night vision works great the the motion detector is very good. I would say almost too good so select the level that works for you. At its highest setting the motion detector will activate if a bug crosses its field of vision. This can affect your battery life. The only thing I would improve is a longer battery life. At the settings I have the Toucan on, I hand to recharge it about once every three weeks. Not a major issue but it be nice to have a long lasting battery. Still, I would highly recommend this camera.
review_text_4: I got this in the other day and it‚Äôs great! I have them set up around my house for some extra security and we love it. Gives a clear view of what‚Äôs going on outside. Will be very useful when keeping an eye on the house while at work. The price is also great and the product is comparable to ones that you get for 3x the price. Would recommend!!
review_text_5: These cameras are absolutely terrific! I love them! The only downside is the battery life, I get about a month out of them before I have to recharge them. But for the price I don‚Äôt think you can get better quality. Easy install and love the magnetic base! Highly recommend!

review_header_5: Great  camera that is truly wire free
review_text_2: I am a bit of a remote camera nerd. I have bought and set up complex networks for my two properties, as well as for friends and relatives. When I first saw a claim that a camera could have 6-month battery life, I was skeptical. Either that's not true, or the picture quality is very low. After extensive testing, I've found that not to be the case at all. Besides being truly simple to set up - with a phone app and Q code, I was in business within 5 minutes - it takes razor-sharp video in both bright and dim conditions. My battery tests indicate that it uses less than 3% of charge per week, which means it will probably last more than the 6 months promised (tune in later for updates).The best part of all is that, without the need for a charge cord, you are really free to mount just about anywhere. I have mine mounted in an attic - where I don't have electricity - looking down at my driveway. I never could have got such a wide-angle view from anywhere else in my house.All in all, this is a great little camera and a terrific price.
review_text_3: If you've seen the name brand "Arlo", this is basically the same thing at a fraction of the cost and no need to pay for cloud storage. The camera was very easy to set up and sync to the free app Adorcam. It came with a USB charging cable, but you have to supply the charging brick and a micro SD card if you want to be able to save and record video.Picture quality is pretty good, but becomes very pixelated if you zoom on any image. Its best used within 30 feet or so from where you mount if you want thee best resolution. It also needs to be relatively close to the wifi router or you will need a wifi repeater to extend your signal.The night vision is really good. I was surprised at the quality of the night images.Motion detection can be a bit weird. In the app you can set it to all motion or only "human" movement. I have mine set to all, and I only have one complaint: there is a delay in the time it picks up movement and the time it starts recording. For all intents and purposes, I think I would still have all the images I need, but it's a bit annoying. It is also a possibility that the angle at which my camera is pointed, but it did it a bit during table height testing too. I do like that the app let's you customize the length of each recorded video segment in case you want to save SD card space and battery life. It really makes everything customizable. I have been leaving mine on max battery saving setting but also goofing with watching live feeds (which zaps battery more) and its is still sitting at 100% for the last 7 days its been on. It also allows you to speak through the camera from the app live feed.Ultimately, this camera with the free app works really great and is definitely worth the price. I'll probably get one or two more to hang in other locations around the house.
review_text_4: Nice wireless camera with great features. Setup was very easy and was put into use within minutes.Download the Adorcam app prior to plugging it in as it'll ask to pair with wifi as soon as you plug it in. Pairing with wifi was simple. Battery came about 50% charged and took a maybe a couple hours to get to 100%. Camera came with charging cable, but we needed to supply USB wall plug in charger. We used one from an old android cell phone.I'm using it as a driveway alarm notification in an area we don't have electrical access. Motion sets off the notification via the app. I haven't had any false notifications yet.One feature I really like is the ability to manually set off an audible alarm. It's loud and would be useful to scare off an intruder. We own numerous SV3C cameras and wish the manual alarm was a feature on their wifi cameras.Camera is set to record upon motion detection and is stored on a micro SD card we bought separate. The app will also take a picture of initial motion. Battery life has been great so far. Camera is easy to mount and take down to charge.So far we're very pleased with functionality and will be buying more to use as trailcams to record wildlife in areas we have no electricity.
review_text_5: I own several wireless cameras that I have e placed around my complex to keep an eye on suspicious neighbors This camera truly has a user-friendly interface as well as being 100% wire free. You get the camera, mounting screws A charger and small instruction booklet stating on how to use it. One thing that I was surprised at was that the camera had a 39% charge right out of the box, all the other wireless cameras that I have purchased have had at least a 60% charge. No complaints though. Another thing that really surprised me about this camera is that it uses a different type of charger. Instead of using a micro-USB it uses a Type C charger. To some people this may not seem like a big deal but to others it might be beneficial to have a camera that shares the same type of charging interface. This camera does have the option for the user to add an external SD card for extra storage, Videos can be formatted directly from the ADORICAM app to free up space if necessary.Now let‚Äôs talk about the app, the app on Google play is called ADORICAM. It is a very simple user-friendly app that connects with the camera and your Wi-Fi connection. To set up the camera you are required to hold the camera around five inches from your phone until you hear the camera chime, assuming that you put in your Wi-Fi password correctly the camera should be connected. When connected it has numerous useful features such as an alarm button that sounds a loud sired, Video recording and still photo image capture.Overall, I am satisfied with my purchase and am glad that I added this camera to my surveillance system, now only time will tell on how it holds up.

review_header_2: Grab This Quality Bargain Security Camera
review_header_3: Good camera for the price, setup not difficult, features missing vs expensive cameras
review_header_5: Super easy to set up, great quality
review_text_1: This is by far the best security camera I've had. You can move the camera around from the app which is really cool and if you put it in the right place you can cover a ton of area. The solar panel holds the batteries and there is room inside of 6 18650's which is probably a bit of overkill, it comes with 3 installed and room for 3 more, unless it's dark for days on end the 3 batteries should be plenty, but always good to have options. The motion detection is spot on and starts quickly, works much better than my Ring doorbell. Overall awesome high end security camera.
review_text_2: Amazing üëè technology advanced security camera..Swivel using app is incredible coupled with Zoom feature is outstanding...than on top of that the Solar charging as you can see in my picture is by far one of the best features....Totally wireless and with the WiFi feature...Pictures are only in SD that I took but it has the HD feature by simply tapping in app...Alert settings are amazing as seen in my pics. Without question a bargain for the money! Easy install and connection!
review_text_3: Cameras work as advertised (I have 2). I ordered extra batteries (18650) from Amazon (separately) and added them in to the cameras. As with all cameras, finding a good mounting position is the hardest part. This one needs to have a good wi-fi signal, which means you will likely have to add an outdoor wi-fi extender or outdoor wired LAN antenna, or indoor wi-fi extenders on inside walls closest to outside camera location. I ordered wifi-extenders (TP-Link AC750 WiFi Extender RE230) separately also on AMZN, and setup up the extenders and cameras inside, prior to installing cameras outside. Had to move extenders to various locations inside the house to get best connection to camera and to base wi-fi. SOLIOM+ App seems to work pretty good, and camera stays connected to wi-fi. All wi-fi problems so far have been with my signal & extenders, not the camera as far as I can tell. My camera (and solar panel) are in shade under trees, and we have had several dark stormy days, but after several weeks I have had no battery charging issues, and cameras have stayed online all the time, day and night. I also added memory cards (SD) to each camera before installation. I record all video to SD.I tried to activate the free (7-day?) Trial Cloud video storage via the SOLIOM+ app on my phone, but it just didn't work. I wanted to test that Cloud storage before sending any money for a paid account, but that's on hold until I can try to get the free Trial to work. Camera video quality is great, day and night -- I use the night vision mode by turning off the cameras light and use IR. Pan/Tilt works good, but you should know that is is in 'fixed increments' when you hit the app p/t buttons. There is no optical zoom, but you can 'zoom' in the app with normal phone 2-finger touchscreen operation. Also, there is no way to view video through any other means other than their SOLIOM+ app on the phone. A firmware upgrade would be greatly appreciated that allows standard network access from camera to software like Blue Iris. Most camera makers seem to have proprietary software or apps so this maker is not unusual. 1 drawback is (at maximum movement sensitivity) camera misses some activity (cars and people in driveway). There is also a 'glitch' (I would call it), where motion is activated just fine, but recording stops at your preset time limit, even though motion continues. There will be no added video either on the original clip or on additional clips. All additional motion is just not recorded. On the other camera which is viewing only yard, (versus driveway, cars, people), motion is activated for leaves falling and bugs flying by. None but the most expensive (several times $cost of this one) have great motion control so this isn't a complaint given the price of these cameras, just be aware of some of the limitations of less expensive cameras like this one. So far this camera has operated in weather from 80's down to upper 20's (F) and in lots of rain without any problem. 1 big problem is that when recording to SD card, you can only *view* the saved video on your phone (in the SOLIOM+ app), but you cannot download the video and save it to your phone or anywhere else -- you have to open the camera, take out the SD card, then copy the video clips that way - which is pretty ridiculous. That is probably the only reason NOT to get this camera. I assume, but have not tested it, that video on their cloud service would be downloadable to a PC or something. There are video capture apps for android that may help to capture the video while you play it on your phone, but I have also not tried any of that. SOLIOM+ app should be updated ASAP to allow downloading video from SD to phone storage.
review_text_4: We love the pan, tilt, zoom option and the video quality is great. The setup is extremely easy. You can add 3 extra 18650 batteries for backup power but it's not really needed. You can store/review the files on your micro SD card or the cloud. If you want to use the cloud, they have 3 different price plans as shown in the pics. So far so good, really happy with this purchase.

review_header_1: Stunning video with amazing color distribution. Totally 4K!
review_header_3: You may need extra base stations if you‚Äôre house is big and made with stucco walls .
review_text_1: I'm coming off of a frustration of trying to get Amcrest cams to work with the Synology NAS. After beating my head against the wall trying to get it all to work, I gave up 2 weeks ago. Frustrated with trying to keep the wireless cams online, I yanked them and threw them in the garbage (literally). I purchased a Pro 3 and a Pro 2 separately along with the Ultra Smarthub to start off. Kind of sticking my toe in the water, I ran this for a week. Setup was ridiculously simple. Not over stating either. Performance exceeded my expectation by a lot. The big issue for people is loading speed. I'll just say before I had the Amcrest WiFi I had Ring which was even more frustrating. Not a good experience at all. Really long load times or just hanging. So far with Arlo, I can trace every issue directly to something on my network. I added 2 more Pro 3's just to make sure I wasn't just experiencing an anomoly. The network can keep up with the cameras no problem. Snappy response to load. Does Arlo ever hang or slow perform. ABSOLUTLEY! But very very infrequently once you get clean WIFI. Move that router as far as you can from the Arlo HUB. Remember, Arlo uses it's own little private network, so you just need to provide the hub with clear wired connectivity. Also make sure your cameras have as much unobstructed path to the hub. I have a Camera on the other side of my 3,000 square foot house. I have 4 bars. I added the Ultra to my now 5 camera set up. Wow! Even more gorgeous! Great Cam, field of view is amazing, covers my whole front house including the porch. I would recommend to a friend. I do have to be honest, the Pro 2 is very very disappoining. Color bleeding is bad at night. Night vision is pretty much unusable. I bought all my cameras but one refurbished. No issues at all, perfectly packed with all accessories. All pieces came EARLY. yea!!! I absolutely love this system so far!!!!
review_text_2: We had a little security scare a few weeks ago and decided to purchase a security camera system. I have to say I'm super impressed. Sharp video quality, local storage capability, security light, motion sensor, siren, e911, easy install, two-way communication and HomeKit compatibility. What more could you want!? The local storage and HomeKit compatibility is what really sold me though. I only wish the HomeKit integration was a little deeper (Secure Video please!!)...but HomeKit integration is at least there which is was a requirement for me. Some of the other reviewers complaints seem like they're rooted in poor wifi signal...you're dealing with 4K video so the units obviously need strong signal outdoors. I've had zero issues. Definitely feeling safer and would totally reccomend!!
review_text_3: The video is great if the cameras have a really good signal but the videos are Vero slow in loading if the signal is less then 3 full bars
review_text_4: The Arlo Ultra camera system I had recently purchased has worked like a charm. I am now able to have a peace of mind while sleeping or not home. I was able to locate a camera fairly far and high up on a pole and this monitors the front of the property as well as whom enters our culdesac. In return, if someone has problems or a break in within the neighborhood. We could possibly review the footage and perhaps catch a license plate if they are not on foot . Although the cameras have been installed for one week exactly. Very little issues with them. Just be sure your wireless range can handle the distance unless you buy a wireless repeater to extend the range.
review_text_5: We have 6 of these with 2 home docks and we love them. They show great picture quality and the battery life last pretty good as long as you turn off the notifications every time it detects something. We bought 6 from Best Buy but we recently had to purchase another one because my daughter knocked it off the window and it broke something. This was easy to sync to the home base and start using right away. They run off wifi, we have really bad internet and these still work okay. You can speak over them from the app but with our slow wifi it‚Äôs hard for you to hear someone talking back or it‚Äôs delayed a little.

review_header_2: Great value, have patience with the set up
review_header_5: Easy set up and good price
review_text_1: Excellent system for the money. We have installed 4 of the 8. Easy hookup, got setting set and the system recording. Everything works well thus far. Cameras have a crystal clear picture & Nightvision reaches well too. We‚Äôve got the main areas covered right now.
review_text_2: I recently bought a house and wanted to upgrade my security system so I gave this unit a shot. Basically for 8 cameras and 1tb harddrive,the deal cant be beat. I didn't want wireless cameras cause I find those can cause problems so I decided on a wired unit. And the cabling definitely is tedious but the come with quite long cables so that gave me a little more freedom for that. The dvr unit was also a bit of a process, it works best with an ethernet cable connection, so setting that up initially did take some time. There is a bit of a guided set up which helps. But once that was done I had no problems remotely viewing my set up through the manufacturers app. I did run into a few questions and the manufacturer was really helpful so I was pleased about that. If you have the patience , this is a great system for the money, it has literally all of the features I wanted plus no subscription required to view remotely , and that was one of my top priorities when searching for a security system.
review_text_4: Great Product. I like the qualify of this security camera system. It's very clear. Easy setup, plug and play. No need open port on the router or using any type of domain to access from the web/smartphone. All in one system, came with pre installed 1 TB Hard drive. The capacity can record up to 1 month with 8 camera 1080P. The resolution was great with the 1080pIts a 4CH 1080P NVR can display the video clearly. 4 1080P 2MP wireless IP66 waterproof cameras with 24 LEDS automatic IR cut filter. The camera is indoors or outdoors at night, it can still be shot clearly. Up to 100 ft night vision. It come with remote view on PC and mobile devices with audio supportive, motion detection and email alerts, setup the NVR by mouse or the remote control, IP66 weatherproof cameras. The IP pro app on the iPhone very user friendly. I like the user interface was very simple and clean. I also found the signal repeater was a great function. Each camera can act as repeater and pass the signal back to the NVR. This way you don't need to put your NVR at the center of the all camera. I also see there was audio icon on each camera screen. This security camera come with motion sensor alert. Best part it's wireless so no more installation of long cable. The motion detection can be set in the system to record when there is an object moving in the recording area, and immediately send a video screenshot to you by email. You can also customize the detect area and sensitivity to reduce false alerts. Overall, I am pretty happy with this security camera system, it's very simple and easy to use, the quality is good and it's affordable and I recommend it.
review_text_5: Brought this XVIM 8CH 1080p security camera system for my small business for security purposes. Has been using for over a week, we are happy with our purchase so far.To begin with, the price of this sets of camera system was relatively attractive compared to others in the market. It was being well packed and includes 1TB Hard Drive and 8 pieces of cameras.Besides, the installation was quite easy if you read the instructions well before setting up. We can manage to set whole things up within 2 hours without any support from others.Finally, for the quality of pictures, I would say not excellent but was clear enough to record any people as well as any activities. With these cameras, we felt more secure and could be an evidence in case of any crimes.Overall, it‚Äôs worthy to have one.

review_text_1: A lot of reviews say this isn't 5g compatible but it is you just need to download the updated version of the app. Works great in regular mode and night vision. Motion detection is spot on. Easy to mount. 100% recommend
review_text_2: Great camera for the price! It was a little confusing at first to set up because normally you have to connect to wifi in order to set it up, but this one you need the app to set it up. BTW, I have 5G wifi and it works for me.As you can see, the quality is really good. I purchased to catch my cat marking and make sure he was the only one, that‚Äôs the reason why there are no chairs around the table and a litter box in the room.It came with a 3 month free Cloud backup, however, I have a Cloud account and I‚Äôm not sure how I can connect the two. SD card does not come with this camera.I did give it 4 stars for the motion detection because there was a time where I found pee on the floor and the camera didn‚Äôt catch it, it is possible that I had a bad internet connection at that time (our internet sucks).Overall, great camera for what I need it for and the price was great too! I‚Äôm very happy with it.
review_text_3: I have bought 6 different kinds of cameras in the last 4 years. Every one of them took me a long time to connect. So now i get Anxiety thinking about purchasing a new. I opened box with Dread hearing all the bad reviews. It took me longer to get the app then it did to connect. I am so happy and it made my day by being so easy. And I have new 5G internet with T-mobile. Happy with them too at $50 a month. Thank you so much!! I‚Äôm buying 4 more today.
review_text_4: I got a new router with 5G+2.4G wifi. And I finally found this minicam, which can really connect with my 5G router, the setup took me some time, as the connection failed the first time, I contacted their service at support@arenti.com and updated my app to the latest version, then the connection finished in 2 mins.I'm so excited as I need a cam to look after my kitten badly when I was not at home, now I can also talk with her via the 2-way speaker, the night vision allows me to see clearly in the dark, it also works with Echoshow, but with a bit delay, similar like my former cam in my old house.Anyway, this is only a fixed cam, the angle cannot be adjusted remotely via the app, the aftersales guy told me they gonna launch a 5G PT cam soon, can't wait to get one.Overall, this cam is worth the price, and I will update my review if anything goes wrong.
review_text_5: I bought this camera to spy on my pets when I am gone. My last camera no longer worked after I upgraded my Wifi ( new router is 5G). This camera connected perfectly with it. The picture on the camera is nice and clear, night vision is also good. I am waiting for this company to make one that will pan and tilt that‚Äôs also compatible with 5G. Very happy with this and would not hesitate to buy more cameras from this company ( which I will when the other models are 5G compatible).

review_header_1: This solar camera is perfect for my backyard.
review_header_4: Impressively Large Viewing and Panning Area
review_text_2: This camera does not need electricity to operate and function. The camera battery that is rechargeable can sustain a very long time without needing recharged. (6 months)It has held a charge without being connected to electricity OR THE solar panel for over three months, and it is still only 1/2 power on the battery scale. When using it outside, two points of importance, one, the solar panel will keep it constantly charged so electricity will never be needed after the initial charge up. And also the color black is more important to be used on the outside so that in darkness it does not show up as well as if it was white. The camera has PTZ that is accessible from your phone to be able to adjust the camera, and the app allows you to go back in the history and pull up events that occurred usually up to one or two months, depending on the size of the SD card that you put into the camera. Also the camera has a much better picture if HD is pushed on the camera settings. Wifi is necessary if you need to access the camera remotely. You cannot go wrong with the purchase of this camera, the quality of the pictures is excellent and the response time of the camera to record is excellent.
review_text_3: This camera is a HUGE upgrade from the older one that I have from the same company. The video is more clear and the wi-fi extender is EXCELLENT! I have a slower internet and the extender is very nice - no freezing up or slowing down. Being able to move the camera around is an awesome improvement too, keeps me from having to install multiple cameras. It was very easy to connect with their app and set everything up, maybe 10-15 minutes (mainly because after connecting it needs to download a firmware update.) Even installing it outside was super easy, four screws to your base and then put camera on it and tighten down with little screw tabs. If you are looking for a camera but not wanting a huge investment or complicated installation, this one is perfect for that! I highly recommend it!
review_text_4: - Design, build and paint quality is excellent- Since our side patio, yard & walk in area is very narrow and long, the camera can pan the whole side of the house. It also can pan straight down to alleviate any blind spots.- If someone comes to our side entry door we can pan to see who it is and use the speaker (two way speaker) to ask any questions before deciding whether we should open the door. Of course it's also great to see if Amazon or other vendor packages have been delivered. (Panning is done through the use of an icon on your mobile device)- Battery life is very good. In 3 weeks of use the battery is at 85%. (I intentionally left off the solar panel to make sure the battery was good.)- I did encounter one minor problem involving still images not being viewable after the camera detected motion and recorded video. The company was contacted via email and within 24 hours asked for more information. After giving them the info, they responded again within 24 hours with their explanation. (Nothing wrong with the camera ‚Ä¶ a software app update will be upcoming which should fix the issue.) After working in the computer support area all of my life, I am always impressed by companies which actually care about customers and respond quickly. Kudos to their support team!This is a very nice and functional security camera which I would purchase again.
review_text_5: This come with everything you need, except for the optional memory card. Charge it before you install, and with the solar panel set up to face the sun, you never have to worry about it running out of battery. No monthly subscription required which I love. You can add a microSD card to save footage. The pan and tilt functions work nicely from the app which allows you to expand your view. Motion detection works a little too well, so I would get alerts if strong winds move plants/tree shadows. Overall a great value!

You can equip this outdoor security camera together anywhere in your home. Such as indoor/outdoor, yard, garage, shop, and other places.,Wireless and Cordless: When we say that our indoor/outdoor surveillance cameras are completely wireless, we are serious. There is no need to use wires for viewing streams or installing. Our rechargeable security camera is powered by a built-in rechargeable battery, allowing you to place it indoors and outdoors without worrying about annoying wires. (Only compatible with 2.4G WiFi router),1080P HD Image Quality and Weatherproof: Our wireless security camera adopts 1080P HD camera to provide you with clear and clear recording. You can watch real-time video remotely through zumimall App. It maintains a wide viewing angle of 110 degrees, and provides two-way audio calls, allowing you to easily hold the conversation. When motion is detected, alarms and images can also be forwarded to your smartphone. name: Wireless Rechargeable Battery Powered WiFi Camera, Home Security Camera, Night Vision, Indoor/Outdoor, 1080P Video with Motion Detection, 2-Way Audio, Waterproof, compatible with Cloud Storage/SD Slot
review_header_1: Great quality product for the price! After 6 weeks of use the Battery bar still shows full !!!
review_header_2: Best buy, value for money, it has everything
review_header_4: Tough little gem of a camera.
review_text_1: This camera is absolutely wonderful! From when I first opened the box I was very impressed with the packaging and the high quality of materials used to make this product. I could see that much thought and consideration was put into the design. The software installation was a breeze! Once I downloaded the app and turned on the camera, the app immediately recognized the camera and just a few simple steps later my camera was ready to work. I was also very happy to see that I had a few options for mounting the camera and what really made my day was that I was able to mount the camera without having to drill any permanent holes in the walls. (there is also the option to mount it via a screw and hanging it). Once the mount is secure on the wall, attaching the camera to it with the built-in magnet is easy and ball design allows you to adjust the camera angle or remove the camera at any given time.Immediately after I completed the setup and installation, I get real-time notifications when there is any motion detection. As long as I have a stable connection on my phone, I have the option to use the intercom function to speak to whoever is at my door. What I really like about the notification function is that I can go back and view screenshots as well as video. The quality of the picture and video is very good and the night vision function works incredibly well. I attached a picture to this review of my two dogs in a completely blacked out room.The waterproof design is also nice to have although it was not a necessity for me now, it may come in handy some day.I have used the camera indoors at times to check in on my dogs and now mostly use it for the front and rear entry to my house.Now what really surprised me most with this camera is the battery life. I was very skeptic to the claims made in the listing but now after nearly 6 weeks of daily usage and the battery indicator shows full bars! Well, color me impressed!!!Overall it is great for me to be able to see who is at my door, whether I am home or not.One thing I would like to add and I hope the seller can see this comment is that the font on the instruction manual is very very small. I recommend enlarging the font so that it can be easily read by old timers like me.
review_text_2: I recently planned to go out of country for few days and wanted to have a camera to keep an eye on my house while I am away. Once the product was received, my daughter could do the set up in just few minutes using my phone. I installed this in the front porch using the included stickers. Magnetic attachment is super easy to bring in for charging. I didn't want any wiring and any hard installation in the wall. So the set up was really easy. Location of the device is about 40ft from the router. I charged it to 100% though it came pre charged. Picture quality is super clear. Night vision is perfect. Monitored the view from different country for days and the camera still was 100% charged. Very happy with the purchase. Motion activation is perfect, sends a message to my phone. I haven't used the SD card option yet.
review_text_4: I know the saying you get what you paid for, and I found this camera to be a great value. The price and reviews were what sold me. My experience is as follows.......First fast delivery with prime. Received and installed 5/7/2019 ...Then my device was fully charged and undamaged when received. Simple directions. Great pics and night vision, easy installation. Motion detection works well as well as the person to person intercom. The camera is also (in my opinion) of good quality, heavy duty. I would say that especially after I dropped twice with clumsy hands (not on purpose) in stalling memory card. Maybe 4‚Äô.5‚Äù above floor. As far as the app, it works fine , I do wish that you could send videos or pics to email since it is connected to my internet with out taking memory card out... but this is not a deal breaker. I will be going on trip and will test long distance receiving of notifications. One of the neighbors‚Äô kids set it off and I was notified pretty quick. I show that the camera is running at 52% internet signal because of installation distance from router, and still get impressive results. I read somewhere that the battery will or could last to upwards to 120 days in standby operation, .... after trip I plan on making another purchase... I may or may not get a router signal booster, but I am very happy with my decision and experience with this camera. I will post and update on battery performance later when I have to charge again but we all know that the amount of time on live feeds and motion detection will need to be taken into an account... P.S. I will post pics soon.
review_text_5: Surprisingly, this is a pretty good quality camera. I like that it alerts you when theres any movement detected. It recorded and take pictures when theres movement. With that being said you can put an SD card in to save your pictures and videos but theres also a cloud where you can choose to pay monthly or yearly. So you have options to either choose SD or a Cloud monthly/yearly subscription.UPDATE on battery life: I received this item on june 6th but I didnt put it up until june 10th and right now is july 6th. So the battery is at 18% as of right now. So if you use the camera as often as I did(every time theres a notifications due to high sensitivity movements) of course it'll take up the battery. It did however notify me that its 18% and it needs to be charged or it will automatically shut off. Still not bad. Planning on buying another to rotate while the other one is charging. Picture quality is pretty good.On another note, there's a solar for this camera that can be charged without having to take it down to plug in to charge. Less worries about the battery being low and it'll continously charge throughout the day.

The solar outdoor security camera will automatically adjusts itselft to night vision mode by detecting the ambient light,the solar camera lets you see more valuable details all day around,Two Installation Methods for Solar Panel: With the eco-friendly solar panel,the wireless security cameras B10 can run 365 days a year with the solar panel screwed on the camera top or install the solar powered security cameras any areas you want surveillance using the 9.8ft long extension cable. review_header_4: Soliom B10 Goes for the gold!
review_text_2: I‚Äôve had this product for a couple weeks now. I can honestly say this product is easy to install and is of great quality for under $100. I have mounted this camera in my backyard which is mounted to a tree overlooking my back door and and side alley. My camera is mounted up about 15 feet. This camera has great wireless range, excellent battery life, and picture quality is clear.Installation is easy too. Just charge the battery and follow the easy step guide which will guide you through the process. Took less than five minutes to set up. An app need to be downloaded which took a couple minutes.As for installation, just use the easy mounting template then install. The longest time for install is to setup the ladder and then it took me less than 10 min to complete the entire process.All said, I am pleased with the overall ease of installation, quality, and how it performs with the wireless network. I give this product a solid five because it exceeded my expectations.
review_text_3: My first camera. I have seen some from other friends but too pricey. I don‚Äôt want the Ring ones because again, pricey. I went for this one and very impressed may I say. Quality is superb! Took me about 10 minutes to mount and install with the app, not kidding, 10 minutes tops. The only thing I didn‚Äôt like was that it‚Äôs not easy to adjust the position. You have to unscrew little screws and move it, if it was easier to move this would be the PERFECT camera but it‚Äôs a great and I mean GREAT camera. You will not go wrong if you buy this. Imma buy another 2 for my front door and patio. They‚Äôre awesome!
review_text_4: I have been a devoted Soliom user since I bought my first solar wireless security camera several years ago. I had always wanted to have security cameras, but didn't want to get involved with running and concealing wiring and Soliom was the solution with its combination of solar power and rock solid wifi connections.While the S90 and S600 are excellent products and still in use on my property, after multiple summers of 110+ degree days which caused no problem, the B10 takes it to a whole new level. In the first place, the footprint is significantly smaller and the unit less heavy than it's predecessors, yet retains all of the functionality and perfomance is even more enhanced. Because it is small and lightweight, installation is a breeze, and it quickly and easily paired with my router, although it is a fair distance away. As soon as it ws paired, I began to see a brilliant HD picture and a quick test revealed that the 2-way intercom was loud and clear on both ends. Even better, the false alarms often triggered on previous models by tree branches blowing in the wind, were virtually eliminated by the new PIR smart technology. This is enhanced even further by the new ability to program times of operation and a siren that can be set, along with a bright light, to alert the homeowner and to frighten away possible intruders. As with all of my Soliom cameras, it charges fully each day under our bright desert sunlight, and seems to retain its charge even on cloudy days, although I have not had this long enough to use it through the Winter, but based on my experience with my other Soliom cameras it should be more than adequate for a stretch of cloudy days. In the few instances when I have needed some technical support, I found Soliom customer servcie to be both competent, prompt and genuinely concerned with customer satisfaction. For all of the above reasons, I have given the Soliom B10 a five star review and recommend it without hesitation to anyone needing a solar powered wireless security camera, at a very reasonable price.
review_text_5: If your looking for a Solar powered, 1080p, Wifi Security Camera, Spotlight, Color Night Vision, Two-Way Talk, Siren Alarm, and Motion detector camera at an affordable price, this is it!! Soliom added an 10ft extension cable to mount the solar panel away from the camera. You can practically mount the camera anywhere now.. so many possibilities! This is another great product from Soliom. Thank you!!!

features: Blink Outdoor is a wireless battery-powered HD security camera that helps you monitor your home day or night with infrared night vision.,With long-lasting battery life, Outdoor runs for up to two years on two AA lithium batteries (included).,Store video clips and photos in the cloud with the Blink Subscription Plan and save events locally to the Blink Sync Module 2 via a USB flash drive (sold separately).,Outdoor is built to withstand the elements to help you protect your home inside or out, come rain or shine.,Designed so you can set up yourself in minutes. No wiring, no professional installation required.,Get motion detection alerts on your phone with the option to customize motion zones in the Blink Home Monitor app so you‚Äôre only alerted when you need to be.,See, hear, and speak to visitors with live view in real time and two-way audio features on your Blink app.
name: Blink Outdoor ‚Äì wireless, weather-resistant HD security camera with two-year battery life and motion detection, set up in minutes ‚Äì Add-on camera (Sync Module required)
review_header_1: Neighborhood package thief will be CAUGHT and PROSECUTED with this crazy clear video!
review_header_3: I actually purchased the product.  1st time user of Blink.
review_header_5: What an awesome wireless system...buying more!
review_text_2: This new camera is better then the Blink xt2 ! It has been totally re-engineered. Take it from someone who owns all the different cameras Blink had to offer since day one and had to get on a waiting list to get the very first one. So, I should know what iam talking about. This new camera no longer has the push down and pull system to open the back to install batteries. It has a large screw that you simply unscrew with a included tool to open the back of the camera which is really nice. Once you open the back and install the included batteries scan the small QR code inside the camera threw the blink app it will scan to find the camera once that is done it will automatically do a firmware update. After that you are ready to install your new blink camera. Also noticed the sound is much louder and more clear then the other cameras. This is good if two people are talking in a low voice you can hear what they are saying. Has brighter clearer night vision. Nice clear voice communication with two way talk. Alot stronger wifi signal to sink module and from sink module to camera. Sharp, clear, bright, and colorful HD vision during the day. I noticed before I wrote this review that some people only gave this camera 2 or 3 stars. Like the guy who is complaining about software issues. Well if you follow the directions you would not have that problem. Let the camera finish its firmware update. Duh ! Also, if you have been a Blink customer for a while and want to add this camera to your current system. You do not have to pay for cloud storage you are grandfathered in. After you add this camera to your existing system it will actually tell you this ! The front of the camera has a all new face with a very smooth and shinny surface iam sure to help combat the weather and give it a more high tec look. Their is no longer a switch inside the camera to turn on or off the blue recording light located on the front of the camera. It's is all done threw the app which is really nice as well. They really did a good job in re-engineering this camera and listened to customer complaints about their past cameras and went threw and fixed every issue. I would definitely buy this camera again ! UPDATE : 09-25-20 After using this camera for a couple of days. And as other reviewers have noted that this camera only has a 25 foot motion trigger ! Anything further than 25 feet it will NOT record when motion is present. So if you need a camera get the Blink XT2 for the further range. This camera will only be good for specific areas like door or window that are within the 20 to 25 foot range from the camera.
review_text_3: It's super easy. Works great. Setup was simple. It works exactly as advertised. What I didn't know for sure is that the batteries are just high quality AA batteries. So when they die, you can get some rechargeable ones and just rotate them through the thing. I'm going to order a couple more. They are pretty great. *Edit-A nice person took the time to let me know it's best not to replace w/ traditional AA batteries.
review_text_4: So far everything is as advertised. Setup was a breeze and the image quality is great - especially when set to ‚Äúbest.‚Äù I really appreciate the custom activity zones that you can set, as well as the ability the turn off the led light.In terms of improvement, the included mount is pretty basic. For better or worse the mount snaps into the back of the camera module. This makes installing it relatively easy, but also means anyone could detach it with a firm pull. I‚Äôve noticed that there are upgraded mounts that you buy, but haven‚Äôt had a chance to fully check those out yet.Lastly, I noticed another reviewer mentioned subscription pricing, but it‚Äôs a bit misleading. Yes, there is cloud storage that you can pay for, but there are multiple levels, including a free plan, as well as a basic plan for $3/month. Also, the paid plans don‚Äôt start until 2021. More importantly, What this camera has, that the XT2 doesn‚Äôt, is local storage. If you‚Äôre big on privacy, and don't want to store videos on the cloud, you can attach a USB drive to the blink module and save your videos there (see photo which shows the usb drive). There‚Äôs no fee for saving your videos locally - you can still get alerts and watch your video feed live for free.
review_text_5: What an awesome product...total install took 25 minutes. I put 3 camera‚Äôs up outside to monitor my summer home. One of the camera‚Äôs I places on a pole in the yard pointing at the roof so I can monitor snow fall and snow melt roof system. The app was friendly. I shared the app with my wife and she was up and running in 2 minutes with minimal effort. We are so happy with this wireless system.

review_header_1: A good option as outdoor security camera...for me to poop on.
review_text_1: I hope this review can save everyone some time! Amazon's al.go.rhythms philter out sub optimal critiques. So...If you're looking for an outdoor security camera that isn't this product, I highly recommend it! It'll work with a USB extension cord, no days. I spent hours trying to get it to work. Technical support is responsive if you enjouy a call weeks after you've purchased something else, and being sad.
review_text_2: We originally purchased 2 of the Zmodo cams, to keep an eye on our mountain cabin while we were away. We were so impressed that we bought 4 more! We now have cams to watch our barn and horses as well as our parking area and gate/driveway. Several people have had problems with theft, but with our security cams, we have not had anything come up missing or vandalized. We've had a couple of "turnarounds", in the driveway, but as soon as they see the cam (and our "you're a star, smile!" signs), they hightail it to easier pickins. It's very entertaining to watch the old videos, too.We highly recommend the Zmodo cams; they are easy to setup, easy to install and very dependable. Our original two cams have been in continuous operation, for over a year, with nary a hiccup. Zmodo cams are outstanding!
review_text_3: I moved recently into an old house and eventually found that someone was throwing animals down my well. I ordered the set of 2, one to watch the back where the well is and one to watch my front door and work shop. It's nice to be able to check up on things an scroll back through the motion detection markers. Worth the price and piece of mind. They took me an hour or two to mount in safe spots and run the power cables into my house but it was certainly worth it.I hope I never need them again but I will be so greatful if I do.
review_text_4: EXTREMELY satisfied and happy with this purchase. I currently have a Zmodo doorbell camera, so linking the cameras was a SIMPLE and easy process. Total time of installation, hook up to the viewing live footage was LITERALLY eight minutes. Took longer to drag the ladder out. The whole process would have taken even less time if camera location was next to power source...but even that was easy. I DO DEFINITELY recommend this package of cameras. As a matter of fact I am ordering two more for the other side of my house.TIP: If camera location will be further than five feet from power source, order a micro USB extension plug/cord (only cost a few dollars on Amazon) at the time of ordering.Hope this helped. Good Luck.Overall product, installation and hook upA+++ across the board.BUY THEM. You won't be disappointed
review_text_5: Love these cameras I have them all through in and out of my property, they work great. The app is great and easy to use

description: Building on the success of the #1 best-selling YI Home Indoor Security Camera, the YI Home Camera 1080p delivers high definition videos of your home, so you can view every moment in even clearer quality. Its Baby Crying Detection technology also acts as a state of the art baby monitor, sending an alert to your phone at the first cry of your baby. By connecting to YI Cloud you can be rest assured you'll never lose any footage, even if your camera is damaged or stolen.

name: YI 1080p Smart Home Camera, Indoor IP Security Surveillance System with Night Vision, AI Human Detection, Activity Zone, Phone/PC App, Cloud Service - Works with Alexa
review_header_1: Great inexpensive security camera with easy setup!
review_header_3: Good camera, im using it with a 64GB SD ...
review_header_5: Easy setup! We have used Insteon cameras
review_text_1: Bought this to monitor our front door while away on a trip. Delivery of the item was on time and I got it set up on my android phone in less than a half hour. We bought a 32GB micro SD card for it and positioned the camera to view outside the office window towards our front porch and the picture is very clear at all times of the day! I am able to receive the alerts and view them from my phone and/or laptop. I am also able to view more than the 6 second clip if I want to watch the full footage of the movement. It is easy to save the 6 second clip to the SD card; however it doesn't save the full footage. But I found out that if I leave that clip in that day's activities then I can still view the footage. I have set both the sensitivity and alert frequency settings to low and it still picks up passing vehicles but I am okay with that since I am able to delete the unneeded clips easily. I am amazed and pleased that I can be hundreds of miles away and still be able to monitor my front porch. And it's considerably cheaper than the Ring or Nest products. I am very pleased with this product!!!
review_text_2: This thing is amazing. Picture is super clear and detailed. The only thing that would make it better is if it told me the temp in my toddlers room (I use it as a baby monitor). Sound quality is great. Such a great buy.
review_text_3: Good camera, im using it with a 64GB SD card, its been almost a week since I installed it and the card still has over 20GB free space.The seller is a pain in the @ss emailing daily begging for feedback.
review_text_4: UPDATE: The app problems have been corrected with the latest update!!! YAY!!! I ABSOLUTELY LOVE these cameras again!!! You won‚Äôt be disappointed if you purchase these cameras. Thank you YI!!!!! All my cameras and the app are working great again. I‚Äôm so glad I procrastinated buying a different brand. These are great cameras. Highly recommend. ‚Äîfrom owner of 20 cameras. :)I‚Äôve purchased 20 combinations of YI cameras in past two years. Have loved them until past couple months. The app is not updating motion alerts for hours or days. Now they are worthless to me. Sad-these were great until recently. Hope they fix this soon or I‚Äôm changing to another brand.
review_text_5: Easy setup! We have used Insteon cameras, Arlo cameras, and also have a Samsung camera, which we are having issues with already. Capabilities of the YI 1080P camera are comparable to other cameras we have paid a lot more for. Picture is very clear. We can rotate camera easily with cell phone. Voice out of the camera is good quality. Changing settings and schedule of monitoring is easy, but a little more limited than others. This camera meets all of my requirements for a simple security solution, and I would take this for indoor use above any other cameras we have used, and the price is considerably less than the manufactures listed above. I would highly recommend this camera, but we have not yet used the Micro SD card for storage yet, and we still are impressed with what we are getting

name: Amcrest 4K Security Camera System w/ 4K 8CH PoE NVR, (4) x 4K (8-Megapixel) IP67 Weatherproof Metal Turret Dome POE IP Cameras (3840x2160), Pre-Installed 2TB HDD, NV4108E-IP8M-T2599EW4-2TB (White)
review_header_4: Worth Every Penny! Better than the rest!
review_text_1: I've installed several POE systems for other homes as a handyman on the side. I've wanted something for my house and thought I'd try Amcrest. I've tried Lorex and Ring and other brands. Each has their own app and interface when using the back end of the system. Some harder than others.I installed this system myself. Four cameras total. (as seen in first pic)It came with 60ft of Cat6 cable where some of the others systems come with 100ft. Luckily I had reel of Cat6 cable of 1000ft extra and can make my own cables because the two cameras from the back of the house barely reached to the entrance 1" hole for the wires. I was able to have a junction box to continuing the wiring to the NVR system box. As you can see from the photos I wired four of the cables into a 1/2 PVC pipe up from the ceiling edge of the walls down to where I have the NVR.Just like any system it takes time to get to know how it works. I will say the platform was so much easier than other NVR systems I've used when trying to setup the network/p2p/firewall and ports from routers. (side note: comcast was a little difficult at first to open the port forwarding due to their "cloud" of working from the router.) But after a few tries I was able to get the port forwarding to work to get the app to work outside of the house when using the phone.Quality is outstanding! But due to each system, this one couldn't keep up with having four, 4k cameras so it would blank out 1-2 of the cameras. In another review, a buyer did mention this issue with her system. I will say this is common with any system. It turns out you would have to spend on the $1000 system which has more processing power to run all cameras in 4k. This would bog the system on any brand. SO it is recommended to lower the resolutions. So in my case I put three of the cameras to 5m (1080p) and just my driveway to 8m (4k). I also was able to change the frame rate from 15 to 25fps on the 3 cams. This allowed camera with most traffic to capture more in detail but not bog the NVR.The LED night vision is outstanding as well. (see photos) Don't get confused, doesn't have a LED light, but its a LED working through IR.All the cameras did have a mic built in. But I wouldn't rate it good or bad since the app audio playback isn't so great but the system itself does pick up pretty well if you can get it straight from the drive. You can def. hear from about 50ft when someone is walking to the mailbox across the street.I could say a lot more but over all I am very happy with this system compared to other brands I've installed or had. I was tired of people walking up and the "Ring Doorbell/stickCam not capturing faces or only people walking away. Or just never working at all. Also the IR was terrible or blurry. But Amcrest has won me over.I will say side note I did notice that my iphone on playback worked really well without being jittery or slow or the scrubbing was fine. But on ipad or android it was way jittery and I thought had to do with my frame rate on the NVR system itself but found out that wasn't the case. Has to do with the app on whatever phone its on. SO don't blame the system itself for its faulty playback. It runs just fine if you view it from a HDMI TV or iphone 6 plus. I also was able to preview it from my desktop by typing the IP address in the browser which allowed me to control the NVR settings and view all cameras from my computer from my home network.I def. recommend this system with the turret cameras. Low profile and easy to install. I read also with the Amcrest system I can get the doorbell and include it to the NVR recording on my wireless home network which is awesome. So I may add that and do a review on that. But right now spent enough! Lastly it‚Äôs nice that I can create other users. Either as a viewer or another admin. So that‚Äôs a nice feature as well without someone messing the main login.Hope this helps for those who are wanting a 4k camera system with built in 2TB drive. Amazon has the best pricing! This goes a little more on other sites and that's without a hard drive. So Amazon def. has it beat.I got this for $559.99 plus tax out the door was $611.79I will do an update of how long a camera last for my system. Last install clients lorex, one of the 4k bullet cams already crapped out and not even 6 months. That was a $900 system. Client not wanting to deal with wait time and warranty, spent additional $140 for replacement.
review_text_2: When I bought this, I had owned an Amcrest Wifi camera for over two years as a baby monitor and have absolutely loved it. So it was an easy decision to try this DVR system. Still have only installed two of cameras due to the complexity of getting the others installed, but so far I‚Äôve been very happy with first two cameras performance. The DVR system could be more updated and user friendly, especially for someone who‚Äôs never used a system like this. But after weeks of playing with it, adjusting the motion detection settings and such, I got better with it. Unfortunately I couldn‚Äôt get the motion detection to work 100% of the time the way I wanted it to because we don‚Äôt have rain gutters and the rain coming off the roof would always prematurely set it off the motion notifications.I did have issues with re-synchronizing the wifi cameras to the DVR after making changes fi my internet setup, but Amcrest Tech Support was awesome and quickly helped me resolve the issue.Overall, still will recommend this system and have plans to add more cameras.
review_text_3: If you are like me and don't mind paying a little more for a much higher quality product, this is the camera system for you. It is fairly easy to set up, although it's much easier to follow the online instructions versus the user manual that comes with it. You will need a wired connection to your router and an HDMI monitor to get started and then after the NVR is set up you can switch over to an ethernet to wifi device if it has a WPS button to pair it with your wireless router. The one wire connection to the cameras makes the installation of the cameras a breeze. The camera housings are very high quality with a decent range of adjustment. They also allow you to run the wire outside of the camera or through the center of the camera mount and into the wall. The video quality and night vision is superb, even picking up night time action at the end of my 100 foot long driveway. The NVR has all the features you would expect from a mid to high range system. The mobile app works as it should and gets you into live view quickly from anywhere you are. I do have a 600 Mbps connection, so I don't know if that could be a factor in the connectivity speed or not. Something to note when considering placement of this system is the NVR's fans are a little noisy, but they do keep the unit cool.
review_text_4: These cameras are fantastic. We almost bought another brand, but found these instead. Easy to install and work great. Have not failed us yet! The picture quality is better than the system through a company that was at our house previously. The app is really cool as well. Super easy to navigate once you figure it out. I gave the motion detection a 3 star because it was too sensitive if you have a flag or trees around. I tried decreasing the sensitivity and setting the grid for where you would like motion detected, and I could not get it to set. But not worth overlooking this system, for sure! Very pleased!
review_text_5: excellent customer support, could not have done this without him patient,knowledgeable,very fast also able to get cameras to detect movement at certain times of day,looking forward to buying more cameras since this was so easy cameras have very good coverage,so far so good thankyou amcrest

name: Amcrest Floodlight Camera, Smart Home 1080P Security Outdoor Camera Wireless WiFi with Flood Light, Built-in Siren Alarm, 114¬∞ View, IP65 Waterproof, MicroSD & Cloud Storage, ASH26-W
review_header_1: Excellent combo security camera and floodlight!
review_header_2: Easy to use, works great & has all the features you need! A++ Recommended!!
review_header_3: Great quality camera with great price
review_text_1: I‚Äôll start off by saying, I‚Äôve installed hundreds of security cameras for clients, and probably half as many flood and/or security lights. I‚Äôve personally never liked combo devices, as I‚Äôve found there usually is a functionality trade off in one side of the device (camera is great, light is horrible, or vice versa.) So when I was given the opportunity to review this security camera and light combo at no cost, in exchange for an unbiased review, I jumped at that opportunity!First impressions: The hardware felt solid and sturdy. The included instructions were straight forward and included easy to follow along diagrams. If you feel comfortable with turning off the circuit breaker for the location where you are installing the light, and can attach three wires, you probably won‚Äôt have a problem installing this device. (Note: if you are uncomfortable, you should consult a qualified electrician for assistance.) The hardware install process took me 20min total, to remove the old floodlight and install this new one.First configuration: After the quick install, I was off to the configuration. The clear and easy to follow instructions included, explained how to download the app from the app store and get up and running quickly. I have an iPhone so the app was easy to find and download in the Apple App store. This was my first Armcrest Smart home device, so I needed to register for an account, which took just another minute to verify my email address.Once I paired the device with my phone/Armcrest account, I realized the device initially had some challenges communicating to ‚Äúthe cloud‚Äù. This was caused by the app/hardware developer deciding to utilize non-standard ports for communication to ‚Äúthe cloud.‚Äù I don‚Äôt know why the developer felt this was necessary (its not), and after I allowed the exception in my Firewall security settings (for both my phone and the hardware), I was up and running with no problems. (Note: If you don‚Äôt know what this means, don‚Äôt worry, you probably won‚Äôt be affected by it. If do you know what I‚Äôm talking about, enable SSL outbound over all TCP ports and you‚Äôll be fine.)After the hardware device had a steady/consistent connection to the internet, the iOS app indicated that a firmware upgrade was needed. The app seamlessly guided me through the process and it was completed in about 3min.Usage: By default, push notifications for motion alerts are on. If you don‚Äôt have anything that moves in view of the camera, this is excellent. Unfortunate for me, I have two large trees that when blowing in the wind, triggered the alert. No biggie though, I was able to easily set up motion zones to ignore the trees, and only alert on the walkway. If motion is detected, not only do I get a push notification, I also am presented with a video clip of the event that triggered the vent! This is super handy if you want to know what happened in the past, or while you were not home, and don‚Äôt want to review lots of video footage.When its dark outside, and motion is detected, I have the device configured to turn on the flood lights. This is excellent not only when walking outside in the dark, but also a great deterrent for people who are not supposed to be there. The led lights are nice and bright and you can easily configure how long you want the flood lights to stay on after motion was detected. In the event you are alerted by motion and you turn on the live view and see something you don‚Äôt like, a single press of a button in the app sounds a very loud siren on the floodlight. It‚Äôs very loud and can be heard over two blocks away!I am excited to report this device changed my views on combo devices; it is possible to have both a great camera and great light in one package! In conclusion, this is an excellent consumer grade device with tons of options that make it a great buy.
review_text_2: There are so many great things with this Flood Light Camera that I find myself having trouble figuring out where to start. From the beginning of when I received it, in its great packaging, it could have fallen from 50 feet and still be ok, the protection of its packaging was great. As I took it all out, I noticed it even came with a hanger that you can use that holds it while you wire it into your house. I have never seen a floodlight come with that before and I have installed many! Wiring so simple. Hot, Neutral, and Ground and it is done! After I wired it to my house, I opened up the app, scanned the QR Code and I was able to see the cameras view instantly. Previously on flood lamps, you had to keep climbing ladders and making adjustments to sensitivity and length of time it stays on but with this, I was able to mount it, come down my ladder, and from my living room chair I can adjust ALL the settings from my phone. I already have several IP Cameras around my house in other locations and I have the Blue Iris Security Camera Software. I plugged in the IP address that the app so easily lists in its Device Information and Blue Iris was receiving a Great Live Video Feed in no time! In the Amcrest Smart Home App, I am able to view my driveway from anywhere in the world. I can choose where it should pick up a motion to record and how to notify me. Even when the Flood Lights are not on, the camera has GREAT IR lights and can see everything in the darkest of nights. When I get home there is no place that is dark, the lighting is L.E.D. Super Bright! With motion-activation turned on for the lights I have tried to sneak past it but it picks me up the minute I am in the line of sight from every angle. It is above my Garage and the split second I walk out of my garage it sees me, from the minute I step foot in my driveway or my yard the lights come on. When I installed it I went ahead and added a MicroSD card in to the top of the camera. It keeps a good history of all motions detected so if my Blue Iris on my home computer was to go down or miss it, it is also saved in the camera itself as well. You can view or download directly from the App, and you can even format the SD card from in the app. There is not a single thing I can think of this Flood Light Camera System can‚Äôt do. This is a Great Solution for both my lighting and my security needs!!
review_text_3: Let‚Äôs start from the box I was a little surprise since the box was larger than expected but it was well organized. Not sure why regular manuals are missing on recent cameras, doorbell products, maybe set up process has been simplified, I had no issue since I was familiar with the product but for new customer it might be an issue. This is my amcrest camera number 9 and so far i am very happy with the products, I'm just replacing old cameras with newest version. So far no issue but when there is one they will fix it very soon with a firmware update. This camera works with Alexa devices and Fire Tv. Motion detection works great very smart at level 3 and the light sensor is accurate and it turns on time when motion is triggered and when is dark. I can force control light from app and works great. App functionality works great on Smarthome and old app, I have some old cam and use the old app to have all together. Camera itself has a great look and overall product look great above my garage door and it didn‚Äôt look weird cam/light, very similar with RING Floodlight and I like this better. It feels good quality product, plastic for the camera and metal and very sturdy, it comes with the hook that will help you during installation process, I was very impressed. Floodlight/light is very strong good coverage you can tilt and adjust to many direction. And finally SD CARD option is the big win, why pay for subscription like on Ring or other brand, and thats why i switched to Amcrest since it gives you the option for SD card so you can save the footage on SD card. I have activated both motion detection and continues recording on 64GB and that will be good for 7-8 days recording HD. If you do just motion detection it will be more than a month with HD quality. Honestly I am very happy with this product and it will be a good sell.
review_text_4: I have switched all my cameras from Ring to Amcrest now, I normally use their 4k cameras but the 1080p one has done very well for me so far. The motion light has been great and even caught some skunks on camera the other night.Pros:‚Ä¢ Single app for all my Amcrest cameras‚Ä¢ The camera has local storage so if disconnected at least it still works.‚Ä¢ Motion detection with the LED lights and they are super bright.‚Ä¢ 2-way audio works great, was surprised to be honest because my previous camera (ring), while working, was never clear. Same internet and everything and none of the same issues with this one.‚Ä¢ Works great with Blue Iris in case you don‚Äôt want the cloud offering, at least they aren‚Äôt forcing you to the cloud, unlike some others.‚Ä¢ Installation was easy as I replaced an existing motion light with this.Cons‚Ä¢ If you don‚Äôt know electrical, please have a licensed electrician install.‚Ä¢ If you have had previous Amcrest cameras like the 4k, there is a new app for this and the doorbell. But the setup was a breeze.

name: Amcrest ProHD 4K Dome Outdoor Security Camera, 4K (8-Megapixel), Analog Camera, 164ft Night Vision, IP67 Weatherproof Housing, 2.8mm Lens, 110¬∞ Wide Angle, Built-in Microphone, White (AMC4KDM28-W)
review_text_1: I had ordered these cameras for the perimeter of my home, and a number of less-expensive dome cameras for the interior. One by one, two by two, I have been replacing the less expensive domes with these quality units. The camera housing and mounts are metal, so shielded from electro-magnetic interference, within reason. The IR illuminator LEDs are strong, but......"intelligent." With bullet cameras, there is a "beam" of infrared energy which seems to be focused, thereby giving hot-spots. These cameras have not only a very wide focal angle, but the IR is not focused, but well dispersed: no hot-spots. Used with a quality monitor or HD tv, there is a world of difference between these units and most other consumer-related dome or bullet cameras: image definition. You will instantly recognize the difference in image quality. In addition, the IR photosensor which turns-on the IR, is not as sensitive as other cameras I've had.....I installed one of these ProHDs in our den, and the lighting has to really dim, to activate the IR. The result of this, is that the image is shown in color, and that coloration is truly spectacular and defined. In IR, the B & W image is crisp and clean. Don't waist your money on lower-priced cameras; invest in quality.
review_text_2: Great camera. Picture is good. It has great sound, can hear everything! I like the wide range it captures. We have stuck with this brand of cameras and have always been happy with them and the support.
review_text_3: This is the only 4k camera on my system right now and it is WAY clearer than my 5mp cameras. Would buy again
review_text_4: had problems with setup of amcrest cameras and grace figured it out and was very polite and helpful
review_text_5: clear and wide
