features: ,,This PTZ Speed Dome PoE AI Camera features Smart Motion Detection (SMD) which allows the camera to detect and filter between human and vehicle motion events. IVS features (tripwire and intrusion) for perimeter protection, and face detection to detect facial images. Please note, face detection is typically recommended for use with an AI NVR, however, can be used independently to detect faces. Offers 4MP @30fps video with a wide 61.6¬∞ viewing angle.,Smarter, Safer, Security - Utilize intelligent alerts that send notifications to your computer or smartphone via the Amcrest View app. Record events on this PTZ POE + camera as soon as they happen and store them on your computer, MicroSD (up to 256GB), NAS, or Amcrest Cloud. This camera requires PoE+ power (802. 3at) in order to operate. Utilize the pan tilt zoom feature with 32x optical motorized zoom and 16x digital zoom as well as continuous 360¬∞ pan, 90¬∞ tilt capturing every angle.,Always Resilient - Whether it's rain or shine, day or night, this outdoor pan tilt zoom camera has an IP67 rating which means it's built to endure whatever mother nature throws its way. Once nighttime sets in, innovative starlight technology from the CMOS Image Sensor and IR LEDs helps this camera see up to 492 feet at night even in ultra-low light. H.265 Compression technology allows for files to be compressed without any noticeable difference in quality.,Find Solace in the Cloud - Amcrest Cloud was created to ensure that you don‚Äôt miss a thing, no matter where you are. With an intuitive interface, you are able to live-stream your footage which enables you to play it back based on your preferences. A PoE injector or switch is required; not included.,Simple. Reliable. Secure. - At Amcrest, we want to ensure the safety of our customers, their loved ones, homes, and businesses. This POE + outdoor PTZ camera features HTTPS and SSL encryption to ensure data privacy. In addition, You‚Äôll receive a full 1-year US and Lifetime Support provided directly from Amcrest. Compatible with the following Amcrest AI NVR's: B08CJJC9HN, B08KHQD5R8, B08KHQXL48, B08CJJ3YKR, B08KHD3QYJ, B08KHQZXCX, B08CJMRQPY, B08KHQQ5FH, B08KJ7B993
name: Amcrest 4MP Outdoor PTZ POE + IP Camera Pan Tilt Zoom (Optical 32x Motorized) UltraHD POE+ Camera Security Speed Dome, People and Vehicle Detection AI, 492ft Night Vision POE+ (802.3at) IP4M-1083EW-AI
review_header_3: I cannot find anything I don't like about this camera
review_header_4: Best security camera I have used
review_text_1: The Amcrest 4MP Outdoor PTZ POE + IP Camera Pan Tilt Zoom (Optical 32x Motorized) UltraHD POE+ Camera is a great high resolution camera with optical elements that are unique to this equipment. Starting with a rugged, dependable build and ending with cutting edge electronics, the Amcrest Amcrest 4MP Outdoor PTZ POE + IP Camera offers a range of features most other cameras don‚Äôt. Below are a list of pros and cons, followed by some suggestions for potential improvement.Cons:No speaker for talkback includedNo microphone included for the listen function (there is wiring in place to connect external speaker and microphone, but such accessory is not included and would have to be purchased separately; also a quick search on amcrest.com does not find such accessory, maybe a third party/).Camera switches to nighttime even as light appears to be sufficient and abundantHaving trouble focusing when zooming in, faces are out of focus, blurred and with apparent image ghostingLarge and heavyFisheye and privacy mode not availableAuto-Tracking not available in mobile appWhen on the mobile app, image ratio is either squeezed (portrait mode / vertical) or stretched (landscape mode / horizontal)Cloud app is laggy, with pan tilt relatively responsive but the image is significantly lagging behind with anywhere between 3 to 10 seconds delayExpensiveProsVery solid built, sturdy, all the components included, reliable hardware, screws and bolts, rubber washers - all to ensure a watertight installation (even gloves are included)Minimum lag on Amcrest View app (not the cloud app)Very responsive PTZGreat POE+ power function, No need for additional 24 V power or 110V power plug, just pull an ethernet cable connected to a POE+ switch, plug in the camera, scan the camera bar code with the app, and installation is done!Easy setup top with the existing appLocal storage and SSD card for up to 256GbGood iris control, good iris range - the iris opens very well allowing plenty of light.Potential improvements:Software:Improve software to coordinate zoom focus and Iris in a way that allows for better image clarity and less Image ghostingImprove mobile app (Amcrest Cloud) to display real size image (rather than stretched or squeezed)Hardware: ‚Ä®If possible reduce size and weight. On a large commercial property this may not be an issue, but on smaller residential buildings this camera may stand out.Include speaker/microphone for two way communication
review_text_2: Amcrest PTZ POE outdoor camera is build like a tank. Very well constructed with metal double enclosure (for protection from heat of the sun I suppose) and sturdy and thick aluminum mount. This surveillance camera is a serious business with 32x optical zoom and motorized dome. You can control pan with full turn 360¬∞ angle and 90¬∞ tilt. Camera can move quickly or slowly and is completely silent all the time. It uses a very good motor for sure. Picture quality is stunning and you can see every smallest detail on your property in Ultra HD resolution. To connect camera you will need just Ethernet cable connected to POE+ switch. You also need to download the App and get the camera to your network. You can watch and control video on a phone, iPad, computer or NAS.It can be connected to NVR as well which I actually did. I connected the camera to my existing surveillance system Hikvision NVR via ONVIF protocol and it started working immediately. Even PTZ control works well from my NVR. Amazing compatibility. It also has paid cloud storage support or you can just record video or events to onboard microSD card. Camera has a nice web UI with lots of settings. You can program camera movement as you wish, there are many features and functions here. Night vision works pretty good and camera focus works well enough.Highly recommend product if you have large property.
review_text_3: I've been waiting on Amcrest to step up their game and offer a new high-end ptz cam. Here it is. 32x optical zoom plus you can turn on 16x digital zoom. The latter is kinda buried in a menu but it IS there. This cam is like having a several thousand dollar Axis camera as one of my Blue Iris cams. Yes, it connected up to B.I. easily with no hassle. Great night and day vision. I have not dealt with the AI yet so I can't comment on that aspect. The zoom/ptz interaction works like a high end cam should. When you're zoomed way into something, the ptz is still easy to manage. You can add a 256gb card into it if you wish. Going to buy a 2nd one of these and retire an existing Amcrest 18x older ptz to some other duty. Oh, another thing: It's quiet. Even when you are next to it (and I was for several hours installing it), it's silent, even when doing a ptz move. This feature may be very useful for some of you. I've seen a lot of noisy ptz cams. This one is not. I have not turned on the defog option yet, so I'm unsure if that introduces any fan noises or not.
review_text_4: This is a very solidly built POE Camera.The installation of this camera was a breeze. I already had the Amcrest View Pro installed (for my other camera from Amcrest). So installing this camera as an additional device was very simple. The fact that it works using POE made my installation very easy as I didn't have a power connection near the garage where I have installed this camera. But, since I already had an ethernet wire running there, I was just able to connect it to the existing ethernet wire and connect the other end to the POE Converter that I had bought earlier.This is a security camera that I have installed outside my garage in a spot that is kind of hidden so that no one can see the camera.The camera supports 256GB of memory. This will allow me to store a lot of recordings without having to delete occasionally.The zoom of this video is great. I was able to pan/zoom to see every minute detail of the person's face who was standing like 20 ft from the camera.The Camera price seems to be high. But, for the quality of this camera it might be worth it. I will know if I can use this to monitor any security intrusion at my house like the one I had earlier, when someone tried to break into my car parked outside the garage. But, we were not able to find out who it was as the face was hardly clear in the night mode with my existing security camera.Any integration with Alexa or similar services would be helpful.It is also nice that the camera can be broadcast live using RTSP so that it can be shared with anyone.The application also allows sharing the camera with other family members. That's a big plus. When I am out of home or do not have internet connectivity, my wife can monitor itOverall, I would give this a 4.7 out of 5 rating.
review_text_5: This camera is hands-down the best built camera I‚Äôve ever personally used or tested. The quality of the materials is second to none. The camera is heavy as you would expect it to be due to the high end components. The starlight sensor in it is incredibly accurate and detailed in low light. The night vision reach that I‚Äôm able to get with it is quite incredible. It‚Äôs easily almost twice the distance that most other more consumer oriented cameras have. The PTZ motors and components are whisper quiet and fast. There are no weak, shaky or dead spots in the camera travel. I can set it to a position I need with incredible ease. The 32x optical zoom is also pretty fantastic and leaves nothing to be desired. It will go super far. I didn‚Äôt find myself feeling the need to turn on the additional 16x digital zoom. I also love that it has two sub streams in addition to the main stream. That is incredibly helpful in more complicated blue iris setups. The AI seems to be working well also. This camera is incredibly smart and fast. It isn‚Äôt held back by buggy firmware. It reacts quickly and smoothly. This camera is a great ‚Äúeye in the sky‚Äù type of camera. I can get tag numbers and critical details reliably due to the excellent specifications of this camera. The included mounting hardware and cables are all excellent quality and instructions are concise and clear on how to get it all mounted and hooked up with ease. The multiple options for powering the camera are nice as well. Another welcome addition is the trip wire hookup. That isn‚Äôt something you typically see on the smaller, cheaper cameras. My only request would be that the camera have a small speaker and microphone built in for situations in which hooking up an external mic and speaker aren‚Äôt feasible. However, amcrest has many other options for these use-cases as well. I‚Äôm incredibly happy with amcrest as a company and this camera is nothing short of amazing.

name: Amcrest UltraHD 4K Varifocal PoE Dome Outdoor Security Camera, 4K (8-Megapixel) 3840x2160P, 164ft Night Vision, 4X Optical Zoom, Motorized Varifocal Lens 58¬∞-110¬∞, White (IP8M-2454EW)
review_header_1: 4K resolution and night vision are better than expected
review_header_2: Very clear picture and recordings! Great Camera.
review_header_4: It's ok. But then what camera is awesome?
review_text_1: This 4K camera is a nice upgrade from the 1080p (2K) bullet camera I have, basically doubling the resolution I had making it easy to identify people walking down the sidewalk, watching package deliveries, and identifying makes of cars that drive by. For those starting out with their first camera, I recommend a minimum 1080p (2k), but definitely go to 4K like this camera if your budget allows.The night vision on this camera is better than the bullet camera this is replacing, illuminating edges of the video much better and more evenly. Like another has reported, I did notice that the IR light can create a light hue on the top of the video which is caused by the IR reflection from the dome. I found this reflection can be minimized by cleaning the dome and lowering the brightness of the RI light in the camera settings.The wide-angle lens on this camera allows me to put the camera under the corner eave at the house and cover my front door along with my entire front yard and driveway just like the bullet camera I have.This camera is expensive because you are paying a premium for the motorized optical zoom that can be adjusted remotely to zoom straight ahead. This dome camera does not have a motorized Pan/Tilt. The zoom is great if you need to keep an eye on something in the distance and you can't mount a camera closer to it. If you are mounting the camera near the area you are keeping an eye on, then it's not likely worth the premium.I have had good luck with wireless cameras, but I have a very busy wireless network and wanted to ensure there are no signal losses or bandwidth issues, especially with 4K, so POE is my preferred choice. Running a POE cable is just as easy as running a power cord from my perspective so I highly recommend POE cameras.This camera can record 15 frames per second (FPS) at 4K. Its not the best frame rate to capture fast moving objects, but you can go into to the configuration options and lower the resolution a little to get 25 FPS. I think the trade off is worth the extra FPS.Let me know if you found my ramblings helpful with a thumbs up. Best of luck in your surveillance project.
review_text_2: 11/24/2018 Update - I've attached pictures of day and night view. Very Clear! I need to make one more adjustment to have the night vision lights closer to the back door - but this camera is great. One word of caution - Keep Palm, Hand, and Finger Prints OFF OF THE DOME GLASS. I had a very blurry night picture at first and could not figure out what was going on - and then I got some glass cleaner and cleaned the dome glass - and WALLA, clear as can be. This is a great camera - I have one suggestion for Amcrest - automatic pan/tilt functionality instead of manual.I had installed several Amcrest cameras before purchasing my first POE camera. and I must admit, it took me a couple of days to figure things out (largely my own fault as my power source was not connected), but once I got it - it was easy street going forward. Test the camera operation before you do any mounting to make sure you can get a picture. The picture quality is very CLEAR and the ZOOM IS OUTSTANDING- I could see the details of a rabbit in my yard. I will add pictures later. Installation was the most difficult - instead of buying a new POE switch, I connected a 5 port TP-Link 5 Port Fast Ethernet switch that I had sitting on my desk unused, to my existing DVR that I use to monitor/record CCD hardwired camera. Since I was replacing one of the CCD cameras, I was able to use the existing power connector and I already had an extra 100 ft Ethernet cable that I was able to run to the camera for POE.Worked great - and what a clear picture. Just installed today, so will update for night vision.A word of caution, it took me several go rounds to finally get the lens position to where I wanted it, I tried to do this before I mounted, but still needed adjustment afterwards. DON'T DISCARD THE DOME FASTENING TOOL - you will need it. The dome attaches very easily with the tool. So far I really like this camera. Will update after a few days! I plan to purchase another Amcrest POE. I am very happy with this camera!
review_text_3: I had decided to purchase this camera to replace the one overlooking my back yard and I made the right decision. The picture quality is outstanding. When I decided to install surveillance cameras around my house, I knew nothing about these systems, so after looking into it I purchased an Amcrest POE NVR as the center piece of the system. My consideration was based on making the things simpler without extra power supply wires and/or injectors and I made the right decision.Excellent quality camera, 4K (8MP) UltraHD, well-built and easy to install. The installation of this camera was a breeze. Basically, having the Amcrest NVR, using the ethernet CAT 5 or 6 cable, installation is plug and play. I own several Amcrest cameras, but this one stands out on picture quality offering a crisper image. Simple setup for motion detection when paired with Amcrest NVR. The IR LED night vision up to 164 feet gives you a very good picture quality, day and night. You can notice the 8-Megapixel progressive scanning CMOS image sensor at work. The wide viewing angle of 40¬∞~110¬∞ allows you to capture every angle. An optical zoom of 10X, obviously would have been a plus. I am very happy with this camera! I would recommend it camera for image quality and features.
review_text_4: It is digital zoom so once you refresh the zoom resets back to 100%. Other than that excellent camera. The UI is same template as pretty much any camera out there so if you use Dahua or what have you you will see it is the same but maybe different color template. As for recording and capturing it is OK. Recording to FTP works OK. Recording to SD card works OK. Email is through YAHOO only as support for everyone else disappeared with no fix. That's ok if you have a few cameras but I have 100s of clients so that was very annoying. I'm not a fan of Amcrwst but instill use these for smart home install as the camera URL works reliably in web i terraces - until Amcrest mess that up with their ridiculous new smart home products. Walled garden worked for Apple as they had the volume, Amcrest doesn't have the volume and should keep it all OPEN.
review_text_5: This is my 5th camera from the brand. I trust them for the quality and ease of use.Ease of connectivity: Just open the Amcrest Pro app on the phone, add device and scan the QR code to set the new password. Once set, i logged into NVR and added by searching the camera into the system.Quality of video: Excellent day and night video quality. I can set the recording settings in the NVR.Overall: One of the best video cameras i have got and ever improving hardware.

description: AMCREST MODEL: IP8M-2696EW-AI CAMERA FEATURES:Stunning UltraHD 4K (8-Megapixel / 3840x2160) resolution, 4K @30fps, (4K @20fps when AI is enabled, AI is automatically enabled)Best in class low light capability utilizing the latest CMOS image sensor and chipsetSuper-Wide 108¬∞ viewing angleProfessionally view on a PC using the Amcrest Surveillance Pro software or Blue Iris ProfessionalFeatures a CMOS 1/2.8‚Äù 8MP progressive image sensor to achieve unsurpassed low-light capability and night-vision up to 98.4 feetWorks with Amcrest Cloud remote video storage, Amcrest NVRs, MicroSD Card (up to 256GB) and QNAP NAS & FTPWorks with Google Chrome, Safari, Firefox, Microsoft Edge web browsersHeavy-duty metal IP67 Outdoor Weatherproof CameraDual H.265/H.264 compression allows for maximum encryption with the latest technology as well as backwards compatibility with legacy platformsDORI Distance: Detect: 280.5ftObserve: 112.2ftRecognize: 56.1ftIdentify: 28.2ft.Wide Dynamic Range: up to 120dB True WDROperating Conditions: -40¬∞F ~ +140¬∞FCompatible with the following Amcrest Junction Boxes, ASIN: B07CB468HC, B07FK662Z5PoE power supply (injector or switch) required but not includedSmart Plan: Heat map, Artificial Intelligence (IVS) and People countingPerimeter Protection: Tripwire, Intrusion, Abandoned Object, Fast Moving, Parking Detection, Crowd Gathering Detection, Missing Object, & Loitering DetectionCompatible with AM-HAP201 (B07KTBZGC3)This product may contain components which are not NDAA compliantDimensions: 7.6 x 2.8 x 2.6 inchesWeight: 1.3 lbsPACKAGE INCLUDES:1 x 4K (8-Megapixel) 2.8mm Lens Bullet AI IP PoE Security Camera White (IP8M-2696EW-AI)1 Year Warranty When Purchased from Amcrest.

Face detection is available and works independently with this camera. However, facial recognition (recognize, search, authenticate) is only available through an Amcrest AI NVR (ASIN B08CJMRQPY). Offers 4K @30fps video with a super-wide 108¬∞ viewing angle. A PoE injector or switch is required; not included.,SMARTER SECURITY ‚Äì Receive motion alert notifications and view your camera via your smartphone with the Amcrest View app. Monitor your camera on a PC using the Amcrest Surveillance Pro software or Blue Iris Professional. Works with Amcrest Cloud remote video storage, Amcrest NVRs, MicroSD (up to 256GB), and QNAP NAS, FTP, Google Chrome, Safari, Firefox and Chrome, Microsoft Edge. DORI Distance: Detect: 280.5ft, Observe: 112.2ft, Recognize: 56.1ft, Identify: 28.2ft,DAY OR NIGHT, RAIN OR SHINE ‚Äì Built to whether any storm and the darkest of nights, this 4K PoE IP Camera features a heavy-duty metal weatherproof IP67 housing as well as 1 built-in IR LED and a 1/2.8‚Äù 8MP progressive CMOS image sensor to achieve unsurpassed low-light capability and night-vision up to 98.4 feet. Listen to what matters most using the built in microphone. Dual H.265/H.264 compression allows for maximum encryption with the latest technology as well as backwards compatibility.,SECURE CLOUD VIDEO BACKUP ‚Äì The optional Amcrest Cloud remote video storage subscription service allows you automatically store your videos off-site in a third-party location hosted and secured by Amazon AWS. This way if something happens to your local PC/NVR/NAS/MicroSD Card, the footage will be safely recorded in a secure off-site location and accessible to you through a web-based Flash interface for PC (Chrome/Firefox/Safari/Edge) and AmcrestCloud smartphone app.,SIMPLE, RELIABLE, SECURE ‚Äì This Amcrest PoE camera features a secure SSL/HTTPS connection, FCC and CE certificates. At Amcrest, we want to ensure the safety of our customers, their loved ones, homes, and businesses. Compatible with the following Amcrest Junction Boxes, ASIN: B07CB468HC, B07FK662Z5. Compatible with the following Amcrest AI NVR's: B08CJJC9HN, B08KHQD5R8, B08KHQXL48, B08CJJ3YKR, B08KHD3QYJ, B08KHQZXCX, B08CJMRQPY, B08KHQQ5FH, B08KJ7B993. Compatible with AM-HAP201 (B07KTBZGC3)
name: Amcrest 4K AI POE Camera 30fps UltraHD 8MP Bullet POE IP Camera, Security Outdoor Camera, 98ftNight Vision, 2.8mm Lens (108¬∞), IP67 Weatherproof, 4K (3840x2160) @30fps, White (IP8M-2696EW-AI)
review_header_1: Excellent camera for a very economical price!
review_header_4: Use these to setup BlueIris systems for customers
review_text_1: This is a fantastic camera ‚Äî the image quality, even at night, completely blows away my Nest Cam IQ Outdoor, especially with wide dynamic range enabled on the camera. The 4K stream is pretty bandwidth and storage hungry, but H265 encoding shrinks that down pretty well ‚Äî and the level of detail in the feed is pretty amazing. Easy to setup, loads of options and works seamlessly with Synology Surveillance Station. POE makes wiring pretty straightforward, although you will need a waterproof junction box if you are mounting this outdoors and running the cabling on (versus in) the wall. The Amcrest waterproof junction box is pricey, but it‚Äôs also the easiest to use and install, with a number of thoughtful details (although don‚Äôt use the waterproof connector housings that come with the camera inside the Amcrest box - they don‚Äôt fit, which is a bit foolish on Amcrest‚Äôs part.)A note on lenses - I have this version (2.8 mm) and the 4 mm version. The 2.8mm is great for close range surveillance where a very wide field of view is needed.... for many applications, I would recommend the 4mm version which captures a lot more detail past 20 feet distance.One last thing - check your Amazon cart carefully. There is an identical-looking but older version that does not do 30FPS at 4K. Not in itself an issue, but even the latest firmware on that older version is problematic using a Mac and Safari (or Chrome). The new 4K30FPS version has firmware that has those issues resolved.
review_text_2: I have tried many ip cameras from Hikvision, Trendnet, Reolink, Sunba and I am really enjoying my Amcrest cameras. This particular model is the Black Bullet 2.8mm 4K 161FT model. I purchased the Turret style 2.8mm but did not like them nearly as much. Also a great camera with audio and an sd card slot which I wish the Bullet had because the quality in my opinion is better.This camera comes in at an lens aperture of f1.6 which means it can let in a lot more light than the other cameras especially at night. What this means is less need for full noise reduction to achieve less grain in the picture. Another great feature is the angle of view. Surprisingly at the same angle of view as the Turret, the Bullet actually appears a slight bit wider. The Turret is a bit taller in vertical view but it is marginal especially if you don't need to look at the sky. I felt the Bullet was just a tad sharper than the Turret as well.The build quality is very nice on this unit. I like its form factor and relatively small size. I particularly like how easy it is to place the camera and be able to angle it without the wide distortions the Turret gives you if you are off center of the mount. Meaning you mounted it on an angle instead of straight ahead.Don;t hesitate on the 4mm version of this camera because in y opinion it is even sharper than the 2.8mm. I believe you are down to a horizontal view of 87 degrees I believe from 122, But if you don't need the wide angle or your subject you want to watch is farther away from the camera, the 4mm version is literally my favorite so far besides the wonder Amcrest 4mp 12x optical zoom PTZ camera. Buy a bullet, you wont regret it. By the way I paid for all my cameras with my own money, so not in bed with the company.Installation was a breeze and being used currently with Blue Iris. Motion detection features seem to be working well. I purchased Black because as my front security cams I actually want the to be seen from the street as a deterrent.
review_text_3: I love these cameras, the video quality is head and shoulders above my previous cams (IP8M-T2499EW), the video quality is just amazing, the low light capability is greatly improved, the smoothness of video is better than my 15fps 4k cameras and the 6mm option is great too, though not as zoomed in as I had imagined but I can't complain. The only downside (for me) and reason I haven't already bought a second pair is the lack of audio recording, I like having at least 1 set of cams with audio on the front side of my house, so I'll have to wait for a model that includes that to get a second pair there but might get a more zoomed out pair for back side of the house soon. For the price range, these are the best bang for your buck, you won't be disappointed!Pros:+ Improved visuals in low light, even in Color Mode+ Smoother video than any 15FPS I've seen+ Few more configuration options than older models+ All around crisper image than older models in this price range.Cons:- No Micro-SD card option- No Audio- Not as "zoomed" in as you might expect.I attached 2 images, of the same center-point, one is of my older 2.8mm model (IP8M-T2499EW) and the other is this 6MM model, its only a few second apart and I should point out, it's lightly snowing at the time as well as taken after 9pm at night, the newer camera just cuts-through the snow and shows a clear image where as the other one is grainy and you can see the snow falling in the darker areas. Both are in the same mode and settings. BLC enabled and Color mode. oh and in case you're wondering, the weather details at the bottom of videos are using a program called Blue Iris Tools along with the Blue Iris software.
review_text_4: These cameras are my favorite to use with BlueIris security systems that I build and install for customers. The image quality is hands down the best for the price you pay and without going into a professional brand series. The one thing they lacked over their older 15fps model was a SD slot that I wish they had but its not completely necessary for my installs. The night vision works pretty good but I almost always set the cameras up for color night vision as they don't need much light to keep the image bright enough at night to get the job done. The GUI on the cameras should you access them directly via IP address now load without flaw or needing to install extensions. This was a major plus for me as before models I despised having to use browser extensions that were slow and clunky.If your looking for a high quality, top end camera with features galore and great color night vision at a reasonable price look no further!
review_text_5: i bought this camera to replace a failed GW Security IP camera. My usage was simple, setup the camera on a fixed IP and point it to our NVR with no internet access. You do need a power supply or PoE switch as the unit does not come with a way to power it. I had no issues powering the camera with either my Unifi US-8-60W switch or my BV-Tech non managed POE switch. On my Unifi switch, it consumed ~5.5W of power, for reference.Initially setup the camera with internet access and made sure the firmware was up to date. Was blown away as to how easy it was to configure the camera using the web interface (my old cam needed a Windows app and IE Plugins) in Chrome.Had a ton of features which i decided to try before installing with our NVR like saving motion alerts to google drive which worked well. Had no issues connecting via ONVIF to either my Synology NAS or Dhaua NVRI ended up lowering the resolution to 5 MP to match my other cameras so when i viewed the live feed, they all looked the same and not to overload my NVR. Night vision is much clear and so is the view field.Great camera.

description: AMCREST MODEL: AMC4KBC28-W CAMERA FEATURES :High Resolution UltraHD 4K @15fps. 1/1.8" 8MP CMOS image sensor.2.8mm Lens with 110¬∞ Viewing Angle. 2 Powerful IR LEDs for 130 feet Night Vision. IP67 Indoor/Outdoor Weatherproof Cameras. Long Distance Transmit Range (up to 2,296ft). Built-in Microphone for 1-Way Audio. Wide Dynamic Range up to 120dB.Camera is only compatible with Amcrest 4K DVR's; ASIN's: B07R6TBM7Y, B07R927K13, B07HPB7D9F, B07HPC7THS, B07S5XDLD6, B07S5H35BH, B07HPBZ3Q9, B07HPCYLQ5, B07HPDRZX8 and B07HPBM67B. Cameras not recommended for use with 3rd party systems. DIY Installation. Operating Temperature: -22¬∞F~140¬∞F. Dimensions: 7.1 x 2.8 x 2.8 inches. Weight: 1.17 lbs. *Analog Cameras Require a DVR to Operate. A DVR is Required, but Not Included and is Sold Separately. Camera Power Supply and Coaxial Video Cables are Not Included but are Required and Sold Separately.* PACKAGE INCLUDES:1 x 4K (8-Megapixel) 2.8mm Lens HDCVI Bullet Camera White (AMC4KBC28-W) 1 Year Warranty When Purchased from Amcrest *Additional DVR's can be purchased under ASIN's: B07R6TBM7Y, B07R927K13, B07HPB7D9F, B07HPC7THS, B07S5XDLD6, B07S5H35BH, B07HPBZ3Q9, B07HPCYLQ5, B07HPDRZX8 and B07HPBM67B.*

name: Amcrest ProHD 4K Bullet Outdoor Security Camera, 4K (8-Megapixel), Analog Camera, 130ft Night Vision, IP67 Weatherproof Housing, 2.8mm Lens 110¬∞ Wide Angle, Built-in Microphone, White (AMC4KBC28-W)
review_header_1: Great camera. Works great with Security Spy NVR software
review_text_1: I have two of these for outdoor security on my rural property. I like them a lot. I tried the Amcrest NVR but it was awful. But I am quite likely to buy more of these cameras. Super sharp images and video. Convenient POE power source. Night vision isn‚Äôt as good but that is to be expected.
review_text_2: Replaced some old cameras with these 4k on my 4k Dvr. Very clear vivid video. I couldnt use my old camera cable and power supply though because it did not support HD. So there was added cost to the swap I didnt expect. Camera is great though
review_text_3: Nice Cameras, I‚Äôve had Amcrest since 2016, no real complains.
review_text_4: A very good wide angle camera. Note, the wider the angle, the smaller the objects. Works good in low light i.e. before night vision kicks in

features: ,,STARLIGHT ILLUMINATION & MIC ‚Äì Stunning low-light 5MP performance with Starlight 1/2.7‚Äù image sensor and 5MP resolution (2592x1944). Super-wide 103¬∞ viewing angle allows you to cover more ground. Power Over Ethernet (POE camera) for easy installation (POE Injector or Switch Required; Not Included, Sold Separately). Does Not Include a Power Supply. This is a FIXED IP camera and Does Not Pan/Tilt. Built-in mic for one-way audio.,SMARTER SECURITY & STORAGE OPTIONS ‚Äì Receive motion alert notifications and review footage via your smartphone with the Amcrest View app. Playback and record professionally on a PC using the Amcrest Surveillance Pro for Windows and MAC (included) or third-party software such as Blue Iris. Works with Amcrest Cloud remote video storage, MicroSD Card (up to 256GB), Amcrest NVRs, Synology and QNAP NAS, FTP, Edge, Chrome, Mozilla Firefox & Safari.,DAY OR NIGHT, RAIN OR SHINE ‚Äì Built to weather any storm and the darkest of nights, this 5-Megapixel Turret PoE IP Camera features a heavy-duty weatherproof IP67 housing as well as built-in IR LEDs and a Starlight technology image sensor to achieve industry leading low-light performance and night-vision up to 98 feet. Dual H.265/H.264 compression allows for maximum encryption with the latest technology as well as backwards compatibility with legacy platforms.,SECURE REMOTE STORAGE ‚Äì The optional Amcrest Cloud remote video storage subscription service allows you automatically store your videos off-site in a third-party location hosted and secured by Amazon AWS. This way if something happens to your local PC/NVR/SDcard/NAS, the footage will be safely recorded in a secure off-site location and accessible to you through a web-based Flash interface for PC (Chrome/Firefox/Safari/Edge) and AmcrestCloud smartphone app.,SIMPLE, RELIABLE, SECURE - This camera features a secure SSL/HTTPS connection, FCC certificate, and received regular firmware updates. . You‚Äôll receive a full 1-year US Warranty and Lifetime Support provided directly from Amcrest. Compatible with the following Amcrest Junction Boxes, ASIN: B07CB468HC, B071L2RDK2, & B07195BN8X.
name: Amcrest 5MP UltraHD Outdoor Security IP Turret PoE Camera with Mic/Audio, 5-Megapixel, 98ft NightVision, 2.8mm Lens, IP67 Weatherproof, MicroSD Recording (256GB), White (IP5M-T1179EW-28MM)
review_header_3: Cannot beat the features for the price
review_header_4: Incredible night vision, overall high quality video and impressive FOV
review_header_5: My old system is heading for the garbage can....
review_text_1: So I bought this Amcrest IP5M-T1179EW-28MM for my hotel business at one of the locations where the Lorex system is installed, which was also installed by me. One of my Lorex LNE8950ABW camera was destroyed in building fire a few months ago, so I decided to give this Amcrest IP5M-T1179EW-28MM a try as it was also 60% less in cost compared to the LNE8950ABW camera.Quality:Excellent build quality, strong overall housing.I can‚Äôt believe the image quality is as good at the Lorex 8MP camera given this is a 5MP camera.Starlight sensor provides better visibility at night in color and works better than the black and white night vision. I get clearer images for faces, cars, and license plates for farther distances at night.Connection:Directly connected to my Lorex LNR616 using an ethernet cable, and it worked out of the box!You do not need a DVR or NVR for this camera to work. You can plug this camera on a POE network switch or buy a POE injector for a regular switch/router/access point to supply power, Video, and audio all over a single network cable.Access:I use the browser on my desktop to access settings. Still, you can also access this camera and setup page via local web interface over a browser, Amcrest View Pro app, Amcrest Surveillance pro, or Amcrest Cloud. The mobile app is straightforward to use, and it guides you step by step.Audio:The built-in mic is susceptible to picking up audio. I can hear the customers even outside the night window.Storage:I am currently using this camera with SDCard of 256GB with snapshots uploaded to local FTP onsite data sever, H265 compression helps keep the files 40% smaller and get more playback time. There are also other various storage options available that are handy when needed.Interface:Clean web UI and functionality, I must say more than my Lorex NVR.I am so impressed with the value received for the quality and price. I will look into, Standalone license plate capture camera (if they have one) as I am using my current lorex camera with openALPR but it is not doing a job at capturing license plates and smart home video doorbell, as the two doorbells I use at the hotel that customers have to press to receive service as my current ones keep dying every few months due to rough and frequent use by customers including direct sun heat they get 5 hrs a day.Love about this camera:This camera is capable of standalone operation. This means you do not need an NVR to make the camera work. It has a built-in NVR functionality. It can also detect motion, record video clips to a microSD card, send an email and push notifications, even upload to an FTP server.Lorex cameras cannot do any of this. Without an NVR or another device like NAS to store the video, there‚Äôs no point in buying one. Also, since they have ONVIF support, they should theoretically work with any ONVIF-compliant NVR.Overall:I would purchase a camera and would recommend anyone looking for excellent quality and functionality products for a valued price.
review_text_3: I bought this camera because it was inexpensive and I wanted to see how good it could be for the price. I was pleasantly surprised and have purchased three since my initial purchase.The picture is so much better than my old 1080p cameras. I am running my cameras at the second highest resolution (2688 x 1520) so I can get 30 frames per second (FPS). The highest resolution is 2592 x 1944, but only supports 20 fps. I can tolerate 25 fps at the lowest, but I am more than pleased with the resolution I am using. This camera also has something my older cameras do not, audio. The sound quality is not great, but the microphone seems pretty sensitive. It is more than sufficient to know if something is going on. Now I can hear if my dog is making noise when I'm not home.I also like this camera has H.265, which saves on storage space. I have not done a side by side comparison of recordings in H.265 and H.264 with this particular camera model, but I know H.265 videos can be much smaller than H.264.The camera's interface is quick and consistent with other Amcrest cameras. Nothing much to say about that.I use the surveillance program Blue Iris, so I cannot comment on the camera's built-in motion detection. For the Blue Iris users, this camera is quickly found via ONVIF. The sub stream is also quite decent, so be sure to use the sub stream with Blue Iris to save yourself some system resources when viewing all cameras via the GUI.If I had to find a criticism, I would pick the housing being made of plastic, however, this camera would cost more if they used machined aluminum. I don't mind the housing being plastic as long as it does not become brittle or turn yellowish over time. A possible issue for some people is that the camera can be removed quite easily by pressing down on a tab and sliding the camera. It will then come of the mount with no tool needed. You will not want this camera within in reach because it can be stolen, however, I recommend keeping cameras out of reach whenever possible. I don't mind how easy it is to removed the camera because that made it that much easier to install. All of my cameras are also out of reach. If I needed to mount a camera within reach of people, I would use a camera with a clear dome and one that cannot be easily removed.I used Dahua PFB203W Water-Proof Wall Mount Brackets with these cameras. They are a perfect fit and resolve awkward angles when mounting a dome camera on a wall. I also like that the cable from the camera with the ethernet jack can be housed within the wall mount. It looks clean and can reduce the risks of tampering or the elements. I put a bit of clear silicon along the top of the mount to reduce the chance of water getting in through the uneven surface of stucco. This mount makes it really easy to swap out cameras if you are using a similar Dahua mount. The two different models I had used the same bracket that attaches to the wall. This meant I simply loosened a single screw that secures the mount to the bracket, pulled off the mount, and unplugged the camera. Mounting the new camera was the same process, but in reverse.I have tried a coupe Dahua cameras because they were cheap (which I suspect are the OEM maker of Amcrest cameras or they buy from the same OEM). I was looking around and cannot find a similar Dahua with a lower price than this Amcrest camera. I also prefer Amcrest because they will likely issue a few firmware updates over the years. Neither of my Dahua cameras have firmware updates and one said it will never get one.I have purchased four of these cameras and will be purchasing at least one more in the immediate future. Any cameras that need replacing will be replaced with this model unless Amcrest comes out with something better for the price.
review_text_4: To start, this is a great camera that has all the features you'll need. I compared it side-by-side with another Amcrest camera that this one replaced (IP4M-1028EW-36MM). Both day and night, the picture quality is excellent. I was most impressed by how well the LEDs for the night vision worked. I'm used to my other cameras with 18 IR LEDs that create more of a spotlight effect, rather than a flood where it's very bright in the center, but then the light dims quickly the further you go out, they aren't the greatest at night. When this one only came with 2 LEDs, I thought it would be worse, quite the opposite though. This camera does an incredible job of night vision. The 2 LEDs provide more of a flood effect with no visible hotspots that uniformly light up the entire area (see pictures, there is a second light in the image, to light up the yard's furthest part). With a 2.8mm focal length, it does a great job of displaying the entire area. You can see a lot more at the top and bottom versus the 3.6mm but less on the sides. It's closer to a "fish-eye" kind of view. The audio is good if there is no wind, it will pick up the slightest breeze, but it does an excellent job of picking up the sound around it. The picture is excellent quality, but I did notice the video was a bit laggier than the 4mp cameras that I had. This camera would typically lag about 4-5 seconds, whereas the others were about 2 seconds (The settings can probably be adjusted to make that better though. I just used the default settings).I had this set up using an Amcrest NVR with PoE. The setup was simple, plugged it in, clicked remote devices, the camera was listed there, selected it and clicked add. That was it, I had it working in a few minutes. There are 2 things I am not a fan of with the housing. First, there is no way to tighten the camera once you have it in the place you want. The camera is stiff to move, but it would be nice to tighten it so it cannot move. The second is the "quick connect" mounting plate. You can take the camera off by pushing on a tab and pulling the camera out. No tools are needed to take the camera down. To install the camera, you screw a plate to the wall/ceiling and then slide the camera onto that plate. It makes installation quick and simple but makes removing the camera all that much easier. You can choose not to use the plate and attach the camera directly; however, the holes from the screws do not sit flush on the surface, so I was worried the plastic would crack because of the gap. I wish there were a way to screw/lock the tab so you would at least need some tool to remove it if desired.Besides those 2 minor things, this camera is excellent, and I would highly recommend getting it.Pros:Incredible night vision with only 2 leds (lights up the whole area evenly)Large up/down FOV (more of a fish eye view)Great quality videoCons:Any amount of wind will cause noise with the microphoneNot a fan of the housing
review_text_5: This camera is going to be the first of many for me. I have invested in a few different brands since purchasing our home about 3 years ago. Im an IT professional, so IP cameras have always interested me, but entry cost was a huge factor. I started with a Swann DVR system since I am no stranger to running cables. Cheapish entry point, built in recording, etc. Time goes on and they show their age fast, images get blurry/heavy artifacts as cables flex too much in the hot/cold cycle. The bundle of 8 cables leaving a makeshift security closet was ugly and unsustainable.When the camera arrived, it was very similar to professional ip cameras I have unboxed for work in the past. Solid casing, mounting template and mounting bracket, option for flush mount with cable out the side or through the backing wall. Ethernet connector has an assembly to make it weather resistant, with optional power-in port.I swapped it out in a spot where a Swann bullet camera had been, above our second story. This is not the ideal placement for a camera like this, as it would benefit at being down low to get the most out of its resolution, but i was looking for a wide angle to cover the entire south side of the house. 2.8mm viewing angles tend to do just that!Setup is as easy or complex as you want to make it. I didn't install a micro sd card inside the camera as i would be running video to my NAS. I plugged it in, opened the app, scanned the QR code on the cable, and I was already looking at my camera! I assigned it a manual IP since i have a dedicated IoT network to keep things segmented and logged into the camera via its web address. Built in console is complete and in depth. Changed my detection area settings, schedule, name, and logo placements on the image.The part that made this a for-sure for me was its ability to integrate. Alexa is nice and all, but this integrates natively with Synology Diskstation NAS's. I logged into Synology Surveillance Station and searched for new cameras. Within 5 seconds it populated the camera, and loaded everything it knew about the device. Swann cant do that. They don't even offer an RTSP protocol option, so I had to jump through hoops for days to get it to even see the Swann. They do not want you dealing with any other storage than their own NVR's. Amcrest software starts by asking if you want to save to SD card, maybe make your computer an NVR, send files to a network location or NAS. Why WOULDNT you want to use whatever you want?!Image quality is great, night vision is NEXT LEVEL. I turned off the IR for a bit and it still looked amazing. Mic is sensitive to the point that even from above the second floor, i could hear frogs in the nearby ditch. 20fps is silky smooth with natural movement even for fast cars going past. H.265 compression saves so much space over H.264 and is the most modern option to use.I have given my coax system a time limit to live, because one ethernet line to the garage fed into a PoE switch looks MUCH better than the 4 light duty coax cables there now. I still have the safety of my UPS backing up the cameras during an outage as one PoE switch on the backup will keep them powered up centrally.For the price, you cant go wrong dipping your toe into the IP cam waters with this camera. I sent a picture to an older coworker of mine, and within 10 mins of showing her, it was in her cart. You will not regret this camera.

features: ,,4MP H. 265 ‚Äì 2. 4ghz WiFi IP camera features immaculate 4MP (2688x1520P at 30fps video using excellent low light capability utilizing the CMOS image sensor and chipset. Cover more ground using super-wide 90¬∞ viewing angle and remote pan/tilt. Works with Alexa through Amcrest Cloud. H. 265 video compression technology allows smoother video and reduces file sizes and bandwidth consumption. The 4MP ProHD Pan Tilt Camera Does Not Have the Digital Zoom Feature.,SMARTER SECURITY ‚Äì Receive motion alert notifications, review footage and engage in two-way communication via your smartphone using the Amcrest View app. Playback and record professionally on a PC using Amcrest Surveillance Pro for Windows and MAC or Blue Iris Professional. Works with Amcrest Cloud remote video storage, MicroSD, Amcrest NVRs, Synology and QNAP NAS, FTP, Chrome, Firefox, Edge, Safari, etc using Amcrest Web View Extension.,LOW LIGHT NIGHT VISION ‚Äì Features a CMOS 1/3‚Äù 4MP progressive low-light image sensor and built-in IR LEDs to achieve superior low lux performance and night vision up to 32 feet. Not all WiFi IP cameras are built the same and our Texas based team with over 10 years of WiFi camera experience has built-out the performance of this camera by using the highest quality components in order to deliver the ultimate best in class 4MP pan/tilt WiFi camera experience.,SECURE CLOUD VIDEO BACKUP ‚Äì The optional Amcrest Cloud remote video storage service allows you automatically store your videos in the cloud hosted and secured by AWS (motion based and 24/7 continuous recording available). If something happens to your local PC/NVR/MicroSDcard(256GB, FAT32)/NAS, the footage will be safely recorded in a secure off-site location and accessible to you through a web-based interface for PC (Windows & MAC) (Chrome/Firefox/Safari/Edge) and Amcrest Cloud smartphone app.,SIMPLE. RELIABLE. SECURE. - This Amcrest 2.4Ghz wireless security camera features a secure SSL/HTTPS connection, wireless AES/WPA2 encryption, FCC and CE camera certificate, UL rated power supply, and receives regular security firmware updates (Supports both 5ghz/2. 4ghz). Operating Temp: 14¬∞F ~ 113¬∞F. At Amcrest, we want to ensure the safety of our customers, their loved ones, homes, and businesses and you‚Äôll receive a full 1-year US and Lifetime Support provided directly from Amcrest.
name: Amcrest 4MP ProHD Indoor WiFi Camera, Security IP Camera with Pan/Tilt, Two-Way Audio, Night Vision, Remote Viewing, 2.4ghz, 4-Megapixel @30FPS, Wide 90¬∞ FOV, IP4M-1041B (Black)
review_header_1: Supports ONVIF - Works with Milestone Xprotect
review_header_4: Amcrest Crime Footage: Cheez-IT Box Caught On Snout
review_header_5: Awesome camera with lots of features
review_text_1: Happy with this camera so far. I use it with my Milestone system - the video quality is great and it offers some nice features. Ive found the performance on 2.4ghz wifi to adequate. Its not perfect but it works well enough.The camera does support ONVIF although I had some trouble getting it connected in Milestone at first. Oddly enough when I used the "Address Range" option to add it to Milestone it worked.The device has a Speaker and Mic that enables 2 way communication. This works in milestone but im having trouble talking from my phone on the mobile app into the camera. Still messing with that.The setup via App is easy. I used an ethernet connection and the P2P app to program it.I do wish the camera used a USB-C rather than Micro USB. Ive found I am able to run it off a portable battery for quite a bit. Useful for when I have a party and want to monitor who is in certain rooms.The little plastic adjustable screw mount that comes in the box is handy. I like that it uses the Universal standard Camera mount that you might find on a tripod.Im always happy with the affordability of these Amcrest cameras and the fact that the App does not require you to use a cloud service or sign into some account to setup the cameras. Configuration is very easy.
review_text_2: I've had a number of different styles of these cameras over the years. My first move into this format of camera was when I purchased a Foscam FI8918W 10 years ago as a baby monitor for my first born... These little cameras have come a long way! I love that this camera connects to power using a standard USB connection compared to the wall wart power adapters of my older cameras. It would have been a nice plus to have POE however for this price point there is probably a limit on just how much tech one can pack into this small package.As a pro user so I setup and use the camera with the Amcrest View Pro app. The instructions start with the camera on a wired network first before connecting it over Wifi. The setup and beginning configuration was super straightforward and easy to follow. This is my 7th Amcrest camera at my house and I have recommended them to many others in my extended family and friends. Hardly a tour of the View Pro app however two way audio worked great and the PTZ controls worked okay as well. The View Pro app made it very straightforward to review the footage or watch the camera live on my smartphone.The camera's web interface is similar to Amcrest's other offerings and I am pleased to see like other newer Amcrest cameras the image stream did not need any additional plugins or settings and displayed straight away. The web interface I felt was consistent and easy to use from the other cameras I have. I set up the camera to detect motion and record to the SD card internally using the web interface. It had no issues recognizing the 64gb micro SD card I grabbed off my shelf and put in it. For some reason I could not get the detection sensitivity graph to work correctly on my current release of Edge or Chrome and would also be nice if the PTZ function was slower when set to speed "1" even with a rapidly short click of a mouse the camera would move farther than I intended.For my use I also connected it to my Milestone DVR system. For some reason the Milestone camera wizard was unable to find the camera over my Wifi connection, however I found it on the first go through the wired connection... having the Milestone DVR software set the camera up through the wired connection and then updating the address to the correct IP address when connected through Wifi. I was able to test the microphone through Milestone and listen to audio from the camera, however I was not successful in getting the speaker to output sound on the camera or get the PTZ function working. I figure that's a configuration issue on my end. I do not recommend connecting the camera to a dedicated DVR over Wifi as it takes up a lot of bandwidth with either H264 or H265.I have had the camera now a couple weeks and my wife and I use it primarily to watch our fur-babies (cats) go around the house while we were away. It worked excellent and the IR night vision had no issues illuminating the space the camera was pointed at. I highly recommend these types of cameras over traditional "baby monitor" style devices available at big box stores costing well over $200 as these cameras are accessible while at home or out and about through your cellular data. As an IT professional recommend Amcrest cameras to people in my organization who ask for guidance for kid/pet cams where this camera succeeds, or other Amcrest offerings if something with a more security focus is needed.
review_text_3: This is my 4th Amcrest camera so I have been able to try out a few different models.Initially this is really easy to setup as long as you have the Amcrest Pro app on your phone. Connect the camera to your router/switch, open the app and under device manager select add device, then scan the QR code and follow the steps from there to add your wifi. After you add it to the wifi you can unplug from the router and you should be able to see it in the app.You have the option to mirror or flip the image so that if you mount it upside down on the ceiling you can still have the photo display correctly.There are a few new features on this camera I haven't used on previous ones that were interesting to try. The first is Auto Track where the camera will attempt to pan/tilt to track a person or object moving through the room. It works OK the few times I tested it, I'm not sure if I would leave it on as an everyday option.The other feature is Privacy mode in which the camera points directly down at it's base so that it won't see or record any video. This would be helpful if you have guests staying in your home and they don't want to be recorded.The Microphone and Speaker seem to work well, I don't generally use these on my other cameras.One thing to make note of is that this camera does not have an optical zoom, however the picture quality is excellent so using the digital zoom still produces a quality photo.Overall I am very pleased with this camera so far and don't expect any issues as the other cameras I have had for a few years and work great as well.
review_text_5: This is a great camera! with storage flexibility and motion trackingI love that it is not a closed system and you have the ability to choose your storage medium and have direct access to your video stream . I also have an Amcrest NVR and this connects seamlessly to it , to have all my recordings in the same box. Also has pan and tilt functionality, giving you more area to view.For the price and functionality I would highly recommendWhat I like1. Set -up/installation : Set up is easy and straightforward , I needed to add some additional length to the power as the one provided was not long enough for my needs.I have been pleasantly surprised with the wifi connection , ZERO dropouts to my NVR . I reused the hooks I had on a previous camera although one was provided2. Paring : After downloading the app, finding the camera is quite easy using either the search feature or using a fixed IP address which is recommended , plenty of guides for this depending on your router type.3. Motion detection : This is customizable for regions so you can eliminate areas that are not of interest . It also has motion tracking which works well , although it sometimes gets lost4. Quality : its 4MP with great picture quality, also had adjustable settings as needed. Night visions is also great, if you are extending the power source , do make sure to provide adequate power otherwise the IR will flicker5. Storage: You can use an SD card or connect rtsp stream to a dedicated NVR . Cloud backup are available, a lot of options which I love !6. IOT: If you are a DIY smart home integrator like I am , this will work great as the system gives lots of flexibility like RTSP/ONVIF , it also have an API for integration with other smart home products, what not to love!7. Smart home hub: integrates with smart home hubs , so you want easily view streams on that Alexa or google screenWhat I don't like1. The APP (Amcrest pro view) needs some improvement , if functions for what it does but could be a lot better

details: {'Package Dimensions': '16.46 x 16.14 x 12.44 inches', 'Item Weight': '15.49 pounds', 'ASIN': 'B084NSYLRQ', 'Customer Reviews': '', 'Best Sellers Rank': '', 'Date First Available': '2020-02-10', 'Manufacturer': 'Amcrest'}
features: ,,Amcrest‚Äôs NV4108E-HS NVR comes with a Pre-Installed 2TB Seagate SkyHawk Security Surveillance Hard Drive (Supports hard drives up to 6 Terabytes) while Featuring 8CH Recording, the Latest H.265 Video Compression, 8-Port PoE, and Playback & Live View in Up to 8MP Resolution @ Real-Time 30fps. Includes 4 x 5MP IP PoE Outdoor Turret Cameras (2592x1944) @30fps, each camera comes with built-in microphone. Includes 4 x 60ft Ethernet Cables.,Starlight Illumination & Mic ‚Äì Stunning low-light 5MP performance with Starlight 1/2.7‚Äù image sensor and 5MP resolution (2592x1944). Super-wide 103¬∞ viewing angle allows you to cover more ground. This is a FIXED IP camera and Does Not Pan/Tilt. Built-in mic for one-way audio.,‚ÄãPlug & Play setup, Easy to configure, access and control. Scan QR Code on NVR from the "Amcrest View Pro" app to instantly access live viewing and playback. Connects to and manages all the POE IP cameras on your network directly through their ethernet cables for ultimate ease and convenience in a home security system.,‚ÄãBlazing throughput of 80Mbps enables you to watch things happen as they happen: real-time, highly reliable HD video without loss or delay. Conveniently packaged with extras such as USB mouse, network cable, and quick start guide with user manual.,‚ÄãAdvanced H.265 compression technology lets you save on storage space which allows for longer recording times. H.265 technology compresses your video without sacrificing any of the UltraHD video quality. All systems CE & FCC certified with UL compliant power supplies. Guaranteed for a Full Year from purchase with US Support and US Warranty offered exclusively by Amcrest.
name: Amcrest 5MP POE Security Camera System Outdoor, 8CH POE NVR, 4pcs 5MP Turret POE Cameras, IP67 Metal Turret POE IP Cameras, Built in Mic, Pre-Installed 2TB Hard Drive, NV4108E-IP5M-T1179EW4-2TB
review_header_1: No fuss installation with reliable good video quality system
review_header_3: Amcrest provides open compatibility (ONVIF) with great hardware.
review_text_1: I was previously using two 4k Amcrest POE, and two reolink 4MP POE cameras with Blueiris, along with Wyze V2 cameras and Eufy cameras. Blueiris is a wonderful software but very overwhelming to set up. This system is very simple. Plug and play. They simply just work straight out of the box.CAMERASThe bracket/mount for the camera is extremely easy to install. It's good for easy installation and bad since it is easy to detach if someone wants to steal but then I will have footage of the thief. I will take the easy install instead.I had to install sideway for 2 of the cameras due to my wire configuration. The image was rotated 180 degrees so they are correctly oriented. The only issue is the pics look stretch out when I make the fit to screen. Minor issue but I wish the screen just filled with black bar instead of stretched to fit especially in mobile app view.Night vision is great with infrared but since my house and front yard has decent light, I left the infrared light off. The night time images are way better than my old cameras I had.NVRFirst time when I hook up the NVR to my old TV that I was using before all I got was not supported error message. I had no idea what is not supported. After a quick Google search, I found that my TV has terribly low resolution that the NVR cannot display. After I swapped put the TV to a monitor, everything showed up great.Setting up the NVR was easy and straight forward. I was able to found all the cameras and able to add them, including my Amcrest doorbell even though the control/setting of the doorbell was very limited in NVR.I set up all the cameras setting and everything was working great. The problem I have was alarm set up. I set up to see the alarm message and they pop up but only stayed for a short time and went away. The message screen is still up but the actual messages disappeared. I don't see any other way to set them up so the alarm messages won't go away until I dismissed them.The motion detection detects every bit of pixel shifts of the scene. Since these cameras are not AI capable like Eufy, I understand why the every moments can cause the motion detection to go off. My cheap Wyze cameras are the same way but one thing I like is wyze will highlight the motion in green box to show what casued the camera to trigger. If Amcrest can implement something similar, that would be easy to track the reason of the motion alerts.When I turned on the face detection in the app, it turned on and saved the setting. But so far, I haven't noticed any face detection. I only see the normal motion detection. Snapshots are working great to glanced though the footage which is very helpful.These are my observations. I hope they are helpful.
review_text_2: Plugged everything in and powered it up. Immediately hit a snag where the region was set to Uzbekistan and English but both were greyed out and non-changeable. However I could change it via web browser, logged into the web admin where I could set region correctly.Checked NVR firmware which was up to date. Checked the cameras and they needed an update which was easy enough, hardest part was locating the camera firmware to download. I really liked that you could update all the cameras from one central place, that is a very nice feature.Setting up cameras in Blue Iris was surprisingly easy, just gave it the IP address and login info and it detected the first camera right away and gave me a picture. Subsequent cameras were also easy by cloning the settings for the first camera and editing. The cameras perform very well in Blue Iris.Cameras give a nice clear picture and seem well built. I thought at first the cameras didn't rotate on their base, but then discovered they do when I grasped and turned them. The way the camera attaches to the wall bracket seems firm enough, but I probably would have liked to see a screw to make theft of the cameras a little more difficult.The supplied cables have ends that didn't fit the waterproof coupler that comes with each camera. I was able to cut away the strain relief with a knife and the coupler then worked perfectly.The NVR has fairly comprehensive features, only thing I found missing was the ability to fast forward through sections of recording. The manual is rather lacking and there is no help built in. I didn't find it much of a problem, but if you haven't used some sort of camera system like this before it might be difficult.This was a massive upgrade from my old DVR system as the camera picture quality is really very good in daylight or night time.
review_text_3: I installed this product at my cousin's house, after he saw how responsive and clear the image is on my Blue Iris + Amcrest system was at home.We had to drill some holes in his walls to run CAT5e cabling from his bedroom to the living room, where we placed the NVR. We connected the NVR to his 75 inch 4K TV and it gives an impressive image!The image given over the included Amcrest View Pro software is crisp and fluid. The lighting situation on my cousin's porch is tricky; the porch light is always on and there is a Circle K located across the street with extremely bright lighting. I did not change any of the image settings such as exposure in the provided images, this is how it looks on auto mode, which is great.The cameras also include microphones which provide streaming audio to go with the video, so far I have not been in a situation where I would hear someone speaking; but I can very clearly hear the traffic in the street a good distance before I actually see the vehicle in view, so the microphone sensitivity must be pretty darn good.There is a bit of artifacting in the audio quality due to low bitrate, maybe Amcrest could raise the default value a hair.The app is very responsive when doing playback, after dragging the slider on the timeline, playback begins after 2-3 seconds. This is a fair bit more responsive than some other systems I have used.The most important thing to me is that Amcrest maintains full ONVIF compatibility, which means you can get as creative with your set up as you want. You can completely disable the P2P features and run the camera system on a separate, internal network with no internet connectivity, and set up your own NVR system using the software of your choice. This is important because the camera system you have mounted on your walls may exist longer than the company you purchased from!This is my third Amcrest-based system that I have installed in the past 2 years. This one using all Amcrest-provided hardware, the other 2 are a hybrid system using Blue Iris / Amcrest NVR / Amcrest Cameras. They are now my go-to recommendation for both work and at-home surveillance.
review_text_4: This is an excellent NVR and camera package. I actually had the standalone NVR (NV4108-HS) non-ethernet version of this and had a few cameras. So, I got this package and I have to say if you‚Äôre considering a non-ethernet version, this is the way to go. I have a full-stack Ubiquiti network, and for whatever reason, the cameras struggle to connect to my PoE switch. With this one ‚Äì no issues whatsoever. You connect the cameras to the NVR and they just work. Also, the NVR came with the hard drive pre-installed. The last one I had to install a drive ‚Äì very nice it was already installed.The NVR has (as far as I‚Äôm concerned) an easy-to-use and intuitive setup wizard to get it going. When you power on the NVR, it takes you through all the necessary steps to get it configured and set up (including adding the cameras). Then you‚Äôre ready to go. Mine shipped with the newer firmware, but if you have to update the firmware it‚Äôs not too hard. The user interface on these newer NVRs is so much better than the analog NVRs of the past which makes them an appealing option to many of the ‚Äúsubscription‚Äù based cameras such Nest, Arlo, Wyze, and many others. I like having my camera recordings stored locally and I like being able to use them without having to pay anyone.During the setup of the NVR, it guides you through a Peer-To-Peer setup of their Amcrest View PRO app which allows you to access your NVR remotely. Essentially Amcrest facilitates a secure connection between your device and the NVR with no subscription fees. The best part about this is that you don‚Äôt have to open any ports or anything in your router. The connection is automatic and transparent without any action on your part.The app does need some work but the notifications work well. They were right on par with my Nest Outdoor Cam and Wyze Cam and you tell the app what to when you tap on the notification. It allows you to select a few options two of which are opening to a live view of the camera or the recording event.The IP5M cameras are excellent! What makes them so excellent is their low-light performance. I really don‚Äôt like using IR if I don‚Äôt have to ‚Äì you can see more detail without IR if you have enough ambient light. A great example of this is recently on my neighborhood Facebook page someone posted a video of someone trying to break into a car. The thieves pulled their car into their driveway and if they had IR turned off you might have been able to see the license plate, but because they had IR turned on the license plate just looked like a bright reflection. These IP5M cameras work well with low light and the picture almost rivals my Ubiquiti G4-PRO($449). The cameras have an excellent and high-quality microphone that can provide detailed audio once the ‚Äúaudio filter‚Äù has been disabled. The audio filter makes it sound like the microphone is underwater so I would strongly encourage doing that. You can disable the camera's microphone filter from the camera‚Äôs web interface.Speaking of the camera‚Äôs web interface. The camera's web interface CAN be accessed when they‚Äôre connected to the NVR. It may vary but you‚Äôll use a URL similar to this http://<nvr-ip>:100. It‚Äôs the NVRs IP and then a port. You can see this if you use a browser to connect to the NVR and then select ‚ÄòCameras‚Äô.Also, I would suggest changing the password again after you have finished the setup. I believe you change the password before adding the cameras. The cameras use a default login of admin/admin. If you change the NVR password after you have added the cameras it will update passwords on the cameras as well. The camera's web interface is accessible even if you‚Äôre not authenticated to the NVR.The NVR is fairly quiet and doesn‚Äôt run too warm as far as I can tell and with roughly 7 cameras connected with IR running it was using around 35 watts as measured with my kill-a-watt meter.Performance-wise ‚Äì I would feel pretty confident that this NVR could record from six to seven 4K cameras running at their full FPS and resolution. I connected five IP5M cameras and two IP8M cameras all recording at their highest resolution and maximum FPS and set to record all the time and it was only using roughly 55Mbps out of 88Mbps of its available bandwidth. It doesn‚Äôt seem to struggle when recording but trying to playback the recordings you might be able to select 1-3 channels before it will say ‚ÄúOver decode ability‚Äù. I don‚Äôt really find that a problem as I‚Äôm only going to search one camera at a time. Also, a note about the matrix view of the NVR itself ‚Äì it won‚Äôt play the 'main' stream from all the cameras. It will intelligently balance which stream it is showing in the matrix view ‚Äì pretty smart.Playing back recordings is pretty easy ‚Äì it‚Äôs easy to find motion events as the yellow blocks on the timeline. Downloading videos is tricky though ‚Äì I would suggest using ‚ÄòSmartPSS‚Äô and then watching a video on YouTube called ‚ÄúHow to Playback and Export CCTV Video Using SmartPSS‚Äô from ‚ÄòAuckland Security Cameras‚Äô. Also, be sure to read the ‚ÄòEXTRA NOTE:‚Äô in the description.The method in the video works pretty well ‚Äì as the video is very nice and clear if you can get the original video from the NVR itself.My favorite way to browse motion events is using the NVR itself (the web interface is decent from a Windows PC). The Amcrest App needs a lot of improvements before its usefulness will be on par with its competitors. If Amcrest nails their app down ‚Äì this NVR with mobile app will be a game-changer.So, in summary: Great NVR, super simple to set up and configure, mobile motion notifications work great and built-in ethernet is life. Also, IP5M cameras are probably the best value in Amcrest‚Äôs lineup for quality and low-light performance!
review_text_5: I have several Amcrest cameras along with a few other brands as well. I‚Äôve been using Blue Iris at home and an Amcrest NV4108-HS 4K 8CH NVR at a vacation home. I liked the simplicity of the NVR at our vacation home, and needed some more cameras at home and decided to add this NVR kit with 4 cameras. This kit does not disappoint. I already have a couple of the IP5M-T1179EW cameras, so I knew they had a great picture and good starlight performance at night especially considering the price point. Yes, there are better performing cameras with larger sensors for pro level night time performance, but they cost 2 to 3 times what these cameras do.Since I already owned the NVR at my vacation home, I mostly knew what to expect. One difference is that my other NVR did not include the POE ports. I honestly prefer that setup, as it allows me to run one cat5/6 cable to the back of the NVR and use static IP addresses that I setup on my router. The camera webgui‚Äôs are all easily accessed through a standard web browser. This version has the POE ports built in which does save on a POE switch or individual POE power supplies, but it gives you less flexibility on your camera placement. For example, you have to run all the cables back to the NVR from each camera vs just one cable from your router or a switch etc. You do still have the option of adding other cameras to the NVR through its LAN port vs the POE ports, so it does still give you the same flexibility if you want it. I just find the POE ports on the NVR as less convenient and redundant.That said, the POE ports can give you extra security as the NVR isolates them with a separate IP address format. My main router gives out addresses in the 192.168.1.xxx range, while the NVR addresses have their own IP range depending what you choose for example 10.1.1.128. The camera webgui‚Äôs are not readily accessible through a web browser as the IP address range is different from my routers range. You can access them if you log in to the NVR from a PC or mobile device and click on the link next to the camera. This will open the webgui of the individual camera. One caveat is to make sure the ‚ÄúVirtual Host‚Äù checkbox has been checked on the Network page of the NVR. It will allow you to resolve the address that is not in your routers range.One other note, I had no trouble accessing the cameras that were plugged into any of the POE ports other than Port 1. Amcrest uses an amended address, that of the NVR, plus a port number to access each camera. For example, in my Port 1, the camera was given an internal IP address of 10.1.1.128. When I click on the link to the cameras webgui within the NVR page, it directs me to 192.168.1.100:10080 for Port 1. (192.168.1.100 is my NVR IP as assigned by my router) The other ports follow with Port 2 as 192.168.1.100:10081, Port 3 as 192.168.1.100:10082 etc. The problem is that port 10080 has been deemed dangerous and has been blocked in most modern browsers, IE, Edge, Chrome etc. When you try to access the webgui of the camera in Port 1 of the POE ports, the browser will give you a blocked port error. There are ways to open up the port on various browsers, but it involves overriding the built-in behavior of the particular browser you are using. Just google unblock port 10080 for workarounds for your particular browser. Nevertheless, it is something that Amcrest should change with a firmware update that removes the use of that particular port. I haven‚Äôt seen any way to change the port range from within the NVR, so it‚Äôs something Amcrest has to address with a firmware update.If you are looking for top-of-the-line nighttime low light performance, you will have to pay a lot more and move up to cameras with larger sensors such as a 1/1.8‚Äù image sensor at 4mp or 1/1.2‚Äù at 8mp to get more low light capability at night. The sensor in the Amcrest IP5M-T1179EW cameras included with this NVR kit have 1/2.7‚Äù image sensor at 5mp. The more megapixels you cram onto a sensor reduces the low light sensitivity, unless you make the sensor larger to compensate for the extra pixels.Overall this system works well, and the cameras give a great mid-range consumer quality picture. Most users will be thrilled with the picture quality at day and night.
