features: ,,EXPERIENCE ULTRA HD 4K ‚Äì Stunning ultra-high quality 4K (8-Megapixel / 3840x2160) resolution featuring enhanced low light capability utilizing the latest CMOS image sensor and chipset. Super-wide 105¬∞ viewing angle allows you to cover more ground and keep more of what matters to you safe. Power Over Ethernet (POE camera) for easy installation (POE Injector or Switch Required; Not Included, Sold Separately).,SMARTER SECURITY ‚Äì Receive motion alert notifications and review footage via your smartphone with the Amcrest View app. Playback and record professionally on a PC using the Amcrest Surveillance Pro for Windows and MAC (included) or Blue Iris Professional. Works with Amcrest Cloud remote video storage, MicroSD Card (up to 256GB), Amcrest NVRs, Synology and QNAP NAS, FTP, Pale Moon and Sea Monkey Browsers, IE, Safari, Firefox 49.0 and Chrome with Amcrest Web View Extension.,DAY OR NIGHT, RAIN OR SHINE ‚Äì Built to whether any storm and the darkest of nights, this Dome 4K PoE IP Turret Camera features a heavy-duty metal weatherproof IP67 housing as well as built-in IR LEDs and a CMOS 1/2.7‚Äù 8MP progressive image sensor to achieve unsurpassed low-light capability and night-vision up to 98 feet. Dual H.265/H.246 compression allows for maximum encryption with the latest technology as well as backwards compatibility with legacy platforms.,SECURE CLOUD VIDEO BACKUP ‚Äì The optional Amcrest Cloud remote video storage subscription service allows you automatically store your videos off-site in a third-party location hosted and secured by Amazon AWS. This way if something happens to your local PC/NVR/SDcard/NAS, the footage will be safely recorded in a secure off-site location and accessible to you through a web-based Flash interface for PC (Chrome/Firefox/Safari/Edge) and AmcrestCloud smartphone app.,SIMPLE, RELIABLE, SECURE - At Amcrest, we want to ensure the safety of our customers, their loved ones, homes and businesses. You‚Äôll receive a full 1-year US Warranty and Lifetime Support provided directly from Amcrest. Built in microphone for one way audio. Compatible with the following Amcrest Junction Boxes, ASIN: B07CB468HC, B07FK662Z5 & B07628JHXL.
name: 2-Pack Amcrest UltraHD 4K (8MP) Outdoor Security IP Turret PoE Camera, 3840x2160, 98ft NightVision, 2.8mm Lens, IP67 Weatherproof, MicroSD Recording (256GB), White (2PACK-IP8M-T2599EW)
review_header_2: A great security camera at a small price.
review_header_3: Amazing low level light, crystal clear image daytime or at night.
review_header_4: Best Amcrest camera I have used yet
review_text_1: I have 13 security cameras (of various models) around my home, all feeding into Blue Iris running on an Intel NUC NUC8i5BEK. About 4 years ago it all started with 4 Hikvision HD dome-style systems and I have been happy with them. Slowly I've been swapping the Hikvision out with Amcrest HD PTZ dome cameras, which are great because they move. I also added the Amcrest doorbell camera, one of the only products I found which would *also* stream to Blue Iris, which was a hot button for me.I've been wanting to upgrade a few of the Hikvision to 4k .. really liking the Amcrest line up, I purchased this one. The 4k clarity is outstanding, and adapting to varied lighting is excellent. The night vision is far superior to the ageing HD products I had. What I really like too is Amcrests configuration tools, which run on my iPhone and also provide a very comprehensive web setup. No more do I have to dance around Internet Explorer ActiveX controls (ARGH). The Amcrest cameras use Chrome, which runs on both my PC and MacBook. Also the Amcrest doesn't require an overly complex configuration tool to be installed. Also, the iPhone app makes firmware upgrade extremely simple, like it *should* be :)The Hikvision dome cameras require periodic cleaning; those exposed more to the elements even more so. When the dome gets rain spots on them, the IR from inside the dome reflect back into the lens and can essentially make the camera useless till I get out the ladder and clean them up. This Amcrest is better design in that regard, where the IR is separated from the lens and I've not needed to clean it once, in comparison. Adjusting the camera position is much simpler too. Just loosen the lock screw and adjust. No more dangling dome cover.I've been very happy with this purchase, will buying a few more myself and recommend to my neighbors.
review_text_2: I have been involved in the security business for over twenty years on a commercial level and started when everything was analog, using coax cables to each camera and such. So, this gives you some background for my review.These are not commercial level cameras like Axis, Bosch, Honeywell and so on BUT for the price (especially when they go on sale) they are worth it.I have seen them used in commercial environments where cost was a huge factor ($100 compared to $1000 each and up.) but where HD, WDR and H.265 video compression is required these fit perfectly!I own several of these now and use them on my rental properties. I have a few in my primary residence and will replace my older ones with these POE cameras as they die.They have the same (if not better quality) than their competitors on the market like Dahua, etc. Everyone needs special features based upon their needs, so this statement isn't to start a comment war. :)The IR doesn't really go to 98ft but if you need to see that far, then buy an IR extender/panel. ANY camera needing that type of distance for nighttime vision you will need an IR extender/panel.The microphone works great but it's not two ways. I use it to pick up speech if someone is at an entrance and just standing there.The wide-angle lens with the WDR (Wide Dynamic Range) really makes it better for viewing. Think Axis low end camera quality without spending $700+ per camera.It streams one of the latest video codecs (make sure your NVR or storage device supports it) which has great compression and saves a ton of storage space.It comes with a SD card slot which is very helpful. If someone breaks in, most of the time they will look for your NVR or computer to grab that to remove evidence. Having a SD card gives you a backup at the camera level if they take your recording device or cut your Internet or Fiber before breaking in. Always go with the worst case Scenario!A few additional things to remember as well.FPS (Frames per second) and motion activation. If you are new to this, you might think that you need to have the camera recording full resolution and 24/7. That is never needed unless you are at a military base, airport, or other super high security facility.I highly recommend 7 frames per second for general use if you need 24/7 video capturing. Now there is a twist to this. You can capture 7FPS but when the camera senses motion it can trigger to capture at 30/60 FPS. This will give you 24/7 and full capturing of whatever comes into the camera view.I recommend interior cameras to be set at capture upon motion at full resolution and full FPS. There is no need to waste storage space on stairwells, hallways, nighttime only cameras or anything that you do not need to view/capture unless there is movement. You will save a ton of storage space.Always have the cameras (or NVR) grab screenshots and send them to you or a cloud storage device. Again, this will notify you and allow you to have a copy offsite if something happens onsite. Burglary, fire, etc.Use a storage calculator! I cannot tell you how many times I have seen where the storage space does not meet the client's needs. Then the storage device does not expand, and they must start over again. Figure out how many days you want to keep the recordings. Now remember, most new systems will send a copy to your Email or Cloud server when capturing events, so you do not always need the typical thirty days. you can get away with 7-10 days before it overwrites the information. This gives you plenty of time to make sure you have a backup, etc. Now commercial and government installations have legal requirements for storage and public records requirements so make sure you build the storage based upon your needs.ALWAYS ground each camera and ethernet cable to save the rest of your inline equipment. I say for all installations, not just for these cameras. Any surge or lightning strike will fry the device BUT properly ground will add a layer of protection for greatly reducing the factor of destroying everything connected to the switch and more. You can find dedicated inline devices for this.Remember though, the device needs power over ethernet (POE) so make sure you buy one of their power injectors or make sure your switch that you are plugging it into supports POE.For the price, features, water resistance, etc. I recommend this camera!
review_text_3: I tested this camera as a POE setup and a non-POE setup, the non-POE was powered by a 12v 2a Plug. For the POE I am using an Amcrest NV4108E-HS 4K 8CH POE NVR. I also tested this camera with Blue Iris 5 which is a 3rd party NVR software solution that I love. I am currently Running 8 Amcrest cameras 24/7 on both systems.This camera works well as a standalone camera as it does have an on board micro-sd slot, however I found the integration with both the Blue Iris software and the Amcrest NVR seamless. It really is another great Amcrest camera. I have been using it for a little over 3 weeks now and the only issue I‚Äôve had is the Amcrest NVR kept saying the video for this camera could not be processed. I think my NVR wasn‚Äôt powerful enough for all 8 cameras even though the specs said it was. More research needed on my part. The image quality is superb, the night vision is where it shines in my opinion, this camera only has 2 IR LEDs yet it handled low light conditions better than all my other cameras did as seen in the uploaded picture the IP8M camera is the only camera out of the 3 that has not gone to night mode because it handles low light so much better than before. The one-way microphone is also a nice touch, you can even set up recording based on noise detection. I plan on using this camera to document the work on my 69 Chevelle and will post an update with more use.Amcrest products are great and customer service is fantastic. When you purchase this camera, you are investing in the product and a company that cares about you.
review_text_4: The IP8M-T2599EW-28MM is a very nice improvement upon other Amcrest 4K cameras that I have used and by far the best.BUILD QUALITYThe build quality on this camera is comparable to the other 4K Amcrest cameras that¬†I have with its very solid metal construction.¬† The box does clearly come with everything you need to make sure that your camera is safely installed.¬† I really enjoy the new "face" of this camera.¬† I find the solid black field around the lens makes the camera stand out less.¬† It's always tough with cameras to not give the impression of overbearing surveillance, so this helps out.¬†INTERFACEAs with other¬†Amcrest¬†cameras that I have used, this camera has the modern¬†Amcrest¬†interface. The preview mode allows for crisp and clear playback on what the camera is looking at.¬† There is a rich set of available features that are very easy to edit and you can also tune your video quality quite easily to help it match up to the environment it is in. The camera also has such a strong feature set that an NVR would not be required due to its built-in functionality.¬† It is also able to have different "backoffice" type settings for things like changing the name and many networking settings including Dynamic DNS.One thing I would like to see in the camera is if the interface could list out what model of camera this is.¬† As I get more cameras installed, it would help to have this by default without having to use the device name, watermark, or manual tracking.It would also be nice if the camera could use centralize user authentication instead of only local authentication on the device.VIDEOThe video¬†quality on this camera makes a big¬†step forward.¬† I'm not sure if it's just tuned better, but it's much crisper than my other 4K cameras. The daytime video is really great.AUDIOThe audio on this model is pretty good.¬† Seems to be less tinny and garbled than other ones I have used in side-by-side testing.POWERMy camera is powered by PoE. While in standalone live preview mode, I have noted that the camera draws between 2.3W and 3.2W.¬† Once again, this is the best that I have recorded with Amcrest.SUMMARYThis is the best Amcrest camera that I have used so far.¬† Really great to see how they keep developing their products.
review_text_5: This review is for AMCREST UHD 4K (8M) turrent outdoor POE camera (IP8M-T2599EW).(AMCREST offered 50% off for an honest review of this camera.)A very short review - if you are using 3rd party software to manage cameras (like Blue Iris or Synology Surveillance Station), no need to look further, this is no doubt one of the best outdoor cameras for you.More details:First of all I have been using AMCREST outdoor POE cameras for 3 years and I am generally very satisfied with their hardware. (Not so for their software, more on this later). I have 8 AMCREST POE outdoor cameras (IP4M-1026EB) setup around my house and I have never had any issue with any of them (knock knock wood...). So I have high expectation for this product too. While I haven't been using it for long (only 2 weeks), I can tell the construct is very very sturdy and solid, you don't see any plastic, all are metal and glass (for the camera) and the finish is elegant, it's a high end camera (unlike some other brand's outdoor camera, you get plastic stuff).Secondly, it's easier to install than most other bullet outdoor cameras because with the provided tool, the base and the camera can be totally separated, so you first install the metal base (as easy as a piece of cake), then you fix the camera onto the base. Whereas for bullet cameras, the base and the camera are one piece, the installation is less flexible.Thirdly, its features make it perfectly used with 3rd software: a) dual stream support - a sub stream (low resolution) can be chosen in viewing or storing, this greatly reduce bandwidth or storage depending on your configuration (Blue Iris and Synology both support substream) b) x265 support - again cut bandwidth usage or storage requirement almost in half c) aac audio support d) overlay is removable and configurable, so you get better control overlay drawing in 3rd softwareFourthly, like all other AMCREST cameras, it has a standard web interface to configure everything, from picture quality (BLC, WE, IR and Exposure) control to even customized https certificate, it covers every aspect, way better than some cameras that can only be configured in the app.Fifthly, the day-light picture quality improvement over my previous generation (4M pixels) is easy to identify, however, I don't see a huge night-time picture quality improvement.Sixth, the motion detection feature is largely the same as my IP4M-1026EB, I was hoping they can bring in "human-detection" or "boundary-cross-detection". (It would be a killer-feature to be able to do human-detection without the need to go cloud.)Other things worth mention: there is an option to turn off P2P (default is on), P2P is regarded as unsafe sdcard is supported, I didn't test it.Lastly, the mobile app is about average, I am not saying it's not good, it is not just as good as the hardware level. I personally install AMCREST App on my camera for live view and manage them using BlueIris for video recording (right, they can stream to multiple destinations at the same time) thus get the best from both worlds...I highly recommend this camera

Best in class low light capability utilizing the latest CMOS image sensor and chipset. Super-Wide 31¬∞~113¬∞ viewing angle. Wide dynamic range up to 120dB. name: Amcrest 4K Optical Zoom IP Camera, Varifocal 8MP Outdoor POE Camera Bullet, Security Camera, 2.7mm~13.5mm Lens, IP67 Weatherproof, MicroSD Recording, (IP8M-VB2896EW-AI)
review_header_1: Solid Camera with zoom lens adjustment.
review_header_3: Amcrest 4K Optical Zoom IP Camera, Varifocal 8MP Outdoor POE Camera Bullet
review_header_5: Unique bullet camera with 5x optical zoom
review_text_1: Had a chance to test this camera out for a couple of weeks now and the primary reason for which I purchased it, reading license plates. This is not a dedicated license plate camera, however, it does a great job reading license plates during the day. I am still working on and tuning the settings at night, but I am currently able to ready every single plate during the day at a distance when I estimate to be around 70-80 feet. The setup of the camera is straightforward but the Amcrest Cloud App on IOS is missing a lot of features, so my go-to is the web interface that is hosted by the camera which is the same as all the other Amcrest models. This camera supports face detection, smart motion for humans and vehicles, IVS, and all the default triggers. I currently have mine set up where it catches traffic and not a lot of people walking, but it has been able to catch all cars driving by. This camera also supports local SD card storage which I use on all my cameras as a backup. All in all, it's a great camera and I'll be keeping it in my arsenal of security monitoring.
review_text_2: I've been using the Amcrest 4k optical zoom camera for the last couple of weeks. The motion detection can detect whether it is a person or car which seemed to work pretty well. I mostly am just interested in people coming up to our door and that seemed to work well. Cars that speed by may or may not get picked up as a car. I had some initial issues installing the camera using the Amcrest ViewPro iPhone app. The app would crash when I tried installing it as a P2P device and scanning the QR code. I eventually got it added and the camera worked great. The optics are pretty nice, with the exception of the focus feature. When I changed the focus a small amount the picture was so out of focus it wasn't recognizable. I can press the AutoFocus button to get it back though.Overall I'm pretty happy with the camera though, being able to optically zoom with a bullet camera is pretty nice as well as being able to distinguish between people and cars with the motion detection.
review_text_3: This camera surprised me with the quality of the video. I have purchased a few cameras that boasted "great video" however they left me wanting. The video was crisp and clear. Night vision is better than I expected. Positive side effect is being able to clearly identify wildlife at night. Setup was a breeze. Like any camera there is a lot of tweaking to get the configuration that you are specifically looking for, but make no mistake this camera affords you the ability to configure exactly to your liking. I will be purchasing more Amcrest cameras in the future.
review_text_4: Purchased as an upgrade from an older bullet camera and overall I am pleased with the camera. I enjoy that I can now browse into the camera without special plugins. Works nicely with BlueIris. Also, appreciate the improved camera performance at night, it doesn't perform magic, but clearly better than my older camera. If you are using the BlueIris AI for alert confirmations then you don't need the AI features of this model.
review_text_5: This is a very nicely build Amcrest 4K Optical Zoom POE bullet Camera. Aluminum base and wall mount are quite heavy and overall construction seems to be built very well and easy to adjust. Camera also has adjustable sun shade made of plastic. Optical zoom is rather unique feature in bullet form factor and you will hardly find such cameras on the market. So you can control motorized 5x optical zoom at stunning 3840x2160 4K resolution with auto or manual focus. This is not a WiFi camera and to connect it you will need Ethernet cable connected to POE switch or NVR or you can use your external 12V power adapter. Video quality is outstanding and you can see detailed picture from min to max zoom. I connected it to my Hikvision NVR via ONVIF protocol and camera started working immediately after entering login and password. I chose 1080p resolution at 30 fps but camera supports up to 3840x2160 at 20 fps. Traditionally for Amcrest this camera has a nice web UI with tons of features and settings such as intelligent video surveillance. You can record and control video on your smartphone, tablet, computer or NAS. Camera also has paid cloud storage compatibility or you can record video just to onboard microSD card and play it back via smartphone app or web UI. Night vision works pretty good and camera focus works well enough in night mode.Improvements. To me personally it would be nice to get an automatic zoom control function with schedule. I need to zoom in on my driveway every night and zoom out every morning after.Anyway this is highly recommend product.

name: Amcrest New 1080p WiFi Camera Indoor, 2MP Pan/Tilt Home Security Camera, Auto-Tracking, Motion & Audio Detection, Privacy Mode, Enhanced Browser Compatibility, H.265, Two-Way Talk IP2M-841B-V3 (Black)
review_header_1: These cameras are a heaven sent for us
review_header_2: Pretty easy to install and use. Great camera.
review_header_3: A fantastic camera at a good price point
review_header_4: Great camera at a good price
review_text_1: This is my 4th Amcrest camera. My 1st camera is getting close to 2 years old and still going strong. Basic functions and the phone app are pretty much self explanatory. I personally have had trouble working out things like motion detection and recording schedules. Usually I just call customer service to straighten it all out (which takes about 10 or so minutes and then you usually are on your way). With my new camera I decided to play around with the app and the online functions some more. After doing some reading (yes... I actually read the online user manual. Who would have thought! Right?) I was able to set up my motion detection and schedules. I have used them to monitor my young kids from another room or to keep an eye on my house while I'm away. It's even helped me solve a few mysteries as to what my dog is up to in the middle of the night or while I'm at work... those video's are keepers for sure. They do their job! I've been incredibly happy with these cameras and I love that I'm not forced to save video's to a cloud (although it is an option). I just insert a 64GB chip in each camera and that has worked out well so far for me. I have a few friends who are such fans that they have even purchased these for their homes as well. The 2-way audio is very helpful. I prefer not to put camera's in bedrooms, but I do have one outside my kids rooms so that I can make sure they are up and going in the morning. If someone decides to sleep in I just use the 2-way audio to get them moving. I also have a camera I keep loose so that I can move it wherever I need it. Currently it is placed in a window facing outside (I had to turn the night vision off since it just reflects in the window) so that I can monitor my backyard for a project we're working on. I'm hoping I can use the recordings to make some kind of time lapse video of our progress! These cameras are a heaven sent for us. Both fun and functional.*I purchased my first 3 cameras and 4th camera was provided by Amcrest for testing and an honest review. I would not hesitate to buy more cameras in the future from Amcrest and I'm liking the idea of a few outdoor cameras.
review_text_2: This is the second camera I do buy from Amcrest. I really love the product. I love the quality of the video/image. It has lot of capabilities that allows to navigate in different directions without the need of having to enter in a complicated configuration process. Just need to connect the camera to the router (for configuration only), plug the power adapter and after that, it just takes less than a minute to have it ready to using.So far, it works great at night and day. It switches mode automatically and the quality at night is good enough. one of my two cameras is installed in front of my house and the other one is in the garage.The size of the camera is just fine. No to big so it can be seen for people and not to small so it can't capture few things.The option of pan and tilt is just great and it does not affect image quality. Of course, how well you see the image when you are remotely, it depends of the internet connection speed you have at home or the place you have the camera installed and your mobile device connection.For sure I give 5 starts to this camera. There are two things I would improve on it:1: the slot for adding the micro SD card. For people like me with big fingers, it is hard to insert/remove the card into/from the slot.2: The lens aperture and wide angle. In some way, these two things really limit how you see the image and how many things you can see during a camera capture.Finally, I got to say that it is an amazing product for the price. It is worth the expense.I am attaching a couple of pictures. I do apologize in ahead for the mess you see in the garage pic, but that was the only way to show the audience how well it works.
review_text_3: This is a really nice camera, that is very easy to set up and use. The build quality is great and the image quality is exactly what I was expecting. The PTZ function is super fast (almost too fast if there is network latency). I set this camera up to use both wired and WiFi connections. This allows me to simply plug in the camera in any room I want to monitor and it is up and running in seconds. I use Blue Iris for my security system and this integrated in easily. I have also tried it with the Amcrest App which works well also.One of the reasons I chose Amcrest is they allow the most flexible ways to use their cameras. If you want a super easy setup, that's an option. If you have a more advanced network there is plenty of advanced options to allow you to set it up however you need it. They offer a cloud service but don't force you to use it. When some companies require you to have an account with them or go through their servers, Amcrest does not force you into that. If you know how to configure your network you can use their products without having any external accounts.
review_text_4: I've been using Amcrest cameras for many years and have always been pleased. This camera is no exception. All of the features function as they should. The pan and tilt seems more responsive than on older models which I own and the video quality is superior. As well as the Amcrest phone app, I was pleased to find that it is compatible with Blue Iris software and Amcrest Surveillance Pro both of which make the camera controllable from your PC. It comes with a mounting bracket which allows for positioning in most any situation and attaches via a thumbscrew to a standard 1/4-20 threaded fitting. The fitting allows it to be mounted on a standard camera tripod as well. Amcrest also has a toll free number so you can actually speak to someone if you require any assistance.
review_text_5: Great camera, great price. It's very clear, the zoom is great, along with pan and tilt. The only problem I'm having is I can't keep the time set correctly. It's constantly changing the time. Very frustrating, and looking up events I have to see what random time zone they put my camera on so I can properly look up the events. If I can finally solve that problem, I'll be thrilled and this camera will be a 5 star for sure. I use their cloud service, that way i know everything is being recorded, no headaches for me. It's $20 per camera for 30 days continuous recording. They also have less days /less money plans or better deals when buy at 90 days for $35.99. I'll definitely go to that plan if I can get the date issue I'm having solved finally. There is also a motion recording plan, cheaper than the constan recording. The camera is well built, comes with great mounting piece, with screws too. Includes the power cord via USB cord and plug. Also includes an ethernet cord. Mine is set for wifi, and it was simple to set up and stays connected with no issues whatsoever. I highly recommend this camera.

name: Amcrest SmartHome 4MP Outdoor WiFi Camera Bullet 4MP Outdoor Security Camera, 98ft Night Vision, Built-in Mic, 101¬∞ FOV, 2.8mm Lens, MicroSD Storage, ASH42-B-V2 (Black)
review_header_2: Quality! I now own 4 Amcrest IP Cameras and I am very pleased with them.
review_header_3: Great feature-set, fantastic picture quality (inc. Night-Vision), reliable & seems VERY sturdy.
review_header_5: Great Wi-Fi camera and awesome price for all the features it comes with.
review_text_1: Great price/value ratio.Hello dear readers,Here is my review about this camera.I got this camera for inside of my garage, since the garage door sometimes doesn't close. I also have an amazon key service, and delivery guys don't close the door sometimes.As a fan of Amcrest products I didn't look for any other camera but Amcrest. And this one didn't disappoint me too. The quality is as always very high. Camera's body is made of plastic, but I would say is some sort of ABS hard plastic. Same with the mounting bracket. The good thing about Amcrest cameras they have a MicroSD card slot on board, so even if you are not planning to get a cloud subscription or if you don't have external NVR to record the footage, you can simply plug in for example 64gb memory card (can get here on amazon for $10) and set up an event recording or scheduled recording or even continuous 24 hours recording. By the way, I was able to connect the camera to my Synology NAS for 24/7 continuous recording.The camera has both wi-fi and hardwired ethernet connection options. So if you have a bad wi-fi signal or you just want to be on the safe side and worry about wi-fi signal interception, you can turn wi-fi connection off and use ethernet cable.Overall happy with the purchase and would definitely recommend to my friends.
review_text_2: Hope this answers some questions about this camera.1.You need to download the Amcrest Home App to your phone to set this Camera up. Mine could not be accessed by Amcrest Surveillance Pro for the initial setup on my wireless network.. The Home app makes it really easy to do it.2. Once that is done, you do not need that app any more. Surveillance pro and Live View both can be used to tweak this camera to your liking. All settings are available (Video/Audio/Network/Motion -everything you need to set this up the way you want to use it. Yes, including setting a static IP. Yes, this does get an IP address, hence it is an IP camera. No, it does not have a web-page login like most IP cameras for tweaking, but once it's on the network, it's not needed anyhow...Surveillance Pro/Live view will access that for you.3. Daytime picture quality is awesome with the perfect coverage for my needs-101 FOV @ 2.8 lens fit the bill. Night vision is good for this price range, but not fantastic. Starlight is a great addition to these cameras.4.Surveillance Pro (If that is your poison) has a serious learning curve. It takes sometime to understand all the settings and what they do. But once you get it down, it works perfectly as does the Live View phone app.I have finely gotten away from all the mix of odd-ball cameras using iSpy and decided on Amcrest (Re-badged Dauha's-which are very good cameras) . I am very pleased with the quality of these cameras in all areas. Highly recommended for the average residential use!Update:9-23-2021Camera is still performing like the day I got it. No issues. Yes, a wireless camera may disconnect every once in awhile (In my case rarely, router placement is critical). Just simply unplug the power from the wall- wait a few seconds and then plug it back in. It will reconnect with all of it's original settings.I see where some folks gripe about the motion detection..that's a software issue, not the camera. This camera does not have built in motion detection. I found an awesome software for accurate motion on Amazon if you are interested, AI-Homeguard. It's AI driven and eliminates 99% of the motion detection issues.
review_text_3: I am beyond happy with my Amcrest Outdoor security camera!This is my third Amcrest camera (I also have 4MP UltraHD Indoor WiFi Camera with PTZ & 4K USB Webcam).From my experience with these two other products, I knew Amcrest was a great brand and my expectations were fairly high.Well the outdoor security camera didn‚Äôt disappoint!Like all Amcrest products I‚Äôve used, setup is easy and the camera itself is extremely reliable with some great features.I have a home automation platform running on a Raspberry-Pi and Amcrest is one of the easiest brands to integrate with it, so I can have all my camera feeds in one place! The night vision is fantastic, really good quality. One of the most important features for me is Motion Detection. I depend on it a lot, to notify me for movement in certain places depending on things like If I‚Äôm home or not. Just like my Indoor PTZ camera, motion detection on this is great.This camera also got me to use the ‚ÄúAmcrest Smart Home‚Äù app for the first time (Previously I‚Äôve used ‚ÄúAmcrest View Pro‚Äù). I could still add the camera in Amcrest View Pro (though didn‚Äôt check if this was supported) but the instructions say to use Amcrest Smart Home; I have to say.. the Amcrest Smart Home app is actually fantastic. Much more intuitive and modern! (Although I‚Äôm still using Amcrest View Pro as well as it now has both my cameras added)On top of reliability and great functionality, the camera itself is very aesthetically pleasing. Looks like nice and modern, definitely more compact than similar cameras from other brands and it feels very sturdy. It has yet to get a hit off anything or have to put up with much stress, but the material feels really really strong.POE is also a massive benefit for an outdoor camera like this one, really happy with that.TLDR:Amcrest products are just fantastic. Great feature-set, really reliable & I‚Äôve always had amazing experiences with their support when I‚Äôve had questions.I‚Äôd recommend Amcrest and this camera in particular to anybody!
review_text_4: Testing Period for review: 11/17/2020-11/30/2020The camera came in nice, solid packaging, and was undamaged upon arrival. The instructions were easy enough to follow to run the initial set-up and connection to the Amcrest Smarthome app.The first few days I had it connected via wifi to test the connection. While connected to the same wifi, the camera had a clear picture, made better by activating the HD quality streaming. The sound coming from the camera was clear. I did format and install a micro SD card for storage as well as sign up for the free trial of the could recording. I do like the motion detection in the app, and the ability to select zones within the app to alert for motion detection.The physical design of the camera was nice and sleek, though I do wish I was able to get the black one since I believe that it would have blended in better. Otherwise, I had no complaints about the physical design of the camera.After a while, and some connection issues, which I will address later, I connected the camera to ethernet. The process was pretty easy, although I wish it would not need a reset on the camera in order for it to connect successfully to a harlined connection.Now the downsides.While connected to the wifi and hardlined to my internet, I had trouble connecting to the camera when I was not on the same network as the camera. When it was hardlined, it seemed to do much better, there were still issues getting the stream to show up though the app.Another nitpick is the the SD slot should not be so close to the rest button because, if you have meaty man fingers like me, you will more likely than not press the button while inserting the SD card.Overall:The connection issues I had are a major turnoff to me. While the connection is much better if on ethernet, it should work well on wifi since it is advertised as a wifi camera. BUT, the quality of the video, the wide angle that it provides, the ability to listen in, and the night vision work well in this camera's favor. I don't know if I would recommend this camera to a friend until the app connection streaming issues are fixed, but overall I am happy with the product. As I sit here, the app is streaming HD video to my phone through the smarthome app, but only if I am not connected to my workplace wifi. I will say that I would pay around $50 for this product, and maybe $65 IF the app connection issues were fixed.
review_text_5: The Amcrest SmartHome 4MP Outdoor Wi-Fi Camera Bullet is perfect for someone who wants an easy and quick setup. After ordering the camera on Amazon, I got it in less than 2 days. The camera arrived in its original box and not inside an Amazon box, but it was well packed and everything inside was intact. The box included the bullet style camera, the power cord, CAT5 cable, mounting screws, camera installation paper template and a weatherproof housing for the CAT5 connection.This camera was very simple to setup and I did not need to read any instructions. Before I started the camera, I opened the latch behind the unit so I could insert my SD card (there is no SD card included so make sure to buy one when ordering the camera). I inserted my 128 GB SD card and closed the latch. When closing the latch, I noticed a rubber gasket to seal the SD card and all the internal components from water. This is an outdoor camera so that is comforting knowing it is made well and not just a marketing gimmick. After plugging in the power cord, I waited until the little light on the front lens was blinking green. I already had the Amcrest Smart Home app from my other device so all I had to do was add the device using the QR code on the camera and enter my password.After testing the camera inside, I installed the camera on my porch using the screws it came with. Make sure you use the template that comes inside the box. This makes installing the camera onto any surface a breeze. The power cord is approximately 9 to 10 feet long so if you plan on installing the camera outside of 9 to 10 feet to the nearest outlet, make sure to get an extension cable. I purposely installed the camera near an outlet so that I would not need an extension cable.The camera is competitively priced, and it has great features. I like the fact it is 4MP because it allows me to see everything clearly without a blur. I was not accustomed to the 30 FPS with my previous camera and this is important to have because it makes the video very smooth without lag. Even at night I was able to see my porch clearly using the infrared lights. The 101 ¬∞ viewing angle is something I have not had before with my previous camera. Now I can see 100% of my yard and do not have to pick which side of the porch I wish to see. The SmartHome App is filled with many features such as motion detection zones and more. I love the fact that I can use an SD card and avoid the cloud service it offers. The camera is well constructed, and I know it will last me many years. If you want to avoid running a CAT5 cable across your home and have an outlet near where you want to install the camera with a decent Wi-Fi signal, this is a must!

name: Amcrest ProHD 1080P PTZ Camera Outdoor, 2MP Outdoor Vandal Dome IP PoE Camera (3X Optical Zoom) IK08 Vandal-Proof, IP66 Weatherproof, Night Vision up to 49ft, Pan/Tilt (IP2M-866EW) (White)
review_header_2: Great value if you roll your own SW.
review_header_4: Great PTZ camera for the money.
review_text_1: I've got 8 of these online for a few months now. I needed POE cameras so I could avoid WiFi and having to put power near the camera. These have a great picture! 4K is the highest and these are only the standard HD but they make up for it with a mechanical zoom lens as well as mechanical focus. 360 degree movement and full tilt makes them even more versatile than the standard PTZ. I couldn't be happier with this camera and I've tried many. It's also vandal resistant and weatherproof - sorry I can't contribute much on those features as mine are inside and out of reach. The free software for iPad/iPhone works very well and Amcrest also makes a free version for PC that is easy to use and reliable. I'm also using these cameras with BenSoft SecuritySpy NVR with the standard ONVIF RTSP profile so no worries about compatibility.
review_text_2: I've tried a lot of cameras from early D-link (my favorite is the DCS-5222L but it is discontinued) to some off the great wall junk and these Amcrest cameras are a very good value. I don't use the vendors SW, didn't use D-link either, I use Blue Iris and it works great. I am not a professional and don't expect professional results at this price point, but do expect responsive PTZ, good auto focus and satisfactory imagery. I prefer 1080P since it gives all the detail I need and uses less storage space, this unit delivers excellent results day and night.
review_text_3: This is the best lower-cost PTZ outdoor camera I've ever owned. Great field of vision. Decent night vision with help from small amount of light from nearby floodlight. Motion detection is good if a bit too sensitive at times (still working on finding the right adjustment). Also, I'm using the Amcrest cloud service, which works well with this camera.
review_text_4: This is my 2nd PTZ camera from Amcrest. The bigger and more expensive model is no doubt better, but this camera delivers great pictures, and easily pans and zooms. One caveat... I mounted it on a vertical surface, so the pan and tilt actions are not as intuitive. It‚Äôs really designed to be ceiling mounted.
review_text_5: This camera replaces an older dome POE camera. The PTZ function is a welcome addition. Day and night picture quality is very good. I use BlueIris to control my cameras and have had no issues adding this camera to my existing setup. I like the small form factor of this camera, you know it's there, but it does not stick out.

review_header_1: ZenCam - Wide view, 2 way audio wifi camera
review_text_1: The ZenCam 1080P wifi camera arrived on time in factory sealed box. The setup was easy and I now have 2 of these working with the Zencam app on android phone. Note: I ordered Micro SD cards to use in these camera's and the camera would not 'see' them. They were formatted in exFAT format. I used the BlackVue program on my Windows 10 PC to format them to FAT32. They now work in the cameras.
review_text_2: Works fine. Use it to monitor front door entry way.
review_text_3: It only uses 64 gig or smaller micro SD card. Haven't installed yet, more to follow
review_text_4: Excellent product for low $
review_text_5: Just for watching outside the house

review_header_1: Best Amcrest Camera I own (OUT OF TEN)
review_text_1: I have ten Amcrest cameras safeguarding my property, and this is without question the coolest one. Starlight tech is quite similar to how it uses every bit of ambient light around the exterior of the camera and special sensors within the camera to brighten that image far beyond what the naked human eye is capable of viewing after dark.Just as amazing in terms of quality during the daytime as all of my other 4K cameras from Amcrest, however THIS ONE obviously SHINES at nighttime after the sun goes down, both figuratively and literally. The two LED lights on the face of the camera put out a warm white, dim, present but not off-putting amount of light, to assist the Starlight ColorNightVision in functioning at it's best. Again, while not off-putting, they are definitely very visible.I have included multiple different images. One showing the camera's POV in broad daylight, one showing the camera's POV in the middle of the night WITH STARLIGHT, one showing the camera's POV WITH STARLIGHT (But without the warm white LEDs), and one showing the camera's POV with regular old B&W nightvision. The clear choice is the Starlight ColorNightVision. The other two images show the unit itself in broad daylight, and middle of the night conditions.
review_text_2: This is easy to set up and the image quality is fantastic. A value and I feel like I can trust Amcrest more than other brands
review_text_3: Bought this along with other 32 Amcrest cameras. It works as advertised. Night vision is good and looks like daytime image. Very clear image and impressive performance!
review_text_4: Works very nicely and provides a great night vision picture!
review_text_5: This camera has the best nightvision in low light of any camera I have ever used. Been installing cameras for more than 15 years and the technology has come so far!!!!!!

review_header_1: Too much security is a good thing.
review_header_5: Nice camera for quick and easy setups with a nice price.
review_text_1: Very easy to set up and monitor what's happening in your home and the outside. I live on a street in downtown Phoenix and unfortunately, we have a lot of homeless and people with mental problems and they seem to like hanging out at one of the bus stops below my balcony. I've called the police on several occasions because of drugs and sex crimes and having a record is great for the prosecutor's office when they take the person(s) to court.
review_text_2: My fault. Thought I was buying a 720p version. This is definitely the low budget model. I'll be replacing it in the summer.Update: even though I admitted I purchased the wrong item, Annke customer service is going out of their way to make sure I'm happy. Outstanding. Will continue to recommend this brand to friends and family.
review_text_3: Ordered this camera to replace one of the cameras that came with the complete system I had ordered some years back. Husband just unplugged the old one one from the outside plugged in the new one. He repositioned it, look in the phone to make sure it‚Äôs where you want it. This camera is much clearer than the other 7 cameras.
review_text_4: This camera works great on an older system that uses Analog cameras. I had a beer system which died. I tried using the camera that came with it, but it didn't work with it as it was a digital system. So all that said, if you need an analog camera, this is the one to get. Picture is Better than what I got with the digital!
review_text_5: This camera is pretty neat. It‚Äôs very easy to set up. Has very good night vision quality and great day time quality. Very nice camera for the price, can‚Äôt be beat.

review_header_1: Great System and Working Like a Charm
review_header_2: Great system, clear picture, easy to install, setup and use.
review_header_3: Can't beat the quality for the money!
review_header_4: Great value, so easy to install, The clarity is excellent and the playback is great as well!
review_header_5: Good quality, especially considering the price point
review_text_1: First of all, I was searching and looking for a surveillance system for my bussiness. To be honest there are many many systems out there that offer pretty much same features and functions just with different brands.. I was like pretty much overwhelmed by the market. I just came across this one while I was searching one day..and then I just decided to pick this one because:1. I do like its design and the color. ( I guess there are many white ones out there, but for some reasons, it just popped out on me.). These cameras look solid from the pictures, and I was hoping that they are not made by cheap plastic.2. This system is not that expansive compared to other ones.3. It is wired system. Personally, I do not like wireless counterparts because I know they can be hacked..and I have seen that on the news..4. The 1TB storage main unit is a plus for me as well.According to the description, it offers many features such as night visions and motion detections...etc..I personally do not care about all these fancy features as long as they can work reliably.After received it, I installed them by myself (I have to say that these cameras are built with great quality). It is my first surveillance system that installed myself. I would say it does require some work especailly for mounting them on the wall and running wires. But the connections and operations are pretty easy, and please go through the mannual if you are going to do it yourself..It is working great now as you can see in the picture..I do not really pay attention to all other fancy features, but it does have geat night vision. I would say this is great system with all basic funtions you need for a surveillance camera system. Will update more once I have all features explored.
review_text_2: I installed this system as an upgrade to my old analog camera system. This system was very easy to install since I already had the cables in place from my old system. Running new these lines as a new install would have been pretty easy if I did not have them in place. Connecting the cameras were very easy plug and play. The only down side i saw to the cameras were the lack of mobility (being able to rotate and adjust them into an exact position that I needed) However i still was able to move them. The DVR was super easy to install and setup. The install wizard walked you through the easy steps. The picture from these cameras are crystal clear in both daylight and at night. I left two of my old 720tlr connected and they were compatible with this dvd( However the New Cameras did not work on my old system) The comparison is unbelievable. These new camera have a very vivid picture in the day time. The night vision is awesome on these cameras. They produce a very clear black and white picture even giving detail to the face where my old cameras whited our the face. ( We had some one break into one of my work cars., with the old system you can see the person, etc.. However when you went to zoom into his face, we were unable to make out his face.) With these new cameras, you get an even clearer picture at night that give awesome definition in low to no light. The app on my phone is super easy to use and it is so user friendly. If you follow the steps in the manual you will get online (provided you have internet access ) with ease. For the price, this system is a must have. I am going to be buying two additional systems to install in my mother and inlaws house. I WOULD RECOMMEND THIS SYSTEM! I have a video however i am not able to upload it, as soon as I figure it out, I will upload it.
review_text_3: I'm a small solely owned security business which installs security systems and I've installed a variety of systems. This has definitely been a great surprise and will be using this system from here on out. Night vision is excellent also. I've added some screenshots from an install using my phone remote app. Another great feature is the ability to playback video from your phone remotely! You will be extremely happy with this system!Now if there was a way to add my business logo at the startup it would be perfect!
review_text_4: Great DVR system kit, the installation was straight forward and relatively going smooth. The clarity is exactly what we needed, very reasonable price, so easy to install, the playback is great as well. Additional for that it works with any kind of old analog or AHD cameras, plus it supports an IP camera as well... Customer Support was really good as I had an issue with adding an IP camera and they resolved so quick‚Ä¶system included everything you need, would recommend to friends and family.
review_text_5: Received this set a couple of days ago, and I am impressed. It contains everything you need to get a simple surveillance system going.To set things up, I hooked the DVR to a HDMI monitor, turned on the system and it boots right up. The OS is a little clunky, but considering I won't be using that, I can see past that.I set up a couple of camera's, changed some of the camera settings and made sure the web-interface was enabled.I installed the camera's in my garage, installation is simple, just a couple of screws and the cable just plugs in.I then hooked things into the rest of my Blue Iris surveillance system, which was rather simple.The quality of the camera's is good. The pictures attached show the image in complete dark and very bright light.All in all, great set for the price. I have several POE camera's that cost more each than this set of 4 + the DVR. The image quality of those POE camera's is much better, but for a simple application, or as a start set. Nothing beats the ease of use of this set.

name: ANNKE 5MP Home Security Camera System 8CH H.265+ DVR Recorder with 4X 5MP (2560TVL) Wired Outdoor CCTV Cameras, 100 ft EXIR Night Vision with Smart IR & WDR, IP67 Weatherproof, Motion Detection - E500
review_header_3: Great video quality and very easy to setup
review_header_5: Very nice system! Many viewing options. Lots of features for a reasonable price!
review_text_1: I bought this system to replace my old wireless system. My old system kept losing connection to the wifi making them useless. I decided to start over and buy this system so I can hard wire everything so it will always record properly. The first step was deciding where I wanted to keep the DVR. After deciding it's location then I had to decide a general location for each camera and plan a path for the wires. I bought wire clips and used the to keep the wire attached to the wall of my house. Everything was essentially plug and play after running the wires. The wizard walks you through all the settings when turning it on and all the cameras are immediately ready to view without changing any settings. After the wizard there are more detailed menu where you can configure the motion detection and a bunch of other settings. The motion detection menu allows selecting the specific areas to detect and also a privacy mask option. The cameras are super clear during the day and night with the night vision. License plates are easily read with this system. The hard drive came preinstalled. After setting up the DVR I downloaded and setup the app for remote viewing. I used the app while positioning the cameras so I can see the exact view when mounting it. These mounts were harder to adjust compared to my old camera ball mounts. There have 2 different screws to adjust the position. I really like how quickly the cameras load on my phone when viewing the cameras remotely. The DVR comes with a remote and a mouse so it's easy to navigate it's menus. I can now comfortably allow my kids to play in the yard as I can watch them from inside my house while working or cooking dinner. I recommend this system for anyone who is willing to put the extra effort to run cables but then have a rock solid system that's easy to operate and is very reliable.
review_text_2: I have been searching for nice security system for business for a while. The biggest factor were a system that has high definition video while recording. My previous one was only 720p solution. Las time when someone breaking my business. I can't really see the theft 's image. This unit provides almost 2k solutions. I can easily see the everything in the video even in very low light conditions. The instructions was pretty easy and clear instructions. The wifi setup was a piece of cake and work as expected. You can see the life time recording on your smartphone anywhere anytime. The night vision works great too. The hard drive gives us lots of recording time. The system are very user friendly. I am so happy with the product and it's capabilities.
review_text_3: Was worried about the quality of the video because the reason I choose this camera is my wife like how it look, but the video quality turn out to be great(both day and night). All the pictures is from 3rd floor looking down, it look pretty clear on the app. The setup was very easy with the app ( I was too lazy to put a monitor to it.) The instructions was straight forward. I was surprised that it came with a mouse (I didn't needed but it's helpful if I ever going to plug it to a monitor)One downside after looking at the pic, the setup didn't ask for adjusting time so my time is off by 12hour. Another thing is I put the recorder in my computer room and the head for the plug is long so other stuff cannot plug next to it( I end out getting an extension cord just for it)
review_text_4: We got this for home use. We needed a wired system of cameras because our internet is not great. We wanted a system that would alert us on our phones, and didn't want a monthly subscription. We've only had it hooked up 5 days so far, so we still have much to learn, but so far, we're very impressed. I won't say set up was easy, but we did seem to get through it. Thankfully the system seemed to get all the ip info once we hooked up the ethernet cable because what we know about ip addresses is not much! Also, once you download the app, you scan a bar code with your phone from the screen display, and it linked them. After I scanned that bar code, I could see video on my phone if i clicked on the app, however, it took me 4 days to figure out how to get push notifications on the phone to alert me to motion at my house. The Annke website was much clearer to me than the booklet that was included - their website was where I finally figured out why I wasn't getting push notifications & got it fixed. I love the push notifications! Also very impressed with the ability to play with the motion detection - a grid will come up on the screen and you can delete sections from the picture - specifically we had a treeline in one corner that was blowing in the wind & kept setting if off, so we were able to delete that section on the grid. The picture quality is great. We have it hooked up to a tv monitor. Daytime pictures are very clear. I'll have to update this review on nighttime view because I don't think we have it set correctly. One of the cameras has a good nighttime picture, but one of them is just basically black. We can tell it's our backyard, but that's about it. But again, this may be a setting we need to tweak - will update review after we play with it some more. I haven't tried customer service yet, so I can't comment on that feature yet because we hooked it up on a weekend, and it is available Mon-Fri. My main reason for getting the system was the ability to monitor the house while I was at work during the day, and it seems to be working fantastic for that.
review_text_5: I bought this system to replace my 6+ yrs old system which was burned by a lightning. NOTICE: DVR's are powered by tranformer Power Supplys and camera's are not protect from lightning's, You need to place a Grownd cable on a marked bolt on the back of the DVR for that purpose( I didn't know it and had a big loss on old system) Camera's are very bright and clear. The digital Zoom is amazing. The field of view of one cam is outrageouse! The cameras feel too light, but do a great work. Im only concerned if they will hold a huricane in PR. I think I did a great buy! Oh the 2TB hard drive can hold over 30 days recording. Pairing with IP camera's was very easy. I can view and record my IP cams on the DVR(THAT IS AMAZING). Thank you Annke !

review_header_4: Great image quality, value, and easy setup. NV works great as well short range.
review_text_2: This Camera sytem is better than I expetcted.1. This system include almost all your need for a secutity camera system, you just need buy a Hard disk drive.2. When I using the App, I saw the video is not clear enough. After I change the view form Basic to HD, it turned better resolution.Anyway, this system is a good choice for your home security.
review_text_3: I got this product few month ago. I lost the instruction and contacted the seller. They are very professional, sent me a copy by email next day. It‚Äôs very easy to install, you don‚Äôt need a professional worker to help unless you will need to organize the cords inside and outside the house. The instruction is easy to understand. And the camera work perfectly. I took two pics, the first one is with light on, second one is light off. Honestly it works better in the dark compare to dim environments. I haven‚Äôt try the app but so far I‚Äôm very satisfied with everything. Definitely recommend.
review_text_4: I'll be honest, I wasnt expecting much at all with this camera system, but wow am I suprised. Picture quality is as good as our night owl system costing much more, night vision is very clear even in low light or no light situations. This system doesnt come with a hard drive to record, but isnt very much to get one and install. It zooms very well on any frame, and has audio as well, but the audio quality seems a little staticy. Hookup is super easy, if you have a large house, definitely spring for the extra cables, you may need them. Otherwise you definitely wont be upset with this system if you want a security system on a budget. Good stuff
review_text_5: Wow. It's a nice security setup for the money. $90 for 4 cameras and a DVR. The DVR is very responsive and boots up quickly. Put in your own hard drive and you're good to go. The phone application works fine. You have to connect to a router for internet via lan network cable. I posted a photo of the camera on an old PC monitor. And a screenshot of my phone as well. If you want a nice usable cheap solution for security with a little installation work then buy this unit. It even comes with it's own USB mouse.

review_header_2: So far every parts works great.
review_text_1: Absolutely the best $250 Ive spent in a long time. Stupid easy to install and setup, including the smartphone app.Picture is razor sharp.Installed my system with a dedicated power supply and custom length rg58 siamesed cables. Did not use any of the supplied wires or power adapters. Only used the DVR and cameras.Put the DVR and power supply in basement and ran all cables to them.Got a long HDMI cable and long USB cable so I can monitor and control everything from my nightstand while laying in bed.Everything works fantastic !!!
review_text_2: First, setup was not too bad, if you‚Äôre handy, it will be easy to install and program. Utilizing existing co-axial cables and stabilized power supply. One thing I really like about it is it comes with everything, so you can set it up directly without make additional trips to store for some cables/cords.* Images: The images displayed on the system are very clear and more remarkably. In a lower light environment they will switches to black and white. So the cameras apparently have very good light sensitivity.* View: These cameras have phenominal quality and the field of view is so much greater than my older cameras.I've only had this system for a couple of weeks, and don't even have all of the camera's connected yet (though I did test them). In a year, once I can speak to longevity, I will return to give an update to the product. So far, however, I'm very pleased.
review_text_3: I do not give out praise often; in fact, this is my first Product Review in 5+ years. But I absolutely had to share my experiences with Annke Tech Support as their level of assistance and patience and accommodation was nothing short of phenomenal. After initially emailing them, they evaluated my request and responded to me within 13 hours (time zone gap included) and said that Tech Support would reach out in 24 hours. They reached out in 2...just excellent. From there, they were extremely responsive to help me troubleshoot my issue and we emailed back and forth a few times. Eventually, THEY determined that email would not resolve the issue so we had a Remote Desktop Sharing session to efficiently find resolution. We lost connection at one point, and Tech Support even CALLED ME to make sure we were still able to proceed. About 30 minutes later, I'm all set and happily keeping their product. As I am sure many of you have experienced poor customer service at some point in your life, you can rest easy that this company cares about their product and customers. If a positive review on their customer service is not enough to convince you to buy....allow me to review their product.Summary ÔÉ® Customer Service is Unparalleled. Price is Excellent. Video Quality is Great. Setup is fairly straight-forward. Some improved/updated instructions would be beneficial, but manageable as is. Interface could be improved to enhance experience, but ok.I spent a decent amount of time reading product descriptions and reviews for Home Video Surveillance and simply could not find anything that matched the price or positive reviews. Sure, there are some eyebrow-raising comments in some of the reviews, but nothing truly concerning. Some folks are expecting too much out of Nightvision, in general. This system performs above its price point. Sure, there are $1,000+ systems out there that will outperform this product, but that's not what you are buying. This system is a great middle ground between buying one/two over-priced Nest or Ring cameras that are merely selling their name and buying a 'high-end' surveillance system, which is probably overkill for you home. If you really need a system like that, then you should probably consider moving to a better area. You are going to get enough product (8 cameras and a DVR and remote access) to satisfy almost everyone‚Äôs surveillance needs.The quick setup guide provided was fairly straight-forward. I was able to connect it to my Smartphone without issue, easy. Adding the SADP Tool to my networked laptop was a bit more effort. The link provided in the guide was not accurate / retired, so a quick search on Annke's website located the software then back to the guide to complete setup. Not the end of the world, just be patient. If you cannot find it, email them. My 'issue', which required Tech Support, was that remote connection via the Web was no longer supported, despite being included in the guide. While this was a bit deceiving and frustrating, Tech Support was able to find a work-around and use Port Forwarding to allow me the type of access I was interested in. Most people will probably not need this, but I prefer laptops over phones and tablets, so it was a deal-breaker for me if no resolution‚Ä¶plus I didn‚Äôt want to have to install the SADP Tool on all of my laptops (again, I may be abnormal as I have 4 laptops in my home, but just sharing my experiences). Thankfully, Annke was able to help.Other than that, just know that the SADP Tool, Web, and DVR (i.e. direct connection between DVR and Monitor) interfaces are not overly user-friendly, but with some tinkering, you get used to the buttons and how to use the system. Again, not that big of a deal when you consider what you are getting for the price.If you are debating between this product and a competitor, give Annke a shot knowing that they will take care of you if you need help.
review_text_4: Only had it up and running for a day but very happy with it. Very clear, night vision is much better then our old system that cost more than this one. The camera's are plastic, but they won't rust. Make sure you know right where you want them incase you need more wire. Our head of security approves also.
review_text_5: I bought this update security camera system for my store month ago after i lost some package. It.comes a few days later after i ordered. Great shipping speed. I installed it right away. It'a very easy to install and set up. The video quality is great. The images of video taken during the day and night are both very cleaer. It comes with 8√ó1080p hd camra heads and i can see every connor of my store when i seating in my office or home. I also installed two heads out front of the store. Don't need to worry about in the rain or snow cause they waterproof. Since i had them around my store i haven't lost any package in past month. As a small business owner i think it works perfect for me. Anywag This system is outstanding. Great price and Amazing product!

description: Product Description: Are you looking for a security camera system with amazing functions and reasonable price? This ANNKE security camera system is able to stream 1080P live videos to your smartphone, tablet and PC. When you are away, you can still access the video and receive instant email alerts as well as APP alarm pushes, whenever any motion is captured. Getting a reliable surveillance system can be the most worthy investment you‚Äôve ever done for your family. Key Features: ¬∑ 1080P HD Viewing, Recording & Playback ¬∑ TVI/AHD/CVI/CVBS/IP 5-in-1 DVR ¬∑ Advanced H.264+ Video Compression ¬∑ Easy Remote Access on Mobile Devices ¬∑ Customized Motion Detection ¬∑ Email Alert with Snapshots & APP Push ¬∑ Smart Search/Playback Function ¬∑ 1080P HDMI & VGA Output ¬∑ IP66 Weatherproof Cameras Specifications: DVR Video CompressionÔºöH.264/H.264+ Video Input Mode: TVI/AHD/CVI/CVBS/IP Video Input: 8CH Analog HD/Analog + 2CH IP Video Output: HDMI/VGA up to 1080P IP Video Input: 2CH up to 960P Resolution Encoding ResolutionÔºö1080P Lite/720P Camera: Image Sensor: 2MP CMOS Image Sensor Video Resolution: 1920*1080 Lens: 3.6 MM Number of Infra-Red LEDs: 12 Day and Night Function: Support IR-CUT Night Vision Distance: Up to 66ft/20m Operating Conditions: -40 ¬∞C ‚Äì 60 ¬∞C (-40¬∞F ‚Äì 140 ¬∞F) What‚Äôs Included? * 1√ó 16CH 1080P lite DVR, 2 TB Hard Drive Included * 12√ó 1080P Bullet Cameras * 1√ó Power Adapter for DVR * 3√ó Power Adapters for Cameras * 12√ó 60ft/18.3m BNC Cables * 3√ó 4-to-1 Power Splitters * 1√ó USB Mouse * 1√ó User Manual * 12√ó Mounting Screw Kits

You can enjoy 1080P HD live viewing, 1080P Lite recording and playback, and night vision can cover up to 100ft.,„ÄêAdvanced H.264+ Video Compression„ÄëWith this advanced technology, more memory space will be saved in storing the same surveillance video. It helps deliver much smoother video recordings and saves you the cost of buying an extra HDD.,„ÄêCustomized Motion Detection„ÄëMark out the relevant areas for motion detection to minimize false alerts. review_text_1: I read the good/bad reviews on this system and decided to take a chance on it due to the functions that were advertised and the price. I am happy I bought this system so far. First thing I did was make sure it worked by connecting a cam to the DVR and firing the system up. All good. Then I planned the DVR location and I wired up all the cam wires up through the wall and across the attic. Had to purchase a set of two 25ft extension wires to reach the farthest 2 cam locations, but that was inexpensive and expected. The set comes with all 60ft cam wires. Connected everything to the DVR and bam!, 8 cam views all working and nice and clear. There are many settings and adjustments that can be made which the instruction book touches on very briefly. But I clicked around and got a grasp on what the DVR and cams can do. After a little while I figured out how the system works and how to navigate the menus. The camera adjustment instructions come with the individual cams, so there's two sets of instructions to refer to. I had no trouble setting up passwords or any initial registration. By the way, in addition to the night vision, the particular cameras in this set have a single bright LED security light (white light alarm) that lights up when the cam detects motion, which I really like. You have to set the light to come on for each cam, its in the DVR settings. I have the cam on my front porch set to use the security light, also to sound an alert beep on the DVR itself, which can also be set for each cam. That is separate from the alerts on the mobile app. The mobile app set up just fine and it actually works quite well. Right after I installed the system, I left town on a trip. I had no issues viewing all 8 cams from over 500mi away and I don't even have high speed internet on my end. I got alerts (when I turned them on) and could review the recorded footage on every single instance. It all just worked as advertised. Also, on this system, you can add up to 2 IP cams that connect with a cat5 cable directly to the wireless router that the DVR is connected to and it will pick them up. I may eventually get one of those to add a 9th cam.
review_text_2: So, we've been running this system for about 3 months. I'll save the good stuff to the end of the review. It is definitely a five star product.Initially we used the system's live view, just to monitor the outside activity as it happened around us. This was largely due to not being able to find the time we needed to fully commission the set up. For example, we couldn't get the mobile app. to work and couldn't bring it up on my PC without downloading one of those gaming apps.The system is complex...which is a good thing. There are many useful features such as line crossing and intrusion even face recognition and use an interactive grid to create areas to monitor, schedules to record and customizable notifications or actions such as LED security light activation, alarms etc. It is extremely versatile. Look, the user manual is about 300 pages long.All of that said, as much as we struggled with the set up, Annke's live chat tech was the answer to all of our problems. Demi, a real person, spent a long time and a exercised a ton of patience with our frustrating experience until we had everything up and running.In this day and age that alone is worth five stars. We give Annke, 10 out of 10!
review_text_3: Before using these unit I had a Samsung CCTV 4 channel camera and was looking to add 4 more. I had some concerns over this set as I have never used or heard of Annke before.Once I received the unit I noticed everything was well packaged nicely and everything I needed was inside the box.The cameras were straight forward to install just like my previous set so I had no issues.After connecting all the cameras, setting up the unit was straight forward with easy to follow on screen instructions. I didn't even need to use any manuals.The first thing I noticed when using Annke's software on the CCTV is that it was VERY quick compared to my Samsung CCTV. Everything was really snappy and didn't take much to move around the menu. It DOES NOT come with a remote like my samsung CCTV but this didn't bother me since the Annke system was very convenient and QUICK.Initial setup of all the cameras was SUPER easy you just need a little patience to browse the menu to learn it and youll have no issues getting it set up the way you want it.I have NOT tried the mobile app as I have other cameras with that functionality so I didn't need it.
review_text_4: The software has a lot of options, fairly straight forward setup if you‚Äôve ever dealt with electronics.... the video quality and feeds are great, especially for the money. I will also add that I chatted with customer service real quick, and they were extremely fast to respond and very helpful. Thank you again!
review_text_5: We had an initial problem with the lights on these cameras not going when someone walked in front of the camera at night. I contacted customer service and they were phenomenal in helping me get this problem fixed. They sent me screen shots to show me step by step how to program them correctly. We have 6 around the house and they all work very well.
