features: ,,„Äê4K Ultra HD with Sony Sensor„ÄëThe Sony CMOS image sensor, advanced EXIR 2.0 night vision tech, 120 dB true WDR & 3D DNR, all enable the 4K 8MP Ultra HD PoE bullet security camera to deliver the sharpest images at 3840 X 2160 pixels both day & night (even in 0.01 lux darkness).Protects your home and business day & night,„ÄêEasy Setup & Stand Alone„ÄëUnlike analog CCTV cameras, this PoE (Power over Ethernet) security camera only needs one ethernet cable to transmit video signals and get power supply simultaneously. Thus, you don‚Äôt have to worry about plugging in and image quality problems caused by long coaxial cables. Safe, stable and reliable transmission is always guaranteed. Not Work with Analog Signals via BNC Cable,„ÄêAdvanced H.265+ Coding & Audio ecording„ÄëAnnke PoE IP security camera provides smooth stream, records more videos and consumes less bandwidth with the latest H.265+ coding. The built-in microphone with the environment noise filtering records clear voice, providing vivid videos with sound without just silent live stream or playback,„ÄêSupports Up To 256 GB TF Card„ÄëThe Ethernet bullet surveillance camera has a TF card slot, enabling users to insert an up to 256 GB TF card (not included) to the camera for recording videos. Users can also connect the camera to an NVR with just a network cable for both data & power transmission and get 24/7 recording all the year round,„ÄêOutdoor IP67 Weatherproof„ÄëThe heavy-duty metal security camera is durable enough to withstand extreme temperatures from -22¬∞F to 140¬∞F. Built with a higher level of weatherproof feature than IP66. No water/fog will get into the camera. Highly recommend ANNKE 4K PoE NVR(Please Search B07N3W8JPY, B07N3Z2QBV).
name: ANNKE C800 PoE 4K Security Camera w/ Audio, H.265+ 8MP Outdoor IP Bullet Camera, 100ft EXIR 2.0 Night Vision, 256GB TF Card Storage(Not Included), Smart IR, IP67 Weatherproof,120 dB WDR
review_header_3: Work well especially the night vision, better than ADT cameras
review_text_1: I like the camera, good quality, toolless adjustment, sharp picture. Why on earth would they send it out without a waterproof lid and rubber seals for the network connector? I've installed thousands of these type cameras, and they ALL come with them. They claim it is an accessory, or it doesn't need it because it is built so much better. It looks the same as all the others. Even all their description pictures show it with the lid. I would include pictures showing it but there's nowhere to upload them. Look at the pictures.Edit: seller contacted me and offered to solve problem. Great customer service.
review_text_2: I first set up my 8 channels security camera system a few years ago, at that time, 1080p was the best resolution i could get. Everything is still working until now, however, recently, i've lost several packages due to package thief and the camera was able to catch the thief in action, however, its resolution is not high enough for me to clearly print out his picture and his face. I decided to purchase this 4k version camera to replace the existing one at my front entry door. There's a big difference in picture quality and clarity in the captured footage. With the enhanced resolution, i can actually zoom in on people face as they're entering the recording zone and be able to recognize and clearly see their faces. It's still a little pricey, but i guess if it does the job well then it's worth it.
review_text_3: Our house was equipped ADT cameras with the previous owner. It was okay to start with but I just can't bear with the ever going up contract price from time to time. I just tell myself enough is enough that I terminated the contract and started to build my surveillance. This one is my first attempt on the journey. The installation does take some effort in order to drill and mount on the wall. I just took advantage of the existing ADT power supply and signal cable which probably saved 90% of the time. With years advance in technology, the camera works way better than the ADT ones, especially at night. It can hardly tell it is a night vision if my front garage lights are on. The fancy feature with the app with email notifications are quite useful. So far I am happy with it and plan to get several more to build the full coverage around the house.
review_text_4: I bought this camera to be a part of an aurora detection system that I'm building. I wanted a 4K camera with really good low-light color sensitivity so it can catch the green of an aurora in the night sky and this looked like a really good candidate.The camera was easy to install and immediately generated real time day time 4K video that I could stream with VLC.I do need to be able to control the exposure though--the aurora when it first fires up can be faint--and here was my first stumbling block. Everything I tried to access and set regards exposure threw up an "unauthorized user" error! How can that be if the same user can stream video off this camera 'til the cows come home?It took a quick chat with tech support at Annke to point me to the correct place to set up an ONVIF user and once that was done I now have the ability to adjust a myriad of settings via python-onvif-zeep.I'm not quite where I want to be yet with the aurora cam -- my experiments with night vision are inconclusive (the clouds and now a full moon have not been helping ;-) but so far so good and time will tell.In summary, for the price it's hard to pass up a 4K camera with great low light capabilities for what this one can be had on Amazon--especially if you're the geeky type that wants to control the camera via software and not a pointy-clicky interface.
review_text_5: This is my first security camera, so I'm still a newbie to this technology. The camera came package well with all the parts inside. Connected the cameras up inside to ensure it works before installing on my house. I like the smaller size bullet cameras vs. the larger bullet cameras. Just one adjustment ring to aim the camera to your liking. The camera only comes in white. I spray-painted mine dark blue to match my house trim color, which hides the cameras more. Pro: The price, H.265+, smaller bullet size, picture quality. One ring view angle adjustment. Con: A little more night vision range. The included user manual reading print is a little small for my reading. Setup took a while; I suggest you watch a couple of youtube videos. The camera only comes in white; I wish they made it also in black. Overall I would repurchase this camera.

review_header_1: For a super low cost camera system I am definitely impressed
review_header_3: but other than that it's a great value. I can't get the app to work ...
review_text_1: I purchased this for keeping an eye on the exterior of my business. A single camera for my interior surveillance system is more than double the cost of this entire package so I wasn't expecting too much. After reading some positive reviews I decided to try it out. You will need to supply a hard drive and a monitor, otherwise it comes with everything you need for basic installation.Installation is the same as with any wired cameras and the level of difficulty will depend on your particular circumstances. Camera quality both day and night is pretty good. Again, keep in mind the cost of this system. If you are looking for CSI quality then be prepared to spend about $2000 dollars per camera and many times that for the system to record it. These cameras are very light seem cheap but have so far withstood temperatures in excess of 100 degrees and strong wind and rain. Only time will tell how long they will hod up and how well they withstand snow and cold.The DVR itself is small, light, and a bit flimsy. I was worried when I opened it up to install the hard drive and saw how unimpressive the inner components are. In fact, I was worried about damaging it by setting a small 15 inch LCD monitor on top of it. The DVR did fail to boot once during initial testing and had to be unplugged to restart it. The LED to indicate power on the front of the DVR stopped working after a day of use.The software is pretty straightforward and easy to use. There are quite a few options that are standard in professional systems but nice to see in such a low cost solution.I'm rating this product 5 stars for a DVR and cameras at such a low price that actually works decently. I'll update this review if components begin to fail.
review_text_2: Shipping was fast, I had an extra 500 gb laptop hard drive laying around. So why not! Wired it all together and positioned the cameras where we needed them. System works great. Now to get more cameras for the 8 channel. I would buy the extra cable for them they only come with about 60 ft.
review_text_3: DOES NOT COME WITH HARDDRIVE, but other than that it's a great value. I can't get the app to work either. It won't connect to my Wi-Fi. Picture quality is great. Really easy set up. Each camera comes with 100ft of cord which was more than enough.
review_text_4: Overall an awesome security set up, especially for price. This camera has caught my neighbor's dog crapping on my lawn and the same neighbor's kids hitting my car with their bikes on multiple occasions. Let's just say I have all the proof I need now to file some complaints. They have been doing these things all year but kept saying "you don't have proof so they (landlords) can't touch me!"... Well, hope my neighbor has fun explaining my proof to the landlords :)The motion detection works well - maybe even too well, often times when there is a breeze and the bushes in the front lawn move, it will trigger a camera. Not really a problem, just proves how sensitive the camera is as far as detection goes.They've been in rain and wind and have held up well so far. Not sure about snow as I've only had them since the spring.You will definitely need to buy a memory card for this unit as it does not come with one.Set up for a not-very-tech-savy person such as myself was easy. Honestly I just use tape to hold the cameras on the wall instead of screws. So far has worked well.I would definitely buy this again if I ever needed to.
review_text_5: This is a great system.1. Package came well packed delivery was quick2. Set up was very easy3. 2 of my camera had some vertical lines moving across the screen. Tech support was responsive via emails.4. Annke Vision remote viewing app works great. Annke View was not so much as it didn't work if I were not viewing with Wi-Fi.I can't ask for more out of this $129 system.Only concern I may have is how durable the components are. I've only had this for a few days and it's been great. If it lasts over a year, then I think it's well worth it. Anything more than a year would be a bonus.

description: Cutting edge protection, picture perfect. Zoom in to see and record video with the 4K security camera with HDR camera for a clearer, undistorted picture, day or night. With free local storage, the home security camera with mobile app allows you to remotely access your locally stored videos from the included Arlo SmartHub (requires MicroSD card, sold separately). Ultra 2 is a wire-free and weather resistant camera to deliver fast, easy installation and flexibility to get the perfect outdoor camera view, year-round. With the integrated spotlight, see important features like faces and licenses plates in full color, at night with color night vision through the home security systems. Get the big picture with the 180¬∞ diagonal view to make this the perfect front door camera. With 3-months of Arlo‚Äôs Secure plan included, receive notifications for people, vehicles and packages and take quicker action like sound the siren, call a friend or dial emergency services via your home cameras with app for phone.* Ward off unwanted guests by triggering the siren or integrated spotlight automatically or manually from the Arlo App. *Arlo Secure includes cloud recordings of video clips at 2K or lower resolution for 30 days. Renewal of an Arlo Secure subscription is required to maintain Arlo Secure features, including cloud storage, advanced object detection, rich notifications, quick responses, cloud activity zones. Arlo Secure service not available in certain counties.

review_header_4: Easy to set up and works as hoped for
review_text_1: Really easy to set up, but the sensitive setting was a little difficult to find. Instead of being with he camera settings it is hidden in the mode area. However, Arlo has a lot of information online and was easy to resolve.
review_text_2: I upgraded from an Arlo Pro to the Arlo Ultra 2 Spotlight Camera and am quite satisfied. Build quality and image quality are excellent.
review_text_3: I swapped a Pro2 for a new Ultra2. It was easy to setup the new camera in the Arlo app. The camera position tool in the app made it easy to position the cameras view. The video quality is very good with some slight chromatic aberrations at high zoom levels at 20+ feet. The detection algorithm is also very good. It recorded a squirrel and correctly flagged it as an animal. Distance to the hub is probably 30-40 feet with one exterior wall in between.
review_text_4: Unlike my experience with Arlo's wired doorbell and chime, the Ultra 2 cameras work fabulously. The batteries do not last the advertised length of time. Knowing that I ordered two extras and the charger. The main camera battery had to be exchanged every two days and the secondary camera in our carport every five days. I installed a third-party 3 watt solar panel designed for the Arlo for each camera. The solar panels keep both batteries charged at 100 percent. I think it will be a pain to review the recordings on the base station's mini SD card, so there is no question in my mind that customers purchasing the cameras will also need to purchase Arlo's cloud storage service once the free trial period is over. Customers need to have reasonable expectations. I have my camera's set at the best quality settings, but still, don't expect to be able to read license plate numbers, and the "color" in nighttime recordings is very marginal.
review_text_5: I purchased the Ultra 2 to replace an aged system. Once you see the video, you'll declare 4k video is the only way to go. I installed the two cameras outdoors myself, and I am far from being a home improvement guy. You'll love it. I also watch my camera feed at night on my Amazon Echo Show. Be mindful there is an update package for the cameras and the base. Do the quick download before installing. My system uses the 25' constant power supply accessory, too. No pesky battery replacement or charging issues. You'll love this... I do!

description: UHD video quality - Zoom in to see sharp details with Arlo Ultra‚Äôs 4K & HDR advanced image quality technology 180 Degree diagonal field of view - See more with a wider angle lens that has auto image correction reducing the fish eye effect Enhanced night vision - See what‚Äôs lurking with color night vision allowing you to see video in color rather than traditional black and White Integrated spotlight - Light up the night using Arlo Ultra‚Äôs integrated spotlight Smart Home Security featuring superior video and audio quality Noise canceling technology - Listen and speak to visitors with crystal clear full 2-way audio that reduces wind and noise Wire free and weather-resistant design and includes 90 Days of Arlo Smart Premier service with rolling 30 day cloud recordings Auto zoom and tracking - Auto-focus on moving objects with clarity and detail Outdoor security camera system Compatible with Alexa and Apple Homekit Security light feature helps ward off unwelcome guests.

review_header_3: Umm ummm ummmm ‚Ä¶ yay it works!
review_header_4: Very simple to use, but also has advanced settings for those who want more
review_text_1: Thank goodness mine is working but you have to sync manually by holding the button down(10 secs.) on the cameras until it flashes amber to add them. Had to turn off night vision for better images using the built-in spotlight. It can be a hit or miss if you buy refurbished or maybe just incorrect configuration. Sometimes app will not find the hub/camera if you have VPN on your mobile device. It has to be turned off.Update: Bought an endurance 256GB Micro SD card, you can now view the videos from the app if you are at home. Set to save on the card and got rid of my subscription. You will not get the fancier options like activity zones and intelligent recognition but still works fine. It will probably hold thousands of hours of recording before it gets full then will replace the oldest. Downside is you can only access the recordings on the SD card if you are on the same wireless network but the cloud recording still works and is good for seven days for free. Overall a very good investment.
review_text_2: The camera itself is amazing. I love the quality of the picture, the features. It has night vision but also a bright LED light that can be turned off if it's a feature you don't prefer. 2 way audio! Makes it easy to talk to couriers and food service ppl even if you're away from home. Easy to set up. Did everything myself without help or support from ARLO. My only complaint is that I bought 2 cameras but it didn't come with 2 mounts. Not enough hardware included in my opinion. Would have loved to mount both cameras outside but I'm having to buy additional hardware for it when it should have come with it. My friend uses Arlo and she recommended it because she doesn't have to pay a monthly subscription but for the ones I bought (ultra 4k) I'm currently on a 3 month trial then I think they're going to make me pay a monthly subscription to continue using. I am pleased with the quality of the camera and it's features and being notified when it detects anything at the door and for doing the job it is ultimately supposed to do but I'm hoping I don't have to pay a monthly subscription and would have been better to be able to mount both cameras outside.
review_text_3: Re: the renewed product The firmware on the base unit is probably old as sin. When you plug on the power and internet, just walk away for about 30min to an hour. It needs to do stuff in the background and download new firmware. You might think you just bought a brick but you didn‚Äôt. It just needs to update. Everything else works as expected.
review_text_4: Bought and installed for someone else after a cheaper brand quit working about a year after installation. I came across these first when my landlord had them installed and was very impressed with them. The video quality, super easy setup, so many extra bonus settings you can set up if you desire, that‚Äôs what got me researching Arlo. After a couple month of looking into Arlo I decided that I was going to be my recommendation because I want to be confident in the brand I‚Äôm recommending to someone else, especially when it comes to security
review_text_5: Setup was very easy. Love that I can view the cameras on my iPhone and my desktop (although not simultaneously for some reason). The range from the base to the camera is not as good as I would hope but to be fair I have many stone walls throughout my home. I ended up using 2 base units which works seamlessly. Image is clear. Motion detect is awesome. I used 4 cameras (2 on each base) to cover the inside of my home in critical areas. Very happy.

Arlo Essential Indoor Camera is a 1080p monitor that captures video in HD and offers a way to reassure your privacy with an automated privacy shield, controllable through the Arlo App. Receive motion alerts directly to your phone and use 2-way audio to hear and speak to visitors to make an ideal baby camera monitor. See at night, with black and white night vision. You can make this camera a hidden camera by placing the video camera on a shelf or mount to a wall with the included wall mount. Connect directly to Wi-Fi for easy setup. Get notifications on your smartphone when your camera spots people or animals, and view recorded video clips directly from your phone, with 3 months of included Arlo Secure*. * Arlo Secure includes cloud recordings of video clips at 2K or lower resolution for 30 days. Renewal of an Arlo Secure subscription is required to maintain Arlo Secure features, including cloud storage.

review_header_1: Works flawlessly on eero mesh network.
review_header_2: Easy of installation and camera access.
review_text_1: Bought this to use in our nursery. The included mount allows for the camera to be mounted on the wall overlooking the crib. Connected it wirelessly to our eero mesh network, no hub necessary, by temporarily pausing the 5GHz and only allowing 2.4GHz. Installation was less than 5mins. The new privacy shield is a great touch for an indoor camera.Note: Connecting to the eero mesh network requires you to pause 5 GHz and only run on the 2.4GHz band. To do so you simply open the eero app then go to Settings-> Troubleshooting->My device won‚Äôt connect-> My device is 2.4GHz only. This will allow you to temporarily pause the 5GHz band and run only the 2.4 GHz. After connecting the Arlo you can turn the eero 5GHz back on manually or let the network automatically turn it back on after the 15min timer expires.
review_text_2: The Arlo Essential Indoor Camera features the ability to connect directly to wifi of to the base station, I found that to be a great option as I live in older house with thick walls. Using a wifi extender, I can still connect cameras wherever I need them! Camera is sleek and has a nice ranging pivoted stand. The privacy shield is a nice feature, so that we just know... I will be buying a couple more, hopefully with an Amazon gift card! Thanks, Arlo!
review_text_3: The camera was easy to set up, just like all the Arlo cameras. The quality of video is very good and we are very happy with our purchase. We have 7 Arlo cameras around the house now and we are now looking to add more.
review_text_4: I have other ARLO products and added this to monitor inside my home. Easy to install. The ‚Äòeye patch‚Äô cover opens when motion is detected provided the camera is armed. Very discreet so can be used anywhere indoor. The night vision on the camera is good.
review_text_5: Works great except cannot get it to work on my wife‚Äôs phone.

It takes the worrying and wondering out of your life with 100% wire-free audio doorbell and HD camera that gives you flexibility to place it anywhere so you can see and hear more of who‚Äôs at your door. Get a call on your phone when someone presses the doorbell. Advanced features include quick response, silent mode, and leave a message.

review_text_1: Since the day it was received, I have been unable to connect the system to my router.The older version worked until it didn't and was flawless and seamless when connected. I have tried the support and troubleshooting methods with no luck. Buy at your own risk I have bought an upgraded version and it also doesn't connect. Looking for alternate wireless camera systems.UPDATE: (08/05/2021) I was able to get the system to work by holding down the sync button for approximately 10-15 seconds til the 3 lights turned amber in color then the app was able to find the base unit. Synced all 6 cameras and have had no issues.
review_text_2: This was a great addition to my existing 3 Arlo Pro and 2 Arlo Pro 2 came. I wanted the video doorbell but the 24v wiring that ran from my hard wired chine had fallen inside my front door frame. This one runs on 2 AA batteries. Installation was a snap and I love being able to speak to delivery people with having to be face to face during my COVID-19 quarantine.
review_text_3: Quick and easy setup. Video is high quality. You don't need a memory card if you use your app. It will store video for you there. I would recommend the VIDEO doorbell. I made the mistake of just getting the chime and had to buy another camera for the entrance to my store.
review_text_4: Battery is not charging any more after 1month of purchase. I have to have a power cable hooked all the time.Tried calling customer service at 10:00 pm just to try. But I got shocked to find amazing customer service form amazon technician Enron who connected me to Arlo Tecnician. Arlo is sending me new battery replacement for my Arlo camera. Amazing customer service from Arlo as well. Thanks you both of you. I really admire your hospitality and your service
review_text_5: I have the Arlo 6 camera security for my home, I feel protected. Last year I purchased the 6 camera system for my 2 children home. This was a gift for my Granddaughter who recently moved into her first home. The camera is a little slow starting to record, but from reviews from other products, they are also. They are so easy to mount, unlike most systems, you can tilt the camera in any direction.

description: For the ultimate protection rain or shine, see more of what's happening with an ultra-wide field of view and 4K video with HDR. Perfect for protecting any location where you need the biggest, best view. Easy wireless installation‚Äîno need to connect your security camera to electrical wiring.

review_header_1: I am impressed with the performance
review_header_2: Outstanding Video Quality-a snap to install
review_text_1: The Night Vision is Great the 4K is great also. Do not count on a six month battery life. I added a Solar charger to my most active camera and I am very pleased.
review_text_2: So, I have purchased other camera systems to monitor the perimeter of our home, and they have all ended in failure. A friend showed me here Arlo app and I was sold. The system s exactly as described. I bought the Arlo Ultra 2, with a hub and four cameras. Now, I‚Äôm that husband/dad where things never seem to go right when I try installing something new. This was a snap. I did have to reset my hub after the software update, but that was the only hiccup. Once the hub was set up, my cameras took about 60 seconds to ‚Äúload and go‚Äù. Coverage is fantastic and the video is clear as day. I had to contact Customer Support for a setting issue, which they resolved in a matter of minutes for me. Very polite and quick to help. I did purchase the power cords for the outdoor cameras as I am not a fan of ‚Äúbattery-operated‚Äù. Set-up was really that simple. I am a new fan of the Arlo system. Also, the app is very user-friendly and I can set the alerts to my preferences and schedule.
review_text_3: Well, I'm afraid I have to criticise the fact that, once my introductory period ends, I will need to pay a regular subscription for my Cloud Recording.
review_text_4: Not as good as the ads say but still a good camera system
review_text_5: Best one clear whoa much better

review_text_1: The price is on the premium side, but I got tired of replacing outdoor cameras every year. I hope this to be more durable than the last 3.Set up was a breeze, although instructions were practically non-existent. You can download the Arlo app and set up an account before you get the camera.Small glitch after installing, the app walks you through some steps and finally shows you a QR code on your phone that you hold up to the camera lens. The camera didn't seem to be working so I unplugged it and plugged it back in and it came on and scanned the code (I have mine wired to eliminate charging the battery). When I first put the battery in, it came on. But by the time I mounted it outside and started the "install" process, I had to reboot it.Super easy to connect to Google Home if you have a Google display. If not, it will still connect but you can't really do anything with it using google voice commands. It really works with the Google Nest Hub display or the Amazon Show, so you can use a command to see what's going on outside.The picture is very clear. It is not in color at night unless you go to the app and tap on the flashlight icon, then it shows in color. Not sure the purpose of that.You can enlarge what you see by pinching the screen. Shows the view in either horizontal or vertical orientation. I was surprised at the price that it's only 160¬∞ instead of 180¬∞ like some other cameras in this price range. But it is still a nice wide view.To use it outside, I recommend ordering the exterior mounting bracket (not included) otherwise a crook can just reach up and pull the camera off the included base as it attaches via a magnet.So far, I am very pleased with the ease of installation and use of the camera. With this model you do not need to have the Arlo WiFi hub as you do with most of Arlo's other cameras. I didn't want to end up with all the extra equipment and this works great with my existing WiFi network.

review_text_1: This is the 2nd Zosi system I have purchased. I got this one for my business. Since I've had the first one, my brother, my nephew, and one of my neighbors have purchased a system. Overall great experience. My only complaint is during the night 1 single spider can generate 100+ emails while going up and down right in front of a camera. With night vision though I'm sure that's an issue with any system. Would definitely purchase another if the need arises as well as recommend Zosi.
review_text_2: These cameras provide a great, crisp, and clear picture and look very soaking with subtlety. I highly recommend them for wired applications.I bought a refurbished 16ch DVR when my most recent one died like the rest. I figured it would be just another one but I actually really like it! It's been very dependable, even through a couple spikes that fried other appliances. The app on my Galaxy Note has been tick solid. I haven't used the remote PC interface yet but plan to.
review_text_3: The picture is clear, especially the night vision. The set-up took us a minute but once we got the right monitor (we were trying on an outdated one originally) everything was set-up in 2 minutes! My husband gets text alerts to his phone and has a perfect picture to see what's going on. The cameras are high quality and the customer service has been great too!

description: Security at its Brightest. Zoom in to see and record video in 2K with HDR for a clearer, undistorted picture, day or night. Connects directly to Wi-Fi without the clutter of extra gear. The flood lights outdoor camera illuminates your property with 2000 lumens of brightness or up to 3000 lumens with the outdoor magnetic charging cable. The flood light camera is wire-free and weather-resistant to deliver fast, easy installation and flexibility to get the perfect camera view, year-round. With the floodlight wireless security camera, see important features like faces, licenses plates, and pets in full color, at night with color night vision to make the perfect surveillance camera and pet camera. Get the big picture with 160¬∞ diagonal view. Receive smarter alerts for quicker action. With 3-months of Arlo's Secure plan included, receive notifications for people, vehicles and packages and take quicker action like sound the siren, call a friend or dial emergency services.* Ward off unwanted guests by triggering the siren or floodlight automatically or manually from the Arlo App. Works with Amazon Alexa, Google Assistant, Apple HomeKit*** and Samsung SmartThings. Requires Arlo Outdoor Magnetic Charging cable (sold separately) to emit up to 3000 lumens. *Arlo Secure includes cloud recordings of video clips at 2K or lower resolution for 30 days. Renewal of an Arlo Secure subscription is required to maintain Arlo Secure features, including cloud storage, advanced object detection, rich notifications, quick responses, cloud activity zones. Arlo Secure service not available in certain counties. ****Apple HomeKit compatibility for Arlo Pro 3 Floodlight requires connection to a compatible SmartHub or Base Station - sold separately.

review_text_1: I've only just gotten my cameras set up, so I can't comment on their overall effectiveness. Initializing the cameras was fairly easy, although one wouldn't detect the QR code right away, but was fine after a factory reset.Additionally, consider buying directly from the Arlo website. I didn't realize until after I bought them that Arlo offers 1 year of protection against the theft of your cameras if you don't purchase them through a third party like Amazon. That piece of mind would have been worth it to me.I was surprised by the included mounting hardware. I expected to find 3 of the small magnetic mounts, which are attached to the wall with just one screw and to the camera with a magnet. I didn't think that sounded very secure, so I ordered 3 of Arlo's pivoting screw mounts. It turned out that the box of cameras contained 1 smaller pivoting screw mount already, though, so I am returning one of the ones I bought.
review_text_2: I have purchased three Arlo Pro 4 cameras. They connected to my WiFi network with ease. They promptly notify me when motion is detected. I've been extremely pleased with my purchases & will likely purchase another one.
review_text_3: There was a robbery at gunpoint in the middle of the day on our street. The neighbors camera caught a lot of video that the police officers could use to catch and prosecute the guy. This is my first outside security camera I have ever had and I absolutely love it! I like that you can pause the notifications it send you for different periods of time. I also like that you can look at your videos and use a filter for it to only show you videos (in your history) of animals. In the app, you can also pause videos (or not) and zoom in while reviewing videos. I made a suggestion to the technology support that it would be nice to have the ability to select which zones (that you have set up) will trigger the camera. I asked him, ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs the sense in setting up zones if you can‚Äôt pick and choose which zone(s) you want to monitor for a certain period of time?‚Äù (like, monitoring/triggering only zone 1 at night and monitoring all zones during the day) I had to set up my zones so that the tree branches would not trigger the camera when they blew in the wind. The only problem now is that the shadows of the tree branches on my driveway often trigger the camera. Overall, this is a great camera for the price and if I were to buy another one, it would be an Arlo.
review_text_4: The camera comes securely packaged and ready to operate after a quick battery charge. I did have a bit of trouble getting the owner's manual to download. It went fine on my iPad, but when I tried to get a backup copy to my laptop, I received an error number that then took me to a 'tech chat' option. Sadly, that was a connection to some scammers (in my opinion) who tried to sell me some very expensive and unnecessary security. They told untruths and pressured me a lot. Arlo needs to know this and the bad impression of the Arlo company they conveyed. The camera itself, though is fine and gives clear images. Just a warning here for folks who might run into the same situation.

review_header_1: Stunning video with amazing color distribution. Totally 4K!
review_header_3: You may need extra base stations if you‚Äôre house is big and made with stucco walls .
review_text_1: I'm coming off of a frustration of trying to get Amcrest cams to work with the Synology NAS. After beating my head against the wall trying to get it all to work, I gave up 2 weeks ago. Frustrated with trying to keep the wireless cams online, I yanked them and threw them in the garbage (literally). I purchased a Pro 3 and a Pro 2 separately along with the Ultra Smarthub to start off. Kind of sticking my toe in the water, I ran this for a week. Setup was ridiculously simple. Not over stating either. Performance exceeded my expectation by a lot. The big issue for people is loading speed. I'll just say before I had the Amcrest WiFi I had Ring which was even more frustrating. Not a good experience at all. Really long load times or just hanging. So far with Arlo, I can trace every issue directly to something on my network. I added 2 more Pro 3's just to make sure I wasn't just experiencing an anomoly. The network can keep up with the cameras no problem. Snappy response to load. Does Arlo ever hang or slow perform. ABSOLUTLEY! But very very infrequently once you get clean WIFI. Move that router as far as you can from the Arlo HUB. Remember, Arlo uses it's own little private network, so you just need to provide the hub with clear wired connectivity. Also make sure your cameras have as much unobstructed path to the hub. I have a Camera on the other side of my 3,000 square foot house. I have 4 bars. I added the Ultra to my now 5 camera set up. Wow! Even more gorgeous! Great Cam, field of view is amazing, covers my whole front house including the porch. I would recommend to a friend. I do have to be honest, the Pro 2 is very very disappoining. Color bleeding is bad at night. Night vision is pretty much unusable. I bought all my cameras but one refurbished. No issues at all, perfectly packed with all accessories. All pieces came EARLY. yea!!! I absolutely love this system so far!!!!
review_text_2: We had a little security scare a few weeks ago and decided to purchase a security camera system. I have to say I'm super impressed. Sharp video quality, local storage capability, security light, motion sensor, siren, e911, easy install, two-way communication and HomeKit compatibility. What more could you want!? The local storage and HomeKit compatibility is what really sold me though. I only wish the HomeKit integration was a little deeper (Secure Video please!!)...but HomeKit integration is at least there which is was a requirement for me. Some of the other reviewers complaints seem like they're rooted in poor wifi signal...you're dealing with 4K video so the units obviously need strong signal outdoors. I've had zero issues. Definitely feeling safer and would totally reccomend!!
review_text_3: The video is great if the cameras have a really good signal but the videos are Vero slow in loading if the signal is less then 3 full bars
review_text_4: The Arlo Ultra camera system I had recently purchased has worked like a charm. I am now able to have a peace of mind while sleeping or not home. I was able to locate a camera fairly far and high up on a pole and this monitors the front of the property as well as whom enters our culdesac. In return, if someone has problems or a break in within the neighborhood. We could possibly review the footage and perhaps catch a license plate if they are not on foot . Although the cameras have been installed for one week exactly. Very little issues with them. Just be sure your wireless range can handle the distance unless you buy a wireless repeater to extend the range.
review_text_5: We have 6 of these with 2 home docks and we love them. They show great picture quality and the battery life last pretty good as long as you turn off the notifications every time it detects something. We bought 6 from Best Buy but we recently had to purchase another one because my daughter knocked it off the window and it broke something. This was easy to sync to the home base and start using right away. They run off wifi, we have really bad internet and these still work okay. You can speak over them from the app but with our slow wifi it‚Äôs hard for you to hear someone talking back or it‚Äôs delayed a little.

review_header_1: WARNING:  Free 1 year of Smart Premier Requires You Cancel Existing Smart Premier Service
review_header_3: Great system, you have to be realistic!!
review_header_4: Great cameras, FW has been corrected from terrible initial launch.
review_header_5: Got it last night, same day delivery!
review_text_1: WARNING TO EXISTING ARLO CUSTOMERS WHO ALREADY SUBSCRIBE TO SMART PREMIER. I am a long time Arlo Customer. I have two original Arlo Cams, two Arlo Pro Cams, an Arlo Pro 2 Cam and 4 Security Lights. I am also an existing Smart Premier subscriber and pay $9.99/month. I recently added the Arlo Ultra 2 Camera System and SmartHub to my existing set up. I assumed my Smart Premier Service would automatically revert to a free year of service. NOT so. After an extensive amount of time with Arlo Customer Service to sort this out, I finally learned that in order to get the 1 year free of Smart Premier you must CANCEL your existing Smart Premier subscription BEFORE you add your SmartHub or Ultra Cameras to your existing set up. If you don't cancel your subscription before adding the SmartHub/Ultra Cameras you will not get the benefit of the free 1 year of service. To fix this, you will have to cancel your subscription and then remove the SmartHub (with a 'hard" reset from the back of the unit) and then reinstall it all and set up Smart Premier again. In fairness to Arlo, their customer service was great and the person who help me was incredibly patient and helpful. Apparently many folks are having this same issue so I thought it would be helpful to post this since I found nothing about it on any of the Arlo Support forums.Other than this minor issue, I have to say that setting up the SmartHub and Cameras was seamless and even easier than setting up the Arlo Lights or my previous Arlo Hub/Cameras. Video quality is great and the 180 degree view is a game changer. I can now see the entire inside of my Garage with just 1 camera. Audio quality is also much better than the Pro 2. The Ultra is pricey, but if you are looking for the best camera available (from any provider), then this is it.
review_text_2: I replaced my Arlo Pro's with these Ultra's. I am so glad I did. The picture is excellent and the setup took me all of 10 minutes. You don't have to individually set up cameras anymore. Just plug the access point into your router and open your app. It will find the cameras automatically. No more scanning QR codes and such. The cameras have a great night picture as well as a new led light you can turn on and off. The Free yr of the Smart Recording system was a nice extra. I have not measured the bandwidth yet, but make sure you don't have Bandwidth limits from your internet provider before you take the plunge to upload everything to Arlo's cloud.Also I will be adding the Solar panel to my setup for my Driveway. I'll leave a review for that next.
review_text_3: Got it from the very first release and did not have any issues at all. Yes some did, but I have been pleased from the start. Mixed in with my pro 2 cameras and had no issues with setup or connection. Very pleased. The only con was I had to wait so long to write my review.
review_text_4: Fantastic Upgrade from Pro or Pro 2. Rough start initially, as I bought my first set on initial launch at BB. Arlo has corrected the major bugs that affected me. I bought a second 4 pack once FW improved. Currently I have 8 Ultra cams, each with 4k recording upgrade. I may switch 2 cams to CVR plan once outdoor power cable becomes available. 5 of 8 cams are hooked up to the Solar Panel accessory & they're working great too. Really looking forward to additional accessories becoming available and future FW updates improving the cams even more. Not an inexpensive system but reasonably priced for me. Annual cost will be under 300 USD (annual payment plan) after initial free year of Arlo Premium and including the 30 days of 4k motion triggered cloud recording upgrade on all 8 cameras.I'll try to answer any questions directed to me. I don't work for Arlo & I still have a couple Arlo Pro cams that I'll eventually upgrade to Ultras to round out the 10 camera limit on my plan.
review_text_5: Super happy, wow. Thank you Arlo!!!

review_text_1: I like the camera but if you don‚Äôt pay them for their subscription service they turn off some of the features on the cameras, kind of shady. There are other cameras available from other companies that do not require you to purchase a subscription to actually use all the functionality the cameras were designed for. Other than that good night vision activity zones motion pick up work fairly well. Battery life nowhere near what they state. Mine last a little more than 30 days if not on solar panel.
review_text_2: Yes, this is a refurbished unit which I generally steer away from but it has been working excellently. Don't hav..e any idea what was wrong with the old one but it was causing all kinds of connective and battery life issues with all the other units in my system, Whole system works like new again. Thanks.
review_text_3: This camera works great most of the time. Sometimes it doesn‚Äôt pick up motion no matter the size. I drove my truck by it and it didn‚Äôt record but when I got back home it recorded the same spot I drove by previously. Battery life dies off fast when cold. It went from 87% down to 18% overnight on a cold snap. I bought the solar panel and haven‚Äôt had any issues with battery since. Overall I‚Äôd definitely buy another but would add a solar panel with it.
review_text_4: I have a older model hub which will not work connect to this camera. However you do not need a hub for this camera. Just download the Arlo app and connect camera directly to your internet!
review_text_5: Great camera! Quick ship. This was a perfect addition to our current Arlo pro 2 cameras with home base - added right on to our home base, no problem.

review_header_2: Easy setup in minutes and picture quality is very good
review_text_1: There has been a lot of breaking and entering around my neighborhood over the past few years, which is why I bought this security camera. I got to say, the night vision of this camera is simply incredible. I have been using it for some days now and everything just runs so smoothly. The app that comes with it is something that doesn‚Äôt get enough credit for. It makes it so easy to monitor what‚Äôs happening outside which makes my family and I feel safe all the time. Another great feature is that the camera is completely water proof. There was a hurricane the other day when I thought the camera wasn‚Äôt going to make it. To my surprise, it stood unaffected. I‚Äôll definitely recommend this product to my neighbors!
review_text_2: This camera beats my expectation. It was very easy to setup, I was able to connect and perform software update in minutes, I got it up and running in about 15 minutes or so. Its almost easy as plug and play type of deal. The best part, it take SD card for extra storage, so I don't need to pay for cloud storage. The connection is strong, camera app is very responsive and connects quickly. Picture quality is excellent, its better than my other cameras. The sensor works quite well, I tested it out and put it next to my baby video monitor in my son's room, the motion detection works better or as good, and the video quality is much clearer, both runs on the same WIFI. I think I will buy two more, since I already have their app on my phone.
review_text_3: I purchased this to keep an ‚Äúeye‚Äù on my teens as my husband and I went out of town. I loved getting notifications when they were headed to school or sitting down to eat. Now we‚Äôre back home we‚Äôve installed it out by our front door and are very happy with the range, quality and integration with our phones.
review_text_4: I love this product, it is very easy to setup and the picture quality is excellent. This is perfect for outdoor or indoor use as it has a very sleek design. This wireless camera is perfect for any person's home -- highly recommend!
review_text_5: I put it on my garage. The picture quality is much better than I thought, even at night. There is one function which I like the most is recording function. It will automatically record 10 seconds if it detects any motion. It can replay at any time on your phone up until 7 days. Really like this one a lot!!!

review_header_1: Affordable 2 camera wireless solution, without compromise.
review_header_2: Left Blink for another amazing privacy-focused product from Eufy!
review_header_3: Great setup, preferred over Arlo due to price
review_header_4: Been almost a year now and still happy with the purchase
review_text_2: I travel for work almost every other week. I originally purchased the Blink camera system because I was thrilled with having month long battery life and the tiny profile cameras I could mount in the corner of my room.They served me well for a time, but like many people I began having major privacy concerns when Amazon purchased them. Eufy's camera systems are different. No footage is uploaded to the cloud and instead all of your video lives locally on your device. Eufy claims it is encrypted, but I wish they would specify if their employees have any way to ever access the footage or not. Some clarification on the privacy end of things would help further set them apart from Blink and their other competitions.I decided to take a chance on the Eufy 2C after having an amazing experience with Eufy's video doorbell.I'm so glad I did! The cameras are low profile and blend in easily in corners or even just mounted to walls. The base station is quite small and looks right at home next to my router, and the app works instantly with no headache. The cameras have crisp video and audio and Eufy provides easy-to-follow instructions for mounting. I do wish the mounts were magnetic or had a way to quickly remove the cameras for charging. Thankfully, after several days I haven't gone down a single tick in battery life so I am hopeful charging will be few and far between. Notably missing is Homekit support and expandable storage, but Eufy promises us that both of these features are coming soon. They seem to have a good track-record for customer service so I am hopeful.Below I will provide some pros/cons but to be honest none of the cons are dealbreakers, just things I hope Eufy will consider for their next software updates and product iterations.This is the best security camera system I have ever used and one of the simplest setups as well. I can't recommend this product enough! Go buy it!Pros:-GREAT video quality-Spotlight functionality-Seamless App and great wireless range-Good installation instructions-Battery life/USB charging-RTSP (record to your network or NAS!)-Clear audio & 2/way audio-Good nightvision performance-Recording light-Built-in sirens on each camera and homebase-AI detection means my pets don't set off the cameras (THANK-YOU!)Cons:-No HomeKit Support-No Geofencing (Auto arm on leaving and disarm on arrival)-16GB/ No way to expand storage with USB or SD (yet)-Mounts are cumbersome, magnetic would be a lot easier to remove for charging-No way to re-arrange order of cameras in the app
review_text_3: Overall I got this over the Arlo system. Price of the immediate purchase and since no monthly fee it was a no brainer. I did. I two sets 2c and Eufycam 2. I needed two hubs to reach my backyard and front corner of my house. About the furthest two points from each other. Hub range could be better as it has trouble going through walls.Clarity is goodDetection is about 90%. I think it may require time to ‚Äòsettle‚Äô. For example I setup and kept walking in front of it and it did t go off for a day. Was about to return when it started working. So do give it a chance. Start with all motion and high sensitivity, and go down from there or switch to human mode.The light is triggered manually. If I really cared I would have taken off a star but I don‚Äôt need that feature.Note the 2c has a siren but only for alerts. The Eufycam 2 has a siren for tampering which is nice. Haven‚Äôt tested either siren.Charge it up when you receive. I started at 40% out of the box but it dropped quick. Again almost returned it. But I charged to 100% and it‚Äôs been fine since then.There is only motion and human motion detection. Kept seeing AI mentioned for face detection, neither camera had that (I had hoped the Eufycam 2 had it). Alerts do try and show a face if it caught one, but not the face identification I read about.Eufycam 2 has better battery and that tamper siren, but other than that not much difference (size shape etc). So I‚Äôd suggest buying when there is a good deal and buy two sets while at it for the extra hub.
review_text_4: So I'm updating my previous review from last year from 4 stars to 5. I love Eufy products and have cameras, smart bulbs, vacuums, etc. Was having an issue with these cameras falsely reporting motion when the camera would wake from its sleep mode, that would cause tons of motion alerts 24/7. Worked with their support for a while but didnt seem to have a fix at the time. Now 6 months later their support reached out to me that they pushed new code and to check it now, it does seem they resolved the issue. I recommend Eufy all the time because of their top notch customer support and they have great products at a great price.
review_text_5: My wife bought this as my birthday present. What I really liked this so far is the over box and camera design and user experience. The package seemed really classy from the plastic wrap (tightened) to the unfolding of the corrugated lid.The item I got were HomeBase and the two cameras 2C. The installation was fairly easy and quick. I really liked the use of the app that was downloaded from Google Play Store per the instructions said.The overall camera quality's awesome as I used one for indoor and the other for backyard. The motion detector is great at the sensitivity level (default). I think for a beginner like me, this is a great fit.

review_header_4: The delivery and the well package.
review_text_1: I am looking for an outdoor security camera to monitor my backyard, trying to buy a security camera, I have to say I am shocked by this feature. It took me less than 10 minutes to get it up and running, downloaded the app, connected it to the Internet, and saw my backyard in the video. I think the size of the camera is good and all tools can be used to install it if needed. With spotlights, you can still see clear color night vision even in the dark. If you want, you can tap the alarm button in the app, and then a very loud screaming alarm will sound. You can also talk through the camera. It comes with free 7-day cloud storage. I am absolutely satisfied with this purchase!
review_text_2: Arrived on time and as promised. Camera and mounting bracket look good stand alone and when mounted. Camera video quality is great both during the day and night. I also like that it records a requested amount of video when motion sensor is triggered. Battery life is also good. I will be buying more for other areas I want to have Camera coverage.
review_text_3: This camera is so reliable and functional. It is really worth it!
review_text_4: Delivered on time. Well functioning as soon as I installed works perfectly.
review_text_5: This product looks in a good quality. It‚Äôs easy to install and control via the app. Clear in night mode and motion detection is sensitive enough in the activity zone. My house doesn‚Äôt have outlets under the roof, this wireless camera fits well.

name: Blink Outdoor 3rd Gen + Floodlight ‚Äî wireless, battery-powered HD floodlight mount and smart security camera, 700 lumens, motion detection, set up in minutes ‚Äì 1 camera kit
review_header_1: A well designed, quality device for the money
review_text_1: I see reviews stating the light was not recognized by the Blink app. You may check your camera's firmware, I had 10.33 running and the light would not install initially. I updated the firmware to 10.48 and it worked. You can update camera firmware in the camera profile settings. You need the Blink outdoor camera with a USB connection. Connecting the USB cable can be tricky but take your time you'll get it. Best to plug it in then snap the camera in place.A quality item for the price, the LED chips appear to be very decent, the plastic lenses and housing are good quality, I think they'll stand up well to weather and sun exposure if needed. After updating my camera's firmware, installation was very straight forward.. you remove a plastic strip on the battery contacts, plug the USB cable into your camera, then snap it in place. The app recognizes the install and you adjust settings in that camera's profile. You'll see lighting icons appear in that camera's profile screen (see pic). Lights are bright enough to illuminate a small area, and you get a color pic & video instead of grey IR if it's dark. I wanted the ability to illuminate a side of my house should anyone decide to walk around the area.
review_text_2: This mount is NOT compatible with the XT, XT2 or any of those older generation cameras. Install was easy, though i recommend a cordless drill if you have one. You have the ability to turn the light on and off on demand and of course you can control the duration of lighting when the camera's sensor triggers it. It's 700 Lumens, which is plenty light between the two strobes. I have no complaints. The negative reviews are from those who've mistakenly purchased the setup without making sure the camera model they have actually works with the setup. If in doubt, you may just want to get the camera and floodlight kit. Good luck.
review_text_3: First, please be aware this works with the Blink Outdoor cameras, as stated in the description. Installation was very easy. Just have to mount the back plate and the flood light slides right on and locks into place. The camera can be a little tricky to get plugged into the light but once it is plugged in you can tell it is secure. Immediately after plugging in the flood light the Blink App automatically detected it and added the light controls to the camera it was plugged into. So far it seems to work well at night. Lights up the area really well and can definitely tell a difference in the video at night with the flood light as opposed to the IR Night Vision recordings. I am very pleased with this flood light mount.
review_text_4: I bought this to primarily do two things: 1) draw attention to the external camera and 2) provide me light when I'm taking out the trash at night and it works super well for both those reasons.Regarding the first reason, I consider cameras primarily to be a deterrent and something that discourages bad behavior but won't actually prevent it. By adding a floodlight to my camera I'm hoping to draw more attention to it and encourage people to maybe think twice. The lights are super bright so there is no way that people will miss that they are on camera so to me this accomplishes what I'm looking for. I was initially worried about mounting this as I rent a house however the floodlight comes preinstalled with a siding shingle so I was just able to hang it like before.Regarding the second reason, well like most people I'm lazy. I could use my smart phone flashlight when taking out the trash but it's easier to have a light automatically come on when I step out the back. Again the lights are super bright so I have no trouble seeing at night. The flood light an be configured regarding how long to stay on when triggered for 15, 30, 60, 120, or 300 seconds so good control capability there.Overall I'm pretty happy with it. It isn't life changing but it does what I need it to do and I have no complaints.
review_text_5: This product was easy to add to my existing Bilnk system. Camera works great. Problem was that the lights were not recognized. Two issuers there. One, me. I did not notice that I should open the back AND remove the plastic covering the back of the batteries. Two: there‚Äôs nothing in the instructions saying you have to do that.

review_text_1: We have two of these cameras, this one and the older version. I have zero complaints! The set up is ridiculously easy (you literally just screw the base onto whatever you're attaching it to and then screw the camera onto the base. No wires or anything. The battery life isn't bad either. We've had it up for about 2 months now and have only had to charge it once I believe. You can set how sensitive you want the motion detection to be and if you put in an SD card you can view 10 second video clips of whatever set the camera off. If you don't put an SD card in you just get photos. Either way it's not a bad deal. I definitely plan on ordering this brand/camera if we decide to add any more cameras to our home. I will say that our two are not in the rain (under the carport or an awning) so I can't speak to how well they hold up in weather but we have had our original camera for probably a year now and it works just as well as when we first got it.
review_text_2: The camera works great on our garage. It‚Äôs pretty far away from the router and it still picks up the signal. Highly recommend this camera to everyone.
review_text_3: I bought this to watch my chickens to make sure they are safe. It doesn't pick up when the chickens walk by or any animal. It only picks up tall objects such as people. plus my internet is not strong enough outside. So,I need to call the internet service and see what I can do. Also, need to move it lower to the ground to see if it will pick up any animals such as the chickens, cats, coons, squirrels, skunks etc.
review_text_4: I love this camera to monitor my household while I‚Äôm out of town. Very clear picture. Lots of storage, and clear audio. This is a quality product and highly recommended.
review_text_5: Camera‚Äôs motion detection and camera‚Äôs battery life is great. I have 2 camera‚Äôs already and Im loving it.

review_header_2: Great battery life, great quality video and audio, highly recommend
review_header_3: Best Deal for the money...1 Major complaint!
review_header_5: Great System - Grab an extra battery & Wifi booster
review_text_1: I wanted something simple for my grandparent's home, which would allow me to be able to check the area while away. I found these and thought they would be a quick and easy answer to my problem.Shipping was quick and easy and everything showed up in great shape.Out of the box, everything looked great. The installation is fairly simple, and it comes with all the required hardware. The batteries will need to be charged a while in order to ensure the battery life is optimal. After charging them overnight, I installed the mounts, slid the battery into place, and followed the instructions on the app. After a short wait everything was set up and ready to go.These have been up for a while now and I have absolutely nothing bag to say. As long as you have wifi boosters around the house, you should not run into any issues with connectivity or lag. The notifications are great, and the video clarity is exactly what I was looking for. Additionally, this system allows you to post possible issues to the neighborhood so your neighbors can be made aware of issues. For example, I recently saw a lady had her package stolen off her front porch and they managed to get the whole thing on video.Overall, I would absolutely recommend these for someone that is looking for a simple solution to a home security video system. This allows you to be literally anywhere and still check on things around the property. I would am extremely happy with this product and will continue to do business with them in the future.
review_text_2: Love these cameras. I bought the 2 pack 7 weeks and 1 day ago when I discovered someone was peeking in our windows and testing our locks, and just had to change the battery today. The front camera goes off 4ish times per day (when we go to and get home from work), and the battery was at 5% this morning. Our back porch camera goes off about 1-2 times per week and was at 37% this morning. I live in upstate NY so these cameras were installed in single-digit weather, and the batteries have now lasted through into the warmer 50-60 degree days. I'm amazed at how long the battery life has lasted and the quality of the video. I love that I can see my packages get delivered (the delivery man even waves at the camera), the quality of the video is amazing, and I can go back and watch old footage as well as go to a live view whenever want. The spotlight is great for helping with night vision and I love that I can talk to whoever is in front of the camera. Definitely recommend. Purchased a second battery for each camera to extend the battery life (have not put them in yet; this review is on a single battery in each camera) and look forward to getting 3+ months of battery life out of each camera.
review_text_3: I was reluctant to have to spend any money on outside cameras but all my research pointed me to Ring products. Price point on the wireless spotlight cameras is excellent and once I got the cameras, installation was so easy. I have had them about a week and everything works well. Only major complaint that needs to be addressed asap by the company is recording time. We need full event recording rather than short clips. Only recording the first 30 seconds does nothing if a burglar or nefarious person waits 30 seconds to rob you. It should at least start re-recording after the 30 sec period if motion is still detected. This can mean the difference between catching a thief or not. It must be addressed immediately! If they fix that then they will have a much better rating!
review_text_4: FOLLOW-UPJust when I thought I was Ringless, I finally spoke to a Ring rep over the phone and was very pleased with the next step. Not only did Ring understand my frustration, they were aware that my camera was not displaying. Ring sent me a replacement camera and emails wanting to know more. A review of a company should note the wrong and a follow up when they make it right. I recommended Ring to my friends and family when I bought it in 2019, I standby their product therefore "I" standby my Endorsement. Thanks RING!
review_text_5: I love these, and how easy they integrated with the ring door bell we already had, After they arrived, I realized based on placement, they option of 2 batteries versus one was the way to go, so I didn't have to keep on getting up on the ladder and charging, (which takes several hours) and be without coverage.The wifi even when it was 7 feet away with a window between, we had problems connecting, I would get a notification, and moments later it might pull up. That too is random when it does that.The motion is fabulous, I had to place one really high to capture the back yard 2 stories up, and it catches everything, to the point I had to scale back sensitivity, and shut off one side of it, as my tree would move. One thing I would love to see Ring do with these, is allow you to draw out the objects triggering the motion sensor like on the door bell. This one, you just turn of sections.Overall, I wouldn't hesitate to consider these, just know going in the things that are small hiccups.

review_header_1: I've tried many security camera systems. This is the one!!
review_header_2: ZEEPORTE has redeemed my confidence in wireless security cameras!
review_header_4: For the price this camera exceeded my expectations.
review_text_1: My criteria for security cameras is as follows:1) Good quality picture2) Triggers at good distances3) Records videos locally (no monthly fee and privacy)4) Low number of false triggers5) A good phone app to control the cameras and view the videos.6) A reasonable priceThe Zeeporte camera checks all of the above boxes.I'll start here by saying that I've tried Eufy 2C, Vava, and Blink X2C systems. They are all more expensive (and sometimes much more expensive) than the Zeeporte. But the Zeeporte is a superior system to all that I've tried so far.The battery life of this camera is decent. I've used it heavily over the past 6+ days with many tests. I've recorded 209 motions and it is at 89%. Since I've used it heavily, I'll estimate 10% per week which means that it'll last 10 weeks (2.5 months) on a charge. In regards to size of the memory card that you'll need, I've used .22GB of the 120 GB card that I bought. At the current rate, it will record for 1.5 years before getting full - and then I'll just reset it. It is easy to transfer clips to your phone storage (online for my iphone).When I did my testing, I set it to the motion detection sensitivity to the highest value (95). What really impresses me with this camera is the low number of false triggers.. Really, I get none. It records people and cars and that is it. And it does not seem to miss any events. The angle of the camera did affect the distance of the triggering so try different angles.The only area of improvement that I can see is the mount. It is fine, but as I noted in my headline, I've tried several brands now including Eufy, Vava, and Blink. All of these brands had superior mounts, but the one that Zeeporte mount is fine. I had to make sure I tightened it well. One note - the other manufacturers that I listed require base stations and do not record on the camera itself. The Zeeporte does. This means if someone steals your camera, then they will get your videos. So, just don't put your camera within reach. A camera should not be mounted low and the instructions tell you to not do so. This is probably another reason that Zeeporte does not have a magnetic mount.. which would make it easy to steal. The mount that it has requires you to screw it off.Oh.. I just remembered another great feature of the Zeeporte. After your day is finished, you can view the events for the day (and all prior days) in a mode that shows you a timeline and lets you quickly sweep to each event based on the time and watch it. This is really nice to have!Overall, I do recommend it 100%
review_text_2: Last night was a disaster for me as I tried to get another brand of security cam to activate, I spent at least 5 + hours agonizing over the instructions, questioning my own intelligence and more 'Is it me?', I kept asking self.Long story short, it wasn't me, it was the product, and so going to return it.But smartly I ordered two security cams by two different companies and I'm here to say that 'ZEEPORT' has redeemed my happiness and joy and confidence in my ability to set up wireless WIFI connected security cameras...Also I timed it, from time I started activation to time it was up and running and it took less than 25 minutes!...I"m sure those more tech savvy than myself could do it in 15 or 10 minutes or less, I kid you not.Yes I'm a bit emotional cause coming off of a bruising night fooling around with that other security 'dome' camera system, which iI will not name, but if seek out my other review, you may stumble upon it...so yes I'm estatic right now cause ZEEPORTE delivered to me what they promised, a product that works right out of the box, a product to where you don't have to be a computer scientist to figure out, and all along the way, through each step, on your phone there's a 'help tab', in case you need help.Their 'help' doesn't hide from you.In closing, to be honest this can't be considered a totally full review, cause I haven't left my home yet and tried viewing camera from afar, until I do that, only consider this a 50% review.But will say WIFI connection was super easy...I mean super easy, compared to lasts night nightmare with other product (actually it was easy also, but after wifi connected to product their 'network' did not function).Anyways, so far so good with this product and will give another review as soon as can test away from home and see how it does then.It's a outdoor camera, but I have it indoors for now since other products failed me, I will order more though, probably from this brand, we shall see.
review_text_3: I love this camera, it gives great night vision even when my yard light is not on. Motion detection is great it alert me on everything it captures including the garbage man waking me up not to miss my trash guy, The birds in the attic, The neighbour talk. Even when it very windy and something is blowing across the street. Picture quality is absolutely awesome and incredible clear as day light. I call see all three of my neighbors home including mine. The voice quality is very good. If you asked me if I would recommend this camera to anyone else I would not hesitate to yes. I would recommend this to everyone. That's one reason. Why I gave this camera a 5 star. Yes it will video when you tap on the screen to see what going on for as long as you wish. The installation is easy all you have to do is charge for how long the instruction says. I have not charge mine since I put it up and it still has a full battery. This is a great gift and if you live alone and travel it's great to have because you can also put on the away button on your camera. . Ank me again and I will tell I am getting ready to purchase a second one for my home. I wish they came in a double pack. It gives me a piece of mind when I sleep at night to know I am safe. If I could give this camera a 10 out of 10 I would. I surely recommend this to anyone who is looking to purchase a camera for their home.
review_text_4: For my first ever security camera I am highly impressed. I needed a battery operated camera with easy installation and this one is perfect. Set up was easy, it was mostly charged when I received it and I easy drilled it to a tree. WiFi connection is excellent, picture quality is pretty good and the night vision is really good. I noticed the picture quality is better on sunny days rather then really cloudy days. You can change the motion detection, watch live, download videos and delete video all from the free app that you download. Honestly for the price I think I that this camera is pretty awesome and far better then I actually expected. You need a microsd card and to download an app. Other then that everything else is a piece of cake. I would recommend this camera.
review_text_5: I was sceptical at first on purchasing this security camera.I was looking for a really good security camera for the outside of my house.I have simplysafe for my home security system and have there camera as well inside but am not impressed with putting one of there security camera outside of the house.after reading the reviews on this camera.I figured that I would take the chance with it and see how it would perform.after unboxing the camera,and going thru the instructions which were very easy to understand.I figured I would just stick the camera temporarily inside the window seal and see how it would perform, before I mount it.and I must say that I was more then pleased with the clarity of the picture.as you can see from the above pictures.shooting thru the window from the distance that I had it was outstanding. Which I plan to install outside which will work great with my motion lights outhere. As far as the motion sensor it picks up motion great .you can adjust in the setting to suit you,it also has a home mode along with an away mode...as far as battery life I will have to up date in a later review.it came fully charged and seems to be holding pretty good.I must say if you are looking for a really good security camera,I believe you will be more then impressed with this one.Hands down it beats my simply safe cam hands down and for alot less priced.

review_text_4: Digital bird house! Added security camera in my backyard. This birdhouse can be built using a single cedar fence board. Refurbished stickup camera was mounted along with a solar panel. Birdhouse needs to be within range of your home Wi-Fi network.
review_text_5: Overall super happy so far. I bought 2 stick up battery powered version 2 refurbs, plus a refurbed ring doorbell pro. They arrived a day early, and the prime driver hid my package, which was super thoughtful! The porch pirates are so annoying!All 3 units installed super quick and painless. Simple to follow instructions and if you have 2 brain cells to rub together, they are a cinch to have up and running in less that 5 min per camera and 10-15 for the door bell (but that‚Äôs just bc of the swapping out of the old unit.) DO be sure to check your transformer voltage to ensure compatibility.Be aware that one of my cameras came with a dead battery, but I charged it to 50% and went ahead and got it booted up. The other battery arrived at 45%. So if you initially can‚Äôt get your camera to power up, try charging the battery before freaking out, calling and bitching, posting on every known social media app and all that jazz.The night vision on the cameras is ‚ÄúOK‚Äù at best. I mean it‚Äôs good enough to know if someone were in the room, but not good enough for me to know WHO, assuming I would know.
