review_text_1: I have a much better security camera system for my home's exterior but thought I might try one of these cams indoors since I have the Ring alarm system and a Ring Doorbell already. I made the silly mistake, I guess, of assuming there would be some kind of integration with other Ring products - there isn't. None. Not a single thing.It seems like common sense to me that they'd integrate in a couple of ways. I assumed that I'd be able to tell these cameras to only sense motion if the alarm was armed. Nope.I figured I could at least set it to detect motion when I wasn't in the house. Nope. There isn't even any kind of proximity setting for it to even know if you're home or not. They are not location aware in any way. The Ring alarm system isn't either, so I suppose I should have known better already.I also assumed that if my Ring alarm went off the cameras would automatically come on and start recording. Nope!The only motion option at all is to not alert you to motion during specific hours. Note, this doesn't stop motion detection during these hours, it only stops the alerts.Motion detection/recording is only an on or off thing... absolutely no options whatsoever.Annoyed by the lack of integration I still mounted the camera in my great room. I figured I try it for a few days and see how long the battery would actually last with motion recording on. This is a high traffic area so I wasn't holding my breath... and sure enough, after not even 1 full day the battery is down to 80%. This is with all the 'battery saving options' on. This was only a test as I don't actually want recording of any kind going on in my house while I'm home unless the alarm is armed or going off.With absolutely no options, no integration with Ring alarm and no settings to limit it's recording this thing is really only good for one thing; on demand video with no automatic recording. So, the thing is turned off now, doing nothing. I can still activate it from my phone to occasionally check my house isn't burning down.Hopefully someday Ring will update the software and provide some common sense integration with it's other devices.This is all a shame as the build of the camera is quite good considering the low price as is the video quality. The audio isn't great but it never is on cameras of any kind.***UPDATE***Ring support reached out to me directly almost immediately after I posted my review (Good on them) and told me how to link the Alarm, somewhat, to the camera. You have to go into your Base Station settings, then linked devices, then you can set the cameras to record when the alarm goes off - but only then. Make sure you have the updated app that just came out to do this. I didn't. Again, the setting is in your base station, not in the cameras.This solved probably the biggest issue I had with the camera. The rest of my review is still accurate though per Ring support. Hopefully they'll add the other much needed features in the near future.***ANOTHER UPDATE***From Ring Support: "The Modes feature will be released in November and will allow you to have the option to record motion only if the Ring Alarm System is set to Away Mode". This will be a great update and should have been available on launch. I wonder if they are only just now thinking of it from all the negative feedback and reviews, but glad it's 'coming soon' either way.***ONE MORE UPDATE***Ring provided me early access to the 'Modes Feature' and I've been using it for the past few days. It resolves all the issues I had with the alarm integration. With modes you can set your cameras to only record when your alarm is set. They can all be set independently and act differently depending on if you have your alarm set to off, home, or away. For instance, you can set your exterior cameras to record when your alarm is set to home mode, but have your interior cameras are turned off. You can set your interior cameras to only record while in away mode, etc. etc. Or any combination. The cameras can now be set the same way motion and door sensors can. This is a great improvement. They haven't told me exactly when this feature will be made public but have said it will be released 'by the end of the year'.I've increased the rating from 3 stars to 5. This software update really has resolved every issue I had with the cameras. I've now ordered and installed an additional 6 for my home.***LAST UPDATE***Having the modes features and my cameras set to only pop on and record during an alarm event (which is rare) and be off at all other times, I've had 2 months to evaluate battery life, almost exactly 60 days now. All my cameras were down to below 10% battery level when I checked them last night. Given the rate of battery drain I had expected them to last 3 months - though 2+ still isn't bad. I have two external cameras on my entry gates outside with the solar panel add-on, they stay fully charged at all times even though it's pretty much been non-stop dark and cloudy days here since installation. They are set to record all motion and since they point at a street they record events dozens of times per day... so if you're thinking of getting the solar panels for outdoor use, I highly recommend them.
review_text_2: Before I start my revised review, let me state that there's been a lot of news lately about people hacking into Ring cameras, but this only happens when someone installs a new camera and doesn't update the default username and password (or has an extremely weak password which is easy for a hacker to guess). This is like leaving your front door open while on vacation. Your camera is sending and receiving signals over a wireless network. Anyone within range of the signal can potentially be a threat if you don't have good encryption (username and good password) set up on your camera. There's no logical reason for a Ring owner to not do this. Ring even stresses changing the default settings during the initial setup process. Bottom line, don't blame the car manufacturer if you leave the keys in your car and it gets stolen.----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Recently, I wrote a rather scathing 1 star review about the problems I was having with my new Ring Stick Up Wireless Battery Cam. I'm no stranger to wireless cams, having 10 hooked up and running seamlessly on another network as I write this, but I was totally frustrated with the connection reliability, not only with my two upper end cellphones, but also on my Galaxy Tab and Amazon Show. More times than not, the software wouldn't connect with the camera but when it did, the video was choppy. Notifications were also hit and miss. I have a great wireless mesh router system throughout the house, so after doing all the troubleshooting I could think of, I assumed it was due to faulty hardware or software. I gave up and started the return process through Amazon. It was a new product after all and new products sometimes are really buggy. Plus, I read other negative reviews which seemed to justify my thoughts and actions.Then I got an email from a gentleman from Ring saying he read my review and asked if I'd be willing to let him help troubleshoot my issues with me. Although I had already started the return process, I was willing. It was refreshing to know Ring Customer Service was genuinely interested in troubleshooting possible defects in their newest product.Together, we isolated the issue within about 20 minutes. It turned out it wasn't the camera or software after all.Anyone having connection issues should do what he advised me to do. Open up the Ring app and click on the 3 little dots to the upper right of the camera screenshot, then select settings. From there go to Device Health and check the signal strength. Although I had a good mesh hub (inside) within 10 feet of my camera (mounted outside), my signal strength was RSSI -64. He stated that the signal was so weak it was on the cusp of what is needed for the camera to even minimally operate. This prompted me to reboot my wireless mesh system and reset/reconnect the camera. When it came back online, my signal strength went to -39, a vast improvement.A quick check of all of my devices showed the camera and software working flawlessly. Hat's off to Ring.Anyone who may be having connection or audio/video/notification difficulties, check your signal strength to the camera via the Ring software, even if your router is close by. You just might be surprised.***UPDATE***Camera (and software) is still working flawlessly on all devices.Ring has now updated their Windows 10 desktop app (which previously didn't work with the new wireless battery cams) and it works flawlessly as well.Observations.Notifications on my phone, Tab and Amazon devices (Show, Echo, Dot) are almost instantaneous. Alexa says "Someone is at your front door." Very cool.I bought an extra battery, but it looks like it'll be at least a few months before I need to swap it out, even with the intensive testing I've done on the Stick Up Cam. Battery life seems excellent.I have one zone blocked out and that seems to work fine as well. I also have it mounted a couple of feet above and to the left of my front door, tilting downward at an angle. Even though residential traffic is visible in the field of view, I've not gotten one trigger due to street activity. The motion sensor is triggered by anything coming into the bottom half of it's field of view. From the time someone triggers the motion sensor until the time I'm aware of it is 1-2 seconds. That's about as close to real time as you can get. It's not given me a false alarm even once.Telling my Amazon Show to "(Alexa), show front door cam" takes about 5 seconds to complete.I can also watch triggered video clips and get a live feed while away from home without any extra setup to my network. It's totally automatic.Because of the customer service I received from Ring and the fact the product is much better than I originally thought, I will be expanding my Ring family soon.
review_text_3: Had the camera up and running in less than ten minutes. Excellent quality picture. Hooking up to the solar panel when installing, this way battery is always charged. Received mounting hardware, camera has been installed.
review_text_4: Installed 2 of these outside my house in about 20 minutes. Mounted one above my garage and the other near my front door. The video quality is pretty good. Not facial recognition software good but good enough for a good description of people if needed. I used the mounts that came will the camera and scanned the QR code for setup. Not sure why people couldn't set up zones. It is part of the setup unless you skip over the steps. I do agree with most reviews that the notifications are spotty. Took my trash out and the one by the garage only recorded me going to the side of the house and the one by the front door only recorded me coming back. A neighbor walked by this morning and it started recording after they walked by and were down the street. Pic attached. Went outside again and the both cameras picked me up as I would have expected. I will adjust the camera and reset the zones to see if that helps. They are my first Ring cameras so there may be fine tuning on my part that is needed. Will update this as the days go by.Windows 10 app logs me in but says I don't have any cameras set up. Tried on a PC and 2 laptops. Please fix!!Phone apps are pretty good so far. (Samsung note 9)Updating to 5 Stars.....After adjusting my zones and motion settings I was able to get the results I needed. At one point the wind blew leaves across my driveway and my sensor went off. After fine tuning I see no issues with the camera and its performance. It is by far better than other cameras I have purchase over the years and after comparing subscriptions from other companies $10 a month or $100 is a deal.
review_text_5: Don‚Äôt let any negative reviews influence your decision to buy these cameras. The negative reviews are from people who have not read the instructions or just have no idea how a security camera works. I monitor 16 security cameras where I work so I have a lot of experience with them. I bought the Ring Stick up camera and the solar charger for it as well. They both work great. I bought two more a week later. Now a month later I have no issues with battery power loss of any kind. Just set your zones to cover what you want. Don‚Äôt put motion sensor on full or you will catch bugs and falling leaves. I set my sensitivity in the middle. The image quality day and night is pretty good. You can also look at your cameras from a computer as well as your phone. You don‚Äôt need an Alexa to use these. The microphone works well too. Overall I would highly recommend these if you just read and understand the instructions and how they work which is very simple and easy.MD in SC 1-1-21

review_header_4: Easy to set up and works as hoped for
review_text_1: Really easy to set up, but the sensitive setting was a little difficult to find. Instead of being with he camera settings it is hidden in the mode area. However, Arlo has a lot of information online and was easy to resolve.
review_text_2: I upgraded from an Arlo Pro to the Arlo Ultra 2 Spotlight Camera and am quite satisfied. Build quality and image quality are excellent.
review_text_3: I swapped a Pro2 for a new Ultra2. It was easy to setup the new camera in the Arlo app. The camera position tool in the app made it easy to position the cameras view. The video quality is very good with some slight chromatic aberrations at high zoom levels at 20+ feet. The detection algorithm is also very good. It recorded a squirrel and correctly flagged it as an animal. Distance to the hub is probably 30-40 feet with one exterior wall in between.
review_text_4: Unlike my experience with Arlo's wired doorbell and chime, the Ultra 2 cameras work fabulously. The batteries do not last the advertised length of time. Knowing that I ordered two extras and the charger. The main camera battery had to be exchanged every two days and the secondary camera in our carport every five days. I installed a third-party 3 watt solar panel designed for the Arlo for each camera. The solar panels keep both batteries charged at 100 percent. I think it will be a pain to review the recordings on the base station's mini SD card, so there is no question in my mind that customers purchasing the cameras will also need to purchase Arlo's cloud storage service once the free trial period is over. Customers need to have reasonable expectations. I have my camera's set at the best quality settings, but still, don't expect to be able to read license plate numbers, and the "color" in nighttime recordings is very marginal.
review_text_5: I purchased the Ultra 2 to replace an aged system. Once you see the video, you'll declare 4k video is the only way to go. I installed the two cameras outdoors myself, and I am far from being a home improvement guy. You'll love it. I also watch my camera feed at night on my Amazon Echo Show. Be mindful there is an update package for the cameras and the base. Do the quick download before installing. My system uses the 25' constant power supply accessory, too. No pesky battery replacement or charging issues. You'll love this... I do!

review_text_1: I've only just gotten my cameras set up, so I can't comment on their overall effectiveness. Initializing the cameras was fairly easy, although one wouldn't detect the QR code right away, but was fine after a factory reset.Additionally, consider buying directly from the Arlo website. I didn't realize until after I bought them that Arlo offers 1 year of protection against the theft of your cameras if you don't purchase them through a third party like Amazon. That piece of mind would have been worth it to me.I was surprised by the included mounting hardware. I expected to find 3 of the small magnetic mounts, which are attached to the wall with just one screw and to the camera with a magnet. I didn't think that sounded very secure, so I ordered 3 of Arlo's pivoting screw mounts. It turned out that the box of cameras contained 1 smaller pivoting screw mount already, though, so I am returning one of the ones I bought.
review_text_2: I have purchased three Arlo Pro 4 cameras. They connected to my WiFi network with ease. They promptly notify me when motion is detected. I've been extremely pleased with my purchases & will likely purchase another one.
review_text_3: There was a robbery at gunpoint in the middle of the day on our street. The neighbors camera caught a lot of video that the police officers could use to catch and prosecute the guy. This is my first outside security camera I have ever had and I absolutely love it! I like that you can pause the notifications it send you for different periods of time. I also like that you can look at your videos and use a filter for it to only show you videos (in your history) of animals. In the app, you can also pause videos (or not) and zoom in while reviewing videos. I made a suggestion to the technology support that it would be nice to have the ability to select which zones (that you have set up) will trigger the camera. I asked him, ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs the sense in setting up zones if you can‚Äôt pick and choose which zone(s) you want to monitor for a certain period of time?‚Äù (like, monitoring/triggering only zone 1 at night and monitoring all zones during the day) I had to set up my zones so that the tree branches would not trigger the camera when they blew in the wind. The only problem now is that the shadows of the tree branches on my driveway often trigger the camera. Overall, this is a great camera for the price and if I were to buy another one, it would be an Arlo.
review_text_4: The camera comes securely packaged and ready to operate after a quick battery charge. I did have a bit of trouble getting the owner's manual to download. It went fine on my iPad, but when I tried to get a backup copy to my laptop, I received an error number that then took me to a 'tech chat' option. Sadly, that was a connection to some scammers (in my opinion) who tried to sell me some very expensive and unnecessary security. They told untruths and pressured me a lot. Arlo needs to know this and the bad impression of the Arlo company they conveyed. The camera itself, though is fine and gives clear images. Just a warning here for folks who might run into the same situation.

features: Blink Indoor is a wireless, battery-powered security camera that helps you check in on your home day or night with infrared night vision.,With long-lasting battery life, Indoor runs for up to two years on two AA lithium batteries (included).,Store video clips and photos in the cloud with the Blink Subscription Plan and save events locally to the Blink Sync Module 2 via a USB flash drive (sold separately).,Get customizable motion alerts on your phone through the Blink Home Monitor app so you‚Äôre only alerted when you need to be.,See, hear, and speak to people and pets in your home with live view in real time and two-way audio features in the Blink app.,Designed so you can set up yourself in minutes. No wiring, no professional installation required.,Works with Alexa ‚Äì use your voice to monitor your home through supported Alexa-enabled devices.,Includes five Blink Indoor cameras and one Sync Module 2.
name: Blink Indoor ‚Äì wireless, HD security camera with two-year battery life, motion detection, and two-way audio ‚Äì 5 camera kit
review_header_2: Stop comparing these to professional security set ups
review_header_4: Captures everything, even when you Blink!
review_header_5: Capable indoor wifi camera at a reasonable price
review_text_1: Very easy install and setup. Video quality doesn‚Äôt seem to be much better than the cheap wyze cam I replaced with this blink, even after adjusting to ‚Äúbest‚Äù quality. Love that it‚Äôs wireless and no longer have a 9 foot cable hanging on my wall. App is pretty intuitive. Alexa integration is great. Had an issue with the first cam, customer service was very helpful.
review_text_2: I just want to say for all the people that crap on these cameras, these cameras are amazing. They do the job. They are sturdy. They last through snow, wind, rain, and sun. They have amazing low light vision. Clear pictures. And a great setup to last two years on double AAs. And for those who need them to last longer buy the adapter to plug them in. It's stupid how these people come and review these as if they were 5000 dollar security set ups. These are worth it and a great value.
review_text_4: We are happy with our blink indoor cameras. It being wireless, light, and battery powered made it easy to install. The motion detection feature allows you to choose sections of the room you want monitored. The night vision is provides good quality captures and we were surprised the battery life is rated for two years. However, please keep in mind that it could change base on how much you use the live view, how often it triggers to record, how long the duration of recording, is set to, and if your wifi signaling is bad.Note: if you have a large area or areas with lots of obstructions (i.e. cement, brick, steel, and aluminum) walls you may want to have a wifi meshed network to extend you wifi network pass these obstructions. We have the Google Nest Wifi system. Also, the blink camera must connect to the sync module via low frequency radio (LFR). Because of this, the camera must be within distance of the sync module. This is separate from your home wifi network. My suggestion is to get another syn-module if you run into issues where your single sync-module cannot cover all camera areas.
review_text_5: The all-new Blink Indoor ‚Äì wireless, HD security camera appears to be a good product at a reasonable price. I bought a set of three that came with a Sync module. I believe up to 10 devices can be connected wirelessly to the Sync module that communicates using your home wifi. I was able to easily set up the camera using the Blink app on an iPhone. in addition, I was able to link to Alexa using my Amazon Prime account. This helped to view the camera on the Echo View screen using Alexa voice command such as, "Alexa, show Living Room."I understand that Lithium AA batteries (supplied with the camera) would last for two years. Also, there is a USB-C port to power the camera, although no cable or USB charging block is provided.The camera comes with a small mountong bracket and screws for wall or ceiling mounting.15 day trial for storing in the cloud is free and after that the subscription is $3/month per camera or $10/month for all cameras. However, the Sync module has an USB post and a low profile USB thumb drive upto 256 GB may be used to store video clips in MP4 format.My only complaint is that a detailed User's Manual explaining all these should be included instead of finding at Blink support website.

review_header_2: So Easy an Old Man Did It
review_header_4: Great Value for a fine product
review_header_5: Fair security camera for a great price.
review_text_1: I have to say that I am very impressed with the picture quality. I got the 1920 upgraded version, and not only that the quality is great but it also loads super fast and without any delays. It connected quickly to my network. The camera itself is made well, and it feels quite durable/premium. I like how it looks and I love that I am able to maneuver it. There are tons of other options associated with it, but I‚Äôm not really using them much. I do recommend this camera.
review_text_2: First impressions are the opening gateway. What do I mean? The beautiful box and shipping package done with such care reveals the great quality that followed. Well written in perfect English, the legible instruction book is printed on quality paper and organized clearly delineating very easy instructions on setting up the camera on your Android or iPhone phone and/or computers, the images the camera provides in dark stormy or beautiful days or nights of moonlight shadows moving across your property - you will see and hear what is there and you'll command by your voice what you want "Stop and Unfold yourself!" "Hamlet" Act One scene 1 or tell your kids to bring the ball inside and get out of the rain. This camera works with WiFi signal or wired direct into your router. The power comes from a supplied transformer plugged into any household outlet. The night time viewing is so ample because of the modern electrical engineering design. The carapace or outside cover is all waterproof and safe for exposure but also works, sleekly inside. We found it does not have to be screwed into a wall but can rest on a desk or shelf and pointed at the subject area. We strongly recommend this product after years of installing many cameras in commercial buildings and in residential properties, our experience is this camera is a next evolution in easy DIY (do it yourself) security products. On Amazon we found drill bit for the outside install under our roof eve. My brainy friend Mario really liked how easy it was to install on his iPhone and set-up on the desk-top computer. He gives a 4 Star rating but I give it an extra star because I can now see far down the road for the UPS Driver and the USPS letter carrier delivering our stuff. This company Anran, will sell millions of these, I give it 5 Stars.
review_text_3: Under current difficult time, it is important to keep your family safe. That is reason I purchased quite a lot of security cameras. However a simple camera that can track automatically is needed. This PTZ security camera is the one I am looking for. I was attracted by its compact size. Tested and worked perfectly. It seems easy to install though I don‚Äôt have time to place on the wall. Will do during the Thanksgiving and share later.
review_text_4: This 2 Megapixel outdoor security camera is one awesome low-cost device. It features superb 1080P daylight full color, full motion video with variable framerate. The low light/ night vision is outstanding. It offers the convenience of 2.4Ghz WiFi connectivity that is easy to setup wirelessly from your phone in adhock mode. Once connected locally to your phone, you perform a very basic setup to direct the camera to your 2.4Ghz access point router. Once the camera is attached to your own 2.4Ghz network using your SSID and security credentials you simply enter the UID (each camera has a unique unit ID) into CamHi or Hip2P software. The Anran software will find the camera /add it to your list of viewable devices. I cannot speak for apple IOS but for Android the CAMHi application is easy to use, stable and works well. Same deal with the Windows 10 compatible Hip2P client. In my case I do not have time to set around watching a security camera. I also do not have time to sift through video files if I think I had something happing on one of my properties. This camera has the ability to generate emails. If you have motion detection properly configured the device will send you an email with a video snapshot or video clip of the action which tripped motion detection. If you get an email you had an issue, if you don‚Äôt go back fishing! I will mention setting up SMTP protocols for sending emails very from internet provider. The best way to do this is to be sure to use an email address originating from your service provider. For example, if your WiFi AP/router is connected to SPECTRUM be sure you use SPECTRUM SMTP configurations and a SPECTRUM EMAIL account. For security reason most ISP restrict SMTP sourced emails to their own network! By the way there are thousands of cheep, low cost security cameras. Most sort of work OK, they fail or technical support is minimal at best or non-existent. Anran products are low cost to reasonable, they are NOT CHEEP junk. They do have responsive technical support. I own a number of Anran products. As an Engineer I can truly say I find ANRAN camera products are reliable, quality products you can trust.
review_text_5: The camera is fair. It's made of plastic. The way it is designed structurally I find questionable if it truly is up against weather environment with the plastic designs and few (speaker) holes it has around. When unboxing the package for the two wires (AC/Ethernet) there is a clear cut for something else that was once there. I suspect it's probably further CCTV options. I don't know why the cut was done to begin with but it is there and exposed. Camera feedback and general quality is fair as well for the price you pay. The PC software and phone app are two entirely different beasts with bad UI navigation. Everything you want and need is there but it is a tedious task of setting it up the way you want it to be. I've had two interruptions from the phone app where it refused to pick up the camera and yet everywhere else was accessible. I don't know what went wrong regarding that but in the end the 'fix' was just restarting the camera. There are plenty of quirks that are not accessible to the normal phone app user. One major difference that I can recall being the software allows to set up FOUR detection areas while the phone app allows only one. This was something I needed and the software can be a bit iffy. It requires patience, with the UI navigation being -all over the place-. For the price you pay, it's fair. I can give a proper recommendation but be warned you will need an actual computer for further options unless you just want the bare minimum.After thinking of it I changed my review from 4 to 5 where I will likely buy this product again for additional security. If I have any future issues I may change it appropriately. I think it will handle the Texas heat well.

review_header_2: Start up and Setup is amazingly easy
review_header_4: Great camera - VERY easy to hook up and install. Great pictures wirelessly and on solar power!
review_text_1: I bought this camera to review it.. and I was little skeptical about it because I saw some reviews that didn't like the app.. and the app indeed have low rating in play store, but I was surprised how easy, smooth and successful the process on installing and initiating the camera.First the packing: very well packed with nice box that protect the camera, plastic wrap on the lens.. package includes the camera, mounting bracket, charging cable, user manual and screws for installation (which I didn't use them and used screws that work on concrete wall)Second, shipping: very fast shipping, arrived on time.. with no problems.Third, the installation: very easy .four steps, installing the bracket, installing the app on my phone, initiating the camera and install it on the bracket.Fourth, the image quality and performance: very nice image quality and whenever the camera detects motion I get alarm on my phone, very nice mic, loud and clear..Overall the camera is really good, I bought it to review it And I decided to use it for personal use..Pros:Good material quality.Good performance with good image quality.Fast shippingGreat customer serviceCons:Size could get smaller .. still acceptable but smaller is better.The plastic nut on the bracket should be made from better material.. metal to replace plastic would be much better.
review_text_2: This camera is excellent. I have bought the packaged system from this company before. It included 4 cameras that needed AC power and were connected back to a NVR with a HDD for recording. Those work great and I use them as fixed cameras in the front and back of my home.But - I wanted a camera that I could put anywhere.... this is it. Its battery operated and I set it in any spot I want to keep an eye on. I have included some photos of the images and user interface. The image is amazing. You can see a comparison from a photo I took to what you see on your phone thru the app as an image. It's almost the same.The setup was super easy. I dont think it could be any simpler. You unbox this thing, and 5 minutes later it was up and running using the instructions supplied in the box. I have placed it front and back in my home with great connection performance. We have good WIFI in the house, but it seems to be very strong in capturing the signal. No problems with that.I have the setup ON for motion detection with a notification to my phone.e. Each time it detects motion - I get an alert. I click it and see what is happening. Super easy. You can have that on or off.I recommend this if you want something easy to setup, portable/moveable and don't want to worry about needed to plug into AC power.
review_text_3: Good camera to buyDay vision is very goodNight vision is goodMotion sensing is goodAlerts to phone are goodPretty much plug and playDidn't need tech support
review_text_4: I bought this camera to keep an eye on a construction project in my backyard. I needed a battery operated wi-fi camera. I tried another brand that was horrible. I couldn't get the camera to link to my home network.This one was unbelievably well behaved linking up.The battery has run for more than a month without charging. The photos are decent quality and the video is great.I showed it to one of the guys who works for me. He and his wife a slowly building a house in the Philippines for when he retires. He's been looking for some way to keep an eye on things there. He checked and found out that this camera has a solar panel option. He just took six units with him to the PI.I cannot recommend this camera any more highly. I am very satisfied with this purchase.Update: 2/1/2021: Charging for the second time since I bought this. Oh. And another guy I work with bought three units and loves them. I'm buying another two. That makes a dozen for my group!Update: 2/14/2021:I just bought another to look down my driveway. I've shared the camera with my wife. Super easy to do. Now we can both check in on the house from anywhere we have a phone signal.Update 3/10/2021: Bought another. This one was hooked up, on line, and installed on the wall at the back of my house WITH the solar panel within 20 minutes of opening the box.
review_text_5: Camera lasts very long even with frequent motion detection. Enough battery to last 3 months. Video quality is surprisingly clear. Don't judge quality from theview you get in the app that is being streamed over internet to your phone so video quality all depends on internet. Take the sd card out and watch the videoon a computer and you will see how clear it is truly being recorded at. Night vision is also impressive illuminates a good 50ft area in front of the camera.Motion detection works it is sensitive but needs to start recording faster.

Send instant Alert and activate the Siren manually when it detects person, sound, or motion. review_header_1: Great security cam for a great price!
review_header_3: So simple, even I could work it!
review_header_5: Used for Catching Not Me and Ida Know...
review_text_1: I got this camera as I've been looking around a while for a not too expensive camera for a bit of home security. This camera fits my needs exactly! The price isn't too expensive so I could get a few more for around the home if I need to, and I probably will!Pros:-The images / video come out nice and clear, I can view it on my cell phone and clearly see the faces of anybody who passes-The infrared camera is excellent! Even at night when all the lights are off, the images come out crisp and clear!-Motion sensor is great! Unlike some other cameras where you define a blob of the areas you need, this app gives you a 5x5 grid you can just choose to detect instead of having to fine tune the edges, so it's quite easy to change to ignore areas you don't need that have a higher traffic.-App is well made and easy to navigate! I had no problems setting up the camera at all through the app, the camera has a time and date stamp as well, and it's possible to sort through the videos it took by date, and even narrow it down by type (options are Motion, Sound, and Human shape).-Lens is slightly fish-eye so it has a great coverage, more than I thought it would! Just a small camera covers my whole living room area with basically not much blind spots!Cons:-Another App! Might not be a con for you, but I have a smart home with tons of apps, so it's a tiny hassle to have to add another app instead of using a camera that already works with one of my other apps, but for the much cheaper price of a great camera, it's not too much of a bother in exchange. It's also a well made app so I don't have too much complaints about it!
review_text_2: Received the home pro camera on time, App download and camera setup ‚Äì took me a while to figure out it only works with 2.4G wifi network, the APP video instruction helps. I use it keep an eye on my cat when I am not at home, talk through the camera via the app on my phone and tablet. I am impressed by blurams APP, the notifications are marked as 3 different types, sound, human and motion, which is very helpful when I search on the video clips. The sound and video quality meet my expectation. Had in use for about a week, hopefully it will continue to work well.
review_text_3: Wow, I cannot say enough good things about this camera! First, it was super simple to set up. Anyone who knows me also knows I have worse than horrible luck with technology. This worked perfectly. The picture is great quality and I even got notifications when someone/something moved in front of the camera or made a loud noise.We bought this to see what our teenager was up to while we were gone. It was fairly easy to hide although he found it on day 3. Lol it worked great. And even better, I found out I have a great kid!! (Admittedly I already knew that last part but I was a teenager once too...ü§£)Overall, I would highly recommend this camera. It's priced great, great video quality and the app works perfectly. The only thing you need is a MICRO SD card and to download the app.
review_text_4: Fantastic camera, regardless of the price!¬†Night vision mode is very good. I love it. Image quality is very good. It looks to me like 1080p HD video. On my network it streams in full motion at a nice high frame rate. There's none of the jerky low frame rate video that I get from some of my other cameras. Color reproduction is quite good. incredibly easy setup. You just install the app on your phone, plug the camera in, push a button on the back, and then point the camera at a QR code the displays on your phone. Then you are prompted to enter the password for your wifi, and that's it. It literally takes 1 minute to set up, with no messing around with firewalls, routers, ports, etc. It's an absolute breeze.The motiion detection is simple and reliable. An optional push notification is sent to your phone. And you can go into the app and watch the recording. highly recommended this productÔºÅÔºÅ
review_text_5: We are doing foster care for a young sibling group of three and have been frustrated trying to figure out what is happening some of the times. The wife and 17yo daughter have the phone app on their phones. This is a little too techy for me but they can pull up video and within about 5 minutes figure out who the culprit is. Unfortunately, there is a free 1 month introductory service that ran out the day when we could have used it most. There was no warning until the service stopped but we upped the subscription for a year and things are back under control. The footage is also helpful for showing the culprit why they are being punished.

review_text_1: The image quality during the day and night is excellent.The motion detection function is great and a bit sensitive. The system is running very well, of course, if any accidents are discovered later, I will update the comment.
review_text_2: One camera doesn‚Äôt always want to show the picture. It‚Äôs sporadic. All the others have a great view and good picture
review_text_3: Will change my stars to 5 if push notifications start coming thru for motion alarm from the app esee cloud. Bought this for that reason. Went upto 5 stars as I found why no push notifications. There is a setting for each channel you have to setup to get push and email notifications.
review_text_4: THE SOUND PICK UP ON THIS IS PHENOMINAL WOW AND THE PLUG AND PLAY IS REAL HAND WASNT REAL BAD TO HOOK UP LITTLE WIRE AND A COUPLE OF WATER PROOF ELETRICAL BOXES AND LIDS AND I WAS UP AND RUNNING IN NO TIME VERY NICE VIDEO QUALITY THE SOUND PICK UP IS A SELLING POINT VERY NICE OUTFIT GLAD I BAUGHT IT
review_text_5: This is a great camera system and a great cost. Just make sure you keep the plug area out of the rain, bc I had one to go out due to the weather

name: Hiseeu 2K Wireless Security Camera System Outdoor 3MP Dome PTZ Cameras and Bullet Cameras Surveillance Mobile&PC Remote,IP66 Waterproof,Night Vision,7/24/Motion Record,Motion Alert,Two Way Audio
review_header_1: Make sure you get the correct power adapters!!
review_header_2: Cameras and the mic is very good
review_header_3: Very happy with the Hiseeu Wireless System
review_header_5: I lost my setup book during a move, still got it working.
review_text_1: Came with all 220v adapters. Luckily I had spares. Nothing on the box would tell you.Edit: After only leaving my previous single star review (no complaints to Mfg or Amazon), the Mfg customer service rep reached out to me and asked if I wanted to get replacement power adapters. I said I did and just a few days later a bag arrived with a full set of 120V/12V adapters.So, in addition to a pretty decent low budget security camera system, their customer service ranks up towards the top too! They obviously read their reviews and are willing to act on them without a lot of drama. Hard to find in this day and time.The Camera system itself is pre-paired, so all you need is power and a phone to set-up around the house. I can't connect it directly to my TV HDMI yet (older LCD so unsupported mode) but a borrowed VGA cable let me run it to set up emails and all the recording parameters (can't access the set-up from phone or PC that I can figure out).Carmeras have good daytime and respectable night vision. I did augment the IR with a flood and it's actually better vision at night than daytime!!! Zoom is a little dodgy but using the focus helps. PTZ camera are good and I love the rover mode.Like I said... it's a good option for a budget system. A lot better than my previous Foscam set-up and cheaper overall since you have an annual cost to record that isn't here!I'm happy with it and would recommend it to others!
review_text_2: The cameras and the sound is very good. It picks up talking from probably 30‚Äô away with your back to the camera. The night vision is pretty good. I only have issues when it is changing from dusk to dark. The smart vision setting goes back and forth for a about half an hour. It isn‚Äôt a deal breaker. The only problem is if you want to depend on the human sensors to notify you of movement. If it‚Äôs windy and something like a tree or a box blows around it will detect it. If a car drives by my house, it will detect it. It has also picked up on moths flying at the camera at night and shadows moving on the wall. I turned off the sensor down to minimum on one camera cause it went off too much. Set up to my phone and iPad perfectly so I can view the cameras from anywhere. I have and would recommend these to people on a budget that wants security without a subscription to a company. I also set the system up myself so I saved money on installation.
review_text_3: The Hiseeu Wireless Security Camera System was easy to setup and connect to my phone for remote viewing from the EseeCloud app. It has high quality 3MP images. The PTZ Cameras are easy to control from the phone app. I enjoy being able to view from front and back yards with these PTZ cameras. The 2-way audio is amazing and the speakers on the PTZ cameras are loud (and louder than the Bullet Cameras). I like the convenience of being able to have a 2-way conversation using the cameras and the phone app. The NVR is easy to setup to send Motion Alerts to the phone app. The system is Plug&Play and I have it saving videos 24/7 (as this is nicely set as the default setting). I like how the Wireless IP addresses of the cameras are already setup to the NVR unit. The inner cardboard box arrived open, but I believe that's because the seller setup the addresses of the cameras to the NVR ahead of time (pre-installed). It was easy to screw the cameras above my doors and under the eaves of our house. Some of the cameras are over 100 feet from the NVR unit with strong signals. I highly recommend this Security Camera System because it has quality images, has a working phone app, has 2-way audio, is Plug and Play, and is easy to install onto walls.
review_text_4: We have pretty janky, rural internet that maxes out at 1 Mbps upload speed. This system works great!! I bought 4 extra cameras (2ptz and 2 fixed) and adding them is pretty simple. Be careful if you want the ones that match the kit as they're described as 2k instead of 3mp. The cameras described as 3mp are different looking.... The motion detection isn't the best but easily turned on and off in the app so I'm happy with it!I would buy again and have already recommended to friends and family!
review_text_5: A very "plug and play" system: I got all the cameras out and plugged them into the wall. I hooked the box up to an old vizio tv with the provided hdmi. All cameras connected withing a few seconds except "camera 1". I just had a blank screen for that one (a white screen with the hiseeu logo). I played with the settings for a bit, where I found by right clicking on the screen I could left click on "wireless add". I left it in this mode for perhaps 5 minutes where it found and auto added the camera.A bit more playing around and I got it to only record during motion detection. Motion detect is very sensitive, its autumn here and a few leaves blowing will set it off. I'm fine with this.Night vision is great, it does a good black and white. I don't like that the cameras all glow red during this mode, but I understand the necessity.PZT mode will allow you to pivot the two cameras that have this function. Use "speed" in this mode to adjust how far the camera moves per -up-down-left-right- click you do on the arrows. A speed of 1 will barely move the camera, 8 will move it alot. Knowing this can help set the camera up to just the right spot. Finding the best spots, you can select a "preset" number of 1 or higher and hit "store", this allows you to quick select a "preset" number and hit "go to" to quickly scan to the saved spots.Zoom doesn't appear to work on any of my cameras.For an easy and small power extension cord to the cameras, I bought and tested: "Vanxse CCTV 10m(30ft) 2.1x5.5mm Dc 12v Power Extension Cable for CCTV Security Cameras IP Camera Dvr Standalone". These seem to work well, and will extend 30 foot per cord.Signal is great. I can't seem to reach the wireless range of my cameras within my yard. I have the box set up with several walls between my farthest camera, perhaps 100 feet from the box to the camera. The signal indicator on the screen says 3 bars. The furthest camera is a Ptz kind, and it does seem to respond slower to pan than the camera that is only 30 feet away.Overall a great system, I ordered 1 ptz camera and a few extension cords so that I can have an overview cam from my backyard tree, will try to update review once is installed.

review_header_1: Solar Powered outdoor Cam With 2 Way Audio
review_header_2: My most stylish and powerful PIR camera
review_header_4: Exceptional Security Camera With Solar Panel
review_header_5: Love this! Here is the reason why...
review_text_1: * Using this on my patio to watch into the backyard. During the day if kids playing there or in the evening/night for deers.* Simple setup. The app is very simple to get the camera ready. You need to connect the app to Wi-Fi once and add the camera to that after that you can access it from anywhere. You need a regular 2.4 GHz wifi connection for this. I tried connecting to my router wifi which is default to 5GHz and it does not get the camera setup then I moved that to my mesh network setup which is 2,4 GHz it took 2 mins t setup the camera and another 2-3 min to upgrade the firmware on cam.* Solar panel looks well made and the screen is not reflective.* App is very well made and a lot of features. 4+ rating on the Google play store.* Camera has its own battery and can work without a panel also once charged. (Not sure how long it will work still exploring that).* Camera also has a good Night vision and Motion sensor.* Mounting plates and screws come in box. I did not mount it yet as I moving it around the patio.* Solar panel cord to camera is around 10 ft or may be more.
review_text_3: We have an area in front of our garage that we cannot drill through so this solar powered camera works great. We installed in on a post that sticks out from our garage and where it's at, it gets sun all day long, no matter what time of day. We were able to angle the camera just right that we would not only get in front of our house but the only neighbor that we have too. We're able to see who turns the corner and can clearly see license plate numbers whether it's day or night. We live in a condo complex and this thing has some great night vision. We were having some issues with people attempting to break into cars and the one camera we do have that requires it to be plugged in, the angle of it does not get plate numbers, just the cars and the people attempting to break in. With this camera, I'm able to get the angle that we need and can clearly see license plate numbers either in the front or the back. This was really easy to install and using the app is just as easy. We can take clear pictures while watching the playback and when it comes to videos, we're able to play, pause and even download them. The picture quality during the day is very clear but what surprised me was the clarity of the night vision. There's no blur or grainy looking picture or video. Has really come in handy on several occasions and just makes it easier because the charge that it gets from the sun has kept the power on this camera going.
review_text_5: Absolutely recommend this product! Truly works on SOLAR power, easy to install! No more power provision needed.So I live in a townhome setting and always wanted a security camera.... The cost of security camera was never an issue but the installation cost to provision the power to the camera was way more than the cost of the camera itself! (since I don't really have power outlets outside close enough for where I wanted to install it)This one solved the power problem completely! This thing is in theory truly wireless and the SOLAR panel does a very good job of keeping this powered on 24x7!I have had it up and running for over a week and half now and the battery charges with the SOLAR panel very well! (Yes, even on Gloomy, rainy cloudy days)I was a little worried about Winter if the panel was covered with SNOW, but someone answered a question that they had snow on it for over 6 days and the camera continued working, but the way I installed the solar panel (slant), the snow will not be able to accumulate. (but lets see what happens in Winter)Literally took 15 - 20 minutes start to end to set up and and install!Love the fact that you can switch from SD to HD (high Definition color) if you like... and the best part is it has Voice and Video!!! It gives you a live view and audio with in 10 to 15 seconds of opening the app... (keep it mind, it does take some time to get a live feed... its not instant the moment you open the app and I was expecting this delay because it is over IP) some may find this to be a problem, but for me it is not! I don't even know if there is a product out there that gives you a instant feed the moment you open the app. Its a technology issue not a product issue the way I look at it.I decided to not buy the cloud service, I am using a SD card instead and it does work perfect, it does not record constantly, but you have the ability to record as and when you need to.Another big positive surprise for me was the quality of the SOLAR panel, I was thinking I would get something that was flimsy and could get damaged if there were strong winds, but to my pleasant surprise, the build quality of the solar panel is very robust! Even the camera feels nice and not made out of cheap quality materials!It ships in sturdy packaging and this was a nice addition to my home!

review_header_5: Good combo with existing sensor light
review_text_1: My Catalytic Converter was stolen And I hope to use this camera to deter and even catch thief. My trucks catalytic converter was stolen off my truck that was parked on my driveway a week ago. Cost me $1,000 to replace it. I hope with the motion sensors, it can alert me if someone does under the truck. I set it up under the truck and it works. I can see at night and motion sensors works. I also put a motion sensor floor light to deter the thief. I really hope this will work. But the camera works as it should. No issues.
review_text_2: My fence was distant from the building. I previously installed solar motion light on the fence but there were times that light was on but I did not know what's going on. I bought this camera to neutralize that situation by pointing this camera facing fence. When the fence light was on, I also got app notification from this camera. There is delay for the video stream, but it is acceptable for my case. Still happy.
review_text_3: I bought this to monitor activities in my yard. My neighbor‚Äôs dog dug a hole below the fence and damage the plants in my garden beds. I got videos to show my neighbor for keeping the cute doggy behave. It‚Äôs also helpful to spot rabbits and squirrels in the backyard to show my kids.
review_text_4: Very easy to use, you can monitor, record, playback and voice intercom. The price is also relatively affordable and satisfactory shopping.
review_text_5: I put this camera right above existing outdoor sensor light. It works well as a supplementary camera so I don't have to buy expensive spotlight camera because my LED sensor light works just fine. The battery seems good and I like the USB charging so I don't need to wire it.

review_header_5: Easy to install and high quality camera
review_text_2: Seriously, I have three of them. Easy to set up, comes with its own storage card, doesn't require a subscription, the picture quality is SUPER clear, and I could go on. My main complaint is re: the motion detection, but that's likely more of a situational thing. We have a lot of bears and other wildlife around, and since the camera focuses on person detection, it only captures them if the motion detection is turned up to its highest sensitivity - which drains the battery faster. The battery life has been great so far, though. No regrets, and I'll definitely stick to Eufy cameras moving forward!
review_text_3: This is the best video doorbell I have ever owned. No monthly fees, clear reception. Records when you install a SD micro card. Gives you all info including how much battery % is left before charging. I have only owned it 1 week so not sure if battery last as long as they say. Easy installation. I am happy with my purchase. I highly recommend this product.
review_text_4: I am happy with these cameras and the entire set up. Picture quality is excellent, can easily access previous recordings without having to payany fees. Very easy to install, modify configuration, and access stored videos. I fully appreciate the ease with which these cameras add needed security to my home's balcony door.

review_header_1: Great Quality CCTV with very easy installation
review_header_3: Easy Setup, Solid Cameras, Good support (Basic English)
review_header_4: Wireless Security System Automatically Recognizes Cameras!
review_text_1: This is what were looking for. The system is really easy to install. The quality was great. Wifi connection to NVR is really great we can see basically no delay at all. The mobile app was a bit difficult to configure but still answer the basic need for remote monitor.The attached photo is from our backyard where anything on the grass is dark and really hard to see but the camera said otherwise. Great Product.
review_text_2: "3TB HDD Pre-Instal - Hiseeu Wireless Security Camera System, 8CH 1080P NVR 4Pcs Outdoor/Indoor WiFi Surveillance Camera with Night Vision, Waterproof, Motion Alert, Remote Access" model WXKIT-8HB611-1T.**I will only try to point out some things not discussed in the description andFirst this is an EIGHT CAMERA system so don't be confused by the "4pcs" in the description.Second, I sent an email question to their customer service and received a response in less then 24hrs - VERY GOOD.Third, this is a Standalone system running Linux which gets rid of the BLOATWARE/SNIFFING of Windows and Chrome, etc. 'nuf said on my opinions of Goggle and Microsoft.Second, BUY the system with ALL the cameras (8 max) so that you have 'Spares" bought cheap as a 'kit.' I have used 6 in my system to date. The Camera Software has display settings for 8 camera windows, 6, 4, and so on.Third, the Cameras housing, adjustment arm and base are 'cast metal' (not plastic) very well made. I specifically chose ones with good 'hoods' as several of my units would be hit by the sun and typically would bleach out the image.Forth, the camera's field of view is very good and clarity range is as far as it shows. There is no flutter in the images after 4 months installed. The automatic 'white balance' is the best I have seen on NUMEROUS systems including Commercial versions. This comes into play when it goes B/W for night vision. On that note, there is a 'electric eye' on the front that actually switches the Camera mode too which does NOT rely on software to make that determination and uses decades old established 'eye' tech for delay - i.e. doesn't switch back & forth and does not get effected by passing headlights etc. This is the BEST manner in my opinion and you can actually HEAR the switch when you cover the eye with your finger!Fifth, the NIGHT VISION of the camera is exceptional for a non-commercial unit. It uses THREE "infra-red illuminator" LEDs (shown in picture) that are very strong (bottom "led" is actually the electric eye). The 65 feet is correctly advertised. However there is a hotspot because the LEDs are not shining 'spread out' as far as camera's field of view. This is an issue with ALL infra-red Iluminators as the Infra-red light is such a small band of light energy - that's why your TV remote does not work from a distance or if you don't point it at the TV when your batteries are low. If you need to see further or wider, you will need to invest in separate ACTUAL Infra-Red Iluminators and place them as needed. Note that I have overlapping cameras and each 'see' the others Infra-Red spots.Sixth, Make a CAMERA MAP and plot locations as well as which camera goes where. The system comes FULLY SET UP however, having done this before, I plugged in the entire system on a table, started it up and determined which cameras were 1-8 and LABELED them. Then made sure to put them in the order I wanted them DISPLAYED so when turned it all on, it was only the matter of alignment. I have three in one location alone giving over 180 degree coverage. Those are 150ft away from the base unit and still have a SOLID 3 of 4 bars wifi.Last, I did not need any internet connections (etc.) so have no input there.PS. the noise is typical of just a Hard Drive head indexing and is not loud but it will transfers through its cabinet to a hard surface and becomes a 'sounding board' making it out to be louder than it actually is, which you can fix by putting some soft 'feet' on it. The intermittent indexing does make sleeping around it a little funny. The best step would be to offer SSD when the prices come down as they are noiseless and have a better longevity in a constant "write" hard derive scenario such as this.
review_text_3: So, let's review, right?Well, when I bought it, of course the price was right, but I was worried that It was on the cheap side, and that it might reflect in the quality. The answer is NO. This was well worth the value. After 2 years, still working just fine.Now, Let's talk about it.Basically, it's pretty easy. Unwrap everything. Grab a network cable, a power strip, and a HDMI or VGA monitor.Once you have those things, plug it all in. DVR to the network, power and HDMI/VGa and a mouse (included but crap), and the cameras all in to the power strip. Turn it all on at once.When everything is on, the cameras should already show up on the screen in a grid. You have to set a password (make it easy, no keyboard). Then walk through the Wizard. Set the time, give it an IP or DHCP (easy instructions included)**. When it says ONLINE, you are done. You can tweak it anyway you want, but honestly, that's about it.There's also a QR code that it displays to download the app for mobile access, and there is one that connects the DVR to your phone. I dowloaded the iPhone app, then clicked 'add DVR' then pointed my phone to the QR code... and in about 5 seconds, the phone showed my cameras.** If you have a router that supports uPNP, use it. It will make things easier.The reason I am posting a review now is because of a recent issue I had. I came home one night to find the DVR had been stuck in a reboot. It would load the startup screen, then reboot. After an EMAIL to their SUPPORT, I was given some options to reset a setting, reboot, and try again. This didn't work, so they sent me a new firmware. That corrected the problem, and I was back online.In many cases, a company would simply tell me that 2 years was over-warranty. I really appreciated that they were able to provide support.I should mention, they do not speak fluent english, so there was a little assumption and muddling I had to go through to understand some of the instructions, but overall. Very impressed.
review_text_4: I ordered this system last year and to my shame it sat in the box till now. I've had a lot of time to do my pet projects and this was one of them. So finally I got it out and after reading reviews of how wireless camera systems were difficult to setup I was dreading the fight. However, no fighting needed. I hooked it up to the tv and plugged it into 120VAC. I plugged in the cameras to 120VAC in different parts of my house in window locations. I then turned on my tv and switched to the HDMI port of the Control Unit of the system. Once again to my surprise I saw my screen divided into squares for each camera powered up. I didn't fight with it at all! Apparently the system is automatically keyed to recognize its cameras and any extra cameras you try connect to the system must be wired. It is still early in my installation and I am trying things out yet. I ran an ethernet cable to the Control Unit and will be trying out accessing from my phone and computer. It looks like you can manually access it over the internet if you know the IP Address and ports of cameras or you can download the software app and use the software to access cameras and schedule recording. I would recommend this system.
review_text_5: I purchased this system recently for my property,At first I was a little hesitant buying a system off Amazon, but then did my due diligence research on the system and Hiseeu as well as tried asking some pre-sale questions to their support to see how efficient support really was. (They did a great job of answering questions)I have been pleasantly surprised with the system as a whole.Setup was very easy as the cameras come preloaded to match the system. (I encourage a new buyer to setup all of the cameras and system in one room first before installing them, This will allow you to identify camera 1 thru 8; although the cameras can be easily reassigned)Once setup, the Admin Menu is pretty easy to understand and work with, so no difficulties there. The viewing ‚ÄúPhone App‚Äô works well, with sharp images that I can now view when I‚Äôm away from the house.All in All, I recently had a 900.00 System that I used, and I have found the Hiseeu system is practically the same and for 1\2 the money,I will say though, that I will come back after a month of operation and either update this review or add a new one so I can comment on the stability and connectivity of the System.Note to Potential Buyers:Read the Product description, Hiseeu offers an additional 8% off if you email them for a code before the sale, To me; that was the final item that had me land on them for a product.

description: Size:1 Count (Pack of 1) Now you can monitor a job site, farm, cabin or any other remote location with the VOSKER V200 4G Mobile Security Camera! The V200 combines the look of a trail cam with the practicality of a surveillance camera while utilizing 4G connectivity, an app like a cell phone, and the convenience of solar charging! This weather-resistant and rugged camera also has a built-in SD Card slot so it can do onboard recording. This audio video surveillance camera also has night vision and automatic motion detection. And besides harnessing the power of the sun to keep it charged up, it can also run on a rechargeable battery pack, 8 AA batteries, or a 12-volt battery‚Äîall sold separately. This model comes with a preactivated nationwide SIM card and a variety of mobile security plans, including free.

name: Vosker V200 | Cellular Security Camera | Built-in Solar Panel | LTE, Wireless, Weatherproof, No Wi-Fi Required | Motion Activated Outdoor Surveillance Cameras | Mobile Phone Photo Notifications
review_header_1: Camera is great and easy to set up, however:
review_header_3: Very easy to setup and inexpensive to operate on an annual basis.
review_text_1: I give the camera five stars. It is easy to set up and use. The picture quality is good (HD quality or a little better). Support by email is good. However, upon "motion detection" the receipt of the notification email with pictures posted to my Vosker account may arrive within 30 seconds or several hours. I find this troubling considering this is a LTE (AT&T, Verizon) based security camera. I have 5x5 signal reception (strongest). This issue may be a problem with the volume of cellular traffic between the Vosker servers and my email account. I would expect Vosker to monitor the traffic and adjust the network and routing. Vosker management is free to respond to my comment. For a top quality security camera like the V200 this should not happen.
review_text_2: We are building a house out in the country that is over an hour drive one way from our house. We wanted to be able to keep an eye on the construction process to know when it would be worth our time to drive up to the site and back. From my research, I determined the best type of camera was one that had solar charging capabilities and also cellular built-in in order to send me photos when there was activity. So I bought this camera. I played around with it for over a month at my home in order to get a sense of how the camera worked and which settings were the best for me. The camera is super easy to activate and you get one month free of the elite plan, which is unlimited photos. I ended up opting to continue this plan after the one month free trial period. For $20 a month I can get as many photos as I want sent to me and 40 photos upgraded to high DEF if requested. Once I had a good feel of how the camera and the associated app worked, we drove up to the construction site and found a tree that pointed toward the site that we felt had a good point of view. I‚Äôm glad I played around with this at home first so I didn‚Äôt have to fool around with it when we were setting it up. I love the VOSKER app and set the camera to send me photos every two hours. This camera is working wonderfully and since it‚Äôs been installed it has maintain 100% battery power through the solar panel. It helps that we have a cell tower on a mountain above our build side which gives a 5 x 5 signal. The night vision took a photo of a couple deer walking around the construction site at 1 AM from 50 feet away in complete darkness. We had a person who came to the site and I thought that he worked for our builder but wasn‚Äôt sure from the standard definition photos sent so I requested a high def photo and determined that this was the guy I thought it was. The camera is doing everything we hoped it would and I couldn‚Äôt be happier with my purchase. I am thinking that maybe some of the one star reviews came at a time when VOSKER was doing a software upgrade that caused people issues. That is partly the reason why I wanted to do a review. I couldn‚Äôt be more thrilled with my purchase.
review_text_3: I love this camera and phone app!! I use it as my primary driveway camera system. It never fails to alert me of visitors when I am at home or away. I will be buying another one for my other home.
review_text_4: I use the camera to see who comes and goes on my drive way.the reaction time is a little slow on the v 200.if the vehicle is driving a little too fast you miss the plate#.The other issue is the GPS location feature should only be accessed from the phone app.Alot of people use game cameras and if their robbed they take the camera to.So far I'm very happy with the results
review_text_5: I own a number of these and they are really decent outdoor cameras. The V200 is able to send photos even from truly remote areas; a strong LTE signal from a cell tower will mean it can send notifications to your phone nearly instantly but even with weaker signal, photos do arrive.
