review_header_2: Firstrend's Customer Service is what you need
review_header_3: UPDATE Jan 2020: Easy to set up and very clear pictures on viewing applications
review_text_1: I purchased a model #FTUS-WNK84102T-JG SC-4PCS 1080P Camera-2TB HDD-1 8CH NVR 3.6MM. I purchased 2 additional Firstrend 1080P cameras to fully cover the outside of my home for $65 each. Firstrend also recommended a Wifi Signal Booster 2.4 Ghz 4W 802.11 Signal Extender for $30.99 to extend the range on the antenna that I was having problems with intermittent signal coverage.The paperwork initially provided was too little and very confusing. I had a few calls with Daisy and she was wonderful, helped greatly, and was very pleasant. Recently, Daisy sent me a newly published User Manual (User Manual Of Firstrend Wireless Camera System-888-806-1588.pdf) which is written in much better English, covered more topics, and solved the overall issue that so many buyers complained about in earlier reviews.The hardware seems to be made really well and sturdy. I had an issue with the antenna connection on one of the cameras and Daisy replaced the camera quickly and the new unit worked great. I read in the original instructions that you needed to tighten the antenna down tight ‚Äì just don‚Äôt tighten it too tightly or you may strip the treads - this may have been partly my fault do to the way the instructions were written.The picture quality is very good in both the day and at night. The power cord on the camera is roughly 9‚Äô in length and depending on placement getting electrical outlets to the cameras can be challenging depending on your experience level. If you use a booster to improve the Wifi signal, the cord on the booster is only a little over 3‚Äô so when I ran electric to for those units I put in a double box with an exterior bubble cover. I also used the same 2-gang weatherproof box when I put 2 cameras in close proximity to each other. Firstrend advises to put cameras at least 5‚Äô from each other.Make sure that the cameras are all connected and working before you install them outside on your house. Adding a camera or two isn‚Äôt difficult as long as you have the channels on the NVR to support them. Daisy indicated that the 2 Terabyte hard drive in the NVR that I purchased would record up to 8 Channels/Cameras for 2 weeks automatically and then overwrite the disk starting from the oldest files.Wifi connectivity is absolutely critical. It took me awhile to get workable locations determined on a couple of cameras so that signal issue was consistently strong. What I found was that moving the camera to the end of a gutter or on the other camera to the top of a 7‚Äô fence away from the house itself provided a strong signal without a booster. A good strong signal was obtained on the other camera that would go on and off at times by using the recommended booster.I've attached a few photos that I took during the installation. The TV screen shot shows a typical view while monitoring the cameras and was taken at night while it was raining.Bottom line ‚Äì I didn‚Äôt find it extremely simple to install but if you take your time and do it right it is not a difficult system to install and you will have a first class camera system that will protect you and your home which is what all purchasers are striving for. I strongly recommend this product.
review_text_2: So this is my first security system. When you first start looking for your system, you looking for all the bells and whistles: I want to be able to see all area's of my house, I want to record it, I want to zoom in and talk through it and have them be able to talk back..... Well at least that's what I wanted. I work from home, in the basement and wanted to know what was going outside of my dungeon while I work. Do I really need to get up to check who's at the door? Why is the house quiet, are the kids dead? But what system would work best for me? I have wanted one for years but never followed through because I did not want to run video cords from each camera all the way to the basement, Heeeeell no. So Wireless, yes please! All they need is power plugged into a normal outlet and then they wirelessly send the video to the NVR (DVR) unit where it is being recorded....at my house, no need to be spending money every month to rent some company's cloud somewhere. No monthly fee! But which one? There were at least 5 different brands that I still had on the table at this point. I went with Firstrend in the end because of all the great review about their customer service. And yes you should use email, as yes you are talking to someone across the world, and yes there is a delay of a day or 2.... BUT, It's worth it! Daisy will work with you to make it right! I had a tall order seeing as how my NVR was going to be receiving signals from a basement over a 2,500sq house in the suburbs of Ohio. Some cameras worked great right out of the box. Some cameras worked great sometimes but would lose the signal after a few hours and then I would have to unplug them and plug them back in to make them work again. and 1 camera was just a dud and could not get further than the room I had the NVR in. But, Firstrend Customer Service to the rescue! We tried a few different troubleshooting options, and after those possibilities were removed I was sent 2 wireless boosters to apply to the cameras losing the signal, and a replacement for the camera that was a dud. No forms, no hassle, just what was your amazon order number, what address to send them to, done, express mail, Return anything, naw, don't worry about it! YES! Thank you for making this easy! and in the end I have a working system that I am happy with. I would suggest getting the 4 camera system to try it out and you can always acquire more cameras later. There is Motion Sensing tech on the cameras but I have not found the sweet spot on the sensitivity scale to make it text my phone for kids running with sticks at each other in he driveway but ignore differences in tree shadows, however I think that might be a difficult task for any system. The NVR interface and the App interface are decent, not great, not crap, but I'm happy with it. My next step is to try and share the app to my wife's phone so we both have access, but I know there is some trick to it, as the company is trying to protect you from hackers. But it can be done. I also thought I would like the scheduled recordings for some of the time and then just motion alerts for the rest of the time, but so far I have just stayed with Record everything all the time and no alerts. Sure, it won't protect me from invading clowns spun out on bath salts as they trigger the motion sensor, but better than being texted every 5 mins that the flies/mosquitos are always checking out the camera's built in red light for night vision. Product, I would give 3-4 starts; but man that customer service making it easy for me to make sure everything actually works and no risk? 5 big a$$ stars!
review_text_3: I'm updating this review today Jan 28, 2020:I've had the system installed and working fine since Oct 2018I wrote the review below soon after we got her up and running without problems.Last month we had some sort of power glitch or unprotected power spike (as noted on the recorded time-stamp of video feed.) Both exterior cameras went on the fritz.Since the unit is just a bit outside out of its 12-month warranty and after a short email exchange with the manufacturer‚Äôs representative (Neal) requesting a couple of steps to get the two cameras back online, they, Firstrend have been gracious enough to offer sending me two (2) more exterior cameras which we were not able to repair and get back online.My 15-month experience with this product and the help of their rep. Neal still justifies me giving them 5 stars!Their email help is quick and efficient and their out-of-warranty product support is what's to be expected from a successful company!FIRST REVIEW: "This review is for the n1080P Wireless Security Camera System, Firstrend 8CH Wireless NVR System with 4pcs 1080P Security IP Camera and 2TB Hard Drive Pre-Installed, 65ft Night Vision and Easy Remote Monitoring. Got it set up in about 5 hours (running extra ethernet cable 65 feet to garage and hanging 5 cameras) and the screen views are excellent! Do spend the few extra bucks and get the 1080p system. Motion sensitivity program algorithms need some work though. Too sensitive, even at the lowest settings. Workaround is to record only during motion activation at select periods of time and eliminate the continual recording (if you don't want to overrun old recordings on your drive or if your drive is not big enough or absent and you only want to get notifications either by email or text) You can record both continually and when motion-activated and then separate files into two folders for easier viewing later or you can record either continually only or motion detection only. One big plus is that all cameras record even though only one camera was motion activated. And they only record for 30 seconds after motion activation, not hours, sucking up your hard drive space. This parameter of recoding time is not adjustable. 1080p picture quality of viewing live shots and recorded shots is EXCELLENT, whether it's on your iPhone or your Windows machine!Daisy, in their service group, is wonderful! She was able to resolve the major two hiccups during the set-up, syncing of extra 5th camera (deleting and adding a new ip address of new camera that didn't come with the new 4 camera system, a simple procedure since everything is menu-driven) and why a black and white picture when should be 1080p color (default of system during low light/night conditions in area where camera was surveilling.) The color came back during daylight :)
review_text_4: So far very pleased with this purchase. Had a situation with "Motion" setup. Left Email, less than 24hrs later received a response from Daisy.She addressed all my concerns and supplied me with step by step assistance in getting "Motion" feature working. Thank you Daisy.It took me time looking at reviews before I decided on this unit. The clarity of video and playback is very good and now with Motion detection working this is a Great system for my security needs.I hope Firstrend continues its A+ customer service if and when needed by anyone.Love the wireless feature (no "home run" cabling needed, but could also be used with Ethernet connection) just power outlet to power cameras.Included with this unit is a mouse, short Ethernet router cable, all necessary hardware to mount cameras with a mounting template, covers for non used camera cable ends, drill for mounting, wrench for adjusting cameras and instruction manual.
review_text_5: This is a nice piece of kit. It is easy to set up, including on your phone. There is a wee bit of a learning curve, and I keep learning things about it, but you can get off the ground and operating quickly.Picture quality is quite good, including in the black and white night vision mode.Figuring out how to save the video and some of the powers of the system are a little confusing. Mastering mouse clicks helps, the system likes slow deliberate mouse clicks! Quick clicks frequently don't work.It will stream to a phone, it will send alerts to the phone. You cannot play back video on the phone without the cloud account (has a monthly fee).You can control the alarms for each camera independently (BIG yay!). Haven't fiddled with it, but it appears you can select sensitivity areas visually on each camera as well. This could be hugely helpful for our front camera that sees cars on the road.A helpful accessory/necessity is power extension cords for the DC cord that goes to each camera. This helps you plug in the camera charger inside somewhere and run a small DC power cord out to where the camera is mounted.All in all, we are quite pleased with this system.

name: ZOSI 4 Pack 1080P 1920TVL Home Security Cameras Outdoor Indoor,120ft Night Vision, IP67 Weatherproof 2MP Surveillance Camera,Work For 720P/1080P/5MP/4K HD-TVI,AHD,CVI analog CCTV DVR System(Black)
review_header_1: Cameras and company wonderful. Purchase different cables.
review_text_1: I originally bought these 4 cameras 2 years ago. Within 6 months I had to replace 3 of the cables. They just stopped working. (I have 4 other cameras I have had for over 3 years and never had to buy new cables for them) One of the cameras has shown parts of the screen in purple almost since the beginning. Changing the color settings did not help. At about a year one of the arms just snapped off of one of the cameras. It still works and is held together and hanging from a strap, but at a strange angle because there is no bracket on it or a way to adjust it. The way it broke, would not allow it to be repaired. I was barely touching it and getting ready to adjust it when it snapped. Today I am replacing the 4th cable because it stopped working. I may have just gotten a bad set, but I would not recommend these cameras after what I've been through. The cameras I bought 3 years ago for much less money are still working great and I've never had a problem with them. I rarely give bad reviews, but today was the last straw.After posting my review I was contacted by the company. They sent me 2 brand new cameras to replace the 2 that weren't working correctly. Although I don't recommend using the cables supplied with the cameras, I do recommend the cameras and the company. Do yourself a favor and purchase better cables so you aren't replacing them in a few months. I buy these for all my cameras --> Amcrest 2-Pack 150 Feet Pre-Made All-in-One Siamese BNC Video and Power CCTV Security Camera Cable with Two Female Connectors for 960H & HD-CVI Camera and DVR (SCABLEHD150B-2pack). $25 for 2 and so far they work great. These cameras are very easy to position and adjust. No special tools needed. Just a small Phillips head screwdriver. The cameras supply a clear, color accurate video of whatever area of your yard or home you want to see. I can actually see the fish swimming in my pond. I would love to purchase the latest version ZOSI makes, but not in the budget at the moment. If banks, stores, and gas stations had these cameras, you could actually see and identify thieves instead of just seeing blurry figures. Thank you ZOSI for exceptional customer service.
review_text_2: I‚Äôve only unboxed and set these up for testing before the hard install later to come.I bought these to expand my harbor freight cobra 8 channel that only came with 4 cobra cams and expand they did.Now I‚Äôm glad it only came with four or I would have never found these. A single cobra cam is $40 these @$25 each is incredible.Of the four photos the lower quality are of course the cobra cams and the much better quality are the new ZOSI cams. I will add more daylight photos soon.Also note worthy, I did test to see if these cams kept their joystick settings after a power outage and they do. These cams appear to be very well built. Comparing them again to the cobras they are almost twice the size, %200 better image, they have twice the IR LEDs and the metal housing gives the impression that they are durable and well made.If the daylight images are just as impressive I‚Äôll be ordering another set.For the price I haven‚Äôt found anything about this cam I don‚Äôt like.A special note for harbor freight cobra users.Again I did test that these kept their joystick setting after a power outage. To make your life a little simpler I tested every set point on my cobra DVR.Unless you just want to run threw it yourself, do yourself a favor and set both the cameras and you DVR in TVI mode and you‚Äôll be all set.Cobra DVR main menu-camera set up tab-Drop down tab to TVI and saveI ended up changing all cams even the four cobra cams to TVI I found they looked a little better.Awesome productAwesome value
review_text_3: I bought a four pack of these little gems to augment my existing Zmodo home surveillance system. With these cameras, I added three new views (channels) to my home system for a total of seven and replaced one of the original Zmodo cameras. Since installing these Zosi cameras, have definitely taken notice of the sharper, clearer picture, the significantly better night vision and the picture "stability" of the cameras which significantly decreases the number of false motion recordings (the brightness of the picture is consistent and does not change suddenly as my Zmodos are prone to doing). As a matter of fact, have purchased another four pack of these cameras as of the writing of this review to replace the three remaining Zmodo cameras and have one as as a spare. Bottom line, these are GREAT little cameras for the money IMHO!
review_text_5: I have a swann DVR that came in a kit with cameras. One of the cameras stopped working and another was giving problems. I received these zosi cameras and installed. WHAT A DIFFERENCE. The picture is much better day and night than the swann cameras. A great camera for the money. I will eventually replace all the swann cameras with these.

features: ,,(1). H.265+ can further improve compression ratio on the basis of H.265 standard and save about 80% storage compared with H.264, and thus effectively saving storage resources and provides an excellent and smooth viewing experience.,(2). [ 2MP System Overview ] __ Exclusive 8 Channel 5MP-Lite DVR Recorder paired with 8 Weatherproof 1080p bullet cameras with 80ft night vision and 90¬∞view angle. 60FT BNC+DC CCTV cabling provides both video and power to your cameras,more stable and reliable than wireless security system.(1TB security certified hard drive was pre-install inside the DVR),(3). [ Local or Remote Access, Playback Anytime & Anywhere ] __ View and control your security system locally by connecting the system to a monitor without internet, or via free ZOSI Client software on tablet, PC, or via Smartphone APP (ZOSI Smart ) on mobile devices remotely.You can also playback significant evidence or funny videos records by searching different days, hours or minutes.,(4). name: ZOSI 1080P H.265+ Home Security Camera System,5MP Lite 8 Channel CCTV DVR Recorder with Hard Drive 1TB and 8 x 1080p Weatherproof Bullet Camera Outdoor Indoor with 80ft Night Vision, Motion Alerts
review_header_3: Verry good Video Quality and the night vision is super.
review_text_1: I'll be honest with you, I wasn't sure what to expect for under $200 bucks. Everything came as it should and it took me a day to mount and wire up all the camera's. It took me another few hours just to get all the angles right and to move one to different location. Once I had it up and running it took me only a little bit to figure out how to get it running and recording. The main unit is about a 12" x 12" and everything hooks up nice. It comes with a 1Terabite drive and was easy to get formatted and recording. One thing I would say to all, is let it keep the default image resolution settings. If you try to go higher than the camera's will handle, it will cause it to reboot and start all over. I hooked this up to a older TV with the HDMI connection and it stays on at all times right above my computer desk.My real worry was the quality of the camera's. Truthfully I don't think they are 720p camera's myself. If you try to make the image large the image is a bit blurry and unstable. Not the kind of unstable that would make it not be usable but if you have watched a 720p video it's a lot better than this. But that aside, the quality is much better than the older style systems you used to get, and for the money it's worth it. The biggest plus to this system is the night vision. This to me is where this system really shines. The camera goes Black and White when it gets too dark and the images are not awesome, but better than anything I have seen on any of my work systems. They really do show about 65 feet in the pitch dark and though it is a bit grainy you can still make out anything moving out there. I can even see my dog when he goes out to do his thing : pThe peace of mind from having this system is worth every penny. We had some prowlers before we got this messing with our water lines and this is why we purchased this unit. If they ever come back, their gonna get a nice ride and three meals and a cot.Also just a helping hint. The joints to the camera's are sturdy, but if you try to tighten the locking clamp by twisting the camera body you will break the joint. So don't be tempted. Get a pair of Channel Locks and hold the camera and then tighten the lock ring, not super tight but snug. You can thank me later : )
review_text_2: I ordered this system. It arrived super fast and communication with the vendor has been excellent. My plan was to power up the system on the kitchen table and let it run for 4 or 5 days to become familiar with it and verify that it works. I figured being Amazon I could send it back if it didn't live up to expectations. So far, so good.I have been running this system in one configuration or another for more than two months now and have not regretted the purchase. The quality and software capabilities far exceed my expectations at this price point. My only complaint on it so far is the remote app for android. My problems with it are outlined below. Since I am not that interested in remote viewing this is not an issue for me.I have NOT been given a discount for this equipment as some reviewers so the comments below are strictly my own.1-4-17Received the system and wired everything except WIFI and video out. Everything worked well on initial power up. Easy setup with the Wizard. Good clear image for each camera. As night approached and the lights turned off I checked night vision. I don't know what it will do for long distance but in the house in total darkness, 15 feet away I could easily see a person move and what they were wearing. I could not make out details of the face.1-5-17I let system run all night and recording worked fine. Today I opened the DVR to see how it was built.The hard drive is a Toshiba 1 TB 6 GB/s SATA drive. My plan is to install a larger drive so that when we are on vacation we can have two weeks of saved video. I can then use this drive as a backup drive in my server.There is a small cooling fan on the left as you are looking at the front of the unit. There is a good size heat sink on the main chip. I plan to install the DVR on its side so the fan should be up with space on bottom ( right side of unit ) to assure air flow.There are three USB connectors. One on the front of the DVR and two on the back. A mouse comes with the system. I tested it with a wireless mouse but it would not work because you couldn't load a driver for it. The two other USB ports can be used for a backup drive and a wireless dongle.There is also an RJ45 LAN port on the back. I plugged a Cisco bridge into it to connect to my wireless LAN. Entered the password and connected with no issues. I ended up running an Ethernet cable from the RJ45 port to my router. I had some issues getting the remote access app to work with wireless. Not sure if that was the reason.Also a BNC video out connector. Not tested yet but my plan is to run this to my video distribution system so that I can view the cameras on any TV in the house.I had an issue with one of the indoor cameras. I moved the camera on its gimbal mount too far and some of the silicone tubes popped out. My error for moving it so much. I attempted to put them back but they would not stay in place and there was no way to get a dab of glue in there. Then I read the camera instructions ( yes, I should have done that first ) and learned that you can disassemble the camera to mount it to the ceiling. Now I can re glue the silicone pieces. One helpful point is that the instructions say to unscrew the bottom part of the mount. I grabbed the two pieces to unscrew and they would not budge. The trick I learned was hold the two parts very gently and wiggle them in a counterclockwise motion.1-7-17I set a fixed IP address on the DVR and when I go to the browser on my computer on the LAN and type in that IP address I can view the cameras and change any of the settings. This means I won't need a monitor or mouse connected to the DVR and it can be better hidden. It doesn't do you much good to DVR the bad guys and then have them steal the DVR.Installed the app SECU365 as recommended by Zosi. My Norton AV said there was no risk. After it installed it appeared to install something else and all of a sudden Norton said it sent data back to China and was a privacy issue. Considering that this is a view into my home I'm very concerned about anyone hacking into this. It may be safer to forego the remote view. If anyone has info on a different app that is known to be safer please leave a comment.Also a note on the silicone bumpers on the indoor cameras. After regluing they fell out again while installing on ceiling. The camera still held in the position I set it so it wasn't a big deal. Just annoying. I plan to replace the silicone tubes with something different on the next camera I install.3-2-17We have had some milder winter weather in our area so I was able to get all the wiring run in the attic and the outdoor cameras installed. I had a minor problem with one of the outdoor cameras and the vendor responded quickly and took care of the problem. I have been very happy with the quick response on any issue from the seller!With all 8 cameras running full time but not recording any audio I am able to record a few hours less than 2 weeks of video. I have not done much with learning to use the motion detection or the time out for the cameras feature. I would guess that I will get more than 2 weeks of video by only recording motion. I will write more on this topic later when I have more time.One thing I learned was that you can only save video clips out through the front panel USB port. I should have learned this before I installed the system because I had to use a 90 degree USB adaptor and a short cable to access the port.As mentioned before I can view live video, review recorded video, copy recorded video to the front panel USB and change any of the configuration settings from my Win7 browser. I wish there was a way to copy a portion of a recording to my local Win7 drive through the browser. I am planning to write to support if a firmware update would allow to do this or any other features. I will write more on this at a later time.
review_text_4: It is lowest cost for such a security system even buying the hard drive separate, and I put a 2TB hard drive and only used 2 of the 4 cameras so I got two more for spares.The instructions are lacking so it takes a little (just a little) ingenuity to figure out things like the red light is power and the green light means the videos are activated and working, and "play back" only means play back while we have to go to the main menu and click "backup" in order to copy a file onto a flash-drive. The red icon means no sound but this DVR can install a microphone if our State does not object. The small yellow lighted icon is for the motion detector coming on, but even with motion detection the videos are recording 24 hours every day constantly so it gives full coverage.The infrared comes out black-n-white but it is brilliant how it lights up the entire yard like a strobe light and yet completely invisible to our human eyes, except for the little red glow of the infrared around the face of the camera.I attached mine to one of my HDMI's on my TV so to watch a live view outside then I just change from TV over to the HDMI and there it is constantly live monitoring but when I turn away from that HDMI then the TV does not show the video so it harms nothing.I mounted one camera inside but I do not want inside on full time monitoring so I put the power wire hanging loose and so if I ever want the camera inside to start working then I just reach down and push together the loose power cord and then the inside camera comes on only at my comand.I am very happy with this.
review_text_5: Picture quality is great, use of the DVR is pretty straight-forward, and overall I'm very happy with these (especially for the price! I just could not ding a star for two minor issues (below) given the price of this system).Hooked up the app to my phone and now I can see the house while away.Customer service is spot on. I had a hiccup of my own doing and they were quick to respond via email to get me sorted. I sent pictures of my issues, they sent answers. Got me running fast!Setup: mostly easy except the camera assembly has swivel issues. There are two screws that keep the barrel in place that prevent it from easily fine-tuning the angle of the picture after install (see picture). But, loosen those screws and turn the barrel, tighten again, and it does work; it's just not easy at the top of a ladder.Cables: the cable lengths were great - got everywhere I needed them with ease. But, the cable connectors are different lengths (see picture). A bit OCD sure, but try to put them in electrical tape or outdoor tape and you have a lump.Grab a 2TB Storage Drive, also on Amazon, and this is a perfect system for install and walk away.https://smile.amazon.com/gp/product/B00IMPO5MO/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_search_asin_title?ie=UTF8&psc=1Again, for the price, you can't beat this. I've installed many, many security systems. What you get for the price is great. And the customer service alone is worth it.

name: ZOSI 4 Pack 2MP 1080p HD-TVI Home Security Camera Outdoor Indoor 1920TVL,36PCS LEDs,120ft Night Vision, 105¬∞View Angle, Weatherproof Surveillance CCTV Bullet Camera
review_header_1: Over All great system, And Zozi stands behind every product they sell with outstanding customer service!
review_header_2: I understand some stuff is just bad and not the companies fault
review_header_5: Great cameras, at a great price.
review_text_1: This is my 12th security camera install. I have always liked the Zosi brand so when my home needed a upgrade I went with Zosi. To be honest I ordered 2 of the 8 channel 720P DVR + 8 camera setups, just for the 16 cameras. It was just as cheap to order the complete set as opposed to ordering just the cameras separate. I will keep the 2 DVRs for a future jobs.I was disappointed when I opened the box for the dome cameras and saw they where "PLASTIC" housings. I almost sent back both systems right there. Zosi in the past has always used aluminum housings on their dome cameras. Plastic will eventually fade and become brittle with UV exposure. I was also disappointed that two of the bullet cameras had stripped screws as I will be contacting the seller directly to get remedied (Seller has been known to have great customer service) I am sure they will work with me to fix the problem.I was pleased with the quality of the 720P vs my old 800 and 1000 TVL cameras. The setup was easy as expected, plug and play and you are done. I was originally worried as I run my cameras through OdiySurveil baluns (See pic) as it makes it easier to run 2 network cables then 8 separate Siamese's (I would highly recommend for any security install, you still need power but easier then "home running" each camera feed) Overall I would order the products again. Thanks Zozi!!!!!******************UPDATE***********************Zosi customer service is outstanding, I had 2 bullet cameras that must have been a bad batch and Zosi was quick to remedy the problem and sent me 4 new 1080P cameras to replace the 720P. I have been a life long Zosi fan and this outstanding customer service seals the deal for all my future security camera install needs. Thanks Zosi for being so understanding and just plain awesome!
review_text_2: I bought this about 7 months ago. I had an issue with 2 cameras and reached out to Dealer through amazon. Kelly Chan contacted me and shipped out 2 replacements right away. I understand some stuff is just bad and not the companies fault. I had an issues with my DVR locking up and e-mailed Kelly Chan directly and she had a new DVR shipped to me in about 1 week. I have not had any more Issues and this company's customer service is top notch. The system does what I need it to. setting it up for motion detection is a little tricky but their website has videos to help you through it. Kelly Chan is on my A list for customer service. Job well done.
review_text_3: Ok. Packaging was nice. The bullet cameras have a metal housing which looks and feels durable. The white blended in nicely with my house (which is also white). The setup was relatively easy. Took a little long to figure out the remote viewing but wasn't too hard. The day quality is really good, Super clearI did have a little issue with some of the dome cameras but Zosi customer service contacted me and was very accommodating . I was able to keep the camera system and they fixed the issue.Definitely worth buying and if you have any issues, Customer service is great (Responsive and accommodating).
review_text_4: considered only going 4 star but i really do like them for the price and they feel like a heavier/sturdier better built camera. added some realistic shots as to what it actually looks like from my DVR
review_text_5: Most excellent cameras. I got these to expand my system to 8 cams. Well these new Zosi cams are so much better than my Swann cams I am replacing all the Swann cams with these. Wider angle view, much better colour popping out at you. It's a big difference. Given, the Swann cams are about 5 years old. The Swann DVR crapped out so I bought a Zosi unit to replace it. the Swann never really worked right from the beginning. It had major false motion detection problems, making it useless for alerting you via email. It would send tons of false email alerts with pics of an empty yard. Even with the unit zeroed in to small grid areas, tons of false alerts. So it was turned off for alerts. Back to the Zosi unit. So far everything has worked perfectly. With the additional cams it is even better than I've ever had here. Big kudos for Zosi. Keep up the great work.

features: ,,„ÄêTrue DIY NVR System with Monitor„Äë-- No need to run cables all over your house to connect the NVR and cameras. Simply mount the cameras, true plug and play, just plug in the adapters and go. With built-in rechargeable battery, carry your monitor anywhere you desire. Super Convenient!,„ÄêStunning 3MP Ultra-HD video and 2-Way Audio„Äë:3.0MP presents 2048*1536 Mega Pixels about 1.5 times clearer than 1080P. Infrared LED array that allow you to see up to 100ft night vision even in darkness. You can hear and talk to the guys who around the cameras. Free App and NO monthly fees.,„ÄêSmart PIR Activated Floodlight „Äë The Spotlight & Siren alarm on security camera is of great innovation, not just monitoring your home but proactive to defend it! Once trigger any suspicious object, it auto light-up your yard or scare off intruder, and records ultra-clarity color videos even at night. An instant email alert and phone app notifications will be sent to you in time! Enjoy a peace of mind.,„ÄêMulty Recording Modes„Äë--Auto, manual and scheduled recording modes. Five seconds pre-record period ensures the event is fully captured. Built-in motion detection sensor(PIR) with adjustable sensitivity settings to avoid false alarm and save memory space,„ÄêPortable 7" IPS Touchscreen Monitor„Äë: The IPS touchscreen monitor will let you get a wide viewing angle. Crystal clear night vision visibility ensures footages. 5200mAh Rechargeable battery and 32GB SD card are included.
name: [3MP&2-Way Audio&Floodlight] Tonton Portable LCD Security Camera System Wireless, 7" IPS Touchscreen Monitor,4CH NVR and 2PCS 3MP Floodlight Cameras with PIR,Rechargeable Battery,32GB SD Card Included
review_header_2: Easy to use. Superb build quality
review_header_4: Excellent hardware -Use Potplayer to view videos on your Windows PC
review_text_1: I have owned several different brands of wireless security camera systems very similar to this one, that is they had two cameras and a portable monitor. No question, the Tonton is the best. Highly recommended!Over the years, as new features became available, such as night vision, Internet connectivity and higher resolution, I would upgrade my system. My last system was 720p and triggered on every movement, and I mean even bugs flying in front of the camera. The night vision was so poor that it was basically useless. Then the internal battery pack, which was not user serviceable, started bulging and cracking the plastic on the back of the monitor. This gave me a good reason to purchase the Tonton system and am I ever happy that I did.The Tonton gives me every option that I ever wanted with one exception. I would like to be able to turn off the Infrared LEDs at times, but I don't think there is any system that will do that. The build quality is very good all around, and I was especially impressed with the camera mounts... they are beefy and solid. By far the best mounts that I have ever seen on these types of cameras. Image quality is stunning, both day and night. On my old system, I could barely recognize myself at night. There would have been no way to identify a stranger. The Tonton has very good night vision. The batteries on the Tonton are common 18650 which are user replaceable. That's a big plus to me, but you don't even need the batteries unless you want to run the monitor in a portable mode. I cannot speak to long term performance because I have only had it for a few days. I did need some tech support (to find a setting in the menu) and they were very responsive.The cameras auto-synced right out of the box and I was blown away by the 1080 resolution, coming from 720p. To me, 1080 is a must have! I am a very demanding consumer. I have high expectations of products that I buy, and I was not disappointed with the Tonton. In fact I am thrilled with it.Bottom Line: The Tonton system has amazing quality and features, especially considering the very modest price. Then consider that you get the 18650 batteries and 32GB memory card included, now that's a great deal.
review_text_2: I liked this Wifi portable NVR so much, I ordered 2 of this model.Build quality is absolutely solid and clean.Set up could not be easier. Basically, just power on the NVR and cameras. Select your local Wifi network and press a button to pair cameras, and NVR.The monitor is touch screen and allows you to view 1 camera at a time, or all at once. You can navigate, adjust setting, control recording time, and settings all from the portable unit. You can zoom into a point of interest. Record based off a schedule or motion detection. Back up video to pc or phone.There is also a useful feature that allows you to speak through the camera to whoever might be present.Image quality is great and night vision is good, although I cant speak on the outdoor performance because both of mine are for indoors.I have contacted customer support a few times with questions and they were fantastic every time!Really very helpful and polite.It's been over a year now since owning these units, and I've seen that they constantly keep the remote view app up to date and improved with new features.After all the years with numerous other brand / systems with their sub par quality and crappy clunky software; I thought it was take it or leave it with NVR systems; until TonTon came along showed me different and impressed me thoroughly!
review_text_3: This is exactly what we were looking for. Nothing fancy, not overloaded with bells and whistles. We just wanted to see who was at the front door before opening it (frosted glass front doors, can't see through). Package arrived quickly and packed well. Easy to use - NVR monitor runs either off electricity or batteries which was VERY IMPORTANT TO US, so when we were outside in the back of house, we could bring monitor with us to see who rang the door bell. The cameras, we had an electrician run electric so cameras were installed through soffit of house. But, you can plug the cameras in anywhere as long as you have an electrical outlet. You can set it up to cover the area you want, use an alarm if you want, use just motion, program to record when you want; set to record automatically with motion, there is an app you can download so you can receive notification over your phone if you want. We did have a problem with the NVR monitor not running on battery only. Monitor wouldn't work off battery. Emailed seller, and received a replacement monitor. Had issues reprograming NVR monitor to match with cameras since cameras were synched with original monitor. Once again, emailed seller and with their help - I was able to reset cameras to match up with the new monitor --- took less than 2 minutes!!! Simple fix!!! Seller sent a video demonstrating how to link cameras to monitor....perfect! Long story short----we are VERY HAPPY WITH THIS PRODUCT, it is exactly what we wanted. Now we will know who is on the other side of the door...can talk directly to the person. Yup, very happy with this product. Thank you to Will for his patience and quick response. I highly recommend this product! Somebody knock at my door!!!!
review_text_5: The Good:Excellent night vision!¬† Honestly, I was expecting somewhat mediocre¬†quality night vision for this very affordable security system.¬† I was quite pleasantly surprised at it's quality.No false alarms.¬† This system has yet to send a false alarm.¬† The cameras are set up in the courtyard and it's entryway which have very limited activity.¬†¬†The customer service is spot on.¬† I dread having to contact ANY customer service, especially if I'm already frustrated with a new gadget, but fortunately this security system has been mostly pretty easy to set up - except...¬† I was having a recording issue, so I contacted customer service and got it all straightened out quickly.¬† In all fairness it was user error - but it's comforting to know Tonton's customer service is there if needed again.The Bad:The User Manual could really use an overhaul.¬† If someone is setting up and using a security system as a first time user, the set up process may take a bit longer to figure out.¬† It's not intuitive, but, as I mentioned in The Good, their customer service is excellent.So, it's not actually "bad" but I would love to have cameras that are both AC and DC powered.¬† And have the option to use either.¬† It would make it just a smidge easier to move the cameras, should that be necessary.

name: Security Camera Outdoor, Solar Powered 360¬∞ PTZ Wireless Outdoor Security Camera, ieGeek WiFi Security Camera with Pan 355¬∞ Tilt 120¬∞, 15000mAh 1080P, PIR Motion Detection, 2-Way Talk, IP65
review_header_1: This solar camera is perfect for my backyard.
review_header_4: Impressively Large Viewing and Panning Area
review_text_2: This camera does not need electricity to operate and function. The camera battery that is rechargeable can sustain a very long time without needing recharged. (6 months)It has held a charge without being connected to electricity OR THE solar panel for over three months, and it is still only 1/2 power on the battery scale. When using it outside, two points of importance, one, the solar panel will keep it constantly charged so electricity will never be needed after the initial charge up. And also the color black is more important to be used on the outside so that in darkness it does not show up as well as if it was white. The camera has PTZ that is accessible from your phone to be able to adjust the camera, and the app allows you to go back in the history and pull up events that occurred usually up to one or two months, depending on the size of the SD card that you put into the camera. Also the camera has a much better picture if HD is pushed on the camera settings. Wifi is necessary if you need to access the camera remotely. You cannot go wrong with the purchase of this camera, the quality of the pictures is excellent and the response time of the camera to record is excellent.
review_text_3: This camera is a HUGE upgrade from the older one that I have from the same company. The video is more clear and the wi-fi extender is EXCELLENT! I have a slower internet and the extender is very nice - no freezing up or slowing down. Being able to move the camera around is an awesome improvement too, keeps me from having to install multiple cameras. It was very easy to connect with their app and set everything up, maybe 10-15 minutes (mainly because after connecting it needs to download a firmware update.) Even installing it outside was super easy, four screws to your base and then put camera on it and tighten down with little screw tabs. If you are looking for a camera but not wanting a huge investment or complicated installation, this one is perfect for that! I highly recommend it!
review_text_4: - Design, build and paint quality is excellent- Since our side patio, yard & walk in area is very narrow and long, the camera can pan the whole side of the house. It also can pan straight down to alleviate any blind spots.- If someone comes to our side entry door we can pan to see who it is and use the speaker (two way speaker) to ask any questions before deciding whether we should open the door. Of course it's also great to see if Amazon or other vendor packages have been delivered. (Panning is done through the use of an icon on your mobile device)- Battery life is very good. In 3 weeks of use the battery is at 85%. (I intentionally left off the solar panel to make sure the battery was good.)- I did encounter one minor problem involving still images not being viewable after the camera detected motion and recorded video. The company was contacted via email and within 24 hours asked for more information. After giving them the info, they responded again within 24 hours with their explanation. (Nothing wrong with the camera ‚Ä¶ a software app update will be upcoming which should fix the issue.) After working in the computer support area all of my life, I am always impressed by companies which actually care about customers and respond quickly. Kudos to their support team!This is a very nice and functional security camera which I would purchase again.
review_text_5: This come with everything you need, except for the optional memory card. Charge it before you install, and with the solar panel set up to face the sun, you never have to worry about it running out of battery. No monthly subscription required which I love. You can add a microSD card to save footage. The pan and tilt functions work nicely from the app which allows you to expand your view. Motion detection works a little too well, so I would get alerts if strong winds move plants/tree shadows. Overall a great value!

name: CasaCam VS802 Wireless Security Camera System with 7" Touchscreen and HD Nightvision Cameras, AC Powered (2-cam kit)
review_header_2: Good quality, has everything I needed and was so affordable!
review_header_3: It works, simple and reliable. I would buy this again and would recommend it to a friend
review_header_4: Just amazing!! Worth every penny! See full review.
review_header_5: Can see who is at your front door at all times day or night.
review_text_1: UPDATE:7-24-2019:I have upgraded my review to 5 stars.You can see my complete video review on YouTube. Search for "CASACAM WIRELESS" in the search bar.You will find 3 videos to view.1. After communicating with the manufacturer they have explained to me that the plastic housing is UV rated.2. It is normal for the camera to feel warm to the touch.3. After having the camera for several days. I have discovered that this system is feature packed with many options to enhance the cameras performance.4. Video quality is very good5. Customer service is excellent.Two Camera Night Vision CasaCam, (this is the system without the extra spotlight).My first impressions: THE CAMERA:1. The camera material feels cheaply constructed. It is plastic no metal or aluminum.2. The lens cover is plastic not glass and is most likely susceptible to scratches and probably yellowing with age (like car headlight covers).3. The infrared L.E.D.‚Äôs on the front of the camera (they turn red at night) look poorly soldered.4. The camera is warm to the touch when on (day or night). I don‚Äôt know if this is normal.5. The power cord with the supplied extension cable for each camera is about 16 feet long. Not long enough for most installations. They charge $10.99 for additional 15 feet of extension cable.6. They claim the camera is ‚ÄúWEATHERPROOF‚Äù but should not be exposed to rain. It is probably fine mounted under an overhang or eave. They should consider making a rain/weather shield.7. The mounting bracket is adjustable but would be much better if it were a ball and socket.8. The instruction manual is better than I expected but is not clear on every function of the camera system. It wouldn‚Äôt hurt if they used a larger font.The MONITOR:1. The monitor feels nice with a little weight to it. It should be 10 inches for a better viewing of 2 or more cameras in split screen mode.2. The kick stand on the back is a nice feature but it feels flimsy and will probably break with a little pressure.3. The screen is a touch screen and responds okay but is a little awkward if you don‚Äôt get your finger in the right spot (make sure you remove the protective film or it will not perform well at all).4. The menu bar is pretty straight forward and simple. It is easy to figure out once you have played with the system for a few minutes.5. The monitor can be unplugged and carried around. This is a very nice feature. The battery life varies according to reviews I have read. I have used it for about an hour and a half with some charge still available.The Video:1. The daytime video quality is not bad at all. You will be able to recognize someone standing at your front door etc. You will see cars driving up and down the street. You will not be able to read a license plate (unless the license plate is right in front of the camera).2. The motion detection works and is adjustable and can be turned off.3. The night time video is acceptable. It is in black and white (it makes my blue eyes look very creepy) and you may not be able to recognize someone so easily.4. The two way speaker works, but is not as good as I had hoped. It is tinny sounding and there is a lag between talking and listening. You have to press the talk button while talking and release to listen. The playback sound on the video seems to be much better quality than the live audio.5. The SD card is over writable. For best playback I put the SD card in my computer where I have more control over the playback options.6. Internet connection. I am not using that option at this time so I have no comments.BOTTOM LINE:It‚Äôs not a bad camera system. The video is very good especially in the day time. The camera system has features for recording times and alarms. The portability of the monitor is an excellent feature. I wish the camera was constructed better. I can‚Äôt help but wonder about the longevity of this camera. From all the negative reviews I have read on Amazon the manufacturer has responded to most trying to work with their customers to resolve any issues that have arisen which makes me feel like this is a good company and improvements will hopefully be in the near future. Of course I have already spent my money on a product that for now seems to work very well.
review_text_2: I absolutely Love this camera system! We had been looking for one for forever and tried three other camera‚Äôs before we finally found this one! Where we live they don‚Äôt have WiFi that works very well so I wanted to get one that didn‚Äôt require WiFi and came with a non stationary monitor. I was using them as a kid and dog cameras so I wanted to be able to have two way communication with them as well. This camera fit All my requirements! The two way communication works amazing, the monitor can be carried around without being plugged in (although it doesn‚Äôt last very long, only about 4 hours but it also charges back up quickly), it can be plugged into the internet so you can view remotely from your phone, it‚Äôs So affordable compared to others, you can add cameras to it, it‚Äôs weather resistant, night vision is clear and amazing, saves footage so I can go back and review clips, I haven‚Äôt ever had a problem with slow connection and we have a camera outside and in our basement. If I could give it more stars I would! I did my research, tried other more popular cameras but this one was by far my favorite out of all of them! I haven‚Äôt had to deal with the company so far because I haven‚Äôt had any problems so I don‚Äôt really know how their customer service is but I guess that‚Äôs a good thing! I would definitely recommend this to anyone!
review_text_3: Exactly what I wanted. This is a nice simple affordable camera system that DOES NOT require wifi, a router or internet to work. Setup is simple, camera's are good, monitor is good, recording of video works as expected. night vision is decent, motion detection works but is not very long range and the audio (one way or two way) is good. Once you download the app to your phone and connect the monitor to your router you can view the camera's remotely, your results viewing the camera remotely will depend on the quality of your internet connection on both ends (camera end and cell phone end). Please understand this is a basic camera system quality of picture is average quality and features are adequate but somewhat limited. If you are looking for a high end feature rich video system this is not it! But if you are looking for a decent camera system with reasonable functionality I highly recommend this product. At this price point I don't think you can do much better. **Quick update** Have owned the product for six months now, It is in continuous use 24/7 One power adapter stopped working, Contacted the company by email and they promptly responded (less then 12 hours) and will send me a replacement no problems no issues. Things break, that's life but quality customer service like this is what makes a product stronger. very pleased!
review_text_4: Amazing product and amazing support!!This system is a must have, no WiFi is required which is what caught my eye. You can always use WiFi for remote viewing which is very secure and for dvr playback.Another plus is that the system can be incorporated with your RV trailer lights. Camera reads 9v, but after emails with the casa team 12v can also be used!! Which is very exciting because I can now use a rearview camera. (See con below)As for my other camera I use as a baby monitor in the buck house of the RV which has amazing video 2 way talking. So if I need to tell my little man to calm down or just to say I love you it works amazing and works great also with the remote app through WiFi.Con- as of right now for the camera settings, image can‚Äôt be reversed for the rear backup camera like I have setup. When you look at picture, left is really the right and right is really left if that makes sense. I am just really hoping they release a update to be able to reverse image.We plan on doing a full review on YouTube so more to follow on Gone with The Millers
review_text_5: Shipped fast and packaged very well. Easy too install and setup. No problem connecting too my router. Installed and formatted a128gb class 10 SD card with no problems. The picture quality is excellent and with the monitor being very portable, can use it in any room in the house. A very good security camera system at a great price. Very clear video with the night vision. You can have up too four cameras connected to the monitor at all times. I only have two at the moment but plan on getting two more very soon.

description: Size:4 Cameras The PhoenixM2 is the perfect outdoor or indoor security sytem to monitor your house, office, or business‚Äîno contracts or monthly fees required. Securing what you care about should never be a hassle. Our home & business security system is simple to install, easy to use, and they don't require an app. You won‚Äôt even need professional installation. Simply plug in up to 4 cameras within 450 ft. of the monitor to send uninterrupted footage straight to the Phoenix‚Äôs private network using our exclusive GigaXtreme wireless technology. This camera is built to be durable, rust-resistant, and tamper-resistant. It can handle everything from dust and dirt to subzero temperatures. Long-range, infrared night vision ensures that you get high-quality footage in the dark up to 40' away.PIR motion sensors in the camera notify you of any movement. See a visitor? Talk to them through the 2-way audio. This camera is equipped with both recording options. You can even set your cameras on a schedule. Save footage with an included 16GB SD card, located inside the PhoenixM2 without a subscription, contract, or sneaky fees. If you need more storage, simply upgrade the SD card (up to 128GB). Our SecureGuard encryption ensures that your footage remains for your eyes only‚Äîat no extra cost to you. Give yourself and your family some peace of mind by staying safe and informed with Defender cameras.

name: Defender PHOENIXM2 Plug-In Power Security Cameras- for Home & Business Surveillance Indoor & Outdoor Bullet Cameras with 7 Inch LCD Display Monitor No Wi-Fi Needed Free 16 GB SD Card Included (4 Pack)
review_header_2: Great deal, quality and ease of hookup.
review_header_3: Defender Phoenix M2 is a GREAT buy for the money.
review_header_5: Everything I wanted in a stand-alone home security camera system
review_text_1: One of the easiest security camera systems I've ever used. I like that it's a stand alone system so no complicated connecting to the internet. I put in a 32 GB SD card and it gives my tons of recording time when set on motion detection. I got video the first day of some random old lady milling around on my porch. The video is clear with great sound. The monitor settings are fairly easy to navigate through and set up was a breeze. I ordered a 3rd camera to add on. I highly recommend this system for anyone looking for a stand alone system. Defender is really good about answering any questions you have. I have a wired Defender DVR system at my business that works flawlessly. They are a great company with quality products.Update****I am still very happy with this system. I have caught high school kids lingering on my porch waiting for the bus despite me putting out a note saying to stay off. I was able to catch them in the act and tell them to leave. I have video proof in case anyone tries to say otherwise. I like how clear the video and sound recordings are. It will give me the evidence I need if I have to continue to chase these ill mannered idiots off my property. I would LOVE to show it to all their parents so they can see how they lack in the parenting department.UPDATE**** Still working great. I have a 2 story 3200 sq ft house and there has been no issues with the monitor connection to the cameras which 2 are outside and 1 inside. I am ordering a 4th camera to place on my back porch. The intercom makes it nice as long as I am near the monitor. I can talk to whoever is with in ear shot of the camera. Gives me piece of mind that if something were to happen I will have video and sound footage. I use a 32g sd card and I can get well over a weeks worth of footage with the motion detection set. The camera in my house picks up a lot of movement but the card holds plenty of memory. I have it set to override once full. I don't bother to check it unless we notice something unusual has happens. Then I just pop the card into my laptop and save the video. Came in handy when a stray cat jumped on my back to attack my parrot. My husband didn't believe me until I played the footage back.
review_text_2: We had a similar system from Lorex which has served us well for almost 10 years but something happened to the monitor so we bought this system. The cameras are very nice and feel like a quality camera and I believe made out of aluminum. This is plug and play so no pairing required. The picture quality is very nice and clear. It also has a zoom button and two way audio which is a nice feature to have. Some similar units have only one way audio. This cannot be used over the internet if that's what you want. I have one of the cameras on my workshop which is about a 120' from my house and see no connectivity issues or picture quality issues. This is a very nice home security system that requires no skill level to hook up. If you can open the box you can hook it up.
review_text_3: I bought my Defender Phoenix M2 on a whim, only because it did not require WIFI. It came with 2 cameras. I could not believe how easy it was to install. The hardest part for me was finding the right camera angles. The features are unbelievable. It even has a zoom feature. The color is great and the night vision is fantastic. I have another system that I paid over $700 for and the night vision is only half as good as the Defender. The best feature is the two way intercom system. The volume could be louder, but for what your getting for the price, you can't complain. This system is great if your on your sofa and someone rings your doorbell. You can simply talk to them over the intercom. I'm actually thinking if buying another one for my daughters house. I rate this system a 10 out of 10. You should probably have some handy man skills running the power wires, but that's it. No hard wiring. A/V or Ether etc cables, no hassles trying to sync it to your internet, like my expensive system which took me 2 days!! If you want an inexpensive great wireless system with tons of great features that won't slow down your internet speed, then this is the one for you. I have added a side by side daytime screen picture and 2 single full screen night vision pictures.
review_text_4: I've had this security system for about 4 months now. I usually wait before reviewing. This system is excellent. The people who complain about it either don't know how to use it or they can't be pleased. The signal is very good. We have two cameras. One is in the balcony and the other is in the front patio. At first, I would review the monitor every day but now I don't bother. The picture quality is very good but just keep in mind it is not HD. The SD card that came with it is sufficient because it just overwrites one the card is full. This is not a wifi system which is fine with me because I don't use Wifi. I'm happy with it being a self contained unit.UPDATE: I've had this camera 4 years now and it's still great. The customer service was also very good. One of the cameras stopped working and the manufacturer replaced it during the warranty period. Also the AC adapter to the other one broke and they replaced that too. That was all about 3 years ago during the warranty period. If these break, I'll get a truly HD system but for the price these have been excellent.
review_text_5: I have been using the Defender system for around 6 months and I am totally satisfied with the product. It has functioned right out of the box - literally plug-and-play and continues to function flawlessly. It comes with 2 cameras, which is all I needed, but you can expand it with 2 more cameras purchased separately.I literally spent days researching all security camera offerings on Amazon and other online shopping vendors. Almost all of the offerings were for security cameras which relied on the "cloud" to store the recordings and a cell phone app to access them. Most also required a monthly service fee of one kind or another to get at your own recordings.I checked into fake security cameras - no wiring needed - I recommend that no one go that route - pointless - crooks can tell the difference.The Defender met all of my requirements: camera communicated via WIFI to a standalone mini computer - all the cameras need is a power source. I simply drilled a small hole through a wall and plugged in the power cord. The power cord has 2 sections so that you do not have to drill a hole as large as the wall plug. I use a simple appliance surge protector for each camera and the mini computer. The cameras are weather resistant - not water proof - they have not been affected by rain or snow as the roof eaves give partial protection - I may add a simple aluminum shield at a later date.The cameras have both day and night infrared optics. The cameras have a motion sensor with a wider range than the camera so that it starts recording even before the moving target enters the camera range. The mini computer analyzes the pixels and will begin recording if there is enough pixel changes to activate a motion hit - you can control the sensitivity. On the highest sensitivity, it will pick up bushes moving in a light breeze. The sensitivity settings are camera specific. They pick up small animals moving in the yard and the images are clear and crisp.The cameras also have a mic to pic up sound - so you can hear any conversation trespasser has. You also have an option to speak to someone outside via a speaker built into the camera.It comes with a SD memory card that is totally adequate but I ordered an additional memory card in case I had to turn over one to the police for evidence. If you use the continuous recording option, you might want to consider getting a larger SD memory card. I review any recordings daily and delete them if they show nothing worth keeping. The SD card holds 8GB or 700 minutes.The WIFI is good for 150 feet and was unaffected by walls, floors and ceilings. I was able to locate the mini computer anywhere in my 3 story with basement 5,000 sq ft house.You can record based on motion detection, scheduled recording periods, constant recording (it overwrites oldest recordings automatically - option), or on demand (press a REC button). You can control how long it will record from 15 seconds to 1 min for the motion detection recording. You can schedule each camera separately with selections by day (Monday), date (1-5th) and time ranges.You can individually turn cameras on and off, adjust brightness and adjust resolution. You can monitor cameras individually, with split screen or by rotation. You also have a SLEEP mode which will turn on the display only if it goes into recording mode.The recordings file screen appears as a calendar with days with recordings marked in blue - you can filter the calendar by all cameras or just one and search prior months. When you pick a day, all recordings for that day appear in a list for you to select and view and/or delete.This system is extremely well designed with all the features anyone could want and they are easy to understand and use.

review_header_5: Great night vision, and they look good
review_text_1: I was hesitating buying cameras because I hated the idea of connecting all kinds of wires and going through attic and all sorts of troubles waiting , but these wireless cameras ? Oh man! I was extremely happy with them! You literally just have to plug it into a power source and boom you have yourself a security system! Best camera system you can get! And On top of that their customer service is exceptional! They are quick to respond on any questions I had!**HELPFUL TIPS **You want to put your DVR as close to the middle of the all the cameras as you can get it since it‚Äôs wireless the longer it is the less signal you might get (they have an extra long range antenna included if needed )Also like any night vision cameras make sure there is no light source pointing at cameras (there is image I included to show you night vision won‚Äôt work that good if there is light source pointing at it)The higher internet speed you hav the better signal you have!If this review helped you like it so others can see thanks! üòâ
review_text_2: I've read a lot of bad reviews about this little system. Probably most of them were from folks who might not have properly set theirs up. As for me, it worked perfectly right out of the box. Nice, sharp images, both day and night. For the price of this unit, there's no complaints here. I opted for one with no HDD so I could install my own. From past experience I've learned that shipping items with a hard drive might be damaged from rough treatment along the way. I installed a 1TB SSD and it worked beautifully. Added an additional 4 cameras also. Packaging was outstanding. It was all packed as a new computer would be. Very strong and tight. I would purchase again and this seller goes high on my list.
review_text_3: Installation was simple. The DVR detected all cameras with no issues. The WiFi signal level wasn't all that impressive, but I did not experience any 'drop off' of cameras as seen in some other reviews. I may have to add an antenna extender to the furthest camera, but that doen't concern me that much. One feature that really stood was how easy it was to connect to a cell phone or other mobile device. Simply install the ZOSI Smart Viewer on your device, then scan the QR code on the DVR. That's it! No mucking around with port or NAT settings. No drops of ports or forwarding issues. It automatically does all of the work for you! Very pleased with the product.
review_text_5: Works like a charm, not a simple install if that's what your looking for. I used to install cable, so wasn't bad for me. Took me about 3 hours to mount, and run the cables. Word of advice...test it all before you install lol.

name: ZOSI 1080P Security Camera System with 1TB Hard Drive H.265+ 8CH 5MP Lite HD-TVI Video DVR Recorder with 4X HD 1920TVL 1080P Indoor Outdoor Weatherproof CCTV Cameras ,Motion Alert,Remote Access
review_header_1: Great, Cheap CCTV System. Still don't know if they sell footage to China
review_header_2: Protect what you have worked hard for!
review_header_3: Don't be afraid of the price point! Quality product
review_text_1: I am highly privacy driven both in public and in cyberspace. The system works great. The interface is pretty easy to use. Great 1080p picture. Great night vision. I went with hardwired cameras due to their lack of vulnerability to cyber threats. However, the DVR does have an ethernet connection and there is an app you can use to monitor the system. I will continue exploring the cyber vulnerabilities of this system to ensure it does not sell info or footage to a third party. The only gripe I have is that the motion detection is pretty touchy, even at the lowest sensitivity level. One bug flying in front of it and I'll get a notice. I also noticed that if a car drives fast enough in front of my residence, I still get a motion detection notice even though I have removed that area from my camera's detection grid. For the money, I can't complain. Better than paying ADT $40/month to tell me my dog tripped the alarm. Be prepared for a hard day in the attic or crawl space to install, that's the price you pay for hardwired systems.
review_text_2: Our peaceful safe neighborhood has recently become a target for crime. Houses and cars have been broken into almost daily. So we decided to purchase a security system before we were hit. This was our 1st ever security camera purchase. I did not know anything about how to pick one so I did a lot of research and eventually decided on this one. We got the 8camera and 500gb hard drive.It arrived fast and great packaging.Hookup was a bit challenging and time consuming (maybe because this was our 1st) but took a while to get the cords ran. So patience is a plus for all brands I would assume not just this one. But soon that time consuming part was worth it. The picture is crystal clear even in pitch dark. We. Couldn't believe how good it was in night vision. Daytime is just as clear. We have it hooked up to a computer screen that was not being used and its perfect. We have recommended it to everyone . great system, crystal clear pictures and good customer service.Luckily,we have not caught anyone trying to break in our stuff that we have worked hard for many years to get. But if we do we will be ready.Although we have not caught burglars we have caught wildlife on camera. We live in the country/woods type of area and have seen our daily visit from our neighborhood bear as well as raccoon and opposums. I am attaching a pic of the night vision and one of our bear sightings. We only have up 5 of the cameras right now. The pictures are pictures of the screen with my phone but still pretty good quality.
review_text_3: Better than expected! Received it on 5-17-17 hooked it up and the clarity is more than I need. Also love the night vision , also very clear. Was Leary because of the price point but after reading a majority of the feed back I purchased it. Glad I did!
review_text_4: Absolutely worth the money. I‚Äôve had a different swann system and that hard drive fried after one singular storm... this system has gone through several power surges, storms, and a tornado. It‚Äôs still kicking. I was able to use those 4 swann cameras with this device for a total of 8, just waiting to find the perfect spot for the last camera. It‚Äôs perfect. Easy to set up and use. The app was also easy to set up. Downside is that every time the internet or power goes out you have to reconnect the system to the app, but it is what it is. Not a big deal. I did give the night vision a 4 star because I wish it was just a tad bit clearer. The app has a feature that you can take screen shots and videos of recordings. You can go back almost two weeks. The zoom is incredible. Overall, I‚Äôd recommend this to everyone.
review_text_5: I recently got this set-up after attempting a cheaper IP wireless camera. For my needs, the IP camera was a wash and difficult to set up and use. I decided to bite the bullet and spend a little more for this system. I do not regret it one bit! The set up is relatively easy, although wires are almost always a pain. After testing the system, I installed 3 of the 4 cameras. The included cables are more than generous in length. Although the cameras are waterproof, the connections are not, so for the one camera that isn't under the roof line, I did have to get some marine quality heat shrink wrap and a heat gun. All in all, once installed, the system is a breeze to set up. As it has a built in hard drive, it's so much easier than getting a cheaper system that requires an additional hard drive. I like that I can see, playback, and even record segments from my phone. In addition, the included DVR is easy to use and maneuver through. This is the 1st security system I ever installed, and I now feel like an expert after doing this myself. I would absolutely recommend this system, and I've actually already convinced a few neighbors to get the same system. I have a feeling I will be helping a few neighbors with their installations, now.
