name: Cobra Smart Dash Cam + Rear Cam (SC 200D) ‚Äì QHD+ 1600P Resolution, Voice Commands, Built-in WiFi & GPS, 16GB SD Card, 3" Display, Shared Alerts, Incident Reports, Emergency MayDay, Drive Smarter App
review_header_1: Amazing value - this one is a keeper
review_header_2: Unboxing Cobra SC 201 & First Use Reaction
review_header_4: A great camera that can connect with your phone
review_text_1: Full disclosure: I am a first-time dash camera owner. That said, I am a tech professional and did a ton of research before deciding that this model was the best value for me. Just got the dash camera delivered this past week, and it did not disappoint.Its got amazing video quality, and I found it very easy to setup. Lots of settings I have not played with yet, but it seemed to work well out of the box. The larger display size is nice - particularly because I have it monitoring my rear camera.A few things to note: I found that the "Quick Start Guide" on Cobra's website has a lot more useful information than the printed version in my box. And the Voice Commands feature is really really cool; worked very well for me - I use "Take photo" and "Lock Video" a lot! Finally, there are two free apps that work with this camera, Cobra iRadar and Drive Smarter. I have been using the second one a lot more - and found it to be nifty. Made it easy to connect my iPhone with the dashcam, and update the camera's firmware. I've been using it to share videos - so convenient to not have to remove the camera from my vehicle or pop out the SD card.All in all - "Two thumbs up" for me!
review_text_2: Finding the right dash camera with all the selection out there today can be daunting so I'll tell you our experience and why we chose the SC 201 from Cobra. I also added some unboxing images bc that's important to me. Shape/Size, video quality, forward facing and in cab facing, and brand recognition were key factors when making our decision. There are all sorts of shapes and sizes out there now. A small sleek profile that doesn't block visibility was step one. Next we wanted HD/clear video quality 1080P bc what's the use if you can't make anything out clearly if and when we ever wanted to share for fun or when we actually needed it. We have young kids and if you do, you know the best things that ever come out of their mouths are in the car.. When else are we all in one place together without electronic distraction and have time for conversation... Lastly, we couldn't pronounce half the brands out there let alone trust the ones we could and have never heard of. My husband has had Cobra CB's in his trucks over the years and has their marine radios on our boat. Never had issues so we started and ultimately ended here because they have been around for ever and no reason why they wont be for a ling time. Also we found they have every applicable type or use case dash cam you could want.Product itself came with everything we needed including the SD card. We are happy with the size (I'll update with the mounting location in our truck later) and the mounting bracket provides flexibility and is small when you don't have the camera mounted. First couple trips around town and really pleased (actually surprised) on the quality of the video. Has already provided mediation in a dispute, which I won, and for the record after reviewing the tape HE was supposed to defrost the fish for dinner that night.. :)
review_text_3: I have been looking for a dashcam for a few weeks. I wanted something easy to use and set up with just some basic features. This dashcam goes above and beyond. It has front and rear video and both have fantastic picture quality in day or night driving. The front dashcam is a great size, takes up minimal windshield space, and the HD video display covers the entire backside of the unit for maximum screen size with no wasted space. The rear dash cam is the same with a small size dashcam so it's not in the way when I look out my rearview mirror. Rear cam picture is also HD Video and displays on the fronts screen if you want or change the setting for no display. Here is where this dashcam goes above and beyond, it has a built-in Forward Collision warning system and Lane Departure Warning. It's like upgrading my car! This dashcam has alerts for red light cameras and road hazards. I downloaded the app and didn't even need to call customer service to help, simple to set up and understand. Great price and I am thrilled.
review_text_4: This camera is a replacement of a old camera of a different brand. I really like that you can see the symbols on the screen to let you know what the buttons are for. It's easy to set up with your phone and you can change the settings on the camera or on your phone.Both came with a adhesive stick on mount which I don't know how long that would last. I used the stick on mount for the rear camera and I bought a mount for my rear view mirror that can swivel. My old camera had a suction mount that would fall off about every month and the camera thought it was in a crash and stop recording. This camera has a separate file for events like this. I also like that you can remove the camera easily because of the magnetic connection for the mount. My wife hit it with her hand the other day reaching for something on the dash and it did not fall, all I had to do was readjust the camera mount that is on a swivel mount. I have not used the talk to camera option yet, but I don't use that option on my phone either.The camera quality is great and it has a little weight to it. The night vision is very good even on the rear camera and I have a tinted rear window. The picture quality is also great.I liked this camera enough that I bought one for my truck.I downloaded the IRadar app that works with the camera but I found out that it has a subscription that I don't really need. I guess if I traveled alot it may be worth it.
review_text_5: Worth the money I have both versions this one is really nice the old setup didn‚Äôt come with go‚Äôs built in. Plus they give you so much cable it‚Äôs sick. I put this in the new body style impala very nice and the app works great.I would say it‚Äôs worth it‚Äôs money easy.

review_header_1: Great Picture Quality. Safe With Encrypted Channels
review_header_5: Easy setup and great video quality! Simple App!
review_text_1: I am so happy I found this product! I was skeptical about cameras connecting to my home due to hearing of problems relating to other brands and hackers. This camera connects to a safe and encrypted server every time you log in to view your cameras so I am always able to feel at ease! These cameras are wonderful and the price you are paying makes them even BETTER! They have great quality and set up takes no longer than 5 minutes! Upon receiving the cameras (in a timely manner I might add) they were nicely packaged with an instruction manual that made set up easy and quick. The longest set up time was finding where I was going to put them! The adhesive 3m tape worked great as I stuck it to the side of a wall and I haven‚Äôt had any problems. The app is the third one down in the App Store (I have pictured the correct one for reference). As you can see in the live shot I included the image is clear and the two way sound works wonderful. I love being able to check in on my dogs all day when at work and being able to speak to them through the camera makes things ten times better! Definitely recommend this product!
review_text_2: Pros: the picture quality on these is wonderful. I can see everything so clearly, even with the night vision. The microphone works well too. It‚Äôs 2-way. The instructions were simple and very clear. I love that this comes with both the micro SD card option and the cloud upload option for recordings.Cons: completely user/reader error... I didn‚Äôt read the product description very carefully and thought these were outdoor cameras. They are not. I also thought that ‚Äúwireless‚Äù meant cordless. Not the case. These have to be plugged in to work. Both were not a deal breaker. I found a great use for them indoors and they were easy to install with the plug attached.If you are looking for an inexpensive way to feel secure, check in on animals or have a baby monitor, these are definitely the way to go.
review_text_3: If you're looking for something super simple and affordable for piece of mind this is it. I'm honestly impressed with the image quality for the price. Night vision is pretty amazing. Picture shown of my room is dark but not pitch black, outside pic is pitch black. Alerts work well, annoyingly well, but you can adjust sensitivity or set a schedule etc. Love the fact it comes with two 32gb memory cards so you're ready to go out of the box. Set up was very simple. Literally download the app, plug in camera, pick up camera and scan a barcode that pops up on your phone to sync and you are viewing live. Playback is my only gripe because just the smallest slide will fast forward or rewind by a few minutes. Hard to pin point exact times, not impossible. Might be better to have it just record on movement detection but i just keep it on full time. Speakers work very well, can talk to my dog while he's on my bed. This was a deal breaker lmao. You can also hear from the mic in the camera so you can use as a baby monitor or hear your wife's boyfriend. I know these are indoor but I put one against a window and it worked perfect for daytime but at night there was nothing but glare from the ir light. I just decided to say screw it and mount it outside under the car-port where things don't really get weather damaged. Seems absolutely fine this morning: no dew in the lens or anything and I added pics just to show. Will update review if I totally screwed up but with the price I doubt I'll get too mad either way.Edit: about a week outside under the carport and no noticeable difference or damage whatsoever. Working perfect.. Would not put it somewhere it can get rained on for sure. Will update again after a whileNew pic added at midnight still going strong outside. Keep both cameras on event recording and playback is sooo much better.5 month update! New picture added with timestamp for proof. Outside camera still going strong. Noticed recently it was going offline occasionally and figured out it was the power cord going bad from the weight of the extension cord pulling down on it. Micro usb are used for everything so really not an issue, most people have a thousand of them these days. Bedroom camera still great because theres no pressure on that cord.. Other than that literally no problems other than the occasional alert from curious critters :)
review_text_4: I own 2 Wyze cams and several eufy cams and I like them both but the quality picture on these cameras tops them both. The pictures on these cameras top the Wyze cams and match or maybe exceed the Eufy for quality. Ery pleasantly surprised these cameras.Highly recommend.
review_text_5: These are great cameras for the money, the setup was super simple, and the app is easy to use and doesn‚Äôt glitch out or anything. I was actually shocked at the video quality it‚Äôs really sharp, I can read the letters of my license plate of my car in my driveway.

review_header_2: If you‚Äôre reading this just by you will not regret it.
review_header_3: I finally found a security camera with minimum false alarms!
review_text_1: I was looking forward to buying this Outdoor camera and just let me tell you, it is worth the wait. I've purchased two Snowman indoor cameras and I was counting the days for the release of this new Outdoor model.It works two-way sound which I can talk to the camera through my smartphone, and the sound quality is great. Also, just press the siren icon button on the phone and the Siren and Flashing Alarm audio will go on just enough to keep any intruders away.It has a grate panoramic view. However, it does not have Pan and Tilt rotation but the wide view is excellent. Highly Recommend!
review_text_2: I love this camera system but this outdoor camera is perfect. Just what you need if your reading this review just buy it you will not regret it.I thought the sound & Motion detection alerts were nice and what I needed. But this camera has facial recognition and can be set just to alert you if it sees a person face. See you‚Äôre not being bothered with every animal walking across your lawn.
review_text_3: I‚Äôve tried several security cameras and found Blurams the best, because:> Almost no false alarms> Great night vision, excellent motion detection, superb picture quality> Very sturdy camera, easy installation (5 minutes)> Very sleek APP design ‚Äì very intuitive to use> Prompt customer supportÔÉ∞ I could not use the facial recognition function because it requires cloud services. I should have known that since the camera does not have on-board microprocessor, the facial recognition must be processed on the server side which why they use the cloud services. However, they should have explained this in the product description.ÔÉ∞ The alarm duration is short and cannot be expanded unless you sign up for cloud.I would have given 5 starts if they would have explained that some of the functionalities require cloud sign up.
review_text_4: I am SO glad I got these! I bought 4 of them to put around my house. It sends accurate and precise notifications to my phone. The picture quality is good and the sound quality is good. I love that I can hear clearly, they can hear me on the other end clearly, and the alarm is louder than I expected. Really easy to set up and install. I am extremely happy with this purchase.
review_text_5: This security camera is the simplest that I ever had to set up and operate. I received the package two weeks ago, I figured I can plug the main unit in and then install the cameras the next day. The configuration of the device did not take more than 10 minutes before I was able to view the live stream on my phone and the default settings worked great so I did not have to tweak them other than letting the cameras send me notifications on my phone.

review_header_1: Can‚Äôt be more please with this system... Amazing customer service....
review_header_3: You get product that worth more than its price w awesome customer service
review_text_1: So I wanted to put up some security cameras just for some added protection. I went with this system because it came with 2 1080p cameras and a 1080n dvr with a 1tb hard drive. Overall the system works great. Awesome picture quality in the day and great picture at night. I want to say it was easy to install but there is always going to be an issue with finding a place to make a hole to run the cable. After it was all set up I turned it on. Out of the box the picture quality was just Ok. Only a few issues with picture being to bright or fuzzy. I then went through the menus and found all kinds of setting to mess with. After a few days and nights of adjusting and a lot of online reading I was able to get the quality up to 1080p standards. The only complaint I would have is that is doesn‚Äôt come with a book telling you what all the settings do. And even today. There are a few I still can‚Äôt figure out. I have it set up to continually record and I am not using any online streaming programs or the motion detection. I just recently bought 2 more cameras to add to the system. Overall I am really happy with it. Can‚Äôt beat the price anywhere.There were some reviews that I read before I bought it that made me think it‚Äôs not any good but I still went with it. People complaining about it rebooting all the time just never found the setting to disable auto reboot maintenance. You can also back up important videos with a flash drive, you don‚Äôt need the internet plugged in at all. You can also update via the usb with a flash drive. And if you do buy this system or any other system, don‚Äôt forget that you need to regularly clean the cameras lens to keep your picture quality good. I clean min about twice a month unless we get a lot of rainfall and or dusty windy weeks. I have already recommended this system to two of my friends.After about a month I started having issues with the dvr. The hard drive started showing errors and wasn‚Äôt recording. The playback was freezing and everything was running sluggish. I got ahold of Hiseeu and got helped right away. They said my dvr probably had a defected board. They quickly sent out another dvr and even gave me a free upgrade to 8ch dvr. The hard drive got formatted on my pc and I put it right in. Works so well I think I will have to order a few more cameras. Hiseeu‚Äôs customer service was amazing. Talked to them about my issues on Thursday and I had my replacement on Saturday.
review_text_2: Initially I wasn't expecting very much from this product based on the price.However, after using it for a while I found this product to be of excellent quality. It met and exceeded my expectations and had many features and abilities. I was not expecting.I had it for a short while and then I experienced a problem with the hard drive. I contacted the vendor and they responded with courtesy and in a very timely manner. They sent me a new hard drive and installed and have been using and enjoying this product very much. It is a very good product for the money. Based on my experience with this vendor I would have to say that it is a very high quality company. I think you should know that.
review_text_3: i love how the performance of this product exceeded beyond my highest expectstions. it is as said in the description your get more value fir your money. And not only thwt you will get too of the line customer service stress free no bs customer service and its stress freee they will replace defective item guaranteed .
review_text_4: This system is awesome! No, its not the top of the line, but for your money, you are getting a great value because this system is comparable to the best. No, its not 1080P, but the description states 1080N. Still, a very crisp video. Bottom line, I know I got a great DVR and cameras for my money. Oh, did I mention their fantastic customer care and service? They contacted me and wanted to make sure I was pleased with my purchase.
review_text_5: I found it easy to set up and install. There was a video i mean a lot of videos explaining how to install if you have any doubt on what to do. Many options and sensitivity settings for up to 8 cameras. Night visions works great also. Wires were long enough to hide from front of house to back where my cable tv enters the house. The other 3 cameras were closer so i didn't need to purchase the 100ft extension. I had to make the hole bigger of course since the connectors were pretty large ( my only complaint ). Only took a few couple hours to install since i took my time hiding the wires and attaching the cameras. It helps to have a staple gun for holiday lights for the wires. The app you can download to view the cameras on my phone works a lot better than i expected.

review_text_1: I have not owned these cameras for very long but so far, they have been functioning very well. The picture quality is great, but you do lose some details when you zoom in. The microphone feature is nice to have, and the vocal clarity is great. I am currently trying a new location for one of the cameras, as I have decided to face it out the front window, but I can remotely move the field of vision back inside the house if desired.
review_text_2: I love these cameras! I have two of them in my house and would love to get a couple more! Some of the things I love about this camera are: (1) the ability to select which portion of an image (see photo) I want to receive notifications on, (2) the ability to save a preset view so that if I move it around, I can click the preset and go back to where I want it to stay, (3) the ability to talk through the camera, (4) the ability to turn off notifications for sound, and (5) NO MONTHLY SERVICE FEE! Although this one isn't made for outdoor use, I placed it inside my house looking out my front door and I'm able to spy on my packages and whenever someone approaches the house. I often use my camera to also talk to my kids when I can't get a hold of them. Ha ha! All in all, a GREAT device and will DEFINITELY be buying more for our home in the future!
review_text_3: The blurams cam was recommended by many you tubers and is hands down one of the best cameras I have purchased. We have it installed upside down and use it as a baby monitor. Installation was easy and fast, and the picture quality is great during the day and night time. I just still need to figure out how the SD card storage works.
review_text_5: I wanted to be able to keep an eye on my place when I'm not around especially when I travel. I've seen different devices but this one popped up on my screen so I decided to give it a try. It was very easy to set up. Let me tell you I highly recommend this camera it has night vision and can rotate from left to right there is also a button to talk which is awesome.

review_header_2: Good enough for most use cases.
review_header_4: Perfect for watching the northern lights
review_text_1: It appears I have a landlord that likes to enter tennant apartments/duplex. My neighbor showed me pictures on her phone of the landlord and workers, (that were painting the outside) enter her place which she had not yet moved out of. I asked what she used to get these and she showed me the Wyze v2. So I jumped on line and search out her camera. I came across the v3. I did more digging to see what the difference were and the first was size. I was able to use the magnetic mount and mount it to my fish tank rack. It looks like from a distant something for my tank. It is just over 25 feet from the camera to the front door. I watch a few YT videos and it out performs the v2 and it have color night vision. I have not test this out yet, but is a dimly lit room you can see in color and clearly. You have a free trial of the CAM Plus which I think is a great addition as it will actually catch a person and classify it as such and sent a text to your phone. So winner on size, hideable and clear video and the ability to zoom in on the playback mode. I also added the memory card as a back up to the Cam Plus. Also it plugs in and you can buy a longer cord if needed and no worry about batteries dying For a piece of mind and cost for me this was a no brainer. It works well and helps reduce my stress. Should they entered now I have enough proof and sound to take them to court. Check it out if you need a piece of mind and it will help and not break the bank.
review_text_2: I'm a professional, and I've been using these things all over the place. They're cheap. They're versatile. They're uncomplicated.The cost point is substantially lower than most of their competition. You can afford to install four of these where you would be able to install a single¬†
review_text_3: I live in a condo on a second floor and the Board kept saying they would get security cameras but never did. Meanwhile, during the night, someone came into our very well lit parking lot and cut out my catalytic converter!!! Just mine (apparently Honda Elements are targets..who knew?) Anyway, I was so upset. It cost me almost $2000 to get it fixed. So I decided if the board won't get cameras...I WILL. So I bought this and it has been the BEST THING EVER! I just prop it in my window (which has a screen that cannot be removed) and it's perfect. I can have it right up against the screen and still see everything or close the window and it will still be fine through the window AND screen! I have it aimed at the parking lot. I can see the entire condo complex with this thing! Amazing! I can see everything at night! Every time there is motion, it saves a 12 second blip and I can go back and look at them or be notified of them when it happens! I haven't tried the siren feature yet. All I know is that I finally feel safe after my ordeal of being ripped off. The picture is great. People have noticed it because it has a red or blue light. Which is a good deterrent from crooks as well. Best purchase in a long time. Should have done it sooner!
review_text_5: Love this camera. It was so comforting that I had it when I went on my trip. Downside is you can only run this on a 2.4ghz frequency. And your wifi name has to be all in one word. Example: JohnDoe24 Special characters and spaces didn't do too well for me. It lost internet connection and couldn't find it. But after changing the name it connected no problem.I have Comcast, it did read my dual broadband wifi okay at first but within a month, not sure why it all of a suddenly was unable to locate my wifi. After loads of internet researching, I found i needed to separate the two broadband and rename the Wi-Fi. Afterward it connected just fine. Have not lost internet connection yet.

features: 1080P HD indoor, plug-in security camera with motion detection and two way audio that lets you monitor the inside of your home day and night.,Get alerts on your smartphone whenever motion is detected or customize motion detection zones so you can see what matters most.,Store events conveniently and securely in the cloud with a 30-day free trial of the Blink Subscription Plan or locally with the Sync Module 2 and a USB flash drive (USB sold separately).,See, hear, and speak to people and pets in your home on your smartphone with Blink Mini‚Äôs live view and two-way audio features (live view is not continuous).,Sets up in minutes ‚Äì just plug in the camera, connect it to wifi, and add it to your Blink app.,For additional ease of use, pair Blink Mini with a supported Alexa-enabled device to engage live view, and arm and disarm your camera, and more using just your voice.
name: Blink Mini ‚Äì Compact indoor plug-in smart security camera, 1080 HD video, night vision, motion detection, two-way audio, Works with Alexa ‚Äì 1 camera
review_header_1: Easy set up but app is lacking
review_header_2: Easy to install only took 5 min!
review_header_4: Easy set up and great image quality
review_text_1: I‚Äôm a Blink XT user with three cameras on the exterior of my home. The set up of the mini was FAR EASIER than the outside cams. I had this thing set up in less than 5 minutes. Picture is good. Sound is LOUD which is what I was looking for.The app however needs some work to support this style of camera. The app works decently for the BlinkXT cameras and functionality, which is motion for most users. As in you get a notification that there is motion, it records, and you watch the recording or live as you please. but it is clunky to get into the Blink Mini for the purpose of continuous viewing which is my intention for this camera, like a baby monitor. Like many other Americans now working from home with a full house of kids, I wanted to use this to assist with keeping an eye on the kids as I worked and record those cute moments. I wanted to use this to visualize a blind spot that I can‚Äôt see from the office. I tried mounting it from the ceiling and realized you can‚Äôt rotate the video. Mounting on the wall was a little problematic, I couldn‚Äôt quite get the right angle needed.Another quirk to the app is if you switch to another app and then come back to the Blink app, you have to hit the play button to resume viewing.All in all, these are minor issues specific to my use of the camera which is why I have it five stars anyway.Hey amazon/Blink, it would be an awesome feature if you‚Äôd allow the integration of this camera with Alexa so we can ‚Äúdrop in‚Äù and talk through the Echo Dot. Just saying.
review_text_2: I love this lil camera!! Easy to install! Only took 5 min and it works great!! Highly recommend this!!
review_text_3: Great price and product. Connected very easily to my existing Blink system. I am not happy with having to pay for storage after trial ends.
review_text_4: This is a great little camera monitor. Pros: easy set up, easily managed with your smart phone, clear image quality with motion detection. Can be set up to arm and record at any time. I bought this to use in my master bedroom by my desk where I keep sensitive information.Cons: if you are using it with another Blink product and you arm 24/7 then the other Blink unit also needs to be armed which is an issue because my other unit uses 2 AA batteries. There is no timer on the app to set up a time to arm which would by useful because I sometimes forget to arm at night. It has good night vision quality. It needs to be plugged in so is a problem if you put it in a place (i.e. bedroom closet) if there is no outlet. Because of this, it is difficult to make the camera more hidden (if you are looking for a nanny camera for example).Overall it is easy to use and I would recommend it for a basic home security camera.
review_text_5: SO...I rarely write reviews but was so amazed by this camera I wanted to let others know. I bought the camera after using the Ring indoor camera for twice the price and it made a constant clicking noise with the filter adjustment to light in the room that was a known issue Ring told me and not a defect. I've tried all the other brands out there WYZE, etc and disappointed with all. Then I tried the Blink Mini which I thought was a good price. The setup was a breeze, up and running in 30 seconds. The app is responsive and user friendly. My wifi is sloooow but it still loaded a 1080p HD quality view w hen I accessed it from my mobile app. My favorite feature is the night vision. All my previous cameras just showed a dark room or shadows but this camera shows a clear and crisp picture in pitch black darkness. Very pleased with this and you can't go wrong here. My 2 year indoor camera journey has come to an end here.

description: Style:Wyze Cam Pan Product Description Say goodbye to losing sight when something moves outside the view of your camera. With its 110¬∞/sec rotation speed, 360¬∞ horizontal range, and 93¬∞ vertical range, Wyze Cam Pan delivers 360¬∞ coverage in under 3 seconds so you can see exactly what you want to see, when you want to see it. Operation Temperature:32‚Ñâ ‚Äì 104‚Ñâ / 0¬∞C ‚Äì 40 ¬∞C. From the Manufacturer 360¬∞ coverage Wyze Cam Pan gives you 360-degree coverage in under 3 seconds. Life moves fast. Your camera should too. Works with Alexa Wyze Cam Pan works with Alexa. Control Wyze Cam Pan with your voice by saying, "Alexa, show me the Living Room" to view a live stream from your camera. Clarity Day or Night With 6 infrared LEDs, Wyze Cam Pan‚Äôs enhanced night vision distinguishes 18 steps of gray and provides clear images up to 30 feet away. Pan Scan Patrol your room with Pan Scan. Set the camera‚Äôs patrol route with up to 4 custom waypoints. 2-Way Audio Listen and talk to anyone you care about while not at home. Unique mic design minimizes motor sounds while providing high quality audio. A Class-K audio power amplifier enables high speaker volume. MicroSD Card Storage Wyze Cam Pan supports local storage of recordings to a microSD card (sold separately). Play back videos with your Wyze app to solve life‚Äôs mysteries. About the Startup Describe your product in 3 words.Tech for all!How did you come up with the idea for this product?Wyze Labs was created with the mission of making high quality, easy-to-use, affordable smart home technology accessible to everyone. We believe big things come in small packages ‚Äì that‚Äôs why we created an affordable, easy-to-use smart home camera that can help you solve life‚Äôs mysteries, big and small. So you can be everywhere. And watch everything.What makes your product special?In creating the Wyze Cam we focused on 3 things: quality, affordability and design. We partnered with our user community to create a camera that is useful, easy-to-use and affordable. It has the features users want, in an elegant, simple design.What has been the best part of your startup experience?Working directly with our user community to create a product we all love. We‚Äôre not just selling a camera ‚Äì we‚Äôre creating a new way for our user community to participate in the product development journey, from vision to testing to launch. And this is just the beginning. We can‚Äôt wait for you to join us!

review_header_1: Amazing picture, features, ease of use at this low price! How does it stack up against Nest?
review_header_2: SO much functionality for 30 bucks! WOW.
review_header_3: You can view anywhere from your phone. No temperature detection
review_text_2: I'm a bit of a camera addict. I have hardwired (fixed) cameras that are hooked up to a DVR, and I have 4 Nest cams as well. But we have a lot of pets, and I wanted to have some PTZ cams to be able to look around and check on them when we are away. I heard several tech podcasts (TWiT, Stacey on IoT) ranting and raving over this Wyze cam, so I took the plunge on one. WOW, how amazing to get all this, for $30 (plus shipping)! The image is super-clear, and I LOVE the ability to scan around a room via my phone. I even installed the Wyze app onto my Pixelbook, and when I enlarge the image on my big screen, it looks incredible. I have only had the camera hooked up for a day, and I am still learning the ropes, but I am SO pleased, I am going to order another two, if not three cameras right away!The motion detection feature is pretty slick. I set up the camera in our spare bedroom, where some of our cats hang out, and when Barbie came in, the camera detected her and began following her movements. She was intrigued at the noise (noticeable, but not loud, btw) of the camera whirring, turning. I have attached a screenshot I grabbed via the app, where she is examining the Wyze cam! Highly recommended.
review_text_3: After going through multiple nursery cams, I am SUPER impressed with this camera (especially for the money)! No app issues, great video quality, simple easy setup. Hands down better than the other video monitors we‚Äôve had.
review_text_4: I have tried many cameras the advantages are ease of use of use, setup, and cost. Possible disadvantages are that it works only with the Wyze app as of now. The Wyze Pan and its fixed counterpart are game changers. If you don't need a cloud Cam or an outside security cameras these cameras set the bar. They aren't the best cameras but they are incredible values are as close to zero setup as possible. Frankly floored by these things. Buy one to try the worse case is you loose less than $50 and 10 minutes to setup. If you already have another Wyze camera it will take longer to get out of the box than to get it working. Great thing for many users. I'm not throwing my other cameras away, but the other camera makers need to be paying attention.
review_text_5: There aren't many security cameras with all of the features that Wyze packs in - and NONE at this price-point. I got high capacity GB SD cards that literally save a month's worth of activity and is immediately accessible remotely. You don't really need them tho as you also get 14 days of Cloud storage free. Those photos/videos you save there can then be easily shared thru a variety of ways (text, email, print, etc). The complaints below are a combination of user errors (like not adjusting the pan/tilt speeds) and/or poor WiFi connectivity (or just a bum unit that should be replaced). My system connected flawlessly and I only have 100Mbps service in a rather large home. There is little, if any lag, and the high definition picture blows others away.While this is an indoor camera I shoot mine through internal windows for the same effect. The image shown is thru my living room window to the front door. No more wondering when you get deliveries as WYZE notifies you immediately and saves the clip in a notification email to you. You simply can't buy peace of mind for under $40 - unless of course you get this camera.

review_text_1: This little camera is excellent for the price I paid for it. I have tried other small cameras with no success. This, however, is a breeze to install and operate from the App. We ordered it to observe our dog while we are gone. One drawback: No SD card slot therefore, no local storage. Owner must buy unlimited cloud space for a reasonableprice.
review_text_2: Definetly a great product for the price. this is my fourth camera now I have 2 ranger 2c's indoors and 2 bullet 2cs outdoors all work great. Very good cameras for home security
review_text_3: Add the camera to the app was a pain in the a** but after that everything worked smoothly! We use it for our 1 month old when we are on the porch. It detects motion and audio and send notifications! The only downside is that you can‚Äôt add one camera to 2 accounts and you can‚Äôt log in into the same account from 2 phones!
review_text_4: We just started leaving our 7month old puppy out of her crate while we are out for extended periods of time. Had a Blink camera in the living room and realized we needed one for the kitchen/dinning room. Found this and liked that it moved. The picture is better than the blink, really clear HD, and the movement makes it great to use to check up on the puppy as she sometimes sleeps in corners. The price and ease of use is great as well. Only negative is that when operating the camera movement remotely, it does make a semi loud noise (for a dog at least). She hears it move and it sets her off barking lol. But other than that, great product. Glad we got it!
review_text_5: This camera is great!!It moves to where You want it and it has a zoom. It was easy to install, it connected to my wifi thru the app. It started working immediately. It had a long cord but you'll have to add a extension cord if it doesn't reach your plug, of course! I can watch thru the app out the window and in the house. All with a simple movement of my finger. The night vision is as clear as day time vision.You can speak with occupants of the room and interact with them.If your kid or pet is doing something cute, and your not there, you can take a picture or video and look at it later on your phone tablet or computer, wherever you download the app.Only thing is, you'll have to get a subscription to be able to view your pictures or videos. Either way it's less expensive than home security system. Once you purchase your camera is yours so your only paying for the cloud per se.Over all it's better than the blink camera which doesn't have all these features.Overall, I like it!!!

review_header_1: Excellent security cameras and even Greater support
review_header_3: You will get 1TB internal HardDrive, nice night vision and easy to install.
review_text_1: Things did not start off so great at first,,, I received a 4 channel system when I ordered an 8 channel NVR system.. Contacted seller through Amazon and they immediately sent the correct item and an RMA for the wrong one. Must have used express because I rec'd it in 2 days. Then I had trouble getting system setup. I had an 8 channel system ,same brand, that I was wanting to upgrade so knew a bit about setup. This was supposed to be easier, just plug and play. But it was only loading some cameras and then losing connection and I could not get all 6 cameras to function properly. I contacted seller again late on a Saturday night and informed them I thought NVR was faulty. That began a series of 15 to 20 emails and replies over the next 2 1/2 days working on system.. support saying he thought it was interference because he could access the NVR and it looked good...I still believed it to be NVR as I could NEVER get all 6 cameras on. Finally I got up in middle of night Monday night and tried one more time before I was going to demand refund... In the dark I discovered that as odd as it sounds 2 of the 6 power adapters were defective( at least 1 of those was an old one of mine) This wasn't readily evident because I had 2 good ones in computer room and when I got camera connected to NVR I moved the camera to other areas where th bad adaptesr were and never used same ones so didnt catch the fault. and support wasnt aware that I was connecting cameras to a different adapter when camera went supposed off line... after fixing that issue all was good and I now have all 6 cameras running and doing GREAT. Support was helpful and patient and always answered email within an hour os so... was very impressed with interaction with the support personnel... and am very pleased with this Xmarto system. I've used Xmarto for at least 8 or 9 years and they are always dependable and have good quality pictures. The night vision cameras have worked for years now without loosing quality. The first system I had 10-12 years ago cost twice as much and the night vision cameras had to be replaced every 2-3 years as they deteriorated that badly.
review_text_2: I bought my original XMarto system for a friend many years ago, at the same time I bought a system for my own property security, both systems are still working perfectly with no deuteriation whatsoever, and very little maintenance and trouble free..I recently bought a new 8 channel system as there systems have gone ahead in leap's and bounds in every respect, and I wanted to add PTZ. I removed my old system and installed the new system and right out of the box everything worked perfectly, new system only came with 4 cameras so I used 4 of my old cameras, same thing, joined the new system no problem.There old software apps were a bit dicky, but it seems that all the bugs are out as the new apps are working perfectly.The images on my monitor, television and my phone are outstanding and the security aspect is excellent, just make sure you use a very strong password.
review_text_3: Recently my family member purchased a house and needed a surveillance camera system to be installed on doors and garage. Private installation companies were too expensive, so decided to set up a DIY system. Found this camera within the budget and it was mentioned that easy to install. The package was on time and well package. Although I need to run to a hardware store to get some accessories so that I can set up an efficient system, the power cables were short so needed some extension setup. No WIFI or anything required, easily download the app and customize the settings. Great buy for a home.
review_text_4: This is a fantastic security system. It was indeed very easy to install and very user-friendly to set up. The quality of the images is great and because it has wireless cameras you do not need to deal with the hassle of wires from NVR to the position of cameras. You only need to connect the camera to the power each one has a power adapter with a long cable. The application allows you to remotely monitor your home and in this model you can install a separate microphone with each camera to record audio too. The quality of the video is amazing and the night vision is also excellent. This is really a very good purchase: a professional system at an affordable price.
review_text_5: This is the 3rd XMARTO Security Camera System I have purchased. The cmaras are excellent and the NVR works very well. I am able to see all 3 of the systems on the same smart phone app, which is very useful.

features: Compact plug-in indoor camera that lets you see, hear and speak to people and pets from your phone, tablet, or select Echo device.,Watch over your entire home by connecting one or multiple Indoor Cams to all your Ring devices in the Ring app.,With a Ring Protect Plan (subscription sold separately), record all your videos, review what you missed for up to 60 days, and share videos and photos.,With Live View, you can check in on your home any time through the Ring app.,Easily setup your Indoor Cam by plugging into a standard outlet and connecting to Wi-Fi.,Place on a flat surface or mount to a wall with the versatile mounting bracket.,For added peace of mind, pair with Alexa to help you keep an eye on your home.
name: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
review_header_1: Small size and high quality camera
review_header_4: Excellent addition to the Ring lineup
review_header_5: Had issues but ring support was great!
review_text_2: For a while I have been using Ring cameras for the the exterior and Wyze cams for the interior on my house. With the new indoor cam I can now access all my cams from one app. To me the picture quality is great overall and especially in total darkness. Live view connection is a lot more stable than my Wyze cams. Alexa integration is a big plus, no need for third party hacks to complete routines. Because I already have Ring cameras it‚Äôs worth it to pay a little more over a Wyze cam.
review_text_3: In February, I noticed my ADHD medication ran out early. I‚Äôm very careful about taking it exactly as prescribed so it was strange that I had run out 10 days early. For reasons I won‚Äôt get into for this review, I suspected the property manager of my building was stealing it. Obviously that sounded crazy, but I couldn‚Äôt think of another explanation. A friend suggested a Ring camera, so I bought one never expecting anything to actually come of it. I put some antihistamines in my now empty pill bottle thinking no one would ever take them, set up the camera when it arrived, and felt more secure knowing it was there. Set up was simple so I figured worst case scenario, I was out a bit of money and I spent maybe 10 minutes setting it up.Fast forward a week later when I get a notification via the app that there was motion detected on my camera. I open up the recording and there she is, entering my apartment, going right for my decoy pills, taking them, and leaving. I immediately left work to get back home. I called the police who sent an officer. I showed him the video and he admitted that had I not had the video, he wouldn‚Äôt have believed me. I was able to quickly and easily send the video to the police and to the president of the company that owns my building. I also was able to download the video and get it uploaded so that I have copies of it as I go through the next few months as she (hopefully) gets brought to justice.I cannot emphasize how much this little camera has helped me. I would not have caught my burglar otherwise. Because of it, they were able to look up records of who used their electronic key to access my apartment and she had been in there 7 times over the month prior. This would have gone on for longer and who knows if it would have resulted in harm to myself or my cat had I not caught her. This camera has given some of the sense of security she stole from me back and stopped a nightmare situation from worsening. I will still be recovering from this for long time and I am hoping she is brought to justice, but I cannot thank Ring enough for helping me secure my home from an unexpected source of danger.
review_text_4: This camera for $60 is a solid deal. I have had a Ring Pro and Ring floodlight camera for about a year.This indoor camera can either be put on a surface or mounted on the wall.What's in the box?1. Ring floodlight camera2. Proprietary AC adapter3. Mounting accessories4. Manuals.The included mounting equipment is a nice touch. Although I'm not going to mount mine.1080P video is solid. Covers a wider area.The two way audio is good to check up on Pets, senior citizens,etc. The sound comes through very clear from the mobile app. Two way talk is definitely a nice addition to this camera.The footprint of this camera is small. A blue light comes on when it detects motion.In order to have saved footage for up to 60 days, you have to pay a fee. $3 a month but a little lower if you get the annual subscription.If you have a bunch of ring devices you can have saved footage as well other features for about $10 per month.Case in point, solid camera at the price point. Provides piece of mind for your home.

features: Connect your Ring camera with Alexa then enable announcements to be alerted when motion is detected. Talk to visitors through compatible Echo devices by saying ‚ÄúAlexa, talk to the front door‚Äù.,Lets you see, hear and speak to visitors from your phone, tablet and PC,Powered by the quick-release rechargeable battery pack.,With a Ring Protect Plan (subscription sold separately), record all your videos, review what you missed for up to 60 days, and share videos and photos.,Monitors your home in 1080HD video with infrared night vision and Live View,Includes built-in LED light strips and a siren,Includes Lifetime Theft Protection: If your Camera gets stolen, we‚Äôll replace it for free
name: Ring Spotlight Cam Battery HD Security Camera with Built Two-Way Talk and a Siren Alarm, White, Works with Alexa
review_header_1: Super Easy to Install, no wires necessary!
review_header_3: Great Camera. Works well for the backyard.
review_text_1: I have a Ring pro on my front door and loved it so much that I wanted something for the back patio since I have contracts (lawn, pool, trees, etc) in my backyard. My challenge however is that all the walls on the patio are either stucco or rock, which makes it near impossible to run a hidden power line. So I opted for this option and so far it works great. The lights are pretty bright and the motion detection works as expected.As for the battery life, it has been in for a couple weeks and it has lost about 10% battery. So I‚Äôm guessing it will last about 3 months before it needs a charge. I just ordered a second battery which should double that battery life.The connection is very quick, it seems to connect much faster than my front door, but in fairness it is closer to the wireless router.As for installation, I installed it using the provided screws into the frame of my patio door. It actually works perfect there because you can‚Äôt really see it and allows me to perfectly position it for motion detection.My only complaint is the motion zone setup. Unlike the ring pro where I can ‚Äúdraw‚Äù motion zones (which significantly helps reduce motion alerts), it only allows you to specify a distance. It really isn‚Äôt very intuitive, so I just leave it at mid-range and it seems to work just fine for now.Beware, in order to have video playback, you do have to subscribe to the ring premium service. And you have to have a subscription per device! I have it for my front door, not sure I‚Äôm gonna pay for the back door. That was kind of a bummer to find out I‚Äôd have to pay more. It should be a household subscription.Overall, I‚Äôm very happy with the device and would recommend it to anyone looking for an easy to install solution without wires.
review_text_3: We have this camera for the backyard and also the ring doorbell for the front door. We got the doorbell first and think it does the job. It is not the best nor is it the worst. Now the camera for the backyard is very nice. We got it as a safety precaution because we felt someone had used the pool while we were away and did not want that to be a safety issue. As you can see in these live pictures I just took that it covers pretty much the whole yard and you can zoom into areas on the app with your finger. Also pictured. We have the sensor set Just right to capture the movement in the backyard. At night when motion is detected the lights fire up to record. There is also an option to push an alarm on the light. It‚Äôs not super loud but loud enough for the neighbors to hear and scare persons away. I have also included a screenshot of the app view of the ring items we have.I would recommend this camera but really recommend using the solar panel with the camera and not have to worry about taking the battery out to charge it.
review_text_4: Love the freedom of wireless, the solar panels work great and only need a couple of hours of sunlight per day to keep the batteries topped off. Video quality is great and I've got eyes on the whole yard now. Just picked up 3 of these beauties. Simply system anyone can install and operate. Thank You Ring!!I bought a camera system a few years ago with a hard drive a 4 wired cameras. Wires all over the house and you need a PHD in programming to get the system to work. It ended up in the trash without ever making a single recording. Ring just makes it all doable for the average Non PHD humans...
review_text_5: Updated Review:Received a new camera from Ring. Setup this past weekend and it has been great so far. A lot different and better results from my first go with Ring.I had upgraded my network devices, modem and router. No more drops or freezing. Worked with Alexis from Ring support and she has been great!!The camera works flawless.

review_header_1: Great Product at a Great Price
review_text_1: I needed a camera for outside my garage because the one I have outside did not focus on the cars in the driveway. The spotlight was an added bonus. The video at night impressed me, it was very clear. I am going to get another one to replace my other camera that is not clear at night.
review_text_2: The video quality is great with AI which can detect and recognize the moving subjects as pets, etc. adjustable lighting with wide range tilting

Free App and NO monthly fees.,True DIY DVR system with monitor. Simply connect the camera to a power supply and experience peace of mind! User friendly interface, no complicated settings. It has never been so easy to operate a DVR like this!,Portable 7" touchscreen monitor with auto, manual and scheduled recording modes. Five seconds pre-record period ensures the event is fully captured. Rechargeable battery and 8GB SD card are included.,Smart motion detection uses dual sensors (heat and video motion) to minimize false alarms. review_header_2: Good quality, has everything I needed and was so affordable!
review_header_3: It works, simple and reliable. I would buy this again and would recommend it to a friend
review_header_4: Just amazing!! Worth every penny! See full review.
review_header_5: Can see who is at your front door at all times day or night.
review_text_1: UPDATE:7-24-2019:I have upgraded my review to 5 stars.You can see my complete video review on YouTube. Search for "CASACAM WIRELESS" in the search bar.You will find 3 videos to view.1. After communicating with the manufacturer they have explained to me that the plastic housing is UV rated.2. It is normal for the camera to feel warm to the touch.3. After having the camera for several days. I have discovered that this system is feature packed with many options to enhance the cameras performance.4. Video quality is very good5. Customer service is excellent.Two Camera Night Vision CasaCam, (this is the system without the extra spotlight).My first impressions: THE CAMERA:1. The camera material feels cheaply constructed. It is plastic no metal or aluminum.2. The lens cover is plastic not glass and is most likely susceptible to scratches and probably yellowing with age (like car headlight covers).3. The infrared L.E.D.‚Äôs on the front of the camera (they turn red at night) look poorly soldered.4. The camera is warm to the touch when on (day or night). I don‚Äôt know if this is normal.5. The power cord with the supplied extension cable for each camera is about 16 feet long. Not long enough for most installations. They charge $10.99 for additional 15 feet of extension cable.6. They claim the camera is ‚ÄúWEATHERPROOF‚Äù but should not be exposed to rain. It is probably fine mounted under an overhang or eave. They should consider making a rain/weather shield.7. The mounting bracket is adjustable but would be much better if it were a ball and socket.8. The instruction manual is better than I expected but is not clear on every function of the camera system. It wouldn‚Äôt hurt if they used a larger font.The MONITOR:1. The monitor feels nice with a little weight to it. It should be 10 inches for a better viewing of 2 or more cameras in split screen mode.2. The kick stand on the back is a nice feature but it feels flimsy and will probably break with a little pressure.3. The screen is a touch screen and responds okay but is a little awkward if you don‚Äôt get your finger in the right spot (make sure you remove the protective film or it will not perform well at all).4. The menu bar is pretty straight forward and simple. It is easy to figure out once you have played with the system for a few minutes.5. The monitor can be unplugged and carried around. This is a very nice feature. The battery life varies according to reviews I have read. I have used it for about an hour and a half with some charge still available.The Video:1. The daytime video quality is not bad at all. You will be able to recognize someone standing at your front door etc. You will see cars driving up and down the street. You will not be able to read a license plate (unless the license plate is right in front of the camera).2. The motion detection works and is adjustable and can be turned off.3. The night time video is acceptable. It is in black and white (it makes my blue eyes look very creepy) and you may not be able to recognize someone so easily.4. The two way speaker works, but is not as good as I had hoped. It is tinny sounding and there is a lag between talking and listening. You have to press the talk button while talking and release to listen. The playback sound on the video seems to be much better quality than the live audio.5. The SD card is over writable. For best playback I put the SD card in my computer where I have more control over the playback options.6. Internet connection. I am not using that option at this time so I have no comments.BOTTOM LINE:It‚Äôs not a bad camera system. The video is very good especially in the day time. The camera system has features for recording times and alarms. The portability of the monitor is an excellent feature. I wish the camera was constructed better. I can‚Äôt help but wonder about the longevity of this camera. From all the negative reviews I have read on Amazon the manufacturer has responded to most trying to work with their customers to resolve any issues that have arisen which makes me feel like this is a good company and improvements will hopefully be in the near future. Of course I have already spent my money on a product that for now seems to work very well.
review_text_2: I absolutely Love this camera system! We had been looking for one for forever and tried three other camera‚Äôs before we finally found this one! Where we live they don‚Äôt have WiFi that works very well so I wanted to get one that didn‚Äôt require WiFi and came with a non stationary monitor. I was using them as a kid and dog cameras so I wanted to be able to have two way communication with them as well. This camera fit All my requirements! The two way communication works amazing, the monitor can be carried around without being plugged in (although it doesn‚Äôt last very long, only about 4 hours but it also charges back up quickly), it can be plugged into the internet so you can view remotely from your phone, it‚Äôs So affordable compared to others, you can add cameras to it, it‚Äôs weather resistant, night vision is clear and amazing, saves footage so I can go back and review clips, I haven‚Äôt ever had a problem with slow connection and we have a camera outside and in our basement. If I could give it more stars I would! I did my research, tried other more popular cameras but this one was by far my favorite out of all of them! I haven‚Äôt had to deal with the company so far because I haven‚Äôt had any problems so I don‚Äôt really know how their customer service is but I guess that‚Äôs a good thing! I would definitely recommend this to anyone!
review_text_3: Exactly what I wanted. This is a nice simple affordable camera system that DOES NOT require wifi, a router or internet to work. Setup is simple, camera's are good, monitor is good, recording of video works as expected. night vision is decent, motion detection works but is not very long range and the audio (one way or two way) is good. Once you download the app to your phone and connect the monitor to your router you can view the camera's remotely, your results viewing the camera remotely will depend on the quality of your internet connection on both ends (camera end and cell phone end). Please understand this is a basic camera system quality of picture is average quality and features are adequate but somewhat limited. If you are looking for a high end feature rich video system this is not it! But if you are looking for a decent camera system with reasonable functionality I highly recommend this product. At this price point I don't think you can do much better. **Quick update** Have owned the product for six months now, It is in continuous use 24/7 One power adapter stopped working, Contacted the company by email and they promptly responded (less then 12 hours) and will send me a replacement no problems no issues. Things break, that's life but quality customer service like this is what makes a product stronger. very pleased!
review_text_4: Amazing product and amazing support!!This system is a must have, no WiFi is required which is what caught my eye. You can always use WiFi for remote viewing which is very secure and for dvr playback.Another plus is that the system can be incorporated with your RV trailer lights. Camera reads 9v, but after emails with the casa team 12v can also be used!! Which is very exciting because I can now use a rearview camera. (See con below)As for my other camera I use as a baby monitor in the buck house of the RV which has amazing video 2 way talking. So if I need to tell my little man to calm down or just to say I love you it works amazing and works great also with the remote app through WiFi.Con- as of right now for the camera settings, image can‚Äôt be reversed for the rear backup camera like I have setup. When you look at picture, left is really the right and right is really left if that makes sense. I am just really hoping they release a update to be able to reverse image.We plan on doing a full review on YouTube so more to follow on Gone with The Millers
review_text_5: Shipped fast and packaged very well. Easy too install and setup. No problem connecting too my router. Installed and formatted a128gb class 10 SD card with no problems. The picture quality is excellent and with the monitor being very portable, can use it in any room in the house. A very good security camera system at a great price. Very clear video with the night vision. You can have up too four cameras connected to the monitor at all times. I only have two at the moment but plan on getting two more very soon.

name: [Newest] Wireless Security Camera System, Firstrend 8CH 1080P Wireless NVR System with 4pcs 1.3MP IP Security Camera with 65ft Night Vision and Easy Remote View,P2P CCTV Camera System(No Hard Drive)
review_header_2: Best wifi security camera system out of four I purchased here on Amazon.
review_header_3: The support for firstrend is the greatest. They stayed on the phone until I was ...
review_header_4: I really like this camera system
review_text_1: I had a "4pcs 960P Cams+8CH 960P NVR(No HDD)" unit for about one week. So far so good. The following is my experience:1. Good price.2. Very quiet NVR. I can barely hear any noise from the NVR in any room. I think it is because the NVR doesn't have a fan - not sure it is good or bad.3. Good video quality during daytime and night.4. Setup is easy. Cameras were already linked to the NVR once I received it.5. Robust remote view app on mobile devices - though its user interface could be better (see below).6. Great customer service - Daisy helped me over the phone for a few issues (see below). She even called me back and left me a few voice messages to make sure I am satisfied. Much appreciated!Now for the areas which could be improved:A. It takes 3.5 inch hard drives. I bought a NVR without a hard drive because I have an spare 1T 2.5 inch hard drive from my old laptop - that will save me about $50. After I opened the NVR to install the hard drive, I found the 4 pre-drilled holes don't fit my 2.5 inch hard drive. I was disappointed because the description on Amazon says: (4TB HDD Max can be supported: Internal, SATA Interface, 3.5/2.5inches). I read the manual (operation guide). It says "Please purchase HDD (SATA 3.5")" (on page 06). Luckily the wiring works. So I just used one screw to install my 2.5 inch hard drive. The NVR has lots of empty space in the box. I would suggest make room for both 2.5" and 3.5" hard drives.B. The camera antenna can be attached to the left side of the camera only. This causes some problems for me. It would be nice if the antenna can be attached to either side of the camera.C. No dome camera is available for this kit. I would like to add one dome (or fish eye) camera to the system. Unfortunately they don't make it.D. The first time I connect the NVR to the TV in my family room with HDMI cable, the TV shows "Mode Not Supported". I called the customer service. Daisy gave me some tips to trouble shoot the issue: use a VGA cable or a different TV. I followed her advice. VGA cable and another TV all work fine. So that means the TV in my family room might not be compatible with this NVR.E. One camera's signal was on and off. Daisy pointed out that camera might be too far from the NVR or there might be too many walls between the camera and the NVR. She patiently went through the "repeater" setup procedure with me on the phone. Basically, a camera (with good signals) close to both the problematic camera and NVR was setup as a repeater to take the signal from the problematic camera then pass it to the NVR. It fixed the problem. Thanks, Daisy.F. The camera's base is too small. A little bit bigger base will make the camera more stable.G. There are 3 or 4 screws to adjust the camera's angle and position. They are not well designed.H. The remote view app on mobile device, Danale, is solid. However, the user face has room to improve. For example, in one camera view mode, swipe to left or right should show the previous or next camera.I. During the setup, I was asked to provide the password for my home wifi. I was very hesitate to provide my password though I did it eventually. Anyone knows if this poses a security risk?This wireless surveillance system is very good considering its price. I will upload some pictures and report back in a few months.
review_text_2: In researching a wi-fi only camera system, I purchased four systems on Amazon, and returned three and kept this one. I purchased systems from OnWOTE, HISEEU, Firstrend, and Canavis. If you are shopping for a wi-fi security system with a good image, and great wifi reception, which is critical to the system working properly, this system from Firstrend is your best bet related to cost, and as others have mentioned the customer service.I will briefing describe the issues with the other systems, this is based on my opinion and the operation of the systems based on where we needed the cameras and systems to be placed. The OnWOTE system had just average picture quality, and not good night vision at all. In addition I would loose connectivity with cameras often. The HiSeeu system was OK, but I have a power supply fail repeatedly and contacted customer support via email. Johnny replied and agreed to ship a new power supply to me. He sent me an email showing a shipment notification, but almost one month after that email I have never received anything. With the power supply failing, and lack luster customer service that system was returned. The Canavis system had the best picture quality and the worst reception range for the cameras. I wanted to like and keep the Canavis system, but the dropping of the connection and the slow transfer rates resulted in the return of this system as well. Yes I know, I could have purchased a wi-fi range extender to improve the reception, but WHY should I have to do that. I am not looking for a mile of connectivity just a normal two story home. And if I am spending $200 on the system, it should just work out of the box. The Firstrend system has a great picture and good night vision. One of the best parts is the connectivity of the system. I am getting excellent signal transmission on the unit and cameras, from the same locations the other units were failing. I did have one issue and that was one of the camera was great in the daytime, but at night the image was foggy almost like it had condensation behind the lens of the camera. So I contacted customer support via email, and received an email back within one day. They asked a few trouble shooting questions, normal stuff, and agreed to send me a new camera. That was great customer service. Within a few days the new camera arrived, and I could not add it to my system following the instructions that were sent via email with the shipment notification. So I found a phone number for Firstrend, 888-806-1588 called the number left a voice message, and sent an email as well. The instructions they sent appeared to be for a different system due to the menu configuration. Within one day, I received a phone call from an international number, it was Firstrend. Wow, they did return my call. During the call the nice lady discussed with me my situation about not being able to add the new camera to my system. She researched my order, and the camera they sent me to replace it. She discovered the new camera was not compatible with the system I purchased. She promptly stated she was sending me a new camera for my system, and for me to keep the camera that had sent in error. I asked how long would the new camera take, and she added priority shipping at no charge as well. So that evening I received an email from Firstrend with a screenshot of the order being placed for a new camera and 2 day shipping. So I really could not ask for much more customer service than that. I have had the system up and running for over two weeks now and really can't stress enough that the reception range on this system and the cameras is very good. I had to adjust the direction of the antennas on the cameras for maximum throughput, but it is running well.So in conclusion, for the money, the Firstrend system is great - and the customer service is outstanding. I am hoping the system lasts for a couple of years, so we will see.Take care,
review_text_3: Easiest setup ever. I actually returned a zmodo camera system that was way too difficult. The support for firstrend is the greatest. They stayed on the phone until I was finished setting up the system. I love these guys.
review_text_4: I really like this camera system, it has easy installation, clear videos, good price, etc. I highly recommend this camera to anyone who needs a security camera system.
review_text_5: I purchased the Firstrend Camera System with 4 cameras and no hard drive. The instructions were simple and the cameras linked up with the NVR as soon as I turned on the system. However, due to my own error, two cameras subsequently disconnected from the NVR, and I was very discouraged for about 24 hours. However, the Firstrend support is very good. Owen returned my call and emailed me some instructions that fixed the problem immediately.The wireless signal strength is good--I have one camera that is located one floor above and about 35 feet away from the NVR, and it syncs with the NVR flawlessly. However, if you should have a problem, Firstrend sells a signal booster that will likely fix the problem.The picture quality is outstanding and the infrared night vision is awesome--I can easily see 80 to 100 feet out. I installed a 1 terabyte hard drive in the NVR. It was easy to format and is large enough for my purposes.The Danale remote view software is excellent. It will be nice to visually check in on our home when we are away.All in all, a very good system at an economical price.

review_header_1: This solar camera is perfect for my backyard.
review_header_4: Impressively Large Viewing and Panning Area
review_text_2: This camera does not need electricity to operate and function. The camera battery that is rechargeable can sustain a very long time without needing recharged. (6 months)It has held a charge without being connected to electricity OR THE solar panel for over three months, and it is still only 1/2 power on the battery scale. When using it outside, two points of importance, one, the solar panel will keep it constantly charged so electricity will never be needed after the initial charge up. And also the color black is more important to be used on the outside so that in darkness it does not show up as well as if it was white. The camera has PTZ that is accessible from your phone to be able to adjust the camera, and the app allows you to go back in the history and pull up events that occurred usually up to one or two months, depending on the size of the SD card that you put into the camera. Also the camera has a much better picture if HD is pushed on the camera settings. Wifi is necessary if you need to access the camera remotely. You cannot go wrong with the purchase of this camera, the quality of the pictures is excellent and the response time of the camera to record is excellent.
review_text_3: This camera is a HUGE upgrade from the older one that I have from the same company. The video is more clear and the wi-fi extender is EXCELLENT! I have a slower internet and the extender is very nice - no freezing up or slowing down. Being able to move the camera around is an awesome improvement too, keeps me from having to install multiple cameras. It was very easy to connect with their app and set everything up, maybe 10-15 minutes (mainly because after connecting it needs to download a firmware update.) Even installing it outside was super easy, four screws to your base and then put camera on it and tighten down with little screw tabs. If you are looking for a camera but not wanting a huge investment or complicated installation, this one is perfect for that! I highly recommend it!
review_text_4: - Design, build and paint quality is excellent- Since our side patio, yard & walk in area is very narrow and long, the camera can pan the whole side of the house. It also can pan straight down to alleviate any blind spots.- If someone comes to our side entry door we can pan to see who it is and use the speaker (two way speaker) to ask any questions before deciding whether we should open the door. Of course it's also great to see if Amazon or other vendor packages have been delivered. (Panning is done through the use of an icon on your mobile device)- Battery life is very good. In 3 weeks of use the battery is at 85%. (I intentionally left off the solar panel to make sure the battery was good.)- I did encounter one minor problem involving still images not being viewable after the camera detected motion and recorded video. The company was contacted via email and within 24 hours asked for more information. After giving them the info, they responded again within 24 hours with their explanation. (Nothing wrong with the camera ‚Ä¶ a software app update will be upcoming which should fix the issue.) After working in the computer support area all of my life, I am always impressed by companies which actually care about customers and respond quickly. Kudos to their support team!This is a very nice and functional security camera which I would purchase again.
review_text_5: This come with everything you need, except for the optional memory card. Charge it before you install, and with the solar panel set up to face the sun, you never have to worry about it running out of battery. No monthly subscription required which I love. You can add a microSD card to save footage. The pan and tilt functions work nicely from the app which allows you to expand your view. Motion detection works a little too well, so I would get alerts if strong winds move plants/tree shadows. Overall a great value!
