name: ZOSI 1080P HD 1920TVL Hybrid 4-in-1 TVI/CVI/AHD/960H CVBS CCTV Surveillance Weatherproof Bullet Security Camera 42PCS Infrared LEDs, 120ft IR Distance, For HD-TVI, AHD, CVI, and CVBS/960H analog DVR
review_header_2: Great camera with easy to use features. Hard to beat, especially at this price point!
review_header_3: Best camera for the money, hands down.
review_text_1: After much research for cameras for our house, I narrowed down my choice to this Zosi model for two primary reasons: the cost, and the many other overwhelmingly positive reviews. I had considered the wireless type of cameras available nowadays, but there were just too many reviews that mentioned lots of problems getting, and staying, connected, so I elected to go with the hard-wired video and power type. My thinking was that if the home wireless network goes down, or any camera's connection is unstable, then a wireless camera is useless. I purchased four of these cameras, so far, in April and May of 2017. I've installed three of them outside and they have performed flawlessly, rain or shine, since installation. I used the gray 3/4-inch PVC conduit and weatherproof gray PVC 4-inch round light boxes camera mounting. I drilled a 1/2-inch hole in the center of the box's cover for the cable to go into the box. I used flat head stainless steel machine screws to attach them to the covers, with silicone sealant applied to the screw holes for weatherproofing, and the same sealant around the bracket's edge for weatherproofing the bracket. It was a nice, clean, installation, with plenty of room inside those 4-inch boxes to roll up the connections. The picture included shows two of the three cameras in place. One of the four cameras I purchased has remained inside our house and is in use in our basement until it's permanent spot is ready for mounting. The camera's night vision range is excellent, but it's even better when there are reflective surfaces (sheds, lattice, etc) for the infrared to bounce off of. The video (both day and night) is very clean and crisp, and the best part is these don't cost 5 to 8 time more like the other cameras I looked at initially!! I have a UPS power backup for the system in the event power drops out. The cameras are being recorded 24/7. To add to all this, I recently installed an additional "entertainment system" consisting of 4-agile TV modulators (professional style) I purchased on that well known auction site (starts with an E) for very little $$$s each, fed by the camera's video, with their RF outputs combined to allow a single coax with 4-TV channels to connect to our 65-inch Smart TV's "TV" antenna input in our Master Bedroom. This gives us very LARGE pictures to look at of our property, and watch the Raccoons come and go, too, when there's nothing worthwhile to watch on cable TV. I did have one issue that came up with one of the four cameras within the last week. It's front "lens" (or glass) has fogged-up on the inside, for some reason, so I contacted Zosi Customer Service direct since I was beyond Amazon's return time frame. Zosi's handling of the issue has been absolutely fast and fantastic - best customer service I've received from ANY vendor in a long time. Special thanks goes out to "Anran" of Zosi Customer Service for the speedy resolution!! IMHO, these cameras are worth every dollar spent, and Zosi's Customer Support is superb!! What more could you ask for!!
review_text_3: You can't buy a better camera for $20. I replaced one of my zmodo kit cameras with this, and it puts the rest of them to shame.Something to note: the viewing angle is significantly wider than my original cameras, if you're looking for a zoom camera this is not it. See the picture below, the 2 cameras are mounted in the exact same location.
review_text_4: I bought this camera to use instead of a doorbell cam. Since my doorbell isn‚Äôt wired, I couldn‚Äôt install one. I love this camera! Setup is easy with the quick start guide they include. The app is really easy to navigate also. I see one small problem, but not for me. It is mounted in a low light hallway, so when the sun is shining brightly, the small part of my screen where it shines is washed out. Just white. I am not using it, however, to watch what is going on downstairs, but to see who is at my door and be able to talk to them. This is awesome for that. The rest of the screen is perfect: great picture!During installation, the guide tells you that if an SD card isn‚Äôt installed at that time, the camera will be unable to read it. This is false. I put my card in a few days later, the app told me it was not formatted, but within the app,easily, it will format it. The SD card works fine! You don‚Äôt have to use an SD card as it utilizes Cloud, but after 30 days there is a charge for that. With the card installed, you can turn off Cloud.Motion detection is very good although it‚Äôs a second or two behind. But you can tap on the alert, and it takes you to the moment of detection in a screenshot.Night vision is really very good, even though I don‚Äôt need it. The only difference in quality you can see is that it‚Äôs in black and white instead of full color. Daytime is great! It shows colors correctly, clear view of people and faces.Audio I can‚Äôt say enough about. I keep the speaker on so I can listen and talk to someone. To speak to someone outside, simply tap and hold the ‚Äúintercom‚Äù, or the Mic icon on the screen. It just couldn‚Äôt be any easier.While I can not install anything to our walls (outside the condo) with screws, or anything that penetrates the wall, the adhesive works okay. If it falls, I will reinforce the bond with gorilla glue (found here on Amazon). I am using the magnet mount myself, but either mount is fine.Overall I give this 5 stars, even with the couple of minor things I mentioned. I think, if the camera is not in a low light area, there would be no problem having an awesome picture. This is a great camera for what I need and want, and the price is affordable. I would recommend this for both indoor and outdoor use.Update/3 months later:Everything I said about this camera still holds true, except for one thing. Time before last the camera was on the charger for an entire day and night.. about 20-24 hrs. The camera lasted almost 7 weeks between charges! This time I did the same thing, and on the 5th day it shows at still 100% charge.Update: I‚Äôve been using the camera a while now, and this update is about the battery life.so I discovered, by accident, that when I start charging the battery in the afternoon or earlier, if I leave it on the charger overnight, the battery lasts longer. The first time I fell asleep and it was charging all night. That time I got 6 or 7 weeks. I did that again 8 weeks ago, and it is still at 10%. Now I let it run until it shuts off too, but don‚Äôt know if that makes a difference. But yes, I would give this a 6th star but f I could.

review_header_2: When running the cable make sure you run the correct end of cable.the cable only hooks up one way..
review_header_3: Low budget basic wired security camera. Great for convenience stores
review_header_4: Please make sure read instructions and step by step to install. It took a little bit time.
review_header_5: Safety just by having this camera around my house.
review_text_1: I live in an area where it's not safe to leave a bicycle even in the backyard, my 3rd bicycle has been stolen over the last 3 months. I was researching which surveillance system to buy, first my attention was captured by Google Nest cameras system, however, I realized there was a subscription fee which I really don't want to pay. I found this surveillance system 2 weeks ago and ordered. Last week it arrived and Install it in the backyard, front yard and in the, and even one camera left to install somewhere, so I installed it in the kids' room. The quality of the video in the night is pretty good. First I was under impression that 1TB of space wouldn't be enough, but then I realized it's for a week of the video recording, Also as you can see in the photo the hard drive is pretty standard if you want to increase the space you can just buy another hard drive in Best Buy, but I doubt you will ever need more than 1TB. Make sure you read the instruction first, it's also very important where you install the cameras, make sure it's not under the direct sunlight since it reduces the lifespan of the camera.
review_text_2: I bought this security system for our house and property..My wife is sick battling brain cancer.We head to hospital 200 miles every week. Now I can leave and not worry as much.you can even set the cameras up to send you an alert is someone comes on your property.you will no it and go to your app on phone and look at it no matter where yoir located..this system has 4 camera's im going to purchase more to add on the inside of the house..What I love about this set up is its so simple to install the wires only hook up one way and the power is supplied through the wire itself.you can down load a app for phone and also add it to your laptop..the night vision could be a little better but over all its clear..you can look at the picture as one picture or view all 4 at the same time..the email set up is easy as just putting it in the system and when motion is detected you get a email telling you..I highly like this system easy for us country folks to hook up ours selves..If you need help contact me on This review ill gladly answer a question or you can call tech too..Im so happy I bought this setup..i feel safe at home and when im.out of town now..
review_text_3: For the price, this cam set does what I need it to do. Record all the time, playback anytime, all from a monitor using a mouse. Anything more expensive than this is not worth it. The hard drive that came with the unit was defective, but customer service was lightning fast and sent me a new one.Pros:-records at least 1080p-night vision was really clear at night. Could see what the human eye can‚Äôt see-customer service was quick and to the point-cables were longCons:-Navigating the interface was confusing and not intuitive-Software used to interact with the user, including computer program and phone app is outdated and often doesn‚Äôt work-Manual is lacking a lot of details-No indicator that lets me know the unit is recording, because of this, it took a fair amount of time to realize it wasn‚Äôt recording because the hard drive was defectiveTips for improvement:-The engineer should certainly revamp the interface by incorporating a basic mode/advance mode because a lot of the settings, I don‚Äôt know what they do, (I‚Äôm an IT admin, so I typically know what I‚Äôm doing)-Browser support is lacking for everything except Internet Explorer which is at its end of life. I can‚Äôt access the unit using macOS. A wide variety of stable and secure support would be nice.- the manual should have more details, like what certain icon represents. When I click certain things, icons just show up and i don‚Äôt know what the unit is doing-they should do away with the mouse for cost savings. A cheap wi-fi mouse I bought for this was more convenient to use than the wired one.If you own a small, hole in the wall business, who just wants a simple security cam set connected to a nearby dedicated monitor that records all the time, then this is the device for you. If you are someone who‚Äôs tech savvy, want to remotely access the cam feeds, or do some neat, efficient and auto features, this is not for you.
review_text_4: I bought this security camera system for my new restaurant. Before I bought it, I researched online about security camera system. Finally, I got this. I followed instructions to setup cameras. But it took my a little bit long time. Cause this is my first time to buy this type camera system. There has four cameras. I need to install on the wall for four different places. Then connect them together. It lets me work so hard. This system needs a monitor or I can use app to watch anytime. The best benefit is that they include 1TB memory disc. That‚Äôs why I bought it. Just don‚Äôt need to buy extra memory items. It‚Äôs easy to record with setting in the monitor correctly. Usually I watched its app everyday. I can see clearly. It‚Äôs good choice to my restaurant. Don‚Äôt regret to buy it. It works for me.
review_text_5: Very nice set of CCTV cameras, so my story for getting security cameras is my next door was robbed, so I'm scared what my house will be happening if I don't take some kinda actions. Saw it on Amazon and purchased for a great deal, so far it look amazing. The images are clear and it captures everything. I Will just list the pro and cons about this product.Pro: 1) It is clear 1080p, but in the settings you can pick from 720 - 1080 p, but it can goes to 2080 p too.2) motion sensor and night vision (black and white not green).3) cameras are easy to set up and it looks great.4) enough HD space to record all day.5) Will made, it is not plastic like other cameras, it is metal construction and it has some weights to it. Which I like.Con: 1) even though it is easy to setup, the instructions in the software is some time confusing. You have to spend some time to play with the settings.2) You have to have at lest 3 electric open plugs for this device. One for the monitor, one for the cameras, and one for the motherboard inside. So get ready 3 open plug spot or extension cord.3) Once it is on you can't turn it off, there is no off button. Not sure if this is good or bad.Overall, it is a great buy for it's price,it show clear images and great features, and hope to keep away the robbers thinking of breaking in. Give it a try.Thanks for reading.

description: The Defender Wireless Cellular Trail Camera has been designed to be the ultimate remote game scouting tool. It is the perfect camera to operate on remote hunting properties with limited access, as well as sensitive areas where the game does not need to be disturbed. The Defender Wireless trail camera operates in either a long-range low glow Infrared flash mode or can go completely undetectable using the Invisible IR mode, which is great for the game that is easily spooked, or a security application. Transmit HD images and Video clips over a nationwide 4G LTE network from your favorite hunting spot right to your laptop or mobile device using the Strike Force Wireless management system. CAMERA FEATURES: - 20 MP; - 2" Color Viewing Screen; - 120 ft Long Range Infrared Illumination at Night; - 80 ft Invisible Infrared Illumination at Night; - Adjustable IR Flash (Power Save, Long Range, Fast Motion); - 0.3 - 0.7 second Adjustable Trigger Speed; - 1920x1080 FHD Videos with Sound (5 sec- 2 min length); - Adjustable Detection Range up to 80 ft; - 0.6 Second Recovery Time between Images; - Illuma-Smart Technology Automatically adjusts IR Flash for Perfect Night Photos; - SD Card Management Options; - Smart IR Video; - Long Battery Life from 16 AA batteries (not included); - 12V External Power Jack. CELLULAR FUNCTIONS: - Operates on a nationwide 4G LTE ATT Network; - Uploads standard images; - Uploads HD images or Video clips; - GPS tagged images; - Mapping feature; - Create and Manage footage in Folders; - Month-to-Month Data plans; - Activate cameras only when you need them; - Easy to use mobile app. This bundle includes Defender Wireless Cellular 20MP AT&T Trail Camera, 32 GB CD Card and CD Card Reader for IOS or Android devices (depending on the model).

review_text_1: There is nothing, and I mean nothing not to like about this security 4 camera system. Beginning with the well constructed camera bodies, amazing finish. Once I ensured the cameras all connected to my TV, I began to located them around my home. Picked the first location over the pool, next chose a spot overlooking my fruit trees, then moved to the south side of my home camera location I picked connected right away. Forth location was more difficult to pick because of the remote power source. Finally chose near the front door again dead easy. Emailed Johnny (the tech contact) with a question next day answer addressing my needs small tech issue solved. Super, super happy with this purchase I will recommend this highly to my friends who are looking for a security system for their home. Great value so go ahead get this system perfect for any location, home cottage, farm. With the IP PRO app your system is on line anywhere you have your phone. If I could give this product a 6plus it would be done. Thanks HISEEU.Sincerely Ross
review_text_2: this is one of , if not "the" easiest to set up camera system you can purchase.I have also added 2 cameras that are fairly new to this company, has 2 way speaker ..the cameras are good and clear, customer support is top notch.I do recommend the wifi extender, it greatly increased the signal strength for those camerasa bit out of range. the day and night vision is excellent.I highly recommend this system.I have 7 cameras currently in use, I've also am using 2 Wi-Fi repeaters that are working great.I've not had a dropped connection in a long time. These are great, though they can takea bit of learning curve as you add on and use repeaters.
review_text_4: I bought this 8 ch. wireless system and installed it for a friend of mine. I was very impressed with the picture quality and ease of the setup. Before I installed this system I tested it at my hose to make sure it worked properly and it passed with flying colors. My home is about 3800 sq. feet and of course the cameras on the first level worked fine as being the closest, and to test it further I placed two other cameras as far as I could on the lower level and closed all the doors. review_text_1: This is the Best surveillance security camera out of the 3, I‚Äôve bought so far. The pictures are super clear on the 10 inch monitor that came with it and also super clear on my cell phone. Not just clear pictures on day times but also super clear at night time. You can see very detail with the night vision on your cell phone 20/20. The 2 security camera set I bought before can not get this clear pictures at all. The videos is recorded 24/7 and You can also roll back the video to see everything that‚Äôs going on from previous times of the day. Very easy self install that any one can do and super easy to set up on the monitor and on your phone by reading the direction manual that came with it. I bought it almost a month now and so far it‚Äôs running excellent. I would recommend it to everyone. Worth every dollar!! I have had taken some pictures of how clear all the pictures on the monitor and on my cell phone, on both day times and night times so you can see how clean all the pictures are. This is my first time ever written a review on Amazon so you gotta believe me! Thumbs up!!
review_text_2: I ordered this system and my neighbor said this is not what you want so I sent it back. He told me I need battery operated cameras so I decided to research this and battery operated systems. I wanted a no fuss system that did nor rely on I phones since I do not have one and did not want to change batteries. THIS IS THE SYSTEM I WANTED. It comes with 4 cameras and there is a step by step video on the product that is so helpful. The system has a one terabyte hard drive. I did not want anything hooked up to my computer but can be. I ending up buying two more cameras. The system will hold up to 8 cameras. The cameras have to have power but were very easy to install and as soon as the cameras received power, they were on my screen. I am loving the security. The cameras are a little over 900 dpi and are very clear. The night vision is in black and white and even catch all the bugs whizzing by.
review_text_3: This little cheap system was truly a plug and play system. There was no hard drive insertion or pairing cameras.There was no need, for me, to connect this to the cloud. I just plugged in the AC transformers and turned on the system.Then everything worked. The only thing that I had to do was to tell it the time and date. The pictures are clear and the night vision works. It has a lot of other features that I don't plan to use. It will record for 25 days before the disk is full and then it automatically records over the oldest date. Easy Breezy.....
review_text_4: Five stars across the board. The system came well-packaged. After opening all the boxes laying the components out it took me all of fifteen minutes to read the installation instructions. I found a location I wanted the home base plugged it in and was done with that part of it. It took me about two hours to install all four cameras and simply plug them in. When I got back inside the house all four cameras are online. It was that simple. Another 15 minutes to go through the settings and I was all done. Factory setting of clarity is absolutely beautiful and night vision is amazing. When an object moves through the viewing area of the camera it's absolutely perfectly smooth. My last system was very jerky and must have missed every 30 frames or so because an object magically moved 10 or 12 ft before you saw it again. I have mine again set at the factory settings of 24/7 recording. Playback of recording is absolutely excellent simply go to date and time stamp that you like and pick the track and watch what you want to watch. Extra little note is that if you unplug and move the base unit Andre plug it in the settings that you select time and date stamp etc are remembered so there must be a small power source within. This system has every option that makes any sense at all. I am extremely pleased with this product in ALL respects. My compliments to the manufacturers as this system as well thought-out well-engineered well-designed at a very fair price. I have absolutely no issues with workmanship or product materials. Having a background in engineering and QC I give this product and company an A+.
review_text_5: I've had the 4 channel (wish I'd gotten the 8 channel!!) for about a year now. It was super simple to set up. Plug in the DVR and mount/plugin (or hard wire to dvr) the cameras...and they automatically pick up the signal and show up on the screen. Adjusting them is very easy. This system was designed to work great, be easy to set up, and give peace of mind. Yesterday, I was tnkering with the settings (not fully awake) and had a problem with one camera not working. I emailed Customer Service, and Cindy helped find my problem, sent a video of how to fix it, and 5 minutes later, all is well again. She is so nice, patient and knowledgable. I give the system and the csutomer service AAAAA+++++ and 5 Stars!! Oh, and I'll probably end up buying the 8 channel soon :-) Thank you Cindy for helping me out!!

review_header_5: Great features compared to my previous outdoor cam!
review_text_1: The video quality is really good. It offers two options of image resolution: 360p and 2K. In my experience, the image quality of 2K is much better, and it does not have a significant delay even with the cell phone data plan instead of WIFI.In addition, I was surprised by its functionality of adjusting to different light conditions, as shown in these photos. Despite a strong light in the visible area, you can still see most part of the photo with enough information.The motion detection feature is also useful. Every time someone stepped on the porch (either get in the house or get out of the door), it will take a video with a few seconds, which is sufficient enough to see what happened. Although you do need to clean them up after a while, otherwise there will be more than 30 video clips per week :)This video camera offers many other functions. I still did not get some of them after using the camera for two weeks. It would be a good idea if it can provide detailed instruction to explain all the functions.
review_text_2: The Bosma EX Pro is a fantastic security camera that holds essential features. Motion detection, automatic light switch, 180-degree pan, night vision, and siren were some of the features that are a must in a security cam, and the Bosma EX Pro worked flawlessly. Linking the Bosma app from my mobile device was seamless and took me less than five minutes to get started.The camera is responsive to the app controls, and I didn't experience any delay when panning or applying changes. However, the app would be unresponsiveness at times, and this could be a hit or miss when catching a potential culprit. As a new outdoor camera out in the market, I assume the device and software will get better with time as firmware and app updates are released.It took a few days to get comfortable with the app and set up sweet spots for activity zones (detection spots). Overall, a great, sturdy security camera that will potentially handle all kinds of weather.
review_text_3: I purchased the 2021-Bosma Ex pro around 10 days ago, and right away put it to use !Once downloading the App, then Installing the camera and set up was much easy .There are different functions to choose with useful features in the setting. Motion detection is very accurate both day and night which also includes alarm. The camera indeed a good quality taking sharp pictures. Overall it's easy to install, operate , and works great as expected.
review_text_4: I am very impressed with the BOSMA EX PRO‚Äôs features for its price point. The camera was easy to install, the hardest part was choosing a spot. Holding the camera and just looking at it, it felt sturdy and well made. The set up process was as simple as it could be, a direct link to the app with step by step instructions. The range of vision that this camera is able to provide is amazing. I like how I am able to move the camera‚Äôs direction as needed with my app and the ability to track motion impressed me. I also really appreciate that in addition to motion detection, it is able to detect sounds - that‚Äôs a new feature I haven‚Äôt seen offered at this price before. The quality of the video is excellent and the interface is easy to navigate. Overall I look forward to what other products get released in the future, and I definitely would recommend to my friends and family.
review_text_5: I replaced my old outdoor cam with this Bosma EX Pro and used for over a week. Great experience and it provided much more security features than my previous one!Several things that I like:- Easy to set up. It came with hardware like screw and anchor. I just followed the instruction on the app and make connection easily.- Great picture clarity even when raining. It got a lot of rains in the past week and the camera is functioning perfectly in rain. The color night vision is also impressive.- Accurate person auto tracking. One of the main features that I choose to upgrade my old camera.I will recommend it to anyone who is interested to buy an outdoor cam.

review_text_1: So far, loving it. Now for the install (see picture). Got this far without cracking the manual and everything works (well at first it didn't, will explain). The hard drive arrives "Unformatted" and has to be formated before the NVR will start recording. Also, even after formatting the display was still showing "not formated", but after I exited "System Setup" and came back the drive was showing as formatted. How to format the drive: right click screen, go to system set up, HDD setup, on the far right is a box that says format, check the box and go to the bottom and click format, exit system setup and then go back in and check the HDD "status"..What's in the box: four camera's (two pigtails: one power and one RJ45 network connector, antenna and mounts), one NVR (with 2 TB hard drive), one stiff HDMI cable with a nice braided covering (I'm guessing 5 feet long), optical mouse and manual.OK, fully installed and have had one issue: The IP install hit a snag. Snag solved, the manual says you must have WAN connector, this is poorly written, what they are saying: you must have Internet services for IP to work. I have an Actiontec FiOS router and it has two "IN" ports, coax cable or the WAN connector, those are input connectors and FiOS uses the coax, the WAN port is not used and cannot be used by other devices. I had a spare LAN port, plugged in the NVR and clicked on diagnostics and bingo, I am now connected "Healthy Network". Silly me, I took their description of using a WAN port literally.Update (8/20/2017), asked for and received the CMS software and it arrived right away (awesome support). Got the CMS working, happy I had the manual, the one page setup also sent Grace Hu worked ... but, not at first because I didn't know ... on the preview tab: on that page on the right side-bar you will see: Area & under Area your newly added Cloud ID you have Chanel 1 -4, you need to double-click on the cameras to turn them on for viewing (the camera icon will turn from gray to gold when turned on).
review_text_2: I compared this multi-camera surveillance system with other leading competitors. As a technical person, I reviewed its specifications in detail, and found it to be the best wireless system for protecting small or large homes.After completing its physical installation, I powered up the NVR, then the four cameras.. They paired up within a few minutes and displayed clear pictures on a 4K monitor.The new 13 page user manual (provided later) provides clear instructionsThe 2 TeraByte (TB) storage disk is sufficient for most applications, although larger internal disks can be obtained if extra-ordinary memory is required. For the unit described here, 2 TB was found sufficient to store 14 days of 24/7 operation when the frame rate is set to about 10 frames-per-second (fps), and with a high sensitivity setting. For two weeks of storage, I used about 1.75 TB.Using IP Pro (an Apple app), viewing on my iPhones was flawless, whether watching from the US or from Europe or from the UK.Backing up a time segment to a PC or to a thumb drive was easy.As an advice to fellow users, great care must be exersized in the evaluation of signal losses through building structures (walls, closets, windows,...).Camera output signal power is limited by law, and camera location and orientation are critical for both the NVR and the cameras. Solid brick walls are especially challenging, and some additional amplification may be required for certain installations. Do not allow the cameras to look directly into the sun: it will burn the sensitive optics.Concluding, the technical service and support provided by SMONET is excellent, especially when compared with other products, and the assistance provided by Mrs. Huang has been very helpful.
review_text_3: I bought this system to replace a lower resolution wireless system that I had installed on my house a while back. The DVR for that system became inoperative and the company no longer offers a model that would replace it. So I ordered this SMONET system and I am impressed with it so far. I bought it without the hard drive, as I have a couple of suitable drives handy.I have to say that customer service has been extremely proactive. Crystal from SMONET reached out to me proactively to ensure that I am satisfied with the product and to provide contact information should I ever need it. That is impressive!!!The system is impressive too. Since it is 8 channels where my previous DVR was only 4, I have more options. I was able to connect my existing lower res wireless cameras to this DVR and use those in addition to the 4 new hi-res cameras that came with it. My home has a relatively large footprint being a single story structure of 2700 square feet. All of the cameras manage to connect to the DVR with good signal except for one of the old ones that needed a "repeater" even in the old system. The great news - that repeater also works with the new system once everything is properly "married".I put a 1 Gig hard drive in mine and it could not have been simpler. Four screws to attach it and then a power cable and SATA cable to connect it. A quick format and it was up and running in minutes. I used a Western Digital drive but you can use a variety of drive sizes and manufacturers.Picture quality is noticeably better which I expected by going to full HD. Even the old low res cameras look pretty good. Motion detection is about the same as the previous system which was very good - so good, in fact, that I have to make sure the cameras are free from spiderwebs as their movement will trigger recording. LOL.The system is easy to set up and configure. Installation does require a power source near the camera but I used some power extension cables, that you can also get on Amazon, where I needed them. Night vision is remarkably good too with the IR illuminators on the cameras.For the price, this was an outstanding value when I ordered it. Now that I've got the hard drive installed so easily AND I was able to "marry" my old cameras to this system, it became an even better value.Thanks again, Crystal, for your proactive customer service!!
review_text_4: The selection process in a surveillance system can be challenging and the priorities vary with each user.My highest priority was CUSTOMER SUPPORT, and in an ever changing technological environment, this seller‚Äôs customer support, Betty Huang, exceeded all expectations. All issues were promptly responded to, professionally, courteously and with full transparencies!My next priority was COMPATIBILITY with my current hardware technology (High Def 1080P TV, Samsung Android phone, Windows 10 PC, Tablet and laptop) and this Wireless NVR Kit delivered.Next, HIGH DEFINITION video was a must and the camera‚Äôs delivered stunning auto focus day and night high definition resolutions.The system was for residential use, so I wanted WIRELESS eliminating unsightly cables like a bowl of spaghetti at the main station/monitoring location, which in my case was my office, and the wireless and surprisingly compact NVR system delivered.Last, which we all consider, was PRICE. The unit is competitively priced compared to current competition for all that it delivers and my second choice was less than $50 lower and it was hard wired and unknown customer support.
review_text_5: Back in December 2016, I purchased my first Smonet NVR that was a 4CH only. That thing has rocked every day since then. For the price and features, you couldn't beat it. I now find my self needing to add more cameras. I purchased this system since I had a 4TB HD already and four existing cameras that I wanted to add to this new system giving me 8 channels. The new system worked out of the box and these are 2MP 1080p cameras vs the 1.3 MP 960p cameras I already had. Now, this system I did not have any problem with as it came. The problem that I ran into was when I wanted to move the Cameras from the old system over to the new one via the match code process. I kept getting the invalid module error (-8) and the camera would not add. Now, working with computers for years now, I noticed that the old cameras had the same IP ranges 172.20.14.30 - .34 which the new system had already assigned to the cameras it came with. No matter if I deleted all cameras and added individually, they all seemed to have the wifi connection info and IP hardcoded inside the camera directly. This is where I was stumped. I wasn't sure how to access the cameras to correct this. I reached out to Smonet via email and they sent the steps needed to access the camera directly as well as the application to configure LAN (not wifi) since its plugged into my switch so I could access the web config page of the camera. Once I did that, I followed the steps on updating the WIFI SSID and passcode to the new NVR info as well as changing the IPs of the old cameras to be 172.20.14.35-38. Once I did this and saved, I did the match code process of the NVR system and BOOOOM! All the old 4 cameras connected easily and were up and running. While the support hours of Smonet are China Time Zone based and not really available for me during the day since I am on EST, they always responded to my emails and were very helpful. The person that assisted was named Crystal. Overall, I am a happy customer and will continue to use their products since typically you can't beat the price. This system for 159 was a good deal as it would have cost me that much just for 4 cameras basically at the going rate of ~35$. So it was a no brainer to go with this setup for the cameras and NVR. The only thing is, I wish I could swap out the antennas on the cameras. My old ones you can, but these seem to have the wire running from inside the camera out to the antenna so you would have to open the camera to replace.. I have external, extended antennas on the NVR since the NVR is located within a Computer RACK system. I will be also be attempting the wifi extending features of the cameras since two of them are for a detached garage that is quite a bit from the base station and I want to improve the signal to them. Overall, I am satisfied and do recommend these systems for an easy and quick DIY job.

review_text_1: While all the reviews and images look great, these camera HAVE to be plugged in to work and that‚Äôs what you do not see in the advertisement pictures . It‚Äôs frustrating because most outlets are not near high ceilings or places you would put a camera . So although it lives up to the hype and is truly a GOOD PRODUCT these pictures should be reported for false advertising.
review_text_2: So far so good. We've been using Yi products for a while, but have had some issues with them lately. We hooked these up today and they are just as easy to setup as the Yi cameras. The video is crisp and the audio is clean. I give them 5 stars and will be ordering more once these have stood the test of time for a bit longer.Update: 12/12/20I've been using these for a little bit now and they are so much better than the Yi cameras I used to have. One of the biggest perks is that they do not require that you subscribe to their cloud service in order to view multiple cameras on the screen. Only draw back to these is that they don't have a Windows app to view cameras. Only android and iPhone. However, you download the Blue Stack emulator for windows and it's like having an Android on your windows desktop. These cameras are perfect! Everything about them is so much better than the Yi.
review_text_3: We got these with the vague idea that we could monitor our kiddo and babysitters while out on date night. But with Covid, date night is a thing of the past. Let's hope I'll need these more in the future.I installed them already and actually I've really enjoyed being able to monitor different rooms in my house from my phone. It's nice that you can see the feed from every camera on one screen, or just do one at a time so you can see more detail. The picture is pretty good, clear enough that you can tell what's going on. Sometimes I use them to see how my daughter and husband are doing when I'm at the grocery store, or just to see which room my daughter is in and whether she's making a mess, but that's about it so far. Hoping to get more use out of them in the covid-free future. Anyway, for the price, you really can't beat these.
review_text_4: My husband and I just moved to a much larger city than we are accustomed to and bought this for our own practice of mind when our teenager is home alone. I didn‚Äôt expect much since the product was so cheap but let me tell you I was blown away with what I received! The picture quality is much better than expected, the sound quality with speaking through them is great, and the night vision works like a dream! I was expecting them to have cords from reading the reviews and those are the only downside! They are a little short but super easy to hide and extensions aren‚Äôt expensive to purchase! Will recommend.
review_text_5: This is a great product, one of the easiest devices I have ever set up, definitely worth the money

review_header_1: Great drone at a fantastic price
review_header_4: Exactly what I was looking for!
review_header_5: very helpful tech support & high quality video
review_text_1: The SYMA x300 is an amazing entry level drone a price I was at first skeptical about. After all, you get what you pay for right? Not here‚Ä¶.you get way more than you pay for. This drone packs feature that others don‚Äôt have at twice the price. The X300 comes with 2 batteries; the battery seems to go much longer than other drones. I think I got around 50 minutes of flying (25 minute per battery). Charge time is 1-2 hours per battery depending on the wattage of your plug. The remote is fantastic that comes with it. You can use it with or without your smart phone as the remote has an attachment arm that cradles your smart device for full screen action mode. The drone hovers at whatever height you set it to and you can take your hands off the control and it will sit stationary at the height the last input you gave it. So if you end up in a panic pilot situation, just let your thumbs off the joystick and it will stop in space. A feature that saves you from avoiding crashes and damage. On windy days, the trim is easy to adjust as well. So if you want to hover and the drone is blowing downwind, just push in the joystick and fly it against the wind for a second and you‚Äôre hovering in one spot. It‚Äôs that simple to tune it in any conditions. The input and responsiveness are spot on as well. Many drones in this price point will take a second or two to react to inputs instantly making the X300 an incredibly fun flying experience. One of the greatest features is a single button ‚Äúreturn to earth feature.‚Äù Just hit the button once and the X300 drone descends to earth and pauses millimeters above the ground before a gentle touchdown. I highly recommend this as a trainer drone to stepping into more expensive models when you want to progress into more advanced features which come at a high price tag. Fly this for a couple of weeks and you‚Äôll be glad you have the experience and confidence I gained immediately from my maiden flight. I plan to step up the SYMA X500 that a friend is flying now that I understand the basics of flight control. This will always be in my quiver for flying fun and for teaching new pilots the exciting world of remote drone flying. You won‚Äôt find a better drone in that ‚Äúunder $100 price point.‚Äù
review_text_2: Disclaimer: I own a DJI Mavic Pro, and started out with a Holy Stone quadcopter. I've flown smaller ones like the DJI Spark, which is similar in size. I would say that for the price, this is a five-star drone. You get a lot for $80.Pros:Small manageable size - the drone is large enough to make it feel like a nice machine, but small enough, especially when folded, to port around, which is nice because it lends itself to easy travel. You can also easily launch it and land it from and on your hand.Robust and reasonably crash proof - The blade guards seemed kind of flimsy, and didn‚Äôt stay on well, so I flew without them. The drone handled test crashes well. The propellers held up well, with only some minor scrapes after hitting the ground and nearby trees. The copter simply hit the ground and the arms folded in on impact.Quiet - The drone has a relatively quiet sound, and isn't too loud. I could talk to those next to me while flying without having to raise my voice while the copter was only a few feet away.Auto-flip function - This is fun. When executed, the drone flips in your specified direction, rolling quickly left, right, forward or backward and returning to hovering once completed. The flip function does not work once the battery drops below a certain percentage.LED lights for battery and connectivity - These are easy to see when on the ground and display info about the battery when charging or low, and connectivity when first powered on. The rear lights are green, and the ones in the front are red, but they can be hard to see in daylight once it gets more than about 30 feet away.Good range. I flew the drone about 70 or 80 feet away laterally without any problems, and about 40 feet up before coming down for fear of wind gusts. It worked fine, with no noticeable latency.Headless Mode - Great function for learning pilots, especially for a drone like this that has no camera feed. However, the instructions are quite confusing on how to engage this and it took me a solid 5 minutes of fiddling with the controls to get it to work. To get this to work, take off, hold the button at the top left of the controller until it starts beeping, and then push the stick forward. The forward-facing direction will remain that relative forward until this function is disengaged.Tuning - This was easy to do, and I liked the tactility of the joystick buttons. I found it worked well.Camera usability- The quality is good, and it is fun to use. However, I‚Äôm kind of in the middle on this, which is why the camera is in both the pros and cons. It does provide an accurate view of what the drone sees, and I didn‚Äôt have almost any lag. The picture resolution was nice. It‚Äôs not super easy to use, but I was able to figure out most of the controls while flying.Battery: This had a nice battery life, with about 22 minutes of battery life to 1.5 hours charging time. I didn‚Äôt stream video, which I would imagine uses a bit more battery, bt for my medium intensity flight, I was very happy with the flight time, especially considering that they give you two batteries, which could give you about 45 minutes of flight time.Cons:Unstable/Jerky Camera - Because the camera is hard-mounted to the drone body, the video is very twitchy and jerky as the drone flies around and tilts, particularly when descending. The video became very shaky. I found myself more inclined to use the photo option over the video though, because of how unstable it was. I also found the field of view to be frustratingly narrow, and wanted a more upwards view from the drone.Instructions aren't very clear - I found myself struggling to engage Headless mode, as well as set up the camera, one of the main selling points with this drone. I‚Äôve found this is a common issue with Syma instructions, and it just makes the products a lot harder to use. There are occasional typos, and the layout is confusing.
review_text_3: This is a great drone to fly around in the backyard. The assembly is quick and easy (even without the instructions) and flight is smooth and controlled.Only tip I would give is.... use outside only.When I was putting the drone together, I started the engines and the drone flew around my living room like a drunken sparrow. People jumping and dodging and running for cover.....it was awesome.....I mean......bad.Buy this drone and have many hours of fun (it includes 2 batteries).
review_text_5: The SYMA X300 foldable Drone is very friendly to use, I called the tech support for the installation and he was very helpful. It is good for the whole family also. I like the 1080p HD camera , the video is in high quality on my phone, I have an IPhone and it works great. You have to download the app called ‚ÄúSYMA FLY‚Äù there is a connection instructions there for you to connect to the phone.

name: Holy Stone 2K GPS FPV RC Drone HS100 with HD Camera Live Video and GPS Return Home, Large Quadcopter with Adjustable Wide-Angle Camera, Follow Me, Altitude Hold, 18 Minutes Flight, Long Control Range
review_header_1: Stable, Easy to Fly and Good Camera Quality
review_header_4: Easy to Setup and Fly; Reasonable Price;  Feature Packed
review_text_3: My husband bought the HS100 for my 60th birthday. Let me tell you I am one pleased grandma! I'm a newbie at flying drones. Right out of the package its a sleek looking drone. You will need to put on the blades and blade guards. The hardest part about that was holding those tiny little screws, lol. Batteries on reciever and drone charged, drone registered. Yes you have to register the drone with the FAA. Did it online, took 10 minutes and $5.00 and I had my numbers. Easy peasy. After following the calibration instructions the first flight went exceptionally well. The HS100 is responsive and very easy to fly. The follow me feature was a hoot. Almost like have a pet flying around following you.lol. And the RTH feature works very well. The drone comes to you very quickly stops near you and lands. Very cool indeed. The biggest reason my husband chose this drone was the camera. I have a small drone and the video is choppy at its best. Let me tell you what, the HS100's camera takes good pictures and decent video. I can actually use my VR headset with this drone and there's no choppiness! I absolutely LOVE the HS100. I have not found anything I don't like about this drone. Good quality drone that won't break the bank.
review_text_4: I‚Äôve been in the RC flying Hobby for 40+ years. I have avoided Helicopters/Drones because they are notoriously known to be hard to setup, maintain and fly. The HS100 is an amazing EXCEPTION. Assembly, Setup and Flying is unbelievably EASY. The HS100 has many features that are in much more expensive drones. If you want to get into Helicopters and Drones this is the product to buy. The RTH (Return to Home) and Auto Takeoff and Land features get you into the air and back down on the ground very quickly, with little risk of crashing. The camera and SD Card worked better than I expected. The HS100 price is just right. Not too expensive for all the features you get and NOT so inexpensive that it is feature lacking. The HS100 is feature abundant!Some Recommendations:Read the instructions carefully and a number of times before doing anything.Inventory the parts carefully before assembling the Drone.(I couldn't find some washers which were stuck down deep inside the box which I finally found).Make sure everything is fully charged, HS100, Transmitter and your Cell Phone.Insure your WiFi is turned on in your cell phone.You can fly the drone without a cell phone, but using one gives you a lots of extra status information so you get the HS100 flying quickly.Install the propeller guards. Some people think they may not look that great. They work and it beats replacing props in the event of an oops.A Good Routine:Have a spotter with you on your first few flights.Check and recheck everything before your first flight.Make a Check List. The instruction manual has a very good first flight check list (Good Starting Point).DON‚ÄôT fly if you see something wrong, FIX IT First!Buy an extra battery. 12 minutes is about average flying time.Some people complain that it's too short. Believe me, you have to concentrate on flying any RC model, 12 minutes is a long time.After flying, take a break, think about what happened and what you want to improve on.Take notes. Holy Stone provides a notebook (great idea). All good pilots use log books.Recharge the batteries then fly again (Drone & Transmitter).If you fly at a park with no power, you can get an inexpensive charger that runs off a 12v car outlet.Wether you fly full size aircraft or models, the rule is check and recheck to minimize something not setup correctly, thus avoiding the chance of a crash.When you are learning how to fly, the less distractions the better. Try to fly your first flight on a zero wind day (either early morning or in the evening when the wind is calm). The HS100 is very light, and very stable, so wind (if strong enough) can make the drone drift if you are not under GPS control.Remember: The HS100 has the auto controls so you can take off and land with almost no experience.However, if you want to start flying your drone far away and/or navigating around objects, you have to learn that the controls reverse as you change direction.When the Drone is flying away from you: the Left control turns the drone Left; the Right control turns the drone Right; This is from your view point to the drone.When the Drone is flying towards you Left control turns the drone to your Right, the Right control turns the drone to your Left. This is from your viewpoint to the drone.A real good thing to do is find a friend that has an RC flight Simulator so you can get the hang of flying an RC model if you never have flown one before. Simulators are not necessary, but they can help you master the controls without having to think about it. The more instinctively you can control the drone the less chance of a crash. Some hobby shops now offer using a Simulator for a few hours at a time. The more you practice, the better you will get at flying. No magic here, just practice!Once I got the hang of flying the HS100, I did a roof inspection on my house and my neighbors house which is a good use for Drones.Sorry for being so long winded. I wish I had someone giving me some tips so I could have avoided some of my oops. I hope my review will get people excited about flying and help them get into flying the HS100. The HS100 is an EXCELLENT product and a heck of a lot of FUN to fly!

review_text_1: Holy Stone has put out an excellent beginner quadcopter in the HS110D.We have another Holy Stone quadcopters and this one seems easier to operate.I took it out for the first time today and the experience was great so I was excited to share my views right away. (see video)The controller is easy to operate without taking your eyes off the quad. The display is very informative and clear so with a quick glance you know which of the 4 speed modes you are in, whether or not you are taking video.Your smartphone easy fits in the controller. I own an LG G4 and I had no problems.Four AA batteries are required and not included, but they are easy to insert with no need for a screwdriver.The battery: The HS110D only comes with one battery and is good for 10-15 minutes.As a newbie, you need a a wide-open space with grass or some other soft surface. It doesn't handle wind very well, so be careful. This is expected as it is a smaller drone.Make sure you snap the guards ALL the way in. It also includes two extra guards as well as a replacement for each propellor and replacement landing gear. The addition of landing gear to this design makes safe landings much easier than other quadcopters that have no landing gear.The card is easily removable, and Holy Stone included an adapter to plug it into your computer for transferring your videos to your computer.Customer service: My boyfriend had to contact Holy Stone for help with his first quad, but I can say their customer service is exceptional. They will go above and beyond to help you with any problems to make sure you are happy with your purchase.The only negatives to the HS110D: A second battery would be nice to have and watch out for wind!
review_text_2: The HS110D is an amazing camera drone. The app is completely different than the one I have for my other drone (HS160). It is so much better. The app for the HS110D is very clean an refined. Not to mention that there is a fairly accurate battery indicator inside of the app. When you are flying during the daytime and can‚Äôt see the lights on the drone, you will know when you have low battery. There is also a flip mode which is pretty cool for doing tricks, but seeing as this is mainly a camera drone I don‚Äôt see myself using that feature too much. The flip mode also serves a useful purpose as well as just for entertainment. Because the drone will not do flips when it is low battery, if you want to know when the drone is low battery you can just attempt a flip and the drone will not do it. The actual drone itself is pretty big, especially in comparison to some of the other Holy Stone drones that I own. It has three speed settings which is very useful because once you start flying the drone farther and farther away from you, it is difficult to determine the speed of the wind where the drone is. With multiple speed modes you can easily just kick up the speed to three and fight through the wind. The drone is strong enough that it will not be swept by the wind if you have it going fast enough. The camera on this drone (720p) is also really cool. I like the fact that it has the option to use the app and save the videos and photos directly to your phone, or save them to the included 4GB TF/microSD card. This is really useful since the drone app functions via wifi so since the wifi range is shorter than the transmitter range, you can fly it farther than the wifi and still capture excellent videos. The drone is also very stable. I really like the way it hovers in place. This is really useful because sometimes trying to take a shot of your family or something in front of a overlook is difficult. I‚Äôve found that I can just fly the drone up a few feet and it will stay in place. Then, I just put the remote down as it takes the picture. The large indicator lights on the bottom are very useful, since they tell you multiple things. They tell you if the drone is connected to the transmitter, if the drone is on low battery, if the drone is in headless mode, and if the drone is flying without problems. The remote is amazing, simply one of the best drone remotes I have ever used. The small LED screen at the bottom with indicator lights is so useful as it tells you the status of your drone. For example, it tells you what speed you are on, whether or not you are in headless mode, if you are in flip mode, if the drone is connected. The controls and remote itself are very ergonomically designed which is essential for flying a drone. You don‚Äôt want to be worrying about the pain in your hand when you should be paying attention to the drone! Put simply, the remote is amazing. It is a very responsive drone and overall really great. I would totally recommend to a friend, especially at the price point.
review_text_4: Don't let the size or the price fool you. This drone is a blast! I have many different quadcopters from toy grade to professional grade. This is "fun grade". Appears to be well made and sturdy. Only have a few flights so far but this has exceeded my expectations by far.Video is clear and latency is almost non-existent. There are compression artifacts visible on saved videos but not really objectionable for fun/hobby use. It's certainly good enough for fun FPV flying.Drone was super stable and I had to remind myself that there was no GPS on this one. Popped it up in a hover and it just stayed there. Climbed to 30-40 meters and it just stayed there. Altitude hold worked perfectly. Just what you need for amateur aerial videos without having to constantly manage altitude.Flight time to low battery warning is about 10 minutes. Battery can be charged while in the aircraft with included micro-USB cable.The Holy Stone app for smartphone worked perfectly and takes only seconds to setup and start flying FPV.Everything was simple to understand and use. Very pleased with this purchase.About the only "con" I can think of is that the instruction manual was a little hard to find as it was hidden under the drone packaging in the box. When I found it, I found another little surprise gift of pocket notebook with pad, post-it notes and pen that was included.

review_header_3: Outstanding performance and a great price!. For both beginners or advanced drone pilots.
review_text_2: The HS110G from Holy Stone came with a nice zipper carrying case with all the accessories needed, including 2 batteries and extra props. Startup was the same as the other drones, you have to pair the remote, calibrate the gyro, then register GPS signal. The initialization of this drone is probably the fastest I've seen yet, I was able to take off within 2 minutes of popping in the battery cartridge.With GPS locked in, the drone will maintain its location within roughly a square meter area, no matter the wind directions. I can't even deal with drones that don't have GPS anymore, it is a must-have feature. The camera mounted underneath is removable, but no adjustable positioning, the camera only points straight forward, but is wide-angle enough to catch almost any view.After a mix-up and a collision with a garden fence, the drone seemed to struggle maintaining balance during the next flight. I was concerned but then did a recalibration of the gyro and it performed much better, so it's important to remember to recalibrate during any hard landing or crash.Return to home seemed to behave differently, as most other drones rise up high to avoid obstacles, then navigate to home position, then drop down. This one maintained its current altitude, then slowly navigated and lowered to the starting point. This one has a unique button that can do an emergency power kill mid-flight. I didn't try it, but supposedly it will shut down the props and the unit just free-falls, perhaps a good safety-net with some of the reports of GPS flaking out in similar drone models and losing control of the drone.All in all this was a fun drone to play with and a good starter drone for the beginner!
review_text_3: I have a couple drones and other RC products. The Holy Stone HS110G stands out as one of the best I have flown. If you are interested in buying a drone or upgrading, please read this review. I will cover all the highlights of this drone. First, like some of the best products made, the packaging usually reflects the quality of the product. The HS110G comes in a perfect designed and well padded case for storage and transport. I actually have never seen a well designed case for an inexpensive product like this. It protects the drone, and is easy to keep things stored. I have considerable experience in the plastics industry. The HS110G drone is made from very durable quality plastic that can take an impact without breaking. The fit and finish is comparable to drones costing many times more. It is obviously engineered by a team that designs state of the art aesthetics with the best materials and functions. Both the controller and drone are robust. The controller has a great feel with a quality weight, not a cheap toy. So, how does it perform? I set it up first indoors. The instructions are clear and written with great visuals. I took extra care indoors. If this is your first drone, just tether the landing gear with string and a weight if you want to learn to hover and the controls. If outside just follow instructions and fly it. Easy! I took it outside with winds around 5 mpg with gusts, and flew it around the yard.Great Fun & Wow, stable and speeds adjusting from low to fast, for beginner to advanced. I really totally impressed. I went up to max saltitude and watched the sunsets and the next day sunrise. Very cool. I took a few images and videos. The camera resolution outperforms my other drones. Crisp and clear photo and video. Great to capture stunning vacation shots you could not get without a drone. I tested the follow me feature, auto take off and land, everything worked great. A real test is to see if a drone comes home if something unexpected happens. I sent the drone at high altitude towards the woods. It disappeared at great distance. I actually thought I lost it. A minute or so later it came right back and landed. I was totally amazed. So, if you want a high quality drone that is affordable, easy and fun to fly with a camera and all the needed features, the Holy Stone HS110G is the one to buy. For yourself, a loved one, or to give as a gift. You will be totally pleased. I hope this helps. Have fun flying......

review_text_2: This is the first drone i ever got and I couldn't be happier with it.1st the price, quality drone at a very competitive price. I suggest to get the flymore version that comes with 3 batteries and few other accessories, its well worth the extra $100 to get the flymore version for all the extra accessories.2nd quality and weight, I couldn't believe how light this drone is at such a small size and yet very stable hoovering in the mid air. Good camera and video quality.I am extremely happy with this drone, couldn't ask for more for such a quality drone at a very good price. Highly recommended.
review_text_4: This is a video shot taken by me with the drone. It is small and has a good endurance of nearly half an hour. The night capability is a bit worse, but it is worth the price!
review_text_5: Trying to get this thing to work was the worst experience I have had with an Item I had such high expectations for. Most likely will never try a drone again. I must add that you should not have to purchase a 5 or 6 hundred dollar phone to operate this machine properly. The DJI Fly App is not available with all 3 of my smartphone phones. Potential buyers of this drone should be aware of this before hand. Make sure you can download the "fly app" in its entirety before you order this drone. Other apps will not work properly. Returned for new and changed phone, result is outstanding!

review_text_1: I have a much better security camera system for my home's exterior but thought I might try one of these cams indoors since I have the Ring alarm system and a Ring Doorbell already. I made the silly mistake, I guess, of assuming there would be some kind of integration with other Ring products - there isn't. None. Not a single thing.It seems like common sense to me that they'd integrate in a couple of ways. I assumed that I'd be able to tell these cameras to only sense motion if the alarm was armed. Nope.I figured I could at least set it to detect motion when I wasn't in the house. Nope. There isn't even any kind of proximity setting for it to even know if you're home or not. They are not location aware in any way. The Ring alarm system isn't either, so I suppose I should have known better already.I also assumed that if my Ring alarm went off the cameras would automatically come on and start recording. Nope!The only motion option at all is to not alert you to motion during specific hours. Note, this doesn't stop motion detection during these hours, it only stops the alerts.Motion detection/recording is only an on or off thing... absolutely no options whatsoever.Annoyed by the lack of integration I still mounted the camera in my great room. I figured I try it for a few days and see how long the battery would actually last with motion recording on. This is a high traffic area so I wasn't holding my breath... and sure enough, after not even 1 full day the battery is down to 80%. This is with all the 'battery saving options' on. This was only a test as I don't actually want recording of any kind going on in my house while I'm home unless the alarm is armed or going off.With absolutely no options, no integration with Ring alarm and no settings to limit it's recording this thing is really only good for one thing; on demand video with no automatic recording. So, the thing is turned off now, doing nothing. I can still activate it from my phone to occasionally check my house isn't burning down.Hopefully someday Ring will update the software and provide some common sense integration with it's other devices.This is all a shame as the build of the camera is quite good considering the low price as is the video quality. The audio isn't great but it never is on cameras of any kind.***UPDATE***Ring support reached out to me directly almost immediately after I posted my review (Good on them) and told me how to link the Alarm, somewhat, to the camera. You have to go into your Base Station settings, then linked devices, then you can set the cameras to record when the alarm goes off - but only then. Make sure you have the updated app that just came out to do this. I didn't. Again, the setting is in your base station, not in the cameras.This solved probably the biggest issue I had with the camera. The rest of my review is still accurate though per Ring support. Hopefully they'll add the other much needed features in the near future.***ANOTHER UPDATE***From Ring Support: "The Modes feature will be released in November and will allow you to have the option to record motion only if the Ring Alarm System is set to Away Mode". This will be a great update and should have been available on launch. I wonder if they are only just now thinking of it from all the negative feedback and reviews, but glad it's 'coming soon' either way.***ONE MORE UPDATE***Ring provided me early access to the 'Modes Feature' and I've been using it for the past few days. It resolves all the issues I had with the alarm integration. With modes you can set your cameras to only record when your alarm is set. They can all be set independently and act differently depending on if you have your alarm set to off, home, or away. For instance, you can set your exterior cameras to record when your alarm is set to home mode, but have your interior cameras are turned off. You can set your interior cameras to only record while in away mode, etc. etc. Or any combination. The cameras can now be set the same way motion and door sensors can. This is a great improvement. They haven't told me exactly when this feature will be made public but have said it will be released 'by the end of the year'.I've increased the rating from 3 stars to 5. This software update really has resolved every issue I had with the cameras. I've now ordered and installed an additional 6 for my home.***LAST UPDATE***Having the modes features and my cameras set to only pop on and record during an alarm event (which is rare) and be off at all other times, I've had 2 months to evaluate battery life, almost exactly 60 days now. All my cameras were down to below 10% battery level when I checked them last night. Given the rate of battery drain I had expected them to last 3 months - though 2+ still isn't bad. I have two external cameras on my entry gates outside with the solar panel add-on, they stay fully charged at all times even though it's pretty much been non-stop dark and cloudy days here since installation. They are set to record all motion and since they point at a street they record events dozens of times per day... so if you're thinking of getting the solar panels for outdoor use, I highly recommend them.
review_text_2: Before I start my revised review, let me state that there's been a lot of news lately about people hacking into Ring cameras, but this only happens when someone installs a new camera and doesn't update the default username and password (or has an extremely weak password which is easy for a hacker to guess). This is like leaving your front door open while on vacation. Your camera is sending and receiving signals over a wireless network. Anyone within range of the signal can potentially be a threat if you don't have good encryption (username and good password) set up on your camera. There's no logical reason for a Ring owner to not do this. Ring even stresses changing the default settings during the initial setup process. Bottom line, don't blame the car manufacturer if you leave the keys in your car and it gets stolen.----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Recently, I wrote a rather scathing 1 star review about the problems I was having with my new Ring Stick Up Wireless Battery Cam. I'm no stranger to wireless cams, having 10 hooked up and running seamlessly on another network as I write this, but I was totally frustrated with the connection reliability, not only with my two upper end cellphones, but also on my Galaxy Tab and Amazon Show. More times than not, the software wouldn't connect with the camera but when it did, the video was choppy. Notifications were also hit and miss. I have a great wireless mesh router system throughout the house, so after doing all the troubleshooting I could think of, I assumed it was due to faulty hardware or software. I gave up and started the return process through Amazon. It was a new product after all and new products sometimes are really buggy. Plus, I read other negative reviews which seemed to justify my thoughts and actions.Then I got an email from a gentleman from Ring saying he read my review and asked if I'd be willing to let him help troubleshoot my issues with me. Although I had already started the return process, I was willing. It was refreshing to know Ring Customer Service was genuinely interested in troubleshooting possible defects in their newest product.Together, we isolated the issue within about 20 minutes. It turned out it wasn't the camera or software after all.Anyone having connection issues should do what he advised me to do. Open up the Ring app and click on the 3 little dots to the upper right of the camera screenshot, then select settings. From there go to Device Health and check the signal strength. Although I had a good mesh hub (inside) within 10 feet of my camera (mounted outside), my signal strength was RSSI -64. He stated that the signal was so weak it was on the cusp of what is needed for the camera to even minimally operate. This prompted me to reboot my wireless mesh system and reset/reconnect the camera. When it came back online, my signal strength went to -39, a vast improvement.A quick check of all of my devices showed the camera and software working flawlessly. Hat's off to Ring.Anyone who may be having connection or audio/video/notification difficulties, check your signal strength to the camera via the Ring software, even if your router is close by. You just might be surprised.***UPDATE***Camera (and software) is still working flawlessly on all devices.Ring has now updated their Windows 10 desktop app (which previously didn't work with the new wireless battery cams) and it works flawlessly as well.Observations.Notifications on my phone, Tab and Amazon devices (Show, Echo, Dot) are almost instantaneous. Alexa says "Someone is at your front door." Very cool.I bought an extra battery, but it looks like it'll be at least a few months before I need to swap it out, even with the intensive testing I've done on the Stick Up Cam. Battery life seems excellent.I have one zone blocked out and that seems to work fine as well. I also have it mounted a couple of feet above and to the left of my front door, tilting downward at an angle. Even though residential traffic is visible in the field of view, I've not gotten one trigger due to street activity. The motion sensor is triggered by anything coming into the bottom half of it's field of view. From the time someone triggers the motion sensor until the time I'm aware of it is 1-2 seconds. That's about as close to real time as you can get. It's not given me a false alarm even once.Telling my Amazon Show to "(Alexa), show front door cam" takes about 5 seconds to complete.I can also watch triggered video clips and get a live feed while away from home without any extra setup to my network. It's totally automatic.Because of the customer service I received from Ring and the fact the product is much better than I originally thought, I will be expanding my Ring family soon.
review_text_3: Had the camera up and running in less than ten minutes. Excellent quality picture. Hooking up to the solar panel when installing, this way battery is always charged. Received mounting hardware, camera has been installed.
review_text_4: Installed 2 of these outside my house in about 20 minutes. Mounted one above my garage and the other near my front door. The video quality is pretty good. Not facial recognition software good but good enough for a good description of people if needed. I used the mounts that came will the camera and scanned the QR code for setup. Not sure why people couldn't set up zones. It is part of the setup unless you skip over the steps. I do agree with most reviews that the notifications are spotty. Took my trash out and the one by the garage only recorded me going to the side of the house and the one by the front door only recorded me coming back. A neighbor walked by this morning and it started recording after they walked by and were down the street. Pic attached. Went outside again and the both cameras picked me up as I would have expected. I will adjust the camera and reset the zones to see if that helps. They are my first Ring cameras so there may be fine tuning on my part that is needed. Will update this as the days go by.Windows 10 app logs me in but says I don't have any cameras set up. Tried on a PC and 2 laptops. Please fix!!Phone apps are pretty good so far. (Samsung note 9)Updating to 5 Stars.....After adjusting my zones and motion settings I was able to get the results I needed. At one point the wind blew leaves across my driveway and my sensor went off. After fine tuning I see no issues with the camera and its performance. It is by far better than other cameras I have purchase over the years and after comparing subscriptions from other companies $10 a month or $100 is a deal.
review_text_5: Don‚Äôt let any negative reviews influence your decision to buy these cameras. The negative reviews are from people who have not read the instructions or just have no idea how a security camera works. I monitor 16 security cameras where I work so I have a lot of experience with them. I bought the Ring Stick up camera and the solar charger for it as well. They both work great. I bought two more a week later. Now a month later I have no issues with battery power loss of any kind. Just set your zones to cover what you want. Don‚Äôt put motion sensor on full or you will catch bugs and falling leaves. I set my sensitivity in the middle. The image quality day and night is pretty good. You can also look at your cameras from a computer as well as your phone. You don‚Äôt need an Alexa to use these. The microphone works well too. Overall I would highly recommend these if you just read and understand the instructions and how they work which is very simple and easy.MD in SC 1-1-21

review_header_3: Great mini camera for checking what is going on.
review_text_1: For the price, they‚Äôre are absolutely amazing little cameras! Sure, they could be better, but they are tiny and inexpensive, so I‚Äôm pretty happy. I bought 2. One isn‚Äôt working properly, but Amazon offered a replacement with zero hassle, so I‚Äôm set!
review_text_2: I really like the compact shape of this camera, it can be installed in any small position, but I encountered some doubts during the setting of the camera. In desperation, I contacted the seller support and quickly got help. The camera is now working.Video quality is not bad.One thing that really impresses me is the motion detection,It will accurately send remote alert notifications to my phone and receive captured photos.
review_text_3: I have roomates and sometimes it is nice to check the door, if they forget it open. So it is nice for security reasons. The image is ok too.
review_text_4: For such a tiny little camera the picture is great! Very surprised. My husband did set up and took him maybe 15 minutes to figure it all out. It also notifies you with motion.
review_text_5: Bought this to keep an eye on the house while we are out ! Absolutely love it ! Picture quality is fantastic and battery life is wonderful!
