review_header_5: I real drone not a toy- but easy to operate in begginer mode
review_text_1: The HS 700E is at the top of the market in this price point. It is built solid and fly's very well. You will need to register with FAA via the drone zone due to it being over 250 grams. It comes with two sets of quick change propellers, that's right, no screws here, two batteries, controller and a soft case with foam insert for all the above to keep them safe. You can fly this via GPS with with or without a phone or tablet. If you want to fly first person view and use all the additional features via the Ophelia Go app you will need a phone or tablet that is capable of connecting to the drones 5G wi-Fi network. The controller connects to the drone via 2.4 ghz. 400 feet high is the limit in the USA and you will have no issue reaching that. In my testing I can get out about 500 to 600 feet distant at 400 ft altitude before losing video connection, your phone may be different. Its definitely far enough to get some great still shots or 4k video. The drone accepts up to a 128gb Micro SD card. I have a hard time getting the sd card out of the slot without using tweezers due to it laying flat against the body surface but not a big issue. With GPS locked the drone holds position very well even in 15mph wind and the Electronic Stabilization does a pretty good job of keeping the shake to a minimum. Without a camera gimble you will see the horizon tilt if the drone is tilted by the wind. Picture quality is pretty darn good at this price point. You can control the cameras up and down motion from the remote control but I wish it moved a little slower and precisely. It has a return to home feature that worked every time I tried it. This is a great feature if you lose connection with the drone. Pre-flight set your RTH altitude to get over the highest object in your area, and up and back it will come. Like I said this drone is solid. It doesn't have the foldable arms that break when you crash. I pushed it a few times and hit some metal poles. I dented a few props but the drone is unscathed.There are many more features I'm not going to cover here but overall I'm happy with this. ***I would not recommend this for a beginner especially a child or teen due to its complexity and weight. This could hurt someone if it fell out the sky or if the props were driven into someone. IF your an adult you certainly could work your way through the instructions, calibrating the compass, as well as getting info from several Holystone Facebook groups. If not I highly recommend starting with a toy drone such as the Holystone HS190 with prop guards( or similar HS models) on so you can learn the basic controls of up/down, forward/backward, left/right, and the confusing for beginners, Axis left/right. It will save you from a lot of heartache.Don't expect this to perform like the thousand dollar drones out there and you will be very pleased. Its a great platform to learn from and another hit from Holystone.

review_header_1: This is by far my favorite drone!
review_header_5: Amazing drone for such a low price point!
review_text_3: I own about 6 drones now. Some are just toys for playing with indoors, but I do have another more expensive drone that is GPS enabled and that I have a lot of fun with outside. However, that drone only has a flight time of about 10 minutes, I believe due to the weight, it's very heavy for a drone. If you‚Äôre just getting into drones, I think this is a great budget beginner drone. You won‚Äôt have the range of a DJI Mini, which this drone is very similar to, but you can have the same experience up to a limited range for more than 1/3 of the price.First, when you open the package, you‚Äôll notice a great carrying case that fits everything, including the drone, controller, two batteries, chargers and spare props. All my other drones are in the original boxes they came in or lying around loose. This case is just another great feature of this drone.The batteries on this drone last about 20 minutes each. They‚Äôre lightweight and have a much better-charging cable than previous drones. Unlike most that use the troublesome micro USB port, these use a usb cable that attaches to the battery solidly and easily. I personally hate micro USBs, as they seem to fit poorly and wear out over time. The Controller still uses the micro USB, but this isn‚Äôt charged near as often as the batteries.One thing to note on the batteries. There is a red cap that covers the battery connection on the drone. You should keep this. This piece allows you to store a battery in the drone without the electrical connection being made. Electronic equipment should never be stored with batteries connected, as it can damage both the battery and the equipment.This HS175D isn't near as heavy as my HS270. This drone is very compact and only weighs about 216 grams. I‚Äôve also noticed this drone obtains GPS signal faster than my other drones and with 20+ minutes of flight time, I‚Äôm completely happy with that. The app that you use on the phone will walk you thru setup and preparation for flight making it quick and easy.The drone‚Äôs camera has a single axis gimble, allowing you to rotate it 90 degrees, from straight ahead to straight down. So, while you lose some ability to move in 3 directions like you would with a drone like the DJI Mini 2, you gain rigidity that protects the camera in the event of a crash. The app doesn‚Äôt have a lot of camera control for things like exposure, but it does work well for pictures and video.Other than the camera, the other difference between a high-end drone like the DJI Mini 2 is the connection between the camera and drone. Not to get too technical because both use Wi-Fi signals, but the DJI Mini 2 uses Occusync, which gives you a range of up to 11k yards (6+ miles), whereas this drone uses Wi-Fi on a 5Ghz channel, which has a longer range than say a 2.4Ghz signal, but it is limited and doesn‚Äôt like interference from solid objects. If you were operating in maximum conditions (no interference at all from other Wi-Fi signals and no physical interference, you might expect a range of about 650 yards at best. I think a more practical limit would be about 350 yards.When operating outdoors, you should keep a clear line of sight with your drone, or you may lose connection, and you won't be able to navigate with the camera. The range of the controller is better and not subject to the same limitations, so you'll still be able to control the drone, you just won't have the camera.

description: UranHub Drone with 2K CameraUltra HD 1152P Camera Drone The 2K camera captures crystal clear aerial photos and 2048 X 1152 @ 25fps videos. With adjustable camera design, you can catch every moment of your adventure from a bird-eye perspective.Trajectory Flight Simply draw a flight course on your app interface, and this drone will fly following the path accordingly. There are 5 ratio options available to meet all kinds of needs.Gesture Control Gesture control allows you to pose to the camera to trigger phone taking and video recording. Pose a Victory Sign to the camera, the drone will take a photo in countdown of 3 secs; pose an Open Palm Sign to the camera, the drone will start or end video recording. Now you can set your hands free and pose your most charming gesture or dance with your loved one.Voice Control This UranHub drone allows you to TALK to your drone to control the direction it moves, which significantly simplifies the operation of the drone for beginners/kids and adds fun to your flight. Recognizable commands: Take off, Land, Forward, Backward, Left, Right, and Stop.Gravity Control The Gravity Sensor Mode enables the quadcopter to follow the direction you move your smartphone. Control the drone just like you are playing Speed Racing.3D Flip Fly the drone to a height over 2 meters. Simply press the 3D Flip button and move the right control stick to flip the drone 360¬∞ accordingly, which provides stunt aerial show.Altitude Hold Built-in 6 axis gyroscope will automatically holds the altitude and the position of the drone, making this drone more friendly to beginners.

review_text_1: Every time it takes off it veers HARD to the right. Day one and propellers are busted.EDIT** DeeRC contacted me after my 1 star review, and sent me a free replacement drone. Great Customer Service! They Made it Right quick and helped me trouble shoot what could have gone wrong the first time! Took it on its first flight and everything handled beautifully. Great drone
review_text_3: I was having a blast learning to fly this drone. It is easy to learn, control, trim, shoot video etc. Today I thought I'd take it for a short flight. Fired it up, calibrated it, checked for GPS mode and took off. Set it to climb and go forward ......beautiful. It leveled off and gave me the "max height" announcement. 30 seconds later I tried to turn it, tried to stop it and it just kept going straight. Eventually the wifi signal was too weak to return video but I could see the distance continuing to increase...800.....900..... I believe 1188 was the last distance reading. I thought "not to worry, it should return home in GPS mode" once it senses a loss of signal. Wrong. It appears to be gone. This happened about 90 minutes ago and I'm just sick as it was a gift from my wife. I'm hoping to get a replacement but am not very hopeful. Will update if seller gets back to me. 1 starUPDATE: Seller has been silent.UPDATE: Received response from "Hellen" the seller offering 50% refund or a replacement drone. I have requested a replacement, have added a star & will wait for it to arrive to let you know in a further update. 2 starsUPDATE: Seller has asked for a 5 star review before sending a replacement which is something I cannot do. However, I am upgrading my review to 3 stars as a token of good will and on the basis that a review of my email indicates the seller attempted to reach me a total of six times prior to my reading their offer. (Spam folder) This seems to indicate diligence on their part. At present I am optimistic and I will be sure to let you know how it goes.UPDATE: New Drone arrived about 15 minutes ago! Package looks like it has been opened previously but contents appear to be in new condition. Waiting for the batteries to charge & will update as soon as I have a couple test flights completed. Upgraded review to 5 stars.
review_text_5: I received this drone today and was amazed at the quality and features. The app is very user friendly. This drones app talks to you ! Yeah no kidding if the compass needs calibration it tells you.I would recommend it to anyone

review_header_1: Very impressed- great pic of a trespasser
review_text_2: I made a review about another camera system on under this camera. For that, I apologize to the seller. I realized the mistake I made while shopping for cameras for someone and I decided to look at the reviews.I've had this system in my home since March of 2021. The battery was strong and would last for 2 months. But now it last for maybe a week or so.Other than that, this camera system works great. I was not pressured into buying any upgrades and I love that I can use a SD card as an option. I will be ordering for the other person.
review_text_5: Vicoo, dct and kityhawk are all the same camera's with minor varieties, their apps are the same, but named different, they are a 1080p generic camera.The cam works great and has 3 levels of IR light, also has an led flashing light that can be set to flash during an alarm. It also has an alarm and 2 way talk and an alarm sound you can turn on, motion has 3 settings from low to high and looks great in color during the day and black and white in night vision.You can record to a mini sd card of 128gb, or 20 seconds without cloud service or micro sd card, it has digital zoom with no zoom lens, comes with 2 types of mounting brackets, 2 way tape and mounting screws.I just ordered my second camera and you can add up to 5 more camera's.Notifications to my cell due to an alarm is almost instant every test I ran a was under or around 2 seconds.The camera is well built and totally wireless, has a nice loud 2 way speaker, no cords at all and can be hooked up in less then a minute. I added a 128gb card and use the cloud storage for $4 a month, the longer you subscribe, the cheaper, ex 1 month, 6 months and 12 months.The camera is waterproof, the only problem with these is that they don't work with Alexa but send video over wifi to your phone, still working on getting a cam app I can use my tv to display camera's, I'm trying tiny cam pro and will update my review when finished.The wireless battery can last up to 6 months before needing recharge (mine is mounted outside for over a week now and my battery is at 98%.)when mounted within an area with low traffic. This camera comes with the recharge cord but no plug, it uses a macro plug instead of usb-c.Directions are English and makes sense, the app has a zone setting were you can change the area you want covered which cuts down false alarms. This camera is really a generic A@lo.

review_header_5: Lots of features for such a tiny camera
review_text_2: This little camera has a lot of features. It is so small, you can literally put this camera anywhere and it won't be seen that easily. What i like most about this camera is it stays connected to wifi, not like some of them out there. Another good thing about this camera is when it's dark, you don't see the traditional red infrared lights in the front of the camera which even makes it more discreet. It offers micro sd card and cloud service. I use the micro sd feature and it works very well. It does run on battery for about an hour but can stay plugged in indefinitely. If you like small discreet cameras like this one all i can say is get one, you won't regret it.
review_text_4: This camera is a very tiny wifi based camera that will have a variety of use cases. I believe that it is important to know what it is and can do in order to know if it will work for you. Image quality and other basic features are fine. You can configure motion based recordings if you have storage installed as well.What this camera is not - It is not an IP cam accessible outside the app. This means that it is not possible to use it with 3rd party applications.What this camera is - It is a well designed piece of hardware that opens up some interesting use cases. For example, the mounting system is magnetic which means you can simply stick it to any surface that a magnet would normally stick to and easily retrieve it later without leaving any marks. It does come with a little self stick mount for surfaces that are not magnetic as well.Note that while the Android app functions as promised, there are a few rough edges with the current version. There are multiple ways of connecting to the camera, but the wifi method requires ignoring the onscreen instructions a little bit. The following steps are currently the correct instructions for adding via wifi:1) Reset the camera to make sure other connection types are removed by inserting a paper clip into the reset button for approximately 5 seconds. After releasing the button allow around 60 seconds for a full restart.2) In the app, select "Add Camera" -> WIFI Connection. Immediately select "I heard the beep". Note that this model (mine is the X5) does not have a speaker so there will be no beep.3) Select your 2.4Ghz wifi connection. The camera does not support 5Ghz, but your phone will see it listed.4) Point the camera at the QR code displayed on the app. While you are doing this watch the blue power light. Since there is no beep, once the blue light flashes, press Next.5) The app should confirm the connection and you should have access to your camera.

No wiring, no professional installation required.,Get motion detection alerts on your phone with the option to customize motion zones in the Blink Home Monitor app so you‚Äôre only alerted when you need to be.,See, hear, and speak to visitors with live view in real time and two-way audio features on your Blink app.
name: Blink Outdoor - wireless, weather-resistant HD security camera, two-year battery life, motion detection, set up in minutes ‚Äì 2 camera kit
review_header_1: Neighborhood package thief will be CAUGHT and PROSECUTED with this crazy clear video!
review_header_3: I actually purchased the product.  1st time user of Blink.
review_header_5: What an awesome wireless system...buying more!
review_text_2: This new camera is better then the Blink xt2 ! It has been totally re-engineered. Take it from someone who owns all the different cameras Blink had to offer since day one and had to get on a waiting list to get the very first one. So, I should know what iam talking about. This new camera no longer has the push down and pull system to open the back to install batteries. It has a large screw that you simply unscrew with a included tool to open the back of the camera which is really nice. Once you open the back and install the included batteries scan the small QR code inside the camera threw the blink app it will scan to find the camera once that is done it will automatically do a firmware update. After that you are ready to install your new blink camera. Also noticed the sound is much louder and more clear then the other cameras. This is good if two people are talking in a low voice you can hear what they are saying. Has brighter clearer night vision. Nice clear voice communication with two way talk. Alot stronger wifi signal to sink module and from sink module to camera. Sharp, clear, bright, and colorful HD vision during the day. I noticed before I wrote this review that some people only gave this camera 2 or 3 stars. Like the guy who is complaining about software issues. Well if you follow the directions you would not have that problem. Let the camera finish its firmware update. Duh ! Also, if you have been a Blink customer for a while and want to add this camera to your current system. You do not have to pay for cloud storage you are grandfathered in. After you add this camera to your existing system it will actually tell you this ! The front of the camera has a all new face with a very smooth and shinny surface iam sure to help combat the weather and give it a more high tec look. Their is no longer a switch inside the camera to turn on or off the blue recording light located on the front of the camera. It's is all done threw the app which is really nice as well. They really did a good job in re-engineering this camera and listened to customer complaints about their past cameras and went threw and fixed every issue. I would definitely buy this camera again ! UPDATE : 09-25-20 After using this camera for a couple of days. And as other reviewers have noted that this camera only has a 25 foot motion trigger ! Anything further than 25 feet it will NOT record when motion is present. So if you need a camera get the Blink XT2 for the further range. This camera will only be good for specific areas like door or window that are within the 20 to 25 foot range from the camera.
review_text_3: It's super easy. Works great. Setup was simple. It works exactly as advertised. What I didn't know for sure is that the batteries are just high quality AA batteries. So when they die, you can get some rechargeable ones and just rotate them through the thing. I'm going to order a couple more. They are pretty great. *Edit-A nice person took the time to let me know it's best not to replace w/ traditional AA batteries.
review_text_4: So far everything is as advertised. Setup was a breeze and the image quality is great - especially when set to ‚Äúbest.‚Äù I really appreciate the custom activity zones that you can set, as well as the ability the turn off the led light.In terms of improvement, the included mount is pretty basic. For better or worse the mount snaps into the back of the camera module. This makes installing it relatively easy, but also means anyone could detach it with a firm pull. I‚Äôve noticed that there are upgraded mounts that you buy, but haven‚Äôt had a chance to fully check those out yet.Lastly, I noticed another reviewer mentioned subscription pricing, but it‚Äôs a bit misleading. Yes, there is cloud storage that you can pay for, but there are multiple levels, including a free plan, as well as a basic plan for $3/month. Also, the paid plans don‚Äôt start until 2021. More importantly, What this camera has, that the XT2 doesn‚Äôt, is local storage. If you‚Äôre big on privacy, and don't want to store videos on the cloud, you can attach a USB drive to the blink module and save your videos there (see photo which shows the usb drive). There‚Äôs no fee for saving your videos locally - you can still get alerts and watch your video feed live for free.
review_text_5: What an awesome product...total install took 25 minutes. I put 3 camera‚Äôs up outside to monitor my summer home. One of the camera‚Äôs I places on a pole in the yard pointing at the roof so I can monitor snow fall and snow melt roof system. The app was friendly. I shared the app with my wife and she was up and running in 2 minutes with minimal effort. We are so happy with this wireless system.

review_text_1: Everything with this camera is easy from setup to monitoring and the battery life is incredible. I bought this in November and 5 months later the battery is going strong. Picture quality is outstanding both during the day and nighttime. Couldn't be happier with this purchase.
review_text_2: full review coming soon, but so far, these are pretty cool. The app works on Galaxy S9 confirmed.This is a great product. Please do not change anything!
review_text_3: Easy to connect to WiFi and easy to install. Picture quality good.Night vision good.
review_text_4: Nice clear picture. East to install. Worked well with my iPhone.
review_text_5: Very easy camera to set up using phone app. Picture is really good, and even without an SD card inserted yet it is storing several images for review through the app. Of course I will install an SDCard when I get one. The unit is compact but looks hardy and should last a while. Battery life looks very good, but that is also based on the activity the camera is surveilling.

description: Security at its Brightest. Zoom in to see and record video in 2K with HDR for a clearer, undistorted picture, day or night. Connects directly to Wi-Fi without the clutter of extra gear. The flood lights outdoor camera illuminates your property with 2000 lumens of brightness or up to 3000 lumens with the outdoor magnetic charging cable. The flood light camera is wire-free and weather-resistant to deliver fast, easy installation and flexibility to get the perfect camera view, year-round. With the floodlight wireless security camera, see important features like faces, licenses plates, and pets in full color, at night with color night vision to make the perfect surveillance camera and pet camera. Get the big picture with 160¬∞ diagonal view. Receive smarter alerts for quicker action. With 3-months of Arlo's Secure plan included, receive notifications for people, vehicles and packages and take quicker action like sound the siren, call a friend or dial emergency services.* Ward off unwanted guests by triggering the siren or floodlight automatically or manually from the Arlo App. Works with Amazon Alexa, Google Assistant, Apple HomeKit*** and Samsung SmartThings. Requires Arlo Outdoor Magnetic Charging cable (sold separately) to emit up to 3000 lumens. *Arlo Secure includes cloud recordings of video clips at 2K or lower resolution for 30 days. Renewal of an Arlo Secure subscription is required to maintain Arlo Secure features, including cloud storage, advanced object detection, rich notifications, quick responses, cloud activity zones. Arlo Secure service not available in certain counties. ****Apple HomeKit compatibility for Arlo Pro 3 Floodlight requires connection to a compatible SmartHub or Base Station - sold separately.

name: Arlo Pro 4 Spotlight Camera - 2 Pack - Wireless Security, 2K Video & HDR, Color Night Vision, 2 Way Audio, Wire-Free, Direct to WiFi No Hub Needed, Black - VMC4250B
review_text_1: I've only just gotten my cameras set up, so I can't comment on their overall effectiveness. Initializing the cameras was fairly easy, although one wouldn't detect the QR code right away, but was fine after a factory reset.Additionally, consider buying directly from the Arlo website. I didn't realize until after I bought them that Arlo offers 1 year of protection against the theft of your cameras if you don't purchase them through a third party like Amazon. That piece of mind would have been worth it to me.I was surprised by the included mounting hardware. I expected to find 3 of the small magnetic mounts, which are attached to the wall with just one screw and to the camera with a magnet. I didn't think that sounded very secure, so I ordered 3 of Arlo's pivoting screw mounts. It turned out that the box of cameras contained 1 smaller pivoting screw mount already, though, so I am returning one of the ones I bought.
review_text_2: I have purchased three Arlo Pro 4 cameras. They connected to my WiFi network with ease. They promptly notify me when motion is detected. I've been extremely pleased with my purchases & will likely purchase another one.
review_text_3: There was a robbery at gunpoint in the middle of the day on our street. The neighbors camera caught a lot of video that the police officers could use to catch and prosecute the guy. This is my first outside security camera I have ever had and I absolutely love it! I like that you can pause the notifications it send you for different periods of time. I also like that you can look at your videos and use a filter for it to only show you videos (in your history) of animals. In the app, you can also pause videos (or not) and zoom in while reviewing videos. I made a suggestion to the technology support that it would be nice to have the ability to select which zones (that you have set up) will trigger the camera. I asked him, ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs the sense in setting up zones if you can‚Äôt pick and choose which zone(s) you want to monitor for a certain period of time?‚Äù (like, monitoring/triggering only zone 1 at night and monitoring all zones during the day) I had to set up my zones so that the tree branches would not trigger the camera when they blew in the wind. The only problem now is that the shadows of the tree branches on my driveway often trigger the camera. Overall, this is a great camera for the price and if I were to buy another one, it would be an Arlo.
review_text_4: The camera comes securely packaged and ready to operate after a quick battery charge. I did have a bit of trouble getting the owner's manual to download. It went fine on my iPad, but when I tried to get a backup copy to my laptop, I received an error number that then took me to a 'tech chat' option. Sadly, that was a connection to some scammers (in my opinion) who tried to sell me some very expensive and unnecessary security. They told untruths and pressured me a lot. Arlo needs to know this and the bad impression of the Arlo company they conveyed. The camera itself, though is fine and gives clear images. Just a warning here for folks who might run into the same situation.

name: VOSKER V150-V | LTE Cellular Security Camera, No Wi-Fi Needed | Security Pack | Solar-Powered Wireless Outdoor Surveillance Camera | Receive Photos on Your Mobile App from Virtually Anywhere (V150-V)
review_header_1: Well Made, Love The Added Security Pack, Easy to Use, Set It & Forget It!
review_text_1: This LTE security camera works as described! First off, the camera itself feels nicely made and doesn't feel cheap. It includes everything you need in the box, microSD card included. It is very easy to setup and start using. You must charge the battery manually before first use. This took quite a few hours, but it's to be expected. Make sure you charge the battery externally from the camera. This pack includes their security lock box and cable. These are very well made and make tampering with the device a lot more difficult. If someone really wanted it, they would need some special tools to get to it.Once the battery is charged, you're good to complete the setup. The app walks you through everything and the app itself is very user friendly. Because this camera works over LTE networks, there is a subscription plan you must have to use it, There is a 7 day Elite package trial which includes unlimited photos and up to 40 HD photos. When motion is detected the camera sends a low quality image to your phone - typically takes about 4 to 5 seconds to receive it. The quality of this image is low for most standards, but you can still make out what is going on. I have attached some samples of the lower quality images to this review. If you wish to see the image in high resolution, you have to request it. It will send the HD photo when the next communication is with the camera (so you won't get the HD photo right away). I have also attached a few samples of the HD photos, as well.The camera lens itself on this camera is not bad for what it is. It's not a very wide angle lens, so be aware. The camera quality on the HD photos is pretty good and the night vision works just fine.My camera has been mounted for about a week from the writing of this review and it has been at 100% battery ever since. The solar panel does a great job keeping the camera charged and active. It has been through rain, snow, frost, and even some warmer temperatures as well and had no issues operating in those conditions.All things considered, a camera like this is not for everyone. It is great if you own property and can't get a Wi-Fi signal there with other cameras. It is a little expensive if you ask me and then you do have to buy a monthly subscription to keep it active. You of course can retrieve all HD photos from the SD card if you choose, but that would require you to go to the camera's location to get them - defeating the purpose of having a setup like this. Keep in mind this camera does photos only - no videos. Even though I think it's a little expensive, I gave it 5 stars because it does work as described and it does do the job well. It all depends on the user and the user's needs. If you need something that you can just set and forget about, this is it!
review_text_2: I have a cabin up in the mountains where I don‚Äôt get Wi-Fi (a true retreat from the world!). Then again, I‚Äôm not always up there, so having this security camera set up offers some peace of mind. It is a solidly constructed piece of tech, to be sure. It also has a decent, hefty weight to it, so I don‚Äôt feel as though it‚Äôll get damaged easily out in the middle of nowhere.The pictures come across crisp and clean. The solar battery has held up so far, and keeps it charged without anything extra to date. I did have to give it the initial charge to get it going, but haven‚Äôt had any issues since. I do wish I could check in on demand, but then again, I would probably be checking it out far too often for no reason! The pictures are sent to me when motion detection occurs, and that‚Äôs what is really needed. I like that it has cheap plans for the LTE provision. Even the night vision is not bad!
review_text_3: I picked this up for a house we had put an offer on. The house was multiple acres and I wanted to put it out near the front of the property where there was no power. Unfortunately the deal on the house fell through but the camera is still great.Despite not having an actual use for it at my current house I did test it out. The camera is basically a "set and forget" device as it seems to keep itself charged in the daytimes and last through the nights even on nights with lots of rain. IT hasn't died yet even with some overcast days so it must not use that much power compared to what its little solar panel makes.The LTE plans from the company are a bit steep but supposedly I can use another Sim card depending on the carrier. One day I may find this out if I do actually find another house like the one I originally picked this for.

review_header_1: Best Wireless Cameras for this Price
review_header_3: made the switch from Arlo. So far I‚Äôm quite impressed. But I‚Äôll update this review later on.
review_text_1: These cameras already caught someone trying to come onto my property, and the alarm scared them away! Funny thing is, I didn‚Äôt even know they had an alarm!!You can set the security feature to home or away, the former will not sound an alarm if you walk in front of the camera and set off the motion detection, whereas the latter will sound a high-pitched alarm to ward off anyone encroaching on your property that shouldn‚Äôt be.Excellent camera clarity for this price point. The battery life is phenomenal. I don‚Äôt think they will really last the full 365 days, but it‚Äôll be at least 6-8 months, which is better than my 2-3 weeks that the Arlo cameras would typically last.Get these, you won‚Äôt regret it!
review_text_2: First, I have been a customer of Eufy for a few years now. Started with their robo-vac and have several other items from them. My personal experience, they have had GREAT customer service through the years! So when we recently had an issue at our house and started my security camera research journey, Eufy was of course on my list.After about 2 weeks worth of research and weighing the pros/cons of wired vs wireless, it came down to the EufyCam 2 and Arlo Pro. After reading several reviews and watching Youtube, I decided on EufyCam 2. I'll start with my only complaint: there should be a charging cable for EACH camera. It doesn't cost much to produce those small charging cables, especially when your parent company is Anker. I had to dig through and find cables about the house to charge all the cameras at the same time. Other than that...I love these cameras!The setup was VERY easy. It took all of 10 minutes, maybe, to do 5 total cameras (I bought an additional one along with this 4-pack). The only issue I had and haven't really messed with yet to fix was adding the cameras to HomeKit. I tried a few times and it would not connect. Not a big deal since I'm not fully integrated into the HomeKit ecosystem so no knock on that.Each camera came with it's own hardware and 2 different mounting options. I went with the screw in option since it would take some time for someone to steal it. Though, I did set the anti-theft option on which emits a siren when unscrewed. I really loved that they included 2 mounting stickers also to help you with drilling placement. This was nice since I was able to just stick it where I wanted to drill and it hides behind the mounting system. So no need to mark with a pencil etc.Once installed and have been using them for 2 weeks, I can say that I am really happy that I went with Eufy. The picture quality is great, day or night. In the app, I would start with the highest sensitivity and work your way down to your liking. The app works flawlessly for me so far. I get quick notifications, the play back is pretty instant and I have not had any issues with the cameras connecting, yet. It does run off of wifi so you can't expect this, or any wireless camera, to be perfect. I will add a wifi-6 mesh system in the next few months to help but again, it's wireless cameras so don't set high standards.In conclusion, if you're looking for great, 1080p recording, FREE self monitoring, wireless system that you can move wherever you want, I would look no further. Based on years of experience, Eufy has phenomenal customer service so rest assured that if you have an issue, it will be resolved. Not to forget, these little cameras look great around your house too. Hope this helps someone out there :)*I'll update this review as the time passes and any good/bad issues or thoughts come up*Pros:WirelessEasy installHomekit integrationUser Friendly AppCustomer ServiceBuild qualityPicture qualityResponsive appPrice (just my opinion)Cons:Would prefer a charging cable per camera
review_text_3: So far I am pretty impressed with these cameras. I purchased this kit as well as 2 additional add on cameras. I upgraded from an Arlo 5 camera system. I‚Äôm definitely not comparing these two systems because my arlos were the first generation cameras.But these Eufy cameras are working out well for me. I like the design of the camera, makes them a little more conspicuous. I had a little connectivity problem with one camera but I just repositioned it; my router and base station is on the complete opposite side of the house, so to be expected. All the other camera had zero connectivity issues. The notification delay is only a couple seconds. My arlos were at least 5-7 seconds.The time it takes for the camera to livestream on my phone is only about 3-5 seconds. Which is way faster than any Arlo system.Most importantly is that there aren't storage/ subscription fees, which is exactly why I‚Äôll be ditching my RING doorbell real soon. Arlo allows you to have 5 cams max before there‚Äôs a fee. Not with Eufy.
review_text_4: EDIT: Customer service reached out to me and resolved the issue by kindly making up the price difference as a refund. I'm changing my review to five stars because the Eufy customer service is excellent and the cameras are quite good. I found the setup to be quite easy.OLD:Deal of the day went on sale right after purchasing, eufy customer service refused to price match and indicated I should instead take all the cameras down and return them then rebuy at the cheaper price. Ecological waste and a pain in the butt to the customer but the product works so there's that....
review_text_5: I used to have a wired security camera system and after 7 years it stopped working on me. I gave these cameras a try because 1) This is the same company that made Anker products and 2)I saw plenty of good reviews on Youtube. After one week of usage, I am very pleased with these cameras! There are plenty of ways to adjust the settings such as motion detection, battery/power management, linking it to it other cameras... The ample of settings features is a big plus. The Eufy app has plenty of features, yet it is seamless and easy to use. The only thing is that I wish the battery would last longer. I've had it for 1 week now and a camera is already at 92%. Granted, I used and tested that camera frequently and rigorously. Also, the mount that it comes with is not the greatest. I weren't able to tilt and turn the camera the way I wanted to.Pros:1) Great to use app2) Plenty of settings to please users3) Sleek and stylish4) Completely Wireless5) Good motion detection (if camera is between 7-10 ft high)6) Good night visionCons:1) Mount can be improved (more angles and tilting)2) Better screws/anchors? Especially for drilling into cement/bricks?3) ExpensiveOverall very good product. Would definitely buy more Eufy cameras to add on to my system!

description: Now you can monitor a job site, farm, cabin or any other remote location with the VOSKER V200 4G Mobile Security Camera! The V200 combines the look of a trail cam with the practicality of a surveillance camera while utilizing 4G connectivity, an app like a cell phone, and the convenience of solar charging! This weather-resistant and rugged camera also has a built-in SD Card slot so it can do onboard recording. This audio video surveillance camera also has night vision and automatic motion detection. And besides harnessing the power of the sun to keep it charged up, it can also run on a rechargeable battery pack, 8 AA batteries, or a 12-volt battery‚Äîall sold separately. This model comes with a preactivated nationwide SIM card and a variety of mobile security plans, including free.

name: Vosker V200 | Cellular Security Camera | Built-in Solar Panel | LTE, Wireless, Weatherproof, No Wi-Fi Required | Motion Activated Outdoor Surveillance Cameras | Mobile Phone Photo Notifications
review_header_1: Camera is great and easy to set up, however:
review_header_3: Very easy to setup and inexpensive to operate on an annual basis.
review_text_1: I give the camera five stars. It is easy to set up and use. The picture quality is good (HD quality or a little better). Support by email is good. However, upon "motion detection" the receipt of the notification email with pictures posted to my Vosker account may arrive within 30 seconds or several hours. I find this troubling considering this is a LTE (AT&T, Verizon) based security camera. I have 5x5 signal reception (strongest). This issue may be a problem with the volume of cellular traffic between the Vosker servers and my email account. I would expect Vosker to monitor the traffic and adjust the network and routing. Vosker management is free to respond to my comment. For a top quality security camera like the V200 this should not happen.
review_text_2: We are building a house out in the country that is over an hour drive one way from our house. We wanted to be able to keep an eye on the construction process to know when it would be worth our time to drive up to the site and back. From my research, I determined the best type of camera was one that had solar charging capabilities and also cellular built-in in order to send me photos when there was activity. So I bought this camera. I played around with it for over a month at my home in order to get a sense of how the camera worked and which settings were the best for me. The camera is super easy to activate and you get one month free of the elite plan, which is unlimited photos. I ended up opting to continue this plan after the one month free trial period. For $20 a month I can get as many photos as I want sent to me and 40 photos upgraded to high DEF if requested. Once I had a good feel of how the camera and the associated app worked, we drove up to the construction site and found a tree that pointed toward the site that we felt had a good point of view. I‚Äôm glad I played around with this at home first so I didn‚Äôt have to fool around with it when we were setting it up. I love the VOSKER app and set the camera to send me photos every two hours. This camera is working wonderfully and since it‚Äôs been installed it has maintain 100% battery power through the solar panel. It helps that we have a cell tower on a mountain above our build side which gives a 5 x 5 signal. The night vision took a photo of a couple deer walking around the construction site at 1 AM from 50 feet away in complete darkness. We had a person who came to the site and I thought that he worked for our builder but wasn‚Äôt sure from the standard definition photos sent so I requested a high def photo and determined that this was the guy I thought it was. The camera is doing everything we hoped it would and I couldn‚Äôt be happier with my purchase. I am thinking that maybe some of the one star reviews came at a time when VOSKER was doing a software upgrade that caused people issues. That is partly the reason why I wanted to do a review. I couldn‚Äôt be more thrilled with my purchase.
review_text_3: I love this camera and phone app!! I use it as my primary driveway camera system. It never fails to alert me of visitors when I am at home or away. I will be buying another one for my other home.
review_text_4: I use the camera to see who comes and goes on my drive way.the reaction time is a little slow on the v 200.if the vehicle is driving a little too fast you miss the plate#.The other issue is the GPS location feature should only be accessed from the phone app.Alot of people use game cameras and if their robbed they take the camera to.So far I'm very happy with the results
review_text_5: I own a number of these and they are really decent outdoor cameras. The V200 is able to send photos even from truly remote areas; a strong LTE signal from a cell tower will mean it can send notifications to your phone nearly instantly but even with weaker signal, photos do arrive.

review_header_1: This tiny camera has surprisingly good camera quality! Don't waste your money on an expensive brand.
review_header_3: Light weight, easy to conceal, affordable peace of mind when traveling.
review_header_5: Better Than Average For Its Size
review_text_4: This is a tiny and affordable little camera, and I have to say it takes pretty impressive video! I learned a lot of helpful info just by reading other people's reviews so I wanted to be sure to leave my own review. It does take sound and video, it is pretty easy to use if you have real instructions, and it is easy to view your photos and video by plugging right into your laptop etc or pulling memory card to put into card reader.1) You need your own memory card. (This is probably obvious if you buy cameras much but I didn't realize and had to wait for my additional memory card order. I bought a 32 GB TF memory card as another review recommended TF card and I wasn't sure what to get. Works perfectly!) It doesn't work without it.2) Search "SQ11 Mini Camera" on YouTube and skip reading the included directions. They're extremely confusing and seem more targeted for trouble shooting if you already know how to use the camera. The gist of it is - turn on with power button, click mode button, and then power button to begin recording video. There are two video resolution settings and also a photo mode, as well as night vision. It's much simpler just to watch a YouTube video to sort how to change each of these settings etc than trying to explain it in writing.Sidenote:I have yet to figure out how to use while charging, it seems to only allow me to shoot while it is unplugged. I have seen some other reviews mention it's possible so I'm probably missing it, considering it hadn't occurred to me to buy a separate memory card it's very possible.I haven't had anything interesting to video so I'll have to hold a video review for when I do!
review_text_5: Let me start off by saying I'm not tech savy.It's small, making it discrete. It's lightweight, but didn't break when I dropped it. Not fragile. There's an odd rainbow sticker on it. If you're trying to hide it, then why would you have a bright sticker on it? I don't want attention drawn to the device. I removed it. It was very easy to do & didn't damage the camera.The instructions are a bit wordy & confusing. You definitely won't be able to memorize the instructions, but that's okay because I want to "set it & forget it" for 100 minutes (that's the run time on the camera at full charge). It was difficult to figure out so keep the instructions in a safe place or better yet...take a picture of the instructions & keep it on your phone.It comes with a TF card (micro SD). I found it easier to read it from my computer with a micro SD reader rather than using the cord & camera that is included.Overall, I like this camera. The motion detection & low light worked most of the time, & the quality is better than average. I really like the wide angle lense option.The image & stabilization were great. The camera held on the clip well. When I went to pinch the clip...the camera went flying and landed on my wood floors. Luckily the camera still worked so I call that a "win" & good durability.

review_text_1: For the price the camera is excellent. Night vision is great, one initial charge and the unit is good to run off solar 100%. Cloud service is great but also has an option for SD internal backup just in case. Detection range seems to be about 25ft out during the day when mounted at 15ft in height. I'd recommend this not only for the device, but also excellent and responsive customer service from the seller/manufacturer.
review_text_2: Ive had security cameras for a long time.I recently moved and decided to go wifi/solar this time around as the biggest pain w/ sec systems is the miles of wire.These are 100% wireless,and ready to roll out of the box-batteries included. Wifi/solar cameras are a somewhat new endeavor,so Ive been waiting for the bugs to be worked out and for them to come down in price.These cameras NAILED IT.I was so happy w/ the first,I bought more.First of all,SUPER easy to setup.Both mounting and the software.NO WIRES except the shortys to the solar panel which U mount by the camera.The software is GREAT.These run off of Cloudedge,so you can run them not only on your phone,but you can get a free Android to PC emulator online (I recommend NOX),and you can use UR PC,laptop,smart TV as a monitor. I was also pleasantly surprised to see the camera also has a 180 degree panning motor built in.The 2 way intercom is great,and night vision is super! Ill be back for more! Thanks!

The amazing part was i accidentally bed the charger end from the solar panel and spoke with the seller since was my mistake and he took care of it. So happy now thank for the seller very helpful and vey responsive. Right away he respond you back... I really recomend the camera
review_text_4: I wasn‚Äôt expecting much based on the price, but I am pleasantly pleased. The quality is just as good as my Arlos and Vivint cameras‚Ä¶but I am raking impressed the the solar capability. These are in the side of my house with 8 hours of indirect sun at the most, but they keep the cameras 100% charged. The setup was a not event‚Ä¶and they have not failed or lost connection since the installation
review_text_5: Great price for a security camera! Solar panel has been working great and charging. I check daily if it has charged and each time, it says 100% :) The only thing I think that deceived me was the pan rotation is manual. From the video, it is showing that cam would rotate once motion is detected. But it's not the case. Other than that, it's a good security cam for the price.

review_header_2: Worked better than I was expecting
review_text_1: How to install your new webcamFirst steps1. Open your box and check contents2. Set aside your instruction book for reference later3. Plug in your new cam to charge itNext1. Using a laptop or cell phone, open your wireless network lista. With a laptop or tablet, open your control panel and go to Network settingsb. Click on ‚Äúlist available networks‚Äù and look for the wireless device as listed in your webcam instructions2. Log on to your new webcam3. Download the viewing app listed in the instruction book4. Start the app.5. Click on ‚Äúadd a webcam‚Äù and add the name and address found on your webcam6. Once your webcam is found, change the network from the factory setting to the network being used where the camera will be located.7. Once located and shown in the app, you can then change the name of the cam and password.8. Enjoy your new webcam!
review_text_2: I was skeptical given some of the other review. Maybe those were for earlier versions. The instructions are as complete as the product's functionality. I found them quite clear in plain English. Maybe a little Chinenglish, but they must have had someone go over it and render the instructions pretty clear. The flow of the instructions are actually well laid out. As other reviewers have noted, do be so overly zealous to put this through its paces without reading the instructions. While the camera seems intuitive, there is a lot of good direction in the instructions - - use them!The images is very clear and I recommend using the 1080 resolution. Shutter speed is fixed at 30fps. Even at night, the camera produces pretty clear images in very low light (and that's without the night vision on). The IR lights are truly invisible to the human eye and are quite decent. They enable the camera to see clearly about 10 feet. If you get this, plan to keep it plugged into a wall charger all the time, or if you want it as a body cam, then plug it into a rechargeable power bank. In cold weather, using this as a body cam gave me about 15 minutes of battery life. Like ALL other IR cameras, you cannot use the IR lights to see through windows at night. It's like standing in front of your bathroom mirror with the door closed and lights off at night and then shinning a super bright flashlight into the mirror and then trying to see your reflection - -this will never work. For that to work, you'd need IR lights outside the window.I plan to attach this to a helmet and record skiing videos, but the limited shutter speed will likely produce ho-hum videos compared to the high-speed of an iPhone or GoPro. If I fall and trash this, well I'm only out $50 - - a lot better than being out $400. Oh, and this is way lighter than a GoPro. We'll see. The magnetic holder is nice and there are multiple options. The camera has a magnet behind the back plate. If you want to mount the camera to the ceiling or drywall, they include a small metal (iron) disk that you velcro or glue to a non-metalic surface. then the camera can be placed and easily removed from the disk. But, battery life is about 60-90 minutes, you still need near-by power.There are two WiFi modes 1.) WiFi directly to your phone which is the mode you have when you receive it or after you press the reset. This is great for using the device as a dash cam in a car, in a hotel, or out in field away from routers. You use this mode to connect your phone directly to the camera when you are within range. When connected directly to camera with phone, you can switch the camera to WiFi mode 2.) which means you log the camera into a local WiFi network. This allows you to see and control the camera from anywhere in the world with a cell phone (no laptop software to access it). In either mode, the camera is burning electricity to run a WiFi network meaning that the battery can only hold out for about 90 minutes max.You have basically two ways to capture and store video 1.) Directly to a phone's memory BUT the phone has to be actively watching (or connected via WiFI mode 1 or 2) to the camera. 2.) Directly to a microSD card. If you plan to use this as a security camera, it could alert you to motion of an intruder, but if they spot the camera, all they need to do is take it and you will not have any video (e.g. no cloud storage option). Now, if you happen to log into the camera because you got an alert on your phone, you can begin recording video to your phone. In that case, having the camera taken still leaves you with those security images on your phone. I must say, the motion detection on this is awesome - - way better than my Arlo camera's. It does not use passive IR, it detects changes in the background. On the highest sensitivity, it goes off when my neighbors dog comes into view about 75-100 meters away. It picks up an individual walking on the sidewalk about 100 meters away and cars going down the street about 150 meters away. It has 7 levels of sensitivity setting and can also be disabled. You can also schedule when you want it to be motion sensitive. Lots of options for security including the alert interval and recording duration.I'm impressed enough with this camera that I plan to buy one for my son's dorm room as they've had a rash of thefts in the school. The frontal area of the camera is about that of a silver dollar (US). It might be pretty easy to disguise/hide. I plan to buy 1 or two more, since they are affordable, to monitor the back room behind a complex aquarium system. I want to monitor liquid levels in several containers as well as some instruments when I'm away from the system on long trips.
review_text_3: Very nice mini camera that provides various ways to use. I downloaded the free app that has simple setup instructions for connecting the mini camera to your WI-fi and store videos on your phone or tablet. Videos can also be stored on the micro SD card (that you supply). You can monitor multiple cameras on the phone app. The mode button allows you to toggle between continuous videos and motion detected.The camera is powered by a rechargeable battery or by directly connecting to an outlet via the USB connector that is provided.The back of the camera is magnetic and can be placed on most metal objects or you can use the magnetic pedestal. The other end of the pedestal has an adhesive backing. Also, provided is a short (5 inch) flexible USB connector that can be used along with a USB adapter. There is, also, an iron disk with an adhesive backing for another alternative for camera placement.For WiFi setup, download the P2PLiveCam app to your phone or tablet. The back of the camera has a QR Code for easy setup.The camera is 1080p with a wide angle lens, with motion detection and night vision.This is a great mini camera for the price. I highly recommend it.
review_text_4: So, this is a personal hideable discreet camera. It comes with 2 usb cables (one short and one longer) to attach to your pc as well as plug into your phone charger to power up the camera battery. It comes with a magnetic disk and an adjustable stand. One side of the disk has an adhesive so you can either stick it to the charger or stick it to the base. I wasn't clear exactly where I was supposed to place it. They also provided a washer that can be placed between the stand and the camera, but, I didn't quite understand why. The instructions were very easy to follow and very on point. If you mess something up, go back and read through the instructions and start over. They have it pretty well written to make it easy for us to understand. It can be set to connect with your WiFi so you can watch live video or record from anywhere using the app on your phone. I wish there was a way to adjust the tone/hue on the video as mine was showing a bit pinkish. There are several tools to use with the video which makes it nice. It can be set to M(Motion) or L(Loop recording) so it can be constantly recording if you choose to do so. It doesn't come with an SD card, though. I wish they had included a packing list so that you know what all you have received and what to do with each piece. Otherwise, great camera!
review_text_5: I bought the camera for security for my car and it worked so well that a couple of days later bought a second one. Lots of good features handy magnetic mount and good pictures. Heavy rain negatively effected the resolution to the point the pictures were useless but just plane dark was no problem, the night pictures were good. I don't believe any camera would have worked in the heavy rain that we got. Although it is not an outdoor camera I made a little shelter out of a black plastic cup and could still use the magnetic mount, powered from the car battery through the USB plug. The onboard battery probably doesn't have a lot of capacity, I didn't test the endurance but I suspect a couple of hours anyway.The support from the manufacturer was great, stellar in fact. Very helpful and very prompt to reply.There are three recording modes always on, record as movement is sensed, or record on a schedule. The control of the camera is through my Android phone, it can be controlled directly as long as you are within range, then the camera is set up and left to work on it's own, or if a WiFi connection is available to the camera you can view the image being recorded and control the camera from anywhere you have cell service and internet available. Later I will use them to monitor the house when we're out. I'm pleased with the camera's and will move them to a house security roll later. They are easy to hide and notify you if movement is sensed if you want (in addition to recording the event).And I would like to mention again that the technical support was great! I highly recommend the camera.

This is a true wireless system. No need to wire each camera to a power source. Now I can forget about those expensive equipment and monitoring fees that I have had for the last 3 years! review_text_2: Easy install Great price, works great, optional monitored system
review_text_3: Love this security system. So easy and quick to install. Cameras work great and can pick up even the slightest movement outside if you‚Äôre looking for that kind of security.
review_text_4: Home Security - One box motion sensor had mounting hardware in it but not the motion sensor? Tried to get a replacement thru Amazon but not able to??

features: ,,„ÄêAlerts and spotlights to protect your home„ÄëShine a light on activity and warn unwelcome guests with spotlight and Siren, wireless outdoor wifi security camera allow you to clearly see events happening outside even in spots you don‚Äôt have good lighting. Trigger the outdoor camera, the spotlight illuminates the activity and emits an alarm sound that can be heard indoors, which is safer than ordinary outdoor cameras.,„ÄêSmarter detection for set special area„ÄëDzees smart security camera with AI recognition, analyze and distinguish people, pets, vehicle. The outdoor security camera can through App to set some specific monitoring zones. When someone passes through the area, the notification will be sent to you immediately, and video will be saved in Micro SD card or Cloud.,„ÄêListen, speak and watch everywhere„ÄëThe battery powered security camera supports remotely access App to get real-time viewing, and activate the siren from anywhere. It built-in noise cancellation speaker and MIC allow you make communication to whoever comes to your front door.,„ÄêCapture more detail at night„ÄëBuilt-in infrared light and dual-source white light provide true color night vision for your night. 1080P security camera with color night vision does not miss every detail. The wireless outdoor security camera with 130¬∞ wide-angle and 33ft night vision range.,„ÄêIP66 Weatherproof & 100% wireless„ÄëThe outdoor surveillance camera has a waterproof housing, IP66 weatherproof certification, and can work normally in any weather (such as sunshine, rain, storm). And it is a rechargeable battery camera, can be used for 2-4 months after fully charged, no hub or wall sockets required during the installation process, connect to Wi-Fi. (Battery camera only supports 2.4gHz network)
name: Dzees Siren Alarm Outdoor Camera Wireless with Spotlight, Rechargeable Battery Security Camera, AI Motion Detection, 2-Way Talk, Color Night Vision, Remote Access by App IP66 WiFi Camera Cloud/SD Slot
review_header_5: It‚Äôs a solid well constructed unit and accepts a large 128GB Micro SD card for lots of storage
review_text_1: Pros:RechargeableWireless2-Way AudioApp CompatibleNight Vision / ColorIP66 RatingCloud Or SD Card OptionsSpotlightAlarm1080P Live StreamCons:5Ghz Networks Not SupportedWhat I received in the package:1 x DZEES Siren Alarm Outdoor Wireless Camera1 x Pedestal Mount3 x Anchors3 x Screws1 x USB Cable1 x User ManualThis DZEES Siren Alarm Outdoor Wireless Camera product is a great camera. This product is IP66 rated, which means that it is protected against multi-directional high-pressure water jets. The camera has 130 degree wide angle FOV and a night vision range of 33‚Äô.Integration. The camera was easily integrated into my current Dzees app and took only a couple minutes to configure and setup.Installation. The installation was also easy. I am personally not a fan of the pedestal mount. Previous Dzees cameras provided two mounting options. A pedestal mount and a magnetic mount. They appear to have moved away from the magnetic mounts which I really enjoyed for easy of setup and take down for charging.Quality. The resolution and quality of the video and photos are excellent and something I have come to expect from this manufacturer. You can live stream up to 1080P and get crisp images and video.Night Vision. The camera offers dual sourced white light color night vision. Which honestly, in my opinion, is not night vision if a light has to come on to provide a color video. But the standard IR night vision is sharp and has good quality definition. While it can max out the range at 33‚Äô. I found that you still get good quality up to about 28‚Äô.Rechargeable. This product comes equipped with an internal Lithium-Ion battery that can power the camera from 2-4 months depending on the features active.Features. This camera offers a lot of features.2-Way AudioSpotlightAlarmNight VisionReal-Time StreamingWirelessThe app offers flexibility and is highly configurable. From triggers to recording time settings to frequency and resolution settings. This camera and app package offers solid features that I have come to depend on as a deterrent and for security.Extra (Paid) Features. The app also offers some additional features that you have to buy a subscription for.AI AnalysisActivity ZoneThe subscriptions range from $3 - 32 dollars depending on the plan.One of the nice features about the AI Analysis is that it will analysis when what it is detecting is Person, Pet, Package or Vehicle and alert you appropriately.But the Activity Zone is the real piece that I wish was part of the app without having to pay for it. It allows you to mark specific areas to notify you. I fine this extremely handy. For example, I have a camera overlooking my driveway and I have a flag out almost all the time. The flag triggers the movement alerts all the time. So I have to turn off motion detection and notifications or it will drain the battery much faster. With Activity Zones I can set it up so that the flag is not in my detection area. That way it does not trigger any motion and thus I can keep motion detection on and still have the security I want from this camera to detect anything moving that is not in the area of my flag moving.You also get cloud storage with the paid subscription. But I much prefer the SD Cards for a couple reasons. I control my own recordings and I still have the ability to record if the power is tampered with or goes out as it is not dependent on the internet to store data somewhere else. Just something to keep in mind.As mentioned, the manufacturer used to offer a magnetic mount which I am a huge fan of. That is unfortunate for me but it is still an excellent camera system.The manufacturer offers a 3-Year Warranty on this product IF you register it online.I appreciate you taking the time to read this. I received this product in exchange for an honest review. All in all, this is another quality camera from a manufacturer I have come to trust for my security. This camera offers flexibility and security with multiple features from notifications to spotlighting to an audio alarm and more. This camera is an excellent addition to my security that I use daily and trust with my family‚Äôs safety. Hope this information was helpful. [5 Stars]This product is made in China.
review_text_2: A very good security camera. Easy to follow instructions. Excellent camera clarity and field of vision. I like that I can add my own sd card so I can store notifications/recordings without having to pay extra for cloud storage. I also like that I can share the camera with members of my family so they can receive notifications as well. I am using this camera in tandem with a doorbell camera from another company. I am actually disappointed in my doorbell camera because it does a very poor job of providing clear pictures at nighttime. Nighttime viewing on the Dzees security camera puts the well known brand name doorbell camera to shame.You can add a package that includes cloud recording storage with intelligent notification and activity zone for as little as $3 per month. If you are using a sd card to store recordings then I personally don‚Äôt see the value in adding the cloud recording. The value comes from the intelligent notification which allows the camera to distinguish between a person, animal or vehicle. And Activity Zone allows you to set a particular area in the cameras view to send you notifications.
review_text_3: I purchased a camera previously from this company and have been looking to add more to my house. When I found out that they had a new camera coming out I couldn't wait to get it. Ordered it on Sunday and on Monday it arrived! Got it set up easily with the app that we already had installed for the other camera we own. Synced up quickly with no issues.For fun we placed it under our Christmas Tree with low light and could see very clearly as our pets moved about the living room.Because this camera is outdoor it mounts with a main screw into the back, previous models they have have a magnetic ball mount option that is not available with this camera. The mount comes with everything you need and securely stays when installed properly. The mounting package also comes with drywall anchors if you decide to mount it inside like we will be doing.Important thing to note is that you need an SD card in order for it to record when motion is detected. This is nothing new for cameras like this. Unless you plan on going with a subscription based security system you will always need a SD card nowadays. That is one reason I love doing security my way, getting a 64gb SD card is really cheap and goes a long way. I'm always able to access the camera and the past history if needed.Overall we are once again really happy with our purchase. Dzees is on our list of products to watch for whenever they come out with new cameras. They are never the most expensive but also are never the cheapest. They do well outside in conditions, especially where I am in NY, it gets 90+ in the summer and below zero in the winter. So if it can withstand the wide range of weather I have I'm sure it candle just about anywhere.
review_text_4: This is my third Dzees outdoor camera. My first 2 are older model with magnetic mount. I bought this new model because of satisfaction with my previous purchases and great Dzees customer service.The screw mounting of new model needs more time to take down to charge battery, but it does provide more flexible monitor angle.I just stayed with VicoHome app which has no problem to handle both old and new model. The DzeesHome app has almost identical UI and features comparing to VicoHome, however VicoHome has battery percentage in main setting but DzeesHome app needs to go one step deeper to see battery %. The app has scheduled sleep function for older model, but not for this newer model. This is not critical but definitely nice to have feature, hope the newer model will bring back this feature with future firmware/app upgrade.Picture quality is good, both cloud and SD card footages are clear and easy to review. The viewing angle is about the same, and the newer model seems having better colored image/video.Battery life seems a little bit better than older model, it‚Äôs still over 90% after one week, but that could be different amount of motion detected.Overall, it‚Äôs a nice wire-free indoor/outdoor camera.

review_header_1: CHECK THE TIPS IN MY REVIEW! - updated from 3 back to 5
review_header_2: Awesome for the price and then some.
review_text_1: Heres the deal. I installed these on a rental house where Im having tenant issues. For that purpose they work. They are inexpensive and I had access to my own hard disks.The Good:Camera quality is surprisingly good in both resolution and physical durability. They do not feel cheap and light. Hopefully time will tell how waterproof they are. The seller seems to have good reviews on backing up the warranty though so again we'll see how it all turns out. Its also nice the system can go up to 8 channels, so there is room to add more. The resolution is very good as well and it gives the choice of standard or high res when viewing the app depending on how fast you want the buffer to run depending on your connection. High res is extremely nice.The Bad:Software just sucks. Its a PITA to get working. Ive hooked up numerous systems, even my own SWANN system (which is very nice when you get it up and running) but this one just does NOT want to cooperate. First it makes you create a random account for password retrieval, which is odd because there is no reason to ever retrieve a password since logging on the system requires the "LOCAL" account password. For that you can simply reset the system. Being that this is a VERY foreign (Chinese) system, it sort of makes you wonder. Secondly getting the system just to start working with the app was insanely difficult and the instructions are HORRIBLE. I will explain below in my tips for setting up.Also the android app (which I use) is pretty bad. It works on my phone (pixel 2), its works on my tenants phone (samsung) but is not compatible with my pixel C? Also it does require some odd permissions. Go in and turn off all the access in android that the app doesnt need like phone, microphone and any others. Im going to try one by one turning them all off until it just doesnt work. I dont like it wants local storage access (which might be for playback), location or camera either.I would like to install this on my pixel c tablet but it is not compatible. Also On the samsung phone you can get a 4 window view but for some reason on my pixel 2 Im only able to view one camera at a time. Have NOT figured this out.Now for some tips on setting up which I plan on possibly making a video for so others dont get frustrated:No matter HOW MANY times I tried to set this up using the ip/domain settings it would not take. I personally prefer that method for trouble shooting and control. No matter what ports I forwarded in the router and brain unit it just WOULD NOT work. I decided to try the QR scan method. That got me no where for 2 different days at about an hour each. I FINALLY figured out when scanning the QR the app was placing about 20 random invisible digits after the QR serial. Once I noticed that I removed those and entered the LOCAL password and it finally connected. Again you set up a random account when you install the app but thats all its for, its very suspicious honestly.Once the app was setup and connected though I got nothing but black screens on everything, all four cameras black. I then realized in the back I had connected the 4 cameras to slot 5-8 and not 1-4. Why this mattered to the unit is beyond me. Why the app just blacked out 5-8 even though it showed connected is strange. I placed the cameras on 1-4 and all of a sudden the app worked. On the actual unit all the cameras were viewing fine but the app is just really picky.Tech support is ONLY in China apparently but when emailing through amazon I did get some form of support back from someone who emailed back some image requests. Be SURE to blot out any personal IP info if you do send this tech support images.I next have to figure out how to utilize the record and playback plus setup an email account for image forwarding.!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! so the tips are !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!use LOCAL pass to login, NOT account pass!!!Make SURE cameras are in the port in order or it will NOT work!!!be SURE the app is not putting empty spaces after the QR serial when scanning!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!Fix the app and you have a VERY solid affordable camera systemUpdate - 5/31/19I had to get a replacement system as the one I had continuously locked up and rebooted. It would also not keep the correct time, and this was an issue since installation but I figured it was a glitch and just memorized the difference. Also on every lock up it would reset the time if I changed it.Anyway getting a replacement was easy but upon install I was again having trouble. I just couldnt get the thing to work with the app. Apparently theres a new app called ZosiSmart in the android store and though its the same DVR (I think anyway), I need to use the new app because the serials have changed. It gave me a little trouble and took a couple DVR reboots but it finally caught the signal and connected. Seems to work fine, thought the new app appears to catch and run a bit slower than the old. Either way, I have my camera system back up and running on my units and let me tell you, thank god I did this as it got me out of a couple jams in just the one year it was up. Im able to position the systems cameras to see all 3 houses and their parking, plus watch the street (which I already told the police in the area I have the system in case they ever need footage. I work very well with the department in my area and its very well reciprocated. If you own any rentals or a business its a really good idea to build a working relationship with whatever law enforcement covers your neighborhoods.I want to especially thank Emma from ZOSI, who helped me through the process via email.
review_text_2: This zosi security system is awesome! At 79.99 it gives great picture quality during the day and at night. Setup was simple by just running the wires and finding where your cameras will go. It didn't come w a hard drive but I had one laying around and used that. I just opened the box and plugged it into the provided SATA cables. I did run in to a few problems during setup but they were solved with a little thought. 1. The DVR system comes press to a lower resolution for a HDMI cable, so if u have a 1080 p or better tv, then you better find a 720 p tv to plug the HDMI cable into so you can see the screen to change the resolution.2. The cameras come w 2 adjustments. The first is obvious for up and down or side to side but the second is the nearest screw to the camera itself. Unscrew this almost all the way out to rotate the camera in any direction then screw it back in to use as a set screw.
review_text_3: Will update if there are any changes; however, it was easy to set up and good picture quality for 720p. Wish I got a 180 deg. cameras but they work for the purpose I purchased it for. Night vision is good (don't really have much to compare it to). The android and PC apps work but can be a little glitchy from time to time (ch. 2 sometimes does not load but comes up eventually). DVR function works well.I have included pictures of both the android app and PC app (picture quality is much better directly from DVR and on playback)
review_text_4: Bought this wired system for my free standing garage, because we don't have dedicated wifi. Did a temporary test setup in my home since I was skeptical of the quality at such a low price. Didn't want to put in the effort to do the final install to find out it was a bust. Installed the $35 500 GB Western Digital hard drive that I purchased separately, hooked the DVR up to an old lcd tv via vga, hooked up cameras, powered it up, followed instructions to format the hard drive, set it to record and watched it work. Took 30 minutes and it has been running for a couple of days with no issues. I've been able to easily review the recorded content. Camera Day/night feature works great and transitions smoothly as light levels change. I'm now satisfied it really is a great deal and will do final install in the garage next week. Several friends have indicated an interest in purchasing a system for their homes.
review_text_5: Are you serious ? for this price point. I bought one of these to install at my mother in laws house. She does not want anything fancy, so i saw this and thought i was check out the quality.3 years back i installed a QSEE system, 4 camera's, DVR with 500GB HD. That was $400, and honestly i see very little difference between the quality of the 2 systems, in actual fact, i think this one is giving better daytime quality than the QSEE.Nighttime quality seems good, i would say facial recognition at 25 feet.Put 7200RPM HD i had laying around (one of many) in, formatted it, recording in seconds.As a bonus, when it put it all back in the box, it all fit perfect !! i mean, who does that ?
