review_text_1: Very nice product for the price. I had a SWAN system I had bought 5 years ago from walmart, paid 100 more for it and only had 4 cameras. But 12 cameras and HD for 100 less was something I could not pass up. Was not to hard to set up, took me about a day, and lots of attic time running wires. The zoom is Awesome, the night vision is clear and works great. Field of view is massive. You can set up to alert you of motion, via the app and a audible alarm on the DVR, and have the system display that camera full screen. We have it set up on our front door to alert us of someone at the door. The only thing I have left to figgure out is having it record only on motion. ATM it records all the time, which is fine, 1tb is alot of storage space. I absolutely recommend this product.
review_text_2: Pruduct is used to monitor my Homestead, in a very rural mountainous region of the West Coast of America. It was a simple installation and straight forward. Quality of the camera image and entire system are pristine. Night vision is extreme! I can see much further with clarity than what is described in the documentation/stats of the device. Very, very reasonable pricing which will deliver you peace-of-mind, both when you're local or away, via a swift, secure and a streamlined accessibility to your security DVR system. I confidently believe you would not be disappointed, or regretful in any fashion, with a purchase from ZOSI.I hope life is treating you and your loved one's well. Stay safe, secure and confident and enjoy the peaceful frame of mind you have given yourself.
review_text_3: I bought the ZOSI 16CH 1080P Security Camera System with 2TB Hard Drive,H.265+ 16Channel 1080P HD-TVI DVR . It's the best in the world. I knwe about Zosi camesas that other people has . The night vision is like day time omg. You can see a bug from a long ways. I got the wired kind. yes you run wires. But Yes.. it's really worth the money and time running wires... Thank you Zosi
review_text_4: It‚Äôs a decent system, especially for the price! The night vision is not as good as advertised, but you can make adjustment to the contrast, brightness etc to dial it in a little better. Overall, it‚Äôs a good system. I would recommend also buying a CCTV power cabinet so you don‚Äôt have to have all of the power supplies plugged into a power strip.
review_text_5: I installed a 12 camera system on my home. After a couple of days one of the cameras Night vision went out. Emailed customer support and they got back to me immediately. After running through some common issues and trying to fix the problem they shipped me a new camera to replace the bad one. Now it works great. Would definitely recommend this product.

review_text_1: I‚Äôm surprised that there aren‚Äôt any reviews. I had to take one for the team though. This camera is great! Quality is amazing, night shift is so great especially because I have a black puppy. It doesn‚Äôt rotate so that‚Äôs my only con. Besides that, you can hear and talk they the camera and it was an easy set up! I definitely recommend. It has cool motion detecton and sound detection that alerts your phone if you allow it. Also, you cannot look at old footage unless you purchase a subscription which is about $6 per month to go back up to 14 days and for 30 days I believe it‚Äôs about $10-$15. Something like that. But I don‚Äôt need it because I only got it so I could hear if my puppy is crying.
review_text_2: It's absolutely necessary to have a camera when you're sharing a room with someone you don't know. Especially if you're a single woman. The camera is affordable and the video is clear also easy to use. I am very happy with this shopping experience
review_text_3: I bought this camera for my small business, compared with the other security cameras, this one is more adjustable and worth the money. It has 2 different models, Day and Night. It will change automatically. Another thing that needs to mention is if you want to use the reply, you will need to buy an SD card.
review_text_4: This camera is exactly what I want. It is easy to set up and has a clear night vision. I can track what my dogs are doing in other rooms at night, and I can see what my dogs are doing at any time. I like it very much, as of now I highly recommend it. I am very satisfied with this purchase on Amazon.
review_text_5: I'm always looking for a remote camera to look at my home when I'm working in the office. This camera satisfies all my requirements such as playback, night vision, and audio talking with my two kittens. It's glad to see them stay safe and play around even I can't stay with them. What I like most is its price! It includes two cameras at a cheap price, with which I can only buy one from other sellers. So I can monitor my study room and living room at the same time.

review_text_1: I absolutely love this system. I purchased it through Amazon for my home, wanting something similar to my business cameras, but in a smaller price range. I had looked to update my cameras at my bar and was quoted over $3000, so when I bought the Zosi system, I was prepared to be underwhelmed. Amazing clarity and the night cameras were 100 times better than my "commercial" system at work! Install was very simple (running the wires for the cameras was the most time consuming) and setting it up for web viewing was a snap.Then I had a problem. The DVR kept freezing after a couple of hours. I thought "well of course, look what I paid for it". I contacted service at service@zositech.com and didn't bother to hold my breath. I have had plenty of experience with Comcast and Verizon and wasn't exactly hopeful.Here's where it gets REALLY good! I had an answer, an apology, an offer for a rebate for my inconvenience, and a genuine fix WITHIN MINUTES! I was completely shocked! They had an update for the DVR, super simple instructions, and not one problem since then. They've checked back several times to be sure I'm completely satisfied and even offered to send out a new DVR, but not necessary, it's been running fine since the update!I've included some pictures of my $$$ system at work compared to the crystal clear view from Zosi. I'll update later with the night view (NO light, incredible view!) because I'm so happy with the system and more importantly, the service.I would be confident replacing my work system with Zosi because I know this company is prepared to stand behind their product. (And the PRICE! I still can't believe the PRICE!)If you've been sitting on the fence, pull the trigger!
review_text_3: Had this camera setup for a few months now. Worked fine for a while until I hooked my internet up to it now it continually freezes randomly and I have to reset the system. I tried installing an update they sent me and still no luck so now they're sending me a new dvr to see if that works. Hopefully this takes care of the problem. When the system is working though I like it. Good picture and I like being able to view them from the app on my iPhone. Customer service has been pretty good about responding to me and now they're sending me a new dvr so I'm happy with that. UPDATE: the new dvr system has been working well now and hasn‚Äôt froze once yet (knock on wood) lol. The new dvr they sent me was definitely an updated one. The looks of the dvr itself is the same but the operating system is definitely an updated version and it works perfectly so far. I‚Äôm very happy now with my system and want to thank Anran for helping me out. 5 stars for sure for the product and you helping me out üëç
review_text_4: The install was pretty straight forward for me. Most anyone should be able to get this set up. For me, the toughest part was figuring out where and how to run the cables. The two coils of 100 ft. and 60 ft. were more than enough for my set up. I did have a problem with one of the cameras not working (see photo). I switched cameras and lines to test it out, with the same results. I was convinced that the camera was defective.That brings me to the customer service. With no phone number listed on their web site, I was forced to email. No response until the following day. So, I went back and forth a couple of times with little to no results. Finally, I contacted the company by way of FB messenger. Again, no response until late yesterday evening. Whoever was at the other end ran me through some testing and sending them photos they requested and to my amazement, we got it working.Come to find out, their support people are in China and that would explain the slow (by my estimation) response. Some of their spelling and wording tipped me off. Once I realized all that, it was all good! The rep that I was conversing with actually knew what they were talking about. Apparently, sometimes a camera has difficulty finding the system, whatever that means.All in all, we're up and running and the night vision is absolutely incredible. It looks almost like daytime. I also have the app set up on my phone and it was a piece of cake getting that going. Just remember that there is a significant lag time with their customer service. Once I understood that, things worked out well.UPDATE: The one camera did have a bug but the customer service response was incredible and a new camera was on it's way within a couple days. I have since installed the new camera and it works great. Based on the customer service response I have upgraded from 4 starts to a full 5 stars.
review_text_5: Just had the system a few days and it‚Äôs crudely setup inside for now. Wanted to let it run for a week or so and check the heat of the nvr and the functions of the camera before fully installing it.That being said the quality seems very good, nothing feels cheap. There were no damaged pins on the nvr or the cameras.I do structured network cabling for a global network data company so I‚Äôm a good bit above the average user and would recommend this camera system.Being what my line of work is the only thing I am going to change is the cabling that came with the cameras. Typically data cable is 4 pairs and 1 pair is send, 1 pair is receive, 1 pair is Poe and one pair is rarely used.The cables that with it would work without issue but being what I know I‚Äôm going to be using panduit cat6 cabling with rj45 connectors.I will update this after fully installing the systemoutside on the house and giving it some more time.Update: haven‚Äôt fully installed the system due to winter time weather.It ran excellent inside and did not get very hot at all. All the features and functions work as they should.Want to clarify the above information on the cabling that came with the system. It is very very cheap cable, it will work fine but it‚Äôs an odd cable. It only has 2 pairs in it and feels like old style but new telephone cable. I use data cable for voice lines on non VOIP systems so it will work fine. I just prefer to use new cat 6 cable to remove any choke points in the sending and receiving of video information.

review_text_1: All the way 5 star for this product. Like all, I was VERY VERY skeptical about this product, just due to the low price in relative to all the others on Amazon and retail store. But thanks to all those that gave this product a positive review, I took a chance and ordered the 8 camera set from here Amazon. First of all, I have been researching this home camera system for about 4 months, reading from the cheapest to the most expensive, almost everyone's review counted, by far this is the best price with the most positive review ratio. So to install, like most have said the instruction was a bit light and not very in depth, almost seem as the writer assumed we have done this before, but can't lower the rating base on their writing skill. the camera was easy to install. I live in a 3000 sq ft single story home, and the control box and power box is located in the corner study room about 7' drop below the ceiling, the 60' cable was just enough to the furthest location, but shy of 15' short of the furthers corner, not a big deal (I have spliced one and added 30' extra length, didn't notice quality difference). the cable and connector quality is GREAT, I have test it in relative to Coax, at 60', its just the same. Night vision, its way more than I was expecting, the only issue, not the fault of this product, is the red LED for night vision attracts bugs and they love hovering infront of the camera at night. Day time, Awsome. The controling and HD box, very easy to use, and YES its a bit slow to respond to command using mouse, but don't compare it to your computer speed. I have added an A/V modulator and integrate it to my current cable system, assigned the camera to Channel 2 , so now I can watch my 8 camera anywhere in the house at any time. I have also went to FRY's electronics and compare, the same 60' cable that came with the camera ran for $24.99 ea x8, that's $199.92 just in cable retail price. Couple of sugestion for those that are installing it. The camera comes assemble, so you have to take it apart for installation, very easy, just untwist the bottom and top cover and the camera will come loose, don't tighten until you have gotten the perfect angle, and don't worry about adjusting until you have setup the app, so you can stand outside your house and watch the app as you adjust the angle. I'm not sure about the screws that comes with the package, I sugest to go to HD or Lowes and get some stainless steel screws, its very cheap, couple of bucks and you won't ever have to worry about it rusting, especially its mouted outside. Also its probably a good idea to get a simple 30 minutes standby UPS to the system, so that when you loose power, ti wouldn't keep rebooting due to bad weather, at least a surge protector. Lastly, depending on your TV, the quality of the video will vary, I have test it with the old SD tv - poor quality, HD-TV good quality, Computer monitor-best quality. If you see Snow on just one camera, you have a loose connection on that camera, if snow on all, its just your video out connection is loose. Good luck DIY.
review_text_2: This is for the 8 POE camera - 2TB system. I wanted a system that was easy to install and not wanting to run separate power lines for the cameras. POE is definitely the way to go. This is overall a good and easy system, and I am very happy with my purchase. Here are some Pros and Cons that come to mind:Pros:- The color picture quality is really good and crisp, especially in daylight. At night / low light the camera automatically turns on the built-in infrared lights - the picture is black and white but is also very clear within the beam spread of the IR lights, which does have a fairly good range to them.- System comes with 8 ethernet cables so you don't even have to buy those.- Ends of cameras where the ethernet cable attaches to is weather proof plus has led lights to show active power being supplied and video data being sent.- Able to block areas of movement so your hard drive is not being filled with video of a tree swaying or a ceiling fan rotating.- You can choose between standard resolution or HD for each individual camera. Standard is really good as is, HD makes it really sharp. However I found that when watching the video feed in real time there is a couple second delay in what you are watching to what is actually happening at that moment when the camera is set to HD. Standard resolution does not have this issue. My home network is very high speed so I know it's not network related lag.Cons:These are minor but were unexpected:- The ethernet cables supplied did not seem to be all the same length. A couple of shorter ones were found when running the cables through the attic. Instead of swapping for one that was longer I just bought a coupler and a 10 foot cable from home depot and finished the run.- There is a rubber-like ring inside the camera mount assembly that the camera sits against for a solid no-movement fit. I found that if I needed the camera pointed at an extreme angle in relation to where the base was mounted I had to cut about a 1/4" section out of it to allow the cable coming out of the back of the camera to clear this ring without being crushed when you tighten everything up.- In regards to mounting the cameras - they are rock solid when mounted but you are dealing with 3 loose separate pieces (after you mount the base piece to the wall) that have to be fitted together, aligned, and held in place with one hand while then trying to screw down the 3 screws to hold everything with the other hand. This was a pain and a challenge when on a ladder but otherwise doable. If you are missing fingers or have other hand dexterity issues this might be a problem. The plus side is that the camera is nice and tight inside the housing assembly when you're done and is not going to shift at all whatsoever.Other Notes:- Only screw in one screw just enough to hold the assembly from separating in order to fine tune pointing the camera. Otherwise you will NOT be able to shift the camera position due to it being that tight inside the housing assembly.- Use the app (for android) "Zosi Smart". Other Zosi apps will not work. Also use this app when pointing the cameras to where you want - makes this part very easy. For PC use the program AVSS. Lots of other Zosi apps / programs out there but these are the only 2 that worked for me for this system.Really Good Customer Support After Installation:I had one camera fail about a month after I installed the system, no video being sent. I worked directly with Zosi customer support via email. I suspect they are out of China, however this was not an issue at all - They were VERY responsive, usually less than 24 hours reply to an email. I worked with Bill, he was very courteous and attentive to the issue. The emails he sent had a lot of good guidance provided. He had me try several different things to ensure it was a bad camera and not a bad cable or port on the main unit, or a setup configuration issue. This back and forth via email was showing me that they were on this and actively trying to resolve the issue. In the end we determined it was the camera itself that had failed and they are shipping me out a replacement. Bill was great and Zosi does support you after the purchase, which is REALLY important.
review_text_3: I bought this system about 5 years ago. During that time, I am on my 2nd DVR from them. The first one stopped working after the first 3 months. I contacted customer support, which is located in Japan so in order to communicate to them, it had to be via email and they responded when I was sleeping because of the time variance. So every question I had, I had to ask and then wait until the next day to answer and this went on for over a week before they finally sent me another DVR. During that time, the DVR went "offline" (got the Zosi start up screen) several times, frozen on that screen. Again, had to communicate via email for several days before they finally sent me an upgrade which I had to upload to a thumb drive. That didn't work and again, had to email them several times to get help with that as it wasn't working. Also, getting the system to work with the app to view the cameras remotely was very antiquated and troublesome to get to work. I am very tech savy so it wasn't because I had no clue what I was doing. Fast forward to 2020, and the DVR has stopped working again. I tried to contact support, this time via Facebook messenger and they asked for my order ID right away. I provided it and it was the last I heard of them. I sent several text messages, AND emails with no answer from them whatsoever. I should have listened to the other reviews I read before I bought this.UPDATE: Zosi contacted me and gave me step by step instructions to upgrade the system and was all done via Facebook messenger. The system is back up and running!
review_text_4: Okay, so I've had this for a few weeks now and finally got it installed quite a bit of work running all these cables and hanging cameras Bought this to keep an eye on things outside. Not a problem when I'm not at home, but when I'm at home thing makes so much noise I can hardly stand to keep it turned on. Picture quality is so so, but it does work for what I wanted to do. I would not recommend this to anyone if they're all this noisy I would not have another one and would not recommend anyone else buy it either! It's not just a little noisy, it's real noisy.Update - after my previous review the seller contacted me and offered to replace the defective DVR. I have since received and installed the new unit and can say I'm very pleased,not only with the product, but also the excellent customer service. Currently I'm waiting for them to send me a return label.
review_text_5: Had it for about 2 months first I had 3 cameras stop the same day tech support is horrible there in China so the time difference made support not very good thank god for Amazon they sent replacement cameras but I‚Äôm still having problems with one of the replacement cameras

description: Of the 126 million homes in America, only 20% have home security. At SimpliSafe, we're changing that. Our goa is simple: to make homes safe for everyone, and not with false security, but with real protection. Our frustration-free DIY home surveillance system bundles have precise sensors to know the difference between a family pet and an unwanted intruder, and are designed with long range sensors for entire home protection. Simplisafe is for homes of all sizes and is built with unprecedented safeguards to keep your home protected against power outages, downed Wi-Fi, cut landlines, and physical attacks from hammers, bats, and more. This easy-to-use wireless system is full of surveillance products small enough to disappear into your home and provide blanket protection. Breathe easy with proper protection at a safe and reasonable price. The 9-piece wireless Security bundle provides 24/7 security with a smash safe keypad that is soft to touch, easy to use during the day and night, and requires no plug (meaning you can place it anywhere), and will alert the police in case of attack. The base station is like your personal security guard: It sends alarm signals to the monitoring center with a built-in cellular connection, 24-hour battery backup, and a 95dB siren. Each entry sensor (4 total) protects your doors and windows and is designed to disappear and blend into the background. The 2 motion sensors are designed for human detection, no pet detection. The simplicity gives you flawless HD video and audio streaming as well as a 120¬∞ field of vision day and night. Enjoy effective, contract-free 24/7 professional monitoring, and make sure your home is the safest place on earth.

review_header_1: A well thought out system for the non technical do-it-yourself installer and no monitoring required.
review_header_5: Simplisafe is an awesome security system.
review_text_1: I installed this system in a 3600 sq ft home to test it out. I did not use nor would I plan to use the monitoring service so I have no comment on that feature. The following are my observations:THE GOOD -- Easy to Install. I have installed professional wireless alarm system and for those you need a engineering degree to understand. The Simplisafe is as simple as it needs to be to install for any average non technical homeowner. There are textual and voice prompts that help guide you though the simple procedures. -- Easy to add sensors. Each sensor has a button that when pushed will then pair it with the system then you name it using the key pad. Its that easy. - Easy to name sensors. When naming sensors you can choose from a standard list of names in the keypad menu or create you own unique name using the keypad. -- The sensor devices come ready with self adhesive backing to attach anywhere it is convenient. -- Good Sensor Gap: The sensors to magnet have a inch or so gap before triggering. This is good because it helps prevent false alarms due to window or door rattling during windy days or other events that could shake the house. -- Keypad is easy to use. It has on screen instructions with 4 control buttons on each screen edge that allow you to easily navigate for installation or when operating the alarm. -- Not complicated at all. Just enough user configuration. When Away, just set the time you want to allow to leave before the alarm activates. When Home set it for 0 seconds so that the alarm will immediately activate. -- Smart alarm configuration; For Home the motion detectors are automatically deactivate so you dont need to do anything. -- Opening Warning and Bypass: the alarm will warn you that a window or door is open when you try to alarm it. It will bypass those if you continue to arm the alarm. -- Excellent Long Range!: I placed the keypad and a door sensor about 75ft away from the base station with 4 walls and 1 floor in between and the Simplisafe detected the sensor being opened as well as the keypad was communicating with the base station. -- The system will give you warning when the batteries need to be replaced. -- Attractive Looking: The devices from the Base Station to the window and door sensors are attractively designed in a off-white color that will most decors. -- Several additional sensors are available at as reasonable price: Key fob to arm, disarm, or panic; Smoke, CO, water, temp, glass break, sirens, cameras and freeze. For example an additional window sensor is $15. -- A nice touch is that the system is provided with a yard sign and stake and 2 window stickers, but far to few stickers. -- Reliable!: Update: After 12 weeks of operating the system there have been no false alarms or unexplained behavior. -- Sirens are loud: In addition to what came with the kit, I purchased and installed 2 sirens on the outside of the house. Being battery powered they are surprisingly very loud. The sirens definitely got the attention of the neighbors......a good thing! -- The Key Fobs are great! In addition to what came with the kit I purchased 2 key fobs. You can set or deactivate the alarm with the key fob. Also there is a panic button at the top of the key fob. Its slightly recessed but a finger nail will easily push in the button. -- No Monitoring service required! One can use this alarm without a monitoring service. The alarm will warn you it is not monitored on each activation but that's only the most minor of annoyancesTHE COULD BE IMPROVED: - The Base Station siren is not very loud. The volume of the Base Station is adjustable but even its loudest is not loud enough. While you may hear it when in the same room or small apartment, it will be difficult to hear across the house. In this test an elderly who normally wears hearing aids did not wake up when the Base Station siren went off in the next room. It will really be necessary to add the additional sirens for practical home use. -- No garage door sensor. Garage doors move a lot in the wind and the small Simplisafe door and window sensor magnet and switch do not allow for enough movement to prevent false alarms during a storm or other door movement. This could have been simply solved by providing terminals to the door sensors to allow a larger magnet/switch configuration to be wired to it in lieu of the Simplisafe switch/magnet. - No Heat Sensor. The garage is one of the important rooms to detect fire. Smoke alarms in the garage are a bad idea as they will have false alarms from driving a vehicle in the garage. The alarm industry will put a heat or fire sensor in the garage to eliminate false alarms but Simplisafe does not offer one.Update: I have since installed 9 additional sensors, 2 key-fobs and 2 external sirens. All very easy to pair and setup. Im impressed with the simplicity to install the alarm. The sirens and key-fobs work great and after 6 weeks of continuous use the entire alarm system has had no false alarms or unexplained behavior. Further a very non technical elderly couple who are using the alarm are able to install new sensors and configure the alarm on their own. A testament to how easy the alarm is to configure.UPDATE: During a recent Santa Ana window event a Simplisafe standard sensor mounted on a garage door has worked well even through the storm event. This is due to the large gap allowed by the sensor to magnet mentioned previously before the switch is activated.Conclusion:A well thought through system for the non technical do it yourself installer but fall a little short of a professional system due to is lack of fire/heat sensor and ID of specific open sensor warnings before arming.
review_text_2: I am in love with this system. It was so easy to set up. Literally took less than 30 minutes to get everything set up and installed. We upgraded to the $24.99 a month live monitoring, but a $14.95 live monitoring is also available or you can opt to not use live monitoring. For our needs, we preferred the $24.99 monitoring so that's what we went with, but it's far from being a requirement. The hub has a battery backup option and a cellular backup, so if someone were to try to break in when the power goes out or were to cut your lines you'd still be secured for up to 24 hours. We have a very large 5 bedroom home and the hub has no problem reaching all areas of the home even though we put it by the front door. It still reaches the opposite end and all corners of the house. The setup is extremely easy as is operation. It also came with a yard sign and window stickers, which are an additional benefit and an added deterrent. We were paying ADT over $70 a month. For $24.99 we get the same level of protection with this company and the equipment is just as good if not better. Highly recommend.
review_text_3: Simplisafe is very easy to set up. My Son set it up in about 20 minutes. It works great and has a nice clear picture, easy to arm and unarm. The only thing I was disapointed in was it will not concet to my phone. I have an older smart phone android. It coneccted to my sons new android phone and to my daughter-in-laws iPhone just fine. It is a good thing they live with me. I guess I will have to buy a new phone.
review_text_4: VERY IMPRESSED!! I WAS SO SCARED LAST NIGHT...MY ALARM WENT OFF AT 1:25 A.M... THEN MY SIMPLISAFE BASE SAID IT WAS THE " BACKDOOR ALARM SENSOR " I GRABBED MY MACHETE AND TOLD MY GERMAN SHEPARD TO GET EM'!! I FOLLOWED HER IN THE LAUNDRY ROOM AND SAW THAT THE SENSOR HAD DETACHED FROM THE DOOR...WHEW!!! IT WAS A FALSE ALARM... I SECURED THE OTHER SENSORS AND WENT BACK TO BED... THANK YOU SIMPLISAFE... IT'S NICE TO KNOW THAT IT WORKS!! IT WAS A SCARY TEST BUT I'M GLAD IT HAPPENED!!! I PUT A SIMPLISAFE CAMERA IN MY HOUSE SO I KNOW WHEN ( NOT ) TO LEAVE MY BEDROOM!!üòÜ
review_text_5: A do it yourself kit. Literally installs in minutes (depending on how many windows and doors you include). Fast response service center. You can't beat the price and no contracts. Arms/disarms in seconds. I love the camera. Can view my home from anywhere.

review_text_1: I bought this system a couple months ago. I originally bought two other systems that arrived with problems, and I had to send them back for a refund. After doing a little more research, I bought this system for my small business. I unpacked the unit and tested it out at home before taking it to the business for installation. Before installation, I chose to purchase a new wifi router, which was quite an upgrade from what was already there, installed wifi extenders where the wifi signals were weak and tested the system and all cameras to be sure everything was working properly and recording. Once I was comfortable with the system, setting it up and installing it in the business was easy. The unit is installed on the second floor, and the cameras on the first floor, all the way to the back of the building, still work with no issues. I did not have to use the extended antennas that came in the box. I did have some questions for the company. The phone number and email are posted here at the bottom of the product description on Amazon, so finding contact information is easy. I chose to email the company, and within 24 hours or less I received a response. I needed assistance getting the system to display on a computer screen. Tech support sent a link to download the software along with instructions on how to set it up. I clicked on the link, downloaded the software, followed the install instructions, and all cameras popped up on our computer screen. The 3TB hard drive gives my business 30 days of recording, which is better than we expected. We have all 8 cameras set to record continuously 24/7. This is a great buy for the money.
review_text_2: I have been in the alarm industry for over 40 years but getting your company to install cameras (even at cost) is ridiculously expensive. I purchased these cameras just prior to our completing a remodel on our home and just started the installation. It was incredibly easy with essentially just plug and play set up. The pictures during the day (and night) are crystal clear and playback is extremely simple. The best issue is that I had some issues with the distance for the wireless reaching and have had incredibly quick response to each and every request for assistance. The system is simple but when there is an issue is is nice to have instant responses to your inquires for help. 5 star customer service and five star system. Really user friendly at all levels and I would recommend to anyone!
review_text_3: I ordered the security system February 1, 2019 but just installed in on April 13th. The system is a Hiseeu with 8 1080P cameras and a 3TB hard drive. The system worked flawlessly right of the box. The video is sharp with great color The night time vision of these cameras is fantastic. This is a very nice system at a good p;rice. I had one question that was answered via email very promptly. If you are looking for a great system at a great price I would highly recommend this one.Jim Davis
review_text_4: Very easy to get up and running. True plug and play, QR code came up on monitor to download the phone app and had it up and running within ,,five minutes of unboxing the unit. Very impressed with nite vision in complete darkness. Its alot better picture quality than other systems iv had. I do have a brick house and having trouble with one of my cameras having a weak signal so sometimes i can see that image.
review_text_5: Good things:1. It's easy to set up. Plug in the power and it works well.2. Easy to connect with Internet and your phone. Fast. Connection is stable.3. Video quality is good.4. Tech support is good. My questions was answered on-time.Bad things:1. sometimes, it delays a little bit. But not a huge issue.2. The range will be affected by walls. But this is normal with wireless system. You may need to my some wireless signal extension device.

review_header_1: Great quality product for the price! After 6 weeks of use the Battery bar still shows full !!!
review_header_2: Best buy, value for money, it has everything
review_header_4: Tough little gem of a camera.
review_text_1: This camera is absolutely wonderful! From when I first opened the box I was very impressed with the packaging and the high quality of materials used to make this product. I could see that much thought and consideration was put into the design. The software installation was a breeze! Once I downloaded the app and turned on the camera, the app immediately recognized the camera and just a few simple steps later my camera was ready to work. I was also very happy to see that I had a few options for mounting the camera and what really made my day was that I was able to mount the camera without having to drill any permanent holes in the walls. (there is also the option to mount it via a screw and hanging it). Once the mount is secure on the wall, attaching the camera to it with the built-in magnet is easy and ball design allows you to adjust the camera angle or remove the camera at any given time.Immediately after I completed the setup and installation, I get real-time notifications when there is any motion detection. As long as I have a stable connection on my phone, I have the option to use the intercom function to speak to whoever is at my door. What I really like about the notification function is that I can go back and view screenshots as well as video. The quality of the picture and video is very good and the night vision function works incredibly well. I attached a picture to this review of my two dogs in a completely blacked out room.The waterproof design is also nice to have although it was not a necessity for me now, it may come in handy some day.I have used the camera indoors at times to check in on my dogs and now mostly use it for the front and rear entry to my house.Now what really surprised me most with this camera is the battery life. I was very skeptic to the claims made in the listing but now after nearly 6 weeks of daily usage and the battery indicator shows full bars! Well, color me impressed!!!Overall it is great for me to be able to see who is at my door, whether I am home or not.One thing I would like to add and I hope the seller can see this comment is that the font on the instruction manual is very very small. I recommend enlarging the font so that it can be easily read by old timers like me.
review_text_2: I recently planned to go out of country for few days and wanted to have a camera to keep an eye on my house while I am away. Once the product was received, my daughter could do the set up in just few minutes using my phone. I installed this in the front porch using the included stickers. Magnetic attachment is super easy to bring in for charging. I didn't want any wiring and any hard installation in the wall. So the set up was really easy. Location of the device is about 40ft from the router. I charged it to 100% though it came pre charged. Picture quality is super clear. Night vision is perfect. Monitored the view from different country for days and the camera still was 100% charged. Very happy with the purchase. Motion activation is perfect, sends a message to my phone. I haven't used the SD card option yet.
review_text_4: I know the saying you get what you paid for, and I found this camera to be a great value. The price and reviews were what sold me. My experience is as follows.......First fast delivery with prime. Received and installed 5/7/2019 ...Then my device was fully charged and undamaged when received. Simple directions. Great pics and night vision, easy installation. Motion detection works well as well as the person to person intercom. The camera is also (in my opinion) of good quality, heavy duty. I would say that especially after I dropped twice with clumsy hands (not on purpose) in stalling memory card. Maybe 4‚Äô.5‚Äù above floor. As far as the app, it works fine , I do wish that you could send videos or pics to email since it is connected to my internet with out taking memory card out... but this is not a deal breaker. I will be going on trip and will test long distance receiving of notifications. One of the neighbors‚Äô kids set it off and I was notified pretty quick. I show that the camera is running at 52% internet signal because of installation distance from router, and still get impressive results. I read somewhere that the battery will or could last to upwards to 120 days in standby operation, .... after trip I plan on making another purchase... I may or may not get a router signal booster, but I am very happy with my decision and experience with this camera. I will post and update on battery performance later when I have to charge again but we all know that the amount of time on live feeds and motion detection will need to be taken into an account... P.S. I will post pics soon.
review_text_5: Surprisingly, this is a pretty good quality camera. I like that it alerts you when theres any movement detected. It recorded and take pictures when theres movement. With that being said you can put an SD card in to save your pictures and videos but theres also a cloud where you can choose to pay monthly or yearly. So you have options to either choose SD or a Cloud monthly/yearly subscription.UPDATE on battery life: I received this item on june 6th but I didnt put it up until june 10th and right now is july 6th. So the battery is at 18% as of right now. So if you use the camera as often as I did(every time theres a notifications due to high sensitivity movements) of course it'll take up the battery. It did however notify me that its 18% and it needs to be charged or it will automatically shut off. Still not bad. Planning on buying another to rotate while the other one is charging. Picture quality is pretty good.On another note, there's a solar for this camera that can be charged without having to take it down to plug in to charge. Less worries about the battery being low and it'll continously charge throughout the day.

review_header_1: Good easy to use security camera
review_header_5: Worth It‚Ä¶ Exactly what I was hoping for
review_text_1: Just got this set up today. I am not a ‚Äútechy‚Äù person but I found it very easy to use and set up. Once receiving you must download the app Adorcam and the app walks you through what to do on your phone using QR code‚Äôs you just scan with your camera to make things easier. You do need to make sure to buy an SD card, they recommend SanDisk 64 with this or it will only take pictures rather than being able to record video (although you can still watch video live in the app and it will take pictures of any events). I also like that you can set how sensitive you want it to be to motion on a continuum from very sensitive to average sensitivity, to low sensitivity or anywhere in between. It does say you need 2.4G HZ internet connection (not 5G HZ) so that is something to note. Overall I found the product very user friendly and easy to set up and so far it has been working great. Would recommend! If I encounter any issues later on I will update this review.
review_text_2: This is my first camera, so I was really excited when it came. I read everything and followed all the instructions. I had to download an app as well. But back to the camera, every time some is on my porch, my camera lets me know, I go check and I can speak to that person right from the kitchen from my phone, I see them real clean. It picks up all the sounds from outside, so I hear birds chirping and dogs barking. I like it a lot. It‚Äôs easy to install. I would buy another for the back yard later, cause the price is great. I also like that I can see when it‚Äôs time to charge it from my phone on the app, the battery last for awhile. I charged it the night before putting it up and checked it three days later and it was on like 98% so I really thought that was a plus. The night vision, and picture quality is great. It didn‚Äôt take me long to figure it out, it‚Äôs so easy to use.
review_text_3: This little camera right here has been absolutely phenomenal!! I purchased it right before going on a road trip (as you can see by all my luggage in the pics) and so I got it in time to install it, which took less than 5 minutes, and the wifi set up only about 2-3 minutes. I left my little neighbors the house keys and in charge of taking care of my dogs, so this was the perfect camera to keep an eye on things while I was away. Little did I know (due to my lack of reading) all the extra perks that come with this baby!The visual is amazing. Full on clarity and quality, not just in full color, but also in the grayscale night vision mode. I was able to keep an eye every now and then on how my dogs were doing and that the girls were doing the job I agreed to pay them $10 an hour to do. Well, I couldn‚Äôt just see, I could also hear, and from the sound of it, everything went great! Very clear sound and immediate response time, even when I was over 600 miles away and my then current location‚Äôs internet sucked. I could hear the girls had doubts about something, and as I look at the feedback on my phone, I see a little microphone button in the middle. Well, little did I know I could just press that little sucker and actually talk to them in real time, too! And the sound was so clear and no lag in time. I was able to clear up their questions in the moment and everything went smoothly.It was lovely to see that every time the camera detected movement, it recorded, and the playback is always available free of charge! I just installed one of my mini SD cards with 128gb and so I get to keep a record of everything. Also, I get notifications on my phone every time there‚Äôs motion detected, and you have the option of silencing those notifications in up to 12 hour increments. What I enjoyed the most is that I never got notifications for my dogs moving around their cages, because those are minimal movements. However I did get notifications for when they walked in the house, throughout the time they were there, and when they left. This worked out perfectly! The recording were done in 10 second increments so it was very accurate. Since I was paying them by the hour, I was able to go back to my recordings day by day, add up the time based on the motions and recordings, and pay them what they were owed down to the exact dollar! This was beautiful! They were happy campers, as was I!!Lastly, I absolutely love that it can be wireless! Of course, I keep it plugged in at all times using an extra extension cord to reach my outlet, but if I wanted it more discreet I can also use it wirelessly. The only thing I can‚Äôt vouch for is how long the battery will last per charge, but that won‚Äôt be necessary for me anyway. This way I can keep a proper and continuous surveillance of my entryway without any missing dates or times.I have zero reservations regarding this camera. It is absolutely phenomenal, amazing picture and sound quality, proper motion detection, excellent and crisp night vision, and a wonderful app to keep it all together for future playbacks. It breaks things down for you to a great extent. It even tells me when my recordings are due to Motion, due to a Human in the room, or due to PIR, which I can only assume means Pets In Room, but I could be wrong. I can share my recordings, and I can also share my camera as a whole with other family members if they just download the app. This Alkivision camera is definitely the one! Trust me when I say I was taken aback by its performance considering the price point, but when I say it‚Äôs better than my name brand products, I mean it! Just don‚Äôt hesitate and buy it; You won‚Äôt regret it!UPDATE: So a few months ago I accidentally knocked the power USB-C cable and because it was hooked, the force broke the cable and so i was left with no power source. Or so I thought. I had forgotten that technically this camera is supposed to also run on battery, and while before I couldn‚Äôt attest to its greatness, now I can certainly tell you that on a full charge, this camera can last you a whopping WHOLE MONTH solely on battery power. I was amazed!! I did have to end up buying a new cable later on, but this was much after the battery had eventually run out after a whole month of no physical connection to a plug.
review_text_4: I love this camera. The picture quality is amazing. There is aa app that you download on the phone and can hear sound from the camera as well as speak through the camera as well. If you do not have an SD card it will still capture photos of the area. I have this at my front door and REALLY am happy that I have it there. i don't have to go to the door not knowing who is there. This camera is great. It has even survived the storms and still going. The battery. life is terrific. It took less than 20 minutes to install and it was super easy.
review_text_5: The camera was really easy to set up and came charged!It‚Äôs super easy to setup‚Ä¶ the accompanying app is user-friendly. You can change the sensitive of the motion detection so you don‚Äôt get alerted by bugs or leaves and It includes a calendar with snapshots of every movement with options to share or download each picture (which could be videos if I put in a SD card), so if anything does happen, you‚Äôll have the photo of the event.the main page of the app gives an easy way to name the device and add multiple devices ‚Äî or share the single camera alerts with multiple people in the home. You can even turn alerts off when your home and there is a help page with a live chat I tested out‚Ä¶ customer service replied within 2 min and answered my questions.The picture quality is impressive, even the night vision considering there is very little light where i need it.I‚Äôm happy I went for the mid-price range and got a camera with lots of settings‚Ä¶ totally worth the money.

The wireless video security system is easy to setup, these WIFI cameras are paired with NVR at manufacturing site. Connect PC/TV monitor to NVR by a VGA/HDMI cable. Support connect with router by 2.4Ghz WIFI network or router by Ethernet cable. Finally power on and serve yourself with 24/7 surveillance, true plug and play.,„ÄêWaterproof& HD Video„ÄëRecords in 1296P Full HD to capture sharp and crisp images, provide crystal-clear HD live video, in order to crisp smooth footage day and night the bullet cameras build in 3 array IR cut filter with auto switch. Up to 65ft Night Vision, The IP 66 weatherproof aluminum housing material to keep Indoors & Outdoors recording.,„ÄêRemotely Anytime and Anywhere„ÄëWireless surveillance camera system allows you to view the live video remotely anytime and anywhere by Phone and Pad(Available for Android & IOS system). Just connect your NVR box with your home router by Lan cable, then download free APP ‚ÄúEseeCloud‚Äù from Android Google Play or Apple APP store. Add your CloudID/User name/password, you can view the video by WiFi or 4G/5G network. PC/Laptop view: Windows/MAC system: Eseecloud Software.,„ÄêMotion Detection and Email Alert„ÄëSmart notifications with email/ snapshot alerts will be pushed to your smartphone when motion is detected. Customize your own detection plan and zone for each camera, you will get extra peace of mind by receiving instant alerts and get notified of what happened.,„ÄêStunning 2K Ultra-HD video, one Way Audio„Äë 3.0MP presents 2304*1296 Mega Pixels about 1.5 times clearer than 1080P. Camera with 3 array Infrared LED allows you to see up to 65ft night vision even in darkness. Employing IP66 Waterproof metal material housing, cameras can be used indoor and outdoor. Outdoor security camera system also allows you to see and listen to people on your property remotely.

review_header_1: Great Quality CCTV with very easy installation
review_header_3: Easy Setup, Solid Cameras, Good support (Basic English)
review_header_4: Wireless Security System Automatically Recognizes Cameras!
review_text_1: This is what were looking for. The system is really easy to install. The quality was great. Wifi connection to NVR is really great we can see basically no delay at all. The mobile app was a bit difficult to configure but still answer the basic need for remote monitor.The attached photo is from our backyard where anything on the grass is dark and really hard to see but the camera said otherwise. Great Product.
review_text_2: "3TB HDD Pre-Instal - Hiseeu Wireless Security Camera System, 8CH 1080P NVR 4Pcs Outdoor/Indoor WiFi Surveillance Camera with Night Vision, Waterproof, Motion Alert, Remote Access" model WXKIT-8HB611-1T.**I will only try to point out some things not discussed in the description andFirst this is an EIGHT CAMERA system so don't be confused by the "4pcs" in the description.Second, I sent an email question to their customer service and received a response in less then 24hrs - VERY GOOD.Third, this is a Standalone system running Linux which gets rid of the BLOATWARE/SNIFFING of Windows and Chrome, etc. 'nuf said on my opinions of Goggle and Microsoft.Second, BUY the system with ALL the cameras (8 max) so that you have 'Spares" bought cheap as a 'kit.' I have used 6 in my system to date. The Camera Software has display settings for 8 camera windows, 6, 4, and so on.Third, the Cameras housing, adjustment arm and base are 'cast metal' (not plastic) very well made. I specifically chose ones with good 'hoods' as several of my units would be hit by the sun and typically would bleach out the image.Forth, the camera's field of view is very good and clarity range is as far as it shows. There is no flutter in the images after 4 months installed. The automatic 'white balance' is the best I have seen on NUMEROUS systems including Commercial versions. This comes into play when it goes B/W for night vision. On that note, there is a 'electric eye' on the front that actually switches the Camera mode too which does NOT rely on software to make that determination and uses decades old established 'eye' tech for delay - i.e. doesn't switch back & forth and does not get effected by passing headlights etc. This is the BEST manner in my opinion and you can actually HEAR the switch when you cover the eye with your finger!Fifth, the NIGHT VISION of the camera is exceptional for a non-commercial unit. It uses THREE "infra-red illuminator" LEDs (shown in picture) that are very strong (bottom "led" is actually the electric eye). The 65 feet is correctly advertised. However there is a hotspot because the LEDs are not shining 'spread out' as far as camera's field of view. This is an issue with ALL infra-red Iluminators as the Infra-red light is such a small band of light energy - that's why your TV remote does not work from a distance or if you don't point it at the TV when your batteries are low. If you need to see further or wider, you will need to invest in separate ACTUAL Infra-Red Iluminators and place them as needed. Note that I have overlapping cameras and each 'see' the others Infra-Red spots.Sixth, Make a CAMERA MAP and plot locations as well as which camera goes where. The system comes FULLY SET UP however, having done this before, I plugged in the entire system on a table, started it up and determined which cameras were 1-8 and LABELED them. Then made sure to put them in the order I wanted them DISPLAYED so when turned it all on, it was only the matter of alignment. I have three in one location alone giving over 180 degree coverage. Those are 150ft away from the base unit and still have a SOLID 3 of 4 bars wifi.Last, I did not need any internet connections (etc.) so have no input there.PS. the noise is typical of just a Hard Drive head indexing and is not loud but it will transfers through its cabinet to a hard surface and becomes a 'sounding board' making it out to be louder than it actually is, which you can fix by putting some soft 'feet' on it. The intermittent indexing does make sleeping around it a little funny. The best step would be to offer SSD when the prices come down as they are noiseless and have a better longevity in a constant "write" hard derive scenario such as this.
review_text_3: So, let's review, right?Well, when I bought it, of course the price was right, but I was worried that It was on the cheap side, and that it might reflect in the quality. The answer is NO. This was well worth the value. After 2 years, still working just fine.Now, Let's talk about it.Basically, it's pretty easy. Unwrap everything. Grab a network cable, a power strip, and a HDMI or VGA monitor.Once you have those things, plug it all in. DVR to the network, power and HDMI/VGa and a mouse (included but crap), and the cameras all in to the power strip. Turn it all on at once.When everything is on, the cameras should already show up on the screen in a grid. You have to set a password (make it easy, no keyboard). Then walk through the Wizard. Set the time, give it an IP or DHCP (easy instructions included)**. When it says ONLINE, you are done. You can tweak it anyway you want, but honestly, that's about it.There's also a QR code that it displays to download the app for mobile access, and there is one that connects the DVR to your phone. I dowloaded the iPhone app, then clicked 'add DVR' then pointed my phone to the QR code... and in about 5 seconds, the phone showed my cameras.** If you have a router that supports uPNP, use it. It will make things easier.The reason I am posting a review now is because of a recent issue I had. I came home one night to find the DVR had been stuck in a reboot. It would load the startup screen, then reboot. After an EMAIL to their SUPPORT, I was given some options to reset a setting, reboot, and try again. This didn't work, so they sent me a new firmware. That corrected the problem, and I was back online.In many cases, a company would simply tell me that 2 years was over-warranty. I really appreciated that they were able to provide support.I should mention, they do not speak fluent english, so there was a little assumption and muddling I had to go through to understand some of the instructions, but overall. Very impressed.
review_text_4: I ordered this system last year and to my shame it sat in the box till now. I've had a lot of time to do my pet projects and this was one of them. So finally I got it out and after reading reviews of how wireless camera systems were difficult to setup I was dreading the fight. However, no fighting needed. I hooked it up to the tv and plugged it into 120VAC. I plugged in the cameras to 120VAC in different parts of my house in window locations. I then turned on my tv and switched to the HDMI port of the Control Unit of the system. Once again to my surprise I saw my screen divided into squares for each camera powered up. I didn't fight with it at all! Apparently the system is automatically keyed to recognize its cameras and any extra cameras you try connect to the system must be wired. It is still early in my installation and I am trying things out yet. I ran an ethernet cable to the Control Unit and will be trying out accessing from my phone and computer. It looks like you can manually access it over the internet if you know the IP Address and ports of cameras or you can download the software app and use the software to access cameras and schedule recording. I would recommend this system.
review_text_5: I purchased this system recently for my property,At first I was a little hesitant buying a system off Amazon, but then did my due diligence research on the system and Hiseeu as well as tried asking some pre-sale questions to their support to see how efficient support really was. (They did a great job of answering questions)I have been pleasantly surprised with the system as a whole.Setup was very easy as the cameras come preloaded to match the system. (I encourage a new buyer to setup all of the cameras and system in one room first before installing them, This will allow you to identify camera 1 thru 8; although the cameras can be easily reassigned)Once setup, the Admin Menu is pretty easy to understand and work with, so no difficulties there. The viewing ‚ÄúPhone App‚Äô works well, with sharp images that I can now view when I‚Äôm away from the house.All in All, I recently had a 900.00 System that I used, and I have found the Hiseeu system is practically the same and for 1\2 the money,I will say though, that I will come back after a month of operation and either update this review or add a new one so I can comment on the stability and connectivity of the System.Note to Potential Buyers:Read the Product description, Hiseeu offers an additional 8% off if you email them for a code before the sale, To me; that was the final item that had me land on them for a product.

review_header_1: Over All great system, And Zozi stands behind every product they sell with outstanding customer service!
review_header_2: I understand some stuff is just bad and not the companies fault
review_header_5: Great cameras, at a great price.
review_text_1: This is my 12th security camera install. I have always liked the Zosi brand so when my home needed a upgrade I went with Zosi. To be honest I ordered 2 of the 8 channel 720P DVR + 8 camera setups, just for the 16 cameras. It was just as cheap to order the complete set as opposed to ordering just the cameras separate. I will keep the 2 DVRs for a future jobs.I was disappointed when I opened the box for the dome cameras and saw they where "PLASTIC" housings. I almost sent back both systems right there. Zosi in the past has always used aluminum housings on their dome cameras. Plastic will eventually fade and become brittle with UV exposure. I was also disappointed that two of the bullet cameras had stripped screws as I will be contacting the seller directly to get remedied (Seller has been known to have great customer service) I am sure they will work with me to fix the problem.I was pleased with the quality of the 720P vs my old 800 and 1000 TVL cameras. The setup was easy as expected, plug and play and you are done. I was originally worried as I run my cameras through OdiySurveil baluns (See pic) as it makes it easier to run 2 network cables then 8 separate Siamese's (I would highly recommend for any security install, you still need power but easier then "home running" each camera feed) Overall I would order the products again. Thanks Zozi!!!!!******************UPDATE***********************Zosi customer service is outstanding, I had 2 bullet cameras that must have been a bad batch and Zosi was quick to remedy the problem and sent me 4 new 1080P cameras to replace the 720P. I have been a life long Zosi fan and this outstanding customer service seals the deal for all my future security camera install needs. Thanks Zosi for being so understanding and just plain awesome!
review_text_2: I bought this about 7 months ago. I had an issue with 2 cameras and reached out to Dealer through amazon. Kelly Chan contacted me and shipped out 2 replacements right away. I understand some stuff is just bad and not the companies fault. I had an issues with my DVR locking up and e-mailed Kelly Chan directly and she had a new DVR shipped to me in about 1 week. I have not had any more Issues and this company's customer service is top notch. The system does what I need it to. setting it up for motion detection is a little tricky but their website has videos to help you through it. Kelly Chan is on my A list for customer service. Job well done.
review_text_3: Ok. Packaging was nice. The bullet cameras have a metal housing which looks and feels durable. The white blended in nicely with my house (which is also white). The setup was relatively easy. Took a little long to figure out the remote viewing but wasn't too hard. The day quality is really good, Super clearI did have a little issue with some of the dome cameras but Zosi customer service contacted me and was very accommodating . I was able to keep the camera system and they fixed the issue.Definitely worth buying and if you have any issues, Customer service is great (Responsive and accommodating).
review_text_4: considered only going 4 star but i really do like them for the price and they feel like a heavier/sturdier better built camera. added some realistic shots as to what it actually looks like from my DVR
review_text_5: Most excellent cameras. I got these to expand my system to 8 cams. Well these new Zosi cams are so much better than my Swann cams I am replacing all the Swann cams with these. Wider angle view, much better colour popping out at you. It's a big difference. Given, the Swann cams are about 5 years old. The Swann DVR crapped out so I bought a Zosi unit to replace it. the Swann never really worked right from the beginning. It had major false motion detection problems, making it useless for alerting you via email. It would send tons of false email alerts with pics of an empty yard. Even with the unit zeroed in to small grid areas, tons of false alerts. So it was turned off for alerts. Back to the Zosi unit. So far everything has worked perfectly. With the additional cams it is even better than I've ever had here. Big kudos for Zosi. Keep up the great work.

description: Size:4 Count (Pack of 1) Setting Up Your Camera With YI Home App 1.Install YI Home App and create a YI Home Account 2.Turn your camera on and select the '+' icon in YI Home App to add your camera 3.Select your Wi-Fi network and enter your Wi-Fi password, then select Connect to Wi-Fi 4.Scan the QR Code shown on the app, then select Next once the QR Code has scanned 5.Select Save, then select Start using to finish pairing 6.If connection failed, please push the Reset button and try again WiFi Settings 1.YI Home cameras will need to connect to a 2.4GHz band network. 5GHz WiFi band is not supported 2.Turning on the location service on the phone if you encounter Unknown SSID issue 3.Encryption mode must be set to WPA/WPA2 (mixed mode) or WPA2 4.Your Wi-Fi password must be 8-20 characters in length If you have any other problem, please contact us via support@yitechnology.com.

review_header_3: Great security cameras at a great price!
review_header_5: Developed for the Customer Not the Company's Profits
review_text_1: Alright, so I'm a tech guy, love anything electronic! I have had CCTV cameras in my house for years. I've been using Swann wired cameras for the most part with mixed emotions. But running new wires to upgrade the system just didn't excite me.I had been looking at NEST cams since I have the smart Thermostats and Smoke/Carbon-monoxide detectors for a while, but the price is ridiculous! Plus your only option with them is cloud service (an additional cost). Then I spoke with a neighbor who sent me a screen shot from his YI camera. I must say, the quality was pretty impressive.So I bought a four pack for $119.00 with moderate expectations. Let me tell you I'm super impressed with the picture quality of these cameras. Set up is quick and easy. When I purchased them I had no idea they had audio as well. The audio quality is incredible, plus it's a two way speaker. Purchased 32 GB SD cards for all of them so I didn't need to use cloud storage and it's been working great! I have them set to record all motion and I usually have about 7 days of history on each camera.Day and night vision are both spectacular IMO. I have attached several photos so you can see the quality both day and night. Side note, I have a couple "indoor cams" mounted outside. To do this I purchased a rubber sleeve/cover from Amazon to make the drop cam weather resistant for outdoor application. It's been through rain, sleet and snow with out issue so far. Link to cover: https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07FD5XHMP/ref=oh_aui_detailpage_o09_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=1A couple cons, the power cable is sooooooo short. I had to purchased longer cables for a couple of my installs. No biggie, they are only a few dollars here on Amazon. The app for iOS is very functional, but it has no multi camera view which would be a nice option.
review_text_2: So I have been using the Yi 1080p indoor camera system for 2 weeks now and I LOVE IT! The camera's are crystal clear during the day and are just as sharp in night mode. The added features of being able to hide any "lights" such as the blue power light and the typical red IR lights for night vision makes "hiding" these cameras a breeze. The playback function works great and give you the time in hours, minutes & seconds. The 2 way talk feature works great and has 2 modes, 1 is a push to talk feature where when you press the button you cannot hear what the person on the camera is saying and the 2nd is a continuous talk where you and the person on the camera can talk back and forth without pressing any buttons (love this feature) the 32gig on board storage is also a great bonus. Like I said I have been using the cameras for about 2 weeks and have barely used 3 gigs of space. (for an idea of the amount of traffic, it's just me, my wife and our 2 pets) so the cameras don't get a ton of action during the week. But are always recording on any motion. (I do not subscribe to the cloud storage as for I haven't seen a need) Anytime you get an alert it will store it on the app and you can upload it to your mobile device and share it with others. The initial motion detection clip is only 6 seconds, but if you wait till the end of the 6 seconds you will get an option to "view entire motion" which will bring up that camera, rewind to when it first detected the motion and play it back until there is no longer any motion, GREAT feature. All of the features seem to work as expected, you can set times for your camera to alert you when it detects motion and zones so that your dog walking around doesn't keep triggering the alerts. I can say the motion detection is VERY sensitive. You can set the setting to low, medium or high but really I can't tell a difference low to high. I have one camera facing out of my front window and it picks up shadows, car lights, leaves blowing, etc. Not a big deal, but on a windy day I can get a ton of alerts. The app works great, you can set a PIN or use your fingerprint to log into the cameras so in the event your phone is stolen, unless they have your PIN or fingerprint they will not be able to pull up your cameras. Connecting them was very simple and took less than 5 minutes per camera. Plug them in, scan the UR code and they will automatically connect to the network your phone is connected to. The packaging was very nice, didn't feel cheap. All cameras were individually wrapped along with all of the accessories. Comes with instruction booklet for assistance with installing/setup. The camera (black part) can be removed from the white base and mounted in different areas. They also sell (separately) wall mounts for the cameras. (cheap, like $10-$15 for a 4 pack) or you can stand them up anywhere you like (they have a round rubber grip on the bottom to help keep them from sliding around. All 4 cameras come with a USB cord and power brick. The USB cord is about 10-12 feet long so you should be able to place these cameras wherever you'd like. OK so I hope this rant...I mean review was helpful. If you're anything like me, I read all the reviews on a product before I make a purchase. Thanks for reading!***(I am not affiliated with Yi or any of there products, this was simple a consumer review, please purchase these at your own risk)***
review_text_3: I purchased the Yi 4 pk. 1080 Indoor security cameras. I was skeptical but am so glad I took the chance. I placed them in various windows facing outside as it‚Äôs outside I want to observe. They work perfectly during the day and, where the outside area is lit, at night. If the area is not lit, there is a reflection on the glass from the IR light, but they ARE designed to be indoor cameras. They work very well indoors, day and night, as intended. I have observed some sketchy people that have rung my doorbell when I‚Äôm not home (I have a camera in the window next to door), along with the neighbor‚Äôs cat, a family of raccoons, an opossum and numerous squirrels. I had an issue where they stopped alerting me of activity (which I see some others have had, also) and contacted Yi customer service. They promptly replied to my request and worked with me to make sure all my phone settings were correct. Turned out, the problem was with my phone settings, battery saver shutting down the app, NOT with the cameras or their app. I especially love that I can insert my own sd cards to save & view past events and not have to pay for ‚Äòcloud‚Äô subscription. I don‚Äôt know of another security camera that offers this. I couldn‚Äôt be happier with this purchase! In fact, I ordered another set of 4. If you are still in doubt, look up some reviews and comparisons of the Yi cameras on youtube.
review_text_5: Best Security Option for a home because:1. Its a one time charge- no monthly subscription- and all of the features of the camera work with the SD card2. The camera video is excellent especially the Night vision- it can see in almost complete darkness- wow3. The detection system is superb- I especially like that you can select an area within the total viewing area for detection. I use this feature so the cars that pass outside of my house do not trigger the alert only the area literally right in front of my door.4. The intercom is clear and at the appropriate volume5. Install and app use is seriously easy whether your a "techy" or not6. Small form and can be hidden without drawing attention7. Excellent price - for what you get its so worth it!8. Retrieve data on multiple device- My wife and I can both check our home and get the alerts simultaneously.9. Still records video on SD card even when wifi is out10. The option to make the camera stealth (no sound or constant blue light)As long as the camera and app lasts then I would definitely tell you do hesitate, buy it- its worth it and more.

Plus never miss capturing any video footage with 24/7 recording capacity when paired a compatible recorder. Change the way you think about large area monitoring and take your surveillance to the next level with this truly all-seeing camera.

review_text_1: Value for the money. Great quality picture
review_text_2: Review for: EZETAI Outdoor Security Cameras Wireless, WiFi Battery Solar Camera for Home Security,3.0MP/1296P IP Camera with Siren,2-Way Audio,Night Vision,PIR Motion Detection,IP65 Waterproof,2-Storage OptionsThis solar panel camera works perfectly. The installation was easy, no need for me to do cable management, just drill a couple holes, then screw these things in and wala, they work. Make sure you put it in a place with a good amount of sunlight though (find that place and determining where to put stuff took the longest). The camera quality is pretty great, the night vision, and motion sensing is pretty good too. Overall, pretty amazing product. Connection to the device to my phone was also pretty easy.
review_text_3: I absolutely love that this has a solar panel to charge the battery and have noticed that it charges pretty well even on darker, overcast days. Installation was straightforward and easy enough. Connection and set up weren't too complicated, even for someone tech challenged like me which was really nice. I'm really happy with how the camera performs too, the motion detection setting is really nice, I can customize exactly how sensitive I want it to be. The picture quality is excellent, both during the day and at night, I was actually really surprised and impressed with how good it shows up at night
review_text_4: Ezetai has created a modernistic-looking, lithium battery-powered, full HD surveillance camera for indoor usage. I enjoy the satisfaction of being able to monitor a certain space. It‚Äôs equipped with WiFi and motion detection, and allows for remote access from my smartphone! The camera works just as good as it looks, and it looks great!
review_text_5: I love having solar charged technology. This picture is at night time and is pretty darn clear and crisp. There is barely any lag time when I get my notifications.Setting it up within the app was easy. I have my solar panel facing the south where it gets the most sun. I get bears, possums, armadillos, etc in my yard so I vice to get notified because my Yorkie, me, and my kids like to hang out and relax in the backyard.
