review_header_5: Good system and you can view your cameras from anywhere with their app.
review_text_1: I love this new system!I was on the hunt for a security camera system. After doing some research I decided I didn‚Äôt want to use a cloud based service that would cost me a monthly operating fee. I then looked at the big box stores, but I elected to try the ZOSI DVR wired camera system. Best value and cost by far.I installed the system without any problems. One could just hook it up and it automatically starts recording, or you can use many other useful features. My mom probably could have just plugged it in to record without any reading... if you want other features, some degree of technical abilities is needed.Points to know:1. I created a gmail account just for this and set security on my gmail to low so that the ZOSI dvr was able to use the outgoing mail server without any issues. I could then make settings on the DVR to email me alerts when motion is detected.2. I didn‚Äôt use a PC to program, but rather the included mouse. It‚Äôs easy. One can then look at a frame and select where in the frame to look for motion and set the sensitivity. This is useful if a frame has trees blowing and cars going by, but you only want an alert if a gate opens.3. I downloaded the ZOSI app for my iPhone and I initially couldn‚Äôt get it to work. I emailed their tech support and they were fast and helpful. The manual is not well written and the tech support by email required me to think a bit differently. I sent screen shots and they texted back, ‚ÄúPlease use zosi smart app on your phone, your DVR's network is okay,¬†And the e-mail issue, the smtp server is smtp.gmail.com¬†please refer to the below link‚Äù I was initially thinking... ‚Äúdon‚Äôt they see I did use the ZOSI app? But then I thought to look and there is more than one app... and there is one called, ‚ÄúZOSI smart‚Äù I had ZOSI view. So get the right one! And I quickly said to myself... that‚Äôs how I set up the email... but I wrote ‚Äúgoogle‚Äù and not ‚Äúgmail‚Äù. It was easy once I corrected my mistakes. Thank you ZOSI support.4. Lots of options for cameras and DVRs. I have a guest house and a front house. Small city lot, but still further than the 65‚Äô of run for the camera cable. I ended up buying 2 different ZOSI systems. Both are great. The cost is great. The app registers the devices and I can monitor from my iPhone.5. In trying to solve some email issues before contacting their support, I read some posts on setting up port forwarding on your router. Don‚Äôt worry... it wasn‚Äôt needed. This isn‚Äôt as complicated as I was thinking!So in the end, I was able to install 2 systems with 6 cameras and my property is covered! All for much cheaper than a monthly fee based service.
review_text_2: Great system for the price. 1080p cameras and a 1TB DVR for under $200 is pretty good. I have all 4 cameras recording at max resolution and it stores about 30days worth of video before it over writes. Easy installation too.I haven‚Äôt been able to get the email alerts to work. The user interface for the iPhone app could use some work. It will freeze sometimes or lock up my 6S phone. Not too often though. I also have the DVR connected to a HD monitor. The user interface is pretty good, it just takes some time to learn how to use all the features.The cameras work well and the night vision is good. If you are covering a large area I would recommend an additional IR flood light for at night.Update..... After about 1 year I had an issue where the DVR would not boot up. I contacted a person named Slina at ZOSI tech support via email and I received a response within a few hours. I was asked to try several things which didn't fix it. I was then asked to send the broken unit back and I received a warranty replacement in about 4 days.I was very impressed with the quick response, level of customer support and the ease of getting a replacement under warranty. My system is now working again and I am a happy customer!
review_text_3: Good set of cameras for Home security. Gives secured 360 view of my home. 30 day recording is a plus. Went with hard wired because wireless camera reception isnt as clear as hard wired. This system also allows me to view my property on my iphone as long as its hooked to the wifi router. Dont let these wack reviews stop you. If you take time to learn this system it can be beneficial. This system helped me stop some kids from hanging out in my yard when we weren‚Äôt home. When i showed the video to their mother, she laid into them like Madea.
review_text_4: I like the camera quality, it is clear and very easy to see a close up view. The main reason I like the Zosi is the customer service. I am not very knowledgeable as far as setting up the features, but all I have to do is contact the support people and they are on it. The company has helped me with a replacement when it crashed and when I could not remember the password they sent me the instructions that were really easy to follow and I got into my system. I would recommend this system to anyone.
review_text_5: Very light compared to my previous DVR. Also it is very quiet. Using a mouse to navigate the menu makes it very easy to use. Also the menus are very self explanatory and intuitive. I was able to use my old cameras with the system (saved the cameras the system came with for future use or replacement). The only draw back to doing this is that I do not get sound nor can I speak through the camera for my old cameras did not have this capability but I know that if I install the cameras that came with the kit I would have this capability. The quality of the cameras are plastic and feel a bit cheap when compared to my older ones that are forged metal. The recorder works very well and you can even use your app on your phone to review recordings.

No wiring, no professional installation required.,Works with Alexa ‚Äì use your voice to monitor your home through supported Alexa-enabled devices.,Includes five Blink Indoor cameras and one Sync Module 2.

review_header_2: Stop comparing these to professional security set ups
review_header_4: Captures everything, even when you Blink!
review_header_5: Capable indoor wifi camera at a reasonable price
review_text_1: Very easy install and setup. Video quality doesn‚Äôt seem to be much better than the cheap wyze cam I replaced with this blink, even after adjusting to ‚Äúbest‚Äù quality. Love that it‚Äôs wireless and no longer have a 9 foot cable hanging on my wall. App is pretty intuitive. Alexa integration is great. Had an issue with the first cam, customer service was very helpful.
review_text_2: I just want to say for all the people that crap on these cameras, these cameras are amazing. They do the job. They are sturdy. They last through snow, wind, rain, and sun. They have amazing low light vision. Clear pictures. And a great setup to last two years on double AAs. And for those who need them to last longer buy the adapter to plug them in. It's stupid how these people come and review these as if they were 5000 dollar security set ups. These are worth it and a great value.
review_text_4: We are happy with our blink indoor cameras. It being wireless, light, and battery powered made it easy to install. The motion detection feature allows you to choose sections of the room you want monitored. The night vision is provides good quality captures and we were surprised the battery life is rated for two years. However, please keep in mind that it could change base on how much you use the live view, how often it triggers to record, how long the duration of recording, is set to, and if your wifi signaling is bad.Note: if you have a large area or areas with lots of obstructions (i.e. cement, brick, steel, and aluminum) walls you may want to have a wifi meshed network to extend you wifi network pass these obstructions. We have the Google Nest Wifi system. Also, the blink camera must connect to the sync module via low frequency radio (LFR). Because of this, the camera must be within distance of the sync module. This is separate from your home wifi network. My suggestion is to get another syn-module if you run into issues where your single sync-module cannot cover all camera areas.
review_text_5: The all-new Blink Indoor ‚Äì wireless, HD security camera appears to be a good product at a reasonable price. I bought a set of three that came with a Sync module. I believe up to 10 devices can be connected wirelessly to the Sync module that communicates using your home wifi. I was able to easily set up the camera using the Blink app on an iPhone. in addition, I was able to link to Alexa using my Amazon Prime account. This helped to view the camera on the Echo View screen using Alexa voice command such as, "Alexa, show Living Room."I understand that Lithium AA batteries (supplied with the camera) would last for two years. Also, there is a USB-C port to power the camera, although no cable or USB charging block is provided.The camera comes with a small mountong bracket and screws for wall or ceiling mounting.15 day trial for storing in the cloud is free and after that the subscription is $3/month per camera or $10/month for all cameras. However, the Sync module has an USB post and a low profile USB thumb drive upto 256 GB may be used to store video clips in MP4 format.My only complaint is that a detailed User's Manual explaining all these should be included instead of finding at Blink support website.

review_header_1: Great, Cheap CCTV System. Still don't know if they sell footage to China
review_header_2: Protect what you have worked hard for!
review_header_3: Don't be afraid of the price point! Quality product
review_text_1: I am highly privacy driven both in public and in cyberspace. The system works great. The interface is pretty easy to use. Great 1080p picture. Great night vision. I went with hardwired cameras due to their lack of vulnerability to cyber threats. However, the DVR does have an ethernet connection and there is an app you can use to monitor the system. I will continue exploring the cyber vulnerabilities of this system to ensure it does not sell info or footage to a third party. The only gripe I have is that the motion detection is pretty touchy, even at the lowest sensitivity level. One bug flying in front of it and I'll get a notice. I also noticed that if a car drives fast enough in front of my residence, I still get a motion detection notice even though I have removed that area from my camera's detection grid. For the money, I can't complain. Better than paying ADT $40/month to tell me my dog tripped the alarm. Be prepared for a hard day in the attic or crawl space to install, that's the price you pay for hardwired systems.
review_text_2: Our peaceful safe neighborhood has recently become a target for crime. Houses and cars have been broken into almost daily. So we decided to purchase a security system before we were hit. This was our 1st ever security camera purchase. I did not know anything about how to pick one so I did a lot of research and eventually decided on this one. We got the 8camera and 500gb hard drive.It arrived fast and great packaging.Hookup was a bit challenging and time consuming (maybe because this was our 1st) but took a while to get the cords ran. So patience is a plus for all brands I would assume not just this one. But soon that time consuming part was worth it. The picture is crystal clear even in pitch dark. We. Couldn't believe how good it was in night vision. Daytime is just as clear. We have it hooked up to a computer screen that was not being used and its perfect. We have recommended it to everyone . great system, crystal clear pictures and good customer service.Luckily,we have not caught anyone trying to break in our stuff that we have worked hard for many years to get. But if we do we will be ready.Although we have not caught burglars we have caught wildlife on camera. We live in the country/woods type of area and have seen our daily visit from our neighborhood bear as well as raccoon and opposums. I am attaching a pic of the night vision and one of our bear sightings. We only have up 5 of the cameras right now. The pictures are pictures of the screen with my phone but still pretty good quality.
review_text_3: Better than expected! Received it on 5-17-17 hooked it up and the clarity is more than I need. Also love the night vision , also very clear. Was Leary because of the price point but after reading a majority of the feed back I purchased it. Glad I did!
review_text_4: Absolutely worth the money. I‚Äôve had a different swann system and that hard drive fried after one singular storm... this system has gone through several power surges, storms, and a tornado. It‚Äôs still kicking. I was able to use those 4 swann cameras with this device for a total of 8, just waiting to find the perfect spot for the last camera. It‚Äôs perfect. Easy to set up and use. The app was also easy to set up. Downside is that every time the internet or power goes out you have to reconnect the system to the app, but it is what it is. Not a big deal. I did give the night vision a 4 star because I wish it was just a tad bit clearer. The app has a feature that you can take screen shots and videos of recordings. You can go back almost two weeks. The zoom is incredible. Overall, I‚Äôd recommend this to everyone.
review_text_5: I recently got this set-up after attempting a cheaper IP wireless camera. For my needs, the IP camera was a wash and difficult to set up and use. I decided to bite the bullet and spend a little more for this system. I do not regret it one bit! The set up is relatively easy, although wires are almost always a pain. After testing the system, I installed 3 of the 4 cameras. The included cables are more than generous in length. Although the cameras are waterproof, the connections are not, so for the one camera that isn't under the roof line, I did have to get some marine quality heat shrink wrap and a heat gun. All in all, once installed, the system is a breeze to set up. As it has a built in hard drive, it's so much easier than getting a cheaper system that requires an additional hard drive. I like that I can see, playback, and even record segments from my phone. In addition, the included DVR is easy to use and maneuver through. This is the 1st security system I ever installed, and I now feel like an expert after doing this myself. I would absolutely recommend this system, and I've actually already convinced a few neighbors to get the same system. I have a feeling I will be helping a few neighbors with their installations, now.

description: Cam v3 is the 3rd generation of Wyze‚Äôs flagship camera, Wyze Cam. Like its predecessor Wyze Cam v3 lets you see and record 1080p video right from the Wyze mobile app. New to Wyze Cam v3 is its waterproof design allowing for outdoor installation with an IP65 rating. Wyze Cam v3 also takes advantage of an all-new Starlight Sensor which allows for extreme low-light performance and shows great detail in the dark. With Wyze Cam v3's color night viewing, night time video recording appears as if it‚Äôs day time.

review_text_1: This camera is a huge improvement over the V2. Aside from the wider angle of view (more camera coverage), the night vision is insanely great in color. The fact that this can be used outdoors and can endure the elements makes it perfect.
review_text_2: Update:I use 5 at my house. I like them so much, I installed 2 at my grandmother‚Äôs house to keep an eye on her declining health and talk to her. Glad I did! 2 days later she fell and we were able to call 911 for her. I was 90 miles away and able to communicate with the Paramedics and have my parents meet them at the hospital.Original review:Excellent camera and easy to use.I see some reviews complaining about they couldn't get the camera to connect. I had the same issue, but I figured out. These cameras need a 2.4GHz WiFi network with a WPA/WPA2 protocol. Wyze Devices cannot be connected to a 5GHz network. So go into your router settings and change it. Many have the option to run both at the same time, which is what I did.Also, if you're having an issue at the QR code screen, where is says scan with cam. It means the Wyze cam, not your phone camera. Just point your phone at the camera and it will sync.
review_text_3: The image quality is superb. The motion can be separated to detect normal motion or persons which is extremely helpful to minimize false positives. It is tiny, lightweight, easy to install and cheap.The only con so far is a somewhat diminished WiFi range compared to my previous v2 cam; not a whole bunch. However, the fact that this one is weather resistant compensates in my book.Pleased with my camera. Thumbs up for sure.
review_text_4: My wyze cam came in today. Within 3 minutes this tiny camera was up and running. I did already have a wyze account. It had to complete 3 firmware updates. I had to log out of my app and log back in. Once that was done it was set to go. I'm looking forward to seeing the night vision this evening.Remember it will only operate on 2.4
review_text_5: Best camera! Ever ir has 2 way audio for 20 dollars ü§Ø

review_text_1: I have not owned these cameras for very long but so far, they have been functioning very well. The picture quality is great, but you do lose some details when you zoom in. The microphone feature is nice to have, and the vocal clarity is great. I am currently trying a new location for one of the cameras, as I have decided to face it out the front window, but I can remotely move the field of vision back inside the house if desired.
review_text_2: I love these cameras! I have two of them in my house and would love to get a couple more! Some of the things I love about this camera are: (1) the ability to select which portion of an image (see photo) I want to receive notifications on, (2) the ability to save a preset view so that if I move it around, I can click the preset and go back to where I want it to stay, (3) the ability to talk through the camera, (4) the ability to turn off notifications for sound, and (5) NO MONTHLY SERVICE FEE! Although this one isn't made for outdoor use, I placed it inside my house looking out my front door and I'm able to spy on my packages and whenever someone approaches the house. I often use my camera to also talk to my kids when I can't get a hold of them. Ha ha! All in all, a GREAT device and will DEFINITELY be buying more for our home in the future!
review_text_3: The blurams cam was recommended by many you tubers and is hands down one of the best cameras I have purchased. We have it installed upside down and use it as a baby monitor. Installation was easy and fast, and the picture quality is great during the day and night time. I just still need to figure out how the SD card storage works.
review_text_5: I wanted to be able to keep an eye on my place when I'm not around especially when I travel. I've seen different devices but this one popped up on my screen so I decided to give it a try. It was very easy to set up. Let me tell you I highly recommend this camera it has night vision and can rotate from left to right there is also a button to talk which is awesome.

review_text_1: While all the reviews and images look great, these camera HAVE to be plugged in to work and that‚Äôs what you do not see in the advertisement pictures . It‚Äôs frustrating because most outlets are not near high ceilings or places you would put a camera . So although it lives up to the hype and is truly a GOOD PRODUCT these pictures should be reported for false advertising.
review_text_2: So far so good. We've been using Yi products for a while, but have had some issues with them lately. We hooked these up today and they are just as easy to setup as the Yi cameras. The video is crisp and the audio is clean. I give them 5 stars and will be ordering more once these have stood the test of time for a bit longer.Update: 12/12/20I've been using these for a little bit now and they are so much better than the Yi cameras I used to have. One of the biggest perks is that they do not require that you subscribe to their cloud service in order to view multiple cameras on the screen. Only draw back to these is that they don't have a Windows app to view cameras. Only android and iPhone. However, you download the Blue Stack emulator for windows and it's like having an Android on your windows desktop. These cameras are perfect! Everything about them is so much better than the Yi.
review_text_3: We got these with the vague idea that we could monitor our kiddo and babysitters while out on date night. But with Covid, date night is a thing of the past. Let's hope I'll need these more in the future.I installed them already and actually I've really enjoyed being able to monitor different rooms in my house from my phone. It's nice that you can see the feed from every camera on one screen, or just do one at a time so you can see more detail. The picture is pretty good, clear enough that you can tell what's going on. Sometimes I use them to see how my daughter and husband are doing when I'm at the grocery store, or just to see which room my daughter is in and whether she's making a mess, but that's about it so far. Hoping to get more use out of them in the covid-free future. Anyway, for the price, you really can't beat these.
review_text_4: My husband and I just moved to a much larger city than we are accustomed to and bought this for our own practice of mind when our teenager is home alone. I didn‚Äôt expect much since the product was so cheap but let me tell you I was blown away with what I received! The picture quality is much better than expected, the sound quality with speaking through them is great, and the night vision works like a dream! I was expecting them to have cords from reading the reviews and those are the only downside! They are a little short but super easy to hide and extensions aren‚Äôt expensive to purchase! Will recommend.
review_text_5: This is a great product, one of the easiest devices I have ever set up, definitely worth the money

review_header_3: Let me tell you about this camera
review_text_1: I have yet to find something about this camera that I don‚Äôt like!! It rotates almost 360 degrees and the lens can also move up and down almost 180 degrees. I had no idea about WiFi frequency and ordered a camera that was only compatible with the 2.4 freq. I had to return it since my freq was 5. I saw several that were advertised as being compatible with both, but after reading the Q&A noticed that that wasn‚Äôt true. I was skeptical that these wouldn‚Äôt work but they did!!! I ordered two and they are definitely worth the price! I have yet to mount them but I am very pleased with my purchase! The set up was less than 5 min for each camera and the cord that they come with is a pretty decent length. You will not be disappointed with this camera!
review_text_4: I purchased an entire Reolink system w/ 8-port NVR, and added 3 of these wi-fi cams on to the system to view the garage, and pets while we're not home, etc.. Super easy setup, the NVR saw them immediately, and they work great. Both day and night vision are amazing quality! I assigned them static IP addresses in my router so it's easy to access them directly as well with a browser (just look in your router for device called E1 or something like that). When you access them directly via browser you have more control/options than when accessing via the NVR, because the cams have their own internal menus. Like I said, I bought 3 of these, And I would buy them again if I need more!
review_text_5: This little camera is amazing! My family loves it. Hard to believe this technology is so simple and affordable. We are hooked. We will be buying more of these. Can't wait to see which dog is getting in the trash!

review_header_3: Excellent camera for the price you can't go wrong
review_header_5: Great value with some nice features
review_text_1: I have many different brands of cameras that I use for various things. I have 4 of the Wyze earlier released cameras and am anxiously awaiting the arrival of their newest camera. Their cameras are small and come with easy to use mounting hardware. I have the cameras set up in traffic areas. When a person enters the area I get an immediate alert on my smart phone. I get a real clear picture of what the camera detected. These cameras have great range and do not loose connection to WIFI like other cameras when on the fringe of a small range from the router. You do need to have cameras in a lit area for night viewing. They do have an add on spot light for one of their cameras and it works just great. I DO NOT use these cameras strictly for a security system. My camera security system is hard wired and works 24/7. IP cameras can alert you to movement, but are only PART of a security system. I would never rely on just IP cameras for security. I hope this helps as Wyze produces some great 'state of the art' technologically advanced IP cameras! You can also use and emulator on your PC and view the cameras from your computer. I hope this helps, I really dislike it when people lacking knowledge about security systems pipe in with misinformation. I installed security cameras in government installations as a subcontractor years ago, and you never loose the basics of a designing a good installation.
review_text_2: Setup was a breeze and the device is scary smart. Will definitely be buying another one.
review_text_3: Love this little camera. It's pretty fragile but so far it has held up pretty well. <fingers-crossed>
review_text_4: Fast shipping just got mines today I‚Äôm super impressed love the siren feature with it...I will totally buy this again real soon
review_text_5: Really enjoy the Wyze camera overall, but had some difficulties configuring things just right.Pros: - Size: Smaller than I imagined and easy to place on a table. - Night vision: was sharper than expected - 360 panning: I love not having to buy multiple cameras to see what's happening in one room, especially to see where my dog is at when I'm away. - 12 second clips for free: Couldn't find another company that offered this.Cons: - The app: Really hard to navigate around and set things up - Instructions: Had a hard time figuring out the right configurations to set things up the way I'd like.

description: The Cync Indoor Camera gives you added privacy and peace of mind while you are away. Check on your home and loved ones from anywhere, at anytime in the Cync App. Use the privacy shutter to disable the microphone and camera for extra privacy when you need it. Get alerts when your kids get home from school, when your dog jumps on the couch, or if something is out of place. Record memories you don't want to forget and share with loved ones who couldn't be there. With voice and out of home control, you can control your security any way and from anywhere. Featuring night vision, HD 1080p resolution, and two-way audio, the Cync Smart Indoor Wi-Fi camera allows you to check on things when you can't be there. Pairing it with your Google Assistant or Amazon Alexa device for extra convenience using voice control. Plugged in for continuous power, the camera delivers instant mobile alerts when you need them; get the notifications with advanced motion and sound detection to focus on the alerts that matter most. Easy to install and easy to use, mount your camera on a wall or place it on a shelf.

review_text_1: Loved how simple to set up, works wonderfully, privacy shutter quite convenient!
review_text_2: This camera is high quality and provides a very clear image on the new Cync app. Very easy to set up and connect. Great experience.
review_text_3: Great wifi camera for the money, good motion detection and night vision.
review_text_4: App is really slick and camera is awesome quality for the price.
review_text_5: nice little unit works as advertiised

Receive instant alerts and live stream 1080p HD video to your smartphone, Alexa or Google Assistant supported display. The Spot even provides HD video up to 30 feet with Night Vision. EC70 continuously records and stores footage on a local MicroSD card up to 64 GB (MicroSD card not included). Premium cloud storage options are available.

review_header_1: No subscription required for EC70 camera
review_header_4: Great camera for its price and you don't have to subscribe to store video
review_text_1: Get the EC70 with a 64gb sd card and you'll be all set.. no need for paying for cloud service.. you can view the live camera view and the recordings over cellular network and over other people's Wi-Fi through TP-LINK's Kasa app so you don't have to be on the same network.. I replaced all my Amazon cloud cams because their paid service was horrible and was required.. if you get the EC70 with SD card support then you are not required to pay a subscription of any kind.. I have been very happy with these cameras so far. I have five of them and I've had no problems.. Thanks TP-LINK üëçP.S. This camera seems to go on sale consistently at $34.99 and that's a really good deal when it does..
review_text_2: KC110Great camera!!! Very simple to set up. Day vision is excellent. Night vision is superior. Pan/tilt is a wonderful feature when you want a full view of the room. It goes up and down, as well as left and right. Zoom is awesome. Audio quality is great. I have nothing negative to say about this camera. The price is unbelievable for the features you receive. The power cord is detachable, unlike their outdoor camera. Kasa app is needed for installation and use. You can set a schedule for record times. You can set zones. You can turn the status LED light off. You can set motion tracking to on where it follows the motion and records. You can adjust the video quality and rotation. You can set it to record video only, video and audio, or not record at all. You can set it to listen for sounds to record. You can set it to record motion that lasts anywhere from 0.1 seconds to 5 seconds. This camera is packed with features! You can even tell Alexa to show it to you on your tv. And she will! It's a little delayed. But it goes through a lot. This camera is highly recommended for anyone looking for these features. I have included a photo with light, and one without for comparison. I'm very impressed.
review_text_3: I just finished ordering a second Kasa indoor camera. The first one is almost a year old now. I mainly use it for monitoring our cat when we travel and to check on the cat sitting service we use.I put a 64G SD card into them, it stores adequate motion detection for my purpose.I usually leave the camera off when we are at home, I don't need videos of us sitting around watching TV.Some people complain the camera makes a loud grinding sound when you pan and tilt the camera. In reality, the camera is very quiet when you move it, but it does have a 2way speaker mic, and that picks up the sound of the motor which sounds loud in your phone's speaker. In person it's very quiet.Another reviewer claims you need to be signed up for cloud service and have your phone on the same wifi system as the camera to use it. That's not true, you can view the camera anywhere in the world as long as the camera is on a WiFi network and your phone has a signal, network or wifi. An SD card stores alerts. 64 gig has been adequate for my needs.To access the SD slot, rotate the camera lens to the top, it's hidden near the base.I'm adding the second camera to watch my cat in another room she likes to hang out in, I'm going to also set it so it has a view of my front door, the pan/tilt/zoom work very well.No need to sign up for cloud storage, in my opinion. If that is something you need, Kasa has it available.I've been very pleased with all of my Kasa devices.For the price, you can't beat the Kasa camera.
review_text_4: I have some other TP Link products and I really like the app so I figured I would try this camera. I was pleasantly surprised at the ease-of-use and the quality of the Video and sound. It has some really interesting features such as the ability to track movement or be set to a "patrol mode" where it rotates through various preset views. It can be mounted on the wall and ceiling or just have it sit on a table. The app has the ability to rotate the picture if you mounted on a ceiling. Best of all, I don't have to subscribe to yet another video streaming storage service. I use this occasionally as a security camera, so the free package lets me store Eight hours of video, which is plenty for what I use it for. If you need more storage, you can buy a plan. The camera takes no time at all to put it on the table, plugged it in (It works off standard 5 V USB) And have it up and running. The TP Link app is one of the best smart device apps I have seen. It works amazingly well for the Smart lights then I have and the same app works incredibly well with this camera. I mostly use it for House security if I'm gone, I have also used it to watch my small dog in our backyard. It's fascinating to watch the Camera track her movements around the yard. And if she is doing something she's not supposed to, I just press the microphone button and I can speak through a speaker on the camera.I think this camera is an excellent value. You get a name brand camera with multiple features for a very affordable price Especially with its night vision, I think this is an excellent security product if you feel you need that. Or it can be used as a nursery camera and I'm sure a variety of other uses.
review_text_5: I have a lot of cameras in my house do to having a spectrum childAnd this one so far is one of the best clear picture I went out of town and was calling my daughter she wasn‚Äôt picking up I opened the camera saw her in the kitchen pressed the microphone and told her look at your phone I‚Äôm calling you and she looked at the camera and went and got the phone loud speaker clear picture wonderful night vision it‚Äôs perfect and you could rotate the camera from your phone great camera great price I recommend it

Nooie Cam 360 has 101¬∞ field of view -- rotates 355¬∞ horizontally and 94¬∞ vertically. name: Nooie Dog Camera with Phone App, WiFi Pet Camera with SD Card, Indoor Home Security Camera for Pet/Baby/Nanny, with AI Tracking, IR Night Vision, Works with Alexa, 2-Way Audio
review_header_3: Third Nooie purchase - great product and app!
review_text_2: I was so reluctant to give this new, updated version of the Nooie 360 camera a try because I've had so much trouble keeping the old camera connected I wasn't sure I wanted another Nooie. But a friend convinced me to try the new model, telling me it was so much easier to connect. I loved the old model when it worked...great sound, crisp images even in low light. We use it to keep an eye on our grand baby so we know when he wakes up. But, the old model was so difficult to connect...and disconnected often, generally when I received a message to update the firmware. I had to always plan at least an hour out of my day to get it connected properly as it usually took repeated tries to finally get it established.This model is substantially different than the outdated camera, and wholly exceeded my expectations. Right out of the box it was easy to install. It really is almost a "plug and play" device at this point. I plugged it in, and it literally took 30 seconds to establish a firm connection with our home's wifi network. Easy to set up using the QR code provided by the manufacturer. Shortly after establishing the connection, I got the dreaded "update firmware" message. I decided to stress the unit even further by trying to update. To my surprise, instead of spending the next hour troubleshooting, within 2 minutes the firmware was updated and the camera back up and running. Tracks motion perfectly, the same great picture and sound. I am so pleased with this purchase! And, an added bonus is that it comes with an SD card, something that was unavailable on the first, outdated model. I will definitely be keeping this one and recommending my daughter to purchase this as a replacement for their camera. Thank you Nooie...you've knocked it out of the park with this one!
review_text_3: This is my third Nooie camera and I love it. All 3 cameras integrate seamlessly into the Nooie app and the quality of the video/pictures are great, including night quality vision. Even without the SD camera, I have the ability to take a screenshot and recording videos directly from the app onto my phone's camera roll. The audio lags a little but otherwise it's a great way to communicate with my cats while I'm not home. Looks very slick too!
review_text_4: I already own the Nooie 1080P so I was excited to so one that has 360 degree movement. My camera is used as a baby monitor so even though the 1080P was placed to see most of the room, I missed being able to pan the room.I received the item very quickly - roughly a day later. I right away loved the packaging, very minimal keeping the waste low. It wasn't packaged with crazy twist ties or excessive bags, very happy!This camera was very easy to install, works exactly like the 1080P. I am happy this one comes with an SD card so I don't need to pay for the monthly subscription to being able to look back on footage.The camera is able to attach to the ceiling which is great for panning the room! How our room is set up though we needed an extension cord to reach and outlet and be in the best position.The app still needs some upgrades but love having access on my phone. The camera pans in the app by touching the screen- a lot like moving around a map on your phone. It keeps it simple and user friendly. Everyone I share screenshots with can't get over the picture quality!Overall, very happy with the camera and the brand.
review_text_5: Wow! We have another Nooie camera that we normally use as a baby monitor that we love - We are 100% replacing it with this! The nighttime and daytime quality are a step above the rest! We love that it has the 360 tracking and that feature has worked seamlessly and as advertised. The sound and motion notifications make it great as a pet cam, security camera and baby camera!The nighttime (black and white) photo I provided is in the middle of the night and it is DARK in that room. The night vision is just WOW!The price is amazing - we have had other security cameras and the quality in this little gem is AMAZING! It takes 5-10 mins to set up and is easy, easy, EASY! Also nice that you can unplug it and move it around and it automatically reconnects to the network.I have had zero complaints with my other Nooie camera and it is the same with this one!

features: Blink Indoor is a wireless, battery-powered security camera that helps you check in on your home day or night with infrared night vision.,With long-lasting battery life, Indoor runs for up to two years on two AA lithium batteries (included).,Store video clips and photos in the cloud with the Blink Subscription Plan and save events locally to the Blink Sync Module 2 via a USB flash drive (sold separately).,Get customizable motion alerts on your phone through the Blink Home Monitor app so you‚Äôre only alerted when you need to be.,See, hear, and speak to people and pets in your home with live view in real time and two-way audio features in the Blink app.,Designed so you can set up yourself in minutes. No wiring, no professional installation required.,Works with Alexa ‚Äì use your voice to monitor your home through supported Alexa-enabled devices.,Includes three Blink Indoor cameras and one Sync Module 2.
name: Blink Indoor ‚Äì wireless, HD security camera with two-year battery life, motion detection, and two-way audio ‚Äì 3 camera kit
review_header_2: Stop comparing these to professional security set ups
review_header_4: Captures everything, even when you Blink!
review_header_5: Capable indoor wifi camera at a reasonable price
review_text_1: Very easy install and setup. Video quality doesn‚Äôt seem to be much better than the cheap wyze cam I replaced with this blink, even after adjusting to ‚Äúbest‚Äù quality. Love that it‚Äôs wireless and no longer have a 9 foot cable hanging on my wall. App is pretty intuitive. Alexa integration is great. Had an issue with the first cam, customer service was very helpful.
review_text_2: I just want to say for all the people that crap on these cameras, these cameras are amazing. They do the job. They are sturdy. They last through snow, wind, rain, and sun. They have amazing low light vision. Clear pictures. And a great setup to last two years on double AAs. And for those who need them to last longer buy the adapter to plug them in. It's stupid how these people come and review these as if they were 5000 dollar security set ups. These are worth it and a great value.
review_text_4: We are happy with our blink indoor cameras. It being wireless, light, and battery powered made it easy to install. The motion detection feature allows you to choose sections of the room you want monitored. The night vision is provides good quality captures and we were surprised the battery life is rated for two years. However, please keep in mind that it could change base on how much you use the live view, how often it triggers to record, how long the duration of recording, is set to, and if your wifi signaling is bad.Note: if you have a large area or areas with lots of obstructions (i.e. cement, brick, steel, and aluminum) walls you may want to have a wifi meshed network to extend you wifi network pass these obstructions. We have the Google Nest Wifi system. Also, the blink camera must connect to the sync module via low frequency radio (LFR). Because of this, the camera must be within distance of the sync module. This is separate from your home wifi network. My suggestion is to get another syn-module if you run into issues where your single sync-module cannot cover all camera areas.
review_text_5: The all-new Blink Indoor ‚Äì wireless, HD security camera appears to be a good product at a reasonable price. I bought a set of three that came with a Sync module. I believe up to 10 devices can be connected wirelessly to the Sync module that communicates using your home wifi. I was able to easily set up the camera using the Blink app on an iPhone. in addition, I was able to link to Alexa using my Amazon Prime account. This helped to view the camera on the Echo View screen using Alexa voice command such as, "Alexa, show Living Room."I understand that Lithium AA batteries (supplied with the camera) would last for two years. Also, there is a USB-C port to power the camera, although no cable or USB charging block is provided.The camera comes with a small mountong bracket and screws for wall or ceiling mounting.15 day trial for storing in the cloud is free and after that the subscription is $3/month per camera or $10/month for all cameras. However, the Sync module has an USB post and a low profile USB thumb drive upto 256 GB may be used to store video clips in MP4 format.My only complaint is that a detailed User's Manual explaining all these should be included instead of finding at Blink support website.

features: 1080P HD indoor, plug-in security camera with motion detection and two way audio that lets you monitor the inside of your home day and night.,Get alerts on your smartphone whenever motion is detected or customize motion detection zones so you can see what matters most.,Store events conveniently and securely in the cloud with a 30-day free trial of the Blink Subscription Plan or locally with the Sync Module 2 and a USB flash drive (USB sold separately).,See, hear, and speak to people and pets in your home on your smartphone with Blink Mini‚Äôs live view and two-way audio features (live view is not continuous).,Sets up in minutes ‚Äì just plug in the camera, connect it to wifi, and add it to your Blink app.,For additional ease of use, pair Blink Mini with a supported Alexa-enabled device to engage live view, and arm and disarm your camera, and more using just your voice.
name: Blink Mini ‚Äì Compact indoor plug-in smart security camera, 1080 HD video, night vision, motion detection, two-way audio, Works with Alexa ‚Äì 1 camera
review_header_1: Easy set up but app is lacking
review_header_2: Easy to install only took 5 min!
review_header_4: Easy set up and great image quality
review_text_1: I‚Äôm a Blink XT user with three cameras on the exterior of my home. The set up of the mini was FAR EASIER than the outside cams. I had this thing set up in less than 5 minutes. Picture is good. Sound is LOUD which is what I was looking for.The app however needs some work to support this style of camera. The app works decently for the BlinkXT cameras and functionality, which is motion for most users. As in you get a notification that there is motion, it records, and you watch the recording or live as you please. but it is clunky to get into the Blink Mini for the purpose of continuous viewing which is my intention for this camera, like a baby monitor. Like many other Americans now working from home with a full house of kids, I wanted to use this to assist with keeping an eye on the kids as I worked and record those cute moments. I wanted to use this to visualize a blind spot that I can‚Äôt see from the office. I tried mounting it from the ceiling and realized you can‚Äôt rotate the video. Mounting on the wall was a little problematic, I couldn‚Äôt quite get the right angle needed.Another quirk to the app is if you switch to another app and then come back to the Blink app, you have to hit the play button to resume viewing.All in all, these are minor issues specific to my use of the camera which is why I have it five stars anyway.Hey amazon/Blink, it would be an awesome feature if you‚Äôd allow the integration of this camera with Alexa so we can ‚Äúdrop in‚Äù and talk through the Echo Dot. Just saying.
review_text_2: I love this lil camera!! Easy to install! Only took 5 min and it works great!! Highly recommend this!!
review_text_3: Great price and product. Connected very easily to my existing Blink system. I am not happy with having to pay for storage after trial ends.
review_text_4: This is a great little camera monitor. Pros: easy set up, easily managed with your smart phone, clear image quality with motion detection. Can be set up to arm and record at any time. I bought this to use in my master bedroom by my desk where I keep sensitive information.Cons: if you are using it with another Blink product and you arm 24/7 then the other Blink unit also needs to be armed which is an issue because my other unit uses 2 AA batteries. There is no timer on the app to set up a time to arm which would by useful because I sometimes forget to arm at night. It has good night vision quality. It needs to be plugged in so is a problem if you put it in a place (i.e. bedroom closet) if there is no outlet. Because of this, it is difficult to make the camera more hidden (if you are looking for a nanny camera for example).Overall it is easy to use and I would recommend it for a basic home security camera.
review_text_5: SO...I rarely write reviews but was so amazed by this camera I wanted to let others know. I bought the camera after using the Ring indoor camera for twice the price and it made a constant clicking noise with the filter adjustment to light in the room that was a known issue Ring told me and not a defect. I've tried all the other brands out there WYZE, etc and disappointed with all. Then I tried the Blink Mini which I thought was a good price. The setup was a breeze, up and running in 30 seconds. The app is responsive and user friendly. My wifi is sloooow but it still loaded a 1080p HD quality view w hen I accessed it from my mobile app. My favorite feature is the night vision. All my previous cameras just showed a dark room or shadows but this camera shows a clear and crisp picture in pitch black darkness. Very pleased with this and you can't go wrong here. My 2 year indoor camera journey has come to an end here.

name: Indoor Security Camera, Wansview 1080PHD WiFi Indoor Camera, Baby Camera, Baby Monitor, Pet Camera, with Motion Detection Two-Way Audio Night Vision, Compatible with Alexa (4 Pack)
review_header_4: Unbeatable value for a quality camera
review_header_5: Very good deal for the peace of mind they give you when you are away.
review_text_1: I've been buying Wansview products for years now and these definitely did not disappoint. I have them set up in various locations around the house. The base allows for sharp-angled installations. I have one above my stove and it lays so flat you can't even see it underneath the cupboard. Makes it easy to watch things that are cooking! I also have one facing outside looking through a window. My biggest complaint is that you cannot control the IR light independently from the nightvision mode (black and white). When looking through a window at night, if the IR is turned on it reflects on the window and blocks the view from the outside. I have external IR lights mounted outside so there is no problem with having enough IR light, the problem is that the camera won't go into IR mode (black and white) unless the IR light is on. Not a dealbreaker, I just wish this camera had that functionality because other cameras they sell do.
review_text_2: Let me preface this with Wansview gave these cameras to me to product test for them, however, I‚Äôve purchased Wansview cameras too, so I would probably be giving these a positive review anyway ‚ò∫Ô∏èthese cameras allow me to check on my dogs and my house when I‚Äôm not home. For example, yesterday I checked on them and saw that someone furry stole butter off the counter. Because I don‚Äôt have a cloud subscription I wasn‚Äôt able to wind it back and see who (which you can do, but only if you‚Äôre either a subscriber or attached to the same WiFi at the time you‚Äôre looking).So, I knew what to expect when I got home. The motion alerts are very effective. You can set how and when you‚Äôd like motion detected, and at what sensitivity. If you‚Äôre connected to your home WiFi, you can even save the video clip if captured, if you‚Äôd like. I think the only feature I‚Äôd add is noise detection, but that‚Äôs just me being extra. For the price these are high quality with many well done features.I attached screenshots of what the camera view looks like in light vs dark.overall a very good experience for the price of all four. I think overall I like their cameras that can move around the room better, but for these not having that feature, their frame of view is still very wide!If you‚Äôve made if this far, you should buy them already.
review_text_3: These four K5 model cameras are surprisingly good. I have had three Wansview IP cameras (an outside fixed W4, and two inside Q5 models that move) and had a few locations that I needed to cover (at 4 different wifi zones at different addresses). All the cameras installed immediately and smoothly, and provide a remarkably large field of view. There is some "fisheye" effect in an auditorium that is 80' long, but with good lighting the view is clear and the zoom allows closer inspection. Night view (inside) is "good enough" to tell if there is something amiss, but of course, no color. The camera does seem to gather more light than the human eye, so it is actually better than being on-site. Sound is surprisingly good - I can hear and be heard by an associate some distance from the camera. I've had the inside fixed units only a few days, but have found the rotating dome cameras to be quite durable over the last year. Good value. Didn't have to purchase any subscription on their cloud to meet my needs. I don't bother with motion sensor feature and alerts, but found they worked fine with my outside cameras (except for moths at night). I can view all 7 units on my phone and tablets anywhere I have signal. I would sure like to have a link to accomplish this on my PC. I was able to share at least one of the camera views with an associate that also needs to keep tabs at this location. That is a handy feature of the Wansview Cloud App.
review_text_4: I have previously bought other Wansview cameras, both indoor and outdoor models, so I already had their app on my phone which made it easy to setup these K5 cameras. Having been very pleased with my other Wansview cameras for performance and dependability, I decided this four-pack would be great to put on four of my window sills looking through windows to serve as security cameras. Their wide angle view is great for viewing a sizeable area, and I am able to view either short clips of movement via the Wansview cloud or video captured and saved on the optional micro SD cards, giving me a complete recorded view of activity around my house. For the price, I am amazed by how fantastic the monitoring is that I now have. BTW, when my daughter found out I bought this set of cameras, she came over to watch the setup procedure. She was so impressed by how easy setup was and also the quality of the video along with the features on the Wansview app that she plans on getting these same cameras to use with a couple to look out her windows and the others to monitor her cat.
review_text_5: This camera package is a very good deal. I don‚Äôt know how to use them with Alexa but there is no need, I can do everything manually from my cellphone. I got these cameras a day before my vacations to Mexico, installing them was very easy, when I was in vacations being able to see what was going on in my house and specially with my cat gave such a peace of mind. These cameras doesn‚Äôt pan so you have to place them in a corner they give a very wide vision of the room and the image is very good. Definitely recommend them.Este paquete de camaras es un buen deal. Yo no s√© usarlas con Alexa pero no es necesario, todo lo puedo hacer manualmente desde mi celular. Las c√°maras llegaron un dia antes de mis vacaciones, fue muy f√°cil instalarlas, cuando estaba en mis vacaciones y poder ver lo que estaba pasando especialmente con mi gato me dio una super tranquilidad. Estas c√°maras no giran o panean entonces se tienen que colocar en una esquina y dan una visi√≥n muy amplia del cuarto y la imagen es muy n√≠tida. Definitivamente las recomiendo.

name: Arlo Ultra 2 Spotlight Camera - 2 Camera Security System - Wireless, 4K Video & HDR, Color Night Vision, 2 Way Audio, Wire-Free, 180¬∫ View, Black - VMS5240B-200NAS
review_header_4: Easy to set up and works as hoped for
review_text_1: Really easy to set up, but the sensitive setting was a little difficult to find. Instead of being with he camera settings it is hidden in the mode area. However, Arlo has a lot of information online and was easy to resolve.
review_text_2: I upgraded from an Arlo Pro to the Arlo Ultra 2 Spotlight Camera and am quite satisfied. Build quality and image quality are excellent.
review_text_3: I swapped a Pro2 for a new Ultra2. It was easy to setup the new camera in the Arlo app. The camera position tool in the app made it easy to position the cameras view. The video quality is very good with some slight chromatic aberrations at high zoom levels at 20+ feet. The detection algorithm is also very good. It recorded a squirrel and correctly flagged it as an animal. Distance to the hub is probably 30-40 feet with one exterior wall in between.
review_text_4: Unlike my experience with Arlo's wired doorbell and chime, the Ultra 2 cameras work fabulously. The batteries do not last the advertised length of time. Knowing that I ordered two extras and the charger. The main camera battery had to be exchanged every two days and the secondary camera in our carport every five days. I installed a third-party 3 watt solar panel designed for the Arlo for each camera. The solar panels keep both batteries charged at 100 percent. I think it will be a pain to review the recordings on the base station's mini SD card, so there is no question in my mind that customers purchasing the cameras will also need to purchase Arlo's cloud storage service once the free trial period is over. Customers need to have reasonable expectations. I have my camera's set at the best quality settings, but still, don't expect to be able to read license plate numbers, and the "color" in nighttime recordings is very marginal.
review_text_5: I purchased the Ultra 2 to replace an aged system. Once you see the video, you'll declare 4k video is the only way to go. I installed the two cameras outdoors myself, and I am far from being a home improvement guy. You'll love it. I also watch my camera feed at night on my Amazon Echo Show. Be mindful there is an update package for the cameras and the base. Do the quick download before installing. My system uses the 25' constant power supply accessory, too. No pesky battery replacement or charging issues. You'll love this... I do!

review_header_1: Great Picture Quality. Safe With Encrypted Channels
review_header_5: Easy setup and great video quality! Simple App!
review_text_1: I am so happy I found this product! I was skeptical about cameras connecting to my home due to hearing of problems relating to other brands and hackers. This camera connects to a safe and encrypted server every time you log in to view your cameras so I am always able to feel at ease! These cameras are wonderful and the price you are paying makes them even BETTER! They have great quality and set up takes no longer than 5 minutes! Upon receiving the cameras (in a timely manner I might add) they were nicely packaged with an instruction manual that made set up easy and quick. The longest set up time was finding where I was going to put them! The adhesive 3m tape worked great as I stuck it to the side of a wall and I haven‚Äôt had any problems. The app is the third one down in the App Store (I have pictured the correct one for reference). As you can see in the live shot I included the image is clear and the two way sound works wonderful. I love being able to check in on my dogs all day when at work and being able to speak to them through the camera makes things ten times better! Definitely recommend this product!
review_text_2: Pros: the picture quality on these is wonderful. I can see everything so clearly, even with the night vision. The microphone works well too. It‚Äôs 2-way. The instructions were simple and very clear. I love that this comes with both the micro SD card option and the cloud upload option for recordings.Cons: completely user/reader error... I didn‚Äôt read the product description very carefully and thought these were outdoor cameras. They are not. I also thought that ‚Äúwireless‚Äù meant cordless. Not the case. These have to be plugged in to work. Both were not a deal breaker. I found a great use for them indoors and they were easy to install with the plug attached.If you are looking for an inexpensive way to feel secure, check in on animals or have a baby monitor, these are definitely the way to go.
review_text_3: If you're looking for something super simple and affordable for piece of mind this is it. I'm honestly impressed with the image quality for the price. Night vision is pretty amazing. Picture shown of my room is dark but not pitch black, outside pic is pitch black. Alerts work well, annoyingly well, but you can adjust sensitivity or set a schedule etc. Love the fact it comes with two 32gb memory cards so you're ready to go out of the box. Set up was very simple. Literally download the app, plug in camera, pick up camera and scan a barcode that pops up on your phone to sync and you are viewing live. Playback is my only gripe because just the smallest slide will fast forward or rewind by a few minutes. Hard to pin point exact times, not impossible. Might be better to have it just record on movement detection but i just keep it on full time. Speakers work very well, can talk to my dog while he's on my bed. This was a deal breaker lmao. You can also hear from the mic in the camera so you can use as a baby monitor or hear your wife's boyfriend. I know these are indoor but I put one against a window and it worked perfect for daytime but at night there was nothing but glare from the ir light. I just decided to say screw it and mount it outside under the car-port where things don't really get weather damaged. Seems absolutely fine this morning: no dew in the lens or anything and I added pics just to show. Will update review if I totally screwed up but with the price I doubt I'll get too mad either way.Edit: about a week outside under the carport and no noticeable difference or damage whatsoever. Working perfect.. Would not put it somewhere it can get rained on for sure. Will update again after a whileNew pic added at midnight still going strong outside. Keep both cameras on event recording and playback is sooo much better.5 month update! New picture added with timestamp for proof. Outside camera still going strong. Noticed recently it was going offline occasionally and figured out it was the power cord going bad from the weight of the extension cord pulling down on it. Micro usb are used for everything so really not an issue, most people have a thousand of them these days. Bedroom camera still great because theres no pressure on that cord.. Other than that literally no problems other than the occasional alert from curious critters :)
review_text_4: I own 2 Wyze cams and several eufy cams and I like them both but the quality picture on these cameras tops them both. The pictures on these cameras top the Wyze cams and match or maybe exceed the Eufy for quality. Ery pleasantly surprised these cameras.Highly recommend.
review_text_5: These are great cameras for the money, the setup was super simple, and the app is easy to use and doesn‚Äôt glitch out or anything. I was actually shocked at the video quality it‚Äôs really sharp, I can read the letters of my license plate of my car in my driveway.

features: Connect your Ring camera with Alexa then enable announcements to be alerted when motion is detected. Talk to visitors through compatible Echo devices by saying ‚ÄúAlexa, talk to the front door‚Äù.,Lets you see, hear and speak to visitors from your phone, tablet and PC,With a Ring Protect Plan (subscription sold separately), record all your videos, review what you missed for up to 60 days, and share videos and photos.,Sends alerts as soon as motion is detected,Plugs into standard power outlets for non-stop power,Monitors your home in 1080HD video with infrared night vision and Live View,Includes built-in LED light strips and a siren,Includes Lifetime Theft Protection: If your Camera gets stolen, we‚Äôll replace it for free
name: Ring Spotlight Cam Wired: Plugged-in HD security camera with built-in spotlights, two-way talk and a siren alarm, White, Works with Alexa
review_header_1: Honest In-depth Review from a Tech Nerd
review_header_5: I can't say enough good things about this camera and company
review_text_1: I‚Äôm a very big tech junkie and am very intrigued by Ring. I first bought ring doorbell 2 and loved the product and app so I went and purchased the Ring Spot light cam wired. The reason I opted for the wired version was I don‚Äôt like messing with batteries, however if I were to buy the battery version I‚Äôd buy the second battery pack to eliminate down time. The wired version is nice as your getting constant power. Then camera also starts recording motion faster with the wired version versus the battery version.Setup: super simple follow Ring app instructions and you‚Äôll be up in running in 10 mins or lessInstall: I live in Nevada land of stucco homes so it takes a little longer to drill holes and place anchors. The ring mounting bracket comes with a level built in to make install easy ‚ÄúPro tip I learned from my door bell‚Äù once you have the mounting bracket level I used a thin nail to start and mark my pilot holes for when I had to drill, which made the install even easier. Once you have the holes drilled anchors in installing is a breeze. The most time consuming part well for me as I‚Äôm OCD is space the holes for the cable clips. Overall the physical installation took 20 mins do to me being OCC. the cable is paintable to match your house. My stucco is white so it was a non issue.Functionality: in order for Ring,Arlo,Nest ect to work properly will require good WiFi and a good router. All these web based on demand cams require good WiFi if your WiFi or router isn‚Äôt up to par you‚Äôll have a bad experience. I run a NetGear Night Hawk Router that I can pick up WiFi halfway down my street so no range extender needed for me. If you have a big house and your router is on the opposite side of the house from your cameras either buy the chime pro extender or better yet by a mesh WiFi like EERO or Orbi or googles mesh routers ‚Äúyou‚Äôll thank me‚Äù the better WiFi signal the better your devices will operate.The App: The Ring App is super easy and user friendly and about to get even better here with new updates and usability. The app allows you to manually turn the lights on and off sound the siren create customized motion areas ‚Äúa feature the battery version doesn‚Äôt do‚Äù as well as set the motion distance for the lights to come on. While reviewing a motion activity or in live view you have the option to turn the lights on or off as well as sound the siren. The app also keeps you informed of any issues with Rings servers or any downtime or issues with devices. The Ring cloud service is outstanding and it‚Äôs very reasonably priced at $3 a month which is cheap. I don‚Äôt need 24/7 video I only need motion events so $3 a month is a great value. The motion or activity alerts are fast and show up on your phone quickly. The two way communication is nice and clear to tell would be questionable people to buzz off if not the alarm will scare them away and wake your neighbors.Overall I am very satisfied with my Spotlight cam wired and my ring doorbell and plan to add more ring devices very soon, with the upcoming software updates from ring the experience is going to get even better. Again I can‚Äôt reiterate enough you have to have good WiFi and router for this device or any of the competitors devices to work properly. I‚Äôm a very very picky person with electronics and can say Ring Spot light cam wired met and exceeded my expectations.The neighborhoods feature within the app is also a great tool to keep you informed of activity or events within your community. Again I highly recommend this product
review_text_3: I have 4 ring Floodlight cameras in use at another property. I really like them so I was excited to see the new Spotlight camera added to the ring lineup. I tried the ring Stick Up Cam Solar prior to ordering the Spotlight and I ultimately returned it due to being spoiled by the better build quality and overall camera quality of the Floodlight Cam. I included photos to show the field of view comparison between the two. While they aren‚Äôt installed in the exact same location, you can see just how much better the Spotlight Cam looks. As expected, the light output is greater on the Floodlight Cam but the Spotlight Cam does a good job of lighting up the immediate area around the unit. After installing and using my first Spotlight camera, I promptly ordered a second and installed it as soon as it came in. Both have been operating as expected. The camera video quality is great, the field of view is awesome. I have already influenced at least one friend to buy a wired Spotlight Cam and he is just as happy with it. I do wish that ring would add some more customization to their iOS app. It would be great to be able to reorder the cameras in any order you want vs left to right based on order of set up. It would also be nice to know if the motion detector triggered the lights or if the lights are on for extended periods without having to open the app. I found that after losing power at one property while not there that the lights stayed on after power was restored. I just happened to notice they were on when I was in the app and had to manually turn them off. HomeKit compatibility would rock too! Anyway, the Spotlight Cam is great! Way to go Ring!
