features: ,,SMART MOTION DETECTION PLUS- This system allows you to choose either Face or Person/Vehicle detection both of which help reduce unnecessary alerts and false alarms from objects like moving branches or animals,ACTIVE DETERRENCE - The cameras in this system feature both motion-activated warning lights and remote-triggered sirens to deter unwanted guests,TWO-WAY TALK - Keep your family and possessions safe with the ability to listen directly to anyone on your property with the built-in mic,COLOR NIGHT VISION ‚Äì The cameras provide clear, colored video quality (ambient lighting required) and with IR night vision for up to 150ft/46m,SENSORS - The Lorex Smart Sensor Starter Kit expands your system and adds an extra layer of security to your home. Receive instant alerts to your phone with the Lorex Home mobile app whenever your door or windows are opened.
name: Lorex 4K Ultra HD IP 8-Channel 2TB NVR System with 8 Smart Deterrence 4K 8MP Indoor/Outdoor IP Cameras and Smart Sensor Starter Kit
review_text_1: Awesome Security System, much more than just the cameras, love the 4k, wide angle, motion detection lights, live sound etc. features. Highly recommended
review_text_2: I am having a new house built and decided to pre-wire for a POE camera system. I ordered this one for that purpose, and was able to test it out in my current house without permanently installing it (yet).Having only had experience with simple cameras like my doorbell cam and a little Blink camera, I am really impressed with this system - it is a serious tool for security and surveillance.Setup is straightforward and the documentation provided makes it simple. The hardest part will be to run the cables through your house, but I'm having that done by pros while my house is being built. POE means it is powered and connected via standard network cables with only and RJ45 connector needed. There are other options (standard switches plus barrel-connector power, or your own POE switch), but it's easiest just to run them back to the main NVR unit. Once physically connected and powered up, there's a simple wizard that you go through to set it up. You will need to provide a computer monitor, but that's about it.The picture quality is impressive in just about any kind of light. I love that it lets you have extremely granular control of event detection (people, vehicle, etc.), motion detection (multiple zones per camera, sensitivity levels, etc.), system settings, storage, and backup. You can also activate a loud audible alarm and warning lights to scare off would-be criminals.Playback is really cool, with colors showing various kinds of activities, the ability to zoom, freeze, take stills, slow mo, date/time zoom, etc. I am still learning how to use it, but in any case it would be really helpful from a forensics perspective.The Android app worked pretty well for me on a Samsung Note 9, despite the low ratings on the Google Play store. It worked fine even over a decent 4g connection for both live view and viewing recorded data in the past. You don't have the granularity of control using the app that you do directly controlling the NVR, but I believe for any day-to-day use of the system, the app is more than adequate.I wish the interface didn't you make log in as frequently as it does, or used a simple PIN or something, but that's a minor issue and actually increases the security of the system a bit.I did not test the door/window sensor or the motion sensor, especially since I use a different alarm system currently, but I might find some creative uses for these in the new house. You get 2 sensors (good for a front and back door), as well as the motion detector - enough for decent home security if you don't have a separate alarm system. These components seem to work with the mobile app, but doesn't directly integrate to the local NVR system as far as I can tell from the docs.I can't wait to get this installed in my new house and use it in a real production environment. This is not a cheap system, but you get a lot for the money. If you are a "power user" who likes to control and tweak things, or you just don't want to mess around with charging batteries on a fleet of cameras, I would definitely recommend this system.
review_text_3: Okay, I have had the chance to play around with a few security systems here and there, looking for the best install. This one, so far, has them all beat! This system is solidly built and super well designed. It is easy to set up, but it does take time, especially if you want to properly install all the cabling in hard to reach or ‚Äúinvisible‚Äù to see locations.Setting up the app is super intuitive, and I haven‚Äôt even begun to play with all the bells and whistles it comes with! Images are sharp, although you get a little grainier at night (which is common), but not as grainy as I have seen some cameras produce. The 2-ay sound works great. I even love the alarm system that you can set off to scare away intruders! Very solid system and worth a look.
review_text_4: When I built my house five years ago, I pre-wired for a four camera system (different brand) and so far I've been fairly pleased with it.Ever since moving in, I've wanted to expand that system, but that meant purchasing a newer 8 camera, NVR and up to four additional cameras.When this camera system became available, I figured that instead of expanding with more cameras, I would just replace the old system (with it's older technology) and I could re-use the old monitor along with some of the cables. Well my old monitor has worked good for four cameras, but I decided that it would have been way too small for eight.Plus, the old camera cables are not compatible with the new cameras.So, instead of replacing the old system, I then decided to install a second camera system, and I'm so glad that I chose that route.I will soon have two, stand-alone security camera systems, with a total of 12 cameras. Plus the new monitor is hanging in the location that I had wished my old one would have been.It'll be a few more weeks before I have this new Lorex system completely installed, but so far I'm really impressed with the equipment.Every single item inside of the box has a look of quality (way better than my old system) and other than having to install the cables, this should be a fairly simple and easy project.I will be using all eight of the new cameras, connected to a 27 inch monitor, and also using the "smart" feature to view each camera on my cell phone.The installation instructions are outstanding, and so well written, that following the step by step process should be a breeze.Although it's still too early for me to comment about camera clarity, night vision, etc. what I've experienced so far has been impressive.
review_text_5: Well worth the cost. Works as advertised, easy to set up.

details: {'Product Dimensions': '6.5 x 2.76 x 2.76 inches', 'Item Weight': '1.26 pounds', 'ASIN': 'B08K1M34ZQ', 'Item model number': 'IP5M-B1186EW-28MM', 'Customer Reviews': '', 'Best Sellers Rank': '', 'Date First Available': '2019-12-11', 'Manufacturer': 'Amcrest'}
features: ,,5MP ULTRA-HD ‚Äì Stunning 5-Megapixel 2592 x 1944p video resolution with enhanced low light capability on this POE outdoor camera utilizing an CMOS progressive image sensor and chipset. Wide 103¬∞ viewing angle allows you to cover more ground. Power Over Ethernet (POE camera) for easy installation (POE injector or switch required; not included, sold separately). Works with Alexa through AmcrestCloud.,SMARTER SECURITY ‚Äì Adjust motion detection zones and sensitivity and receive email/phone alerts and review footage via the Amcrest View app. Playback and record professionally on a PC using the Amcrest Surveillance Pro software or Blue Iris Professional. Works with Amcrest Cloud remote video storage, Amcrest NVRs, and QNAP NAS, FTP, SeaMonkey, and Pale Moon Browsers, IE, Safari, Firefox 49.0, and Chrome with Amcrest Web View Extension,DAY OR NIGHT, RAIN OR SHINE ‚Äì This outdoor POE IP camera features a heavy-duty metal weatherproof IP67 housing, as well as a built-in IR, LED and a low lux image sensor to achieve amazing low-light capability and night-vision up to 98.4 feet. Dual H.265/H.264 compression allows for maximum encryption with the latest technology as well as backward compatibility with legacy platforms. This camera is compatible with Amcrest NVR's and has limited compatibility with third party NVR's.,SECURE CLOUD VIDEO BACKUP ‚Äì The optional Amcrest Cloud remote video storage subscription service allows you automatically store your videos off-site in a third-party location hosted and secured by Amazon AWS. This way if something happens to your local PC/NVR/NAS, the footage will be safely recorded in a secure off-site location and accessible to you through a web-based Flash interface for PC (Chrome/Firefox/Safari/Edge) and AmcrestCloud smartphone app.,SIMPLE, RELIABLE, SECURE ‚Äì This Amcrest POE camera features a secure SSL/HTTPS connection, FCC and CE certificates and receives regular firmware updates. At Amcrest, we want to ensure the safety of our customers, their loved ones, homes and businesses. You‚Äôll receive a full 1-year US Warranty and Lifetime Support provided directly from Amcrest.
name: Amcrest UltraHD 5MP Outdoor POE Camera 2592 x 1944p Bullet IP Security Camera, Outdoor IP67 Waterproof, 103¬∞ Viewing Angle, 2.8mm Lens, 98.4ft Night Vision, 5-Megapixel, IP5M-B1186EW-28MM (White)
review_text_1: I have several cameras: zmodo, ring and wyze. This camera is better than all of them. Great picture and options.This camera is very well built and most importantly, the mount. The mount is very secure and feels beefy. Once tightened, this camera doesn't move unlike the others i have.This camera integrates with Alexa and is easy to setup. As usual, create an account and link it.Multiple resolutions to choose from. You can choose from 1280x720 (720) all the way up to 2688x1520 (4mp).This camera offers cloud storage with motion detection. It allows you to the motion detection area.For the price this camera hands down is worth the price.Please understand before you buy, this camera needs a Poe switch to be powered up. As cheap as these are this is no a deal breaker. Amazon has plenty nicely priced poe switches to choose from.Let me also add, this is a well built camera and mount. Bigger than I thought but not huge.
review_text_2: I didn't know anything about purchasing or installing a camera like this but I knew I wanted a hardwired camera so I would not have to mess with recharging or batteries. I researched cameras on Amazon and YouTube and learned about a PoE camera (power over ethernet). It was so easy to install with just running a coax cable ( used cat 6) from the camera to an additional item I needed, a PoE switch that I purchased on Amazon and a short coax cable to go from the switch to my router. That's it. I also purchased a 256gb SD card for continuous recording.I used the Amcrest Pro View software on my iphone and tablet and the Amcrest Surveillance on my desktop (both versions are free). In hindsight it was super easy to install but at the time it was a learning experience. I probably spent two hours installing the camera and hooking it up and another 3-4 hours getting to know the software. The Amcrest quick start guide and the website both contain a lot of information.The wide angle lens is a huge plus in my situation, I would not have been happy with just a narrow view. Running the higher resolution gives a fantastic view. Using the SD card for recording means I don't need a cloud service but I can still view the camera remotely.Overall I could not be happier with the camera and would recommend it for easy installation and great view.
review_text_3: With all wireless options that are offered today, it is good to always have a hardwired camera; but even better if only an Ethernet Cable is needed, higher speeds, independent of interference and issues with water in the antennas.This POE enabled camera is super easy to set up, the APPs (cloud and ViewPro) are easy to use and follow without much need of configuration, but if needed there are tons of features you can configure to have a very professional setup or just a simple home security camera system.Even it has a great angle view, when in dark environments the images are not perfect from far, but is very good in short distance, so from the price point of view is 100% worth it. I like a lot that you can switch quality modes since not all the time you will need the higher data bandwidth consumption of an HD video. What I would love to have from Amcrest is to have an app compatible with Fire TV, that way you can have a full view of your cameras not only on the computer or smartphone but on your TV as well. Attached 2 pictures of the camera view.NOTE: I'm using the POE Switch from Amcrest and as well super simple to use, I will need to dig more into it, since I want to try the length of all 4 ports used with cameras at the same time, expecting to be able to run up to 100ft each.
review_text_4: The price and quality of this camera makes it a good deal compared to more expensive brands. You are going to get a higher resolution for a better price. The setup of this camera is straight forward: Plug it in, run the app to find the camera, add in to the app, and view. You can hook this up to a NVR or just a regular switch to view Live Video.The App for mobile devices is practically the same you will see across other brands, but seems a bit better, is easy to use, and setup. Follow the instructions Amcrest provides with the camera andSetup took no more than 30 mins to have live viewing on your phone and/or Computer. I tested the Power-over-Ethernet (POE) and the Power directly to the camera if your switch doesn‚Äôt have POE, both worked great.I have the Camera hooked up to a Network Video Recorder (not Amcrest brand) and it works great, which is a big plus if you are looking at switching brands. Great to see that Amcrest is ONIVF compliant.Only Con is the IR light is not the best for a large outdoor areas at night, if you are trying to illuminate a large area in dark hours try to find a model with more than 98ft IR Distance. Amcrest has models with 131 ft. and 164 ft. IR distancesPros: Price, image quality, ease of setup, ONIVF, need to buy Ethernet cableCons: IR isn‚Äôt the best, Amcrest watermark on video.
review_text_5: I have set up over 20 Amcrest installations, and about 10 installations of other types. I prefer the Amcrest for picture quality, build, and durability. I have included some pictures taken with the UltraHD 5MP Outdoor POE Camera 2592 x 1944p during both day and night, in an environment that showcases the camera's quality. Both the day and night footage is exceptional.These camera support native POE, with the ability to get power using a wall-wart. They include necessary hardware to water-protect the cat5 cable. The Camera case and base are made of cast metal, and has a single Allen bolt that allows easy positioning of the camera. Once the bolt is tightened, the camera will not move, even in 40mph winds. (no vibration) The NIGHT Floodlight does not have a red glow, like my older "Vandal Proof" Amcrest; so it is invisible at night unless you know where to look. The lens and the light share a common optic, but the lens is against the glass which removes ghosting caused by internal reflection. Also, the wavelength of this light does not seem to attract insects. As the picture shows, the Night vision almost looks like far infra-red. Both pictures were taken from a screenshot of the video, night time, was taken in the rain.The Crispness of the video shows a solid 25fps to my NVR, and it also supports backup recording on the camera itself. This camera does not need the special Amcrest plugin to access making it much nicer then their older offerings.Motion Detection is also pretty standard, it is very sensitive which can be a pain in the butt, but if you are utilizing a NVR, you can set up zones, and adjust your own sensitivity. The camera may also have a way to set up zones, I did not check.Amcrest provides an app which allows you to view your camera on Android and Iphone at no extra cost. You will need to poke a hole through your firewall unless you use their cloud service. (Which I do not)I will be purchasing more of these cameras in the future as I believe their price and performance is unparalleled.

review_header_2: Great picture quality and build quality
review_header_3: The alert is video in progress.
review_header_4: Reolink continues to be the best value
review_text_1: When I spent countless hours looking for higher quality cameras over my previous setup (Ring), these captured my attention the most. Overall, the installation process is fairly easy, but it can take time depending how you want to mount your cables. For me, I had to go up into the attic, which was the only cumbersome part about it.All you need is a PoE switch and some Ethernet cables. I'd recommend buying the cable that comes in roles, without the connector (R45) piece. Otherwise, you're going to be drilling 1/2'' holes in whatever you decide to put the cable through. This was my first time installing wired cameras, and they turned out amazing. The trade-off with much higher image quality pays off - even though installing is a bit more time consuming. With Wifi cameras, it's easy installation, but the headaches are far much greater with connection, resolution, and pay-based cloud storage. With these Reolinks, all you really need is an SD card & Poe Switch. The SD card allows you to erase, store, and transfer files through a computer or off your phone (FOR FREE).The only negative thing I encountered was with one camera. The little ball joint that allows you to maneuver the camera broke off a piece of the sleeve. I contacter Reolink, and they're supposed to be sending me a replacement.Main thing, do not overlook these cameras. At a 2K resolution, this is all you really need. Great night vision too!
review_text_2: I don't know where to start, but overall I'm impressed by these cameras.Pros:Wide FOVGreat night visionGood Motion Detection settingsAmazing picture quality in daytimeMany apps or programs for different platforms with lots of settings from motion settings to white balance, etc.Cons:Confusing sensitivity settings, had to refer to a article to determine my settingsNight vision has a "Casper" effect where it washes out a person's face with built in IR. With LIFX+ Bulbs it fixes this.Does not include POE injectorsOverall setup was straightforward and getting the SD card formatted was easy. I would recommend getting LIFX+ Lights as an alternative Infrared Light Source to stop the "Casper" effect and keep bugs away from the camera and building webs in front of the camera lense.I don't know if it's my setup but the Windows Program disconnects from the cameras periodically and reconnects but if you leave unattended you might have to reopen the program. Like I said I think it's my setup and nothing to do with the program.This is an unpaid and honest review, I will update if I have any further issues. 5/29/19
review_text_3: Easy to install.Great instructions.Exceed expectations for the moneyI added 2 5mp cameras
review_text_4: How the prices of IP cameras have fallen over the last several years. I remember buying 720p IP cameras for over $150 back in the day, and now we have this Reolink 5MP (which is slightly larger resolution than 2K) for $50. Craziness! Don't hesitate buying this excellent camera. I have 2 of these, and 5 of the previous 4MP versions, connected to a Synology NAS running Surveillance Station and the results are nothing less than perfect. 2K resolution at 30fps all across the board, clear and precise daytime footage, and decent night time IR (even better with an IR blaster, as are most cameras). The Reolink web UI is simple and easy to use, and the ability to do DDNS natively is nice for those who don't use a NAS or computer with their cameras.One note for Synology users: Synology does officially support the 4MP RLC-410 model, but with this 5MP version you have to adjust a few settings. Specifically, the low bandwidth stream in SS does not match the camera's native settings at 4MP, so the camera has to be set up at 5MP to enable that second stream. I prefer the aspect ratio of 4MP, so I just disabled the low bandwidth stream altogether, and then the camera activated properly in SS. Synology might patch this in a future SS update, but for now the fix is quite simple.Bottom line, the RLC-410 is an excellent camera and Reolink remains the brand to beat in the value IP segment.
review_text_5: I bought these wanting to be able to monitor activity at a remote location. They were easy to install and have been working great. I get notifications of any activity in their field of view. Picture quality is good and the SD card seems to hold plenty of activity clips. I would highly recommend to anyone looking for an in-expensive camera solution without having a monthly subscription. Price was very reasonable.

name: Anpviz 16CH 4K 8MP IP PoE Security Camera System, 16CH 4K H.265+ NVR with 4TB HDD, 8PCS 8MP IP PoE Cameras, 98ft Night Vision, Wide Angle Security System for 24/7 Recording, Outdoor Waterproof

review_text_1: I am SO GLAD I choose this Anpviz 8MP IP POE Security Camera System. Perfect kit for a newbie as ANPVIZ's attention to detail is exceptional as the pics show.picture quality and wide angel of the camera is phenomenal hd quality.true plug and play self explanatory system from installing nvr to cameras.The NVR itself is rated for up to 8MP...and that in itself is usually worth 300+ alone if you try to find something similar via ebay or some online website.I buy quite a bit of products from Anpviz and I would recommend them not only for the quality of this system...but for the pride that their team shows in the products they offer...and how they go the extra mile to make sure your expectations are met and exceeded.Anyway , A+ for support. Build quality (electrical and mechanical) of the camera is very good,I would recommend to anyone looking for a cost affective high end security system.
review_text_2: I have eight Hikvision camera and have been a big fan of Hikvision products in general until it became almost impossible to get support. Hikvision will only provide support if you purchase from their authorized dealers. The problem is the dealers go out of business left and right and I‚Äôve have limited success getting support when needed. I was lucky enough to find these Anpviz cameras which appear to be rebranded Hikvision products. They are plug and play compatible with my Hikvision NVR and have most the same features as the Hikvision units. So far I‚Äôm very impressed with the picture quality, night vision and overall quality of the product, and support from Anpviz has been quick and helpful when needed. Anpviz also hosts all the firmware updates directly on their site for quick and easy download. Oh, cost... at least half what a paid for compatible Hik cameras.
review_text_3: Just installed it (05-2021) and the picture looks great. Seems to be on a pricey side but the quality is remarkable. Wish there be a ftp rate setting (or i haven't found it). Will Definitely update if problems arise.
review_text_4: Lots better than my old 1080P, now I can zoom in on text at a distance that my 1080P would not see.
review_text_5: The security camera is perfect! I‚Äôm so happy with this purchase!

Compare to black/white video you get at night with regular infrared cameras, you will get full color video at night with this color night vision camera. name: Lorex 4K Ultra HD IP 8-Channel NVR System with 6 Smart Deterrence 4K 8MP IP Cameras, 150FT Night Vision, 3TB Hard Drive, Fusion Capabilities
review_header_2: Upgraded from Lorex DVR to NVR
review_text_1: I turned to Lorex as a possible home monitoring system after two attempts at using a Reolink. Both of those systems had big issues, like losing all cameras for no reason, losing one camera that required daily reset and reconfiguration, etc. Not so with the Lorex. This is a great looking system and super easy to install. The app is much better too and gives me fast easy access to cameras remotely. One thing I noticed was the 4K cameras produce a much better picture than the Reo system did, but both are suppose to be the same picture quality. The Lorex six camera system cost about the same as the Reo four camera system, so to me it's actually a better value for the money. Also, I really like the added white LEDs on the camera that turn on to warn a person who enters the sensor area that yes, there's a camera and yes, you're already recorded on the system, so "Smile!"
review_text_2: Instillation was fairly simple and required no calls to tech support, Major plus in my opinion. Picture quality is excellent and the night vision works very well. I‚Äôm still exploring software setup options and tweaking settings to meet my needs. The Lorex Home mobile app functions well and is a nice feature to have. If this new unit works as good as my previous still working 12 year old DVR did it‚Äôs a 5 star for sure. Main reason for upgrading was improved picture quality and the NVR POE cameras capabilities.One recommendation for Lorex would be to included a couple 100 or maybe 150 ft cables for the cameras. I found that the included 60ft cables were adequate for 4 out of the 6 camera runs, and would probably meet most home owners needs. In my case the runs were between 20 and 150ft. Although this is not a deal breaker and cables can be easily made or purchased for longer runs, it would of been nice.
review_text_3: These are incredible cameras the best I ever had, Night Vision Works flawlessly facial recognition vehicle recognition all the bells and whistles.
review_text_4: Very happy with this system pros great quality picture, night video is good quality. The cameras are heavy and feel like they are built great. Flaws takes a while to get the settings perfectly fine tuned the way you want. For night color you need to make sure there is plenty of ambient light.
review_text_5: Great product

review_header_1: Best cheap camera I‚Äôve tested yet!
review_header_2: Solid Unit; Would Recommend for the Price
review_header_3: Great 5MP H.265 Weatherproof IP66 IR Dome IP camera option!
review_header_5: High Quality Camera, compatible with Blue Iris Software
review_text_1: For me a I was looking for a lower cost camera to put in my garage compared to the Amcrest cameras I have throughout my house. My Amcrest NVR usually doesn‚Äôt play nicely with other cameras but with some minor tweaking I got this camera up and running and hasn‚Äôt had any issues. (I‚Äôve tested other cameras that would crash the remote app or just straight up not work).A few of the major things I like about this camera vs the Amcrest cameras I have is that I didn‚Äôt have to install any third party software to login, configure, and view the cameras. To me that‚Äôs huge since I‚Äôm always weary of that. Secondly since my day job is in IT I always worry about products ‚Äúphoning home‚Äù and I have been running the cameras almost two weeks and so far they have not reached out to anything that would be an issue. (I‚Äôve seen other cameras reach out directly to IPs from other countries and you can block out all internet by changing the DNS servers as well)I‚Äôm not using this at highest resolution but I did test it some and had no issues. Personally I prefer to run my cameras at 30 frames a second so I‚Äôm limiting it to 1080p like my other cameras. The sensor does its best working in dark and light areas as seen in my pictures. I did like they had designed plenty of adjustments where I could dial in how I wanted my exposure to be. For me I wanted the garage exposed the best if could be since I have another camera on the driveway.Long story short if your looking for a decent feature camera that will work with NVRs this is a great camera to use. It‚Äôs roughly half the cost of an Amcrest camera with the same resolution and I plan to buy a few of these for my in-laws for their exterior cameras once they move into their house.
review_text_3: Test System:‚Ä¢ IP Camera: Anpviz Dome model IPC-D250G (2.8mm version)‚Ä¢ NVR: Synology DS1618+ running DSM 6.2.1-23824 Update 4 and Synology‚Äôs Surveillance Station version 8.2.3-5828‚Ä¢ Power: Supplied via single port PoE Injector 48 Volt 15 WattFirst unboxing impressions:‚Ä¢ Well packed‚Ä¢ Substantial metal base and solid construction‚Ä¢ Manual and software included in the box. The font is a bit small so you may want to consult the copy on the included CD as it‚Äôs easy to readBasic Setup:‚Ä¢ Default IP address in manual 192.168.0.123 which may not be the right choice for you depending on your network setup (it wasn‚Äôt for mine and I had some issues finding the default IP address using my browser‚Ä¢ Download AjDevTools (not IPWizardIII) from http://www.anpvizsecurity.com‚Ä¢ From AjDevTools, select ‚ÄúModify IP address‚Äù to match your network configuration and set a static address if desired, then I was easily able to Login to web portal‚Ä¢ Create new user (and you can delete the default one form here for security)‚Ä¢ In Network/Basic section of app set the IP address you want‚Ä¢ In Network/Service Ports section of app set the port you wish to useNVR Setup (Synology):‚Ä¢ Though the manufacturer has not tested it with Synology‚Äôs Surveillance Station, it works great with the latest version 8.2.3-5828!‚Ä¢ Setup is straightforward and some images are attached of the setup, just use the default ONVIF profile as shown along with the IP address and ONVIF port you setup above, along with your new login credentialsConclusion: The device does everything it claims and the web page is incredibly well laid out and informative. For this price, a better 5MP H.265 Weatherproof IP66 IR Dome IP Camera will be hard to find.Note: The photos accompanying the review above document many of the screens and settings you will need for setup.
review_text_5: Purchased this camera to monitor the front of my house, The camera is well made and easy to install and setup in my Blue Iris software, attached both day and night views of my driveway, both images have good definition and detail, much better than cameras twice its price.

name: 1080P Wireless Security Camera System, Firstrend 8CH Wireless NVR System with 4pcs 1080P Security IP Camera and 2TB Hard Drive Pre-Installed, 65ft Night Vision and Easy Remote Monitoring
review_header_2: Firstrend's Customer Service is what you need
review_header_3: UPDATE Jan 2020: Easy to set up and very clear pictures on viewing applications
review_text_1: I purchased a model #FTUS-WNK84102T-JG SC-4PCS 1080P Camera-2TB HDD-1 8CH NVR 3.6MM. I purchased 2 additional Firstrend 1080P cameras to fully cover the outside of my home for $65 each. Firstrend also recommended a Wifi Signal Booster 2.4 Ghz 4W 802.11 Signal Extender for $30.99 to extend the range on the antenna that I was having problems with intermittent signal coverage.The paperwork initially provided was too little and very confusing. I had a few calls with Daisy and she was wonderful, helped greatly, and was very pleasant. Recently, Daisy sent me a newly published User Manual (User Manual Of Firstrend Wireless Camera System-888-806-1588.pdf) which is written in much better English, covered more topics, and solved the overall issue that so many buyers complained about in earlier reviews.The hardware seems to be made really well and sturdy. I had an issue with the antenna connection on one of the cameras and Daisy replaced the camera quickly and the new unit worked great. I read in the original instructions that you needed to tighten the antenna down tight ‚Äì just don‚Äôt tighten it too tightly or you may strip the treads - this may have been partly my fault do to the way the instructions were written.The picture quality is very good in both the day and at night. The power cord on the camera is roughly 9‚Äô in length and depending on placement getting electrical outlets to the cameras can be challenging depending on your experience level. If you use a booster to improve the Wifi signal, the cord on the booster is only a little over 3‚Äô so when I ran electric to for those units I put in a double box with an exterior bubble cover. I also used the same 2-gang weatherproof box when I put 2 cameras in close proximity to each other. Firstrend advises to put cameras at least 5‚Äô from each other.Make sure that the cameras are all connected and working before you install them outside on your house. Adding a camera or two isn‚Äôt difficult as long as you have the channels on the NVR to support them. Daisy indicated that the 2 Terabyte hard drive in the NVR that I purchased would record up to 8 Channels/Cameras for 2 weeks automatically and then overwrite the disk starting from the oldest files.Wifi connectivity is absolutely critical. It took me awhile to get workable locations determined on a couple of cameras so that signal issue was consistently strong. What I found was that moving the camera to the end of a gutter or on the other camera to the top of a 7‚Äô fence away from the house itself provided a strong signal without a booster. A good strong signal was obtained on the other camera that would go on and off at times by using the recommended booster.I've attached a few photos that I took during the installation. The TV screen shot shows a typical view while monitoring the cameras and was taken at night while it was raining.Bottom line ‚Äì I didn‚Äôt find it extremely simple to install but if you take your time and do it right it is not a difficult system to install and you will have a first class camera system that will protect you and your home which is what all purchasers are striving for. I strongly recommend this product.
review_text_2: So this is my first security system. When you first start looking for your system, you looking for all the bells and whistles: I want to be able to see all area's of my house, I want to record it, I want to zoom in and talk through it and have them be able to talk back..... Well at least that's what I wanted. I work from home, in the basement and wanted to know what was going outside of my dungeon while I work. Do I really need to get up to check who's at the door? Why is the house quiet, are the kids dead? But what system would work best for me? I have wanted one for years but never followed through because I did not want to run video cords from each camera all the way to the basement, Heeeeell no. So Wireless, yes please! All they need is power plugged into a normal outlet and then they wirelessly send the video to the NVR (DVR) unit where it is being recorded....at my house, no need to be spending money every month to rent some company's cloud somewhere. No monthly fee! But which one? There were at least 5 different brands that I still had on the table at this point. I went with Firstrend in the end because of all the great review about their customer service. And yes you should use email, as yes you are talking to someone across the world, and yes there is a delay of a day or 2.... BUT, It's worth it! Daisy will work with you to make it right! I had a tall order seeing as how my NVR was going to be receiving signals from a basement over a 2,500sq house in the suburbs of Ohio. Some cameras worked great right out of the box. Some cameras worked great sometimes but would lose the signal after a few hours and then I would have to unplug them and plug them back in to make them work again. and 1 camera was just a dud and could not get further than the room I had the NVR in. But, Firstrend Customer Service to the rescue! We tried a few different troubleshooting options, and after those possibilities were removed I was sent 2 wireless boosters to apply to the cameras losing the signal, and a replacement for the camera that was a dud. No forms, no hassle, just what was your amazon order number, what address to send them to, done, express mail, Return anything, naw, don't worry about it! YES! Thank you for making this easy! and in the end I have a working system that I am happy with. I would suggest getting the 4 camera system to try it out and you can always acquire more cameras later. There is Motion Sensing tech on the cameras but I have not found the sweet spot on the sensitivity scale to make it text my phone for kids running with sticks at each other in he driveway but ignore differences in tree shadows, however I think that might be a difficult task for any system. The NVR interface and the App interface are decent, not great, not crap, but I'm happy with it. My next step is to try and share the app to my wife's phone so we both have access, but I know there is some trick to it, as the company is trying to protect you from hackers. But it can be done. I also thought I would like the scheduled recordings for some of the time and then just motion alerts for the rest of the time, but so far I have just stayed with Record everything all the time and no alerts. Sure, it won't protect me from invading clowns spun out on bath salts as they trigger the motion sensor, but better than being texted every 5 mins that the flies/mosquitos are always checking out the camera's built in red light for night vision. Product, I would give 3-4 starts; but man that customer service making it easy for me to make sure everything actually works and no risk? 5 big a$$ stars!
review_text_3: I'm updating this review today Jan 28, 2020:I've had the system installed and working fine since Oct 2018I wrote the review below soon after we got her up and running without problems.Last month we had some sort of power glitch or unprotected power spike (as noted on the recorded time-stamp of video feed.) Both exterior cameras went on the fritz.Since the unit is just a bit outside out of its 12-month warranty and after a short email exchange with the manufacturer‚Äôs representative (Neal) requesting a couple of steps to get the two cameras back online, they, Firstrend have been gracious enough to offer sending me two (2) more exterior cameras which we were not able to repair and get back online.My 15-month experience with this product and the help of their rep. Neal still justifies me giving them 5 stars!Their email help is quick and efficient and their out-of-warranty product support is what's to be expected from a successful company!FIRST REVIEW: "This review is for the n1080P Wireless Security Camera System, Firstrend 8CH Wireless NVR System with 4pcs 1080P Security IP Camera and 2TB Hard Drive Pre-Installed, 65ft Night Vision and Easy Remote Monitoring. Got it set up in about 5 hours (running extra ethernet cable 65 feet to garage and hanging 5 cameras) and the screen views are excellent! Do spend the few extra bucks and get the 1080p system. Motion sensitivity program algorithms need some work though. Too sensitive, even at the lowest settings. Workaround is to record only during motion activation at select periods of time and eliminate the continual recording (if you don't want to overrun old recordings on your drive or if your drive is not big enough or absent and you only want to get notifications either by email or text) You can record both continually and when motion-activated and then separate files into two folders for easier viewing later or you can record either continually only or motion detection only. One big plus is that all cameras record even though only one camera was motion activated. And they only record for 30 seconds after motion activation, not hours, sucking up your hard drive space. This parameter of recoding time is not adjustable. 1080p picture quality of viewing live shots and recorded shots is EXCELLENT, whether it's on your iPhone or your Windows machine!Daisy, in their service group, is wonderful! She was able to resolve the major two hiccups during the set-up, syncing of extra 5th camera (deleting and adding a new ip address of new camera that didn't come with the new 4 camera system, a simple procedure since everything is menu-driven) and why a black and white picture when should be 1080p color (default of system during low light/night conditions in area where camera was surveilling.) The color came back during daylight :)
review_text_4: So far very pleased with this purchase. Had a situation with "Motion" setup. Left Email, less than 24hrs later received a response from Daisy.She addressed all my concerns and supplied me with step by step assistance in getting "Motion" feature working. Thank you Daisy.It took me time looking at reviews before I decided on this unit. The clarity of video and playback is very good and now with Motion detection working this is a Great system for my security needs.I hope Firstrend continues its A+ customer service if and when needed by anyone.Love the wireless feature (no "home run" cabling needed, but could also be used with Ethernet connection) just power outlet to power cameras.Included with this unit is a mouse, short Ethernet router cable, all necessary hardware to mount cameras with a mounting template, covers for non used camera cable ends, drill for mounting, wrench for adjusting cameras and instruction manual.
review_text_5: This is a nice piece of kit. It is easy to set up, including on your phone. There is a wee bit of a learning curve, and I keep learning things about it, but you can get off the ground and operating quickly.Picture quality is quite good, including in the black and white night vision mode.Figuring out how to save the video and some of the powers of the system are a little confusing. Mastering mouse clicks helps, the system likes slow deliberate mouse clicks! Quick clicks frequently don't work.It will stream to a phone, it will send alerts to the phone. You cannot play back video on the phone without the cloud account (has a monthly fee).You can control the alarms for each camera independently (BIG yay!). Haven't fiddled with it, but it appears you can select sensitivity areas visually on each camera as well. This could be hugely helpful for our front camera that sees cars on the road.A helpful accessory/necessity is power extension cords for the DC cord that goes to each camera. This helps you plug in the camera charger inside somewhere and run a small DC power cord out to where the camera is mounted.All in all, we are quite pleased with this system.

review_header_4: Easy to install with excellent picture
review_text_1: Let me begin by saying that this is my first and only experience with security cameras, so I cannot compare this system to other systems. Having said that, I was pleasantly surprised that I was able to get it up and running as easily as I did.BACKGROUND: I was not eager to get into the expense and complexity of a security system but my wife was convinced that we should have one. We did our homework. The long-term contracts and expense of commercial systems were out. We would need to purchase and install a system ourselves. Wired cameras were eliminated immediately because we don't have access internally and we didn't want wires running on the outside of the house. That left wireless systems. We soon discovered that every brand we looked at required monthly storage fees per camera. All except Lorex. The Lorex system we purchased included a storage device that communicated with our internet and our smartphones via a hard-wired connection to our router and a Lorex app on our phones.INSTALLATION: Everything needed was in the package. (Good!) Instructions were not "perfect" but internet searches gave us the missing or incorrect information to enable us to continue. Installation and pairing of the cameras were easy. (Surprise!)USE: Everything works as we expected. There are only two things (so far) that could be improved. 1) There is a time lag between motion sensing and beginning of recording. I don't know if this can be improved. And, 2) night (infrared) picture quality is not as good as full-light picture quality. That's just "the nature of the beast."CONCLUSION: The system meets our requirements and our expectations. Can't do much better than that.
review_text_2: As you can see that they are small enough to hide the eaves. These are strictly wireless so that you don't have to cut holes in your home siding. For the cost, these are the best choices.
review_text_3: So far so good the cameras work wireless very far and image quality is excellent
review_text_4: It would be nice if the batteries lasted longer between charges, but the overall quality is exceptional.
review_text_5: This is a great camera system and it requires no wires!!!

review_header_1: Extremely robust and versatile system for the money
review_header_4: Easier than we thought to get it up and running!
review_text_1: Having used professional grade CCTV systems in the past working in retail and food service, albeit 15-20 years ago, the capabilities of this system blow them out of the water. Yes, I understand that in that time technology has gotten more advanced, which is why for the $269.99 that I paid for this system, I don't believe there is a better product on the market that meets the needs I had.I purchased this system to install in my aging father's home 7,700 miles away from where I am currently stationed in the military. My Dad wanted a system to keep an eye on things around his house due to concerns of vandalism and pranksters. He had purchased a couple Blink XT2 outdoor cameras at Best Buy upon the recommendation of the sales associate, which was $200 wasted... My Dad doesn't even know how to send a text message on his cell phone, but they sold him on cloud based cameras...All-in-all for this system, we spent about $550 (including sales tax and shipping of the items ordered from Amazon). The full system that I pieced together includes the following:- this Lorex 8 channel 1080p system (4 cameras, extension/power cables, DVR with 1TB hard drive, and necessary hardware; everything you need to wire and install 4 cameras and operate the system, assuming you have a tv or monitor to hook it up to)- one Zosi add-on 1080p camera- one Zosi 12v power adapter (although the camera system is 8-channel, the cabling and power adapter included only support 4 channels, so you need to order extra cabling for additional cameras0 not a big deal)- two Postta 150' BNC cable extensions- one Postta 100' BNC cable extension- Toshiba 32" Smart TV (Fire TV Edition)- one (donated from my stockpile of personal devices) Amazon Echo Dot (2nd generation)I went this route for a few main reasons:(1) Nothing beats having local storage of the recorded video...(2) ...except, also having the ability to access remotely and download video and take screenshots; this system allows both.(3) Hardwired cameras take longer to setup, but alleviate worrying about replacing batteris, no matter how infrequently.(4) Smart home features. This system is compatible with Alexa, Google Home, etc... I have it set up so that I can tell my Echo Show or Fire TV, in my bedroom 7,700 miles away, to show me any one of these cameras in real time. I also have this system setup with a 32" Toshiba Fire TV being controlled by an Echo Dot at my Dad's house; I'm still working out the kinks with the Fire TV, as it sometimes doesn't display what you want it to, however, my Echo Show does. Additionally, the Lorex Home app for Android and iPhone have given me the flexibility to view real-time footage and system alerts from my cell phone 24/7, from anywhere in the world. Lastly, I just got done setting up the Lorex Cloud program (from 7,700 miles away) on my Windows laptop, which gives me the ability to access the footage another way, as well as make on the fly changes to camera settings, recording, etc.One area where I think Lorex could use some improvement is in their Customer Service Department, however, for the price you are paying, I understand why it is limited- I come to this conclusion based on others' reviews and my one phone call regarding a question I had about using an Uninterruptible Power Supply (UPS) to keep the system online during power outages. I ultimately decided not to use an UPS at this time due to the good reliability of power where my Dad lives. Also regarding Customer Support, it would be nice if Lorex provided a full printed guide with their system, versus the small fold out quick setup guides. I set up the entire system, configured everything, setup Lorex Home on my iPhone, and Lorex Clioud on my laptop, without reading the instructions, but I am also very technologically inclined. I would have preferred the printed users manual for my father, so that he can read it and familiarize himself with the system in his free time. That being said, Lorex has the 114 page manual available on their website, which can be downloaded and printed, so it's really a non-issue, more of just a gripe about convenience.By no means is this an in-depth review. There are so many features of this system that I still need to explore. I spent about an entire day figuring out where to mount the cameras, doing cable runs through the attic of my Dad's house, and getting everything set up, but I also have OCD. You could easily un-package and plug everything in and get it operational, within an hour. All-in-all, I extremely happy with this purchase and the un-matched versatility of this system that gives my Dad peace of mind, and me the ability to keep an eye on things back home from halfway around the world. I would purchase this system again, and will likely purchase other Lorex systems for myself in the future. Anyone who gives this system a bad review is doing something wrong, or is overwhelmed by all of the features and settings that are available; perhaps they need something simpler, like a battery powered stickup camera.
review_text_2: I switched from Arlo to this Lorex 4 camera 1080p system. It is hands down better. Continuous recording, better, programmable motion detection. Very easy to use. I have had no issue with the app or the function of the system. I did have one camera that was not working. Contacted customer service and it was easily setup for replacement with a few serial/model numbers and proof of purchase. I highly recommend.

And was handed directly to my husband. Also had a white sticker on it with the exact details of what's inside. But he's either playing stupid for me or really doesn't know what it is. So we still haven't installed it.

review_text_5: Excellent product... thank you for your help and product...

review_text_1: Cameras can only be viewed from one devise (phone, tablet, computer, etc.) at a time. If someone else in you authorize to view logs into a second devise it will log you out of the previous devise.
review_text_2: Cameras video in color during the night
review_text_3: My primary attraction to the Lorex is that it has local storage and that it‚Äôs a QHD system that is remotely accessible from inside and outside of the home network. The base station can be connected to the internet via ethernet or wifi, The cameras connect to the base station via a second private wifi network that the unit creates. Once the Lorex Home app is downloaded on your mobile device, and you are signed in. It is a matter of pressing the ‚Äòsync‚Äô button on the back of the base station to put it in pairing mode. Follow a few prompts, and you are done in about 2 minutes.The Lorex app allows you to change the multitude of settings, from motion detection sensitivity to activity zones on the phone. I liked the app allowed you to capture picture and videos as needed while remotely having a conversation with a person via the phone app. I also liked that I could turn off all the lights (status light / LED lights / IR lights) via the app. The app is the central part of the experience and I‚Äôll say the ease in reviewing captured footage as well as scrolling through the timeline is a win for me. The app also lets you see how strong the wifi between the base station and the cameras are for optimal placement.Pros:* Easy to activate, use and live with.* Centralized local storage that is remotely accessible, and remote notification of motion activation* Love the 2-way microphone/talk feature and the loud alarm siren feature that can be remotely activated.* Image quality, image colour rendering, image resolution and wide image field-of-view in ‚Äúperformance‚Äù 1080P mode are good enough for surveillance requirements. You can run QHD should you need a higher resolution but you need to plug it in.* Amazing and highly functional Lorex Home app for controlling and viewing your cameras*dual band wifi capable*no subscription necessaryCons:* Motion detection does not work when facing a wall or shooting through glass* The wall mount is horrible. One can quickly remove the camera by just tugging on the camera. If you mount it accessible outside, people can steal it, if you mount it discrete it would be hard to get to it for recharging the batteries.
review_text_4: Very affordable alternative to the major player in the all-inclusive home surveillance game, the Lorex HomeHub 3 camera surveillance system is easy to setup and use. It took me less than ten minutes to get everything setup and connected, with all cameras up and running around my home. The 2k resolution makes it much easier to see details like license plates or identifying characteristics like uniform logos or faces. The HomeHub sends alerts whenever any of the triggers I have enabled are set off. I especially like the built in 32 gigabyte storage which gives me peace of mind that in case something happens while I'm away I will have a recording of it. Very affordable, effective, and most importantly - easy to use home surveillance system.
review_text_5: I have wireless cameras that do not use a hub and use its own SD card. I like that, but I also like this set. There are several useful options. One thing that's nice and not all cameras have without a paid subscription is, this set lets you have detection zones for each camera. Everything is included.

description: Ensure your property is protected 24/7 with this 1080p high definition surveillance system from Lorex! This Lorex DP181-82NAE wired surveillance system comes with 8 weatherproof security cameras and an 8-channel, Full HD digital video recorder (DVR). With advanced person/vehicle detection (on up to 2 channels), the Lorex Home app will only notify you when a person or vehicle is on your property. Enjoy fast access to your system with voice assistance compatibility ( Alexa or Google Assistant), which allows you to view your cameras and activate features with simple voice commands. Plus, with smart home compatibility (Apple TV or Chromecast), you can conveniently stream footage directly on your TV. The cameras record 1080p HD resolution video, ensuring you never miss any important details, even at night! This surveillance system is hard wired so there are no worries about lag or WiFi drop out. But it is designed to be used with or without connection to the Internet. Remote viewing, push notifications, and firmware updates all require Internet connectivity.

name: Lorex 1080p HD 8-Channel Security System with Eight 1080p HD Weatherproof Bullet Security Camera and Advanced Motion Detection
review_text_1: I have had several different DVR security camera systems over about 15 years. I wanted a new system with the BNC connections since I have had this type of camera cables ran for years and didn't want to change it out. I needed eight cameras with at least 1080P resolution and ease of remote phone viewing. I find this system the easiest set up of anything I've previously had. I didn't have to port forward or try numerous router attempts to get addresses and ports set up. To get remote viewing after the Lorex set up all I had to do was to accept access on first attempt through AT&T Smart Home Manager App. That's it!The whole system is impressive from local screen adjustments and control to remote software viewing and control. Although it does not come with a manual one can be downloaded from the Lorex site but I find the quick set up guides easy and software pretty user friendly. The camera view is a pretty wide angle. I find the detail pretty amazing for a 1080P. I love the zoom ability on home monitor and phone. I was worried about only one HDMI output for monitor since I wanted the view on two others simultaneously but I solved that with a splitter HDMI cable and a HDMI to RCA converter running RCAs to two other monitors in other rooms. The system comes with a mouse and everything needed except a monitor. The 1TB hard drive is plenty big enough for me recording continuously because in all these years I never ever needed to go back more than a day or so and certainly not a couple of weeks or more to see an event. The night vision LEDs are a lot brighter on the cameras than previous night vision cameras I've had making it "SEE" farther at night than I ever have been able to do with my other systems. The night view is bright and lots of detail. It's a set and forget system without battery changes, no cloud expense, no professional router expertise needed for simple phone view, and very easy to use with tons of features. I love this system and highly recommend it for a complete system(-monitor) for the price point.

review_header_1: I am SO IMPRESSED by the video quality of this system
review_header_3: that covers the maximum has a very clear Visio
review_text_1: I've been using this system now for a few months. I am an engineer in the live video industry for medical devices (surgical video) and I am SO impressed by the video quality of this Lorex system! I decided to go analog as I had been using a Panasonic digital IP (ethernet and WiFi webcam, circa 2010-ish?) system for years and wanted to go with something with one-way uninterrupted video streaming, higher-resolution and better sensitivity without having to rely on two-way digital handshaking to work due to the history of the Panasonic digital system often locking-up or odd hanging delays or whatever...This system blasts continuous video to the DVR, default the DVR just records everything coming in and you won't get much record time if you leave it like that even with a 2T hard drive. I configured my setup to only record when motion is detected and now I get over a month of recorded video for all channels, nice!As for the color night vision: YES IT HAS COLOR NIGHT VISION if even the tiniest ambient light is available as indicated by Lorex. For example, the camera on the side of my house is ALWAYS in color mode (24hrs a day) because of a street light out on the street that's not very bright but provides enough light to keep the camera in color mode. In total or near-total darkness the camera turns on it's own infrared (IR) LED illuminator and also switches over to a B&W image which has incredible resolution, dynamic range and signal to noise ratio (S/N) given the tiny size of the single IR LED on the camera. Reviewers who are complaining that this system does not have color night vision did not read the spec carefully or do not understand video and illumination basics.One con though: I wish the system had microphones on the cameras and was able to record audio along with the video.In summary if you don't mind running wires then this system is amazing not even taking the price into consideration, believe me I spent A LOT more on the Panasonic IP system 10-yrs ago and am getting much better performance from this new analog system which is not a surprise I guess because of updates to video sensor capabilities in recent years (mobile phone industry driven).BIG thumbs-up from me!
review_text_2: Bought this as an upgrade to my old system that I had for 4years. Definitely an improvement on camera quality day and night. Would buy again if I needed to

review_header_5: Lorex 1080P works great with my Costco Lorex 4K 6 camera security system.
review_text_1: I bought this camera to replace an older one of the same brand and model number that had gone bad after about 5 years. Lorex must have done something to improve this model camera because it does a lot better than the older one (which was excellent in it' day). The night vision on this is so much better than the older one that the picture on my monitor looks like it is day time when actually I took this picture of my monitor at 1 a.m. with the outside porch light turned off. The new camera is number 4 on the picture of the monitor and the others are the original 5 year old cameras. This camera makes such a good difference that after I write this review I am going to order the 4 pack of this camera and replace all of my cameras.
review_text_2: This is an add on for our existing lorex security system. These cameras are superior to the 4 that came with the original system as the mounting bracket has improved to allow more flexibility in positioning the camera. Night vision is okay but could be better. All in all this was a good buy and we will be adding one more camera in the future.
review_text_3: I have the older LBV2531S-C models and they work well but optics and clarity did leave something to desire. I ordered the newer model LBV2531U-C and am really pleased. Night vision is far better and clarity is absolutely great. Able to expand pictures and still have great definition and recognition capability. Will be replacing all my older models with this newer model as time and money become available.
review_text_4: These cameras are great and just what we needed to connect to our existing Loren DVR
review_text_5: This camera 1080P works great with the Lorex 6 camera 4K system I got at Costco. I was afraid it may not work when ordering but was soon relieved when I installed it. The camera even came with the needed cable.

description: Of the 126 million homes in America, only 20% have home security. At SimpliSafe, we're changing that. Our goa is simple: to make homes safe for everyone, and not with false security, but with real protection. Our frustration-free DIY home surveillance system bundles have precise sensors to know the difference between a family pet and an unwanted intruder, and are designed with long range sensors for entire home protection. Simplisafe is for homes of all sizes and is built with unprecedented safeguards to keep your home protected against power outages, downed Wi-Fi, cut landlines, and physical attacks from hammers, bats, and more. This easy-to-use wireless system is full of surveillance products small enough to disappear into your home and provide blanket protection. Breathe easy with proper protection at a safe and reasonable price. The 9-piece wireless Security bundle provides 24/7 security with a smash safe keypad that is soft to touch, easy to use during the day and night, and requires no plug (meaning you can place it anywhere), and will alert the police in case of attack. The base station is like your personal security guard: It sends alarm signals to the monitoring center with a built-in cellular connection, 24-hour battery backup, and a 95dB siren. Each entry sensor (4 total) protects your doors and windows and is designed to disappear and blend into the background. The 2 motion sensors are designed for human detection, no pet detection. The simplicity gives you flawless HD video and audio streaming as well as a 120¬∞ field of vision day and night. Enjoy effective, contract-free 24/7 professional monitoring, and make sure your home is the safest place on earth.

Just plug in the base station, place your sensors, plug in your Simplicam and start protecting your home in minutes - no tools required.,Optional 24/7 professional monitoring and cloud recording with police, fire & medical dispatch starting at 50c/day - No contracts (SimpliSafe products and professional monitoring services are only offered for sale and supported in the US),Sound the alarm. Pioneering signal burst technology that is powerful enough to cover homes of every size, with up to 1000 ft. range - no extender needed.,The SimpliCam security camera lets you see what‚Äôs happening at home anytime from your phone, tablet or computer and comes with a built-in stainless steel shutter for complete control over privacy.,Motion sensors detect motion within 30 feet, has a 90 degree field of vision and gets along great with pets under 50lbs. Perfect for full range coverage when placed in a corner.,Backups for your backups. 24 hour battery and dual Wi-Fi & cellular connections to keep your home secure and protected from the unexpected.,We've got you covered - Customize your SimpliSafe security system with additional sensors for whole home protection - up to 100
name: SimpliSafe 9 Piece Wireless Home Security System w/HD Camera - Optional 24/7 Professional Monitoring - No Contract - Compatible with Alexa and Google Assistant
review_header_2: Easy to install with straightforward operation
review_header_3: Buy now and secure house today!!
review_text_1: Just got the product (2018 edition) about a week ago. Hooked everything up, had to call their customer service group a few times for clarification on a couple of questions. Got great service, polite, helpful, professional. Highly recommend this system (the latest version) to anyone looking for a self-installed home system.
review_text_2: Guessing that a lot of these purchases are event driven and mine certainly is. We have a cabin and a barn on a 6 acre piece of property. The barn is where we park the tractor and store the supporting tools and supplies. The barn was recently broken into and everything of value was taken. While that is deeply disheartening, it really only affects me. If the cabin were to be robbed and ransacked like the barn was, I have several young children that would likely never want to go/stay there again.I do consider myself handy when it comes to mechanical and electronic projects. I also believe that I am a good researcher and analyst. I found that there are a lot of great alarm systems available at very affordable prices today including DIY professional systems. Several of the professional systems now have videos on installation and configuration‚Äîconfiguration used to be the tough part of installing one of those.In my case, I was looking for a balance of price, ease installation and options for monitoring. Given the recent break-in, I also wanted to get this project started and completed quickly as the cabin is just as vulnerable as the barn.This next statement may make you question my research, or at least, reading abilities. While I did plan to have the system monitored, I didn‚Äôt realize until after I purchased my SimpliSafe system that you can‚Äôt monitor the system remotely at all with the app without one of the SimpliSafe plans, and, at the time of this writing, March, 2021, you have to have the $25/mo. plan to do any serious monitoring. I would have putt off having the system monitored for a while if that were not the case. Perhaps it is better that I was forced into a plan earlier than I wanted. As an aside, SimpliSafe gives you 3 days of ‚Äòpractice‚Äô use after you activate your system. This means they won‚Äôt contact local law enforcement if the system detects and alarm. On the one hand I wanted my system monitoring to start immediately but, do understand the logic of giving me time to learn to use the system without causing false alarms.The installation was truly easy. Once you plug in the basestation and pull the battery tab on the keypad, you are off to a great start. Installing any of the sensors is as easy as removing a paper battery tab, using the keypad to tell the basestation that you are installing a new device and naming it from a list once the basestation announces that a new device has been detected. The preinstalled double sided tape makes mounting the sensors easy. Our cabin has numerous unfinished roughhewn wood surfaces and I decided to mount sensors that had to be on those surfaces with the included screws. I didn‚Äôt try the included self-adhesive on the roughhewn wood which, may have worked perfectly.SimpliSafe tells you how far away you can mount sensors like the glass break and motion sensors but it was less clear about how high to mount them given the space I was working in or, for the glass break in particular, the angular range that it could work with. For example, if you have windows on opposite sides of a room with no option to mount the sensor in the middle, can it detect glass breaking behind it or beside it?SimpliSafe sensors are relatively inexpensive, and, as such, perhaps an extra sensor or two isn‚Äôt a bad thing.The App is easy to set up and use and definitely slanted to the easy side rather than the comprehensive side. That said, if a sensor were to drop off the app will alert you to that. I am not looking forward to changing batteries but would rather that to running wires through an older structure.SimpliSafe has done a great job making system purchase, installation and operation easy and straightforward. They even sent me an e-mail letting me know that the county where my cabin is located requires a form and payment to be completed and sent to authorize monitoring and, more specifically, response. Not only did they tell me about it, they sent me the exact link to the form. They also let me know that no paperwork or fee was required for the fire monitor.The cabin can be a relatively harsh environment with high humidity in the summer and relatively cold nights. I am hoping the sensors, base station and keypad are rugged enough to function for years to come.If you are looking at one of these systems, read all you can to understand what you can and can‚Äôt do with and without SimpliSafe‚Äôs monitoring options. Watch or read about sensor placement and plan your own install. I don‚Äôt think you have to become an alarm expert but each install has its own challenges. I found plenty of good information available from a lot of sources on the Internet to address those challenges. I have not interacted with SimpliSafe‚Äôs customer service at this point and can‚Äôt comment on that aspect of the product.Overall, I believe I made a good decision for my family and have only positive things to say about the installation and operation of my SimpliSafe system.
review_text_4: Excellent security system! Easy to install .The best thing is the ability to monitor system with the phone app and receive text and email alerts and ability to arm/disarm.Customer service is the best with virtually no wait and talented reps. (Jay) Yet to replace batteries in any sensors in 7 years. I replace batteries in keypad and sirens yearly as needed. Just installed new generation system in second home and even more user friendly!I upgraded the battery backup to last for weeks instead of a day or so with a bit of ingenuity.
review_text_5: Love this system! Everyone talking about non exsitant customer support, but I‚Äôve called em twice now and both time was on hold for less than a minute to be connected to helpful ppl speaking English perfectly!
