features: ,,HIGH PERFORMANCE, PRO-HD - Experience magnificent full 1080p HD video resolution at 30fps (1920x1080). This home security camera features an extra-wide 133¬∞ viewing angle allowing you to cover every angle. This deterrent camera features a built in microphone and speaker for two way audio allowing you to talk and listen to visitors.,ACTIVE DETERRENTS - This WiFi camera is equipped with active deterrents including a boisterous 110db siren alarm and an illuminating built-in spotlight that can be triggered manually or by motion detection to scare away would-be criminals. The outdoor¬†spotlight camera¬†can also switch between spotlight and strobe light mode using the Amcrest Smart Home app.,SMARTER SECURITY ‚Äì Receive motion detection alerts via email or push notifications and instantly review recorded footage directly from your smartphone using the Amcrest Smart Home app. Securely store your HD footage to the Amcrest Smart Home Cloud or store directly to a class 10 MicroSD card up to 128GB for continuous recording. (Limited compatibility with Amcrest View Pro, not compatible with Amcrest Cloud),DAY OR NIGHT, RAIN OR SHINE ‚Äì This Amcrest outdoor spotlight cam features a heavy-duty IP65 weatherproof housing to protect against dust and rain. The WiFi IP camera's built-in IR LEDs can achieve incredible night vision capability up to 33 feet, allowing you to see clear 1080p HD footage even in the dark.,SIMPLE, RELIABLE, SECURE ‚Äì This Amcrest 2.4ghz outdoor WiFi security camera features a secure SSL/HTTPS connection, wireless AES/WPA2 encryption, FCC and CE certificates and receives regular firmware updates (Does not support 5ghz). At Amcrest, we want to ensure the safety of our customers, their loved ones, homes and businesses. You‚Äôll receive a full 1-year US Warranty and Lifetime technical support provided directly from Amcrest.
name: Amcrest SmartHome 1080p WiFi Outdoor Security Camera with Spotlight, Built-in Siren Alarm, Strobe Light, Two-Way Audio, Night Vision, 133¬∞ View, IP65 Weatherproof, MicroSD & Smart Cloud Storage, ADC2W
review_header_1: WOW!  So easy to set up!
review_header_2: Powerful but inexpensive and easy to use security camera
review_header_5: Best Security Camera You Can Buy at This Price Point!
review_text_1: WOW! I have 3 other Amcrest camera at this house - all indoor cameras. I wanted this one on the front porch. This one is by far the easiest to set up. It was all done and finished in less than about 30 minutes. It is raining today so I‚Äôll wait until tomorrow to screw it into the side of the house. The picture quality is perfect. We don‚Äôt have a porch light so I love the fact that I can set it on so the light comes on when it detects motion. I can turn that on and off easily. I can also share limited access with up to 6 people but I‚Äôll only be sharing it with my husband. My only complaint is that I wish it was available in black since we live in a rural area so white sort of stands out like a sore thumb. We have a log house so white doesn‚Äôt cut it. I might have to paint it black! Maybe they will make them black as an option. I also love the 9‚Äô cord but also the black option would be nice. LOVE IT!
review_text_2: After purchasing this camera and using for a few weeks here are my feelingsPictureGreat wide viewing angle. Allows me to see a wide area of property. The night vision function works well and can view a decent distance. The SD picture looks good but when switching to the HD view you get a lot of detail. (See pics included in review)Spotlight/sirenThis camera comes with an LED floodlight. This light can be toggled on and off easily on the app or be set to activate on motion. The light is surprisingly bright and lights up the immediate area. Also the light can be set to strobe with can bring a lot of attention to the area. The siren also can be activated by motion or button on app. It‚Äôs pretty loud and anyone in the area will be alerted.Listen/talkThe camera picks up the outside noise and sounds clearly. You can easily hear a conversation in the immediate area. The talk function works well. Anyone in the area will hear you.AppThe AmcrestSmartHome app is clean and easy to use. Layout is intuitive and buttons are responsive. Set up of the camera though this app is easy and fast. I had the camera up, running and viewable in minutes. You control all the camera functions here (listen/talk/light/siren/record... etc)Record functionThis works really well and I like the way you control from the app. I did not use the cloud record function but instead use the SD card. You can easily find review recorded footage and sound from the app. It also lets you quickly save pictures and video to device.Motion optionsAlso this works well. Easy to set up and responsive through the app. Areas set activate with what you program without issue.In conclusionI am very happy with my purchase. The camera is inexpensive and easy to use but offers powerful features. I plan on ordering more for my property.
review_text_3: This little camera puts out decent light when motion is detected. The alarm (siren) isn't the loudest alarm there is, but its annoying enough to let you know something was caught by the camera. The Wi-Fi setup is easy to use. The camera uses a usb plug for power so you can always get an extension to get more length out of the power wire. The quality of the picture is pretty good too. Once the spotlight comes on from motion, the quality of the picture improves because of the light. I ended up disabling the alarm portion (which is easy to do in app) and put the camera on my shed in the backyard. When I go outside towards the shed the light turns on automatically to light the way - super convenient. There is a separate app from Amcrest to setup this camera - Amcrest Smart Home. At first I was annoyed that I had to use a separate app to view and control the camera (I have a couple IP cameras on an NVR). However, once the camera is configured, you can easily add it to your NVR and use one app (in my case its the Amcrest View Pro app.
review_text_4: This camera is as simple as it gets. The app makes it super easy to set up and I was done setting it up in less than a minute. It was easy to navigate the settings and make it do exactly what I wanted it to do. The mounting bracket is tough and super simple. I have this mounted on my front porch and have the motion setting set to only go off if someone is on the sidewalk coming up to the house. It is actually a super good picture for being a 1080P camera. The audio is super clear even when someone is talking quietly. The wind was blowing, and it was able to cut some of that out and make the audio useable. The light is super bright and comes on fast after it detects motion. The siren isn‚Äôt super loud, but I don‚Äôt have any intention of using it anyway, so it didn‚Äôt bother me. Overall, I am pleasantly surprised with how well it works.
review_text_5: Great camera and App. Everything works as advertised.Pros:-SD Card which requires no cloud subscription and allows you to record a ton of video depending on your SD Card size-Motion sensing actually works and notifies you via phone notification or email.-Light and Siren work and are useful feature for deterrence.-All features in the new app actually work and work consistently.-WiFi stays connected and no connectivity issues or laggingCons:-Should include a USB cord extension. Had to buy one.Overall very satisfied with the camera and all its features. I have owned other cameras in the past and in my opinion this by far the best security camera you can buy at this price point.

features: Connect your Ring camera with Alexa then enable announcements to be alerted when motion is detected. Talk to visitors through compatible Echo devices by saying ‚ÄúAlexa, talk to the front door‚Äù.,Lets you see, hear and speak to visitors from your phone, tablet and PC,Powered by the quick-release rechargeable battery pack.,With a Ring Protect Plan (subscription sold separately), record all your videos, review what you missed for up to 60 days, and share videos and photos.,Monitors your home in 1080HD video with infrared night vision and Live View,Includes built-in LED light strips and a siren,Includes Lifetime Theft Protection: If your Camera gets stolen, we‚Äôll replace it for free
name: Ring Spotlight Cam Battery HD Security Camera with Built Two-Way Talk and a Siren Alarm, White, Works with Alexa
review_header_1: Super Easy to Install, no wires necessary!
review_header_3: Great Camera. Works well for the backyard.
review_text_1: I have a Ring pro on my front door and loved it so much that I wanted something for the back patio since I have contracts (lawn, pool, trees, etc) in my backyard. My challenge however is that all the walls on the patio are either stucco or rock, which makes it near impossible to run a hidden power line. So I opted for this option and so far it works great. The lights are pretty bright and the motion detection works as expected.As for the battery life, it has been in for a couple weeks and it has lost about 10% battery. So I‚Äôm guessing it will last about 3 months before it needs a charge. I just ordered a second battery which should double that battery life.The connection is very quick, it seems to connect much faster than my front door, but in fairness it is closer to the wireless router.As for installation, I installed it using the provided screws into the frame of my patio door. It actually works perfect there because you can‚Äôt really see it and allows me to perfectly position it for motion detection.My only complaint is the motion zone setup. Unlike the ring pro where I can ‚Äúdraw‚Äù motion zones (which significantly helps reduce motion alerts), it only allows you to specify a distance. It really isn‚Äôt very intuitive, so I just leave it at mid-range and it seems to work just fine for now.Beware, in order to have video playback, you do have to subscribe to the ring premium service. And you have to have a subscription per device! I have it for my front door, not sure I‚Äôm gonna pay for the back door. That was kind of a bummer to find out I‚Äôd have to pay more. It should be a household subscription.Overall, I‚Äôm very happy with the device and would recommend it to anyone looking for an easy to install solution without wires.
review_text_3: We have this camera for the backyard and also the ring doorbell for the front door. We got the doorbell first and think it does the job. It is not the best nor is it the worst. Now the camera for the backyard is very nice. We got it as a safety precaution because we felt someone had used the pool while we were away and did not want that to be a safety issue. As you can see in these live pictures I just took that it covers pretty much the whole yard and you can zoom into areas on the app with your finger. Also pictured. We have the sensor set Just right to capture the movement in the backyard. At night when motion is detected the lights fire up to record. There is also an option to push an alarm on the light. It‚Äôs not super loud but loud enough for the neighbors to hear and scare persons away. I have also included a screenshot of the app view of the ring items we have.I would recommend this camera but really recommend using the solar panel with the camera and not have to worry about taking the battery out to charge it.
review_text_4: Love the freedom of wireless, the solar panels work great and only need a couple of hours of sunlight per day to keep the batteries topped off. Video quality is great and I've got eyes on the whole yard now. Just picked up 3 of these beauties. Simply system anyone can install and operate. Thank You Ring!!I bought a camera system a few years ago with a hard drive a 4 wired cameras. Wires all over the house and you need a PHD in programming to get the system to work. It ended up in the trash without ever making a single recording. Ring just makes it all doable for the average Non PHD humans...
review_text_5: Updated Review:Received a new camera from Ring. Setup this past weekend and it has been great so far. A lot different and better results from my first go with Ring.I had upgraded my network devices, modem and router. No more drops or freezing. Worked with Alexis from Ring support and she has been great!!The camera works flawless.

name: LaView Security Camera Outdoor 1080P HD,Wi-Fi Cameras,Home Security Cameras with Motion Detection,Two-Way Audio,Night Vision,ONVIF Protocol,Compatible with Alexa,Micro SD Card Slot&US Cloud Storage
review_header_3: Got this to complement my indoor two LaView cameras. Great!
review_text_1: **3-19-2021‚ÄìUPDATE OF ORIGINAL REVIEW**This camera appears to be well made, was easy to install and to adjust the camera to view the desired area. This camera also has a clear picture of it‚Äôs surroundings in daylight or with night vision. The motion detection feature is great and alerts my phone immediately. I just installed this camera today and so far I am quite impressed with it. Hopefully it will last for many years. UPDATE: The only issue I am experiencing with this outdoor camera so far is that when it goes offline I have to unplug the camera from the wall outlet and plug it back in in order for it to reboot itself. NOT very convenient when you are away from home and relying on your cameras for security :(I have purchased the Laview indoor camera since my first review and it will reboot itself when it occasionally goes offline so hopefully the same design can be implemented for the outdoor cameras too.
review_text_2: I bought two of these cameras and was so impressed that I bought two more. They work well, are easy to set up, and the price is right. The night vision is a little grainy but not to bad. I would recommend these.
review_text_3: Back in September (2020) I bought and installed two of Laview's indoor cameras, and have found them very reliable and easy to use, so I got one of their outdoor cameras this month (March 2021). It was very easy to install and *relatively* easy to set up on my network. (The process was identical to the indoor camera setup. I did have to trouble shoot a bit in the very beginning... the two things I learned were: 1: Do the initial network connection VERY close to your router/wifi source. The cameras can function farther out, with less robust wifi, but to avoid headaches, the INITIAL connection to your system has to be with excellent wifi signal. 2: I had a bit of a problem initially with the whole 2.4GHz/5GHz issue (their cameras only work on 2.4GHz, but my whole house mesh network is a combo, and I had problems connecting initially. I'm no network guru, I don't even pretend. But I set up a guest network that was only 2.4GHz and connected the cameras to that network. I don't know if I should, but I feel safer anyway having them "walled off" from my main wifi connection.The outdoor camera is now hooked up and running well for about a week. (It looks out on our chicken coop--it's nice to be able to make sure we've closed the door at night, etc., without having to traipse out there...) It's night view is AWESOME, by the way. The indoor cameras have decent night view, but not nearly the reach as this outdoor one does.Anyway, this camera is EXACTLY what I need. Its feed comes up on my phone reliably and instantly, and my other Laview cameras have been rock solid, with no down time, so I anticipate the same with this.An inexpensive yet highly useable camera. Can't comment about waterproof-ness, etc., but will edit this post if I feel the need....
review_text_4: It was a little difficult for me to figure out how to get it to record but that's nothing to do with the cameras, it because I'm a novice, lol. Once I put that SD in everything was good. The camera seems to be great so far if anything changes I'll for sure do an update.
review_text_5: Just hooked up in front of my driveway and it zooms and records with a micro 128 sd card you have to purchase separate. Sends motion detection to you cell phone.I just bought another on for the end of my driveway also. Can't beat the price.This is a high quality camera.

review_header_3: Good quality picture, day and night, with remote access on phone app.
review_header_5: Reasonably priced, text alert no subscription security camera with motion detection and night vision
review_text_1: This is my third outdoor Netvue camera. You can see my other white ones in the background of my pics. I put this one under my deck and the black color conceals much better for it's placement. I tried a couple more expensive outdoor cameras, but these have been the best fit for me. They are really clear and work great with Alexa. With my Echo Show 5 and 8 I simply say "Alexa show me the deck" and a couple seconds later I have a live video feed. I could also use my phone, but find it easier on the Echo. I did have a little more trouble connecting these to my wifi than some of my other wireless cameras, but that may be due to my router. My only dislike is the ethernet cables for wired connection (I don't use them) and I really wish I could turn the IR lights off in the app. The IR's are pretty strong and bounce off the walls, causing a little distortion at night. I covered my IR sensors with electrical tape and installed Lifx IR bulbs on the deck, which are a perfect combo with my cameras. Overall, I'm VERY happy with these!!BTW, with my white cameras I simply installed them by cutting a piece of bar stock steal I bought for $5 at Lowes, drilled and tapped a couple holes, mounted the cameras to the bar stock, and just wedged it in my soffit. It might sound like a hack job, but it's actually a good sturdy fit with no holes in the house.
review_text_2: This is my second Netvue camera. The first was great but the motion was way to sensitive. They have since pushed a new update and it works perfectly!! My new one worked great straight out of the box! It was already up to date! If you want great 24 hour surveillance this is the one to choose! The night vision is crystal clear!
review_text_3: The camera displays two doors on the porch. It has a microphone which works well to converse with someone on the porch. The netvue app is on my Android phone which has live display and microphone mode for remote use. After a month, everything has worked well. It is plugged into an outdoor outlet which is not ideal since someone could unplug it. If they took the camera with the micro card, I would not have a recording. There is an option to subscribe to Amazon Web Services to record motion ($20/year) or record 24/7 and have a 14- day access.
review_text_4: I was worried about installing and configuring a security camera as installing and configuring electronic devices is not one of my strong points. However the procedure was covered in a video with the app and is also covered in a you tube video. The questions and answers on the amazon page also help. I had to play around adjusting the sensitivity because the headlights from cars would trigger the motion detection, but adjustment solved this. The picture is very clear and the IR works OK as do the alerts. I got a 2:00 AM photo of a car prowler the first week I used it.
review_text_5: These cameras are great for our second home which we rent out on short term rentals while not there. The motion detection sends us an alert on our phones so we know when packages are delivered or guests come and go. I recommend putting in the 128 Gig micro SD card which then allows you to go back in time and see what was going on if you didn‚Äôt have time to or we‚Äôre busy when an alert came through. The cameras also have a microphone so you can also hear what‚Äôs going on and we can make sure there are no loud disturbances or parties going on. The motion detectors can be sensitive to our outdoor lights coming on or birds and snow/rain or snow melt but you can easily turn off motion detection and adjust its sensitivity. You can share the alerts and camera feeds with family or caretakers if they download the app and you send them a share link. Haven‚Äôt caught any game animals yet but I think it‚Äôs only a matter of time. They do require a plug in so you have to plan a little on location and we needed power extensions which were easily available also on Amazon. They occasionally go offline and can be rebooted by unplugging the power and they start right back up but if you live far away and don‚Äôt have someone local to do that for you you‚Äôll be offline until you return. Customer support/service was fairly quick and helpful. Overall a great value with lots of features. I really like that I don‚Äôt have to pay any monthly subscription. I think they have a cloud service at a modest price if desired. I a very pleased with my purchase and that‚Äôs why I bought a second one and am considering some for my primary residence.

review_header_4: Works well so far. Time will tell.
review_text_1: Here is what to expect from the camera. The center of the street is 40 feet away. The night seen is ambient light the IR lights on the camera are turned off. The reason you can see so far up the street is that I have a large IR flood light pointing that way. Over all I very pleased with the camera. I can only read the license plate during the day if the light is just right. Hope this helps.
review_text_2: The only negative is that it doesn't have a built in microphone. I'm using it indoors and having audio record with the video would make it the perfect product for my needs. I have other indoor Amcrest cams with audio, but they aren't as high resolution as this cam.
review_text_3: Easy to install with excellent picture quality. Allows the viewing of great detail not found in lower mega pixel cameras.
review_text_4: Works well. Good picture. Can't attest to durability yet.
review_text_5: Amcrest cameras are getting better and better and so much better plus....I had some issues trying to connect this camera for whatever reason and customer service was very professional and got it resolved. Do Not waste your time and money on the other brands, Amcrest is well worth every penny.

review_header_1: Great picture quality. Easiest install ever!
review_header_2: Inexpensive good camera. Happy with it. Good daytime quality. Acceptable night time.
review_header_5: Great Camera for the Price - Better than expected!
review_text_1: I replaced a primary camera and added a new camera to my 12 camera setup, running on Blue Iris NVR software on a big Dell server, monitoring many angles/doors of several buildings on my property. All of these old cameras are/were Dlink 720p bullet-cams that are 6 to 8 years old, which I paid $300 each for back then. I wanted to upgrade to much higher resolution cameras to be able to recognize faces, read license plates at a distance, and other details which are/were impossible with the old 720p cameras.Skeptical, I only ordered two of these, one is this bullet-cam model, another is the dome model RLC-420-5MP, which appears to have the same guts in a different package.Very easy to install. I already had PoE ethernet hard-wired to these camera locations (and dozens of others), so it was literally plug-and-play. I changed the IP address from DHCP to hard-coded IP address so my Blue Iris DVR software knows where to find them.Picture quality was an amazing upgrade from the old Dlink camera, and night vision works great as well, as you can see from the photos. The porch shots are from the dome camera, the driveway/yard shots are the bullet camera. I can't speak to any of the software features since I'm using advanced third-party NVR software, but the video quality is top-notch, and it easily sends 25fps at full resolution of 2560x1920, with many options on max bitrate. It can go as high as 8192kb/s, I have it set to 6144 kb/s and the video is smooth and quality is crystal clear.I plan to give these cameras a week or two to make sure there are no surprises, then I am replacing the other 12 with these and probably adding a few additional cameras, but early results are these are amazing cameras at any price, but especially for under $100 each. I included a photo (and marked it) of the same angle using the old Dlink 720p camera for comparison, you can see what a massive improvement it is.
review_text_2: Update on the support issue. It appears the problem was not due to a defective camera. Blue Iris works fine when this camera when "reolink RLC-410" is selected. But this camera had been configured in Blue Iris as a generic ONVIF. In that mode, the decode errors lead to video artifacts. When I switched the camera type from generic to reolink, the symptom stopped manifesting.Thank you very much for the good email support from the vendor.For Blue Iris users, select MPG4 rather than MPG5 for compatibility with Blue Iris, and choose Reolink RLC-410 as the camera type.I now have four reolink cameras, three RLC-410-5MP and one RLC-411S. I am happy with all of them.=-=-=-I used to be happy with this camera. I own three of the RLC-410-5MP plus one of the prior 4MP models. Two of my 410s work fine. Unfortunately the 3rd one I bought is glitching all the time. About 20 times a day, i get rectangles at the bottom of the picture with vertical line distortion. The vendor is asking me to stare at the camera web page to catch it in the act. ?!?!?!? How can I spend my day staring at a camera web page? That's what NVRs are for. So far I am having trouble resolving this issue. Hopefully they'll come through. Obviously this is a defective unit. (Photo uploaded showing the glitchiness.)=-=-=- prior review below, from before receiving the 3rd (defective) unit -=-=-=-=-=-=-=-I am quite happy with this camera. I have 3 of them around my house, along with a smattering of GW, Dahua, Hik and other Reolinks. These new reolink 5MP cameras seem fairly good. The pictures are relatively sharp. The camera is capable of a decent bit rate. I am getting typically 2-5Mb/s in the camera's highest resolution at 10fps. I don't use any of the storage or motion activation features of these cameras. I drive them all from Blue Iris on a Core i7 with nVidia graphics. I highly recommend this combination. But NVR aside, as a slave to a really good NVR like Blue Iris, this camera performs very well for the price point compared to other similar units. Looks like Reolink got to market with 5MP a little earlier than much of their competition. (Though I see now there's also an 8MP in the market! Gotta try it for capturing license plates of porch pirates!)
review_text_3: This is a great little camera. There are still things I am figuring out but after running it for a full 24 hours I like it. I originally bought it to keep a watchful eye over my mailbox after someone knocked it off it's stand but I have come to learn the limitations of a 55$ camera. My mailbox is simply to far away, during the day at highest motion sensitivity the camera will detect people walking in the street. But at night time even at highest motion sensitivity walking in the street does not set off the MD, however all the bugs coming up to check out the infrared lights do. I mounted it on the soffit and I had some problems with the install as a 3/4 inch hole saw as recommended in the install guide did not make a big enough hole. You can get the top part of the water proofing cap through the hole but it then gets stuck on the part that holds the ethernet cord. I took a stanley knife to the plug and cut off enough of the plastic for the plug to fit. I would recommend going up one size and using a 7/8 inch hole saw, which is what I will do if I install another one of these. I've changed the recording now to do motion sensor during the day and normal recording at night time. I'm still not sure I'll catch anyone knocking off my mailbox, I think I'll actually need to upgrade to a model with zoom for that, but I can't fault the camera for that.I think the windows client app works well once you get the hang of it, it can be a little confusing that there are settings directly for the camera, in the case of an SD card being inserted, and then settings for the windows client app. I have not done any recording onto an SD card so I can't speak to that. The iPhone app works great, simple setup, and when I initially plugged the camera into my POE switch the app detected it right away.All in all a great camera for what it is.
review_text_4: I have 7 IP based cameras and 5 inline cameras many of which have needed replacing over the last 5 years or so. So I have owned a few. I wanted POE and 5 MP so I chose the RLC-410-5MP. The first thing I noticed was the ease in aligning the camera and the single tightening screw, the best I have seen yet. Setup took a few minutes using Blue Iris DVR software. I like this camera so much I felt it needed a review. Sometimes for laughs I read reviews and wonder what people are thinking. Apparently many of these reviews are fake also but this is a great camera and I wish my friend had taken my advice when he purchased his. This camera does everything I want at the best possible price.
review_text_5: I have a home setup with a variety of different brand cameras including WansView, Foscam and now this Reolink one. I run NetCam Studio on my home server and have a 16 camera license on it. I had to replace my outdoor Foscam 8905W which after 3 solid years of Michigan weather finally went non-responsive. I really enjoyed the 8905W because it had excellent nightvision and can view objects around 100 ft away from my house in the backyard with ease.When I started looking for a replacement for this camera I was going between this Reolink model and a 1.3 MP TRENDnet model. My requirements this time around was something that was PoE (because I had already pulled an ethernet cable) and had at least 100ft of night vision capability. Since the Reolink model was supported natively in Netcam Studio I went ahead and took a chance ordering it even though the TRENDnet one had a stated 3 year warranty and had more positive reviews.I was pleased when the Reolink model arrived and noticed a 2 year warranty when you register the product = bonus. Then I was even more pleased when I downloaded the iOS configuration app and it was seamless to get configured with wizards that make it easy and enough advanced options that a techie tweaker like me make changes. That coupled with being PoE made physical installation the easiest I've had yet. I actually spent more time uninstalling my old camera than I did setting this one up from open of box to configured with my server.After one night of running it I am EXTREMELY pleased with the wide view angle of this. It blows my old Foscam model out of the water (at a lesser price!) I can view almost my entire backyard from the same mounting location where I could only see a small section previously. Also the image quality and frame rate is fantastic. I actually had to reduce the resolution and bitrate so that my server could keep up with recording. Having audio is an added bonus as well.Overall now owning 20ish cameras in this price class I can say hands down this is the best camera I own and am considering replacing one of my other outdoor units with this. Would definitely purchase again and suggest any users of NetCam Studio to not waste their time with other cameras in this price range if you're able to hard wire.

This advanced camera features 1080p Full HD resolution with long-range IR night vision for a premium security solution that gives you clarity at all times, indoors and outdoors. This fully weatherproof add-on camera has extreme temperature performance, making it a fantastic choice for securing what matters most in any corner of the globe. Compatible with Lorex D841, DV700FS, DV800, DV900, LHV2000, LHV5100, D241, and D441 DVRs

review_header_5: Lorex 1080P works great with my Costco Lorex 4K 6 camera security system.
review_text_1: I bought this camera to replace an older one of the same brand and model number that had gone bad after about 5 years. Lorex must have done something to improve this model camera because it does a lot better than the older one (which was excellent in it' day). The night vision on this is so much better than the older one that the picture on my monitor looks like it is day time when actually I took this picture of my monitor at 1 a.m. with the outside porch light turned off. The new camera is number 4 on the picture of the monitor and the others are the original 5 year old cameras. This camera makes such a good difference that after I write this review I am going to order the 4 pack of this camera and replace all of my cameras.
review_text_2: This is an add on for our existing lorex security system. These cameras are superior to the 4 that came with the original system as the mounting bracket has improved to allow more flexibility in positioning the camera. Night vision is okay but could be better. All in all this was a good buy and we will be adding one more camera in the future.
review_text_3: I have the older LBV2531S-C models and they work well but optics and clarity did leave something to desire. I ordered the newer model LBV2531U-C and am really pleased. Night vision is far better and clarity is absolutely great. Able to expand pictures and still have great definition and recognition capability. Will be replacing all my older models with this newer model as time and money become available.
review_text_4: These cameras are great and just what we needed to connect to our existing Loren DVR
review_text_5: This camera 1080P works great with the Lorex 6 camera 4K system I got at Costco. I was afraid it may not work when ordering but was soon relieved when I installed it. The camera even came with the needed cable.

review_header_2: So far every parts works great.
review_text_1: Absolutely the best $250 Ive spent in a long time. Stupid easy to install and setup, including the smartphone app.Picture is razor sharp.Installed my system with a dedicated power supply and custom length rg58 siamesed cables. Did not use any of the supplied wires or power adapters. Only used the DVR and cameras.Put the DVR and power supply in basement and ran all cables to them.Got a long HDMI cable and long USB cable so I can monitor and control everything from my nightstand while laying in bed.Everything works fantastic !!!
review_text_2: First, setup was not too bad, if you‚Äôre handy, it will be easy to install and program. Utilizing existing co-axial cables and stabilized power supply. One thing I really like about it is it comes with everything, so you can set it up directly without make additional trips to store for some cables/cords.* Images: The images displayed on the system are very clear and more remarkably. In a lower light environment they will switches to black and white. So the cameras apparently have very good light sensitivity.* View: These cameras have phenominal quality and the field of view is so much greater than my older cameras.I've only had this system for a couple of weeks, and don't even have all of the camera's connected yet (though I did test them). In a year, once I can speak to longevity, I will return to give an update to the product. So far, however, I'm very pleased.
review_text_3: I do not give out praise often; in fact, this is my first Product Review in 5+ years. But I absolutely had to share my experiences with Annke Tech Support as their level of assistance and patience and accommodation was nothing short of phenomenal. After initially emailing them, they evaluated my request and responded to me within 13 hours (time zone gap included) and said that Tech Support would reach out in 24 hours. They reached out in 2...just excellent. From there, they were extremely responsive to help me troubleshoot my issue and we emailed back and forth a few times. Eventually, THEY determined that email would not resolve the issue so we had a Remote Desktop Sharing session to efficiently find resolution. We lost connection at one point, and Tech Support even CALLED ME to make sure we were still able to proceed. About 30 minutes later, I'm all set and happily keeping their product. As I am sure many of you have experienced poor customer service at some point in your life, you can rest easy that this company cares about their product and customers. If a positive review on their customer service is not enough to convince you to buy....allow me to review their product.Summary ÔÉ® Customer Service is Unparalleled. Price is Excellent. Video Quality is Great. Setup is fairly straight-forward. Some improved/updated instructions would be beneficial, but manageable as is. Interface could be improved to enhance experience, but ok.I spent a decent amount of time reading product descriptions and reviews for Home Video Surveillance and simply could not find anything that matched the price or positive reviews. Sure, there are some eyebrow-raising comments in some of the reviews, but nothing truly concerning. Some folks are expecting too much out of Nightvision, in general. This system performs above its price point. Sure, there are $1,000+ systems out there that will outperform this product, but that's not what you are buying. This system is a great middle ground between buying one/two over-priced Nest or Ring cameras that are merely selling their name and buying a 'high-end' surveillance system, which is probably overkill for you home. If you really need a system like that, then you should probably consider moving to a better area. You are going to get enough product (8 cameras and a DVR and remote access) to satisfy almost everyone‚Äôs surveillance needs.The quick setup guide provided was fairly straight-forward. I was able to connect it to my Smartphone without issue, easy. Adding the SADP Tool to my networked laptop was a bit more effort. The link provided in the guide was not accurate / retired, so a quick search on Annke's website located the software then back to the guide to complete setup. Not the end of the world, just be patient. If you cannot find it, email them. My 'issue', which required Tech Support, was that remote connection via the Web was no longer supported, despite being included in the guide. While this was a bit deceiving and frustrating, Tech Support was able to find a work-around and use Port Forwarding to allow me the type of access I was interested in. Most people will probably not need this, but I prefer laptops over phones and tablets, so it was a deal-breaker for me if no resolution‚Ä¶plus I didn‚Äôt want to have to install the SADP Tool on all of my laptops (again, I may be abnormal as I have 4 laptops in my home, but just sharing my experiences). Thankfully, Annke was able to help.Other than that, just know that the SADP Tool, Web, and DVR (i.e. direct connection between DVR and Monitor) interfaces are not overly user-friendly, but with some tinkering, you get used to the buttons and how to use the system. Again, not that big of a deal when you consider what you are getting for the price.If you are debating between this product and a competitor, give Annke a shot knowing that they will take care of you if you need help.
review_text_4: Only had it up and running for a day but very happy with it. Very clear, night vision is much better then our old system that cost more than this one. The camera's are plastic, but they won't rust. Make sure you know right where you want them incase you need more wire. Our head of security approves also.
review_text_5: I bought this update security camera system for my store month ago after i lost some package. It.comes a few days later after i ordered. Great shipping speed. I installed it right away. It'a very easy to install and set up. The video quality is great. The images of video taken during the day and night are both very cleaer. It comes with 8√ó1080p hd camra heads and i can see every connor of my store when i seating in my office or home. I also installed two heads out front of the store. Don't need to worry about in the rain or snow cause they waterproof. Since i had them around my store i haven't lost any package in past month. As a small business owner i think it works perfect for me. Anywag This system is outstanding. Great price and Amazing product!

review_text_1: Great product!Sooooo easy to install and setup. It can move horizontally. You can set privacy zone to be sure you're not recording at your neighbor. Try to install it to cover a large zone that is easy to detect movement because on eco mode, there is a delay to get out of sleeping mode so if someone pass fast, it will not have time to record it. I didn't try to record in continue but if you're able to connect it on an outlet, it would be a good solution to avoid issue to getting out of sleeping mode.Don't forget to charge it completly before setting it for the first time and do it before outdoor installation.
review_text_2: This camera was easy to get up and running. After a full charge, you get up to 4 months of battery so that should be awesome! It does not stay plugged in to the solar bank permanently (you have to open the waterproof seal to plug it in to charge) so we made sure to put it in a spot where we could reach with a step stool and will put an alarm on when we do plug it in so that we don't forget to close that up. The picture is great on our phones and it is motion activated and can be turned laterally from your phone/device to see other things while you are away. It also has a bright light that turns on at night when motion is detected. So far we really like this camera and its ease.
review_text_3: Works great with the app, excellent audio and picture quality. Moves very well manually.
review_text_4: We bought this camera for security at our apartment. This has been the best buy we have made. I can check my front door when someone comes on our porch plus I can keep an eye on my car. The picture quality has been great day and night. Plus it's solar-powered so no worries about the battery. And the memory cards make it easy to keep events for later viewing. I would say buy this one for easy set up to the phone and for easy to put up. Worth the money!
review_text_5: I am a person that does a lot of research into Smart Home products, so when I saw this camera, I was sure to give it a try. For the price, the features on this camera are amazing.The Guaseye PTZ Surveillance camera Model, S02J Has an extensive list of features like, 180 degree lateral movement, IP65, completely self powered using the accompanying solar panel. It even comes with a 32GB MicroSD card!From the amazing picture to the ease in installation, this is a quick way to get a darn good security camera for the price.The only drawback for me was not being able to add it into my Google ecosystem ...that would make it so much better.

description: You must know before you buy:1. This 4-in-1 security camera requires a DVR for recording video. It supports 5MP or 4K 8MP TVI DVR,HD CVI DVR, AHD DVR, and 960H DVR. It does not support IP NVR.2. In TVI, CVI, AHD DVR Mode, camera resolution is 4MP/5MP. In CVBS (960H) mode, resolution is 1000TVL.3. Camera resolution is 4MP/5MP. If connect to 3MP, 1080P, 720P DVR or 960H DVRS, it won‚Äôt work. Please make sure your DVR supports 1080P TVI/CVI/AHD signal input otherwise switch camera to Analog.4. If need to remote view by App, customer needs to use the APP of DVRTechnical Parameters:- 1/2.9" color CMOS sensor- Resolution: 4MP/5MP- 65ft IR Range- TV System: NTSC- Video Output: HD-TVI(4MP/5MP),(AHD/TVI/CVI/CVBS)- Day &Night: Support (ICR)- Frame Rate: 25fps (50HZ), 30fps (60Hz)- Min illumination: 0.1lux(LED ON) 0.01lux(0-3 lux LED)- S/N Ratio: >52dB (AGC off)- Electronic Shutter: Auto 1/50s (1/60s)-1/100.000s- White Balance: Auto - Gain Control: Auto- Weatherproof for indoor/outdoor- Power Supply:DC12V 1000mA4 in 1 video model, provides flexible for your security applicationsHD-TVI/ CVI/AHD/960H technology delivers zero latency HD video over RG59 coax or any standard analog CCTV cabling up to 300‚Äô. With convenient DIP Switch control of settings over coax cabling, you can eliminate the need for a separate cable.Note: This camera does not have recording or remote view feature, require DVR for recording, not wireless and do not support mobile view. Default mode is HD AHD, if you are using other type of DVR, like Analog DVR, please switch the video type follow the user manuals.Package included:1 x Dome camera1 x Bag of mounting screws1 x Installing Template1 x Manual

review_header_1: You Get What You Pay For
review_text_1: The camera does not have ir, instead two visible leds attempt to light up the viewing area. And they fail miserably. There was a ghosting artifact at night on the top left corner of the camera I received. The overall detail of the video at night was lacking. The camera was cheap enough to take a chance on, but this time I lost.

review_header_1: Great Quality Cameras w/ Very Developed Control Panel
review_text_2: First of all, I have to say that these indoor cameras are so easy to set up! I set one up while my 10 year old did the other and they were up and working within minutes. As you can see from my pictures, the picture quality is really great. You can view your cameras with the app and there you can see what you are looking at as well as hear what‚Äôs going on. Also what I found to be fantastic, was that you can make search around the room to look around if needed right within the app, without moving your cameras. The night vision is pretty good as well. I am thinking over ordering a couple more of these for the house as I am so pleased with my purchase. Each camera comes with a sd card to insert in camera for memory, so no extra purchase is required.
review_text_3: When I ordered I didn‚Äôt realize that it was a plug in device. Thankfully the areas I needed them placed had outlets and the cord has enough length!The night vision is surprisingly clear. The app is very intuitive, I‚Äôm still playing around with the settings. My husband has fun by talking to me through the device! Good buy for indoor use.
review_text_4: Now I really recommend this cameras the app is awesome it's easy to use you don't have to buy the cloud if you don't want to but if you want to it's available it records for you automatically motion detection and sound detection is awesome picture quality night vision and day vision beautiful I really really love these cameras it has taken me 2 years to be able to find the cameras that I like all other cameras no good really I really recommend this these cameras
review_text_5: We love these cameras! The features of these cameras are great and at low cost! We use it to watch our pet!!! The camera range on this is great as I can see most of the room using the arrows to scan.

review_header_2: Excellent alternative to Ring and Nest. Highly recommend.
review_header_3: Surprise me with this AFFORDABLE price!!!
review_header_5: An excellent security camera price, build quality, software and online support.
review_text_1: Honestly this camera exceeded my expectations immensely. Motion detection works flawlessly and has different modes, and most of all, night footage is very clear for a 1080p camera.I was most worried about the night video quality, as there were no visible ir lights on the camera housing, but they were there and work very well. Daytime recording is also quite crisp with little to no lag/delay while displaying live video to the app. There are also options to manually turn on led lights, even a siren is an option.There are options to install an SD card for local storage, no need for expensive cloud storage subscriptions(although available) and the Wifi connection is very easy to set up with the app. I recommend a ‚Äúendurance‚Äù micro sd card for best reliablility.All of the mounting hardware is included in the box, including screws, anchors, as well as a screwdriver. I had no problems installing this on my vinyl siding with some clips I bought off amazon as well. I would advise to run this off ac power, however so far the battery is still at 100% after 2 days.Overall a great security camera, would recommend to anybody. Hopefully you find this review useful.
review_text_2: This security camera is fairly inexpensive compared to Ring or Nest, but provides equal or better video with lots of additional functionalities.Build quality-Excellent, outside is hard plastic and feels very solid with good weight on it. Size is comparable to Ring Spotlight cam.Video quality-Great 1080p video quality during day light. Night video is a bit grainy but comparable to Ring Spotlight cam. There are 2 choices of video for night time video, black/white with infrared or color with light on. Both are usage.Easy of use-Easy to set up with download of Vico Home app. Once you pair with camera and enter Wi-Fi (2.4 gz only) infomoratin, you can do all the setup and control right from the app. It's fairly easy to use with good user interface.Extras-1. This is a big one. It comes with FREE 7-days cloud storage without needing to pay or sing up any service plan. This is much better and cheaper than Ring/Nest in the long run. The cloud upload functionality is also excellent. Once motion is detected, video is captured and I usually am able to view the video within a few seconds. 7-day cloud storage for free but you also have a choice to pay for longer term storage.2. The power cable is standard micro usb cable that is detached from the unit. This is a big advantage compared to Nest or Ring, where the power wire is built-into the unit. Standard micro usb cable means i can run power much easier from inside the house, through siding to power the camera, instead of Ring that requires power outlet outside and nearby.Overall, for the price this security camera provides an unbeatable value compared to similar function Ring or Nest. Highly recommended!
review_text_4: I bought this wireless security camera about 2 weeks back. So far, I'm very satisfied with its performance. It is very easy to sync with the phone and ready to be used. The price seems to be very reasonable for the features available on it. I placed this camera pointing towards my door so that I get notified of the movement of the person when nobody is at home. It works like a charm. The 2-way conversation works very well. Also, the feature I liked the most was to set an alarm and turn the flashlight on. So far, I'm very satisfied with the product and highly recommend it.

features: Compact plug-in indoor camera that lets you see, hear and speak to people and pets from your phone, tablet, or select Echo device.,Watch over your entire home by connecting one or multiple Indoor Cams to all your Ring devices in the Ring app.,With a Ring Protect Plan (subscription sold separately), record all your videos, review what you missed for up to 60 days, and share videos and photos.,With Live View, you can check in on your home any time through the Ring app.,Easily setup your Indoor Cam by plugging into a standard outlet and connecting to Wi-Fi.,Place on a flat surface or mount to a wall with the versatile mounting bracket.,For added peace of mind, pair with Alexa to help you keep an eye on your home.
name: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
review_header_1: Small size and high quality camera
review_header_4: Excellent addition to the Ring lineup
review_header_5: Had issues but ring support was great!
review_text_2: For a while I have been using Ring cameras for the the exterior and Wyze cams for the interior on my house. With the new indoor cam I can now access all my cams from one app. To me the picture quality is great overall and especially in total darkness. Live view connection is a lot more stable than my Wyze cams. Alexa integration is a big plus, no need for third party hacks to complete routines. Because I already have Ring cameras it‚Äôs worth it to pay a little more over a Wyze cam.
review_text_3: In February, I noticed my ADHD medication ran out early. I‚Äôm very careful about taking it exactly as prescribed so it was strange that I had run out 10 days early. For reasons I won‚Äôt get into for this review, I suspected the property manager of my building was stealing it. Obviously that sounded crazy, but I couldn‚Äôt think of another explanation. A friend suggested a Ring camera, so I bought one never expecting anything to actually come of it. I put some antihistamines in my now empty pill bottle thinking no one would ever take them, set up the camera when it arrived, and felt more secure knowing it was there. Set up was simple so I figured worst case scenario, I was out a bit of money and I spent maybe 10 minutes setting it up.Fast forward a week later when I get a notification via the app that there was motion detected on my camera. I open up the recording and there she is, entering my apartment, going right for my decoy pills, taking them, and leaving. I immediately left work to get back home. I called the police who sent an officer. I showed him the video and he admitted that had I not had the video, he wouldn‚Äôt have believed me. I was able to quickly and easily send the video to the police and to the president of the company that owns my building. I also was able to download the video and get it uploaded so that I have copies of it as I go through the next few months as she (hopefully) gets brought to justice.I cannot emphasize how much this little camera has helped me. I would not have caught my burglar otherwise. Because of it, they were able to look up records of who used their electronic key to access my apartment and she had been in there 7 times over the month prior. This would have gone on for longer and who knows if it would have resulted in harm to myself or my cat had I not caught her. This camera has given some of the sense of security she stole from me back and stopped a nightmare situation from worsening. I will still be recovering from this for long time and I am hoping she is brought to justice, but I cannot thank Ring enough for helping me secure my home from an unexpected source of danger.
review_text_4: This camera for $60 is a solid deal. I have had a Ring Pro and Ring floodlight camera for about a year.This indoor camera can either be put on a surface or mounted on the wall.What's in the box?1. Ring floodlight camera2. Proprietary AC adapter3. Mounting accessories4. Manuals.The included mounting equipment is a nice touch. Although I'm not going to mount mine.1080P video is solid. Covers a wider area.The two way audio is good to check up on Pets, senior citizens,etc. The sound comes through very clear from the mobile app. Two way talk is definitely a nice addition to this camera.The footprint of this camera is small. A blue light comes on when it detects motion.In order to have saved footage for up to 60 days, you have to pay a fee. $3 a month but a little lower if you get the annual subscription.If you have a bunch of ring devices you can have saved footage as well other features for about $10 per month.Case in point, solid camera at the price point. Provides piece of mind for your home.

review_text_1: I got this to put at our shop. I like that I can view it on my phone. It will pick up if it's a human and not a animal than you will get a notification. I like that I can use my Alexa with it. The picture quality is clear even at night. I like that I can see good at night. It uses a power cord on it. It's very durable and sturdy and well made from strong materials. I like knowing our shop is being covered 24/7. I will buy this again. Good price for a good camera.
review_text_2: This is a great product it takes very good high quality video recordings from the cameras which have great picture quality. It's like looking outside the window at your yard. Even better at night since you can't see hardly anything looking out the window but you can see everything with the cameras! Installation is kind of exhausting if done in the summer time! However that would be any camera system that's hard wired, which I would recommend anyway that way you don't have to bog down your wireless routers bandwidth with your camera system. I have hooked up my cameras with the app and it works very well. They only down side is they say it's Syseye in the pictures but it's actually Sgseye which I had to do some research into other comments and questions answered to find out. The app works pretty good but if you want to save a playback it doesn't seem to work it just saves a corrupt file you can't watch. I'm not sure about on the actual recorder since I haven't tried that yet. The TVR works pretty good and automatically rewrites over the old video as it gets full which is very nice, the only downside to the TVR I can say is that it's pretty loud at night, but not very noticeable during the day. I would keep that in mind when deciding where you want to install it. Ours is in the living room so it's not an issue for us. I would recommend this system for the price with the 2tb hard drive is a great deal and it works very well. I've had ours hooked up and working with all 8 cameras for a couple months with no issues aside from spiders leaving webs in front of the cameras >.<
review_text_3: Based on one week of usage, here is my initial review:Installation & Setup - Very EasyNight Vision - Very ClearPicture Quality - High-quality HDMotion Detection - Very Good,very sensitiveNotifications - Good, i can get the alarm notifications in time.Weatherproof-Very Good, it is metal shell, good heat dissipation.Continuous recording mode captures everything.Which allows me do not miss any wonderful moment.I choose to store the recordings in the cloud.Because this makes feel safe about my privacy.I can download the videos any time.Overall, I like this camera and recommend this to others.
review_text_4: The camera is well packed, everything is neatly laid inside. There is a fastener and clear instruction in the English language. The camera is easy to set up, the app is convenient, high-quality pictures both day and night. You can use cloud storage, as well as negotiate with the companion. And i recommend use the cloud storage, because big enough, when you check the playback video,it's very smoothly, never freeze. We bought 1 camera for installation in an apartment for an elderly person to look after him. Then convinced of the efficiency bought two more. The seller is decent, offers advice on installation and support at any time.
review_text_5: So I have a crazy neighbor. she only does stuff to us when she knows I don‚Äôt have my phone out watching her. So I bought this. Put it on the back of our shed to cover our whole back half of the yard. Was easily installed and set up. And ordered 2 more after watching the live feed one to get the front half of our back yard and the other the get the front of the house. It‚Äôs a good camera for the price. description: Cam v3 is the 3rd generation of Wyze‚Äôs flagship camera, Wyze Cam. Like its predecessor Wyze Cam v3 lets you see and record 1080p video right from the Wyze mobile app. New to Wyze Cam v3 is its waterproof design allowing for outdoor installation with an IP65 rating. Wyze Cam v3 also takes advantage of an all-new Starlight Sensor which allows for extreme low-light performance and shows great detail in the dark. With Wyze Cam v3's color night viewing, night time video recording appears as if it‚Äôs day time.

review_text_1: This camera is a huge improvement over the V2. Aside from the wider angle of view (more camera coverage), the night vision is insanely great in color. The fact that this can be used outdoors and can endure the elements makes it perfect.
review_text_2: Update:I use 5 at my house. I like them so much, I installed 2 at my grandmother‚Äôs house to keep an eye on her declining health and talk to her. Glad I did! 2 days later she fell and we were able to call 911 for her. I was 90 miles away and able to communicate with the Paramedics and have my parents meet them at the hospital.Original review:Excellent camera and easy to use.I see some reviews complaining about they couldn't get the camera to connect. I had the same issue, but I figured out. These cameras need a 2.4GHz WiFi network with a WPA/WPA2 protocol. Wyze Devices cannot be connected to a 5GHz network. So go into your router settings and change it. Many have the option to run both at the same time, which is what I did.Also, if you're having an issue at the QR code screen, where is says scan with cam. It means the Wyze cam, not your phone camera. Just point your phone at the camera and it will sync.
review_text_3: The image quality is superb. The motion can be separated to detect normal motion or persons which is extremely helpful to minimize false positives. It is tiny, lightweight, easy to install and cheap.The only con so far is a somewhat diminished WiFi range compared to my previous v2 cam; not a whole bunch. However, the fact that this one is weather resistant compensates in my book.Pleased with my camera. Thumbs up for sure.
review_text_4: My wyze cam came in today. Within 3 minutes this tiny camera was up and running. I did already have a wyze account. It had to complete 3 firmware updates. I had to log out of my app and log back in. Once that was done it was set to go. I'm looking forward to seeing the night vision this evening.Remember it will only operate on 2.4

review_header_1: EXACTLY the camera I was looking for!

review_text_1: My criteria for a camera was simple, yet specific:* It had to be wireless (I was NOT running cable)* It had to have night vision.* It had to be motion triggered.* It had to be solar powered (I was NOT going to have extension cords running up the side of my house).I live out in the country, so security isn't my priority. However, viewing the various forms of wildlife was. We have deer, bear, moose, bats, foxes, coyotes, mountain lions, etc. that routinely pay us visits, and I love to catch a glimpse whenever I can.The Reolink camera was perfect.It's part of my daily routine; checking the playback to see what visitors I had the night before. The camera was super simple to install and connect to my Wi-Fi, and the solar panels haven't let me down once--even when it's been cloudy out during the day.In my case these cameras (bought 2) were a splurge, but its an investment that pays off each and every day.
review_text_3: Have never had a Reolink camera before, and many of these wifi cameras can be a nightmare and a waste of money! This camera though was easy to setup and has worked great! The solar keeps the battery charged and have had no problems with dropping wifi or phone app not working. Will definitely buy another!UPDATE: Over 2 yrs of daily use and this camera is still working flawlessly. Battery still charges and maintains a charge for days without sun! Will buy the newer version camera when this one fails. Well worth the money!
review_text_4: Easy Set Up - Video Storage a Snap - Clear Crisp Video and Audio Accessible from Anywhere Internet is Available üëâ Right on your iPhone, iOS Device, Android Phone, or Windows PC üëç
review_text_5: I ordered two of the Reolink Argus Eco + Solar Panel security cameras and one of the Argus Pro cameras and a separate solar panel for that item. I received all but the one solar panel (it stated that it would be shipped at a later date, so no surprise there) within 24 hours of ordering. All of the cameras were extremely easy to set up and I had a complete 3-camera system setup and installed within 4 hours. Any questions that I had could be found in the instructions, in the app that you download, or online on their support pages. I did not need to call tech support at all.So far, I like the system very much. We set up my wife's phone and tablet in a matter of minutes so that she could also check in on the camera feeds. I would recommend these items to anyone wanting a quick security camera system.

review_text_1: I have not owned these cameras for very long but so far, they have been functioning very well. The picture quality is great, but you do lose some details when you zoom in. The microphone feature is nice to have, and the vocal clarity is great. I am currently trying a new location for one of the cameras, as I have decided to face it out the front window, but I can remotely move the field of vision back inside the house if desired.
review_text_2: I love these cameras! I have two of them in my house and would love to get a couple more! Some of the things I love about this camera are: (1) the ability to select which portion of an image (see photo) I want to receive notifications on, (2) the ability to save a preset view so that if I move it around, I can click the preset and go back to where I want it to stay, (3) the ability to talk through the camera, (4) the ability to turn off notifications for sound, and (5) NO MONTHLY SERVICE FEE! Although this one isn't made for outdoor use, I placed it inside my house looking out my front door and I'm able to spy on my packages and whenever someone approaches the house. I often use my camera to also talk to my kids when I can't get a hold of them. Ha ha! All in all, a GREAT device and will DEFINITELY be buying more for our home in the future!
review_text_3: The blurams cam was recommended by many you tubers and is hands down one of the best cameras I have purchased. We have it installed upside down and use it as a baby monitor. Installation was easy and fast, and the picture quality is great during the day and night time. I just still need to figure out how the SD card storage works.
review_text_5: I wanted to be able to keep an eye on my place when I'm not around especially when I travel. I've seen different devices but this one popped up on my screen so I decided to give it a try. It was very easy to set up. Let me tell you I highly recommend this camera it has night vision and can rotate from left to right there is also a button to talk which is awesome.

description: Setting Up Your Camera With YI Home App 1.Install YI Home App and create a YI Home Account 2.Turn your camera on and select the '+' icon in YI Home App to add your camera 3.Select your Wi-Fi network and enter your Wi-Fi password, then select Connect to Wi-Fi 4.Scan the QR Code shown on the app, then select Next once the QR Code has scanned 5.Select Save, then select Start using to finish pairing 6.If connection failed, please push the Reset button and try again WiFi Settings 1.YI Home cameras will need to connect to a 2.4GHz band network. 5GHz WiFi band is not supported 2.Turning on the location service on the phone if you encounter Unknown SSID issue 3.Encryption mode must be set to WPA/WPA2 (mixed mode) or WPA2 4.Your Wi-Fi password must be 8-20 characters in length If you have any other problem, please contact us via support@yitechnology.com.

review_text_1: Alright, so I'm a tech guy, love anything electronic! I have had CCTV cameras in my house for years. I've been using Swann wired cameras for the most part with mixed emotions. But running new wires to upgrade the system just didn't excite me.I had been looking at NEST cams since I have the smart Thermostats and Smoke/Carbon-monoxide detectors for a while, but the price is ridiculous! Plus your only option with them is cloud service (an additional cost). Then I spoke with a neighbor who sent me a screen shot from his YI camera. I must say, the quality was pretty impressive.So I bought a four pack for $119.00 with moderate expectations. Let me tell you I'm super impressed with the picture quality of these cameras. Set up is quick and easy. When I purchased them I had no idea they had audio as well. The audio quality is incredible, plus it's a two way speaker. Purchased 32 GB SD cards for all of them so I didn't need to use cloud storage and it's been working great! I have them set to record all motion and I usually have about 7 days of history on each camera.Day and night vision are both spectacular IMO. I have attached several photos so you can see the quality both day and night. Side note, I have a couple "indoor cams" mounted outside. To do this I purchased a rubber sleeve/cover from Amazon to make the drop cam weather resistant for outdoor application. It's been through rain, sleet and snow with out issue so far. Link to cover: https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07FD5XHMP/ref=oh_aui_detailpage_o09_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=1A couple cons, the power cable is sooooooo short. I had to purchased longer cables for a couple of my installs. No biggie, they are only a few dollars here on Amazon. The app for iOS is very functional, but it has no multi camera view which would be a nice option.
review_text_2: So I have been using the Yi 1080p indoor camera system for 2 weeks now and I LOVE IT! The camera's are crystal clear during the day and are just as sharp in night mode. The added features of being able to hide any "lights" such as the blue power light and the typical red IR lights for night vision makes "hiding" these cameras a breeze. The playback function works great and give you the time in hours, minutes & seconds. The 2 way talk feature works great and has 2 modes, 1 is a push to talk feature where when you press the button you cannot hear what the person on the camera is saying and the 2nd is a continuous talk where you and the person on the camera can talk back and forth without pressing any buttons (love this feature) the 32gig on board storage is also a great bonus. Like I said I have been using the cameras for about 2 weeks and have barely used 3 gigs of space. (for an idea of the amount of traffic, it's just me, my wife and our 2 pets) so the cameras don't get a ton of action during the week. But are always recording on any motion. (I do not subscribe to the cloud storage as for I haven't seen a need) Anytime you get an alert it will store it on the app and you can upload it to your mobile device and share it with others. The initial motion detection clip is only 6 seconds, but if you wait till the end of the 6 seconds you will get an option to "view entire motion" which will bring up that camera, rewind to when it first detected the motion and play it back until there is no longer any motion, GREAT feature. All of the features seem to work as expected, you can set times for your camera to alert you when it detects motion and zones so that your dog walking around doesn't keep triggering the alerts. I can say the motion detection is VERY sensitive. You can set the setting to low, medium or high but really I can't tell a difference low to high. I have one camera facing out of my front window and it picks up shadows, car lights, leaves blowing, etc. Not a big deal, but on a windy day I can get a ton of alerts. The app works great, you can set a PIN or use your fingerprint to log into the cameras so in the event your phone is stolen, unless they have your PIN or fingerprint they will not be able to pull up your cameras. Connecting them was very simple and took less than 5 minutes per camera. Plug them in, scan the UR code and they will automatically connect to the network your phone is connected to. The packaging was very nice, didn't feel cheap. All cameras were individually wrapped along with all of the accessories. Comes with instruction booklet for assistance with installing/setup. The camera (black part) can be removed from the white base and mounted in different areas. They also sell (separately) wall mounts for the cameras. (cheap, like $10-$15 for a 4 pack) or you can stand them up anywhere you like (they have a round rubber grip on the bottom to help keep them from sliding around. All 4 cameras come with a USB cord and power brick. The USB cord is about 10-12 feet long so you should be able to place these cameras wherever you'd like. OK so I hope this rant...I mean review was helpful. If you're anything like me, I read all the reviews on a product before I make a purchase. Thanks for reading!***(I am not affiliated with Yi or any of there products, this was simple a consumer review, please purchase these at your own risk)***
review_text_3: I purchased the Yi 4 pk. 1080 Indoor security cameras. I was skeptical but am so glad I took the chance. I placed them in various windows facing outside as it‚Äôs outside I want to observe. They work perfectly during the day and, where the outside area is lit, at night. If the area is not lit, there is a reflection on the glass from the IR light, but they ARE designed to be indoor cameras. They work very well indoors, day and night, as intended. I have observed some sketchy people that have rung my doorbell when I‚Äôm not home (I have a camera in the window next to door), along with the neighbor‚Äôs cat, a family of raccoons, an opossum and numerous squirrels. I had an issue where they stopped alerting me of activity (which I see some others have had, also) and contacted Yi customer service. They promptly replied to my request and worked with me to make sure all my phone settings were correct. Turned out, the problem was with my phone settings, battery saver shutting down the app, NOT with the cameras or their app. I especially love that I can insert my own sd cards to save & view past events and not have to pay for ‚Äòcloud‚Äô subscription. I don‚Äôt know of another security camera that offers this. I couldn‚Äôt be happier with this purchase! In fact, I ordered another set of 4. If you are still in doubt, look up some reviews and comparisons of the Yi cameras on youtube.
review_text_5: Best Security Option for a home because:1. Its a one time charge- no monthly subscription- and all of the features of the camera work with the SD card2. The camera video is excellent especially the Night vision- it can see in almost complete darkness- wow3. The detection system is superb- I especially like that you can select an area within the total viewing area for detection. I use this feature so the cars that pass outside of my house do not trigger the alert only the area literally right in front of my door.4. The intercom is clear and at the appropriate volume5. Install and app use is seriously easy whether your a "techy" or not6. Small form and can be hidden without drawing attention7. Excellent price - for what you get its so worth it!8. Retrieve data on multiple device- My wife and I can both check our home and get the alerts simultaneously.9. Still records video on SD card even when wifi is out10. The option to make the camera stealth (no sound or constant blue light)As long as the camera and app lasts then I would definitely tell you do hesitate, buy it- its worth it and more.

review_text_1: This battery camera is hands down amazing! It‚Äôs incredibly easy to set up and operate. I just downloaded the app and connected it to WiFi. The clarity is perfection! I love that you can set all of the features to different sensitivity settings.
review_text_2: I found this camera due to user reviews, so I wanted to pay it forward. This is has been an excellent security camera, and it is well worth a consideration.I was concerned about getting a camera from a brand I did not recognize. But truthfully, all the bigger name brands seemed to have something wrong with them. For me, I was struggling to find cameras that connected to my wireless network consistently. I also didn‚Äôt want to rely on a cloud based server that could be hacked. No monthly service either, please.This camera solved all those problems. The connection didn‚Äôt take long at all, and they offer several different ways to do it. It needs a micro sd card, but those are inexpensive. You have the option to connect the app of the camera to your photo roll to download pictures and video, too, so you can pull from the sd card anytime you want.I think the real winning feature here is the ability to rotate the camera. They don‚Äôt hit your over the head about it either. In the app, when watching live video, you basically swipe your finger on the screen of your phone to tell the camera which direction you want it to go. I can turn the camera all the way from my front doorway, past my cars parked in the driveway, to swing around to the curb outside my house and beyond. When suspicious things may be happening outside, this is an awesome tool. Can I admit it too? It‚Äôs almost fun. The camera moves slowly but silently.It does not auto track, though, but still.Auto detection is pretty good. Night vision looks really crisp. The image is all around very good. I have a Ring doorbell that does not hold a candle to this camera.Latency is usually very low. I haven‚Äôt used the two way audio really.I wish it had some siren or alarm sound as an option. A manual button for that would be easy and useful.It‚Äôs not small. If you are trying to conceal your cameras, this is the wrong choice. For me, I WANT the camera to be seen. I would rather deter someone than catch them in the act afterwards.I highly recommend the ctronics camera, then, and it‚Äôs pretty affordable. Well worth a try if you are struggling to find a new camera.
review_text_3: After doing some careful research to find a new solution to monitor the outside of my home, I came upon these new camera's and thought to give them a try, I bought two. These camera's replace two different name brands which simply did not work well as security cameras. The set up upon arrival was a breeze and syncing to my wifi network was not a problem unlike other camera brands. When charging, contrary to the instructions, there is no green light indicator, only a red light which turns off once charged. The batteries charged for 4 hours upon arrival and after two months, the new charge was 8 hours each.After two months of operation, both camera's work great and as indicated. The latency or time to react is quite good. I no longer capture the back of people's heads only and these camera's have already caught two people entering my property, bad neighbors!These camera's are App driven only, no base station to deal with. You have excellent control of the camera's via the app so you can just set it and forget it until it pings. I also added two 128GB micro SD cards as required to store content and there is no end, meaning once the cards are full, they are overwritten, so no need to delete anything. These camera's charge via a USB phone cable and the first charge last some two months of use which included set up use.Overall, these are the best home security cams I have used which are cost effective, simple and with no monthly or annual fee's. Now that I have two, I might just add two more for a maximum of four allowed via the app.
review_text_4: I really like the motion sensors and the rotation. With the app you can rotate the camera. Amazing. I def. recommend this camera as it has alot of features in this price. I clicked the picture from the camera and you can see the clarity too.
review_text_5: We got this product 3 days ago, and i wanted to test it out before writing a review. We have this camera outside right above our garage and we love it. We can see very clearly at night & there‚Äôs no crazy wires. It‚Äôs battery powered so it makes for a nice clean look. It‚Äôs also very easy to install and use and the app is easy to work as well. I def recommend this camera for anything. It watches our cars & boat. We just bought another one for the backyard. MUST BUY!!!!!!
