review_header_1: Great simple system with good tech support
review_header_2: Full review,  many tips and few tricks. A good economical  NVR System
review_text_1: Let me start this review with the tech support. The personnel at HiSeeU are fantastic to deal with and very helpful with all of your questions. They have answered most of my questions within 4 to 5 hours via email. I have not tried the phone support. They have answered questions that are outside of normal tech support as I am an engineer and wanted to know some of the details of the system and connections.The system arrived without issues and was packaged in a relatively small box considering that it contained a base station (NVR), four cameras with antennas, one extended antenna (about 10 feet long cable for remote antenna placement), one mouse, one HDMI cable, one 3 foot ethernet cable, one external power supply for the NVR, four external power supplies for the cameras, mounting hardware (screws and plugs) for each of the cameras to include four Allen wrenches to adjust the camera mounts. Also included was the setup instructions and two rather large yellow stickers for posting that cameras were in use.The instructions I will say need a little bit of work as I believe that they do not match 100% the current software. The basic information for how to access some of the menus and initial connections is needed. I did not have an issue as I have been testing systems like these for a few years for use in tropical areas.I chose to connect the NVR first. I installed a 3 Tb full size hard disk into the system. This is pretty strait forward for connections however I did have an issue with the actual mounting of the HDD. The case is more designed around a smaller laptop HDD so screw placements align right in the case. As I was utilizing a full size HDD I was only able to connect two of the screws for mounting but the full size HDD fit and is secure within the housing of the NVR.It should be noted that the NVR has a VGA monitor port, and HDMI port, one RJ45 (Ethernet) port and one USB 2.0 port. There is also one power input port and no on/off switch.I connected the NVR to my monitor (could have connected to TV or other monitor) via the HDMI and connected the provided mouse to the USB port. I them attached the power, within about 10 seconds I received the splash screen and the unit was booted within about 1 minute after that. It is a bit slower than some systems to boot but was acceptable.Once booted you are provided with language options and then manual or automatic setup. Being an engineer and know-it-all, I selected the manual (you may want to select auto). By doing this it allowed me to go through the setup and allowed me to understand what the software was doing. After hunting around the menus and playing with different items I reset the system and connected the ethernet to the device to my router. I booted the system again and to my amazement the system was able to identify my network and obtain an IP address without issues. I went into the network menus and changes the system to utilize a static IP address (for example 192.168.1.60) and then restarted the system. I found in the menus that after any change you MUST select the APPLY button and not assume that selecting OK will work as it does not. You MUST select APPLY for changes to take effect. LESSON #1While the system was rebooting, I downloaded the app for this device. There are several that will work but they recommend using the IP Pro 3 app. Ignore the reviews as it is a simple app that for the last 5 days has worked well and without issues. If you are a Blink user it is similar but has more functionality which is what I think throws people off. After the app was loaded and an account was created, I added my system to the app. This was a very simple task as it involved just scanning in a QR barcode, wait a few seconds, connection is made. I did not need to adjust any firewall setting or any other parameters. It connected without issues.Once all of this was completed and I was sure that I could identify the NVR on my network and could also connect with the app I started connecting the cameras one at a time. There is a page in the menus that identifies each of the cameras and provides the IP address for each. The system utilizes the 172.14.20.xx address range. The connections are also pretty strait forward, put the camera on a table close by, attach the antenna, attach the power supply and then wait a few seconds. The cameras have been pre-matched to the NVR prior to chipping to make it easy. If you have one of the cameras that does not connect contact Johnny at HiSeeU and he/she will send you simple to follow instruction with pictures on how to reconnect and sync the camera. DO NOT HIT THE RESET BUTTON ON THE CAMERA. There is no need to hit this button. I only did by accident when putting on one of the weather proofing caps. LESSON #2Once you have all the cameras connected and you see the actual video on the screen, I would recommend that you restart the system to ensure that all items are functional. Remember LESSON#1Take you time playing around in the menus on the NVR as well as with the app and adjust all the motion or recording settings prior to placing the cameras out an about. This will save having to reinstall at a later time if you mess up. I found that sensitivity around 50% to be good around a patio area but needed to lower it to around 30% in the yard and in areas that birds fly around adjust the other way so as to not be triggered all the time.You can set each camera recording individually or as groups for three different types of recording, Option-1 is to record all the time, Option-2 is to record on motion and Option-3 is to record on alarm. The third option is really not available yet as I do not believe they have the alarm devices yet. These would be simple contact alarms. As I am testing the system for myself and others, I have both Option-1 and Option-2 selected so I receive 24/7 recording as well as motion recordings. This is nice to have and different that some of the other systems out there.I had placed one of the cameras out about 150 feet from my home which is wood and stucco Santa Fe built. I was able via the menus able to see the received signal dB level and for this camera it was about 22 dB which is very low. The camera would come in and out of connection and was not really functional at this distance. I had purchased one the WiFi Range Extender that HiSeeU offers (ASIN B07FY81P8X) as I knew some would be far away and would need some help. I do have other systems out there that function but they are in a way different price range so I expect more from them. Once you have configured the extender you can, through the menus, select and attach the camera to the extender. No need to push any buttons or hit any resets as this will cause you nothing but issues and time. It is very nice the way you can reconfigure the system. As a not, after discussions with Johnny he advised that you do not need to have the extender as each camera can also act as an extender. Through the menus you can daisy chain camera to meet your needs and string them out using the camera as the range extender. You will notice a slight delay f a few seconds between each extended camera but if it is not time critical it is not an issue.If you want to access the system from a PC and not have to utilize the mouse on the NVR then I would recommend that you download the software provided (free) by HiSeeU. It is under the downloads under downlod#3 called ‚ÄúPC Client for Wireless security camera system‚Äù. It works well but I have not been able to do configurations with it yet.So far, we have had rain, snow and subfreezing weather and the cameras have held up nice. I did place one camera under a heat lamp for 12 hours and this camera worked well too.So far to date: (20190103) here are the pros and cons:Pro:‚Ä¢ Price‚Ä¢ Tech Support‚Ä¢ Simple to set up‚Ä¢ Compact‚Ä¢ Built in range extension‚Ä¢ Free cloud access‚Ä¢ Functional app‚Ä¢ Free MAC/PC software‚Ä¢ Built-in linking (extensions)‚Ä¢ E-Mail and app notifications work well and easy to configureCons:‚Ä¢ Short RF range (can be overcome with extensions)‚Ä¢ Instructions (online and paper provided) This could be corrected with up to date language and pictures.‚Ä¢ Power supplies. I have used these same ones on other systems and they only last about 6 to 12 months in the heat of AZ‚Ä¢ Reset button cap. It is poorly made and makes it easy to accidently hit the reset of the camera. Added silicon to button so as to not hit the button and also keep water proof.‚Ä¢ No on/off switch on NVR‚Ä¢ Only one USB on NVR. If you want to export a video on the NVR you can not as you need the USB port for the mouse. This also can be overcome by using the PC software which allows you to export to the PC.‚Ä¢ No ability to connect to existing network wirelessly. Can only connect to router via RF45.‚Ä¢ Ethernet port is on 10/100 and does not support 1000 MbUPDATED 20200518This is now the fourth set of these camera and NVR that I have purchased. I installed my first one here on Roatan off the coast of Honduras in our beach home. It has worked flawlessly now for over a month. I installed a 4TB drive and with all cameras recording all the time plus motion as well as activity logs, I get well over 6 months of recording for the 4 cameras.The cameras have held up well to the harsh monsoon season where we get Nor‚Äôeasters‚Äô rains as well as sea spray hitting the cameras. I did spray the outside of the cameras with a silicon-based spray prior to install and every 6 months just to make sure there are now issues. I also utilize the range extender ( ASIN B07NRBYM5C) that they offer, yes it is cheap plastic and the current software of the NVR will only allow 2 cameras and yes it does induce a lag in the picture but it always works flawlessly even with all the power outages we have here on the island. Always comes right back up when power is restored.I have only had one issue with a camera that had stopped working and I could not bring it back to life, after a quick email to the support folks that answered back the next day with some ideas. Low and behold what they had recommended fixed it and brought it back to life. Every time I have contacted customer support with questions about the product, they have been fantastic and better than the folks at the ‚Äúother‚Äù companies (ARLO).I have shown off my set up and the fact that I can monitor for anywhere in the world several of my friends have asked me to order one and install for them (For a beer or two) which I have been happy to do. Not many products I have been this happy with.I do wish they would update the NVR software soon as there are still some issues with the connection to a higher end 4k TV but it is a simple fix with adjustment of the resolution once you figure it out (through great tech support).Some cons:The newer cameras do not have the reset button on the cable and now include the power and RJ-45 connector. The cord is also a bit shorter but I mount mine on grey electrical boxes to stash the cords and power connections so not a big deal but do miss the reset button.The power cord for the NVR is short, really short.There is no ON/OFF switch on the NVR so you have to pull the short power cable to turn it off.Bottom line:Getting ready to order 3 more sets here. I have been so happy with this set as it is great value for the $$$. Oh, and yes, this is the same NVR device as so many others sell for a lot more.
review_text_2: I am happy with this basic NVR wireless cam system; it is what I was looking for under a tight budget.I decided to purchase the: HisEEu 4-Channel HD 1080P Wireless Security Camera System (Wireless NVR Kits),4Pcs 960P 1.3MP IP Security Camera Wireless Indoor/Outdoor IR Bullet IP Cameras Wi-Fi, P2P,App, NO Hard DriveThe system option that I ordered was the one that comes without a hard drive ASIN: B07FSFXZZ3, Item model number: WNKIT-4HB611AThe reason that I decided to go without a hard drive was that besides going on a tight budget, I also have a 500GB hard drive, that I pulled out of a portable hard enclosure that I hardly used before it went inside a box for about three years. For all purposes is a new HDD. One of the things that I liked about this NVR is that it came with the screws, the power cable and the SATA cable for the HDD, so I didn‚Äôt have to buy those. Installing the HDD was a breeze, and I did not have any complications with it.Before I installed the cameras in the chosen locations, I connected the NVR, and I downloaded the latest firmware, after that, I connected each one of the cameras to their power supply and verified that they were working with the NVR.Do not embellish your installation, do not wrap the cables with nice tie bands, or place the NVR unit in a difficult location until you have everything working right.I knew that I would have an issue with two of the cameras before I installed them, and that is because the location (backyard lanai) of the cameras it‚Äôs a place were my WIFI signal was very poor until I installed a WIFI extender. So, before you install your cameras, I suggest you download on your smartphone or tablet an app called WIFI manager I have the one from kmasoft. It will provide you with information on the signal strength of your WIFI, and you could use it to get an idea what kind of signal the cameras will get from the NVR system (assuming you will have the NVR in the same location as the WIFI router). The NVR provides its own IP address to the cameras; the cameras will not be using the IP address supplied by your WIFI router, the NVR will obtain an IP address from the router, that what will allow you to see the cameras over the internet.Can the cameras work directly with the router? Technically it is possible; it will not be an issue with the cameras that have an ethernet cable, with the push button cameras it will be a more difficult task. However, why would you like to complicate the whole thing? Leave the router alone.In my router, each one of my devices has it own IP address reservation, that way I do not find my devices jumping from one IP to another, which sometimes ends in address conflicts, and erratic connections.After I installed the cameras, I found one of them connecting and disconnecting, and the other one jumping frames. I went through all recommendations such as antenna orientation and so on, but it didn‚Äôt help much.So, I ordered the Wi-Fi Range Extender for hisEEu Security Camera System Wireless. ASIN: B07FY81P8X,Item model number: IPC RouterAn unexepected add on that cost me $20, there goes my budget for the cameras.Unfortunately, the wireless extender comes with instructions for the ethernet cable cameras, and I have the push button cameras. After some pain and suffering, I had the extender up and running. The extender works, and it solved the poor signal problem that I had with the cameras in the backyard, the other two front door cameras are very close to the NVR, so I never have an issue with either one.All four cameras are under covered porches so that they will have no issues with the rain. They will be exposed to the heat and high humidity of Central Florida, but that will be it. Regardless of the claims of any manufacturer about the weather rating for the cameras; you should never expose them to direct rain. The issue is that the cameras run slightly warm, and when they are splashed with water the air inside of the cameras will suddenly cool down, and it will create a slight vacuum pulling in the outdoor humidity with time. I understand that sometimes you have no choice with regards to the location, however, do your best to shield them from the direct heavy rain.WORD OF ADVICE. Never, ever push the button of the cameras, do not play with it, no matter how intrigued you are, do not press that button for any reason, not even if you think that the instructions tell you to do so. NO TOUCHY! You will regret it.A long press of that bottom will reset the IP address, and the short press will allow you to pair them again. When you reset the camera IP address, the chances are that the new IP address will not match the one stored in the NVR, you will need to erase the one saved, and go through the matching procedure to make them work again.So, if your curiosity ended with no cameras being recognized, you will have to remove them from the location, take a seat in front of the TV and the NVR with the cameras connected to their power supply, make sure you have the latest firmware installed in the NVR and that it is connected to the WI-FI router. Once you are comfortable, you can start fixing the problem, which will include disconnecting the cameras from the NVR on the OS screen, then cover the camera lens, press the diabolic button, and disconnect the power. While you are holding the camera, connect the camera to the power supply, release the diabolic button, uncover the camera, it will make a little noise, it will reset and show in the NVR OS screen.If you don‚Äôt want to do all of that, do not touch the button on the cameras, or the IP setting of the cameras on the NVR OS screen.The instructions that come with the extender are perfect for making your life miserable, as they do not apply for the push button cameras, pressing the button of the extender and waiting for it to pair, will not happen, and that is why I ended touching the diabolic button on the camera and hell broke loose. The manufacturer posted a video on YouTube on how to set up the extender with push button cameras.The whole pairing thing of the extender and the cameras can be done in the NVR OS screen without pressing any buttons either in the cameras or the extender. Although while on the menu from the extender you will have to do it once to code match the extender with the NVR.Videos:ZOSI - How to set up the NVR repeaters to boost the Wi-Fi distance?Hiseeu wireless NVR kit match code (No LAN port)Very technical videos in YouTube channel: BehforHow complicated is to set up this NVR system? Well if you are the person that only sets up their devices with the router push button, and don‚Äôt know anything about IP addresses, or router OS setup, then this will not be that easy.Yes, you will be able to get out of the box, follow the questions in the screen for the setup, and make it run. However, if you touch any of the settings, and change the values, you will have a hell of a time. There is no built-in help in the NVR OS as you will find in your windows PC. Your best bet for technical support will always be YouTube videos.This brand is as good as any other with the same product, after all, it comes from the same factory. However, their technical support varies on available YouTube videos. My current firmware is not the one that shows in the videos, but if you know what you are doing, that is that not that much important.Things that I did not like, is that to back up a video, it has to be done through the single USB port in the back unit, one has to disconnect the mouse and then insert a USB memory device. One extra USB in the front of the unit would have been useful. However, in my case, I am not expecting to have to do so at any time.The push button cameras are good; although, I prefer the ones with the ethernet cable, which would have to give me the option to connect and reset the cameras directly to the NVR or my PC. However, it is not a big deal, if you do not mess with the camera button, and if you have the system up and running, you will never need an ethernet cable on the cameras.The camera system that I ordered is four channels, what that means is that only four cameras can work with the system, I will not be able to upgrade and install more cameras later on.If you don‚Äôt like the order in which each camera is laid out in the screen, you can click hold and drag them to a different position on the screen.Manual recording allows you to set up with an easy click one or all cameras to record 24/7; then you don‚Äôt need to go through the scheduler.How many GB does the NVR use while recording 24 Hrs? It depends on what is being recorded, in my home, the cameras are recording the back and front yards doors. The traffic in the area is what you will typically have in a house, as the images are mostly static (few people in and out). I am using about 25-30 GB every 24 hours, so that means that my net HDD 465 GB (after formatting ) will be able to record a minimum of 15 days of 24 Hours videos. For my needs that's is enough, although if the HDD fails one day, I will upgrade it to a larger one. Also, remember these are 1.3MP cameras, higher resolution cameras will use more GB of space in the HDD.There Is no need to install the CMS software for watching the cameras in a PC, If your PC is in the same network as the NVR, just type in your browser the IP address of the NVR, and the cameras will be visible.Remember to set up a password for the NVR. Otherwise, your cameras and the NVR OS will be visible and accessible to anyone in your network.I highly recommend that you visit the manufacturers YouTube channel and watch a few videos before you embark in the installation of your NVR system.I rate this product 5 stars, it works well, the price is right, and the resolution of the camera is very good for the distance that I need it to cover. It is easy to install; however, you must be able to understand the OS of the NVR.The day resolution of the camera is good enough for identification of a person in front of the door or a car parked in the driveway, but it will not allow you to get the tag of a vehicle moving on the street.The infrared (night recording in B&W) is decent but is only effective for close takes such recording a person in front of your door in the middle of the night. If you have a bright light in the location, the camera will switch back to color mode, and the quality of the picture will be even better.The IP Pro3 app for Android devices in straight forwards, set up its easy, I did not find complications with it. Connectivity issues will be the combination of your phone LTE signal and your internet connection signal for the NVR; you can expect some jumping frames and time delay. However, that is considered normal, except if you have the security system and the internet connectivity that a large corporation can afford.Wireless NVR cameras systems have come a long way. They are easy to install, and they beat climbing on the attic and walk over the insulation to install wiring. However, wireless NVR is a compromise that allows you to connect the system a few hours with minimum work, but at the cost of sometimes having to deal with signal issues.Which brand should you buy? Indeed Amazon reviews are helpful, but sometimes some bad reviews are posted by people who do not have enough technical knowledge to solve a problem. I previously mentioned that many of these brands/systems come from one manufacturing plant in China. When you measure the technical support that you receive because of a phone number or an email address you are doing it wrong. Enter in their websites and look at what kind of information they have available; can you download manuals? Do they have a section of FAQ? Then check to see if they have YouTube videos of the unit that you are buying, YouTube videos will be your primary source of technical support for NVR systems, issues with the equipment can sometimes be too complicated for you to resolve with an email or a phone call, a video it‚Äôs the perfect walkthrough.Product support from HisEEu via YouTube videos is very decent. However, the manufacturer still has some work to do in that area. Their YouTube is channel: c hiseeuI contacted technical support via email, and they were very helpful.The last tip. Buy a UPS where you can connect the NVR, the router, and the modem. It will be one of the best decision you can make. It is essential for the NVR as the HDD will not be affected during power failures. Also if you want to maximize your security, then also install a UPS for the cameras as they will keep recording during a power failure, it takes about 20 seconds for the cameras to reconnect with the NVR after a power failure. I may do it for the front cameras as I have an old UPS laying around.I hope that you find the review useful.
review_text_3: For the price $150, nvr with 4 wi-fi outdoor cameras, expandable to 8, very good picture, very good wi-fi signal connection, easy to use. Buy this product. Just a little problem in setting it up. Phone call to them could have been avoided if they have better instruction in the manual. Phone call was helpful and friendly, but they hardly speak English. Have to repeat 10 times, they still don‚Äôt understand. Do not install cameras until they are all paired wit nvr and you can see pictures. Connect nvr to router with supplied Ethernet Cale by connecting nvr to router with Ethernet cable. Turn on nvr and cameras, they will auto pair. Everything perfect so far. Up to this point, you can stop if you do not want smart connection since it‚Äôs up and running.For smart phone access, you download ip-pro from the App Store free. You have to add just one device, it is the nvr. Do not try to add cameras because the 4 cameras are part of the nvr system. The manual does not say this. Now comes the tricky part that I have to call them for help. They list work time 5-9pm Pacific time, night banker‚Äôs hour? On the add device screen, you need to input 3 pieces of info: cloud ID, user name defaults to admin (leave this alone), password for admin. Admin is administrator on the nvr set up earlier.One star deducted for bad manual instruction. Otherwise, I want to give it 5 stars.Update: Upgrade to 5 stars today because of the following. The system has been running smoothly for 3 months since new. I use the IP Pro app on my iPhone an IPad, and my wife runs it on her iPhone. But starting 2 weeks ago, the IP Pro app fail to load. It will load and flash for a second and then closes. I called customer service a few moments ago. They are very helpful and friendly. The gentleman told me to download the the most up to date version 3.2.4. I did just that, and the problem was resolved. Thank you, Hiseeu. I feel safer now that I can monitor the surrounding of my house again.
review_text_4: This was a purchase on prime day July 16 2019 as the price dropped from $169 to $129. With another discount already applied by amazon and an 8% code offered by the seller... I paid $119 for this system.Only bought it for the cameras to add to my existing 8ch system. Cameras are $44/ea. Kind of a no brainer. I did install my own red wd 1tb HDD and tested the whole system. All worked just fine. Bought the 4 camera system without the hdd. Upon arrival I assembled everything on my dining room table, all was good. I installed the camera's and my own HDD in the NVR. Also got the NVR connected to my tv. I was pleasantly surprised at how good the picture was for each camera. Now waiting for nightfall to see how good the IR would be. Again.. very pleased! The system management takes some tinkering to get used to. The motion detection will drive you crazy at night if your using the app and have notifications on.... if the sensitivity is set too high as the bugs like the light/heat from the cameras.Yes each camera has to be plugged in to an outlet but no other wires are necessary for the cameras themselves.Overall here are my ratings.Picture. 4.8/5. Zoom could be better, gets grainy.Motion. 4.5/5. It definitely works. Find the happy place. I havent yet.Night IR. 5/5. Honestly no complaints, works well.System interface. 4.5/5. Now I have not messed with everything but what I have it's pretty simple once you understand.Customer service. 5/5. Fast response. Pretty sure they are located in China, 12 hours ahead of my time zone so when I emailed it was 130am making it afternoon there. Either way, great friendly customer service.Overall. 5/5. Good quality for the price!
review_text_5: I bought in the system in May 2019. I‚Äôm very pleased. Great pictures night and day. VERY EASY installation. I will be adding another camera with two way talk ability for the front door. Very good quality. I work nights so we have it hooked up to our bedroom TV. If the the wife hears a noise she wakes up looks at the TV to see what it is. She feels safe since I bought this system. Only thing I would do different is buy the one with the hard drive. Cause I had to buy it separate and install myself. Which was very easy for someone without electronic knowledge. App on phone works great. There is an email for questions johnny@hiseeu.com. They answered me within 15mins. I strongly recommend. (Didn‚Äôt give motion detection any stars cause I don‚Äôt want use it so I can‚Äôt give a rating)

features: Blink Outdoor is a wireless battery-powered HD security camera that helps you monitor your home day or night with infrared night vision.,With long-lasting battery life, Outdoor runs for up to two years on two AA lithium batteries (included).,Store video clips and photos in the cloud with the Blink Subscription Plan and save events locally to the Blink Sync Module 2 via a USB flash drive (sold separately).,Outdoor is built to withstand the elements to help you protect your home inside or out, come rain or shine.,Designed so you can set up yourself in minutes. No wiring, no professional installation required.,Get motion detection alerts on your phone with the option to customize motion zones in the Blink Home Monitor app so you‚Äôre only alerted when you need to be.,See, hear, and speak to visitors with live view in real time and two-way audio features on your Blink app.
name: Blink Outdoor - wireless, weather-resistant HD security camera, two-year battery life, motion detection, set up in minutes ‚Äì 1 camera kit
review_header_1: Neighborhood package thief will be CAUGHT and PROSECUTED with this crazy clear video!
review_header_3: I actually purchased the product.  1st time user of Blink.
review_header_5: What an awesome wireless system...buying more!
review_text_2: This new camera is better then the Blink xt2 ! It has been totally re-engineered. Take it from someone who owns all the different cameras Blink had to offer since day one and had to get on a waiting list to get the very first one. So, I should know what iam talking about. This new camera no longer has the push down and pull system to open the back to install batteries. It has a large screw that you simply unscrew with a included tool to open the back of the camera which is really nice. Once you open the back and install the included batteries scan the small QR code inside the camera threw the blink app it will scan to find the camera once that is done it will automatically do a firmware update. After that you are ready to install your new blink camera. Also noticed the sound is much louder and more clear then the other cameras. This is good if two people are talking in a low voice you can hear what they are saying. Has brighter clearer night vision. Nice clear voice communication with two way talk. Alot stronger wifi signal to sink module and from sink module to camera. Sharp, clear, bright, and colorful HD vision during the day. I noticed before I wrote this review that some people only gave this camera 2 or 3 stars. Like the guy who is complaining about software issues. Well if you follow the directions you would not have that problem. Let the camera finish its firmware update. Duh ! Also, if you have been a Blink customer for a while and want to add this camera to your current system. You do not have to pay for cloud storage you are grandfathered in. After you add this camera to your existing system it will actually tell you this ! The front of the camera has a all new face with a very smooth and shinny surface iam sure to help combat the weather and give it a more high tec look. Their is no longer a switch inside the camera to turn on or off the blue recording light located on the front of the camera. It's is all done threw the app which is really nice as well. They really did a good job in re-engineering this camera and listened to customer complaints about their past cameras and went threw and fixed every issue. I would definitely buy this camera again ! UPDATE : 09-25-20 After using this camera for a couple of days. And as other reviewers have noted that this camera only has a 25 foot motion trigger ! Anything further than 25 feet it will NOT record when motion is present. So if you need a camera get the Blink XT2 for the further range. This camera will only be good for specific areas like door or window that are within the 20 to 25 foot range from the camera.
review_text_3: It's super easy. Works great. Setup was simple. It works exactly as advertised. What I didn't know for sure is that the batteries are just high quality AA batteries. So when they die, you can get some rechargeable ones and just rotate them through the thing. I'm going to order a couple more. They are pretty great. *Edit-A nice person took the time to let me know it's best not to replace w/ traditional AA batteries.
review_text_4: So far everything is as advertised. Setup was a breeze and the image quality is great - especially when set to ‚Äúbest.‚Äù I really appreciate the custom activity zones that you can set, as well as the ability the turn off the led light.In terms of improvement, the included mount is pretty basic. For better or worse the mount snaps into the back of the camera module. This makes installing it relatively easy, but also means anyone could detach it with a firm pull. I‚Äôve noticed that there are upgraded mounts that you buy, but haven‚Äôt had a chance to fully check those out yet.Lastly, I noticed another reviewer mentioned subscription pricing, but it‚Äôs a bit misleading. Yes, there is cloud storage that you can pay for, but there are multiple levels, including a free plan, as well as a basic plan for $3/month. Also, the paid plans don‚Äôt start until 2021. More importantly, What this camera has, that the XT2 doesn‚Äôt, is local storage. If you‚Äôre big on privacy, and don't want to store videos on the cloud, you can attach a USB drive to the blink module and save your videos there (see photo which shows the usb drive). There‚Äôs no fee for saving your videos locally - you can still get alerts and watch your video feed live for free.
review_text_5: What an awesome product...total install took 25 minutes. I put 3 camera‚Äôs up outside to monitor my summer home. One of the camera‚Äôs I places on a pole in the yard pointing at the roof so I can monitor snow fall and snow melt roof system. The app was friendly. I shared the app with my wife and she was up and running in 2 minutes with minimal effort. We are so happy with this wireless system.

features: ,,„Äê360¬∞ View Pan/Tilt Control & 1080P Clear Night Vision„Äë - Security cameras wireless outdoor can rotate its head 355¬∞ horizontally and 120¬∞ vertically. Simply controlling the mobile phone APP, you can realize remote 360¬∞ all-round monitoring to protect your property safety. Equipped with 4 infrared LEDs, 1080P FHD resolution (1920*1080), 130-degree viewing wide-angle, and 4X digital zoomÔºåthe wireless camera allows you to remotely shoot and watch up to 65ft range Clear pictures and videos,„ÄêNewly Upgraded Rechargeable Battery & 100% Wireless Installation„Äë- Zumimall wireless outdoor wifi security camera has a built-in rechargeable battery. Support 3-6 months of uninterrupted use, provides users with more intimate and convenient battery life support. Free of power cords and wiring hassles, it takes only a few minutes to set up. With a 4dBi antenna, the outdoor security camera can connect your 2.4G WiFi quickly from a farther distance. (Battery camera does not support 5GHz WiFi).,„ÄêPIR Motion Detection & Instant Alerts „Äë- Home security camera using the latest upgraded AI algorithm and PIR sensor with unique human, pet, and object movement detection functions. Through set alarm plan and adjust sensitivity level to minimize false alarms. When the motion detection is triggered, a notification will be sent to your mobile APP and the video or image will be stored in the SD card or cloud storage so that users can more accurately capture the content they care about in real-time.,„Äê2-way Audio & Multi-user Sharing„Äë- Built-in microphone, support two-way audio. Outdoor camera wireless allows you to interact online with children, guests, couriers, etc. As long as another user has the same "CloudEdge APP" as you, you can share the QR code with him and watch the wonderful content of the camera together. This outdoor camera for home security is not only a medium for you to soothe your beloved pet remotely but also a defensive tool to scare off intruders.,„ÄêIP65 Waterproof & Wide Applicability„Äë- The wireless cameras for home security have waterproof and dustproof housing to ensure it keeps working through any weather. You can equip this outdoor security camera together anywhere in your home. Such as indoor/outdoor, yard, garage, shop, and other places.
name: Security Camera Outdoor Wireless WiFi, ZUMIMALL Camera with Rechargeable Battery Powered for Home Surveillance, Motion Alert, 1080P Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Waterproof, Encrypted Cloud/SD Slot
review_header_1: BEST PAN/TILT YOU CAN GET FOR THIS PRICE A+
review_header_2: Not my first zumimall, and won't be my last!
review_header_3: Great distance vision for a pan and tilt camera
review_header_4: Easy installation with excellent range & features!
review_text_1: This is one of the better companies i've noticed as their constant upgrades, product support and customer service rivals or even beats top tier companies like Nest, GoPro, Ring, etc. Far better than Lorex which i've previously owned. Zumimall constantly updates and upgrades and I always worried about getting surveillance with legacy software but they constantly update their app more than Apple would do software updates. Which is a good thing.Can't recommend this camera and support this kind of company, help them with your feedback and watch them actually implement certain features. I've bought probably over 10 units from them of different models over 5 years and have given them out as gifts to friends and family because this company creates products ahead of the market at an affordable price. HIGHLY RECOMMEND, support companies like this! Where the engineering team actually cares about building better products that consumers want, they are the leaders in this market. Thanks ZumiMall
review_text_3: I've tried other battery cams and none had the field of vision I'm able to get with this camera.Pros:*Clear night vision*Almost 360 degree field of vision*Rapid alerts*Camera does respond quickly, no problems opening the app to view alerts*Field of vision at least 55 feet during the day with perfect 1080p*Strong WiFi readings with 2 external antennas, even mounted up in a tree*Easy to install yourself with back plate using only 4 screws. Side screws are applied by hand to remove unit only for charging*Best battery life of any camera I've tested.Cons:*It is a bit heavy due to the large battery, but the back plate is small enough for installation on a medium branch*The app doesn't automatically record videos, you still must manually record the alerts to save. This is an easy fix by the app developer, so shouldn't discourage the choice of this greatly upgraded pan cam.It blends into the environment once we installed the unit. We've finally got coverage over our entire yard plus all the surrounding properties, from just one unit. Highly recommend!
review_text_4: I wanted a wireless security camera with excellent signal strength since the camera is located pretty far from my wireless router. Previous cameras would only work intermittently, but this new Zumimall Pan Tilt Security Camera was just what I needed! It has a strong signal, was simple to install and has a clear picture that is easy to adjust on my Android Smart Phone. It is too soon to test the full battery life, but the unit is solidly built so I'm not expecting any issues. Very pleased!
review_text_5: After purchasing several types of stationary wireless cameras over the years I decided to try a security camera with more features. There are literally dozens of models from different manufacturers available. I had purchased some Zumimall cameras before and was impressed with their quality, affordability and their outstanding customer service. This is also a total wireless camera but it has a 15000 Mah rechargeable battery, which is one of the most powerful batteries I have seen available on a wireless camera, and can give up to 6 months before recharging is necessary. I installed mine with a Zumimall solar charger. Living in South Florida, i get plenty of sunshine so I never have to worry about recharging batteries.The pan/tilt feature is great. It can pan almost 360 degrees and tilt 180 degrees. This allows it to view the entire front lawn, for example, with just the one camera. It uses an app developed by Zumimall (Android or Apple). This app allows you to control all functions of the camera with easy to understand simple instructions. And unlike other brand camera apps I have tried in the past, this app has no glitches, is stable and actually works. This camera is very well designed, engineered and is of very high quality. Setup is easy and took 5 minutes. As I mentioned it is also priced at a price about half of some cameras I have tried with much less build quality. I have it installed (Photo included) in the overhead ceiling of my carport facing my front door and mail box. I have a very bright front door LED light and the night vision is in color and of excellent definition. I also installed a 128 GB SD card in the camera which stores a vast quantity of recorded videos for later review. The mic and speaker work exceptionally well, compared to some other more expensive cameras I have tried. It has a great WiFi receiver as well. Even through 4 walls of my concrete block home the average WiFi signal strength at the camera is 75%. All in all I am very happy with this product and highly recommend it. The only thing I feel could improve the system would be to develop a charging cable with an enclosed watertight boot to protect it against moisture if installing outdoors. ( Such as the one on the charging cable of the A-3 camera.)You will not be disappointed with this camera.

description: Night Owl¬Æ is excited to offer our U.S. designed and engineered 4K UHD 4 Channel Bluetooth¬Æ Digital Video Recorder with (4) Wired 4K UHD Spotlight Cameras and 1TB Hard Drive. With Secure App-Based Bluetooth¬Æ Setup, there is no need to connect a TV or monitor for setup or viewing (optional). You can easily configure your system right from the app on your smartphone or tablet with the Bluetooth¬Æ connection. While a TV or monitor is not required, with Google Assistant you can use simple voice commands to stream camera footage directly to your TV or monitor, all while remaining hands free. Each camera has 1-way audio (speaker) which works with our built-in siren and preset voice alerts. From within the app, you can easily activate the built-in siren, startling intruders and sending them packing. Have a guest but can‚Äôt get to them? Use a preset voice alert to let them know! Smart Detection Technology including Human Detection, Facial Capture and Vehicle Alerts reduce the risk of false alarms, keeping you safe and well protected. Facial Capture lets you see who is on your property by snapping a photo and sending the image to your Smart Device. Motion-activated spotlights flood your yard with bright lights when human motion is detected, instantly warding off trespassers. Need more coverage? You can easily add up to 4 Wi-Fi devices (WNIP2 or WNIP8 Series). Proudly designed and engineered in the U.S.A., our security system uses a wired connection for uninterrupted viewing with no delays. description: Product Description Introducing Night Owl‚Äôs state-of-the-art Smart Detection Security System. Utilizing our Dual Sensor Technology, this system detects both motion and heat to minimize false alerts and keep you apprised of Real threats in Real time. This truly is innovation right at your fingertips! From the Manufacturer 5MP Resolution 5MP Cameras provide 150% more pixels than standard 1080p. Enjoy clear, crisp, and detailed images day or night Dual Sensor Technology With standard motion detection, false alarms often occur when bugs fly in front of the camera, cobwebs appear, the wind strongly blows or heavy rain looms. Our dual sensor technology reduces these false alarms by requiring both heat and motion be detected simultaneously. Night Vision Night Owl‚Äôs Infrared Cameras provide up to 100 ft. of Night Vision. During the day your camera will display in full color mode. At night, it will enter black and white mode. H.264+ Video Compression Technology Save hard drive space and enjoy more efficient data transmission to your Smart Device. Quicker delivery means faster access when viewed remotely. Secure Wired Connection Our PIR system is a hardwired security system that offers invaluable peace of mind. Record uninterrupted and with no delays while enjoying high resolution video. Standard Motion vs. Smart Detection Reduce false alarms by up to 90% with our Smart Detection Security System! Our wired Infrared cameras detect humans, animals and vehicles. About the Startup Describe your product in 3 words.Innovative, Quality, AffordableHow did you come up with the idea for this product?Night Owl originated from a desire to provide customers with an easy to use, cost effective, and high quality product. We believe that everyone should be able to secure what matters most to them. Whether for your home or business, Night Owl offers state-of-the-art technology that will help give you peace of mind, all the time.What makes your product special?While our systems are set to motion record by default, we offer multiple recording options as we understand the needs of our customers are varied. As such, you may elect to set your cameras to 24/7 record or scheduled record should this be a necessity for your home or business. With more effective compression and quicker delivery over lower bitrates, you will be able to quickly access your recordings remotely. Night Owl offers multiple ways to monitor your cameras around the clock. Our free CMS software gives the user full control of their DVR‚Äôs and cameras on a PC or Mac. Easily playback past events, backup video to your computer‚Äôs hard drive, change settings, and view up to 128 cameras simultaneously. Turn your computer into a real-time security center in minutes! Monitor your home or business on a smart device with our exclusive and free Night Owl X app for iOS and Android devices. Easily connect to the app via Smart Auto Detection, which automatically detects devices on the same network. Playback video footage from multiple cameras and systems, save videos and images directly to your phone or tablet, and email, text, or share recordings via social media. What has been the best part of your startup experience?The most rewarding aspect of our company is being able to provide our customers with the security they deserve. Knowing our products help protect homes and businesses with innovative and affordable technology is rewarding as well as motivating. We pride ourselves on listening to our customers and understanding their needs. This has enabled us to become the #1 Wired Security Camera Brand in the U.S*. *Source: The NPD Group, Inc., Retail Tracking Service, U.S., Security & Monitoring, Camera Technology: excludes baby monitors, Wired Only, Based on dollar sales, Jan- Dec 2016

review_header_1: Don't be fooled what others say
review_header_2: Amazing camera security system would definitely recommend
review_header_3: Great video quality, easy to use and durable equipment
review_text_1: Its a great system. I don't know why some people say that it only records with motion. If they read or have some type of knowledge,you can change the settings to record all the time..also you can view it on all devices live and recorded... the best easy to use systems...
review_text_2: This camera security system is amazing and the video is so clear and the clarity is beyond amazing. The HD quality of the pictures that you get from the cameras are unbelievable you can pick up somebody's license plates and their faces. The lens surface may look small but the amount of space in panoramic view you get is large. To hook it up to your smartphone is super easy. The only problem I have encountered is trying to hook it up to my computer. Night Owl has been great with trying to help me work on this. Other than that this camera system is beyond amazing and the clarity of the pictures and quality of the video you will get is astonishing. The audio is amazing on the two audio cameras that you get with the set you can clearly hear if someone makes a comment or say something. If you're looking to update your security camera system I would definitely recommend you buy this camera security system.
review_text_3: I had this camera system professional installed, all around, and inside of my home. I use 2 cams indoor, and 6 outdoor. The outdoor cameras are very durable (I live in Michigan where the weather varies from very hot, to extremely cold; plus severe storms are the norm)! I haven't had any trouble seeing what's going on outdoors, or inside, when I'm home watching on the big monitor (not included), or away on my tablet of cellphones (I use both iPhone and Galaxy S android phones). I really don't have any complaints, and have been very happy with the equipment. The management interface is a little dated, but it's just a camera system, so it's very functional and easy to use. The on-device playback system has improved over the past year, with firmware updates, and is straightforward to use! The mobile app playback is still a little clunky, but I'm hopeful it will improve once they update the apps. Anyway, I highly recommend this camera system, and will buy it again, whenever I move!
review_text_4: I had a first gen Night Owl system that quit working after 5 years so I decided to upgrade to a HD system. I have to say I am impressed with the system in whole. It was easy to set up and the streaming to smartphone worked easily and extremely well once port forwarding was set up. The app is very intuitive allowing for capture of snapshot or video file. The cameras are awesome and correlate movement with IR and display events as a yellow block on a timeline for easy review. the video quality is really sharp and the night vision mode really reaches out so much better than the older 720p cameras I had. The documentation is spotty at best and It took awhile to learn how to search and find events, but once figured it out it's really cool and easy to find things that set the system to record or send an alarm. I am very happy with the system, will see how it holds up.
review_text_5: Great system. But each camera needs WiFi. So with 10 cameras 4 smart TVs 5cable boxes 2 smart phones fire stick and an I pad all on one WiFi with upgraded 150 speed it‚Äôs picture is delayed or pauses a bit. But not it‚Äôs replay mode.Still recommend it but remember how much WiFi it takes. Buyer be ware.

review_text_1: Overall, pretty good system. I didn‚Äôt purchase to monitor the entire neighborhood, but cameras are so advanced that they pick up a lot more area than i imagined when I purchased. They pickup great area, and couldn‚Äôt be more clear and the night vision is 10 times better than any night vision goggles that I have used in the last 20 years in the army...great bargain. This, everyone, is all you need for your home. I have one on all 4 corners of my home and simply don‚Äôt need anything else. It records 24/7, and I can rewind to any second of the day and review on my television or my phone or any other device that can download the FREE app. All remote viewing is 100% free! Can view anywhere! This is all you need and more! For a matter of fact, it protects my home, my cars, my storage building out back, and what I didn‚Äôt expect is....it also has in view, my neighbors homes, front and back and even HD with zoom capability of my neighbors across the street (their homes). At the end of the day, this system is monitoring a lot of my immediate neighbors homes, cars, etc. can‚Äôt beat the price and peace of mind. No complaints really. A little touchy on the motion sensitivity, but I have adjusted that and literally no complaints! Nice!

review_text_1: I ordered one for my meetings. It isn‚Äôt available in EU yet, so I bit the bullet and shipped it international.Remote people have instantly commented on dramatic improvement in meetings... as you can probably expect. Several day trip meetings are now been postponed to ‚ÄúOwl It‚Äù. Quality is very good, so I can comment on how much this Pro version is versus the earlier one. I use Skype and MS Teams.I do want to add a note about the case. It is a shame that Owl Labs don‚Äôt have a convenient case that comes with it. This isn‚Äôt the sort of hardware you want lying loose in a bag during transit.I did discover that most Oculus Rift VR carry cases available on Amazon are an excellent dimension to fit he Owl (Pro or Regular) in with its power supplies and cables. I attached some photos of one Oculus Rift case I ordered. I cut the foam out and glued in some new foam to match the Owl. Works like a charm. I now can carry it separately to meetings or throw the case inside my larger everyday backpack. I just wish Owl Labs did include a case, even if it was an additional purchase option.I honestly cant fault this for much, since there really isn‚Äôt anything else in the industry quite like it at the moment.
review_text_2: I purchased the Meeting Owl Pro to make joining meetings a more interactive experience for remote users than just a speaker alone. So far, I have found this product extremely easy to set up and use. I have been told that the sound and video quality of meetings have been wonderful, and users have really enjoyed being able to feel more a part of meetings they are unable to attend in person.I do not keep my Owl in one location; rather, I travel to client locations and set up the owl so that my team members and others can join the meeting. I've had no issues setting it up each time. It is quick and easy through the app. I use GoToMeeting to run the meetings, which the Owl also very easily works with. I do wish there was a carrying case I could purchase for my needs, as I usually end up packing the Owl in a checked bag when traveling.If you're looking for a way to close the gap between your virtual and in person meeting attendees, I cannot recommend this product enough. It delivers exactly what is promised.
review_text_3: We've tried many different devices for our home office and finally found a devices that seamlessly handles both video and audio in our space. The Owl Pro is that device. Easy connection and setup for all of our users, who vary in levels of technical skill.The only draw back is our meetings now take a couple of minutes longer since everyone wants to know why our camera image is different and that leads to them wanting to know about the Owl Pro.
review_text_4: The Owl Pro will cover up to 15ft distance on all sides when placed in the middle of a conference table. . We love how this camera focuses in on the speaker and yet still can zoom in on others sitting within a 15 distance. For those who are joining the team via zoom, they can see each individual as though they were sitting in front of their laptops but yet in a good distance that is comfortable for everyone, even those who are more shy and don't want to be in the limelight. :-) The voice and picture are clear and for us, it seems to be the next best thing to meeting in person. Very nice camera and a good investment for a team of people that can fill a table 15 ft from the camera.
review_text_5: This has been one of the best investments that we have made, to date, in our vitural counseling, outreach, and teletherapy protocols. It puts the person, on the other end, in the room with you. It unites the group in a way that only Owl can. We would never have thought this was even possible, but it far outperformed our expectations. We got the PRO and recommend it. The spiffs are worth the extra and now we are purchasing two more. I stepped out on a limb with this thing to begin with and now we are buying more. That should tell you something!

description: Proudly American, Night Owl is excited to offer our U.S. designed and engineered 4K Ultra HD Wired Camera(s) with Built-In Motion Activated Spotlights and Human Detection Technology. The camera‚Äôs bright spotlight activates when it senses human motion, stopping trespassers in their tracks. When used with a compatible recorder, Human Detection reduces false alerts to your Smart Device, while Facial Capture takes a snapshot of a person‚Äôs face and sends you a real-time alert. These weather-resistant indoor/outdoor camera(s) use Color Night Vision to continue recording in full-color in low-light settings, only switching to Night Vision if necessary. Night Vision up to 100 ft. and wide-angle viewing provides extreme coverage for your home or business. Night Owl's wired technology uses a secure hardwired connection for real Closed-Circuit Video Security (CCTV). A wired connection delivers uninterrupted viewing and recording, providing you with true around the clock protection. When you connect this add-on camera(s) to your existing recorder, our free remote viewing app for iOS and Android Smart Devices keeps you connected and provides easy access to your recordings. NOTE: The camera(s) are only compatible with the DP8 series and are not backward compatible with other Night Owl wired products.

features: Compact plug-in indoor camera that lets you see, hear and speak to people and pets from your phone, tablet, or select Echo device.,Watch over your entire home by connecting one or multiple Indoor Cams to all your Ring devices in the Ring app.,With a Ring Protect Plan (subscription sold separately), record all your videos, review what you missed for up to 60 days, and share videos and photos.,With Live View, you can check in on your home any time through the Ring app.,Easily setup your Indoor Cam by plugging into a standard outlet and connecting to Wi-Fi.,Place on a flat surface or mount to a wall with the versatile mounting bracket.,For added peace of mind, pair with Alexa to help you keep an eye on your home.
name: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
review_header_1: Small size and high quality camera
review_header_4: Excellent addition to the Ring lineup
review_header_5: Had issues but ring support was great!
review_text_2: For a while I have been using Ring cameras for the the exterior and Wyze cams for the interior on my house. With the new indoor cam I can now access all my cams from one app. To me the picture quality is great overall and especially in total darkness. Live view connection is a lot more stable than my Wyze cams. Alexa integration is a big plus, no need for third party hacks to complete routines. Because I already have Ring cameras it‚Äôs worth it to pay a little more over a Wyze cam.
review_text_3: In February, I noticed my ADHD medication ran out early. I‚Äôm very careful about taking it exactly as prescribed so it was strange that I had run out 10 days early. For reasons I won‚Äôt get into for this review, I suspected the property manager of my building was stealing it. Obviously that sounded crazy, but I couldn‚Äôt think of another explanation. A friend suggested a Ring camera, so I bought one never expecting anything to actually come of it. I put some antihistamines in my now empty pill bottle thinking no one would ever take them, set up the camera when it arrived, and felt more secure knowing it was there. Set up was simple so I figured worst case scenario, I was out a bit of money and I spent maybe 10 minutes setting it up.Fast forward a week later when I get a notification via the app that there was motion detected on my camera. I open up the recording and there she is, entering my apartment, going right for my decoy pills, taking them, and leaving. I immediately left work to get back home. I called the police who sent an officer. I showed him the video and he admitted that had I not had the video, he wouldn‚Äôt have believed me. I was able to quickly and easily send the video to the police and to the president of the company that owns my building. I also was able to download the video and get it uploaded so that I have copies of it as I go through the next few months as she (hopefully) gets brought to justice.I cannot emphasize how much this little camera has helped me. I would not have caught my burglar otherwise. Because of it, they were able to look up records of who used their electronic key to access my apartment and she had been in there 7 times over the month prior. This would have gone on for longer and who knows if it would have resulted in harm to myself or my cat had I not caught her. This camera has given some of the sense of security she stole from me back and stopped a nightmare situation from worsening. I will still be recovering from this for long time and I am hoping she is brought to justice, but I cannot thank Ring enough for helping me secure my home from an unexpected source of danger.
review_text_4: This camera for $60 is a solid deal. I have had a Ring Pro and Ring floodlight camera for about a year.This indoor camera can either be put on a surface or mounted on the wall.What's in the box?1. Ring floodlight camera2. Proprietary AC adapter3. Mounting accessories4. Manuals.The included mounting equipment is a nice touch. Although I'm not going to mount mine.1080P video is solid. Covers a wider area.The two way audio is good to check up on Pets, senior citizens,etc. The sound comes through very clear from the mobile app. Two way talk is definitely a nice addition to this camera.The footprint of this camera is small. A blue light comes on when it detects motion.In order to have saved footage for up to 60 days, you have to pay a fee. $3 a month but a little lower if you get the annual subscription.If you have a bunch of ring devices you can have saved footage as well other features for about $10 per month.Case in point, solid camera at the price point. Provides piece of mind for your home.

description: Experience crystal clear resolution with Night Owl‚Äôs 1080p HD Expandable CCTV Video Home Security Camera System with 1080p HD Wired Cameras. Intended for use both inside and outside, place these cameras where they will be of most use to receive the coverage you need. With 100 ft. of enhanced Night Vision and a 100¬∞ field of view, the cameras guarantee you quality coverage and crystal clear video. Night Owl fits right in with your lifestyle by allowing you to remotely monitor your home or business with our free mobile App and Control Management Software (CMS). Whenever motion events are detected, the system immediately sends an alert to your Smart Device. Equipped with Smart Auto Detection Technology, your DVR is automatically detected by our App's software, making connecting easy. Both the App and the CMS software are compatible with Android and iOS devices as well as PCs and Macs. Also, with H.264+ compression, you will enjoy fast and efficient recording and playback even when you access your recordings remotely. With 24/7 technical support in English, Spanish and French, Night Owl is here for you every step of the way.

description: Product Description Introducing Night Owl‚Äôs state-of-the-art Smart Detection Wireless Security System with 1080p resolution. Utilizing our Dual Sensor Technology, this system detects both motion and heat to minimize false alerts and keep you apprised of REAL threats in REAL time. This truly is innovation at your fingertips! From the Manufacturer Secure Wireless Network With its own independent wireless network ranging up to 300 FT., you will enjoy uninterrupted video without interference from other Wi-Fi networks. AC Powered Cameras Each camera is equipped with its own power adapter and enough cable to install the camera in a desirable location. This allows for 24/7 coverage and Pre-recording, options not available with battery powered cameras. Our AC powered cameras ensure you are achieving maximum coverage and not worrying about the batteries giving out or missing key events. 2 Way Audio Each 1080p wireless camera comes equipped with two-way audio. Pick up and record audio from up to 20ft. away. This feature allows your cameras to record audio and act as a virtual intercom via the Night Owl X App on your Smart Device. Dual Sensor Technology With standard motion detection, false alarms often occur when bugs fly in front of the camera, cobwebs appear, the wind strongly blows or heavy rain looms. Our dual sensor technology reduces these false alarms by requiring both heat and motion be detected simultaneously. No Internet Required/No Monthly Fees The wireless NVR has built-in Wi-Fi and does not need an internet connection for recording or video transmission to the NVR and local TV/Monitor. All recordings are stored locally to the 1 TB pre-installed hard drive and there are absolutely no monthly fees! Please note, Internet is required for remote viewing from a computer or Smart Device. About the Startup Describe your product in 3 words.Innovative, Quality, AffordableHow did you come up with the idea for this product?Night Owl originated from a desire to provide customers with an easy to use, cost effective, and high quality product. We believe that everyone should be able to secure what matters most to them. Whether for your home or business, Night Owl offers state-of-the-art technology that will help give you peace of mind, all the time.What makes your product special?While our systems are set to motion record by default, we offer multiple recording options as we understand the needs of our customers are varied. As such, you may elect to set your cameras to 24/7 record or scheduled record should this be a necessity for your home or business. With more effective compression and quicker delivery over lower bitrates, you will be able to quickly access your recordings remotely. Night Owl offers multiple ways to monitor your cameras around the clock. Our free CMS software gives the user full control of their DVR‚Äôs and cameras on a PC or Mac. Easily playback past events, backup video to your computer‚Äôs hard drive, change settings, and view up to 128 cameras simultaneously. Turn your computer into a real-time security center in minutes! Monitor your home or business on a smart device with our exclusive and free Night Owl X app for iOS and Android devices. Easily connect to the app via Smart Auto Detection, which automatically detects devices on the same network. Playback video footage from multiple cameras and systems, save videos and images directly to your phone or tablet, and email, text, or share recordings via social media. What has been the best part of your startup experience?The most rewarding aspect of our company is being able to provide our customers with the security they deserve. Knowing our products help protect homes and businesses with innovative and affordable technology is rewarding as well as motivating. We pride ourselves on listening to our customers and understanding their needs. This has enabled us to become the #1 Wired Security Camera Brand in the U.S*. *Source: The NPD Group, Inc., Retail Tracking Service, U.S., Security & Monitoring, Camera Technology: excludes baby monitors, Wired Only, Based on dollar sales, Jan- Dec 2016

review_header_1: Overall very satisfied, slight issue with the signal on 1 2nd floor rear camera 22' away from the NVR
review_header_5: Easy to install and works well
review_text_1: So I tried another wireless security camera set before I tried night owl and unfortunately had to go through the huge hassle of removing another set and sealant I used to install a new set, the issue I had with the previous set was getting a decent signal from the rear camera I mounted on the 2nd floor & the NVR is located in the front of the house 1st floor. Well everything is set up now and running great! I did have a similar problem with this system as far as the 2nd floor rear camera getting a weaker signal but not as severe, the signal is 3 bars out of 4 which slightly takes away from the quality the camera records and displays at so I used the wired 6 foot antenna and hooked it up to the camera outside & sat the antenna on a dresser on the 2nd floor & the camera gets a much stronger signal now always displaying decent quality with -1 bar - full bars & there is never a missed second or drop out which is why I really like this set, I also want to note that the rear 2nd floor camera has a brick wall in between the home and the camera, I also have a camera mounted in the front of the house beyond a brick wall but that gets a full signal and is very clear just like the one located inside the home. I still occasionally get -1 bar on the signal leading to a slightly reduced quality on the 2nd floor rear camera but it never cuts out or misses a second. The NVR is packed with features and the mobile app is convenient and I love being able to monitor my home remotely while at work, the motion detection has a lot of customization which is nice since you can choose which areas to detect the motion & the sensitivity, also you can fiddle with the channel the wireless system operates on which may help the signal but I have not had time to get into that yet. I am very glad they included the 1 wired antenna so I could get the great picture I am getting on the 2nd floor rear camera because without it the signal was nearly poor quality, you may want to check the signal before sealing around the cameras to see if you may need to also use a wired antenna that is positioned inside but hooked into the outside camera, I did find they are sold on Amazon in case you need more then the 1 included with this set.The cameras are already synced with the NVR so there is no customization needed on the cameras, all you have to do is boot them up and you are good to go! The night vision is okay and easy enough to distinguish a face and figure of something but not from too far away. Overall I am satisfied with the cameras, the attached pictures are night time and it is very dark in the rear pictures, daytime video is very clear! I am attaching a picture of the motion activated rear camera earlier this morning, it is very clear!
review_text_2: I purchased these after trying out Xfinity home security system. Thank goodness they have a 30 day money back guarantee. Their night vision is useless!! Night Owl camera's are awesome. I had the Xfinity tech watch their video and the night owl - they were amazed. Plus Night Owl's camera system is cheaper and there are no monthly fee's!! I am a 62 yr old female and I was able to set up and install my own system. Just remember to "pair" your cameras with the NVR "before" you take them out and install them. üòÄ
review_text_3: I was concerned about purchasing system after reading reviews. I had a home consultant come out and he advised upgrading my Wi-Fi. Did that ordered the system, had to reset the cameras. (I did hold for 40 minutes til tech support got on with me walked me through it. Everything has worked great since. Great clarity phone app works great and I am pleased with the purchase.
review_text_4: I installed this in a dealership and it did exactly what I needed it too... motion sensor is great, 2 way audio is a bit laggy ( about 5 sec behind) image quality is great. I can easily zoom in or out as I wish. Set up was easy and install was easy as well. If you install the NVR behind a wall, don‚Äôt expect to reach the 100ft signal advertise ... no way it will. But dealership has glass windows and it worked perfectly. The night owl x app is user friendly. Easy set up... does what it‚Äôs needed to do.
review_text_5: Easy to install and works well. Sometimes I have a problem connecting using the mobile app but for the most part it does what you expect. I especially like the fact that the device stores video. I was particularly impressed with the night vision which actually works better than I expected!The only thing I would recommend is buying a couple additional cameras.
