review_header_1: Company stands behind what they sell
review_header_2: They look amazing, and have wide angles
review_header_4: The quality of the Cameras and DVRs and ease of setting up the system.
review_text_1: Had a small issue with my order that was promptly taken care of by company. Love the system which was easy to install and get up and running. Quality is top notch as picture quality surprised me in a very good way.
review_text_2: UPDATE July 2021] So everything is still working fine except for 1 camera is foggy. Only 2 cameras are directly in the rain, one now gets foggy, it's been foggy for at least 6 months already, so it was only in the rain for less than a year (I bought these December '19). I tried to clean it, but it was clean, but I could clearly see water drops behind the lens. I'm buying Honic 100-130 night vision with WDR that totally eliminates blowout. I bought one, and it's awesome, so I'm buying anothre ot replace the foggy camera. This is a great starter set because you get the DVR and lot's of cameras. Then you can replace or add really nice cameras to your setup. It owuld not be fair to compare these SMONET cameras to the HONIC. They are $53 each, so for 8 of them that would be $424 + DVR + hard drive.Manual Zoom would really help these 'get closr to the ground' and WDR would really help prevent blowout. Stronger IR blasters woudl help light up the ground/room for the night vision. But again, all of it is "good enough", and for houses, where you are probably gong to mount these closer to the ground,a dn have less to light up, it's fine. You can get IR flood lights to help, and since the DVR is 16 chanel, you can buy a PTZ camera and 7 WDR manual zoom cameras, and have no waste.[January 2020]They really pull in color much better than our old ones. This allows for more blowout with shadows vs the sun, but overall it looks much better. The DVR had weird color settings out of the box making the blowout worse. I moved everything to 50%, and it looks good. If anyone walks in frame, you can see them very well.Also, these only have 3 LED's, so the night mode is not very impressive lighting up the ground. BUT, I tested it, and if someone walks into frame, the LED's are strong enough to light them up.They have a bit of fisheye on the edges, but it's probably a good compromise. The distortion is very minimal in the middle, but these hit a much bigger area than our old cameras.I was worried about the 'lid' to keep the rain off because it's not adjustable and doesn't hang over the lens very far.¬†But I'm really pleased that no rain, snow, sleet, fog have gotten¬†on the lens. And we have experienced all of that in the first month of having them.¬†The pictures have remained really clear¬†Our last ones would¬†fog up from time to time.¬†2 tips:1. Do not connect these to your old power supply. I fried 2 of them, thinking the first one was a dud. The power supply was different, so we had to use the included power supplies.2. Email the email address in the instructions for the PC application, and ask for the one that is not Denali. Denali works great for your phone, but on the PC you can only view 4 cameras at once. The other program they sent (after I complained) lets you see all of them at once.1.b. If you have a multi-monitor setup, then move the program to the screen you want, then hover over the icon on your taskbar, right-click on the preview, and click maximize. That will allow you to maximize the window on the correct screen. Using the built-in maximize button will fullscreen on your main monitor, not the monitor you have the window on.If you want to be fancy, and add a camera that can move around, I added this camera to the DVR and it works great:SUNBA Outdoor PTZ Camera with RS485 Control (405-22X)After fiddling around with the settings a bunch and replugging everything in, I restarted the DVR, and it just worked!If you want better software, and more 'moving' cameras I think IP cameras are probably a better choice. But I have never bought that type and set it up. I have BNC coaxial cables running everywhere already.
review_text_3: Product is easy to install, compatible with my existing cameras. Haven't heard back from company why it needs my Gmail password to send messages. Or why Gmail says it's a danger and won't let it log in. Signed up for cloud backup and haven't see any recorded video. Half the time it says no recorded video on device then the other half I can play back remote. It took a while to get together because of the time difference but after getting together she was very helpful and problem is resolved.
review_text_4: I bought the security system to replace an old outdated system that I was currently using from another brand. I was able to use my original wiring and connected the new cameras to the wires and new DVR. I could not believe how vivid the color was and how well it picked up images in the dark and farther then my old camera system. I had one power source that to be replaced. With no fault of the system. Marvin at tech support asked if I would order another power source from Amazon and they would reimburse me for the cost. I ordered and received the power source and Marvin immediately contacted amazon to credit the money to my account. I am recommending this camera system to my friends and have no reservations that it is the best you can get for the money spent! A great investment. I give their customer support high rating for caring and acting quickly to resolve the minor issue.
review_text_5: This is perfect for our little retail business...can see what's happening indoors and outdoors when we're not there. I gave one less star because, not having knowledge about how any of this works, it wasn't exactly "easy" for me to install (after my husband did the dirty work of threading wires through the crawl-space and attic). But I always got a helpful response when I emailed the company, and they were able to walk me through to the end.

description: Proudly American, Night Owl is excited to offer our new U.S. designed and engineered 1080p Wire Free Smart Security System. Built-In Motion-Activated Spotlights, Human Detection Technology, and Unique Enhanced Security features provide you with everything you need to protect your home or business. The camera‚Äôs bright spotlight activates when it senses human motion, stopping trespassers in their tracks. Human Detection reduces false alerts to your Smart Device, while Facial Capture takes a snapshot of a person‚Äôs face and sends you a real-time alert. New to video security systems, 2-Step Verification and Single Sign-On prevent unverified access to your device, enhancing your security and privacy. Speaking of privacy, an independent secure wireless network provides real closed-circuit video security (CCTV) with uninterrupted viewing and recording of the 2-Way Audio enabled cameras. There are no fees for storage. Keep everything on the pre-installed HDD. You own your recordings! Being wire free makes for an easy installation. Plus, the battery cartridge releases from the camera‚Äôs base without affecting the mounting position, making it simple to recharge the batteries. Night Vision up to 40 ft. and a 100¬∞ wide-angle view provide extreme coverage for your home or business. For even more coverage, add compatible Night Owl Wi-Fi devices, including our AC Powered Wi-Fi IP cameras and HD Smart Doorbell. review_header_2: Recorded 2 dangerous situations within first 2 weeks
review_header_3: A great security camera system for the price.
review_text_1: I always want to have a security camera system in my house because I am a very busy working mother. Leaving 3 children with my babysitter always worries me even though my neighborhood is safe. After a long time researching, I decided to give this one a try. It comes with everything you would need even has a 1 TB hard drive. It took me 30 mins to install the whole system. With the instructions came with the package is not hard at all. The video is very clear easy to use. I connect with my phone so I can check on them anytime I want. It makes me feel much released. Even at night the view is very sharp . It seems very good quality. For less than 200 Dallas is a nice camera system!
review_text_3: This CCTV has features I was looking for which are usually found in more expensive system like motion detection on selected areas and push notification to my phone. 1080P Cameras with a 1TB Hard Drive and remote viewing for $200.00 is a great deal. The only negative thing I found was the NVR didn't have a remote so your force to the mouse to change selected camera.The installation went pretty easy other than routing the cable in the attic in difficult to reach location. Being a Technician I was able to install the cameras in the optimal location and fished cable in the wall to my entertainment center. Anyone not mechanically incline should hire someone to run the wires if you don't wires showing or wall fished.The setup of the cameras is very straight forward, follow the on-screen setup wizard and your done in 10 minutes.Tips:The weather boot protecting the ethernet connection to the camera is about 7/8 wide which means you'll need a 7/8 bit or a hole saw to route the cable in the attic or wall unless the cable entry is more than 12 inches away from the camera.One of my cameras is 120Ft away from the NVR so I ran my own ethernet cable and removed the weather boot from the provided cable and placed it on my cable before installing the connector. Worked perfectly.The last tip is having a second person makes the installation much easier. But if your doing it alone have the app installed and use that to help you adjust the camera angle.
review_text_4: I was going on a trip and we needed to monitor the business while away. Got this system and the equipment setup was a breeze. Pretty much did what I needed out of the box.The PC and mobile monitoring apps work great and I love the ability to customize the viewing sequences and the multi camera views. I am able to monitor the entire property from any of multiple locations, as well as customize to exclude inactive areas or the area in which that monitor is located, after all, if I'm in a room, I don't need to see that one on the screen and can view another additional area.Customer service is pretty good and certainly does their best to resolve any issues.Would I buy another system from them? At this point I can say, without a doubt!

review_header_3: OOSSXX The affordable solution backed by excellent Customer Service
review_header_4: Live video, realtime alarm ,2TB and weahterproof.
review_text_1: This is my first system & I'm very happy,I had a little bit of trouble at first setting up my phone(my screw up)but once I figured it out it was simple & everything is so easy to hook up there is no confusion. I went with the wired system becauseif you have to run a power cord for the wireless then why not get a wired system & have camers w/more then twice the megapixels also with being a POE system you only run 1 cord just like you would for the wireless & the wireless range is about the same as the length of cord you get.I would have liked 100ft of cord rather then 60ft but it's still worth the money & 2 TB memory is plenty & you can add 4TB more if needed.
review_text_2: Being my first surveillance system, I wasn't sure how hard it would be to set one up. I am a technical person and while I have never completed a wiring run or run wires through walls, I can say this is the hardest part about the setup. Once you get through this step, the rest of the setup is easy.I have done much research and through my research, I have always found experts and in general, people who own a camera system, say it is better to have a wired system vs wireless. While I will not talk about all the benefits, a few are not worrying about batteries, wireless security, and it affecting your network performance. After running the cables to the this DVR, their setup was very easy and simple. Although a few of their menus to navigate around the different settings looks complicated (they have lots of features), they take you step by step to configure your cameras the way you would like.Out of all the features my favorites are being able to select which areas of the camera you would like for the camera to ignore motion and for the cameras to actually be a deterrent system. For example, if you setup a camera for your front door to record when there is motion, you can set it to ignore any motion from cars passing by (a very nice addition).¬†¬†Being a 4k surveillance system the picture is fantastic. The cameras are rated for 30 feet of night vision and I can certainly say they can reach that while still having clear picture. After 30 feet, it starts to get grainy but depending on how you setup your cameras another camera can compensate for that area.Overall, I can definitely recommend this system to anyone looking to setup a surveillance system for the first time or if you already have one. Setup is easy, picture is great, and can even deter a thief with a siren if it ever comes to it!
review_text_3: After years with a low cost solution that worked except at a critical moment where my neighbors car was stolen and the culprit walked on to my driveway to check our vehicles. Trying to lookback at the recording, the hard drive in the old system had crashed and no recording was available. The camera's and the floodlights chased the culprits away, but still would have been nice to have this on camera.After comparing a number of solutions in various price ranges settled on the 8 channel 4 camera package from OOSSXX . Prime delivered the system quick and prior to mounting the camera's in position hooked up the system on the test bench to make sure that everything worked. Using an Comcast XFI router the first challenge was to make sure that the camera's would get the correct IP addresses.The Comcast XFI router does not allow you to reserve IP addresses so setting fixed IP addresses for each camera is not an option so you need to use the "automatic" option to make it work. (This is not a shortcoming of OOSSXX, but a Comcast issue they apparently fail to address despite many complaints for this exact reason where you prefer to have fixed IP addresses for devices.)However the automatic solution works to get all the camera's connected every time following a Comcast initiated network modem reset.During the day all looked to work properly but after it turned dark, on one of the camera's would the Infrared LED''s would not turn on, the Camera switched to night mode but without the LED's there was a completely dark picture only the part where the Infrared LED's from another camera overlapped the picture was clear.I contacted the customer service department both by phone (during the weekend) and left a voicemail and emailed their service department . On Monday I received both a call back from them and an email from the service department. They gave some suggestions to test and after confirming these steps they shipped a replacement camera. I expected to have to wait for weeks to have the replacement, but 2 day's later it was delivered by Amazon. That replacement apparently got knocked around during transport and had a problem, but once again their tech support team responded immediately and a new replacement arrived 2 days later. During this process their technical team stood behind their product, kept in touch and provided better service than I have seen in a long time.As these are POE camera's and they all are on the same network, I was even able to add some of the camera's from my old system by simply leaving them connected to the old NVR for power (the old camera's use a different voltage) and I am able to record 8 channels of Video.Using the EseeCloud app on my phone I have access to the camera's from anywhere in the world.Bottom line, while the NVR might be similar to some of the other brands (or unbranded versions) but the customer service sets them apart from all the others. If I read the feedback regarding some of the large names out there, OOSSXX is miles ahead of those companies.On price versus performance, OOSSXX is the best possible option for a POE based solution
review_text_4: My neighborhood is getting overcrowded and I can always see strange people near my house. So I decided to invest some money in safety. This OOSSXX POE security camera system got the 4K 8-Channel NVR box and 5Mp cameras. The setup took me 35 mins by following the manual which is comprehensive and easy to follow through. I like the fact that the cameras are weatherproof and sturdy. They are able to camera video footage at such sharp resolution. The motion sensor is a plus, I can get an immediate alarm from the app when it detects any movement. I can also check my house by watching live footage from my phone. The 2TB storage is more than enough.
review_text_5: I shopped around for a week before I selected this system and I'm happy with my purchase. This is truly a Plug-And-Play setup. The cameras have good infrared night vision. Playback and saving video to a thumb drive is straight-forward. These cameras DO have microphones. You can set to record sound from only one camera though. The notion detection is adjustable for both sensitivity and what area of the screen is monitored. I had questions about the system both before and after purchase. I received answers in a timely manner both times. You can monitor live or playback from a PC on your network. I do not connect to it remotely from outside my home network so I can't comment on the smartphone app. *A few tips for installation & setup* Get a "security camera junction box" for spots where you cannot complete the connection inside through a wall. The junction box will contain the cable end and connectors and make for a cleaner-looking installation. When setting up the record schedule, I set it to record both by time and detection. That is all 24 hours selected for both modes. That way you can see what triggers the detection and what doesn't, without missing anything. I have had the 4 camera system running that way for almost 3 weeks and the 2Gb HD is about half full.

review_text_2: This CCTV set is surprisingly pretty well built for the cost. The data compression really helps with the 8 channel feed and allows you to forget about it for a while.Pros:- Fairly cheap for a 8 channel digital set-up- Good PTZ capabilities- Fair storage cap- Good data compressionEh-Night vision is pretty good, but lacks some depth. Still, worth the costBad- Cable lengths included might be sufficient for a small shop, but generally a 8ch system with PoE will need longer cables. An option of with or without cables would be beneficial for those with a larger area needed to be covered.- This might be sufficient for a small store or home, but for a business, this is not your best option. Please invest money into a good CCTV system (a professional grade 8ch CCTV set would run $1000+).TL;DR - Good set for the pricing, but if you are looking for a long-term solution and a high quality product, this won't be it. This is meant for small operations and doesn't make the cut for professional grade.
review_text_3: This camera system arrived with 8 Cameras and one was bad. I contacted ANNKE support and they were very helpful. I now have the 8th camera. The photo attached is a view on my phone showing 7 cameras. We keep the 8th one in reserve for when we go on trips and use it inside the house. We have a house alarm system also so the camera system is nice when the alarm goes off and calls us. We can then tell false alarms and reset the alarm system without returning home.
review_text_4: Installation was easy.The setup seems a little overly complicated, but everything works as it's supposed to.Super clear pictures on the Monitor / TV the system is hooked up to through HDMI cable.The picture quality on the phone through the app is ok.Have not contacted tech support yet.It's been running for about two weeks now, hoping that it'll continue to do so in the long run.It's not a cheap system - we went with the NVR as an upgrade to replace our Q-See system.
review_text_5: Honestly I did a lot of review fact checking when I bought this. First was operation and customer service, cause you all know we will need help on this type of thing.First thing we had a previous camera at our barn it is 310 feet from house it did not work. This system took a little time but it connected and has been stable for a month.Second they provide water tight connections for what they provide and also if you wire your own wire.... this is awesome I wired all cat 6.Third the night vision is on point. I don‚Äôt know how it works but there is not 30 diodes that is visible at night. They have two small led you can see at night. It works great....Finally the customer service... I had a new camera that was on house and somehow the lenses broke. I contacted them on a Saturday it is now Wednesday and they have a new camera coming I paid shipping. They did not wait 2 weeks to contact back, I feel this is a great company to work with.

review_header_1: 5mp video quality is excellent. Worth it
review_header_5: decent package - Steve from Customer support is great.
review_text_1: I have purchased the 8 channel 5mp POE video surveillance system and I am happy with it.The camera system has an internal storage space of 1tb which is very convenient.I have the cameras recording 24/7 and found that the weekly overwrite on the NVR (due to space limitations) was too quick for my needs.Installed POE via NVR to camera with cat 5e cable and installation is easy. Basically, plug and play.If the cables will be installed outside I recommend using exterior direct burial cat6 cable because the cables that are included are for interior applications. What I really liked was the fact that you are able to view it TV to nvr , and computer and cell phone via cat 5/6 internet connection from nvr to router. There is also live view and playback features.There are no monthly security company fees which is great. There are also lots of settings for motion detection, sensitivity, motion detection zones, email alerts, and app alerts. The night vision is also acceptable it helps a lot to have lighting in the viewing area.Customer service was also top notch. I had a small issue with one of the cameras. Betty helped and replaced it with zero problems. The response time was swift and all in all I cannot complain about the system. It‚Äôs well worth the money and the picture quality, playback and features are excellent.This home security system has met or exceeded nearly all my wishes and expectations.
review_text_2: The whole system is working great. The only issue I had was 2 out of 4 cameras build condensation inside the lens... I tried contacting support I supplied proof a few weeks ago and have yet to hear anything back about it. I am a little upset about it as it was a christmas present for my father...UPDATE: from 3 star to 5 star.Smonet honored their warrenty and replaced both cameras with little hassle... I even got to keep the faulty ones. That is good business right there...
review_text_3: For my money, this SMONET¬†5MP security system is the absolute best in its class. Installation and setup are quick and easy, and the image quality is crisp and sharp day or night.¬†Installation was straightforward. This is a PoE (Power over Ethernet) system, so I pulled¬†the new CAT¬†5e¬†cables. I made up a plywood drill guide to accurately drill the screw and cable holes in my soffits. With the cameras installed and the CAT5 cables in place, all that's left is to hook up the NVR.¬†Since I usually live-view or playback when I'm away from home, the app is a crucial component.¬†The phone app is excellent. The app also supports remote control PTZ (pan/tilt/zoom) cameras if you decide to add one or more to your system. The system comes with 4 PoE cameras, but the NVR supports up to 8, so you have room to upgrade.¬†The playback feature is also excellent. It's quick and easy to navigate to the time period you want to replay. Simply tap the date and then select the time block (the recordings are saved in roughly 1-hour blocks). Drag the slider to find the exact period you want to replay, then tap the camera icon for a still photo or the movie icon to start recording video. I do wish there was a 30 second skip forward/back option, as this would make finding the exact moment of interest a little easier. Photos and videos are saved to local storage, you can playback video from hard drive remotely anytime anywhere.¬†The system also supports push alerts to your phone. You can choose which cameras to send alerts and choose the portions of their fields of view to ignore so as to reduce false alarms. The motion detection is very sensitive, so I'd recommend selecting only the key ares, like your front steps and mailbox lid. Alerts are almost instantaneous.¬†In conclusion, I would recommend this product to friends, family, and co-workers. The ease of installation is incredible, simply plug and play. If you have to through walls, or into the attic, well, that up to the home owner and has nothing to do with plug and play features
review_text_4: I really wanted to like the system. After a really hard, time consuming 4 days labor to run cables through the attic I finally got the system working. 3 weeks in, everything was working great with all 8 cameras. Then, the horror! Suddenly instead of displaying my 8 cameras on the screen like it used to, it started showing me a 9th spot with an ipc disconnect message. It was a bit annoying, but since I could still see all of my 8 cameras, I didn't let that bother me too much. 2 weeks later, aug 1st, 2020, the menu language just change to chinese, out of the blue. Now I only have visual on 6 of my cameras, 2 of them are dead. There's no way to even attempt to fix anything, as everything is in Chinese now on the screen. Very disappointed with this one. Picture quality is very good, but as for as the software running the system, it's a complete nightmare. Don't make the mistake I made buying this one.Update 8/12/2020Support was right on the ball. They reached out to me and got the language fix and the cameras are back working normally. It looks like it takes time to reply, about 24 to 48 hours. That's why I updated my rating.
review_text_5: Decent camera system that allows you to build a better system around the NVR. Cameras are lower end but they get the job done especially if you're not using the motion detection. The cameras appear to not have built in motion sensors. This works ok if you have a background that's mostly static. However, add in a tree and some wind and you're getting 99+ alerts in a few hours time. The Cameras infrared LEDs are faint but still visible attracting bugs at night causing even more false alarms.The NVR is Onvif compatible and *may* support add on cameras. Since purchase I have added a few extra cameras of better quality and the NVR works with them after a little configuration. Also note I was able to capture the camera's RTSP stream from ZoneMinder so you can tweak the motion detection a little further if you like.This is not a bad system especially if you're recording 24/7 and not concerned about motion detection. The NVR works out of the box with the included cameras and mostly stays out of your way when adding 3rd party Onvif Cameras.

review_header_2: Heavy Duty Cameras built to last.
review_header_3: So far so good. This system is a WINNER!
review_header_5: I am very happy with this camera system
review_text_1: I purchased this system after reviewing other comparable security systems. For 4k cameras, a 3tb hard drive and all of this on an 8 channel poe nvr, the value really can't be matched. After a couple weeks with the system, here is what I've found:NVR:It's similar to other security system software that is on the market. There are a few things worth mentioning, though.1) While going through picture setting adjustments for cameras, some of the settings are shown, but if you click to adjust them, it does not allow you to change. This is minor and most other picture adjustment settings are possible. Little things like this should be easily fixed with a firmware update.2) This is the biggest one for me. These 4k cameras and the nvr are capable of extra features like human detection, barrier crossing, etc... There are even sections of the nvr where you can go to adjust these settings; however, the nvr says these features are not available for the cameras when actually going to the respective settings pages. I reached out to Hiseeu about this and they were very quick to respond. These may be updated in a firmware update at some point. I really think these features should be working by default, but basic motion zones and detection are working so I can't justify deducting a star. Hopefully there's a firmware update coming soon to fix/add these items.CamerasThese are surprisingly good cameras. Picture is slightly washed during very bright portions of the day, butthis can probably be corrected with further tinkering of picture settings. I like how there's audio on these cameras. Keep in mind that 4k 8mb can run at 15fps max. This isn't an issue though because it will let me run them at ~25 fps at 6mb setting, which is basically one step down from 4k.OverallFor the price, these are a no brainier. I've used other (mainstream) brands and the camera quality and software was no better than Hiseeu. In fact, I've been more impressed with Hiseeu. For my needs, this system fits the bill just fine. Very pleased with the purchase.Note to manufacturer:Please provide updated firmware to fix the camera settings and enable the advanced detection settings (human, barrier, etc...).Review is based off:Hiseeu 4K PoE Security Camera System, 8CH 8MP Home Video Surveillance DVR Kit with 3TB Hard Drive
review_text_2: This system is very nice. When you pick up one of these cameras you know immediately that its a high quality device. You will want to mount these securely and not just into drywall with drywall screws. Use the provided mounting screws. The photos are the live feed on my iPhone 8+ which isn't anywhere near as high quality as when viewed on my 4k monitor. But these are on my phone showing live action from over 30 miles away from the building. Some of the views are washed out because they point towards the front windows but I use them in the evening when the facility is open and it is lit overhead with lights. I'll post another picture of the 4 way view later.The support people are amazing. The only thing is they are available in the evening but they respond instantly and are very helpful. I will purchase more cameras from them if I decide if I need more views in my facility. You can't go wrong with this system. I love the power over ethernet for the cameras. If you buy this you will be happy with your purchase. I'm a 65 yr old and am very picky with products I've purchased. I've returned so much stuff I've not been happy with but not this system. 5 stars.
review_text_3: This systems has all the features of the more expensive brands and more. I have an ARLO system at home and the Hiseeu system blows it out of the water! The image quality is just superb UHD (day and night). I no longer have to rely on sensor recorded segments, missing most of the event I wanted to look at. With the Hiseeu it records 24/7 and marks whatever triggers the sensor. I just need to install 3 cameras at home. So far I have only tested one camera. I will update this review once all cameras are installed and running. Did I mention custmer srvc is also outstanding?
review_text_4: I had in my home a CCTV system that has some years. I was looking for an upgrade and noticed that 4k NVRs are trending now. When I compared the specs of this Hiseeu against other brands out there I noticed that this product met and sometimes exceeded the same specifications but it was less expensive.Although I was skeptical, I bought it and installed the system by myself. In a nutshell, this system is by far way more advanced than the one I had that costed me almost the same several years ago.Things that I like are:1. 4k quality picture is way more clear and cover a lot of space.2. Night vision is spectacular. At the beginning I thought I had a light on in my backyard as it looked very bright but that is how the camera actually works.3. It has an integrated microphone. This is a game changer as it not only gives you eyes but ears as well. This is very convenient specially when unusual activities are happening near outside your home.4. Hard drive is huge; no concerns about storage.5. Camera construction feels superior when compared to others I have; metal construction, heavy and solid.For me, I'm extremely happy with this product. In my opinion, this is a great buy and the price is hard to beat.
review_text_5: I have owned several camera systems in the past, with this one, I am really impressed with the sharp picture quality which is far better than any camera system I've ever used before. Also tech support by email was very responsive and friendly when I needed some help initially. They answered all emails by the next morning. They also provided me with a firmware update and it solved a problem I had, after I installed the firmware update, the system worked perfectly. It is nice to see that they provide support if you need help. There are certainly other security camera manufacturers who don't provide support on anything, although I won't name names.Set up is pretty straight forward, the instructions are easy to follow. After you set it up, you can view the cameras either with an HDMI monitor or TV connected directly to the NVR, a web browser on your local area network, a smartphone app called Guard Viewer, or the desktop computer version of the app called Guard Viewer. (These apps are free downloads). I like how the cameras use Ethernet cables instead of how older style camera systems operate with coax cable with a power cord for every camera. I also like how the hard drive is 3 TB which is a lot, storage space is therefore not an issue, and I like how the cameras record sound too. I just record everything 24 hours a day, and when there is motion detected in a recording, you can find it pretty easily in your app, because the timeline you scroll through notes motion with a different color than no motion. I like how there are no fees of any kind to access your own cameras remotely. Apparently this system can be expanded to up to 8 cameras if you want as well. Overall, I think this is a great value. I am looking forward to many years of use.

features: ,,4K Ultra HD ‚Äì Reolink 4K Ultra HD (8MP) PoE camera delivers almost 4 times the clarity of 1080p. Our complete camera system provides users vivid resolution, even when you digitally zoom in. Any flaw or distortion you‚Äôve encountered before has been eliminated, ensuring you the highest quality view of your surroundings.,Person/Vehicle Detection ‚Äì Smart PoE IP cameras can identify people and vehicles in terms of their shapes, minimizing unwanted alerts such as animals or shadows. Cameras can also be configured to specify the type of detection when sending alerts to you. Know what happened simply by glancing at the lock screen.,Plug and Play PoE System ‚Äì A simple PoE connection makes it easier to set-up and install your home security camera system. With a single network cable, stretching up to 330ft, users can enjoy smooth security coverage of their entire house. name: REOLINK 4K Security Camera System, 4pcs H.265 PoE Wired Turret 4K Cameras with Person Vehicle Detection, 4K/8MP 8CH NVR with 2TB HDD for 24-7 Recording, RLK8-820D4-A
review_header_1: Great System for a Small Business
review_header_3: Nice system for under a grand.
review_text_1: For reference I have worked in I.T. for over two decades and have installed security DVRs before. But I honestly believe anyone with the ability to follow simple instructions and capable of minor troubleshooting should find this system very easy to install and use. This is the first DVR I've set up that provides POE to the cameras via the built-in switch. This greatly simplifies and cleans up the installation. Many of the problems I see in these reviews can be fixed via simple troubleshooting. I haven't actually had to contact Reolink support so I can't really comment on how available or helpful they are. I just wanted to point out a few of the negative things I've seen posted and offer a few tips/explanations.Cameras/Channels cutting out - When you're running your cables in the ceilings and walls, steer clear of electrical interference. Don't let the network cables touch existing wiring or things like light fixtures. Also avoid heat - like ductwork if at all possible. This can all mess with any kind of network traffic and especially 4K video feeds. It can certainly be more difficult, especially if you've never run wiring before but it is definitely worth the extra effort to route the cables properly.Complaints about video quality - I can verify this NVR absolutely records in 4K. The streams that you watch on your phone/PC/monitor are reduced quality for performance purposes. Even the "Clear" setting isn't near 4K. To access the full 4K video, you have to download the recorded files. This too can get confusing because unless your computer/device has a 4K GPU, you may not be able to play the files with a native media player. I installed this unit at a satellite office out of town and have not exported any files directly from the NVR but I have downloaded files remotely. These files are typically 1 to 3 GB in size. To edit or crop the videos, you will need a video editor capable of working with 4K video. This also allows you to remove the slight fisheye effect of the wide angle lenses if desired. The clarity of the video is outstanding for a system in this price-range. Frame captures are near photographic quality if you have good lighting. All of that said, if you do not have the resources to actually work with 4K video, I highly recommend setting the cameras to a more manageable resolution like 1080P. The files are smaller and just about any modern computer can work with them. These settings can be adjusted and you can change them back at any time.Complaints about outdated software - I'm not sure where this is coming from. The apps for mobile devices are as good if not better than those we've used and continue to use for more traditional DVRs. The Windows app works perfectly as well. I have no complains whatsoever. Perhaps if you're having trouble viewing the feeds, the upload speeds at the location of the NVR may not be sufficient for the resolution settings you're using.Limited camera positions - the cameras are tight in their housings but you can rotate and tilt them within the housing. You do need to install the plate close to the angle you want but someone reported that it has to be perfect and that's simply not true. If you're way off you would run into problems but I would guess you have maybe 15 to 20 degrees of play in either direction.Overall I am impressed with the quality of this system. The video is excellent quality and the night vision works great as well. Again, I have no complaints so far. I just ordered two more cameras to add to our current installation. If anything changes and we begin to have problems I will definitely be back to add to this review.
review_text_2: Dynamite camera. I'm using the power over ether POE and so less cables to run outside. The 4K video is outstanding. We had some loser keep hacking our wireless cameras and so this NVR is perfect. I'm personally not hooking mine up to the router either since sending the mothership manufacturer information is probably a possibility too. The video software is easy to learn even without reading any manuals. Exporting video to a thumb drive for archive is easy. I'm not using the phone app or wepage connection so don't know about those (heard one used flash video which is not secure)Things that might shock you 1) The mounting turret is more like a key, make sure the camera is pointed the right way on it before mounting the bracket/turret the camera sits on - no problem. 2) The DVR doesn't allow you to delete videos....ever! Really makes sense after you think about it. Conversely after less than one month your hard drive will be full and it will write back on top of itself....so get anything interesting off that hard drive or upgrade size hard drive.The rain season here hasn't started but the book says not to submerge the cameras but the YouTube videos show it being sprayed down (suspiciously without an RJ45 connection). So far so good Reolink !
review_text_3: Quality budget system. I have 5 cameras setup so far and it's very clear. App is easy to use. Windows client app is robust and supports PTZ. App allows up to 4x speed. Windows client allows up to 16x. Lots of color and contrasts settings to play with. Night mode is very clear.Cons: HDD is too small. (5 cameras filled it in 6 days). I replaced it very easily with a 4TB drive. Operating system must be built into the board so you don't even need to reinstall software just format the drive via their software.App fails to play video on 1st click sometimes but that could be my network connection.Can only download 30s clips via mobile app.Motion sensors are turned down to 15 and I still get alerts for bugs flying in front of the camera. Maybe a future firmware upgrade could allow a setting for where the ground/floor is?Lenses sometimes fog in high humidity (pre rain)
review_text_4: The system works and setup was not bad at all. I would give the company a recommendation. It works great for a security system with a NVR. However when its in a traditional security setup, you can't use the cameras for any "fun projects", like time lapse recordings (either ahead of need, or from the recorded feed).Also the NVR sits in a closet. I would expect all control and MAINTENANCE could be from the PC app. But this is not the case, you can update the firmware of the NVR from your PC, but the firmware of the cameras has to be done locally on the NVR. This requires you to still download the firmware on a PC to a flash drive, then on the NVR you need a local monitor, and control is only via a mouse. Ugh. Make all updates be from my desk please, also make them "Auto".And firmware is not simple, you got a hardware version and a software version to deal with. Lot of number matching. Just remember you need to update the PC/Client software, the NVR software, and the camera software all through different processes. That is a complaint. I have not done the cameras yet (I got 6, with with 3 different values of HW/SW tags) as it just seems painful.
review_text_5: This is the third system I have bought, returned the first two. They were wireless and did not work at distances they said they would work, not even close. The second one had 2 bad cameras out of 4 - tired of being QA for these sloppy companies. How do they make a buck with all the returns? This is a wired system, poe (power over ethernet). A bit of a hassle to run wires, but the wireless needed power so you are either running extension cords or ethernet cables. The ethernet cables are probably easier and then no worries about distance. NVR worked, software is fairly intuitive, I have had no problems. The 4K resolution is great, but the wide angle makes everything pretty small. It would be nice to adjust viewing angle, it would be nice to daisy chain cameras.

name: Hiseeu 5MP PoE Security Camera System,8PCS 5MP IP Security Camera for Indoor Outdoor,with 3TB Hard Drive,Face/Human Detect,2-Way Audio Support,H.265+ Surveillance NVR Kit
review_header_1: Easy setup and great quality, included wiring with waterproof connectors a plus.
review_header_4: Great system at a great price, Tech Support is top notch!
review_text_1: Very nice camera system for the price, customer service very helpful and responsive. Had an issue with one of the cams, seller was very prompt to resolve problem. Would definitely recommend.
review_text_2: I was gonna give it 4 stars for the fact that the FOV is narrow, but I needed 3 in front anyway for my walkway.I have to use 3 cameras just to cover my front yard, which is where both of my vehicles are parked.The audio can only be on one camera at a time so I keep it on the middle one.It has tripwire, along with perimeter and zone coverage for the alarm.Some might not like the fact that it only goes up and down for adjustment, so ya will have to play with the camera mounts to spin it around to get the right angle, so for now if its mounted its just straight out the front.I don't know why Hiseeu put the mounts on upside down, I had to turn them all around, because when you mount the camera you was the cable output hole to be at the bottom, so rain or moisture can not get into the base mount,All in all these are pretty good cameras.For now I have the cables hidden on the awning of my porch because I wanted to make sure they would work good, next I am going to add conduit boxes to each camera and stash all new cables inside each one connecting each box via pvc pipe, this was its nice and clean and the thieves cant cut the wires easily.I was hoping to find turret cameras on hiseeus' website but all they have atm is bullets.I will post any updates to these but so far I am liking them, just had to google a few times to find help on setting the security up.Update 8 Dec 2020If you wanted to be able to back up your video and watch on your pute well then do not buy this system.Recording at .265 it saves the backup as 1: .H265 2: AVI 3: MP4None of which are actual video files.I tried and have a 800m file of each type and cant watch any of them and no conversion info, they put a codec file on your flash drive when you do the back up and windows says TOO OLD CANT USE.So now do I wanna take these back down and send them back since they dont do the job well or just say to heck with it and make a blue iris setup for these.Last night I also have a ir failure for some reason, at 3:22 AM the Ir went out and I got the alarm, and then a min later I hear a click on the video and the ir is back, all the other cams were OK.Update 14 Dec 2020If you need to download a video i have found out that the app they have ya use is perfect for it, I can download my videos to my phone then just copy them to my computer for editing.Stay tuned for more updates.
review_text_3: Very easy to install especially if you have attic access. I mounted the cameras on the soffit so I simply drilled a one inch hole in the soffit and pushed the camera wiring through then screwed the camera in place. I put the unit in an out of the way closet to make it harder for thieves to find but I wanted a moniter in my living room over the front door so I bought a cheap monitor for the closet by the unit for when I need to review footage. I got a 60' HDMI cable to run from the closet to the monitor over the front door and added a HDMI splitter so I could have both monitors active at the same time. The included CAT cables were more than long enough and the cameras power also runs through the cable so just a quick connection to the camera and the unit and you good to go. I have not connected to the internet (I have to run a cable from my modem to the unit) but will do so soon.Very happy with the system. Cameras have a good picture and the face capture is a nice touch. It does record sound on each camera but is only available on playback as far as I can tell but thats fine. Face capture does not seem to work well on night vision but the cameras do so I don't see that as a real issue. I will buy this again for any future houses I buy.Update: I figured out how to get sound to play live. You have to mouse click the sound icon on the screen to turn on/off sound while live viewing. Sound will still record for all cameras for playback.
review_text_4: After our cars were broken into, it became necessary that we needed a security system in case another incident occurred. I didn't want to spend thousands on a system that required a monthly subscription or extra "add-ons" to make the user experience better (translated as pay for their marketing dept). After a lot of research and reviews, this system was exactly what we needed. The camera images are clear (including night vision) and are simple to view them on our TV and phones. After checking the cameras to make sure they worked properly and then ran the provided Ethernet cables to it's final destination, the cameras were simply plug and play, since the cables provide power to the cameras too. I also don't have to worry about changing batteries or a weak WIFI signal using this system.Initially, I was having an issue connecting the DVR to our internet, and after an email to their help desk, Kiki from Hiseeu quickly responded with not only the correct troubleshooting information, but went above and beyond to make sure we were taken care of. They even offered to video chat with me to ensure everything went smooth. Talk about great customer service! I highly recommend this system and Hiseeu!
review_text_5: I‚Äôve had two NightOwl and two ZOSI systems in the past but was plagued with problems on each one. But this Hiseeu is fantastic and addresses every one of the complaints I had with those other security systems.1 Setup was simple and straightforward, a pure plug and play setup. No complicated networking setup, just scan the barcode and plug in the cameras and your ready to go.2 The POE is great. No need to run separate power cables, just the one Ethernet cable.3 The picture quality is superb, being able to recognize faces even when the subject is small on the screen.4 I like being able to set up each camera differently. We are living in the jungle of Costa Rica and I wanted to be able to use motion detection on most of the cameras and spot the exotic wildlife passing by, yet one camera is just on our entry gate and I have face detection set up on that particular one.5 So far the DVR is much more dependable than any of the other systems I‚Äôve used. On but the NightOwl and the ZOSI I had frequent problems and would have to reboot the systems. It‚Äôs no fun when you‚Äôre on vacation in another country and you can‚Äôt monitor your property because the DVR needs a reboot. At this point I‚Äôve been up and running for 5 weeks and the system has been going nonstop with no need to reset anything.6 The mobile app is infinitely better than any of the others I‚Äôve used. It is very intuitive for remote replay. And the start and stop are well timed to not use up much hard drive space. Usually I can review the entire night on one camera in around five minutes because the video starts and ends when the action starts and ends.So without a doubt I would recommend and already have recommended this system to others and I would purchase it again if looking for a DVR.(SIX MONTH UPDATE Nov.2, 2021)I recently had my farthest camera (about 200 feet distance) stop working. I texted the customer service and they suggested how to check the camera. It was clear from the test that the camera had gone bad for whatever reason. I wrote it off as one of those things that just happen. The next morning I received an email from KiKi that they had already sent out a new camera to replace it. I have never seen customer service like that. Without a doubt they have my business forever, especially with their great product. I‚Äôve now purchased one of their solar PZT cameras and will leave a review when I get the chance to install it.And by the way, 6 months later the system is still working perfectly, with not a single stop nor need to reboot the system. Take my experience with four previous systems from other companies. These are the best.

features: ,,5MP SUPER HD & STUNNING NIGHT VISION: Capture crystal clear videos day & night with 5MP super HD cameras. The 18pcs infrared LEDs allow you to get high-quality night vision up to 100ft, helping you to protect your property even at night.,PLUG & PLAY POE SYSTEM: With a single network cable, you can connect each IP camera to Reolink NVR for both power supply and video transmission, making the installation easy enough for DIY enthusiasts and beginners.,CUSTOMIZED MOTION DETECTION: Featuring detailed detection settings, the Reolink system allows you to adjust the sensitivity level, area and recording schedule of the detection, thus decrease some potential false alarms and help you enjoy peace of mind day & night.,ENHANCED VIDEO RECORDING: Thanks to the built-in mic of Reolink cameras, the system can pick up ambient sound and help to add another layer of security despite the reliable 24/7 continuous recording.,2-YEAR LIMITED WARRANTY: Reolink provides a two-year warranty and lifetime technical support for our customers. name: REOLINK 16CH 5MP Home Security Camera System, 8pcs Wired 5MP Outdoor PoE IP Cameras, 4K 16CH NVR with 3TB HDD for 24-7 Recording, RLK16-410B8-5MP
review_header_2: They were good enough to catch a theif.
review_text_1: I installed the Reolink NVR package with eight cameras-- then added six more a la carte, including one WiFi camera for an area where we couldn't run Cat 5e cable.Instead of a home run from each camera back to the NVR, I bought four TP-Link PoE switches (great product) and connected the cameras in clusters of 3, 4 and 6 cameras each. A couple of cameras closest to the NVR are on a home run. Those cameras connect to two of the PoE jacks in the back of the NVR and the rest come in on a single LAN jack, which includes the one WiFi camera. It works great.There is almost no documentation included with the products so I went to the Reolink website. It's unbelievably bad...as if it's been written with Google translate. The system is pretty much plug-and-play, but if you run into any issues you're kind of on your own to figure it out. Suggestion for Reolink: You've created a nice product; spend a few bucks and hire an English-speaking editor to clean up your website. Example: One of your staff contributors said sharing cameras via a switch is a great solution-- another said it's not recommended for more than two cameras. I've got six cameras coming in on one switch at full resolution and they look great.I've revised my original four-star review to five stars because the equipment is so good and everything works well once it's set up properly.
review_text_3: Bought the Reolink 16 channel NVR and its pretty much a plug and play operation. The night vision is more clear than I expected and the daytime 5MP is a very sharp imageMy NVR worked flawlessly for 6 months, then I had a problem cause it wouldn't boot up properly. I was very skeptical cause the only way to contact Customer service is through "e-mail only" So I had very little expectation of getting any help..... But they always responded promptly and there was messages from them the next morning when I checked. After a couple of messages............... They 100% resolved my problems to my full satisfaction.When I expand my security system at my warehouses .For sure Ill purchase Reolink equipment again.............. Its good equipment but what really stands out to me is the "excellent customer service" and their desire to solve my issues (even though the contact is thru email) Its a reliable company and based on my experience I would recommend them 100%As a result of the cameras I was able to catch two men in the act of breaking and entering and stealing. and what satisfaction !!!
review_text_4: We've now had this system on our business for 2 years. Never have we had a problem with any portion of this system... it's quite actually been a plug & play operation for us. The install was the toughest job, and only then because we were building our own cables to accommodate exterior applications (UV/buriable outdoor cable) and very long/difficult cable pulls between stories and rooms of our building. Our cameras have now experienced two very cold winters in snow and ice, but most commonly see rain (in OR. state) with a few short months of good sunshine. They have all worked flawlessly. No complaints. The night vision is quite impressive on even just the RLC410 units. We've also got an RLC423, RLC511, and a few others. Each camera has performed admirably. All thumbs up to the folks at Reolink for producing such an affordable product that is also incredibly well built and versatile.My only ONLY grip is that when/if you wish to speak to a customer support person on the phone and ask direct questions in real time... there doesn't seem to be a way to pull that off. Instead its a string of email Q&A with their support staff that can drag on for days to answer one otherwise simple question.On the plus side... their staff is very helpful, though it's clear that English isn't their native tongue. Some of the replies are kinda cryptic and some of my questions need to be asked in another fashion, in order to be addressed. But I'm not hating. Just wishing I could actually speak to some guy named chuck that sounds just like I do.
review_text_5: The easiest software I have ever had the pleasure of working with. I have installed several systems from different manufacturers. I won't get into the name dropping here but from a system installer perspective, Reolink has very solid and easy to follow software. The hardware is just as impressive. I installed 12 cameras at my house without any issues. The attached picture really does not show the amount of detail these cameras display. The attached picture is a screenshot from my phone. I have had them up and running for 2-weeks now with no problems. As others have mentioned the motion detection is somewhat sensitive, but I would prefer this to be the case. The night viewing is impressive with great black and white clarity. The phone app (Android for me) is just as well thought out as the NVR software. I would not have any problem recommending Reolink to anyone that needs a IP camera system.

review_text_1: Remarkable performance overall. I'm very pleased of the amazing coverage, clarity, notification settings options, night vision, and recording capability; purchase price not cheap; however, the price is worth/reasonable based on the quality of the product; I definitely recommend this camera security system 100%!
review_text_2: Love the set up procedures, easy, and quick, The color is awesome, night vision is very good. The wider view area than the previous camera system is a definite bonus. Setting up the motion areas is a little challenging, trying to not respond every time a car goes down the street.The only complaint is only one person, using the app, can view the cameras remotely at a time, and we have to share the account, so only one email address and/or password, wish at least two people were able to view the cameras and get alerts from the system without having to use my user ID and password
review_text_3: The system arrived in very sturdy and well organized packaging. The camera quality and performance is top notch. My son had purchased a different system a few months ago and was very impressed with the quality of the Lorex system. I am very pleased with the sharpness and clarity of the cameras and system. The angle of view is excellent. This was a big investment and I am very satisfied with the quality. I can recommend Lorex without reservation.
review_text_4: These cameras are fantastic! The night and day view is so clear. No mistaking the images captured.
review_text_5: So far so good! Picture quality is excellent. Set up isn‚Äôt difficult. Hardest part is running the wire. Love the 2 way talk feature and siren! App is easy to use. Motion detection is a little tricky to dial in but works well!

features: ,,6 x 4K Ultra HD Weatherproof Bullet Cameras with Smart Motion Detection Plus,Motion-Activated Lights and Remote-Triggered Sirens, plus Listen-In Audio and Two-Way Talk,Color Night Vision and IR Night Vision up to 150ft (45m),Safeguard Technology Monitors for Missing and Left Behind Items,8 Channel 4K Ultra HD NVR with 3TB preinstalled security-grade hard drive
name: Lorex 4K Ultra HD IP 8-Channel NVR System with 6 Smart Deterrence 4K 8MP IP Cameras, 150FT Night Vision, 3TB Hard Drive, Fusion Capabilities
review_header_2: Upgraded from Lorex DVR to NVR
review_text_1: I turned to Lorex as a possible home monitoring system after two attempts at using a Reolink. Both of those systems had big issues, like losing all cameras for no reason, losing one camera that required daily reset and reconfiguration, etc. Not so with the Lorex. This is a great looking system and super easy to install. The app is much better too and gives me fast easy access to cameras remotely. One thing I noticed was the 4K cameras produce a much better picture than the Reo system did, but both are suppose to be the same picture quality. The Lorex six camera system cost about the same as the Reo four camera system, so to me it's actually a better value for the money. Also, I really like the added white LEDs on the camera that turn on to warn a person who enters the sensor area that yes, there's a camera and yes, you're already recorded on the system, so "Smile!"
review_text_2: Instillation was fairly simple and required no calls to tech support, Major plus in my opinion. Picture quality is excellent and the night vision works very well. I‚Äôm still exploring software setup options and tweaking settings to meet my needs. The Lorex Home mobile app functions well and is a nice feature to have. If this new unit works as good as my previous still working 12 year old DVR did it‚Äôs a 5 star for sure. Main reason for upgrading was improved picture quality and the NVR POE cameras capabilities.One recommendation for Lorex would be to included a couple 100 or maybe 150 ft cables for the cameras. I found that the included 60ft cables were adequate for 4 out of the 6 camera runs, and would probably meet most home owners needs. In my case the runs were between 20 and 150ft. Although this is not a deal breaker and cables can be easily made or purchased for longer runs, it would of been nice.
review_text_3: These are incredible cameras the best I ever had, Night Vision Works flawlessly facial recognition vehicle recognition all the bells and whistles.
review_text_4: Very happy with this system pros great quality picture, night video is good quality. The cameras are heavy and feel like they are built great. Flaws takes a while to get the settings perfectly fine tuned the way you want. For night color you need to make sure there is plenty of ambient light.
review_text_5: Great product

review_text_1: Got these for my rental property. Not wireless, they're powered by the included ethernet cables, as stated in the description.The app takes some getting used to, and be sure to have a TV connected when you first set these up because there are somethings you can only control on the DVR, but I don't regret buying these at all. They work even in snow, the viewing angle is respectable, the images and video are high res, and the customer service is top notch. They even sent a replacement camera and ethernet cable for the one that went out, free of charge.Definitely a recommend if your budget is tight.
review_text_2: I've been really impressed with this camera system. It has a lot of features for the price range. I live on the edge of a bad area and this system gives me peace of mind when I'm away from home. My system has been running for a year now. I did have one camera fail, but Cathy from customer service set me up with a replacement camera.
review_text_3: I liked the ease of installation, the ease of downloading the APP and the ease of loading of remote viewing.
review_text_4: Company stans by there product if you have any issues.
review_text_5: muy bueno el articulo

review_text_1: Ring devices are great, a little bit expensive but it worth it, great night vision, maybe the manufacturer can improve wifi signal, besides that it‚Äôs a great camera.
review_text_2: This generation of Stick Up Cams set up with just an image capture on your cell phone of the code on the inside, bottom of each camera. Instant set up to Alexa app. We already own two extra batteries, so not worried about losing the use of the camera when the batteries need recharging. review_text_3: I have absolutely no complaints about my ring cameras. They work just as I hoped.
review_text_4: I love my cameras they‚Äôre pretty sensitive I wish we had hardwired them so you don‚Äôt have to change the batteries

name: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - Black
review_header_1: Small size and high quality camera
review_header_4: Excellent addition to the Ring lineup
review_header_5: Had issues but ring support was great!
review_text_2: For a while I have been using Ring cameras for the the exterior and Wyze cams for the interior on my house. With the new indoor cam I can now access all my cams from one app. To me the picture quality is great overall and especially in total darkness. Live view connection is a lot more stable than my Wyze cams. Alexa integration is a big plus, no need for third party hacks to complete routines. Because I already have Ring cameras it‚Äôs worth it to pay a little more over a Wyze cam.
review_text_3: In February, I noticed my ADHD medication ran out early. I‚Äôm very careful about taking it exactly as prescribed so it was strange that I had run out 10 days early. For reasons I won‚Äôt get into for this review, I suspected the property manager of my building was stealing it. Obviously that sounded crazy, but I couldn‚Äôt think of another explanation. A friend suggested a Ring camera, so I bought one never expecting anything to actually come of it. I put some antihistamines in my now empty pill bottle thinking no one would ever take them, set up the camera when it arrived, and felt more secure knowing it was there. Set up was simple so I figured worst case scenario, I was out a bit of money and I spent maybe 10 minutes setting it up.Fast forward a week later when I get a notification via the app that there was motion detected on my camera. I open up the recording and there she is, entering my apartment, going right for my decoy pills, taking them, and leaving. I immediately left work to get back home. I called the police who sent an officer. I showed him the video and he admitted that had I not had the video, he wouldn‚Äôt have believed me. I was able to quickly and easily send the video to the police and to the president of the company that owns my building. I also was able to download the video and get it uploaded so that I have copies of it as I go through the next few months as she (hopefully) gets brought to justice.I cannot emphasize how much this little camera has helped me. I would not have caught my burglar otherwise. Because of it, they were able to look up records of who used their electronic key to access my apartment and she had been in there 7 times over the month prior. This would have gone on for longer and who knows if it would have resulted in harm to myself or my cat had I not caught her. This camera has given some of the sense of security she stole from me back and stopped a nightmare situation from worsening. I will still be recovering from this for long time and I am hoping she is brought to justice, but I cannot thank Ring enough for helping me secure my home from an unexpected source of danger.
review_text_4: This camera for $60 is a solid deal. I have had a Ring Pro and Ring floodlight camera for about a year.This indoor camera can either be put on a surface or mounted on the wall.What's in the box?1. Ring floodlight camera2. Proprietary AC adapter3. Mounting accessories4. Manuals.The included mounting equipment is a nice touch. Although I'm not going to mount mine.1080P video is solid. Covers a wider area.The two way audio is good to check up on Pets, senior citizens,etc. The sound comes through very clear from the mobile app. Two way talk is definitely a nice addition to this camera.The footprint of this camera is small. A blue light comes on when it detects motion.In order to have saved footage for up to 60 days, you have to pay a fee. $3 a month but a little lower if you get the annual subscription.If you have a bunch of ring devices you can have saved footage as well other features for about $10 per month.Case in point, solid camera at the price point. Provides piece of mind for your home.

features: A Certified Refurbished Spotlight Cam Battery is refurbished, tested, and certified to look and work like new,Works with Alexa to launch real-time video with your voice,Lets you see, hear and speak to visitors from your phone, tablet and PC,Sends alerts as soon as motion is detected. Compatible with ios, android, mac and windows 10 devices,Powered by the quick-release rechargeable battery pack,Monitors your home in 1080HD video with infrared night vision and Live View,Includes built-in LED light strips and a siren
name: Certified Refurbished Ring Spotlight Cam Battery HD Security Camera with Built Two-Way Talk and a Siren Alarm, White, Works with Alexa
review_header_3: Well designed camera & solar array, requires SOLID WIFI, installation OK for a good DIYer
review_text_1: These cameras are the best I would definitely recommend to everyone. If u think u don‚Äôt need it think twice. I ordered one then once I had it up and u won‚Äôt believe the things u miss or happen when u are not home. So after two weeks of buying the first one I ended up buying a second one. The battery powered is the way to go bc u can mount anywhere u can think of, it has nice features u can literally adjust any setting u want. Battery last awhile it come with one, but the camera can fit two to have longer life, the batteries are rechargeable or u can just do the solar panel which works great. It has night vision, two way speaker, sends u alerts to your phone when motion is detected. Never knew I needed them until I got them best investment yet.
review_text_2: Best investment. Bought 1 to test worked perfectly. Now I have 3. Easy to install. I even have one on a tree. Took awhile to get the motion set because I live on a busy street. Got it done with little effort. Hardly any false notifications. Night vision excellent especially when light come on. My son bought 3 also after serum one. I was at his house and his father-in-law was there who has Nest. Could not get over the picture quality and features that his nest doesn‚Äôt have. I can‚Äôt believe how simple this system is. Total time to install all 3 about 30 min. It took him 2 days to get his nest set. No problem with refurbished they stand behind them and you can‚Äôt tell the difference.
review_text_3: I own 6 Ring cameras. 2 doorbell cams, 1 interior Ring cam, 2 Ring spotlight hardwire cams and this new battery powered with solar array Ring spotlight cam. I have owned Ring cameras for a very long time - long before Amazon bought them. The Ring experience these days under Amazon is far superior to 5+ years ago when Ring was a stand alone outfit. My point here is that I have a LOT of Ring camera experience and I've seen a long list of Ring issues and quirks. I bought refurb because I've never had any issues with the other 3 Ring refurbs I've purchased from Amazon - that didn't work out so well for a number of customers.I added this refurbished battery camera to a high sunlight area on my home that would have been a pain to hardwire. I'll go through a few tips based on my 5+ years of Ring camera use and my experience with this new battery operated Ring camera and solar array combo.I read many of the 1 & 2 star ratings and they center around a few recurring issues:-Missing parts - that's not a camera issue, that's an Amazon issue. Send it back and have Amazon make it right-Camera won't hold signal. Two things here - these folks either lack the proper bandwidth or the camera is too far from the modem. That's it - I've never had any issue with WIFI connection that was not modem or bandwidth related. I have 1 GB Verizon FiOS, the new, updated modem and good proximity to the camera from the modem - it kicks butt. If you do NOT have great WIFI with the latest modem and good proximity, you WILL suffer.-The batteries won't fully power up with the solar array. CHARGE the batteries on a USB power cable indoors to 100% BEFORE you install them in the camera! It took me 7 hours for one battery and 6 for the other to fully charge. I use two batteries - the refurb price allowed me to spend the extra $30 on the additional battery.-You need enough sun - my solar array gets full sun for 8-12 hours a day. If you try to squeak by with 1-3 hours, it can be an issue.-Understand the settings on the camera to conserve power and set up the motion zones and sensitivity. Some of the 1-2 star issues were the result of not fully comprehending those fine details.My four photos show the clarity of view, the solar array installed, the camera installed and the "Device Health" screenshot that shows both batteries at 100% and the solar array properly connected. Like I said - charge the batteries FIRST to 100% on a power cord and then insert them the camera. Both batteries have been outside in this camera for 2 weeks and they are at 100% because I have a ton of sun with no shade trees nearby.Installation can range from a simple 30 minute setup if you have DIY skills to absolute torture if you do not possess the Liam Neeson like "particular set of skills". In my case, I can fix most anything and I used 3 inch stainless trim square drive screws through the vinyl corner posts into the framing underneath. Solid as granite when done. I used a siding separating tool and pulled the siding apart, ran the solar array connection wire under the siding and snapped it back together. Liam Neeson easy - if you have the tools and skills.I've had HUGE issues with Ring cameras early on especially with the doorbell units that were an enormous pain in the butt prior to the Amazon acquisition of Ring. Since then, I've never had an issue with any of the Ring spotlight cams, hardwire or battery powered. Your experience may (will!) vary. Hope that helps!
review_text_4: Ring has a good product. My only complaint is the distance that it detects motion. For example, I have it pointed at my driveway, but it only catches when a vehicle pulls up close. It works, but it would be nice if it caught it a little further down the driveway. However, this review is mostly on refurbished devices. Many people refuse to buy because it isn‚Äôt ‚Äúbrand new‚Äù. Well actually they are. They are cleaned up, repaired and brought up to the same standards as ‚Äúbrand new‚Äù ones. So why not save yourself, in some cases, a good chunk of money? The only difference with this it was refurbished. When I opened the package it looked exactly like the ones I bought for full price. I couldn‚Äôt see any difference. And you get the same warranty. So do yourself a favor, consider refurbs and save yourself some money!
review_text_5: I have the spotlight cam, doorbell pro, stuck up cam, full security system and the new indoor cam. This thing is awesome. It's a little bulky but I am really impressed with picture quality and the spotlight is alot brighter than I expected. I have this hooked up to a solar panel and it charges fairly quick in the Georgia sun.My only complaint is the hardware included. They have to be the cheapest screws ever. I dont understand why they dont send quality hardware or self tapping screws..

name: Certified Refurbished Ring Stick Up Cam Battery HD security camera with custom privacy controls, Simple setup, Works with Alexa - White
review_header_1: I choose Refurbished, but it's been 100% perfect & The battery life is amazing.
review_header_3: Easy install and activate wireless camera!
review_header_5: Works Just Like My New Cameras
review_text_1: I live in an apartment complex, so my options are limited. I purchased this refurbished Ring battery cam, and am very very happy with it. It requires no wiring, the entire device is powered by an internal rechargeable battery.More on the battery: The Battery life is insane. it came with 47% battery life out of the box, and I've used it for 3 weeks, and it's at 36% battery life. I did buy another battery to swap it out when it gets low. There are also solar options, but I'm good with swapping it out, but it seems like it will last at least 2 months on a full charge.You can install it a few ways, I did a wall mount to watch my front door area. I attached an image of the image quality in the app at night (there is a small lamp on my door area, so night vision isn't needed for my setup)The Ring app is great, it connects you and your neighbors to share warnings and get notifications for things going around in the community. Your camera is 100% private unless you decide to share. You will get notifications when someone steps in front of the camera, you can talk to them, etc.Setup took a couple of tries to allow it to update, but once I connected it to my wifi It was working.Make sure your wifi reaches the device.As far as a review of the refurbished aspect, you could tell it had been repackaged, but it was professionally done. There were no marks or damage on the product, just a couple o fingerprints. Would gladly purchase another refurbished product from Ring or Amazon.
review_text_2: I decided to add a camera to my new out-building. I decided to give this battery powered unit a shot. I already have a Ring doorbell, and a larger wired system. This little camera has been great. Clear picture. Easy to add to my Ring App. Battery life seems perfectly manageable. It has been running for weeks now, on lower power consumption settings. Battery is down maybe 85%? Best part, if I want to take it and use it elsewhere, I could.
review_text_3: Purchased because I have a recessed porch which makes seeing someone at the front door difficult, also a large open backyard which is extremely dark at night. I now get visual alerts and can see who is at my front door or when packages arrive, and if something is in the backyard or on the deck. Night vision is clear, easy installation and activating them took 30 minutes. Feel much safer with these cameras up now. Mine are mounted so I can reach them with a step ladder if I need to charge the batteries.
review_text_4: Camera is on front of our house and front of our driveway. Works great. Sometimes a little TOO great. We have a shared driveway and our neighbors apparently use the driveway ALOT lol :-). The boundaries work perfectly. Picture is extremely clear. Was extremely easy to mount. Mounted, configured, and up and running in about half an hour. The only thing that is a pain (and it may just be a setting I haven‚Äôt found yet) is when we get a motion alert it takes a few seconds for camera to load the recording. I love the linking feature so I can trigger my side driveway camera at the same time so I can record both parts of my driveway.
review_text_5: I got a great deal on this on one of Amazon's lightning deals. I was a little skeptical as it is refurbished. However, it was received in like new condition and was up and running in no time. I probably would not have bought it at the full price, but it was a great lightning deal. I am very happy with the purchase.
