review_header_4: Very good night vision good range
review_text_1: Ring devices are great, a little bit expensive but it worth it, great night vision, maybe the manufacturer can improve wifi signal, besides that it‚Äôs a great camera.
review_text_2: This generation of Stick Up Cams set up with just an image capture on your cell phone of the code on the inside, bottom of each camera. Instant set up to Alexa app. We already own two extra batteries, so not worried about losing the use of the camera when the batteries need recharging. We have 8 cameras in the house: 4 Stick Up cams and 4 plug in cameras.
review_text_3: I have absolutely no complaints about my ring cameras. They work just as I hoped.
review_text_4: I love my cameras they‚Äôre pretty sensitive I wish we had hardwired them so you don‚Äôt have to change the batteries
review_text_5: Works great great pictures

features: Compact plug-in indoor camera that lets you see, hear and speak to people and pets from your phone, tablet, or select Echo device.,Watch over your entire home by connecting one or multiple Indoor Cams to all your Ring devices in the Ring app.,With a Ring Protect Plan (subscription sold separately), record all your videos, review what you missed for up to 60 days, and share videos and photos.,With Live View, you can check in on your home any time through the Ring app.,Easily setup your Indoor Cam by plugging into a standard outlet and connecting to Wi-Fi.,Place on a flat surface or mount to a wall with the versatile mounting bracket.,For added peace of mind, pair with Alexa to help you keep an eye on your home.
name: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
review_header_1: Small size and high quality camera
review_header_4: Excellent addition to the Ring lineup
review_header_5: Had issues but ring support was great!
review_text_2: For a while I have been using Ring cameras for the the exterior and Wyze cams for the interior on my house. With the new indoor cam I can now access all my cams from one app. To me the picture quality is great overall and especially in total darkness. Live view connection is a lot more stable than my Wyze cams. Alexa integration is a big plus, no need for third party hacks to complete routines. Because I already have Ring cameras it‚Äôs worth it to pay a little more over a Wyze cam.
review_text_3: In February, I noticed my ADHD medication ran out early. I‚Äôm very careful about taking it exactly as prescribed so it was strange that I had run out 10 days early. For reasons I won‚Äôt get into for this review, I suspected the property manager of my building was stealing it. Obviously that sounded crazy, but I couldn‚Äôt think of another explanation. A friend suggested a Ring camera, so I bought one never expecting anything to actually come of it. I put some antihistamines in my now empty pill bottle thinking no one would ever take them, set up the camera when it arrived, and felt more secure knowing it was there. Set up was simple so I figured worst case scenario, I was out a bit of money and I spent maybe 10 minutes setting it up.Fast forward a week later when I get a notification via the app that there was motion detected on my camera. I open up the recording and there she is, entering my apartment, going right for my decoy pills, taking them, and leaving. I immediately left work to get back home. I called the police who sent an officer. I showed him the video and he admitted that had I not had the video, he wouldn‚Äôt have believed me. I was able to quickly and easily send the video to the police and to the president of the company that owns my building. I also was able to download the video and get it uploaded so that I have copies of it as I go through the next few months as she (hopefully) gets brought to justice.I cannot emphasize how much this little camera has helped me. I would not have caught my burglar otherwise. Because of it, they were able to look up records of who used their electronic key to access my apartment and she had been in there 7 times over the month prior. This would have gone on for longer and who knows if it would have resulted in harm to myself or my cat had I not caught her. This camera has given some of the sense of security she stole from me back and stopped a nightmare situation from worsening. I will still be recovering from this for long time and I am hoping she is brought to justice, but I cannot thank Ring enough for helping me secure my home from an unexpected source of danger.
review_text_4: This camera for $60 is a solid deal. I have had a Ring Pro and Ring floodlight camera for about a year.This indoor camera can either be put on a surface or mounted on the wall.What's in the box?1. Ring floodlight camera2. Proprietary AC adapter3. Mounting accessories4. Manuals.The included mounting equipment is a nice touch. Although I'm not going to mount mine.1080P video is solid. Covers a wider area.The two way audio is good to check up on Pets, senior citizens,etc. The sound comes through very clear from the mobile app. Two way talk is definitely a nice addition to this camera.The footprint of this camera is small. A blue light comes on when it detects motion.In order to have saved footage for up to 60 days, you have to pay a fee. $3 a month but a little lower if you get the annual subscription.If you have a bunch of ring devices you can have saved footage as well other features for about $10 per month.Case in point, solid camera at the price point. Provides piece of mind for your home.

review_header_2: Crystal Clear, No Distortion When Zooming, Fast & Responsive
review_header_5: I needed something reasonably priced and easy to install.....
review_text_1: Updated Review----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------A criminal who had been released from jail on probation because COVID, robbed my garage 2 nights in a row. I got a crisp and clear video, posted to the Ring app, other neighbors checked their video and found the same man on their property, the police were involved immediately and the perp was taken back to jail.From the press release of our local PD:"On 5/11/20, [city] Police Department Patrol responded to a residential burglary that occurred the night before. The victim had left their garage door open and went for a walk around the neighborhood. During that time, from about 8 pm to 8:30 pm, an unknown subject later identified as [nam,e] entered the garage, rummaged through the cars and stole the victim‚Äôs mountain bike. While [name] was in the garage, the victim‚Äôs family was at home in the house....When the victim realized his bike had been stolen, he checked his Ring Camera video and saw that the suspect had been inside his garage. He posted the video onto the Ring Camera Neighborhood App, warning others in the area.Many community members had seen the video of the suspect and had been in contact with the [city] Police Street Crimes Unit (SCU). SCU and PROS (Post Release Offender Supervision) Detectives along with Patrol officers began looking for the suspect....This was an excellent example of the community working together to put a criminal back into jail....A review of the [city] Superior Court website shows that [name] has prior convictions for stealing a vehicle, robbery, using pepper spray to commit a violent felony, being under the influence of a controlled substance, possession of drug paraphernalia, and possession of narcotics. [name] is currently on PROS/AB109 and was in custody and had recently been released from jail on May 8th by Probation due to Covid-19 concerns."For a $60 camera, this was a great investment.Original Review----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------I had 5 of the Amazon Cloud Cams, purchased about 18 months ago. Amazon then acquired Ring and Blink, and discontinued the Cloud Cams, although they still provide support (for now).I needed two new cameras, so I went with the Ring. Primarily because I heard nothing negative about the security, as opposed to Wyze. However, Ring has some real downsides relative to the Amazon Cloud Cams.1. More latency.I have great WiFi. I have multiple wi-fi mesh routers throughout the house with no dead spots. Still have to wait ~5-7 seconds to connect to live view. Cloud Cams was 3-5 seconds.2. No zoomI could tap and zoom on Cloud Cams. Can't do that with Ring.3. No live view via Web Browser.Apparently you can download an app on Windows 10, but I'm on a Mac and wonder why I can't view the video in a browser. I could go with Cloud Cams.4. I can't see multiple Cameras at once.With Cloud Cam, I could stream audio and video from all five cameras at once over the web. It was great. Having to switch between cameras, one at a time, and having to wait 5-7 seconds per camera, is a big downside.I get that Amazon needed to simplify its product portfolio after their two most recent acquisitions in this space, but it's a shame the Cloud Cam isn't sold anymore. It was a superior product offering in this space.Design, Packaging, Ease of Setup, and from what I can understand, Security is all excellent in Ring, and I have no complaints. The app, in spite of the one camera at a time limitation, is well-designed too.*** UPDATED 3-Jan-2020 ***I found the Rapid Ring app. It works in conjunction with the regular Ring app. Rapid Ring has limited functionality, but it does everything I need. Somehow, it manages to reduce latency to connect to the cameras. When I pull up the Rapid Ring app, I can connect to anyone of my cameras in <1 second. The app will also continuously reconnect to the camera after the 5 minute timeout period, so I can stream a camera indefinitely. I have upgraded my review to 4 stars. If Ring ever develops a generic web interface to view all cameras simultaneously, I will give 5 stars.
review_text_2: The video on these cams is amazing, I am comparing the performance to previous Ring Cam models, this is the best so far. Really crisp even when zooming the content of the video. Responsive, immediately playing the live video when requested. I am tickled pink with these Inside Stick Up Cams, will recommended to all over other brands. I have replaced two of my three Wyze Cams with these Ring Inside Stick Up Cams, well worth the added expense.I have at this time, the first generation Stick Up Cams (outside and in the garage), Pro Door Bell and two Ring Spot Light Cams (one wired and one battery powered), all are in excellent working order. The video on these Inside Stick Up Cams exceeds expectations in comparison with my existing Ring cameras.Inside I had three Wyze Cams, one that was chronically loosing itself from the network, another two that intermittently would loose themselves from the network. All were chronically unable to provide a video within the app without crashing or without taking valuable time to do so. My internet is very, very stout, throughput is excellent, download of 500+ Mpbs's and upload at over 30+ Mpbs's. So internet speed, latency and throughput are not the issue where any of these camera's are concerned. My decision to replace these Wyze Cams with the Ring Stick Up Cams is well founded, I am quite pleased.
review_text_3: I purchased the ring doorbell and two indoor camera one of which I actually turned outward to capture the driveway. I think functionality, resolution, and being able to access recorded video is all I could ask for. And all at a very reasonable price!Settings options are ample for things like motion zone adjustment , upside down camera placement with adjusted view on the receiver, and even a night glare adjustment if you choose to have an indoor camera face outward.Important to note that after a 30 day trial of free access to video recording, if you want continued access to recordings, it‚Äôs $3/month per camera for the basic plan or $10/month for all cameras - obviously makes sense to do if you have more than 3 cameras.I added two 10ft power cords in case either do the cameras placement was too far from an outlet for the cord that comes with the camera (I think it‚Äôs 6 or 7ft). Actually just moved one of the cameras and needed the longer cord which I had.Another great thing is that I can set up the app on multiple devices.https://smarthomestarter.com/can-you-install-ring-doorbell-without-turning-off-the-power/I decided on the Ring Doorbell Pro so I don‚Äôt have to deal with a battery powered device. The Pro model gets wired directly into where your doorbell is wired into so make sure to cut the power supply first! Also the Pro offers a chime you cam plug into a desired place to hear the doorbell
review_text_4: The RING indoor camera were very easy to mount and activate on my WiFi network. These camera have been integrated into a wide array of SmartHome devices to monitor infrastructure and security. While my Weil-McLain hot water boiler for hydronic radiant floor heat is capable of providing information on its operating status, it does not have the ability to notify me when an error message is generated. Using the RING Indoor cam, I can monitor the backlit screen of the boiler from anywhere in the world via an internet connection and the RING app (picture #1 is a screen shot from the RING app). I can control my garage doors remotely by internet connection and do receive open/close status via e-Mail, but wanted visual confirmation of door status especially if I gave someone remote access and wanted to make sure they closed the door after leaving. With a RING camera ceiling mounted in the garage, the wide field of view (picture #3 is screen shot of garage from RING app) allows monitoring of both doors. RING sells a longer power cable that eliminated the need for an extension cord to provide power. A tilt/swivel mount allows for optimized viewing angles. The mount can be easily configured for ceiling or wall mounting. The camera has a sensitive speaker/microphone. The RING app is easy to use for configuring range and sensitivity of motion as well as viewing with an adequate WiFi signal. My Router is at the opposite end of the house from the garage location and the other camera is in the basement-no problem quickly connecting to both cameras.
review_text_5: Let me start by saying I received no compensation of any kind for this review; it is my honest experience with Ring products. I am a senior, living alone, in a single family home. Security is a big concern for me but I could not afford any longer to pay the outrageous cost of ADT. My neighbors recommended Ring doorbells. I bought those first. I also needed something that would cover the outside of my home, my yard and driveway. I bought this set of 2 Ring indoor cameras. I installed them yesterday in less than 15 minutes with them sitting in window sills but pointed OUTWARD. They are just perfect!!! Because I live in Iowa with very harsh winters, I did not want to have to worry about changing batteries or a solar powered camera. These 2 little cameras plug into to any outlet and the view outside is absolutely clear. I highly recommend them for reasonable cost, ease of installation and for the ability to monitor the entire outside of my home without expensive installation charges.

features: Connect your Ring camera with Alexa then enable announcements to be alerted when motion is detected. Talk to visitors through compatible Echo devices by saying ‚ÄúAlexa, talk to the front door‚Äù.,Lets you see, hear and speak to visitors from your phone, tablet and PC,Powered by the quick-release rechargeable battery pack.,With a Ring Protect Plan (subscription sold separately), record all your videos, review what you missed for up to 60 days, and share videos and photos.,Monitors your home in 1080HD video with infrared night vision and Live View,Includes built-in LED light strips and a siren,Includes Lifetime Theft Protection: If your Camera gets stolen, we‚Äôll replace it for free
name: Ring Spotlight Cam Battery HD Security Camera with Built Two-Way Talk and a Siren Alarm, White, Works with Alexa
review_header_1: Super Easy to Install, no wires necessary!
review_header_3: Great Camera. Works well for the backyard.
review_text_1: I have a Ring pro on my front door and loved it so much that I wanted something for the back patio since I have contracts (lawn, pool, trees, etc) in my backyard. My challenge however is that all the walls on the patio are either stucco or rock, which makes it near impossible to run a hidden power line. So I opted for this option and so far it works great. The lights are pretty bright and the motion detection works as expected.As for the battery life, it has been in for a couple weeks and it has lost about 10% battery. So I‚Äôm guessing it will last about 3 months before it needs a charge. I just ordered a second battery which should double that battery life.The connection is very quick, it seems to connect much faster than my front door, but in fairness it is closer to the wireless router.As for installation, I installed it using the provided screws into the frame of my patio door. It actually works perfect there because you can‚Äôt really see it and allows me to perfectly position it for motion detection.My only complaint is the motion zone setup. Unlike the ring pro where I can ‚Äúdraw‚Äù motion zones (which significantly helps reduce motion alerts), it only allows you to specify a distance. It really isn‚Äôt very intuitive, so I just leave it at mid-range and it seems to work just fine for now.Beware, in order to have video playback, you do have to subscribe to the ring premium service. And you have to have a subscription per device! I have it for my front door, not sure I‚Äôm gonna pay for the back door. That was kind of a bummer to find out I‚Äôd have to pay more. It should be a household subscription.Overall, I‚Äôm very happy with the device and would recommend it to anyone looking for an easy to install solution without wires.
review_text_3: We have this camera for the backyard and also the ring doorbell for the front door. We got the doorbell first and think it does the job. It is not the best nor is it the worst. Now the camera for the backyard is very nice. We got it as a safety precaution because we felt someone had used the pool while we were away and did not want that to be a safety issue. As you can see in these live pictures I just took that it covers pretty much the whole yard and you can zoom into areas on the app with your finger. Also pictured. We have the sensor set Just right to capture the movement in the backyard. At night when motion is detected the lights fire up to record. There is also an option to push an alarm on the light. It‚Äôs not super loud but loud enough for the neighbors to hear and scare persons away. I have also included a screenshot of the app view of the ring items we have.I would recommend this camera but really recommend using the solar panel with the camera and not have to worry about taking the battery out to charge it.
review_text_4: Love the freedom of wireless, the solar panels work great and only need a couple of hours of sunlight per day to keep the batteries topped off. Video quality is great and I've got eyes on the whole yard now. Just picked up 3 of these beauties. Simply system anyone can install and operate. Thank You Ring!!I bought a camera system a few years ago with a hard drive a 4 wired cameras. Wires all over the house and you need a PHD in programming to get the system to work. It ended up in the trash without ever making a single recording. Ring just makes it all doable for the average Non PHD humans...
review_text_5: Updated Review:Received a new camera from Ring. Setup this past weekend and it has been great so far. A lot different and better results from my first go with Ring.I had upgraded my network devices, modem and router. No more drops or freezing. Worked with Alexis from Ring support and she has been great!!The camera works flawless.

review_header_4: Awesome Smart Tracking for moving objects
review_text_1: I have recently had to deal with neighbors who were trying to strong arm me. I filed a police report and purchased a full blink system and added two of these 360 cams. To my delight, these work with my new Alexa equipped home and I can view all cams with my echo. I will be adding the smaller version for indoor to add to my system. I really wanted a CCTV system so I can run it around the clock...just didn't want to deal with the time it would have taken to wire it up so I opted for my current setup. It's a nice blend of battery powered cams and two of these powered devices cutting the setup time since I wanted security much sooner than later. One of the drawbacks with blink is that you are only able to record up to 5 min at a time. They are great cams for catching things as it happens but these 360 cams really surprised me with the fact that I've had them running and recording for the past 12 hours straight. They are fully automated and I smirked every time the camera tracked anything that moved lol. They always reverted back to point of origin which is awesome since monitoring a specific area is important to me. With my Samsung connected to my computer, I'm able to watch my blind spots without touching my phone. I wanted to close with how impressed I am with the quality of the recording. Very confident that with these cams and my blink system, any unlawful actions will be caught on cam which will be key to pressing charges. If you are on the fence, don't be. This is security at a very very reasonable price point :)Update: 10-11-21Pro...err n00b tip since I'm also learning :)The software will record 24/7 as long as you have Smart Scene set up. I have mine set to "Tap Perform to start..." and then the action is "Record Video". I named this Smart Scene as 24/7 Cam. Now you can have multiple Smart Scenes set up and I have this one combined with Scene's that record when motion isdetected. So while you are recording a 24/7 clip, the camera will still record separate videos anytime the motion is detected. This comes in handy so that you don't have to sit there and watch the full 24 hour video since the motion detected videos are saved in another folder. You will have to click record to activate the 24/7 recording and I would suggest clicking on the "Pop-out picture in picture" mode once recording starts. This will allow your recording to continue while giving you access to the rest of your phone. This comes in handy since I'm using this + Blink, Echo, Arlo, Smart Home and Alexa to control everything on one device. My phone also went to sleep mode but the recording did not skip a beat! Lastly, the manually recorded clips are contained in your local file under the user tab on the bottom right. Sorry if some of this is super basic. This is just what I've learned in the past week of operating and staring at my security system making sure the unstable people are captured if they try anything less than smart. Stay safe everyone!
review_text_2: This is a great camera overall and a very good unit for home surveillance applications. The packaging is good an it comes with everything you need to get started. It is nice that a mount is included. I mounted the unit on rails on my second story balcony overlooking my front yard. The angle of view is very good - it is pretty wide angle so you can cover a good sized area. The image quality is great both during the day and at night. It is nice that at night when a street light is on the camera stays in color. When it flips to the IR black and white mode the image quality is still good. The amazing feature of this camera is the human detection and auto tracking. I get a push notification through the mobile app almost instantly when a person is seen by the camera. I haven‚Äôt really gotten any false alerts from it so far which is nice. The camera was a little bit tricky to get connected to my WiFi at first but it was because I was a little bit beyond the recommended 15 ft max distance from the WiFi router during initial installation. Once you bring the camera working the recommended 15 ft radius it was pretty easy to get it added to the mobile app. The app is pretty easy to use and has all the features you would want. Overall I think this camera is a great value for the price and would recommend it, especially for home surveillance because it had the built in WiFi and you only need to supply power to the camera.
review_text_3: I can‚Äôt say enough great things. Option of local storage so I wasn‚Äôt held hostage to paying cloud subscription‚Ä¶ picture quality is amazing. I bought mine so I can ‚Äúcatch‚Äù the animals eating all my flowers. Since installing a few weeks ago- watching all the crazy wildlife has become an evening ritual. Can‚Äôt say enough great things about these camera
review_text_4: This a must have product from Imou! I already have the Bullet 2MP and the Cue 1080p camera for a year already, but I needed one that includes Pan mode, and I like the easy Pan & Tilt feature on this one, beautiful night vision color mode and the smart tracking feature. Also for nightvision mode, you can choose wether on motion detection, turn spotlights on and get full color video or just IR recording. It has two spotlights which is very bright. I like how the camera goes in the moving object and record instantly. The Cruiser model is a must have into your shop or home outdoors.
review_text_5: So far so goodCamera was pretty easy to get connected to WiFiDoes a good job letting me know if there‚Äôs movementWould like motion tracking to be a little betterWould recommend this cameraHopefully I can say the same a year from nowI have went thru 3 other cameras so far.... they didn‚Äôt work well after some time

review_header_2: Super easy to setup and use
review_header_3: The micro SD Card slot is UNDER HIS NECK
review_text_1: Just wanted to add a review that this unit does have local storage (MicroSD Card)The slot is hidden beneath the lens. That is why some users are reviewing that there isn't local storage. Confirming that it has it and works great.
review_text_2: Super easy to get setup. Does the job to let me keep an eye on my cat while I'm gone all day. ... And with the two way audio I can easily skold him if he's up on the counters üòÅ
review_text_3: Just roll the head back with ur fingers and the micro card slot is under his neck & will take up to a 64gb card. These are nice cams for the price. The ones complaining about these cams are user challenged obviously. I even have them placed outdoors, under covers of course, but they work great. Night vision is good for about 60‚Äô - 75‚Äô outdoors. Not so great in windows because the ir light reflects off the window. Just put them under a carport, an eve, or even build u a little wood covered platform like I did for the wife‚Äôs deer cam, and you‚Äôre golden. U can do it, Sparky‚Ä¶ just use your head. The ‚Äúwireless‚Äù is connectivity, Not power! U still need a 110v outlet near by or run an extension cord. As long as your phone can pick up your wifi network where u want to install the cam, your camera can too. After u install the cam on ur home network, u can view it with your smart phone from anywhere u have cell service.
review_text_4: Happy with these but the app could be a little more new user guide friendly for sure. Also you have to get a service that‚Äôs $11.99 a month to even really use them. Wish I‚Äôd have known that part to compare better before buying anything
review_text_5: I can zoom in, great panoramic spectrum, love that its two-way talking. Great for a working person who has a sick person at home that cant use a phone.

name: Certified Refurbished Ring Stick Up Cam Battery HD security camera with custom privacy controls, Simple setup, Works with Alexa - White
review_header_1: I choose Refurbished, but it's been 100% perfect & The battery life is amazing.
review_header_3: Easy install and activate wireless camera!
review_header_5: Works Just Like My New Cameras
review_text_1: I live in an apartment complex, so my options are limited. I purchased this refurbished Ring battery cam, and am very very happy with it. It requires no wiring, the entire device is powered by an internal rechargeable battery.More on the battery: The Battery life is insane. it came with 47% battery life out of the box, and I've used it for 3 weeks, and it's at 36% battery life. I did buy another battery to swap it out when it gets low. There are also solar options, but I'm good with swapping it out, but it seems like it will last at least 2 months on a full charge.You can install it a few ways, I did a wall mount to watch my front door area. I attached an image of the image quality in the app at night (there is a small lamp on my door area, so night vision isn't needed for my setup)The Ring app is great, it connects you and your neighbors to share warnings and get notifications for things going around in the community. Your camera is 100% private unless you decide to share. You will get notifications when someone steps in front of the camera, you can talk to them, etc.Setup took a couple of tries to allow it to update, but once I connected it to my wifi It was working.Make sure your wifi reaches the device.As far as a review of the refurbished aspect, you could tell it had been repackaged, but it was professionally done. There were no marks or damage on the product, just a couple o fingerprints. Would gladly purchase another refurbished product from Ring or Amazon.
review_text_2: I decided to add a camera to my new out-building. I decided to give this battery powered unit a shot. I already have a Ring doorbell, and a larger wired system. This little camera has been great. Clear picture. Easy to add to my Ring App. Battery life seems perfectly manageable. It has been running for weeks now, on lower power consumption settings. Battery is down maybe 85%? Best part, if I want to take it and use it elsewhere, I could.
review_text_3: Purchased because I have a recessed porch which makes seeing someone at the front door difficult, also a large open backyard which is extremely dark at night. I now get visual alerts and can see who is at my front door or when packages arrive, and if something is in the backyard or on the deck. Night vision is clear, easy installation and activating them took 30 minutes. Feel much safer with these cameras up now. Mine are mounted so I can reach them with a step ladder if I need to charge the batteries.
review_text_4: Camera is on front of our house and front of our driveway. Works great. Sometimes a little TOO great. We have a shared driveway and our neighbors apparently use the driveway ALOT lol :-). The boundaries work perfectly. Picture is extremely clear. Was extremely easy to mount. Mounted, configured, and up and running in about half an hour. The only thing that is a pain (and it may just be a setting I haven‚Äôt found yet) is when we get a motion alert it takes a few seconds for camera to load the recording. I love the linking feature so I can trigger my side driveway camera at the same time so I can record both parts of my driveway.
review_text_5: I got a great deal on this on one of Amazon's lightning deals. I was a little skeptical as it is refurbished. However, it was received in like new condition and was up and running in no time. I probably would not have bought it at the full price, but it was a great lightning deal. I am very happy with the purchase.

features: A Certified Refurbished Ring Indoor Cam is refurbished, tested, and certified to look and work like new and comes with the same limited warranty as a new device.,Compact plug-in indoor camera that lets you see, hear and speak to people and pets from your phone, tablet, or select Echo device.,Watch over your entire home by connecting one or multiple Indoor Cams to all your Ring devices in the Ring app.,With a Ring Protect Plan (subscription sold separately), record all your videos, review what you missed for up to 60 days, and share videos and photos.,With Live View, you can check in on your home any time through the Ring app.,Easily setup your Indoor Cam by plugging into a standard outlet and connecting to wifi.,Place on a flat surface or mount to a wall with the versatile mounting bracket.,For added peace of mind, pair with Alexa to help you keep an eye on your home.
name: Certified Refurbished Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
review_header_4: Like Brand New!! Great Quality and Awesome Deal!!
review_text_1: All accessories were included and it was boxed as new so the refurbishment process appears to be very good. The camera has a wide angle that covers the entire room from the corner, and sends me alerts for all motion in the room so it works great. The night vision is surprisingly clear. If you are shopping around for cloud security cameras I highly recommend Ring for pricing, quality and ease of use. I have used them for over two years and could not be happier.
review_text_2: (I put the camera in my front window facing outside.) Ima keep this review short, this camera is AWESOME! I highly recommend buying. I‚Äôve had it for about a month and it works like a charm. Just plug it up, download the app and follow the steps. That‚Äôs it! I‚Äôll be ordering more to put around the house.
review_text_3: In a million years I never expected this to perform as well as it does. We put it INSIDE our office facing the parking lot and it gives us a magnificent wide angle view allowing us to see the front door and all of our vehicles day and night and set up was super duper amazingly easy; seriously, an idiot could set it up. We were so impressed we ordered another one with a flood light on it and mounted it outside then the doorbell one for our house and a flood light one for our house and then 2 more..and for Christmas we got one as a gift for our parents. The app is easy to use and the pictures are clear and easy to save and send.
review_text_4: Wow!The camera I received was brand new.Everything was new!The box was new, the cables were new, the camera was new.The camera still had the protective plastic on it, there was even protective plastic on the lenses.Setup was suuuuper simple and I'm very very VERY impressed with the quality of the image and the video.I love being able to view the camera Live and setup alerts too. I can even snooze the alerts, 4hrs max at time, when I'm home so I don't get alerts.It's also a perfect size imo. It's not too small and not big and bulky at all.
review_text_5: Save yourself the money and buy Refurbished

features: 1080p HD video doorbell with enhanced features that let you see, hear, and speak to anyone from your phone, tablet, or PC.,An upgrade from the original Ring Video Doorbell 2, enjoy improved motion detection, privacy zones and audio privacy, and dual-band (2.4 or 5.0 GHz) wifi connectivity.,Receive mobile notifications when anyone presses your doorbell or triggers your built-in motion sensors.,Powered by the rechargeable battery pack or connects to doorbell wires for constant power.,Easily setup by connecting your Ring Video Doorbell 3 to wifi through the Ring app and mounting with the included tools.,With a Ring Protect Plan (subscription sold separately), record all your videos, review what you missed for up to 60 days, and share videos and photos.,Connect your Ring doorbell with Alexa to hear announcements on your compatible Echo device when your doorbell is pressed and see a live view of your camera if you have an Echo device with a screen. Talk to visitors by saying ‚ÄúAlexa, talk to the front door.‚Äù
name: Ring Video Doorbell 3 ‚Äì enhanced wifi, improved motion detection, easy installation
review_header_1: So much better than the original.
review_header_5: Update: Over all happy with purchase
review_text_1: Cheaped out the first time and got the original. We had it for about a year and it worked well, but the quality was garbage. So I got this one (ring doorbell 3) and the quality is so much better. I would recommend not getting the original and buying this one.
review_text_2: Don‚Äôt listen to the negative reviews. It was easy to connect to my SmartThings and setting up wifi is similar to google. When you connect to the network you have to disconnect your existing network and connect to the device with your phone or tablet. I was able to connect it through my existing hardwire doorbell and my existing doorbell ring worked as well. You just have to go through the ring app and turn that feature on. The video is clean, vivid and not choppy. I connected to my 5ghz network and the signal works just fine. I tested it multiple times with no issues. When someone rings the device my doorbell rings and my Amazon Alexa announces someone is at the front door. A banner popups up and on it and live view activates. The ring service is $30 a year. I also tried it through my fire tv and when asked show me the front door my TV screen went straight to live view. No app needed. Just remember to add the ring skill on your Alexa software and do a search for the device to add it. Once that‚Äôs done your set. I barely looked at the directions to set all this up.
review_text_3: I moved my 1st generation Ring Doorbell to the back door and installed the Ring Doorbell 3 at the front door. The field of view, responsiveness, sound quality and quality of the picture are much, much better on the Ring Doorbell 3 than the first generation unit. It also limits the motion response to just the area I selected unlike the old unit that over responded and picked up the movement of cars and trucks more than 30 feet away even though I had adjusted it to be less responsive. I'm very satisfied with the new unit.
review_text_4: I installed the device yesterday. It works GREAT and it is simple to set up.Soon we'll look into getting more devices for better home security.
review_text_5: Updated: Sept 11, 2020. Changing to 5-star rating for two reasons, the outstanding customer service, and receiving a replacement that is working 100% the way it should. There were many emails back and forth to try and get my ring 3 working. After trying all possible remedies customer service sent me a new ring 3. I installed it 2 days ago and it is up and running without any of the problems I had in the past. So if you do have a problem rest easy knowing the Ring backs up their product and will make it right.Here's the pros/cons for me. Great picture quality and night vision are the pros, motion detection is really the only con I have. Even though I have set up the detection for the 5-15 feet range and have blocked 3 of the 4 areas you are allowed to it is still picking up traffic going by on the street which is about 40 feet from the door. Short of putting up a wall on my sidewalk (which I am sure the neighbors would love) I do not see any way of fixing this. I notice that many other reviewers have the same problems with setting distance and motion detection. Not sure if Ring will/can do a software fix for this but they should. So I guess that annoying detection is better than none at all.

features: Connect your Ring camera with Alexa then enable announcements to be alerted when motion is detected. Talk to visitors through compatible Echo devices by saying ‚ÄúAlexa, talk to the front door‚Äù.,Lets you see, hear and speak to visitors from your phone, tablet and PC,With a Ring Protect Plan (subscription sold separately), record all your videos, review what you missed for up to 60 days, and share videos and photos.,Sends alerts as soon as motion is detected,Plugs into standard power outlets for non-stop power,Monitors your home in 1080HD video with infrared night vision and Live View,Includes built-in LED light strips and a siren,Includes Lifetime Theft Protection: If your Camera gets stolen, we‚Äôll replace it for free
name: Ring Spotlight Cam Wired: Plugged-in HD security camera with built-in spotlights, two-way talk and a siren alarm, White, Works with Alexa
review_header_1: Honest In-depth Review from a Tech Nerd
review_header_5: I can't say enough good things about this camera and company
review_text_1: I‚Äôm a very big tech junkie and am very intrigued by Ring. I first bought ring doorbell 2 and loved the product and app so I went and purchased the Ring Spot light cam wired. The reason I opted for the wired version was I don‚Äôt like messing with batteries, however if I were to buy the battery version I‚Äôd buy the second battery pack to eliminate down time. The wired version is nice as your getting constant power. Then camera also starts recording motion faster with the wired version versus the battery version.Setup: super simple follow Ring app instructions and you‚Äôll be up in running in 10 mins or lessInstall: I live in Nevada land of stucco homes so it takes a little longer to drill holes and place anchors. The ring mounting bracket comes with a level built in to make install easy ‚ÄúPro tip I learned from my door bell‚Äù once you have the mounting bracket level I used a thin nail to start and mark my pilot holes for when I had to drill, which made the install even easier. Once you have the holes drilled anchors in installing is a breeze. The most time consuming part well for me as I‚Äôm OCD is space the holes for the cable clips. Overall the physical installation took 20 mins do to me being OCC. the cable is paintable to match your house. My stucco is white so it was a non issue.Functionality: in order for Ring,Arlo,Nest ect to work properly will require good WiFi and a good router. All these web based on demand cams require good WiFi if your WiFi or router isn‚Äôt up to par you‚Äôll have a bad experience. I run a NetGear Night Hawk Router that I can pick up WiFi halfway down my street so no range extender needed for me. If you have a big house and your router is on the opposite side of the house from your cameras either buy the chime pro extender or better yet by a mesh WiFi like EERO or Orbi or googles mesh routers ‚Äúyou‚Äôll thank me‚Äù the better WiFi signal the better your devices will operate.The App: The Ring App is super easy and user friendly and about to get even better here with new updates and usability. The app allows you to manually turn the lights on and off sound the siren create customized motion areas ‚Äúa feature the battery version doesn‚Äôt do‚Äù as well as set the motion distance for the lights to come on. While reviewing a motion activity or in live view you have the option to turn the lights on or off as well as sound the siren. The app also keeps you informed of any issues with Rings servers or any downtime or issues with devices. The Ring cloud service is outstanding and it‚Äôs very reasonably priced at $3 a month which is cheap. I don‚Äôt need 24/7 video I only need motion events so $3 a month is a great value. The motion or activity alerts are fast and show up on your phone quickly. The two way communication is nice and clear to tell would be questionable people to buzz off if not the alarm will scare them away and wake your neighbors.Overall I am very satisfied with my Spotlight cam wired and my ring doorbell and plan to add more ring devices very soon, with the upcoming software updates from ring the experience is going to get even better. Again I can‚Äôt reiterate enough you have to have good WiFi and router for this device or any of the competitors devices to work properly. I‚Äôm a very very picky person with electronics and can say Ring Spot light cam wired met and exceeded my expectations.The neighborhoods feature within the app is also a great tool to keep you informed of activity or events within your community. Again I highly recommend this product
review_text_3: I have 4 ring Floodlight cameras in use at another property. I really like them so I was excited to see the new Spotlight camera added to the ring lineup. I tried the ring Stick Up Cam Solar prior to ordering the Spotlight and I ultimately returned it due to being spoiled by the better build quality and overall camera quality of the Floodlight Cam. I included photos to show the field of view comparison between the two. While they aren‚Äôt installed in the exact same location, you can see just how much better the Spotlight Cam looks. As expected, the light output is greater on the Floodlight Cam but the Spotlight Cam does a good job of lighting up the immediate area around the unit. After installing and using my first Spotlight camera, I promptly ordered a second and installed it as soon as it came in. Both have been operating as expected. The camera video quality is great, the field of view is awesome. I have already influenced at least one friend to buy a wired Spotlight Cam and he is just as happy with it. I do wish that ring would add some more customization to their iOS app. It would be great to be able to reorder the cameras in any order you want vs left to right based on order of set up. It would also be nice to know if the motion detector triggered the lights or if the lights are on for extended periods without having to open the app. I found that after losing power at one property while not there that the lights stayed on after power was restored. I just happened to notice they were on when I was in the app and had to manually turn them off. HomeKit compatibility would rock too! Anyway, the Spotlight Cam is great! Way to go Ring!

review_text_1: I like this camera, but setup was troublesome at first. I tried connecting P2P and it wouldn't work. I tried connecting directly on my network, using the included power adapter, and it wouldn't work. I tried connecting it through my Amcrest NVR on a PoE port, and still didn't work. The camera powered on and did its little spin start up move, and then it sat idle. The NVR gave it an IP address, but it was not able to actually connect or view the camera feed.Finally, after unplugging and replugging the camera back in, I was able to connect it, after manually adding it to the NVR and refreshing a few times. I have no idea why the camera was fighting during setup, but it's working great now.The image quality appears to be excellent. The camera adjusts quickly to changes in lighting, and it's responsive when using the PTZ functions. I'm also happy to see that it supports microSD cards up to 128GB, as that has been an issue for me with other security camera devices that wouldn't go above 32GB. One thing to be aware of when selecting a location to mount the camera is that the minimum focus distance is a little bit on the high side when zoomed in at all. This is somewhat to be expected, but you should keep it in mind if you plan on putting it over a door or something and want to be able to see faces.Another thing to consider is that the PTZ motor is not silent. If people are close enough, they will certainly hear it moving in a quiet area. Besides that, the camera itself is HUGE. I was not expecting it to be quite this big. It's at least twice the size of my other security cameras, and it's a bit heavy. Which is great if you need to throw it at an intruder.Overall, it's a great security camera and I'm happy with the purchase.
review_text_2: Needed a PTZ camera for my backyard and decided to splurge on this one thinking I'd just return it if it didn't justify its cost. This is an expensive camera for home use, and I highly recommend it to anyone who needs a PTZ camera. The PTZ is fast and smooth with fine adjustments possible. This camera isn't plagued by the cheaper Amcrest indoor PTZ cameras that often overshoot their mark while trying to position them.The Zoom on this thing is incredible as well (the main reason I needed it). The 20x zoom is no joke and it auto-focuses precisely when zooming. You can control the iris, zoom, and focus all manually if needed as well. This become important if you have a part of the picture that it happens to focus on accidentally.You can do some really cool things with this like face detection, auto patrolling, etc (though I'm not using any of that since I use Blue Iris).All in all, I highly recommend this camera to those who must have zoom/PTZ and can afford the cost.
review_text_3: The camera itself is very well built. It's metal housing is thick and overall I am impressed with the build quality. Keep in mind this camera is quite heavy so plan ahead when finding a location to mount. You can power it by either POE+, direct DC or the included wall wart power plug. The setup of this camera is identical to the other Amcrest cameras. You simply power it on with network connectivity and scan the QR code using the Amcrest View Pro app. Once that is complete an IP is assigned and you can view the camera using a web browser.I run Blue Iris and this camera integrates with BI flawlessly. I can control all the PTZ functions from the BI interface. I very much appreciate how easy all of the Amcrest cameras work with Blue Iris. It makes my life SO much easier.The picture quality is exactly what you'd expect from a 4MP camera. The zoom on this camera is impressive, especially at night. For example,at night while zoomed out an object in the distance (~100ft) is almost not visible. I zoom into the object and suddenly it's lit up like the camera is right in front of it. The automatic light control is so nice.Overall this is an impressive camera with a ton of capability. If you don't run Blue Iris the camera has an SD card slot for local storage or it can save videos to NAS or FTP. The camera can work very well on it's own.
review_text_4: I wanted to update a PTZ camera for my driveway and decided to splurge on this one thinking I'd just return it if it didn't justify its cost. This is an expensive camera for home use, and I highly recommend it to anyone who needs a PTZ camera. The PTZ is fast and smooth with fine adjustments possible. This camera isn't plagued by the cheaper other vendors PTZ cameras that often overshoot their mark while trying to position them.The Zoom on this thing is incredible as well (the main reason I needed it). The 20x zoom is no joke and it auto-focuses precisely when zooming. You can control the iris, zoom, and focus all manually if needed as well.You can do some really cool things with this like face detection, auto patrolling, etc. I have paired it with my Synology Security Center and it works great. It connects fast and integrated perfectly. I have full access of the camera from within Security Center.All in all, I highly recommend this camera to those who must have zoom/PTZ and can afford the cost.
review_text_5: First impression when I received the PTZ was great, looks solid, feels durable, and looks nice. Being a PTZ camera it will weigh more then your average camera, this PTZ comes in almost 7 lbs, so mounting them can be tricky if not thought out ahead of time. Installation wasn‚Äôt bad once I had the game plan. I had no issue powering the camera with POE over cat 6. When the camera powered up, got the ip changed, loaded into my NVR and away with testing. The camera quality is as expected, great clear 4mp image even at night! The PTZ functions work great, with minor delays controlling it through mobile, and again even at night the quality is very clear! I was most surprised with how good the zoom function worked at night while balancing the light and keeping a nice clear image. Even at maximum zoom night or daytime, you get a nice clear 4mp image of what ever you zoom into. Its as if you are right in front of what ever it is you zoomed in on. The other function that I find helpful is ‚Äútour‚Äù. You can set up multiple camera positions and set a time to stay on each position. When you hit play, the camera will automatically ‚Äútour‚Äù those preset camera positions while recording if you want. Overall, I have found the IP4M-1063EW-AI to be a very well-built camera, offer great quality footage, offer great features, and performs great! With that being said, I recommend this camera to anyone that may have a large area that needs camera coverage, or if you need a solid zoom in feature. This camera will get the job done!

review_text_2: The camera is easy to set up, but the software takes a little out. I think it is still worth the cost. Would purchase again.
review_text_4: Fantastic camera!!I loved how easy this was to set up, no big cables to deal with all very straight forward.it works perfectly, I put a 32gb micro SD card into it a week ago and and it‚Äôs still recording every time a person walks past my house, pretty sure it will record the whole month of November and December, maybe more?Love the fact it has a speaker on it, so not only does it record in sound but it also gives the option of speaking through it, if I need to talk to a delivery driver or post man I can.The ability to move it around it fantastic, I can look up and down the street no problem!I‚Äôve even watched my cats with it.The app is very easy to use, I would keep the notifications turned off if you live on a busy street with lots of people because you will get a notification every time someone walks past, but it shows how great it detects people, the app also lets you reduce the sensitivity of detection too which is great if you wanted to keep notifications turned on.It‚Äôs kept it charge all week not loosing any bars of battery life, even though the weather has been pretty awful too not much sun at all but it still held up.Live mode is viewable in SD and HD but I keep it on HD all the time. review_text_2: We have a bird nesting on our balcony. The father is red color, very beautiful and the mother have three baby birds. review_header_5: Completely wireless doorbell camera. (Wiring available if needed too)
review_text_1: I am very impressed by this doorbell camera. The video quality is amazing and crystal clear. We have a long driveway but have two locked gates and a sign post. We installed in a few minutes (have a 5-acre span mesh network system) and it was super simple to connect.There are various ring tones to choose from. The door bell once pressed will start lighting up red and you'll hear a chime. On the receiving end you'll hear the chime you selected as your ringer. The volume from the unit is amazing and can be heard in our entire home.And speaking thru the camera app is an interesting option especially for our setup as we can advise the pin code to the key lock so that authorized visitors can come to our property even when we are not home. My wife also likes the fact that she can work in the garden and still be alerted when not in the house.Follow the simple install procedure like we did and you'll have yourself an awesome doorbell camera! It really shouldn't take the average person to setup and if you ever do run into a problem, the manufacturer has outstanding customer support!
review_text_2: This doorbell camera feels solid and durable. it can be installed in about 5-10 minutes. it includes a free door bell chime that it can be paired with and sends alerts when someone is at the door. it also creates a log so i can check to see who has been at my door. there are several chime options and it places a call to my phone when someone is at the door and i can talk to them even if i'm not home. The picture quality is pretty good and offers standard or high definition as well as night vision and motion detection with an adjustable sensitivity. the seller is very responsive and helpful as well.
review_text_3: The camera looks amazing. High quality. Not cheap at all! It doesn't come with much instructions. Pretty basic. Charge, install it on the cloud app, hook it up to your doorbell system or just keep the box in the middle of your living room so it can be heard. With the app on your phone, any time someone rings, your phone rings. You can also share it with your family members as well so they can view and answer the door when you're away. Also, there are 2 types of quality you can view your camera footage in, SD or HD. HD is great but it would drain your battery faster. SD is basic and all you really need. So keep it on SD until you need HD.
review_text_4: Picture quality is amazing. Night vision is amazing, set up was easy. I mean I'm a woman so it took me some effort to screw the mount into the wall but other than that, super easy to work with. I set my motion detection on 5, that's the mist sensitive, because I live in Apts and ppl like stealing packages etc. .. plus I don't have a peep hole on my door, so I can just view them on the live cam. I love it so far. I hope it lasts and is actually weather proof, I live in Texas and we never know what the weather will be like here. It came with tools to set it up, and a user guide, it doesn't have much instructions but it's really straightforward and easy to set up anyway.
review_text_5: Currently using this wireless on my back door, but it does come with everything to hardwire it as well. The picture is great for a small wireless camera. The motion sensor alerts me when there's movement and you can set the sensitivity. The app allows continuous live viewing and if you have an SD card in or the cloud service than you can view a recorded history of events. The indoor chime has a few different rings and is also completely wireless. It said it has a battery life of about 5 months so I'll update that once I have a chance to run it that long. Overall it's a pretty simple yet effective product. I would recommend it if you're looking for a good deal on a doorbell camera.

review_header_2: Very clear, sensitive and, trouble saving
review_header_3: Great Camera for where power is unavailable
review_text_1: I installed this wireless, solar-powered camera on a north-facing wall. Given the insufficient sunlight, my previous installed camera always run out of power. Thanks to the large solar battery panel, power outrage is no longer a problem, even when the camera was set on a high-power consumption mode. Furthermore, the camera comes with a long micro-USB cable, which makes it possible to connect the camera to an electrical and do 24h continuous recording mode.The installation is straightforward. One of the reasons is that unlike most cameras which only provide a fixed angle, this camera is more flexible to obtain a 360-degree view. So not too much adjustment is needed when installing.The app is easy to use. The camera provides a crispy view, even at night or in stormy weather. It is also possible to record colorful picture at night. The motion/humanoid detection is sensitive. The intercom works great, through which I can speak to the deliverers when I am at work.Cons: While the WiFi signaling could be a limitation, this product does work well with a WiFi extender. In contrast, my previous camera does not.
review_text_2: It helps a lot that it does not require wires. There is not much place for me to plug the camera in if it needs to be plugged in. So the being wireless and solar powered saved me from having to find a place to plug in, from constantly having to buy batteries and, from the hassle from dealing with the wires. Not only that, the recording shows up very clearly on my phone and it is very sensitive to human motion. So I know when someone comes close to my door and i can clearly see who it is. I am also able to speak to the person through the camera. It is very convenient if I am on vacation or at work.
review_text_3: I purchased one of these cameras to keep an eye on my off the grid cabin. I was pleasantly surprised with it. The unit was very easy to install. The picture quality is excellent and the app is easy to use. . The night vison is very strong and clear. I have been impressed with the battery life and have yet to run it down. I like the camera so much I purchased two more for my property. I have them set up outside approximately 200' from the cabin and they work great.The best part about these cameras is their customer service. I had a question about a feature on the app. I received a quick response from their rep and a solution to follow.If you are looking for an affordable, easy to use, wireless CCTV solution these cameras are for you.
review_text_4: You'll want a drill for the holes. I started mine with hammer and nail, then drilled. They provide a paper for drilling the holes, which made it easy. You'll need to charge the solar plate for 3 to 5 hours inside, before installing. Also, important, if you use the micro SD card, insert it first. When pairing the camera to your internet, be about 1 1/2 feet from router. The camera "speaks," and is kind of loud. The trickiest part of installing were the bottom holes. I found that doing the right side first, then let camera rotate and hang down for the 2nd bottom screw made it easier, then do top screws. *** The picture quality is very good, day or night. (I can see the bugs flying at night!) Initially, it took several minutes to get it to connect, but once it connects a few times, it goes quite quickly. Camera rotation works great. Whether at home or away, it works great.
review_text_5: I installed this solar camera in front of the garage door. It can monitor the front of my garage door, the front door, and the grass without blind spots. When someone approaches my door. It will also sound an alarm. Makes me feel a lot safer. It is a colorful picture during the day. At night it is a black and white picture. And this solar energy does not need to install wires. Just install it in a sunny place. Don't worry about installation. Will also buy one to install on my back door.

review_text_1: I wanted something simple for my grandparent's home, which would allow me to be able to check the area while away. I found these and thought they would be a quick and easy answer to my problem.Shipping was quick and easy and everything showed up in great shape.Out of the box, everything looked great. The installation is fairly simple, and it comes with all the required hardware. The batteries will need to be charged a while in order to ensure the battery life is optimal. After charging them overnight, I installed the mounts, slid the battery into place, and followed the instructions on the app. After a short wait everything was set up and ready to go.These have been up for a while now and I have absolutely nothing bag to say. As long as you have wifi boosters around the house, you should not run into any issues with connectivity or lag. The notifications are great, and the video clarity is exactly what I was looking for. Additionally, this system allows you to post possible issues to the neighborhood so your neighbors can be made aware of issues. For example, I recently saw a lady had her package stolen off her front porch and they managed to get the whole thing on video.Overall, I would absolutely recommend these for someone that is looking for a simple solution to a home security video system. This allows you to be literally anywhere and still check on things around the property. I would am extremely happy with this product and will continue to do business with them in the future.
review_text_2: Love these cameras. I bought the 2 pack 7 weeks and 1 day ago when I discovered someone was peeking in our windows and testing our locks, and just had to change the battery today. The front camera goes off 4ish times per day (when we go to and get home from work), and the battery was at 5% this morning. Our back porch camera goes off about 1-2 times per week and was at 37% this morning. I live in upstate NY so these cameras were installed in single-digit weather, and the batteries have now lasted through into the warmer 50-60 degree days. I'm amazed at how long the battery life has lasted and the quality of the video. I love that I can see my packages get delivered (the delivery man even waves at the camera), the quality of the video is amazing, and I can go back and watch old footage as well as go to a live view whenever want. The spotlight is great for helping with night vision and I love that I can talk to whoever is in front of the camera. Definitely recommend. Purchased a second battery for each camera to extend the battery life (have not put them in yet; this review is on a single battery in each camera) and look forward to getting 3+ months of battery life out of each camera.
review_text_3: I was reluctant to have to spend any money on outside cameras but all my research pointed me to Ring products. Price point on the wireless spotlight cameras is excellent and once I got the cameras, installation was so easy. I have had them about a week and everything works well. Only major complaint that needs to be addressed asap by the company is recording time. We need full event recording rather than short clips. Only recording the first 30 seconds does nothing if a burglar or nefarious person waits 30 seconds to rob you. It should at least start re-recording after the 30 sec period if motion is still detected. This can mean the difference between catching a thief or not. It must be addressed immediately! If they fix that then they will have a much better rating!
review_text_4: FOLLOW-UPJust when I thought I was Ringless, I finally spoke to a Ring rep over the phone and was very pleased with the next step. Not only did Ring understand my frustration, they were aware that my camera was not displaying. Ring sent me a replacement camera and emails wanting to know more. A review of a company should note the wrong and a follow up when they make it right. I recommended Ring to my friends and family when I bought it in 2019, I standby their product therefore "I" standby my Endorsement. Thanks RING!
review_text_5: I love these, and how easy they integrated with the ring door bell we already had, After they arrived, I realized based on placement, they option of 2 batteries versus one was the way to go, so I didn't have to keep on getting up on the ladder and charging, (which takes several hours) and be without coverage.The wifi even when it was 7 feet away with a window between, we had problems connecting, I would get a notification, and moments later it might pull up. That too is random when it does that.The motion is fabulous, I had to place one really high to capture the back yard 2 stories up, and it catches everything, to the point I had to scale back sensitivity, and shut off one side of it, as my tree would move. One thing I would love to see Ring do with these, is allow you to draw out the objects triggering the motion sensor like on the door bell. This one, you just turn of sections.Overall, I wouldn't hesitate to consider these, just know going in the things that are small hiccups.

name: 3G/4G LTE Outdoor Solar-Powered Celluar Security Camera, Wirefree Rechargeable Battery Camera System w/SD Socket and Cloud, 1080p Night Vision, 2-Way Talk, PIR Motion Sensor, REOLINK Go+Solar Panel
review_header_1: Up load app on any smartphone to work with the camera
review_header_2: The best camera for remote locations!
review_header_4: Nice quality and love the ability to view live video when I want
review_header_5: Setup not easy - but overall a great camera
review_text_2: Amazing camera! Easy to set up. Easy to modify the settings via the app. The microphone is exceptional, I can hear things on the app like if I were standing where the camera was mounted.. The 1080p is crystal clear! Solar panel option and the fact it's on a data plan makes it super versatile! I bought an additional 2 since!
review_text_3: Got a Mint Mobile SIM for this cam. Setup was a breeze. Had to reboot the cam twice to get the SIM to activate (not a big deal). Battery is 75%+ every morning and is fully charged on solar every evening. Image quality is great. Android & iPad apps are excellent and easy to use. Motion sensing is slightly lacking as it is a PIR sensor and not image motion recognition. Camera only records motion events triggered by the PIR sensor so if you need constant recording you will need wired cameras and an NVR. Overall I'm very satisfied!
review_text_4: I bought this camera to monitor a remote renovation project and it works great. No power needed, no wifi required. It works on the rechargable battery & solar panel. At first I bought two tmobile sim cards from a seller on Amazon, but the sim cards would not work and the camera kept saying Sim card Not Recognized. I went to two different Tmobile stores and called customer service (45-minute call) and no one was able to help. I did not want to give up on the camera and I instead decided Tmobile was not the right route for me. I went to Target and picked up a FreedomPop Sim Card $9.99 - Free Basic Plan & GSM SIM Kit and it works great! The set up, from the time of using the FreedomPop was very fast, simple and easy and I am grateful at the quality and ease of the camera. I purchased two of them and would definitely recommend.
review_text_5: Update:changed my rating to 5 stars. The limited sim card options and reception problems are the cell companies issues not the camera manufacturer. The camera works reliably. Just took two days to set it up finding a pre-paid data provider.Also you are able to use an external battery pack to charge your camera.Nick of time! Most importantly be patient, the setup of the sim card is not a breeze it will take time and try your patience. T-mobile prepaid data sim cards are nearly non-existent as they are moving to a different platform. AT&T pre-paid works. What I recommend as steps to follow for setup. 1. Receive your camera/charge the battery right away. 2. Take your camera to the cellular store you plan on using for data. Set it up with the clerk and test it right there before you leave. Now the hard part is done, be sure your carrier is a GSM and supports WCDMA and FDD LTE. DO NOT EXPECT to receive your Amazon box and use the camera right away. I came to use this camera because I was looking for something multifunctional and reliable and I got that. Our old wifi camera died and cellular gives you a lot more flexibility. I was impressed with the solar panel and construction of the camera. I received the camera Tuesday night, set it up Wednesday night, caught the foal being born Thursday morning. Also audio is good and decent battery length. You should have a micro SD card to install right away. Overall a great camera, I'd give it five stars if it was easier to find a sim card that worked with it.
