name: Solar Powered Outdoor Security Cameras Wireless, ZUMIMALL Solar Panel WiFi Wireless Cameras for Home Security, 1080P Outdoor Cameras, Night Vision, 2-Way Talk, Motion Detection, Waterproof, Cloud/SD
review_header_5: A solid security camera at a great price
review_text_1: This is my 3rd Zumimall camera after I started using their products in 2019. In general, I've always liked the simplicity of the setup and the ease with which different settings can be customized in the app. I bought my first camera in 2019, second one in 2020 and the third one now. The wire-free advantage is totally worth it, if you disregard the minor inconvenience of having to take it down charge it every few months. This solar-powered camera provides a perfect solution to that, especially if you have to mount it in a place which requires some effort to remove and put up again. The product is not TOTALLY wire-free now since you have a small cable running from the solar panel to the camera, but this in my opinion is a perfectly acceptable compromise. They also have a rubber seal where the USB cable plugs into the camera body, so it is indeed waterproof.Since they moved to the Zumimall app from the previous Cloudedge, I've found the alarms and the settings are relatively more stable. I'm able to see all my cameras on one screen and each of them can be configured with my preferred alarm interval and motion detection sensitivity. These work really well, I've found a "medium" motion detection sensitivity and 2 minute alarm interval works best for me.Make sure you get a Micro SD card (a small capacity one will do) so it can record videos once the alarm is triggered. You either need a micro SD card or a subscription to their cloud service to record videos. I don't use their two way communication feature much but have tested it and can confirm it works well.In short, totally worth the price compared to some other cameras on the market. I'd recommend without hesitation.
review_text_2: This camera has been great. The image quality is very clear. I love the solar panel attachment to keep it charged at all times. The two way talk is an excellent feature to be able to talk to someone outside of your house. I also like the motion detection to alert me if something or someone is in my driveway. This works great when waiting on food delivery or company. This camera also has night vision that is very easy to see out of. The app is easy to use and the camera was very easy to connect.
review_text_3: I bought this camera to cover the other entrance to the house after having already purchased another model from Zumimall for the main entrance.I was intending to just grab the exact same model as the other camera until I noticed that this new model comes with a solar charger, which will allow me to not have to manually charge this camera. I was even able to save a little money by having the solar charger included, instead of having to order one later.So is this camera as good or better than their previous model? Yes! This camera is amazing. The setup is super simply. You literally just download the Zumimall app, turn on the camera, and follow the step by step instructions in the app. The instructions are well written in English (not looking like someone used google translator) and even include troubleshooting for each selection.From the beginning of downloading the app, turning on the camera, entering a email address & password for your account, and the couple of steps to connect to the camera, you will not spend over 2 minutes in the entire process. They really made the setup fast and foolproof.The mounting of both camera and solar panel is very simply and sturdy. You wont ever wonder if high winds are going to rip them away.The picture and audio quality of the camera is excellent. The app will even allow you to change to a full screen view if you want a larger view. The night vision is perfect as well and you really get amazing detail in both day and night time. I like that you can zoom in on live views if you see something far off. The mic system is very good and clear.One thing that was improved in the app was the ability to ''select all'' recordings to delete, instead of individually selecting each one. I also like the ability to use the alarm feature if you want to.Overall the camera is a great buy, and so far does everything I was wanting it to. If I have any issues, I will update this review.
review_text_4: This is my THIRD ZUMMIMALL camera and I absolutely love it! They are super easy to operate with simple controls. Tons of features and yet easy to navigate. Everything has been thought of with the camera and in the app. The range to catch the WiFi signal is EXCEPTIONAL. The camera is mounted on my shop and the router is in my house (you can see the long distance from the pics). With it being solar-powered, you can set it and forget it. Every time I get into my Jeep it alerts me, which is the whole point of having it. I have another brand camera that doesn't have nearly the amount of features, the app is confusing, and its battery drains after about a month (supposed to last around three months). I definitely recommend this camera and hands down recommend this manufacturer, ZUMMIMALL!!
review_text_5: For its price, this is a robust security camera that works as advertised, with only a few minor quirks.The setup is very easy and only took a couple of minutes to pair the camera with the Zumimall app on my iPhone. The camera connects to whatever wi-fi signal your phone is using at the time of setup, as long as its a 2.4GHz signal‚Äîit is not compatible with 5GHz wi-fi.Once the camera is linked to the app, it shows up as a device that you can select. Once selected it typically takes a few seconds to load the stream. Occasionally it takes a little longer or fails to connect and I have to retry, but this could easily be an issue with my Asus wifi mesh system‚Äîits difficult to say just yet.The stream is HD and looks good with nice colors during the day. When you turn your phone to landscape, the stream goes full screen. I‚Äôd say it looks like a solid 1280x720 image, but not sharp enough to look like 1920x1080, probably do to optics limitations or compression. You can also switch to SD, presumably to use less bandwidth if desired.Once the camera is streaming to the app, you can choose between a ‚ÄúLive‚Äù tab or a ‚ÄúHistory‚Äù tab which will show a list of any recordings the camera has made to the micro SD card (sold separately). The micro SD card is a little tricky to put in or take out because the slot is slightly inset on the back of the camera. I end up using tweezers to insert or remove it.There is also a ‚ÄúCloud‚Äù tab to review cloud recordings if you are paying for the close service, which is $4.99 per month per camera. There is no way to manage your cloud recordings though. It would be nice if there was a way to delete certain recordings if you so desired, but there does not seem to be an interface for that. It would also be nice if you could review and manage recordings through a web browser login. Bottom line is I would like to feel more in control of my recordings.The recordings are triggered by motion detection, which has a sensitivity setting from 1 to 10. When set to 9, I was getting a good deal of recordings triggered by minor events, or perhaps rustling tree leaves. You can also specify how long each motion detection event is recorded‚Äî10seconds, 20seconds, or 30seconds‚Äîand wether or not you want an interval between alarm events (none, 2 minutes, 5 minutes, or 10 minutes). I keep the interval turned off so that a new recording can begin just a second or 2 after the last recording ends, if motion is still being detected. On the downside, I‚Äôve found that the first 2 or 3 seconds of motion are not recorded, presumably while the camera activates its record function, which means the camera is not continuously buffering video.The recordings on the SD card can be viewed in the app wether or not you are at home or somewhere out in the world and wether using wi-fi or on cellular data. There is no additional setup for this, it just works.Event recordings can be saved to your phone‚Äôs album by playing back a video and pressing a record button in the app. This saves the video to an album within the app, and from there the video can be exported to your phone‚Äôs album. Its a bit cumbersome, but it does allow you to record just the bits you want.The app will send you notifications every time a motion detection event occurs, or you can turn that off in the camera settings. You can also turn it off in your phone‚Äôs notification settings. If you do that, but keep the notifications turned on in the camera settings, you will get audible motion alerts if the app is opened.One big checkmark in the plus category is the company‚Äôs responsiveness. They have been answering my email questions within a day or 2.As for the solar panel, it works. I installed the camera 3 weeks ago, and as of yesterday evening, the battery shows 5 out of 5 bars. It was 4 out 5 bars a few days ago, but then I realized that as we are moving closer to winter, the solar panel was becoming shaded by a neighbor‚Äôs tree earlier and earlier in the afternoon. So I moved the panel a few few to compensate. The camera comes with about 7 (estimated) feet of wire to allow the solar panel to be moved away from the camera to a more optimum location.The two-way audio works, but it is subject to network lag, plus the volume is not all that loud if the camera is outdoors, which is not surprising for a speaker inside a small camera.Night vision also works well and looks good, and the camera can be set to automatically switch to night vision when the ambient light levels have dropped.You can link multiple cameras to the app and monitor multiple cameras on screen at the same time.

Professional customer service team at your needs with any concerns.
name: 2K Security Camera,LaView Security Cameras Wireless Outdoor,Security Camera System with 270-Day Battery Life,AI Human Detection,Clear Night Vision,IP66 Weatherproof,Works with Alexa
review_header_2: 2K video quality security camera with cordless option
review_header_3: Wonderful product for a very decent price.
review_header_4: Easy Setup and Great Picture Quality
review_header_5: Nice system without the monthly charge
review_text_1: Recently, both of my neighbors' cars have been broken into and they stole everything they could in their cars, including chump changes, to fishing gears, sunglasses, etc... It's getting pretty ridiculous since the cops couldn't do anything. My front door and front yard camera caught them in the act, but it was way too far to see anything clearly or get a good read of the thieves' license plate... Thus, the reason I got this camera set. Both cameras have built-in battery and it last pretty long on a full charge. I have them up for almost a month, and battery is at around 85% right now. It's very small, very compact and white so they blend in well in my tree (where I attached these cameras on the tree trunk near my front gate, so I can have better video footage of the street and side walk in front of my house). I also like this setup with a central hub, because the captured videos and photos are stored on the micro SD card on the hub (which is sitting inside my house), in case thieves spot the cameras and trying to steal the camera, I can still have the footage to give to authority or insurance claims. I have the central hub sitting inside my house, which is about 100 feet away from the cameras, and the signal quality is at around 60%, which is pretty stable to ensure no losses in captured video/photo transferring. The phone app also notifies me anytime it detects a motion and send me a snapshot when motion was detected. It works very well so far. Hopefully, next time something happens in front of my house, I can get a clearer footage to provide to authority.
review_text_2: This is a great security camera option for those who doesn't want to drill holes in the walls for wires.It comes with 2 cameras that has rechargeable batteries, which can be charged using USB-C cable.The battery supposed to last up to 270 days, which is pretty impressive but I'm sure it will be shorter if it constantly detects motions all day long. Ideally this type of camera is good for places where there should not be any motion other than potential intruders.The setting up the camera with the free app for my iPhone was pretty straight forward. You do have to sign up and create a free account in order to use the app and camera.By default, it asks you to connect to your router using ethernet cable but there's also an option to connect via wireless, which is what I did. I always use GUEST wireless SSID access point for anything that needs my home wireless access.After I successfully setup the app, I was playing around with the camera in my hand and immediately received few notifications about motion and human detection then a loud alarm went off few times. It turns out that it has a Tamper Alarm, which is great since alarm will go off if intruder tries to turn off or turn the camera around. The Tamper Alarm can be disabled from the setting in the app.The video quality was impressive and the app is very intuitive. It shows the battery level as well as wireless signal strength. The base station is what connects to your wireless and has the microSD card for video recording. The 2 cordless cameras communicate with the base station so they will work fine as long as they are close to the base station.You have the option to purchase the subscription to store the video recordings in the cloud but I don't think this is needed since all recordings will be in the base station, which is inside your house so even if the camera is tampered, they can't get to the recorded video files unless they break into the house. Hopefully, you will get the notification when it detects the intruders and take action to scare them off.The cordless feature of this security camera is the main attraction for me. I can place this cameras in different places and move them around as needed. I don't like to have security camera permanently mounted since it makes it appear like I have a reason to keep intruders out but I do want to set up it up when I'm going out of town or vacation since that's when I need it the most.Overall, I'm very happy with it and it's well designed in both hardware and software app. 5 out of 5 stars!
review_text_3: This camera was purchased for usage in my front door. I work the night shift and needed a camera to keep a watch on the door and garage while I was gone. I needed a camera that runs on batteries and connects to WiFi so that I wouldn't have to make holes in the walls for electricity and Internet. I ordered this camera since it met all of my needs. Before using it for the first time, I fully charged it for a few hours. I started setting up after I was sure it was completely charged. To begin, you must first download the app and register, which takes only a few minutes. Then, once the app is ready, switch on the camera and show the QR code from your phone screen to the camera, which will immediately connect.The app itself is excellent; you can choose between HD and SD photos, as well as capture screen shots and video to save to your phone. You can enable motion detection and receive notifications when your phone detects movement. I've only had it for a few days and the battery is still charged, so I can't comment on battery life, but I'll update my review to let everyone know how long it lasts before I have to charge it again. I am extremely pleased with this small camera, and it has behaved as predicted thus far, so I give it 5 stars!
review_text_4: I've had these LaView security cameras for over a week now and am very impressed. The setup instructions were clear and easy to follow. I already had the LaView app on my phone so it took only a few minutes to plug in the base station and pair the cameras. The cameras came fully charged so that was a bonus. The cameras have some weight to them an feel well made. One thing to note: they come with the tamper alarm set on so it goes off while setting them up. Need to turn that off while placing them. It's great that they are wireless and I don't have to run wires to them or plug them in. I placed one on a tree overlooking my garage and front entryway to alert me when packages or guests arrive as we live in the country at the end of a long driveway. Works great so far and the picture quality is fantastic despite the fact that the camera is quite a ways from the base station. Even the night vision shots are clear. I use my cell phone to do live checks of the house when I'm away and the alert notifications work well.I like that they use a base station to link multiple cameras rather than each one operating independently.The app on my phone works well and is easy to navigate but the functions are not fully explained in the supplied instructions. There is a good YouTube video that explains all their functions though. I like that the app displays signal strength and battery level as well as having a human detection feature to minimize false alarms.I had a question on using the MicroSD card and emailed LaView support. The response was quick and Professional.All in all - a great product and excellent support.
review_text_5: I'm reviewing the dual camera system with the base station. There was no memory card that was included with the system but I was able to successfully use a 128GB Samsung micro sd card in the base station. The system is capable of handling up to 4 cameras but for the time being, I'm just using the two that were supplied with the system.The template that is included in the box was easy to use and I was able to drill into the side of the house for one of the cameras and another into a tree without any difficulties. The cameras are about 30 feet away from the base station and I have not had any connectivity issues with them.Charging the cameras was painless and easy. So far it seems that the battery has only gone down slightly over the past 5 days with roughly 25 detections per camera per day. The ability to use the app on my iPhone to view these cameras is nice! Previous to this I have also bought the two package of the moving indoor camera which had the 32GB cards included inside them. Those do not require this basestation.Overall, I feel that this is a good system and the alerting has been manageable and not obtrusive where the cameras are positioned. I will be attempting to change where they are pointed to reduce the amount of alerts. Quite a feature rich device and had all of the features that I was looking for.

features: See, hear and speak to people from your phone, tablet or select Echo device with Stick Up Cam Battery, a battery-powered camera that can be mounted indoor or out.,With Live View, you can check in on your home any time through the Ring app.,With a Ring Protect Plan (subscription sold separately), record all your videos, review what you missed for up to 60 days, and share videos and photos.,Place on a flat surface or mount to a wall with the versatile mounting bracket. Add-on the Mount for Stick Up Cam (sold separately) for ceiling mount.,Watch over your entire home by connecting one or multiple Stick Up Cams to all your Ring devices in the Ring app.,Easily setup Stick Up Cam Battery by inserting the battery pack and connecting to Wi-Fi.,For added peace of mind, pair with Alexa to help you keep an eye on your home.
name: Ring Stick Up Cam Battery ‚Äì see every corner of your home from anywhere ‚Äì White
review_header_2: Read this if you're having connection or audio/video/notification difficulties  ***UPDATED at end***
review_header_4: Works okay so far but the Windows apps doesn't work at all
review_header_5: Bad Reviews = People not Reading Instructions
review_text_1: I have a much better security camera system for my home's exterior but thought I might try one of these cams indoors since I have the Ring alarm system and a Ring Doorbell already. I made the silly mistake, I guess, of assuming there would be some kind of integration with other Ring products - there isn't. None. Not a single thing.It seems like common sense to me that they'd integrate in a couple of ways. I assumed that I'd be able to tell these cameras to only sense motion if the alarm was armed. Nope.I figured I could at least set it to detect motion when I wasn't in the house. Nope. There isn't even any kind of proximity setting for it to even know if you're home or not. They are not location aware in any way. The Ring alarm system isn't either, so I suppose I should have known better already.I also assumed that if my Ring alarm went off the cameras would automatically come on and start recording. Nope!The only motion option at all is to not alert you to motion during specific hours. Note, this doesn't stop motion detection during these hours, it only stops the alerts.Motion detection/recording is only an on or off thing... absolutely no options whatsoever.Annoyed by the lack of integration I still mounted the camera in my great room. I figured I try it for a few days and see how long the battery would actually last with motion recording on. This is a high traffic area so I wasn't holding my breath... and sure enough, after not even 1 full day the battery is down to 80%. This is with all the 'battery saving options' on. This was only a test as I don't actually want recording of any kind going on in my house while I'm home unless the alarm is armed or going off.With absolutely no options, no integration with Ring alarm and no settings to limit it's recording this thing is really only good for one thing; on demand video with no automatic recording. So, the thing is turned off now, doing nothing. I can still activate it from my phone to occasionally check my house isn't burning down.Hopefully someday Ring will update the software and provide some common sense integration with it's other devices.This is all a shame as the build of the camera is quite good considering the low price as is the video quality. The audio isn't great but it never is on cameras of any kind.***UPDATE***Ring support reached out to me directly almost immediately after I posted my review (Good on them) and told me how to link the Alarm, somewhat, to the camera. You have to go into your Base Station settings, then linked devices, then you can set the cameras to record when the alarm goes off - but only then. Make sure you have the updated app that just came out to do this. I didn't. Again, the setting is in your base station, not in the cameras.This solved probably the biggest issue I had with the camera. The rest of my review is still accurate though per Ring support. Hopefully they'll add the other much needed features in the near future.***ANOTHER UPDATE***From Ring Support: "The Modes feature will be released in November and will allow you to have the option to record motion only if the Ring Alarm System is set to Away Mode". This will be a great update and should have been available on launch. I wonder if they are only just now thinking of it from all the negative feedback and reviews, but glad it's 'coming soon' either way.***ONE MORE UPDATE***Ring provided me early access to the 'Modes Feature' and I've been using it for the past few days. It resolves all the issues I had with the alarm integration. With modes you can set your cameras to only record when your alarm is set. They can all be set independently and act differently depending on if you have your alarm set to off, home, or away. For instance, you can set your exterior cameras to record when your alarm is set to home mode, but have your interior cameras are turned off. You can set your interior cameras to only record while in away mode, etc. etc. Or any combination. The cameras can now be set the same way motion and door sensors can. This is a great improvement. They haven't told me exactly when this feature will be made public but have said it will be released 'by the end of the year'.I've increased the rating from 3 stars to 5. This software update really has resolved every issue I had with the cameras. I've now ordered and installed an additional 6 for my home.***LAST UPDATE***Having the modes features and my cameras set to only pop on and record during an alarm event (which is rare) and be off at all other times, I've had 2 months to evaluate battery life, almost exactly 60 days now. All my cameras were down to below 10% battery level when I checked them last night. Given the rate of battery drain I had expected them to last 3 months - though 2+ still isn't bad. I have two external cameras on my entry gates outside with the solar panel add-on, they stay fully charged at all times even though it's pretty much been non-stop dark and cloudy days here since installation. They are set to record all motion and since they point at a street they record events dozens of times per day... so if you're thinking of getting the solar panels for outdoor use, I highly recommend them.
review_text_2: Before I start my revised review, let me state that there's been a lot of news lately about people hacking into Ring cameras, but this only happens when someone installs a new camera and doesn't update the default username and password (or has an extremely weak password which is easy for a hacker to guess). This is like leaving your front door open while on vacation. Your camera is sending and receiving signals over a wireless network. Anyone within range of the signal can potentially be a threat if you don't have good encryption (username and good password) set up on your camera. There's no logical reason for a Ring owner to not do this. Ring even stresses changing the default settings during the initial setup process. Bottom line, don't blame the car manufacturer if you leave the keys in your car and it gets stolen.----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Recently, I wrote a rather scathing 1 star review about the problems I was having with my new Ring Stick Up Wireless Battery Cam. I'm no stranger to wireless cams, having 10 hooked up and running seamlessly on another network as I write this, but I was totally frustrated with the connection reliability, not only with my two upper end cellphones, but also on my Galaxy Tab and Amazon Show. More times than not, the software wouldn't connect with the camera but when it did, the video was choppy. Notifications were also hit and miss. I have a great wireless mesh router system throughout the house, so after doing all the troubleshooting I could think of, I assumed it was due to faulty hardware or software. I gave up and started the return process through Amazon. It was a new product after all and new products sometimes are really buggy. Plus, I read other negative reviews which seemed to justify my thoughts and actions.Then I got an email from a gentleman from Ring saying he read my review and asked if I'd be willing to let him help troubleshoot my issues with me. Although I had already started the return process, I was willing. It was refreshing to know Ring Customer Service was genuinely interested in troubleshooting possible defects in their newest product.Together, we isolated the issue within about 20 minutes. It turned out it wasn't the camera or software after all.Anyone having connection issues should do what he advised me to do. Open up the Ring app and click on the 3 little dots to the upper right of the camera screenshot, then select settings. From there go to Device Health and check the signal strength. Although I had a good mesh hub (inside) within 10 feet of my camera (mounted outside), my signal strength was RSSI -64. He stated that the signal was so weak it was on the cusp of what is needed for the camera to even minimally operate. This prompted me to reboot my wireless mesh system and reset/reconnect the camera. When it came back online, my signal strength went to -39, a vast improvement.A quick check of all of my devices showed the camera and software working flawlessly. Hat's off to Ring.Anyone who may be having connection or audio/video/notification difficulties, check your signal strength to the camera via the Ring software, even if your router is close by. You just might be surprised.***UPDATE***Camera (and software) is still working flawlessly on all devices.Ring has now updated their Windows 10 desktop app (which previously didn't work with the new wireless battery cams) and it works flawlessly as well.Observations.Notifications on my phone, Tab and Amazon devices (Show, Echo, Dot) are almost instantaneous. Alexa says "Someone is at your front door." Very cool.I bought an extra battery, but it looks like it'll be at least a few months before I need to swap it out, even with the intensive testing I've done on the Stick Up Cam. Battery life seems excellent.I have one zone blocked out and that seems to work fine as well. I also have it mounted a couple of feet above and to the left of my front door, tilting downward at an angle. Even though residential traffic is visible in the field of view, I've not gotten one trigger due to street activity. The motion sensor is triggered by anything coming into the bottom half of it's field of view. From the time someone triggers the motion sensor until the time I'm aware of it is 1-2 seconds. That's about as close to real time as you can get. It's not given me a false alarm even once.Telling my Amazon Show to "(Alexa), show front door cam" takes about 5 seconds to complete.I can also watch triggered video clips and get a live feed while away from home without any extra setup to my network. It's totally automatic.Because of the customer service I received from Ring and the fact the product is much better than I originally thought, I will be expanding my Ring family soon.
review_text_3: Had the camera up and running in less than ten minutes. Excellent quality picture. Hooking up to the solar panel when installing, this way battery is always charged. Received mounting hardware, camera has been installed.
review_text_4: Installed 2 of these outside my house in about 20 minutes. Mounted one above my garage and the other near my front door. The video quality is pretty good. Not facial recognition software good but good enough for a good description of people if needed. I used the mounts that came will the camera and scanned the QR code for setup. Not sure why people couldn't set up zones. It is part of the setup unless you skip over the steps. I do agree with most reviews that the notifications are spotty. Took my trash out and the one by the garage only recorded me going to the side of the house and the one by the front door only recorded me coming back. A neighbor walked by this morning and it started recording after they walked by and were down the street. Pic attached. Went outside again and the both cameras picked me up as I would have expected. I will adjust the camera and reset the zones to see if that helps. They are my first Ring cameras so there may be fine tuning on my part that is needed. Will update this as the days go by.Windows 10 app logs me in but says I don't have any cameras set up. Tried on a PC and 2 laptops. Please fix!!Phone apps are pretty good so far. (Samsung note 9)Updating to 5 Stars.....After adjusting my zones and motion settings I was able to get the results I needed. At one point the wind blew leaves across my driveway and my sensor went off. After fine tuning I see no issues with the camera and its performance. It is by far better than other cameras I have purchase over the years and after comparing subscriptions from other companies $10 a month or $100 is a deal.
review_text_5: Don‚Äôt let any negative reviews influence your decision to buy these cameras. The negative reviews are from people who have not read the instructions or just have no idea how a security camera works. I monitor 16 security cameras where I work so I have a lot of experience with them. I bought the Ring Stick up camera and the solar charger for it as well. They both work great. I bought two more a week later. Now a month later I have no issues with battery power loss of any kind. Just set your zones to cover what you want. Don‚Äôt put motion sensor on full or you will catch bugs and falling leaves. I set my sensitivity in the middle. The image quality day and night is pretty good. You can also look at your cameras from a computer as well as your phone. You don‚Äôt need an Alexa to use these. The microphone works well too. Overall I would highly recommend these if you just read and understand the instructions and how they work which is very simple and easy.MD in SC 1-1-21

review_header_5: The camera is very good. I likedit so much.
review_text_1: This camera has a great interface and a great mobile app. I can pull it up in seconds, move it about, talk two ways since it has both a mic and a speaker built-in, and generally do anything I'd like with a standalone camera. But the best part comes if you have a Reolink NVR because the camera can be plugged straight in or used over wifi to record to the NVR and to be controlled by it. I just got my NVR, so I haven't tried that out yet, but I'm very excited to have these around my house! The only downside is that it doesn't support PoE, so if you want a clean one-wire install, this is the wrong camera.
review_text_2: Ive got a couple other reolink cameras and this one is so far the best! The quality of the video is great and even at night.The cops came to my across the street neighbor's house today and they were asking me about who was there today. I was able to pull up video clips from the times they asked so quickly I think the cops were impressed lol.All in all a great camera!
review_text_3: This is a great camera. Zooms. Wired to internet and electricity. Very dependable.
review_text_4: The picture is really good, it pans and too it‚Äôs flawlessly, i have it hooked up to my nvr and it‚Äôs definitely worth the money, idk why the other reviews are negative, it really is good !
review_text_5: Very easy to instal, good material, good lens.I like when (after traking) it comeback to a point aready seted.Very good video image.Timeline Recording could be better to use and understand, maybe next app update they can make it better.Dificult to setup to avoid false alarms, bur I am working on it ajusting areas, objects, cars, etc.

description: Size:4 Count (Pack of 1) Setting Up Your Camera With YI Home App 1.Install YI Home App and create a YI Home Account 2.Turn your camera on and select the '+' icon in YI Home App to add your camera 3.Select your Wi-Fi network and enter your Wi-Fi password, then select Connect to Wi-Fi 4.Scan the QR Code shown on the app, then select Next once the QR Code has scanned 5.Select Save, then select Start using to finish pairing 6.If connection failed, please push the Reset button and try again WiFi Settings 1.YI Home cameras will need to connect to a 2.4GHz band network. 5GHz WiFi band is not supported 2.Turning on the location service on the phone if you encounter Unknown SSID issue 3.Encryption mode must be set to WPA/WPA2 (mixed mode) or WPA2 4.Your Wi-Fi password must be 8-20 characters in length If you have any other problem, please contact us via support@yitechnology.com.

review_text_1: Alright, so I'm a tech guy, love anything electronic! I have had CCTV cameras in my house for years. I've been using Swann wired cameras for the most part with mixed emotions. But running new wires to upgrade the system just didn't excite me.I had been looking at NEST cams since I have the smart Thermostats and Smoke/Carbon-monoxide detectors for a while, but the price is ridiculous! Plus your only option with them is cloud service (an additional cost). Then I spoke with a neighbor who sent me a screen shot from his YI camera. I must say, the quality was pretty impressive.So I bought a four pack for $119.00 with moderate expectations. Let me tell you I'm super impressed with the picture quality of these cameras. Set up is quick and easy. When I purchased them I had no idea they had audio as well. The audio quality is incredible, plus it's a two way speaker. Purchased 32 GB SD cards for all of them so I didn't need to use cloud storage and it's been working great! I have them set to record all motion and I usually have about 7 days of history on each camera.Day and night vision are both spectacular IMO. I have attached several photos so you can see the quality both day and night. Side note, I have a couple "indoor cams" mounted outside. To do this I purchased a rubber sleeve/cover from Amazon to make the drop cam weather resistant for outdoor application. It's been through rain, sleet and snow with out issue so far. Link to cover: https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07FD5XHMP/ref=oh_aui_detailpage_o09_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=1A couple cons, the power cable is sooooooo short. I had to purchased longer cables for a couple of my installs. No biggie, they are only a few dollars here on Amazon. The app for iOS is very functional, but it has no multi camera view which would be a nice option.
review_text_2: So I have been using the Yi 1080p indoor camera system for 2 weeks now and I LOVE IT! The camera's are crystal clear during the day and are just as sharp in night mode. The added features of being able to hide any "lights" such as the blue power light and the typical red IR lights for night vision makes "hiding" these cameras a breeze. The playback function works great and give you the time in hours, minutes & seconds. The 2 way talk feature works great and has 2 modes, 1 is a push to talk feature where when you press the button you cannot hear what the person on the camera is saying and the 2nd is a continuous talk where you and the person on the camera can talk back and forth without pressing any buttons (love this feature) the 32gig on board storage is also a great bonus. Like I said I have been using the cameras for about 2 weeks and have barely used 3 gigs of space. (for an idea of the amount of traffic, it's just me, my wife and our 2 pets) so the cameras don't get a ton of action during the week. But are always recording on any motion. (I do not subscribe to the cloud storage as for I haven't seen a need) Anytime you get an alert it will store it on the app and you can upload it to your mobile device and share it with others. The initial motion detection clip is only 6 seconds, but if you wait till the end of the 6 seconds you will get an option to "view entire motion" which will bring up that camera, rewind to when it first detected the motion and play it back until there is no longer any motion, GREAT feature. All of the features seem to work as expected, you can set times for your camera to alert you when it detects motion and zones so that your dog walking around doesn't keep triggering the alerts. I can say the motion detection is VERY sensitive. You can set the setting to low, medium or high but really I can't tell a difference low to high. I have one camera facing out of my front window and it picks up shadows, car lights, leaves blowing, etc. Not a big deal, but on a windy day I can get a ton of alerts. The app works great, you can set a PIN or use your fingerprint to log into the cameras so in the event your phone is stolen, unless they have your PIN or fingerprint they will not be able to pull up your cameras. Connecting them was very simple and took less than 5 minutes per camera. Plug them in, scan the UR code and they will automatically connect to the network your phone is connected to. The packaging was very nice, didn't feel cheap. All cameras were individually wrapped along with all of the accessories. Comes with instruction booklet for assistance with installing/setup. The camera (black part) can be removed from the white base and mounted in different areas. They also sell (separately) wall mounts for the cameras. (cheap, like $10-$15 for a 4 pack) or you can stand them up anywhere you like (they have a round rubber grip on the bottom to help keep them from sliding around. All 4 cameras come with a USB cord and power brick. The USB cord is about 10-12 feet long so you should be able to place these cameras wherever you'd like. OK so I hope this rant...I mean review was helpful. If you're anything like me, I read all the reviews on a product before I make a purchase. Thanks for reading!***(I am not affiliated with Yi or any of there products, this was simple a consumer review, please purchase these at your own risk)***
review_text_3: I purchased the Yi 4 pk. 1080 Indoor security cameras. I was skeptical but am so glad I took the chance. I placed them in various windows facing outside as it‚Äôs outside I want to observe. They work perfectly during the day and, where the outside area is lit, at night. If the area is not lit, there is a reflection on the glass from the IR light, but they ARE designed to be indoor cameras. They work very well indoors, day and night, as intended. I have observed some sketchy people that have rung my doorbell when I‚Äôm not home (I have a camera in the window next to door), along with the neighbor‚Äôs cat, a family of raccoons, an opossum and numerous squirrels. I had an issue where they stopped alerting me of activity (which I see some others have had, also) and contacted Yi customer service. They promptly replied to my request and worked with me to make sure all my phone settings were correct. Turned out, the problem was with my phone settings, battery saver shutting down the app, NOT with the cameras or their app. I especially love that I can insert my own sd cards to save & view past events and not have to pay for ‚Äòcloud‚Äô subscription. I don‚Äôt know of another security camera that offers this. I couldn‚Äôt be happier with this purchase! In fact, I ordered another set of 4. If you are still in doubt, look up some reviews and comparisons of the Yi cameras on youtube.
review_text_5: Best Security Option for a home because:1. Its a one time charge- no monthly subscription- and all of the features of the camera work with the SD card2. The camera video is excellent especially the Night vision- it can see in almost complete darkness- wow3. The detection system is superb- I especially like that you can select an area within the total viewing area for detection. I use this feature so the cars that pass outside of my house do not trigger the alert only the area literally right in front of my door.4. The intercom is clear and at the appropriate volume5. Install and app use is seriously easy whether your a "techy" or not6. Small form and can be hidden without drawing attention7. Excellent price - for what you get its so worth it!8. Retrieve data on multiple device- My wife and I can both check our home and get the alerts simultaneously.9. Still records video on SD card even when wifi is out10. The option to make the camera stealth (no sound or constant blue light)As long as the camera and app lasts then I would definitely tell you do hesitate, buy it- its worth it and more.

review_header_2: Love this wireless security camera system!!
review_header_5: Fantastic Security Camera for Outdoor Use
review_text_1: Performs as advertised. This is the most user-friendly security camera I have ever tried.1)100% wireless. I have not used any cord but the sticky pad when installing it.2)Perfect night vision. You can switch the night vision modes from black & white to colored. Under colored night vision mode, this outdoor camera can give out white light when detecting the motion to show clearer video and images. Considerable design.3)Convenience cloud service. 30-days free cloud service trial.4)Flexible motion detection. You can adjust the distance this security camera detects.Try it! Great value for the money.
review_text_2: I was looking for months for a completely wireless security system. I bought a few others, they went back immediately. Not what I was needing or looking for. I love these cameras from Abegal. The size of the field of view is one of the largest I could find. I think having the option of colored night vision or regular ir is awesome. I'm not all that tech savvy and I had no problems getting them set up and working. I had an issue with my camera and Abegal got it resolved immediately. I put up pictures of colored night vision and just a day time pic showing you how great the quality of camera is. I would definitely recommend these cameras if you are looking for a great system for not all that much money. You would think that they cost far more than they do. You get a free 15 month warranty by the way.I'm definitely getting more.
review_text_3: I have had this camera for about a year now and I love it. I was hesitant at first, then after a few months, it really came in handy. The only disadvantage is the battery runs down fast, but after having it for a year that is because I have high traffic on my street. I normally charge it when I am cleaning my home so I will not miss anything. The quality is great and it captures every movement. I purchased the cloud that is recommended with the camera, it is only $5 a year. You want regret purchasing this camera.
review_text_4: This camera is easy to set up and easy to use. I like that the battery is rechargeable and the app is easy to use. The set up was simple and took less than 5 minutes. The instructions are clear and user friendly. I've purchased cameras in the past that are difficult to set up and I couldn't figure them out. I was really pleased that I was able to set this camera up so easily. The picture quality is great and the app is easy to use. Overall I'm really happy with this camera. I plan on buying more cameras to complete my set up.
review_text_5: This is my 1st Abegal camera and I am very happy with this purchase of my 1st outdoor camera. Now I'm planning to buy a 2nd one. What I like about this security camera is its improved colorful night vision and its great IR motion detection. You can adjust its detection sensitivity according to your preference. There is an option to use a subscription based cloud system or an SD card. I'm using the cloud service for it has a 30-day free rolling recording trial. Given its excellent night vision I am using this outdoor and I‚Äôm planning to place the 2nd camera indoor to check its click to call function. This home camera is really easy to setup using the Abegal App. You just download the app, turn camera on, scan the QR code and the camera is ready to go in less than 5mins.

features: ,,„ÄêEasy setup, Need Plug Power Supply„ÄëWireless video security system is easy to setup and DIY installation. Wireless means camera and NVR is wireless connection, but they still need work with power plug. True Plug and Play. 1) Connect the NVR and cameras with power adapter. 2) Connect the mouse to NVR, connect PC/TV monitor to NVR with a VGA/HDMI Cable. The Video will show up on TV or display.,„Äê3TB HDD Storage, Remote Playback„Äë With pre-installed 3TB HDD, it can keep around 50 days of 24/7 videos for 4 cameras simultaneously without overwriting. With FREE Eseecloud APP, for android and iPhone, all videos in the HDD can be playback remotely in your hand anywhere anytime. 8 channel NVR comes with advanced H.265+ compression ensures more stable and clearer viewing experience, saves 50% hard drive capacity.,„ÄêRemotely Anytime and Anywhere„ÄëWireless Surveillance Camera System Allows you to View the Live Video Remotely Anytime and Anywhere by Phone and Pad(Available for Android & IOS system). Download Free APP ‚ÄúEseeCloud‚Äù from Android Google Play or Apple APP Store. Register an New Account, then Add Device ID. You can View the Video by WiFi or 3G/4G Network. PC/Laptop View: Windows System: CMS Software. MAC system: MAC CMS Software.(Please Send E-mail to Hiseeu for Software),„ÄêStunning 2K Ultra-HD video, one Way Audio„Äë 3.0MP presents 2304*1296 Mega Pixels about 1.5 times clearer than 1080P. Camera with 3 array Infrared LED allows you to see up to 65ft night vision even in darkness. Employing IP66 Waterproof metal material housing, cameras can be used indoor and outdoor. Outdoor security camera system also allows you to see and listen to people on your property remotely.,„ÄêAI Human Detection„Äë Reduces false alarms -- Compared with the traditional motion detection alert, the Hiseeu 3MP camera adopt more advanced AI human detection technology in 2021. Advanced AI technology for home security camera systems distinguishes humans from animals or objects within the monitoring range reducing false alarms. When an intruder enters the monitoring range, the screen will display the human frame will be triggered.
name: Hiseeu 2K Wireless Security Camera System Outdoor/Indoor 8 CH NVR kit 8Pcs Cameras 3MP WiFi Surveillance Camera for Home Night Vision,Bullet Camera Waterproof, Motion Detection, 3TB Hard Drive
review_header_2: Incredible day and night vision and customer service
review_header_5: Works well. Great video quality. Easy to setup.
review_text_1: I bought this system a couple months ago. I originally bought two other systems that arrived with problems, and I had to send them back for a refund. After doing a little more research, I bought this system for my small business. I unpacked the unit and tested it out at home before taking it to the business for installation. Before installation, I chose to purchase a new wifi router, which was quite an upgrade from what was already there, installed wifi extenders where the wifi signals were weak and tested the system and all cameras to be sure everything was working properly and recording. Once I was comfortable with the system, setting it up and installing it in the business was easy. The unit is installed on the second floor, and the cameras on the first floor, all the way to the back of the building, still work with no issues. I did not have to use the extended antennas that came in the box. I did have some questions for the company. The phone number and email are posted here at the bottom of the product description on Amazon, so finding contact information is easy. I chose to email the company, and within 24 hours or less I received a response. I needed assistance getting the system to display on a computer screen. Tech support sent a link to download the software along with instructions on how to set it up. I clicked on the link, downloaded the software, followed the install instructions, and all cameras popped up on our computer screen. The 3TB hard drive gives my business 30 days of recording, which is better than we expected. We have all 8 cameras set to record continuously 24/7. This is a great buy for the money.
review_text_2: I have been in the alarm industry for over 40 years but getting your company to install cameras (even at cost) is ridiculously expensive. I purchased these cameras just prior to our completing a remodel on our home and just started the installation. It was incredibly easy with essentially just plug and play set up. The pictures during the day (and night) are crystal clear and playback is extremely simple. The best issue is that I had some issues with the distance for the wireless reaching and have had incredibly quick response to each and every request for assistance. The system is simple but when there is an issue is is nice to have instant responses to your inquires for help. 5 star customer service and five star system. Really user friendly at all levels and I would recommend to anyone!
review_text_3: I ordered the security system February 1, 2019 but just installed in on April 13th. The system is a Hiseeu with 8 1080P cameras and a 3TB hard drive. The system worked flawlessly right of the box. The video is sharp with great color The night time vision of these cameras is fantastic. This is a very nice system at a good p;rice. I had one question that was answered via email very promptly. If you are looking for a great system at a great price I would highly recommend this one.Jim Davis
review_text_4: Very easy to get up and running. True plug and play, QR code came up on monitor to download the phone app and had it up and running within ,,five minutes of unboxing the unit. Very impressed with nite vision in complete darkness. Its alot better picture quality than other systems iv had. I do have a brick house and having trouble with one of my cameras having a weak signal so sometimes i can see that image.
review_text_5: Good things:1. It's easy to set up. Plug in the power and it works well.2. Easy to connect with Internet and your phone. Fast. Connection is stable.3. Video quality is good.4. Tech support is good. My questions was answered on-time.Bad things:1. sometimes, it delays a little bit. But not a huge issue.2. The range will be affected by walls. But this is normal with wireless system. You may need to my some wireless signal extension device.

review_header_3: Excellent camera, solar charging makes it that much wasir
review_header_4: A nice concept- Take that Arlo
review_text_1: I needed something quick and reasonable to take care of my front entryway while I'm gone for some days.Searched a lot of outdoor cameras and found this highly rated reasonably priced camera.Ordered it without any delay on Saturday morning around 10 AM and it was delivered same day at 7 PM. That is quick.Second quick thing was the setup. Had hard time with some previous cameras where you need to switch off your 5G Wifi but thought to give a try and guess what it literally took less than 1 minute to setup.All you need is to Install the APP, turn on the camera, Add the camera and scan the QR code in front of the camera and its up and running. Quickest setup ever for any wifi camera. Installing the camera only took 4-5 mins.Result of the camera is also great for both day and night. I can easily read the license plates. (Street name is omitted in one of the photo).Battery is also very powerful. After all the testing for motion detection it remains the same even on third day.Motion detection is very efficient, It saves the footage on cloud right after it detects any movement. You can adjust the motion detection to high or low.Audio is also crisp and one can easily communicate both ways.
review_text_2: Now I have a total of 6 ZUMIMALL cameras. Since May 2019, I started collecting them. I got hooked on the first camera and I kept finding other places that I wanted to monitor for the occassional human visitor (driving up our long driveway) but mostly for the wildlife, since we live in the country.This latest edition to my collection (received 1 week ago) seems more clearer, the angle wider, the picture clearer and the signal stronger (67% - located over 100 feet from my router extender) . I like how the case extends over the front of the camera and keeps drops of rain off of the lens versus the others I have. I strongly recommend the ZUMIMALL brand and their products. Their customer service is great also. They are quick to respond and very helpful. I misplaced the tiny mounting screw to my ZUMIMALL Doorbell camera and asked how to go about getting a replacement. Soon after I sent the email, I got a positive response that indicated that they would send me a replacement screw (no cost to me). I'm looking forward to see what ZUMIMALL comes out with next. Thank you ZUMIMALL!!!
review_text_3: I bought this after my neighbor had a car window smashed in during the night. I needed to make sure if it happened to me, I was protected. I already had a zumimall camera, so it was a no brainier to buy this one. I've been using the other one for quite a while now - only difference is this one came with a solar charger. Huge benefit. I was able to mount it in an area that is impossible to reach without a ladder. I use an SD card to backup the alarm video that it records. It does not sound the alarm over a passing animal, only vehicles and people. The night vision is awesome. I'll include a daylight screenshot and a nighttime screen shot for reference. I'm very happy with this camera, and excited that I don't even have to pull it off the wall to charge anymore.
review_text_4: This review is for the Zumimall ZS-GX1SI was in the market for a wireless camera to use to investigate employee theft. I needed something that was motion activated and would be able to be hidden in a stockroom and record wrong doings. I came across this item because it seemed like it would do the trick and then I could repurpose it to record vehicles since it was fully wireless I would not need to install a power line to it.Reviewing the owners manual they offer a free 3 year warranty extension if you follow the site they provide. The app required is called CloudEdge App. A microSD card (up to 128GB is required to record videos when the sensor detects movement).Battery- Manual states the camera has a built in 10,400mAh 18650 battery which can be used for 3-6 months assuming the camera wakes up to 15 times a day playing video only 10 minutes. There is a solar panel option for fully wireless charging. I could see this thing being used for a high tech trail camera.I was able to set up the camera while still being connected to a charging cable. So I guess you could use it as a wired camera? The app set up had voice prompts which was nice. It walks you through the setup and you enter your wifi password into the app. The app generates a QR code, you then point the camera towards your phone and the camera will snap a picture of the code to configure itself. MUCH better and faster than having to log into the camera and toggle back and forth. The longest part for me was pulling up my Wi-Fi password since it is long and complex.Video quality is acceptable. App has nice features such as battery life and status. It will also show the signal strength and mac and IP address. You can save to the cloud or use the app to access video files saved on the micro SD card. You can also live stream on demand as well as receive notifications.The box says the camera is "IP weatherproof" but does not list the rating. I would say it would be safe to be outdoors but I would not trust it to be in full rain. I would be more worried about water entering through the antennas as well as the speaker. The buttons, sd card and charging slot are protected by a well fitting rubber cover.

review_header_1: So much better than the traditional system
review_header_2: Easy to hook up and get started!
review_header_5: Wansview W4 Camera easy setup, easy to use and great price!
review_text_1: We have two of these now for about 5 months and couldn‚Äôt be happier. There are some drawbacks to getting a WiFi monitor vs a traditional one that I will get into later. But here are some of the features.Picture Quality:Far superior then traditional and more than adequate. No need to install another monitor just for camera, i can just access the camera via wifi from anywhere and it is so easy, even for someone have limited knowledge about technology.Viewing monitor:We use our phones to check which works great. The quality of picture came out clearly and the night vision mode works completely better than our old system which is much more expensive and more complicate to install.User Access and setupSome other comment mentioned how 2 different phones can‚Äôt both check at the same time so I wanted to mention that‚Äôs completely wrong. In wansview cloud view, you can create multiple accounts that can access/view/replay really easy. You can share the camera access to anyone that have the wansview app and they can check it, all the setup process can be complete in just a few minutes.PriceCompare to my old system which costs me almost $3k and hours to setup, wansview camera came in very handy and extremely affordable at $40 (free shipping and free return policy) and all my family can easily find this system is so easy to use. What a stealing deal.
review_text_2: My wife and I bought this camera for the upcoming holiday season where we tend to buy a lot of stuff by mail for gifts. We live in an urban setting, bigger city on a main street with no lock box, just a little door slot for mail. We've had packages stolen before and we just want that added security. I set it up right away. It was very easy to set up. Literally 10 minutes out of the package and it was hooked up. Now we just need to mount it. We tested it out with the video and you get a month of storage free with the app. Then you can either pay by month, quarterly or annually. Theres a free option too but not much storage. It's really affordable. I believe 7 bucks a month or 69.99 for the year for up to 3 cameras. (There are other plans and offers for even more cameras and storage as well) After seeing that it works great we are actually going to purchase 2 more for around the house and back building. You never can be too safe this day and age.It does have to be plugged in so it's hardwired not wireless camera, but does work through Wi-Fi. Also it's good to note that the app only works on 2.4 speed and not 5.0. I'm glad that our fast internet package gave us 2 separate lines so we have both. We were very impressed on what it picked up even in the dark when we took the red light off the camera. It would start recording every time my son would roll side to side sleeping in the morning while we tested it out as grandpa came to babysit the kids for my wifes morning appointment and while I was off to work. All in all I'm very impressed. Will update to see how it lasts through the winter and outside.
review_text_3: This camera works great for my use, and at a fantastic price value. Set up was easy on my cell phone, and it has a Windows app, too. I use it to monitor my front yard and door when I'm away. It has adjustable motion detection and alerts me on my cell phone immediately when it senses something. I just click on the alert and the video comes right up. I can view it or optionally download it to my phone. It stores about 10 seconds of video for each motion detected, starting before the motion was detected. I haven't yet figured out if I can adjust that record period.It also offers / encourages cloud usage by subscription (with free trial), and I've seen some complaints about that. But it isn't required, at least not for what I'm doing. I haven't done the trial and it's still storing my Alarm videos just fine. It seems that Cloud usage would be helpful for continual monitoring and additional feathers, but I don't need that. Very nice camera!
review_text_4: I received the Wansview W4 outdoor camera a few weeks ago in exchange for my unbiased review. It came well packaged with easy to follow instructions and a packet of materials (e.g.: screws, anchors) which cover most installations.Setup: This is not my first Wansview camera, so the app was already downloaded and is pretty user friendly (once you get the hang of the QR reader Wi-Fi setup). Wansview does give the option for cloud storage, which is convenient for those who require it, or you can store clips and images locally on your device.Installation: This device must be connected to continuous power and battery operation is not an option. I had an outdoor outlet in the location where I planned to install the device which made things easy, but this is surely something to consider. The option to connect via ethernet or Wi-Fi is also a nice feature if your installation is set up to be hardwired with ethernet. The three cords that extend from the rear of the camera (power, ethernet, and reset button) are a bit bulky, but can be managed during install. The antenna has several degrees of freedom but can get in the way depending on your installation location. In my case, I mounted the camera on the underside of an eave rather than the side of a wall. Thankfully, Wansview has thought of this and allows you the option of flipping the video orientation if you must mount the camera with the antenna facing down.Video Quality & Integrity: The images are high quality day and night, especially for the price point. I experienced acceptable lag and good stream integrity. The camera only connects to 2.4 GHz bands, so depending upon your provider and Wi-Fi coverage, bandwidth could present a problem with lag and stream integrity.Features: The app allows you to activate motion detection and alerts. This is convenient but does not apply for my application. You can share access to the camera via the Wansview app with many users (e.g.: family members, employees, etc).Pros:Value (This is multiple pros wrapped up in one with good quality and functionality at a reasonable price.)Reliable (Thus far, no issues with loss of connectivity or needs to reboot the camera since installation.)Option to expand to cloud based storage at an additional cost. Probably most useful if you have multiple Wansview cameras.May be controlled by Alexa.Waterproof.Cons: (Only apply to certain applications)The camera does provide audio or a talk back feature. This is something to be aware of to limit disappointment if you require this functionality for your application.The location of the antenna could potentially impact your installation plans, but there is a significant degree of possibilities here to make it work (e.g.: degrees of freedom in the mount and antenna, as well as ability to flip the image).No native or expandable storage in the camera itself.Overall:A good value waterproof outdoor camera with night vision that is appropriate for most applications that do not require audio or talk back features.
review_text_5: This Camera is great. Having 2 older wansview outdoor cameras they were good and but had some minor issues with motion detection and switching night/day vision. But they have corrected these issues with the wansview w4 camera. I now get great 10 second video clips sent to the cloud with really good picture quality. It was easy to set up. After having these for the last several days these are perfect. I recommend getting these cameras. They aren‚Äôt that expensive which is another major plus. I think they did great with this one.

review_header_2: Easy to Setup. Watching Remotely works great. BUT...
review_header_3: Big things come in small packages.
review_header_4: Great Security Cameras for a Wireless Solution
review_text_1: I love innovative tech gadgetry, so just based on the design and innovation on this camera it already gets high marks from me. I was looking for a rechargeable IP camera that I could install in a location away from a power-source. As such, I was willing to periodically change or charge the battery, but having a solar-panel makes that step unnecessary.There is an additional feature to this camera that I did not expect. The solar panel connects to the camera via a micro-USB cable. This is great because if I ever get power to the location where it‚Äôs installed, I can opt to go with a wired power-source. Also, should there ever be a need to top off the battery; I have a way of easily doing that.Overall, the camera was very easy to set-up. It uses a barcode generated on the app to pass along your information to the camera after you've signed up and created an account. All of that process and function is pretty standard, where this camera stands out is in its quality construction and design.Two of the features I‚Äôd like to point out are the power-port cover and the magnetic mount. The ports for the power, reset, and microSD card are all covered by a thick rubber seal/lid that is built into the connection from the solar panel. As you can see in my photo, once you connect the panel, everything is sealed up very well. I do wonder why the lens doesn‚Äôt have a visor or some other protective measure around it though.The magnetic mount is an ingenious way to mount the camera and be able to position it in nearly limitless angles and positions. There must be a pretty strong magnet housed inside the camera behind the rubber indentation. When coupled to the metallic-looking half-ball, it seats perfectly and very securely.The only thing I‚Äôd change or add to this setup is a bead of silicone along the glass/frame edge of the solar panel. Mine didn‚Äôt come with anything there that resembled a seal, so I did just that and now I feel much better about the durability of the panel in wet weather.
review_text_2: The cameras were easy to install - took minutes to get them installed. Connecting to WiFi was a challenge not because of the camera but because I forgot my WiFi passcode. Once I put the right WiFi passcode, it connected in seconds.The solar charge also works great - I installed in a sunny area and the cameras are always 100% charged, thanks to mother nature power (solar).Remote viewing is very quick and the cameras are clear. I can also hear the wind sound and birds chirping if near by. I even checked from across the globe and it worked flawlessly.I get Alert texts all the time as the cameras are sensitive - the alerts show "Body Movement" but the problem is, I could never see the playback. When I play the message back, it keeps connecting slowly and keeps giving me a message that network is slow - not sure why I could see live but network is slow for playback. After few attempts, I get a picture that is barely usable - it is so bright it is washed out. There is no video either. For this reason, the video playback is useless for me.
review_text_3: PHonestly I have to say I wasn‚Äôt expecting much out of this camera since it was fairly cheap. The package arrived within two days thanks to prime so I was really excited to install this as soon as possible. I plan on putting this camera in an area that doesn‚Äôt have WiFi and only utilize the sd card recording function. For the next few days however I will be leaving this camera in an area close to another camera I have to better judge the quality of it since I‚Äôve had these other cameras for about 2 years or more. Upon opening the package I found more hardware than I could ever have guessed, I knew it came with a normal mount and a double sided sticky tape mount but it has so many options I plan on utilizing two of them during my testing phases before leaving it in its permanent home ( I ordered the solar panel option). I charged the camera over night before testing it since I‚Äôve read some reviews about needing to be charged first and the manual does say charge for at least 15 minutes. The manual is very clear which is a breath of fresh air considering how many cameras either only come with a note card size instruction sheet or make you find some weird website online that doesn‚Äôt even exist anymore. For the little I spent on this I am still at shock at how much stuff came with this camera. The camera has an intercom function which is really cool. I will definitely utilize this if I do decide to put it in range of my WiFi for its permanent home but I have enough cameras already around my house so if you are looking for something like that then this is the way to go. The night vision is very sensitive to low light situations but I prefer that since the picture quality isn‚Äôt hindered like my other cameras during night vision mode. The WiFi range is similar to a phone which is better than I expected but I will experiment with range later one since I‚Äôm not really concerned with that.Overall I am very pleased, I‚Äôm interested to see how the solar panel will work with charging the battery. I don‚Äôt plan on leaving it out all year since I‚Äôm going to be changing out the sd card anyway and charging every so often isn‚Äôt that big of a deal.Out of the box I have to say this product has definitely made me a happy costumer, I‚Äôve had people already ask me about recommendations on cameras similar to this and I definitely will be telling them how pleased I am so far. Only time will tell in the long run how great a camera is but if it catches a trespasser even once, it has payed for itself.
review_text_4: I picked up two of these cameras which included the solar panels instead of all the other options out there due to the 100% wireless factor.I didn't want to fuss with charging or replacing batteries and was skeptical at first, but after a week of ownership, I think we have a winner.Along with my order of the two cameras, I also picked up two 64gb micro SD cards. I didn't want to pay for a cloud service and am being responsible for my own storage.I read that the 128gb cards was overkill and that sentiment was true. In fact, 64gb SD cards may be overkill but at $16 for two, no biggy.After unpacking, I installed the SD cards and charged each camera with the provided cords overnight.With both cameras at 100%, I connected them to the Cloud Edge app and formatted the SD cards.I installed one camera at the front and one camera at the back of my house along with the solar panels on my roof.I am happy to say that after a full week of use, both cameras still show 100% charged on the CloudEdge app. The solar panels work!!!The cameras are sensitive to motion, which can be adjusted slightly, but if a humming bird or large bug (grasshopper in my case) flys in front of the cameras, they will record.You can set the default record time from 20 seconds to 40 and 60 if you like.Each alert instance sometimes comes through twice, one showing two screen shots and one showing video. I'm still not sure why I received two different alerts sometimes, but I can live with it.You can view a live feed which includes audio and two way communication which is nice. During the live feed you can take screen shots and record video on the fly.The video is good, but not great. Meaning... If the person is up close, it's very clear, but if the person is more than 10ft away, it's not a crisp picture. Deducted 1 star for that.Night vision works well, but as expected, not as clear as during the day but still acceptable. Deducted 1 star for that.The recording volume is very sensitive and picks up birds chirping in the background as well as any noises you would hear if present.The back of the solar panels are white, so I spray painted them black to blend better with my roof.I wish the solar panel cords came in white to match my rain gutters and wood siding.I like that you can turn off the motion sensors from the app for when you are home as to not trigger the alerts to your phone all day.IMO, these cameras are worth the price for a wireless solution. In fact, I may buy a 3rd just to hide somewhere indoors...just in case.
review_text_5: Seller was very helpful and prompt in getting me set up. Once I was up and running the cameras are working as advertised. Video and sound quality are good. It helps to have fast internet speed to reduce video delays. All cameras are outside (haven't installed inside ones yet) and was able to place where I wanted which, in one case, was over 50' from my router. The cameras with the solar panels are like having wired connections - always powered. Still playing around and will follow up.Update: Seller, again, was very helpful. Even sent me a couple of mounts for the solar panel that I had broken during installation. Also, it was suggested that I tilt downward the angle on the camera to capture movement, which worked better.Next Update: I dropped my camera twice from a height of at least 10' when mounting from the deck. First time it hit the ground, and the next time it hit concrete. Bottom line, the camera still works although the lens cracked after the second time. Mfg. said they would replace the camera...which is way above and beyond good customer service. I just wanted to tell them how durable the camera was. Update: just received the replacement camera.

review_header_5: Good combo with existing sensor light
review_text_1: My Catalytic Converter was stolen And I hope to use this camera to deter and even catch thief. My trucks catalytic converter was stolen off my truck that was parked on my driveway a week ago. Cost me $1,000 to replace it. I hope with the motion sensors, it can alert me if someone does under the truck. I set it up under the truck and it works. I can see at night and motion sensors works. I also put a motion sensor floor light to deter the thief. I really hope this will work. But the camera works as it should. No issues.
review_text_2: My fence was distant from the building. I previously installed solar motion light on the fence but there were times that light was on but I did not know what's going on. I bought this camera to neutralize that situation by pointing this camera facing fence. When the fence light was on, I also got app notification from this camera. There is delay for the video stream, but it is acceptable for my case. Still happy.
review_text_3: I bought this to monitor activities in my yard. My neighbor‚Äôs dog dug a hole below the fence and damage the plants in my garden beds. I got videos to show my neighbor for keeping the cute doggy behave. It‚Äôs also helpful to spot rabbits and squirrels in the backyard to show my kids.
review_text_4: Very easy to use, you can monitor, record, playback and voice intercom. The price is also relatively affordable and satisfactory shopping.
review_text_5: I put this camera right above existing outdoor sensor light. It works well as a supplementary camera so I don't have to buy expensive spotlight camera because my LED sensor light works just fine. The battery seems good and I like the USB charging so I don't need to wire it.
