review_header_1: ease of installation, high quality,detailed instructions,as promised
review_header_5: I recommend for the quality of the product and support provided
review_text_1: There is nothing, and I mean nothing not to like about this security 4 camera system. Beginning with the well constructed camera bodies, amazing finish. Once I ensured the cameras all connected to my TV, I began to located them around my home. Picked the first location over the pool, next chose a spot overlooking my fruit trees, then moved to the south side of my home camera location I picked connected right away. Forth location was more difficult to pick because of the remote power source. Finally chose near the front door again dead easy. Emailed Johnny (the tech contact) with a question next day answer addressing my needs small tech issue solved. Super, super happy with this purchase I will recommend this highly to my friends who are looking for a security system for their home. Great value so go ahead get this system perfect for any location, home cottage, farm. With the IP PRO app your system is on line anywhere you have your phone. If I could give this product a 6plus it would be done. Thanks HISEEU.Sincerely Ross
review_text_2: this is one of , if not "the" easiest to set up camera system you can purchase.I have also added 2 cameras that are fairly new to this company, has 2 way speaker ..the cameras are good and clear, customer support is top notch.I do recommend the wifi extender, it greatly increased the signal strength for those camerasa bit out of range. the day and night vision is excellent.I highly recommend this system.I have 7 cameras currently in use, I've also am using 2 Wi-Fi repeaters that are working great.I've not had a dropped connection in a long time. These are great, though they can takea bit of learning curve as you add on and use repeaters.
review_text_4: I bought this 8 ch. wireless system and installed it for a friend of mine. I was very impressed with the picture quality and ease of the setup. I have a system at my home and it's a professional quality and name brand and does not have the quality pictures as this Hiseeu system. I posted pictures I took from his monitor. These pictures are without a wifi hookup, just from the outside transmission from the cameras to the main unit. Before I installed this system I tested it at my hose to make sure it worked properly and it passed with flying colors. My home is about 3800 sq. feet and of course the cameras on the first level worked fine as being the closest, and to test it further I placed two other cameras as far as I could on the lower level and closed all the doors. Again all cameras produced sharp detailed pictures. I am not a professional installer, however I did install my 16 camera system and am very glad I suggested the Hiseeu system
review_text_5: I bought the DVR with 4 wifi cameras and I really liked the quality of the product, the excellent support provided by johnny and the support provided. The quality of the images is amazing as is the resolution of the device. It was the best investment for my house and the safety of my family, after all, at any time or I can see the images of my house. Thank you

review_text_5: Really like the ability to see the video stream live on the app, the delay is minimal and the quality is good. review_header_5: Great for remote application without power, nice picture, good motion detection
review_text_3: I'm HAPPY with this purchase.We have a Ring System inside our home, and wanted to also see the outside of our property; but didn't want to pay $500.00 for the two outside Ring cameras. I decided to try this camera, so I bought two of them. The pics are Clear day and night. I can compare it to my Ring inside Security System.I RECOMMEND THIS CAMERA.
review_text_5: The product I purchased is an WongKuo Outdoor Security Camera, mine was equipped with a solar panel which will provide additional power. First, the install instructions were great, I am a tech idiot and I was able to see pictures from the camera in very short order. The images were clear and easy to get to. The camera features a PIR sensor for motion detection. In my application, focusing the camera down the driveway, it was able to detect motion in automobiles, yet ignored small wildlife, which is desirable for me.The images are automatically stored in the Cloud for 7 days, you can additional time by paying for a subscription. I did not test the subscription feature. The wide angle lens works as I expected. The two way talk worked without a significant lag.I would like an option of buying a longer cable to hook up to the solar panel, as that is needed formy app. The camera will need to be manually recharged after about two weeks unless I can find a longer cable to get more sun. I also find switching the wireless network to be cumbersome, perhaps it was me, but add a feature or section to the user guide to enable changing between networks.

review_text_1: These cameras work beautifully! The clarity is great and they are very easy to install. We had a small hiccup with one of the lenses and the company was wonderful about replacing it. I had a new camera within two days. Great customer service!
review_text_2: I must say this camera system is awesome, the WIFI coverage is great, really powerfull. Mi home is about 400 sq/ft and the signal is really strong, I have been using it for a month and I haven't lost signal at all.The system is really Plug N play, very simple and the manual is very detailed. It has all the steps in order to set up the cameras.I would definetley recommend this camera system.(The one I purchased is the 4 cameras and NVR with screen) the screen is very convinient.
review_text_3: To start with I gave Tech Support 3 stars simply because I have not had to contact them. From the quality of this system and the excellent response I received from Hiseeu concerning the pre-purchase discount code and a few questions about the two units I was considering I feel any assistance I might need will be satisfactorily handled.This is a pretty straight forward setup, but I had already set up a similar system from a different manufacturer last year. My experience is this system truly is basically plug and play.My only "complaint" is the product description states one way audio and my cameras do not have audio. That is no big deal to me. If I feel the need to have audio on a camera I will simply buy an additional camera with audio.I also have found the motion detection sensitivity setting tricky. I do not want to record constantly nor during specific time periods. I only wish to record when a camera detects movement. It appears to me this system has specific settings, ie. "Highest", "Medium", down to "Lowest" with no agility to fine tune the setting. My other system has a sliding percentage ability to set sensitivity infinitely. This is not a major flaw just something I need to experiment with to find a happy medium.The power supply cords are about 10 feet long so plan on your placement before you start and make certain to purchase power extension cords as they make your install go so much quicker. I have 12 cameras between the 2 systems and using the power extension cords I only had to install 2 new outlets. These power extensions cords come in a bunch of different lengths. I purchased several from 6 foot to 30 foot. They are not expensive and much easier than running an entirely new electrical circuit. I would NOT recommend using a regular cheapo extension cord. The power extension cords are designed specifically for this purpose. Also remember to at least wrap a high quality electrical tape around each connection to help keep moisture out. I used electrical shrink wrap personally, but I'm kinda anal about this stuff.This system truly has a lot of features for the cost. The build quality looks very good. Picture quality is great, even at night. One of my cameras in the front is directed towards our yard light and that camera records in color at night. The cameras are made of aluminum not plastic. I experimented and discovered my original system cameras (which look as though they were made at the same factory) will easily pair to this system and vice versa. Hiseeu also makes a compatible PTZ camera that, I do not have one but have read, pairs to this system.I believe I will get several years of quality surveillance from this system.June 16, 2020 UpdateI for got to mention in my original review that I had absolutely no issues setting up remote access on my Android phone using the IPPRO APP. This APP allows me to view either of my 2 systems with one account. I love that ability to "check in" while away from home. I live in Florida and was able to "see" my system from Illinois last fall. It's is very easy to setup and connection/viewing is only limited to the internet speed you are using.
review_text_4: This is second time I contacted support and got very quick reply, the first time was on weekend. This second support was for a failed hard drive. Within few hours after sending email to support, they shipped me a new high-end replacement and received it 2nd day. When I pulled the original HDD out I could see it too was high-end HDD. The replacement was easy.
review_text_5: I had been skeptical at first but after series of reading and comparing, I found this product to be the best so far. I went ahead and purchased, It didn't take me long to figure out how to match the cameras and all that stuff ( self explanatory) considering that Im not an electronics person but I figured out anyway in no less than an hour. My husband and my brother had it going in a couple of hours. The picture quality amazed me, so clear and the audio is perfect compared to our previous ones. I just loved the fact that it's so easy to install, no sweat. The only minor problem I encountered is one of the cameras has poor wifi signal pick up, though it came with a signal extender I kind of gotten confused so I reached out to the tech support thru email. Johny, got back with me so fast! I didn't quite expect that, I got the answer to my question right away. I highly recommend this product, my kids can now rest assured about our security at home.

description: Size:1 Count (Pack of 1) A powerful wireless Wifi camera with powerful HD streaming and smart home integration! With a unique magnetic mount system, you can place the Geeni FREEBIRD just about anywhere with no wiring or hub required. Unlike other outdoor security cameras, the Geeni FREEBIRD outdoor camera features a powerful 9,000mAh battery that lasts up to 3 months and is fully rechargeable with the included USB charging cable, or can be plugged in with the AC Adapter. Clear 1080p livestream surveillance right to your smart device so you can check in on your home any time, anywhere. Use the Geeni app to control the FREEBIRD surveillance camera system and integrate it into your smart home! With automatic night vision, 130 degree viewing angle and IP65 weatherproof rating, the FREEBIRD is perfect for any situation and fully adaptable to watch over whatever matters to you.

review_header_1: Geeni does it right!  Amazon MAKES it right
review_header_2: Best investment I've ever made for the price.
review_text_1: Geeni makes a great product and has an easy to use app, one of the best, in my opinion.follow up...one camera stopped charging 100% (purchased in Oct 2020), called/emailed Geeni...HORRIBLE customer support, non existent and just gives you the run around...i talked to Amazon customer service.....THEY BLEW IT OUT OF THE WATER for support...thank YOU Amazon..Geeni, you need to take some support classes from Amazon customer support
review_text_2: This is the best little camera. I've had it up for over three weeks now and the camera battery is only down to 50%. I'll pull it down and charge it once it hits about 20%. The camera was hung upside down but it was super nice that I was able to rotate live and captured views. I love it when I'm gone and I get a notification that somethings delivered and I can see that on my iPhone. Also I can log into the app and see whatever's going on in a nice-sized area. Night vision is excellent. The sound is excellent. And I can even speak to whomever is outside from wherever I'm located and I'm also able to record what's going on if I choose to do so. Best investment I've ever made.
review_text_3: Picture/video quality just as good as the more expensive cameras I've used. No need for a power source; built in battery. Depending on location/settings, battery life varies greatly. Advertises up to 3 months per charge. The one on my girlfriend's front porch (Busy street/high sensitivity.) needs to be charged every 4 weeks. The one on her mom's house (Busy street/low sensitivity.) will probably go about two months. The third at my mother's (Country/high sensitivity) will go the full 3 if not longer.Night vision is great! Easy setup using the Geeni app. The ability to share your camera feed with others. All cameras are in my Google Home and function nicely. Comes with a magnetic and screw-on mount; I've used both, but prefer the magnetic mount as the screw-on mount seems a little cheap.
review_text_4: Great picture quality and motion detection. I‚Äôve had the camera about a month and still have 90% battery. Easy installation!!!
review_text_5: Cons, Clear images and videos with clear and loud sound. Takes a couple hours to fully charge but battery lasts for a long time. Sensor catches everything including squirrels and cats. Free app to download. Cons, in my opinion is that when you want to look at live feed sometimes it does take a couple seconds to load feed.

Instant notifications and email alerts with screenshot will be pushed to your phone directly as long as the cameras detect moving objects.,(5). [ Customize Each Camera with Different Record Modes ] __Our ZOSI DVR offers 4 kinds recording modes to meet your needs: Record footage continuously; Record during scheduled times; Only record when detect motion; Recycle record. You can customize each camera with different recording modes, and download the recording files for the USB backup.
name: ZOSI 1080P H.265+ Home Security Camera System,5MP Lite 8 Channel CCTV DVR Recorder with Hard Drive 1TB and 8 x 1080p Weatherproof Bullet Camera Outdoor Indoor with 80ft Night Vision, Motion Alerts
review_header_3: Verry good Video Quality and the night vision is super.
review_text_1: I'll be honest with you, I wasn't sure what to expect for under $200 bucks. Everything came as it should and it took me a day to mount and wire up all the camera's. It took me another few hours just to get all the angles right and to move one to different location. Once I had it up and running it took me only a little bit to figure out how to get it running and recording. The main unit is about a 12" x 12" and everything hooks up nice. It comes with a 1Terabite drive and was easy to get formatted and recording. One thing I would say to all, is let it keep the default image resolution settings. If you try to go higher than the camera's will handle, it will cause it to reboot and start all over. I hooked this up to a older TV with the HDMI connection and it stays on at all times right above my computer desk.My real worry was the quality of the camera's. Truthfully I don't think they are 720p camera's myself. If you try to make the image large the image is a bit blurry and unstable. Not the kind of unstable that would make it not be usable but if you have watched a 720p video it's a lot better than this. But that aside, the quality is much better than the older style systems you used to get, and for the money it's worth it. The biggest plus to this system is the night vision. This to me is where this system really shines. The camera goes Black and White when it gets too dark and the images are not awesome, but better than anything I have seen on any of my work systems. They really do show about 65 feet in the pitch dark and though it is a bit grainy you can still make out anything moving out there. I can even see my dog when he goes out to do his thing : pThe peace of mind from having this system is worth every penny. We had some prowlers before we got this messing with our water lines and this is why we purchased this unit. If they ever come back, their gonna get a nice ride and three meals and a cot.Also just a helping hint. The joints to the camera's are sturdy, but if you try to tighten the locking clamp by twisting the camera body you will break the joint. So don't be tempted. Get a pair of Channel Locks and hold the camera and then tighten the lock ring, not super tight but snug. You can thank me later : )
review_text_2: I ordered this system. It arrived super fast and communication with the vendor has been excellent. My plan was to power up the system on the kitchen table and let it run for 4 or 5 days to become familiar with it and verify that it works. I figured being Amazon I could send it back if it didn't live up to expectations. So far, so good.I have been running this system in one configuration or another for more than two months now and have not regretted the purchase. The quality and software capabilities far exceed my expectations at this price point. My only complaint on it so far is the remote app for android. My problems with it are outlined below. Since I am not that interested in remote viewing this is not an issue for me.I have NOT been given a discount for this equipment as some reviewers so the comments below are strictly my own.1-4-17Received the system and wired everything except WIFI and video out. Everything worked well on initial power up. Easy setup with the Wizard. Good clear image for each camera. As night approached and the lights turned off I checked night vision. I don't know what it will do for long distance but in the house in total darkness, 15 feet away I could easily see a person move and what they were wearing. I could not make out details of the face.1-5-17I let system run all night and recording worked fine. Today I opened the DVR to see how it was built.The hard drive is a Toshiba 1 TB 6 GB/s SATA drive. My plan is to install a larger drive so that when we are on vacation we can have two weeks of saved video. I can then use this drive as a backup drive in my server.There is a small cooling fan on the left as you are looking at the front of the unit. There is a good size heat sink on the main chip. I plan to install the DVR on its side so the fan should be up with space on bottom ( right side of unit ) to assure air flow.There are three USB connectors. One on the front of the DVR and two on the back. A mouse comes with the system. I tested it with a wireless mouse but it would not work because you couldn't load a driver for it. The two other USB ports can be used for a backup drive and a wireless dongle.There is also an RJ45 LAN port on the back. I plugged a Cisco bridge into it to connect to my wireless LAN. Entered the password and connected with no issues. I ended up running an Ethernet cable from the RJ45 port to my router. I had some issues getting the remote access app to work with wireless. Not sure if that was the reason.Also a BNC video out connector. Not tested yet but my plan is to run this to my video distribution system so that I can view the cameras on any TV in the house.I had an issue with one of the indoor cameras. I moved the camera on its gimbal mount too far and some of the silicone tubes popped out. My error for moving it so much. I attempted to put them back but they would not stay in place and there was no way to get a dab of glue in there. Then I read the camera instructions ( yes, I should have done that first ) and learned that you can disassemble the camera to mount it to the ceiling. Now I can re glue the silicone pieces. One helpful point is that the instructions say to unscrew the bottom part of the mount. I grabbed the two pieces to unscrew and they would not budge. The trick I learned was hold the two parts very gently and wiggle them in a counterclockwise motion.1-7-17I set a fixed IP address on the DVR and when I go to the browser on my computer on the LAN and type in that IP address I can view the cameras and change any of the settings. This means I won't need a monitor or mouse connected to the DVR and it can be better hidden. It doesn't do you much good to DVR the bad guys and then have them steal the DVR.Installed the app SECU365 as recommended by Zosi. My Norton AV said there was no risk. After it installed it appeared to install something else and all of a sudden Norton said it sent data back to China and was a privacy issue. Considering that this is a view into my home I'm very concerned about anyone hacking into this. It may be safer to forego the remote view. If anyone has info on a different app that is known to be safer please leave a comment.Also a note on the silicone bumpers on the indoor cameras. After regluing they fell out again while installing on ceiling. The camera still held in the position I set it so it wasn't a big deal. Just annoying. I plan to replace the silicone tubes with something different on the next camera I install.3-2-17We have had some milder winter weather in our area so I was able to get all the wiring run in the attic and the outdoor cameras installed. I had a minor problem with one of the outdoor cameras and the vendor responded quickly and took care of the problem. I have been very happy with the quick response on any issue from the seller!With all 8 cameras running full time but not recording any audio I am able to record a few hours less than 2 weeks of video. I have not done much with learning to use the motion detection or the time out for the cameras feature. I would guess that I will get more than 2 weeks of video by only recording motion. I will write more on this topic later when I have more time.One thing I learned was that you can only save video clips out through the front panel USB port. I should have learned this before I installed the system because I had to use a 90 degree USB adaptor and a short cable to access the port.As mentioned before I can view live video, review recorded video, copy recorded video to the front panel USB and change any of the configuration settings from my Win7 browser. I wish there was a way to copy a portion of a recording to my local Win7 drive through the browser. I am planning to write to support if a firmware update would allow to do this or any other features. I will write more on this at a later time.
review_text_4: It is lowest cost for such a security system even buying the hard drive separate, and I put a 2TB hard drive and only used 2 of the 4 cameras so I got two more for spares.The instructions are lacking so it takes a little (just a little) ingenuity to figure out things like the red light is power and the green light means the videos are activated and working, and "play back" only means play back while we have to go to the main menu and click "backup" in order to copy a file onto a flash-drive. The red icon means no sound but this DVR can install a microphone if our State does not object. The small yellow lighted icon is for the motion detector coming on, but even with motion detection the videos are recording 24 hours every day constantly so it gives full coverage.The infrared comes out black-n-white but it is brilliant how it lights up the entire yard like a strobe light and yet completely invisible to our human eyes, except for the little red glow of the infrared around the face of the camera.I attached mine to one of my HDMI's on my TV so to watch a live view outside then I just change from TV over to the HDMI and there it is constantly live monitoring but when I turn away from that HDMI then the TV does not show the video so it harms nothing.I mounted one camera inside but I do not want inside on full time monitoring so I put the power wire hanging loose and so if I ever want the camera inside to start working then I just reach down and push together the loose power cord and then the inside camera comes on only at my comand.I am very happy with this.
review_text_5: Picture quality is great, use of the DVR is pretty straight-forward, and overall I'm very happy with these (especially for the price! I just could not ding a star for two minor issues (below) given the price of this system).Hooked up the app to my phone and now I can see the house while away.Customer service is spot on. I had a hiccup of my own doing and they were quick to respond via email to get me sorted. I sent pictures of my issues, they sent answers. Got me running fast!Setup: mostly easy except the camera assembly has swivel issues. There are two screws that keep the barrel in place that prevent it from easily fine-tuning the angle of the picture after install (see picture). But, loosen those screws and turn the barrel, tighten again, and it does work; it's just not easy at the top of a ladder.Cables: the cable lengths were great - got everywhere I needed them with ease. But, the cable connectors are different lengths (see picture). A bit OCD sure, but try to put them in electrical tape or outdoor tape and you have a lump.Grab a 2TB Storage Drive, also on Amazon, and this is a perfect system for install and walk away.https://smile.amazon.com/gp/product/B00IMPO5MO/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_search_asin_title?ie=UTF8&psc=1Again, for the price, you can't beat this. I've installed many, many security systems. What you get for the price is great. And the customer service alone is worth it.

review_header_1: This camera's working pretty well for me.
review_header_5: Solid Unit with a Great Image
review_text_2: I'm so glad I got this camera. It works very well. I needed something to catch the rotten kids in my complex when they play ding-dong ditch. Funny, I haven't had any issues with them since installing it lol. It gave me peace of mind when we were out of town recently so that I could see my neighbor take my dog in and out when she was caring for her. It also told me when packages arrived so she could get them for me. And, it caught FedEx being naughty when my package was tossed at my doorstep, tsk task tsk lol. It is easy to set up, and download the app and you can even talk to someone with it when they're right by your door. Although I don't have a memory card in it, it's an option for those who want it. You can change the sensitivity settings to catch as much or as little movement as you need. I can't comment on the night vision aspect of it since I have a light by my door that comes on when the sun goes down that is bright enough to see everything. You can see the pictures are quite clear and detailed, even the one from the night picture even with the light on. I recommend this to anyone who needs simple, discreet security.
review_text_4: I was skeptical about a camera that operates only on battery and claims of 30+ day battery life but I've been pleasantly surprised. Using it 30 days battery is still at 76%, I suspect with more motion it will use more battery, I've had little motion. Detection and notification is nearly instantaneous but you won't be able to review the notifications if you don't have a micro SD card in it (not included).I can't comment on how it is outdoors as mine is indoors, but the night vision reflecting off walls lights up the entire room evenly. You can hear audio live and in the recording which I have little experience with but I can hear a TV on it so it's pretty sensitive. I haven't used the talking through it feature, but that it something you can do.I'll keep this one around in a location I want to capture but don't want to run wires.
review_text_5: I didn't want to get a Ring doorbell, but I wanted to be able to monitor my front porch for package pirates. I didn't have any experience with security cameras, and didn't want to spend a lot of money. This one seemed to have a lot of bang for the buck, and so far it's been really impressive.Pros: Seems solid and well made. Image quality is outstanding. Easy to mount. Easy to connect to wifi. Mine is under a protected porch so it's not an issue but they claim it's waterproof and by the looks I would say that's true.Cons: None really, but some things to know: It does not come with a memory card, so if you want to capture video you'll need one. Otherwise it stores still images. It was easy to connect to the wifi when I was next to the router, but make sure you have a decent signal where you intend to put it. I would say the app is pretty good but I wish I could view landscape. If you want to continuously monitor video then be aware that decreases battery life (this would be true of all cameras). Have not tested the night vision capability.

Up to 64ft night vision. review_header_1: Can‚Äôt be more please with this system... Amazing customer service....
review_header_3: You get product that worth more than its price w awesome customer service
review_text_1: So I wanted to put up some security cameras just for some added protection. I went with this system because it came with 2 1080p cameras and a 1080n dvr with a 1tb hard drive. Overall the system works great. Awesome picture quality in the day and great picture at night. I want to say it was easy to install but there is always going to be an issue with finding a place to make a hole to run the cable. After it was all set up I turned it on. Out of the box the picture quality was just Ok. Only a few issues with picture being to bright or fuzzy. I then went through the menus and found all kinds of setting to mess with. After a few days and nights of adjusting and a lot of online reading I was able to get the quality up to 1080p standards. The only complaint I would have is that is doesn‚Äôt come with a book telling you what all the settings do. And even today. There are a few I still can‚Äôt figure out. I have it set up to continually record and I am not using any online streaming programs or the motion detection. I just recently bought 2 more cameras to add to the system. Overall I am really happy with it. Can‚Äôt beat the price anywhere.There were some reviews that I read before I bought it that made me think it‚Äôs not any good but I still went with it. People complaining about it rebooting all the time just never found the setting to disable auto reboot maintenance. You can also back up important videos with a flash drive, you don‚Äôt need the internet plugged in at all. You can also update via the usb with a flash drive. And if you do buy this system or any other system, don‚Äôt forget that you need to regularly clean the cameras lens to keep your picture quality good. I clean min about twice a month unless we get a lot of rainfall and or dusty windy weeks. I have already recommended this system to two of my friends.After about a month I started having issues with the dvr. The hard drive started showing errors and wasn‚Äôt recording. The playback was freezing and everything was running sluggish. I got ahold of Hiseeu and got helped right away. They said my dvr probably had a defected board. They quickly sent out another dvr and even gave me a free upgrade to 8ch dvr. The hard drive got formatted on my pc and I put it right in. Works so well I think I will have to order a few more cameras. Hiseeu‚Äôs customer service was amazing. Talked to them about my issues on Thursday and I had my replacement on Saturday.
review_text_2: Initially I wasn't expecting very much from this product based on the price.However, after using it for a while I found this product to be of excellent quality. It met and exceeded my expectations and had many features and abilities. I was not expecting.I had it for a short while and then I experienced a problem with the hard drive. I contacted the vendor and they responded with courtesy and in a very timely manner. They sent me a new hard drive and installed and have been using and enjoying this product very much. It is a very good product for the money. Based on my experience with this vendor I would have to say that it is a very high quality company. I think you should know that.
review_text_3: i love how the performance of this product exceeded beyond my highest expectstions. it is as said in the description your get more value fir your money. And not only thwt you will get too of the line customer service stress free no bs customer service and its stress freee they will replace defective item guaranteed .
review_text_4: This system is awesome! No, its not the top of the line, but for your money, you are getting a great value because this system is comparable to the best. No, its not 1080P, but the description states 1080N. Still, a very crisp video. Bottom line, I know I got a great DVR and cameras for my money. Oh, did I mention their fantastic customer care and service? They contacted me and wanted to make sure I was pleased with my purchase.
review_text_5: I found it easy to set up and install. There was a video i mean a lot of videos explaining how to install if you have any doubt on what to do. Many options and sensitivity settings for up to 8 cameras. Night visions works great also. Wires were long enough to hide from front of house to back where my cable tv enters the house. The other 3 cameras were closer so i didn't need to purchase the 100ft extension. I had to make the hole bigger of course since the connectors were pretty large ( my only complaint ). Only took a few couple hours to install since i took my time hiding the wires and attaching the cameras. It helps to have a staple gun for holiday lights for the wires. The app you can download to view the cameras on my phone works a lot better than i expected.

review_text_1: This little camera is excellent for the price I paid for it. I have tried other small cameras with no success. This, however, is a breeze to install and operate from the App. We ordered it to observe our dog while we are gone. One drawback: No SD card slot therefore, no local storage. Owner must buy unlimited cloud space for a reasonableprice.
review_text_2: Definetly a great product for the price. this is my fourth camera now I have 2 ranger 2c's indoors and 2 bullet 2cs outdoors all work great. Very good cameras for home security
review_text_3: Add the camera to the app was a pain in the a** but after that everything worked smoothly! We use it for our 1 month old when we are on the porch. It detects motion and audio and send notifications! The only downside is that you can‚Äôt add one camera to 2 accounts and you can‚Äôt log in into the same account from 2 phones!
review_text_4: We just started leaving our 7month old puppy out of her crate while we are out for extended periods of time. Had a Blink camera in the living room and realized we needed one for the kitchen/dinning room. Found this and liked that it moved. The picture is better than the blink, really clear HD, and the movement makes it great to use to check up on the puppy as she sometimes sleeps in corners. The price and ease of use is great as well. Only negative is that when operating the camera movement remotely, it does make a semi loud noise (for a dog at least). She hears it move and it sets her off barking lol. But other than that, great product. Glad we got it!
review_text_5: This camera is great!!It moves to where You want it and it has a zoom. It was easy to install, it connected to my wifi thru the app. It started working immediately. It had a long cord but you'll have to add a extension cord if it doesn't reach your plug, of course! I can watch thru the app out the window and in the house. All with a simple movement of my finger. The night vision is as clear as day time vision.You can speak with occupants of the room and interact with them.If your kid or pet is doing something cute, and your not there, you can take a picture or video and look at it later on your phone tablet or computer, wherever you download the app.Only thing is, you'll have to get a subscription to be able to view your pictures or videos. Either way it's less expensive than home security system. Once you purchase your camera is yours so your only paying for the cloud per se.Over all it's better than the blink camera which doesn't have all these features.Overall, I like it!!!

With innovative low-power technology, the outdoor security camera wireless has a more duarable standby capability up to 1-6 months after fully charged for 8 hours.,„ÄêWaterproof IP65 & Storage„Äë: The outdoor security camera wireless has IP65 waterproof protection and can be placed outside. Support local SD card storage up to 128GB(not included), and 30-day's free trail of cloud service which contains cloud storage, intelligent notification for people, pets & vehicles and customized activity zones monitoring. If you have any questions after receiving the camera, please find our customer service team on manual instruction.
name: Wireless WiFi Security Camera for Outdoor/Home Battery Powered, 1080P Video/Color Night Vision/AI Motion Detection, Siren Alarm and Spotlight, 2-Way Audio, Waterproof, SD/Cloud
review_header_1: Very impressed- great pic of a trespasser
review_text_2: I made a review about another camera system on under this camera. For that, I apologize to the seller. I realized the mistake I made while shopping for cameras for someone and I decided to look at the reviews.I've had this system in my home since March of 2021. The battery was strong and would last for 2 months. But now it last for maybe a week or so.Other than that, this camera system works great. I was not pressured into buying any upgrades and I love that I can use a SD card as an option. I will be ordering for the other person.
review_text_5: Vicoo, dct and kityhawk are all the same camera's with minor varieties, their apps are the same, but named different, they are a 1080p generic camera.The cam works great and has 3 levels of IR light, also has an led flashing light that can be set to flash during an alarm. It also has an alarm and 2 way talk and an alarm sound you can turn on, motion has 3 settings from low to high and looks great in color during the day and black and white in night vision.You can record to a mini sd card of 128gb, or 20 seconds without cloud service or micro sd card, it has digital zoom with no zoom lens, comes with 2 types of mounting brackets, 2 way tape and mounting screws.I just ordered my second camera and you can add up to 5 more camera's.Notifications to my cell due to an alarm is almost instant every test I ran a was under or around 2 seconds.The camera is well built and totally wireless, has a nice loud 2 way speaker, no cords at all and can be hooked up in less then a minute. I added a 128gb card and use the cloud storage for $4 a month, the longer you subscribe, the cheaper, ex 1 month, 6 months and 12 months.The camera is waterproof, the only problem with these is that they don't work with Alexa but send video over wifi to your phone, still working on getting a cam app I can use my tv to display camera's, I'm trying tiny cam pro and will update my review when finished.The wireless battery can last up to 6 months before needing recharge (mine is mounted outside for over a week now and my battery is at 98%.)when mounted within an area with low traffic. This camera comes with the recharge cord but no plug, it uses a macro plug instead of usb-c.Directions are English and makes sense, the app has a zone setting were you can change the area you want covered which cuts down false alarms. This camera is really a generic A@lo.

review_header_2: Great value, have patience with the set up
review_header_5: Easy set up and good price
review_text_1: Excellent system for the money. We have installed 4 of the 8. Easy hookup, got setting set and the system recording. Everything works well thus far. Cameras have a crystal clear picture & Nightvision reaches well too. We‚Äôve got the main areas covered right now.
review_text_2: I recently bought a house and wanted to upgrade my security system so I gave this unit a shot. Basically for 8 cameras and 1tb harddrive,the deal cant be beat. I didn't want wireless cameras cause I find those can cause problems so I decided on a wired unit. And the cabling definitely is tedious but the come with quite long cables so that gave me a little more freedom for that. The dvr unit was also a bit of a process, it works best with an ethernet cable connection, so setting that up initially did take some time. There is a bit of a guided set up which helps. But once that was done I had no problems remotely viewing my set up through the manufacturers app. I did run into a few questions and the manufacturer was really helpful so I was pleased about that. If you have the patience , this is a great system for the money, it has literally all of the features I wanted plus no subscription required to view remotely , and that was one of my top priorities when searching for a security system.
review_text_4: Great Product. I like the qualify of this security camera system. It's very clear. Easy setup, plug and play. No need open port on the router or using any type of domain to access from the web/smartphone. All in one system, came with pre installed 1 TB Hard drive. The capacity can record up to 1 month with 8 camera 1080P. The resolution was great with the 1080pIts a 4CH 1080P NVR can display the video clearly. 4 1080P 2MP wireless IP66 waterproof cameras with 24 LEDS automatic IR cut filter. The camera is indoors or outdoors at night, it can still be shot clearly. Up to 100 ft night vision. It come with remote view on PC and mobile devices with audio supportive, motion detection and email alerts, setup the NVR by mouse or the remote control, IP66 weatherproof cameras. The IP pro app on the iPhone very user friendly. I like the user interface was very simple and clean. I also found the signal repeater was a great function. Each camera can act as repeater and pass the signal back to the NVR. This way you don't need to put your NVR at the center of the all camera. I also see there was audio icon on each camera screen. This security camera come with motion sensor alert. Best part it's wireless so no more installation of long cable. The motion detection can be set in the system to record when there is an object moving in the recording area, and immediately send a video screenshot to you by email. You can also customize the detect area and sensitivity to reduce false alerts. Overall, I am pretty happy with this security camera system, it's very simple and easy to use, the quality is good and it's affordable and I recommend it.
review_text_5: Brought this XVIM 8CH 1080p security camera system for my small business for security purposes. Has been using for over a week, we are happy with our purchase so far.To begin with, the price of this sets of camera system was relatively attractive compared to others in the market. It was being well packed and includes 1TB Hard Drive and 8 pieces of cameras.Besides, the installation was quite easy if you read the instructions well before setting up. We can manage to set whole things up within 2 hours without any support from others.Finally, for the quality of pictures, I would say not excellent but was clear enough to record any people as well as any activities. With these cameras, we felt more secure and could be an evidence in case of any crimes.Overall, it‚Äôs worthy to have one.

review_text_1: much better than expected great picture sound could be better definitely picks up motion and snaps a shot and records save to local drive instead of buying storage from the company
review_text_2: This camera is perfect for my downstairs room! I put it in the light bulb socket on my fan for when my baby takes naps downstairs! It‚Äôs very easy to use and set up! I like that I can see and control everything from my phone! For the price and ease of use it was definitely worth it!
review_text_3: So I was just thinking I was going to grab a simple camera to watch my front door but this thing can clearly do a lot more. I can't really give my opinion on all of it since I am obviously a noob at this security camera stuff. The main thing, does it work as a camera? Yep. It can record video but I haven't really gotten into that. I'm not doing either of those. So, cool camera. Does everything that I want it to and a lot more that I'm not taking advantage of.
review_text_4: The picture at night is so clear! You could also mount this on the ceiling. They are not technology users and learned how to use it very quickly. I love that this one allows you to move the camera. The price is good for what you get, also bought one for friend's baby.

review_header_1: Thinking of video security??  This is the one!
review_header_2: Can't Beat the Quality or Ease of Installation At This Price
review_header_3: Great home system - REALLY Easy Setup!!!
review_header_4: Still love it after 2 years of ownership
review_text_1: If you have need of a security camera system this is the one. I spent hours researching and checking out different systems in person. Overall this system stood out significantly over others.Pros:- higher resolution. This is so extremely important. Higher the resolution means that you can see identifying information from further distances. Most systems stop at HD 1080 or 720. Reolink takes is another step past that.- PoE. Power over Ethernet allows extremely fast install as you only have one cable to run for the signal back to the recorder AND power. It also means that any holes you need to cut in your walls are much smaller.- The quality of the Ethernet cable is very nice, very flexible and easy to pass through tight spaces.- Multiple ways to access the video feed. Bring able to use my laptop/desktop, phone, tablet, or the Reolink recorder to access the interface and recordings is really nice. Especially when it came time to position the cameras. Bring able to see the camera view in my phone made the process a cinch.- The motion tracking system is great for maximising the recording time and minimising unneeded recordings and alerts.- Plenty of other cameras for specific needs that are 100% compatible and just plug.- Lots of extra ports for more camerasCons: ( these are rather minimal)- mounting screws strip very easily. This is a very common problem with screws in general now days. I really suggest not bothering with the included ones and great a pack of number 6 wood screws- Setting the motion sensitivity is a little tricky. Not really a complaint, but it does take a fair amount of tinkering to get it right for your needs. I suggest taking your time and don't expect to get it correct the first time.
review_text_2: This review also applies to these additional Reolink cameras I purchased along with this system:¬†
review_text_3: Received promptly with two extra dome cameras, as ordered. This is my third system - same location, just keep upgrading to new, better technology. My initial reaction is that this is a great system for home surveillance. I haven't disconnected and replaced the existing one yet but it should be easy as I was already using Ethernet cables (but I had to put converter baluns at each end - now I can just remove those and use existing cat5 and cat 6 cables). But I have fired it up on my desk and connected it to internet and all 10 cameras to be sure all was working.I have to say, while I'm pretty techie and have set up two prior systems, I was AMAZED at how simple and fast it was to set this up for access on my home network PC's, and on my iPhone and iPad. I used a DDNS internet setup in the past but did not need it for this system. It basically just set itself up once I downloaded the PC program and the iOS apps. I refuse to buy anything that has to use the manufacturer's website for internet access - with or without a fee. This works purely over internet with no need to go through REOLINK's servers - perfect! Some other popular brands are not so flexible.Cameras appear way more clear and sharp than my existing system. I ordered 2 extra cameras - the RLC-422 dome cameras with zoom. I have zoom cameras now but you have to use a small screwdriver at the camera to change the zoom to suit the location. I was surprised to find that these can be zoomed remotely using the software. Very nice - and focus adjusts automatically when zoom is changed.Came with virtually everything I needed - you'll want to get a small monitor to connect to the NVR (I got a lightweight 21.5" HDMI full HD monitor for about $100 that sits nicely on top of the NVR) as my existing one was ancient technology.I did upgrade the NVR firmware to one released less than a month ago - very easy to do but be aware that it will take around 45 minutes with no indication of progress. I was about to e-mail their support when it beeped that it was done and then re-started. Had to re-enter all of the set-up info. so do this before you get too far into things.So far, I'm very happy with this purchase, especially for the price - a good value compared to other more advertised brands.
review_text_4: Updated: I've had this for 2 years and still love it. It's indispensable for keeping my farm animals safe, seeing what's going on around the property day and night. Our setup is 16 cameras with total 2500 feet of cable; The cameras have been out in the rain, snow, ice, summer heat, dust and still work great.Reolink support has been awesome - only needed them a couple of times over the past 2 years -- first was a mysterious config issue which they diagnosed and solved; the second was last week when the transformer went out. We're out of warranty now but they still helped to diagnose the issue and we're back in action.Just having it out of commission for a few days showed us how much we rely on it. Being able to see that all is well inside the barns at 2am - wonderful. Even have a camera on the homing pigeons (yeah) - so fascinating to see them doing their thing when humans aren't around.We still just sit and watch it. If we have visitors, we all sit and watch it. Ok, that may be weird.Here's my original review --Day 3 and I love it. I started intending to buy 1 camera, bought 8, added 4 more. Now up to 12 and figuring out that I need (ok, want) more. My use is for farm cam to keep an eye on animals, so night vision/audio/POE and being affordable enough for multiple locations were my key purchase requirements. Has already brought invaluable peace of mind, and is just plain fun to watch (yes, we sit watching the security cameras). The color image is very nice; the night vision is great. I have it inside a goat barn, horse barn and pigeon loft and it is very clear even in nighttime low light (when it goes to black & white). I don't know that it would be mug shot level quality, but I do know I can tell which goat is being bad in the dark goat barn now. Also have it on several outdoor areas, where it's color late into the evening.Instructions are simple, but too simple and lacking some detail I would have liked; would have been nice to note somewhere that password needs a number (and special character?). Without any error message, that was just trial and error. Kind of a bummer for first experience with it, but once I was through that bit, everything else was so easy. POE is the way to go. Can't believe I even pondered on that for a day or two like I did. Installing a camera is literally 3 screws, drilling a hole for cable if needed, plugging in the cable on the camera to the ethernet cable, then the ethernet cable to the DVR - done! The DVR defaulted to auto add, so wait a few seconds and the new camera shows up. Maybe I'll put it on the internet sometime (and I can see from other reviewers that can be a project), but for now, straight out of the box and not connected to my network does exactly what I want.Some other notes --1. Another reviewer noted that the trick to audio is to make sure the DVR is set to record audio in addition to the camera being turned on for audio - very helpful.2. I dropped one camera (yes I did) and it wasn't damaged at all. These seem sturdy.3. After figuring out the 3-way articulation, it was easy to set up cameras pointing exactly where I wanted them. Though I went through a phase where things were at various angles (kind of modern art) then realized the barrel rotates too so now everything's level.4. The packaging was hilarious. Did they have a competition to see how much equipment would fit into the smallest box? Everything was well packed and nothing was even out of place. It was just the densest packing job I've seen for a while.5. Really glad I got the 16-channels because now I realize that everything needs to have a camera on it.... meadow, woods, pond....how did we get by without this?6. The night vision gives such a peace of mind; that was one reason I bought this particular camera system. These cameras have 36 IR LEDs, so more than the usual.An added bonus (other than not having to go out to the barn at 2am to check on them) is being able to see the amount of animal stuff that happens when humans aren't around.... fascinating
review_text_5: Had this in place and operational for just under a month now. Upon receipt I tested all the cameras and they all worked, each one was just "plug and play", plugged it in and the system saw it and began recording right away. Was really inpress with how easy it was. Ran the cables thru my attic to where I wanted the cameras, installed the camera and everyone of them worked, once again with no problems. Down loaded the app for my android phone from the google play store, and once I enter the appropriate password (that I had assigned) I was able to view each of the installed cameras with no issues at all. This made adjusting the cameras' direction very easy while I was up on the ladder. The app also let me, while reviewing a recorded segment, to copy it to my phone and then email it. Makes it very nice in case you wish to share something you recorded like say with the police. Over all I am very satified with the cameras and NVR. I have all ready purchased a couple of additional cameras to go with my setup. While I have a monitor hooked up to the NVR, for ease I have purchased a 10" tablet (amazon Fire 10") and am using it as an wall mounted monitor on the wall near the door, makes it nice to see who's there prior to opening it.Now the cameras that come with it are only 4mp, which works fine for my needs, but the supplied NVR can handle up to 5mp camera if you decide to upgrade later. Just another plus for the system.

review_header_1: Up load app on any smartphone to work with the camera
review_header_2: The best camera for remote locations!
review_header_4: Nice quality and love the ability to view live video when I want
review_header_5: Setup not easy - but overall a great camera
review_text_2: Amazing camera! Easy to set up. Easy to modify the settings via the app. The microphone is exceptional, I can hear things on the app like if I were standing where the camera was mounted.. The 1080p is crystal clear! Solar panel option and the fact it's on a data plan makes it super versatile! I bought an additional 2 since!
review_text_3: Got a Mint Mobile SIM for this cam. Setup was a breeze. Had to reboot the cam twice to get the SIM to activate (not a big deal). Battery is 75%+ every morning and is fully charged on solar every evening. Image quality is great. Android & iPad apps are excellent and easy to use. Motion sensing is slightly lacking as it is a PIR sensor and not image motion recognition. Camera only records motion events triggered by the PIR sensor so if you need constant recording you will need wired cameras and an NVR. Overall I'm very satisfied!
review_text_4: I bought this camera to monitor a remote renovation project and it works great. No power needed, no wifi required. It works on the rechargable battery & solar panel. At first I bought two tmobile sim cards from a seller on Amazon, but the sim cards would not work and the camera kept saying Sim card Not Recognized. I went to two different Tmobile stores and called customer service (45-minute call) and no one was able to help. I did not want to give up on the camera and I instead decided Tmobile was not the right route for me. I went to Target and picked up a FreedomPop Sim Card $9.99 - Free Basic Plan & GSM SIM Kit and it works great! The set up, from the time of using the FreedomPop was very fast, simple and easy and I am grateful at the quality and ease of the camera. I purchased two of them and would definitely recommend.
review_text_5: Update:changed my rating to 5 stars. The limited sim card options and reception problems are the cell companies issues not the camera manufacturer. The camera works reliably. Just took two days to set it up finding a pre-paid data provider.Also you are able to use an external battery pack to charge your camera.Nick of time! Most importantly be patient, the setup of the sim card is not a breeze it will take time and try your patience. T-mobile prepaid data sim cards are nearly non-existent as they are moving to a different platform. AT&T pre-paid works. What I recommend as steps to follow for setup. 1. Receive your camera/charge the battery right away. 2. Take your camera to the cellular store you plan on using for data. Set it up with the clerk and test it right there before you leave. Now the hard part is done, be sure your carrier is a GSM and supports WCDMA and FDD LTE. DO NOT EXPECT to receive your Amazon box and use the camera right away. I came to use this camera because I was looking for something multifunctional and reliable and I got that. Our old wifi camera died and cellular gives you a lot more flexibility. I was impressed with the solar panel and construction of the camera. I received the camera Tuesday night, set it up Wednesday night, caught the foal being born Thursday morning. Also audio is good and decent battery length. You should have a micro SD card to install right away. Overall a great camera, I'd give it five stars if it was easier to find a sim card that worked with it.

review_text_1: I have not owned these cameras for very long but so far, they have been functioning very well. The picture quality is great, but you do lose some details when you zoom in. The microphone feature is nice to have, and the vocal clarity is great. I am currently trying a new location for one of the cameras, as I have decided to face it out the front window, but I can remotely move the field of vision back inside the house if desired.
review_text_2: I love these cameras! I have two of them in my house and would love to get a couple more! Some of the things I love about this camera are: (1) the ability to select which portion of an image (see photo) I want to receive notifications on, (2) the ability to save a preset view so that if I move it around, I can click the preset and go back to where I want it to stay, (3) the ability to talk through the camera, (4) the ability to turn off notifications for sound, and (5) NO MONTHLY SERVICE FEE! Although this one isn't made for outdoor use, I placed it inside my house looking out my front door and I'm able to spy on my packages and whenever someone approaches the house. I often use my camera to also talk to my kids when I can't get a hold of them. Ha ha! All in all, a GREAT device and will DEFINITELY be buying more for our home in the future!
review_text_3: The blurams cam was recommended by many you tubers and is hands down one of the best cameras I have purchased. We have it installed upside down and use it as a baby monitor. Installation was easy and fast, and the picture quality is great during the day and night time. I just still need to figure out how the SD card storage works.
review_text_5: I wanted to be able to keep an eye on my place when I'm not around especially when I travel. I've seen different devices but this one popped up on my screen so I decided to give it a try. It was very easy to set up. Let me tell you I highly recommend this camera it has night vision and can rotate from left to right there is also a button to talk which is awesome.

review_text_1: I am a strong supporter of the Blink system, and these refurbished Minis were a great deal on a fine product. Of course, I connected them to the Sync Module so they integrate into my camera network. But they can be run independently if one wishes. I'm such a strong admirer of Blink that my Sync Module now supports the maximum of ten cameras, and I've never had a malfunction or any kind.
review_text_2: No problem setting up. Just download the app and plug ‚Äòem in!! Couldn‚Äôt be easier.Put one in the front area of the house and one in the rear area.Able to arm and disarm from the app.I would buy again if I needed more cameras.
review_text_3: Already have 10 of the wireless around the house and property. They are great. These are great too! Got four of these for inside the house and they are working fantastically!
review_text_4: i have had no issues with these cameras since purchasing. they operate the same as the ‚Äúnew‚Äù one i purchased last year.
review_text_5: Honestly if you told me these were refurbished I would say you‚Äôre joking. They came in the original packaging and they look like they worked just fine. No complaints here.

review_header_1: I've tried many security camera systems. This is the one!!
review_header_2: ZEEPORTE has redeemed my confidence in wireless security cameras!
review_header_4: For the price this camera exceeded my expectations.
review_text_1: My criteria for security cameras is as follows:1) Good quality picture2) Triggers at good distances3) Records videos locally (no monthly fee and privacy)4) Low number of false triggers5) A good phone app to control the cameras and view the videos.6) A reasonable priceThe Zeeporte camera checks all of the above boxes.I'll start here by saying that I've tried Eufy 2C, Vava, and Blink X2C systems. They are all more expensive (and sometimes much more expensive) than the Zeeporte. But the Zeeporte is a superior system to all that I've tried so far.The battery life of this camera is decent. I've used it heavily over the past 6+ days with many tests. I've recorded 209 motions and it is at 89%. Since I've used it heavily, I'll estimate 10% per week which means that it'll last 10 weeks (2.5 months) on a charge. In regards to size of the memory card that you'll need, I've used .22GB of the 120 GB card that I bought. At the current rate, it will record for 1.5 years before getting full - and then I'll just reset it. It is easy to transfer clips to your phone storage (online for my iphone).When I did my testing, I set it to the motion detection sensitivity to the highest value (95). What really impresses me with this camera is the low number of false triggers.. Really, I get none. It records people and cars and that is it. And it does not seem to miss any events. The angle of the camera did affect the distance of the triggering so try different angles.The only area of improvement that I can see is the mount. It is fine, but as I noted in my headline, I've tried several brands now including Eufy, Vava, and Blink. All of these brands had superior mounts, but the one that Zeeporte mount is fine. I had to make sure I tightened it well. One note - the other manufacturers that I listed require base stations and do not record on the camera itself. The Zeeporte does. This means if someone steals your camera, then they will get your videos. So, just don't put your camera within reach. A camera should not be mounted low and the instructions tell you to not do so. This is probably another reason that Zeeporte does not have a magnetic mount.. which would make it easy to steal. The mount that it has requires you to screw it off.Oh.. I just remembered another great feature of the Zeeporte. After your day is finished, you can view the events for the day (and all prior days) in a mode that shows you a timeline and lets you quickly sweep to each event based on the time and watch it. This is really nice to have!Overall, I do recommend it 100%
review_text_2: Last night was a disaster for me as I tried to get another brand of security cam to activate, I spent at least 5 + hours agonizing over the instructions, questioning my own intelligence and more 'Is it me?', I kept asking self.Long story short, it wasn't me, it was the product, and so going to return it.But smartly I ordered two security cams by two different companies and I'm here to say that 'ZEEPORT' has redeemed my happiness and joy and confidence in my ability to set up wireless WIFI connected security cameras...Also I timed it, from time I started activation to time it was up and running and it took less than 25 minutes!...I"m sure those more tech savvy than myself could do it in 15 or 10 minutes or less, I kid you not.Yes I'm a bit emotional cause coming off of a bruising night fooling around with that other security 'dome' camera system, which iI will not name, but if seek out my other review, you may stumble upon it...so yes I'm estatic right now cause ZEEPORTE delivered to me what they promised, a product that works right out of the box, a product to where you don't have to be a computer scientist to figure out, and all along the way, through each step, on your phone there's a 'help tab', in case you need help.Their 'help' doesn't hide from you.In closing, to be honest this can't be considered a totally full review, cause I haven't left my home yet and tried viewing camera from afar, until I do that, only consider this a 50% review.But will say WIFI connection was super easy...I mean super easy, compared to lasts night nightmare with other product (actually it was easy also, but after wifi connected to product their 'network' did not function).Anyways, so far so good with this product and will give another review as soon as can test away from home and see how it does then.It's a outdoor camera, but I have it indoors for now since other products failed me, I will order more though, probably from this brand, we shall see.
review_text_3: I love this camera, it gives great night vision even when my yard light is not on. Motion detection is great it alert me on everything it captures including the garbage man waking me up not to miss my trash guy, The birds in the attic, The neighbour talk. Even when it very windy and something is blowing across the street. Picture quality is absolutely awesome and incredible clear as day light. I call see all three of my neighbors home including mine. The voice quality is very good. If you asked me if I would recommend this camera to anyone else I would not hesitate to yes. I would recommend this to everyone. That's one reason. Why I gave this camera a 5 star. Yes it will video when you tap on the screen to see what going on for as long as you wish. The installation is easy all you have to do is charge for how long the instruction says. I have not charge mine since I put it up and it still has a full battery. This is a great gift and if you live alone and travel it's great to have because you can also put on the away button on your camera. . Ank me again and I will tell I am getting ready to purchase a second one for my home. I wish they came in a double pack. It gives me a piece of mind when I sleep at night to know I am safe. If I could give this camera a 10 out of 10 I would. I surely recommend this to anyone who is looking to purchase a camera for their home.
review_text_4: For my first ever security camera I am highly impressed. I needed a battery operated camera with easy installation and this one is perfect. Set up was easy, it was mostly charged when I received it and I easy drilled it to a tree. WiFi connection is excellent, picture quality is pretty good and the night vision is really good. I noticed the picture quality is better on sunny days rather then really cloudy days. You can change the motion detection, watch live, download videos and delete video all from the free app that you download. Honestly for the price I think I that this camera is pretty awesome and far better then I actually expected. You need a microsd card and to download an app. Other then that everything else is a piece of cake. I would recommend this camera.
review_text_5: I was sceptical at first on purchasing this security camera.I was looking for a really good security camera for the outside of my house.I have simplysafe for my home security system and have there camera as well inside but am not impressed with putting one of there security camera outside of the house.after reading the reviews on this camera.I figured that I would take the chance with it and see how it would perform.after unboxing the camera,and going thru the instructions which were very easy to understand.I figured I would just stick the camera temporarily inside the window seal and see how it would perform, before I mount it.and I must say that I was more then pleased with the clarity of the picture.as you can see from the above pictures.shooting thru the window from the distance that I had it was outstanding. Which I plan to install outside which will work great with my motion lights outhere. As far as the motion sensor it picks up motion great .you can adjust in the setting to suit you,it also has a home mode along with an away mode...as far as battery life I will have to up date in a later review.it came fully charged and seems to be holding pretty good.I must say if you are looking for a really good security camera,I believe you will be more then impressed with this one.Hands down it beats my simply safe cam hands down and for alot less priced.

review_text_2: This camera was just what I needed to keep an eye on my house. I don't have a baby, but I set it up in the living room for security purposes and it's been super convenient so far. I'd recommend this if you're looking to keep an eye on your house. It's a good size and can fit in a lot of different places.
review_text_3: This is a nice monitor camera. The instruction manuals print is very small. Need a magnifying glass to be able to read.
review_text_4: Easy to install. Worth to buy. Night version is good option.
review_text_5: Great baby monitor, I love how I can move the lens around and see the entire spectrum. The quality is also amazing and I can see a clear picture of when my baby needs help. Is easy to move around when you need to see the baby when you need to walk away for a few minutes.

The cameras now show a full charge every day. The solar panels are evidently sufficient for this application.

I decided to buy several cameras that are solar charged and they are always full of charge.Pros: When power goes out or internet goes down, you still get recordings saved on micro ss card which is uploaded to cloud later.Cons: There is a delay opening view on app with solar, unlike the wired versions. review_text_2: Likes:Spotlight does a good job of lighting up the surveillance areaNew software features show recording preview v my Argus 2Solar panel works greatCompared to the Eufy 4K I tried, no need for base station, better/faster connectivity, and less expensiveDislikes:A bit difficult to tighten mount without camera or ball mount rotating. When to try to fix the rotation, the mount loosens again.
review_text_3: So far, this camera was worth every penny. Great picture quality, easy install and has a slot for an SD card to save alerts so no subscription service needed. Comes with the solar panel that hooks in simple and the camera itself comes with 3 different mounting options. This is a great choice for a moderate price.
review_text_4: This solar powered camera and monitoring system is excellent for it's value. Easy install, connection, and set up. Motion sensor even picked up moths and notified me. Several controls which are responsive all the way in the other side of the country. Seriously considering purchasing more.
review_text_5: We did a lot of research before getting a camera and this one was the final choice. It's better than expectations. The video is clear, the night vision is great, the motion light is nice and bright for the size, and the cordless capability makes it easy to mount anywhere.

review_text_1: Bought this for my non-tech-savvy wife and here's her review :Perfect for checking on an injured pony on stall rest, day and night!!! (Barn is 25 min away and no wifi.)Video is SMOOTH and picture quality is GREAT (screenshots from my camera)! Two settings : hi or lo - I use lowest resolution here, and can easily see if his wraps are undone. Slight lag time on pan/tilt but it's perfectly fine.Moderately easy to set up (Corrine at Reolink tech support emails helped BIG TIME, as upon doing a "factory reset" on the camera, everything worked as it should!) and shoutout to #HuntingFarmer for recommending the FreedomPop $5 a month 12-Month Prepaid plan (bought it for $43!). I don't have to worry about data for 12 months - Each time I pop in to view, I use up 2 MB - so I figure, with the 1 GB allotted, I can pop in 500 times a month (= 16 times a day, which is more than I actually use!) without going over.I set it at lowest motion setting, so no recording is triggered - with that, the camera uses up about 2-5% battery a day; unfortunately, the barn has no direct sunlight (did not think of that when I purchased with the solar panel)... but I just hooked up the solar panel anyway and we will see if the battery lasts any longer. Luckily, it's easy to take down for a quick charge.All in all, a perfect, self-sustaining barn camera. Exactly what I've been looking for!
review_text_3: I have used the Reolink Go for a few months in a horse stall and its been great. When I needed another camera, I saw that this camera can rotate remotely through the app and has a few more features. It has worked seamlessly in the app and installing the camera was easier than the Reolink go with the guides to drill (I recommend taking a copy of it so just in case you move the camera it is easy to install). I have a tmobile sim card that has worked great.Areas of opportunity:-I do wish it had a removable battery like the reolink go but the other ways to charge it have worked.- If you have more than one reolink camera, you have to update your cloud which is a monthly/annual cost; which I found a bit annoying but the app is great so its been worth it so far.Overall, the picture quality is great and being able to remotely control it through the app has been awesome!
review_text_4: I am extremely happy with this camera / solar panel. I mounted it to the spreader of my sailboat mast using the strap it comes with. I also mounted the solar panel just above it using a zip tie. I did not have to drill any holes in my mast. It has never lost signal, not once! I've been testing it for 2 months now. I can see my boat on the mooring ball using my cell phone anywhere/anytime, I can get alerts if there is an intruder or birds lol, it records when there is motion on the included memory chip. I am blown away at how good it is. I also have another fixed size camera from REOLink inside the boat to see the control panel. That one has been solid as well. I cannot say enough about REOLink!
review_text_5: This is a fantastic camera. The support if awesome too. It took a while to figure things out, but be patient and you may. I found Speedtalk the best sim card provider by far. $8 + $8 per month for 1 GB, which seem to be enough to check camera 2-3 times a day and download some clips here and there. Must have cell reception. GSM, I believe, like T mobile. Do your research please for your situation. Besides catching a thief, I've seen Fox, Coyote and other interesting critters. I like that it has almost 180 sweep and up/down. Solar. Incredible.
