review_text_1: Many advantages. Only 4 holes needs to be drilled to put up the camera. No need for any wires as tge cam is wireless and no power required. Even if the sun is not there you can detach the solar cell charge it and put it back. Easy to charge. The app recommends the power consumption for various settings. I like the option of continious light or infra red. The cam gives option of saving on cloud or sd card. The wire from the cam to cell is long enought if the direction of solar cell needs to be different that cam. One of the other ways I used it was to use it by placing it any where temporary as it has its own power supply you can place it any where indoor or outdoor like camping. The app displays that battery charge level so if it goes down you can charge it manually. Multiple phones can watch the footage at the same time. I wish this could connect to google home or alexa.
review_text_2: This is the second solar camera I bought. This is an excellent high-end security camera. The motion detection starts quickly, works much better than my Ring doorbell. I got the first camera to overlook my backyard, and because I like it very much, I got the second one for my driveway. I love being able to view my property without having to go outside. It helps me to keep track of what is going on. This is the ideal solution for me because where I placed it, this is an area where I can't run electric power. It has been great to run off solar power and don‚Äôt worry about electric installation. Living in NY, it hits direct sunlight for just a few hours each day, but that seems to be more than enough to power it completely. I am happy with the video quality and detection quality. It does a great job at night and even has lights, which is pretty cool‚Äîoverall an excellent option for areas with no power.
review_text_3: I intall it in the far back on my 2 acres yard, everybody notice it and it looks very sophisticated so i think that is a huge deterrent for any intruder by itself. Additionally i find a feature that i didn't expect, it have white led lamp in addition to the night IR, so its a really good option for my back yard where i dont have any lights or electricity, o can easily turn it on with my phone and move it around. Image quality is good enough for surveillance and monitoring. Very happy.
review_text_4: I installed this solar powered security camera on my shed overlooking my backyard as I do not have a power source to plug a camera in. The solar panel provides all the energy to keep the camera up & operating without have to constantly take it down to recharge inside my house, like other outdoor units.this model was perfect to keep an eye on things while not at home.I had to replace my previous solar camera, it wasn‚Äôt giving me enough range .. I decided on this model Specifically because it was the best price I could find with The 360¬∞ coverage .The camera & solar panel install was very easy.. Despite the camera being a little heavy, the mount holds it it securely!!I have been using it now for over a month and I am very happy with it!I have the app installed & I am quite familiar with how to setup & use the features. I can honestly say the app is extremely user friendly. This camera uses wifi, so as long as you have a decent connection in range, you can remotely use this camera. There are a few functions within the app for setting up different notifications. The picture quality of of both night and day are extremely clear when viewed on my phone. Camera has excellent night vision!The design, the functionality, the quality, the app viewing & notifications are among the best that I have used in terms of affordable security cameras. A very well made product & I highly recommend trying it out.Worth the price!!
review_text_5: I have several solar powered cameras around my house since I can't easily get power everywhere. This is the first time that I have tried a PTZ one with pan and tilt. It was very easy to set up and get connected and the 1080P picture quality is great day or night. It has a floodlight mode where you can use it as a security light and get full color at night. The PIR motion detection isn't great but works as well as most. The only issue I had was finding a micro SD card that would keep working. I tried several that worked in other cameras but after a day I would get a no memory card found error. Tech Support via email has been great and after putting in a brand new name brand 64GB card it has worked perfectly.

review_text_1: Camera very easy to configure in addition to having the possibility of not charging the battery thanks to its very good solar panel, the battery was almost fully charged at the factory but once the solar panel was installed in a few hours the configuration was fully charged with the The application is very easy and compatible with the cameras of the same brand that I have installed in my house, its images are very clear both in video and in photographs that are programmed at a specific time if you want automatically the price-quality ratio and operation are reasonable and satisfactory the highlight that makes me very happy is not worrying about having to be connected the power every time its battery level drops since the solar panel is very practical and effective the application to access the camera is very nice . pets in my yard I recommend to anyone who wants to protect and increase their security this camera for its price and quality I will continue to try it to make an update of its operation and recommendations in general I feel safer with my family and confident in its good operation and as a novelty angles of movement that I can use remotely.
review_text_2: Last yeah, we actually saw moose in our ER for the first time. Since then, because of cobit I believe, many wildlife has been out and about in our area. We also have a birdhouse where we get various animals and luckily we don't have black bear so far but it's very interesting to see different animals with this camera.The installation is very easy and the setup is simple with the app, the camera was up and running within a few minutes. The solar panel seems to be charging the camera even during cloudy days and we have not had any issue with charging the internal battery.It has me several times already and had snow for the first time the other day but camera works beautifully in the PTZ control works amazingly well!
review_text_3: Definitely like these cameras. 3 cameras covered my whole house. Like the pan tilt feature,and the intercom on it. Picture quality is very good night and day. Definitely 5 stars from me.
review_text_4: This is a solar powered camera, the app to download is called CloudEdge and it‚Äôs was an easy set up, the motion sensor picks up everything, the images is clear, you can talk true this as well, a bonus is that the camera can pan and move around so you really don‚Äôt need two cameras to see the front of your house!
review_text_5: The camera was fairly easy to set up. It took several tries to pair it with the Wi-Fi but every device I have ever added like this requires several attempts to pair. Customer service was excellent I used the chat to communicate with customer service. They were very patient and helpful. I had a problem with the wording they used to instruct you to create a password. The technician directed me and sent me a sample password to use to login and from there he checked back with me several times to make sure that the set up was complete and I had no more questions. I do not know what time zone they are in but the customer service rep that I was chatting with was up with me until almost midnight. If you buy as many gadgets as I buy that need technical support I can tell you that the customer support is most definitely excellent. I purchased this camera because I bought a beach house in Mexico and it is made out of concrete. There is nowhere to run cables so this is just perfect there are no cables so all you need is the sun and a Wi-Fi connection and you are good to go

review_text_1: This is by far the best security camera I've had. You can move the camera around from the app which is really cool and if you put it in the right place you can cover a ton of area. The solar panel holds the batteries and there is room inside of 6 18650's which is probably a bit of overkill, it comes with 3 installed and room for 3 more, unless it's dark for days on end the 3 batteries should be plenty, but always good to have options. The motion detection is spot on and starts quickly, works much better than my Ring doorbell. Overall awesome high end security camera.
review_text_2: Amazing üëè technology advanced security camera..Swivel using app is incredible coupled with Zoom feature is outstanding...than on top of that the Solar charging as you can see in my picture is by far one of the best features....Totally wireless and with the WiFi feature...Pictures are only in SD that I took but it has the HD feature by simply tapping in app...Alert settings are amazing as seen in my pics. Without question a bargain for the money! Easy install and connection!
review_text_3: Cameras work as advertised (I have 2). I ordered extra batteries (18650) from Amazon (separately) and added them in to the cameras. As with all cameras, finding a good mounting position is the hardest part. This one needs to have a good wi-fi signal, which means you will likely have to add an outdoor wi-fi extender or outdoor wired LAN antenna, or indoor wi-fi extenders on inside walls closest to outside camera location. I ordered wifi-extenders (TP-Link AC750 WiFi Extender RE230) separately also on AMZN, and setup up the extenders and cameras inside, prior to installing cameras outside. Had to move extenders to various locations inside the house to get best connection to camera and to base wi-fi. SOLIOM+ App seems to work pretty good, and camera stays connected to wi-fi. All wi-fi problems so far have been with my signal & extenders, not the camera as far as I can tell. My camera (and solar panel) are in shade under trees, and we have had several dark stormy days, but after several weeks I have had no battery charging issues, and cameras have stayed online all the time, day and night. I also added memory cards (SD) to each camera before installation. I record all video to SD.I tried to activate the free (7-day?) Trial Cloud video storage via the SOLIOM+ app on my phone, but it just didn't work. I wanted to test that Cloud storage before sending any money for a paid account, but that's on hold until I can try to get the free Trial to work. Camera video quality is great, day and night -- I use the night vision mode by turning off the cameras light and use IR. Pan/Tilt works good, but you should know that is is in 'fixed increments' when you hit the app p/t buttons. There is no optical zoom, but you can 'zoom' in the app with normal phone 2-finger touchscreen operation. Also, there is no way to view video through any other means other than their SOLIOM+ app on the phone. A firmware upgrade would be greatly appreciated that allows standard network access from camera to software like Blue Iris. Most camera makers seem to have proprietary software or apps so this maker is not unusual. 1 drawback is (at maximum movement sensitivity) camera misses some activity (cars and people in driveway). There is also a 'glitch' (I would call it), where motion is activated just fine, but recording stops at your preset time limit, even though motion continues. There will be no added video either on the original clip or on additional clips. All additional motion is just not recorded. On the other camera which is viewing only yard, (versus driveway, cars, people), motion is activated for leaves falling and bugs flying by. None but the most expensive (several times $cost of this one) have great motion control so this isn't a complaint given the price of these cameras, just be aware of some of the limitations of less expensive cameras like this one. So far this camera has operated in weather from 80's down to upper 20's (F) and in lots of rain without any problem. 1 big problem is that when recording to SD card, you can only *view* the saved video on your phone (in the SOLIOM+ app), but you cannot download the video and save it to your phone or anywhere else -- you have to open the camera, take out the SD card, then copy the video clips that way - which is pretty ridiculous. That is probably the only reason NOT to get this camera. I assume, but have not tested it, that video on their cloud service would be downloadable to a PC or something. There are video capture apps for android that may help to capture the video while you play it on your phone, but I have also not tried any of that. SOLIOM+ app should be updated ASAP to allow downloading video from SD to phone storage.
review_text_4: We love the pan, tilt, zoom option and the video quality is great. The setup is extremely easy. You can add 3 extra 18650 batteries for backup power but it's not really needed. You can store/review the files on your micro SD card or the cloud. If you want to use the cloud, they have 3 different price plans as shown in the pics. So far so good, really happy with this purchase.

review_text_1: iegeek makes great security cameras. I own several of their outdoor, solar power, high definition cameras which allow you to talk to the person you are watching, and listen to them. They have infrared for night viewing / recording and even with no outdoor light, the night image is of very good quality. This camera improves on their previous ones by allowing you to pan the image left, right, up and down. It has SD and HD video settings. It connects using your 2.4 Gz Wifi. Setup is very easy. The camera gives you clear instructions as to what to do so you can not make a mistake. It also comes with written instructions but these are really not needed. The Cloudedge application, available free to download on your android and apple store, is very easy to use, intuitive and allows you to configure the camera settings to your liking. The camera has a SD slot for a SD of up to 128 GB. Plenty of room for hours of recording. It records at intervals that you set and is has motion sensing capabilities so that you don't waste SD space nor battery power recording useless video. Overall I am very happy with this security camera and I highly recommend it...
review_text_3: If you're looking for a decent camera to monitor things inside or outside your home, this might the right choice for you. This camera sets up and installs easily, includes all the hardware needed and even comes with a small solar panel so you don't need to take it down to charge. The internal battery should run for 3-6 weeks without charging depending on how often the camera turns on.Night vision is decent. 2-Way audio works well and can be turned off in the app.This camera only records when there's motion which can be a good thing if you're looking to save data usage on your home internet service.Highly recommend!Pros:- Easy to set up and install. Takes all of 30 seconds to connect to the CloudEdge app.- Diversity antennas for better connection to your WiFi.- Powered by internal batteries which are charged by mini USB or included solar panel.- The CloudEdge app is fast and responsive to the pan and tilt commands.- $30/year for cloud recording (per device).Cons:- Does not support ONVIF or browser based access. You must use the CloudEdge app.- No iPad version of CloudEdge app as far as I can tell.- Only supports 2.4GHz WiFi. Check your Wifi Equipment. Most are 2.4GHz / 5GHz.- May not charge properly in very cold climates. Literature says don't charge below 0degC.
review_text_4: I set up this camera to watch my front door but also wanted to be able to keep an eye on my backyard when the dogs go out so needed one that would pan. I mounted it on a beam of the roof to get a good view so the solar panel is an awesome addition to avoid having to remove the camera to charge it. It's been about a week and still 100% battery so the panel is working as expected! This was my first piece of equipment that came with a solar panel so I was a bit intimidated but it was much easier to setup then expected.The quality of the camera is excellent, both day and night vision. I have other cameras that use the CloudEdge app so setup was quick and painless. The mounting screws were a bit too long to get into the beam easily so I used shorter ones so I didn't have to wait for help with a drill and was able to install it by myself and I'm confident it's not going anywhere.The only downside to this camera is the inability to view or operate it outside of the CloudEdge app. This is not an issue for me though as I use an SD card so if I need to save the footage I can do so by recording through the app. Cloud storage is available also. The app does everything I need it to, I figured out that the camera will pan by touching the live feed as well which is awesome.Overall I'm extremely satisfied with this camera, it's much more than I expected for the price range.
review_text_5: Before I know there were actually sun powered camera exist on the market . I have giant old school camera installation by my land lord . God know how old is that camera. And my wife and I recently experienced miss letters from th USPS . Most important there are EDD unemployment checks . After we contact USPS So we though that might be some people took it after Carrie drop offI first tried the dashcam on the rear windshield. But the problem is that we can't keep the power on without turn the car on . And I second try was put a portable power bank hook up with my dash cam. And it works but only for a few hoursThen I did research and decide to give a try on the solar system camera . Obviously it fits my needs . I put camera next to rear window . And solar panel at front .the cable are perfectly enough for my car . I turned on the motion detective mode . It kinda blow my mind . Totally new thing to me . It will record everything if there is motion and send your a message if you decide to open the permission push to you. We turned on so Everytime carrier drop off and I will receive motion message ony phone .Camera has standard and HD to tier . I highly recommend use the HD . IT make the motion detective more effective. One more good thing I like a lot is the night vision . It will record even the whole dark situation .Breif :meet ally needs No drill no screw no mount needed. . and even if I moved later and just packed up and as long as has sunlight it will do the job . . Very satisfied . All senario . Oh even batter waterproof . But I haven't tested .

review_header_1: Up load app on any smartphone to work with the camera
review_header_2: The best camera for remote locations!
review_header_4: Nice quality and love the ability to view live video when I want
review_header_5: Setup not easy - but overall a great camera
review_text_2: Amazing camera! Easy to set up. Easy to modify the settings via the app. The microphone is exceptional, I can hear things on the app like if I were standing where the camera was mounted.. The 1080p is crystal clear! Solar panel option and the fact it's on a data plan makes it super versatile! I bought an additional 2 since!
review_text_3: Got a Mint Mobile SIM for this cam. Setup was a breeze. Had to reboot the cam twice to get the SIM to activate (not a big deal). Battery is 75%+ every morning and is fully charged on solar every evening. Image quality is great. Android & iPad apps are excellent and easy to use. Motion sensing is slightly lacking as it is a PIR sensor and not image motion recognition. Camera only records motion events triggered by the PIR sensor so if you need constant recording you will need wired cameras and an NVR. Overall I'm very satisfied!
review_text_4: I bought this camera to monitor a remote renovation project and it works great. No power needed, no wifi required. It works on the rechargable battery & solar panel. At first I bought two tmobile sim cards from a seller on Amazon, but the sim cards would not work and the camera kept saying Sim card Not Recognized. I went to two different Tmobile stores and called customer service (45-minute call) and no one was able to help. I did not want to give up on the camera and I instead decided Tmobile was not the right route for me. I went to Target and picked up a FreedomPop Sim Card $9.99 - Free Basic Plan & GSM SIM Kit and it works great! The set up, from the time of using the FreedomPop was very fast, simple and easy and I am grateful at the quality and ease of the camera. I purchased two of them and would definitely recommend.
review_text_5: Update:changed my rating to 5 stars. The limited sim card options and reception problems are the cell companies issues not the camera manufacturer. The camera works reliably. Just took two days to set it up finding a pre-paid data provider.Also you are able to use an external battery pack to charge your camera.Nick of time! Most importantly be patient, the setup of the sim card is not a breeze it will take time and try your patience. T-mobile prepaid data sim cards are nearly non-existent as they are moving to a different platform. AT&T pre-paid works. What I recommend as steps to follow for setup. 1. Receive your camera/charge the battery right away. 2. Take your camera to the cellular store you plan on using for data. Set it up with the clerk and test it right there before you leave. Now the hard part is done, be sure your carrier is a GSM and supports WCDMA and FDD LTE. DO NOT EXPECT to receive your Amazon box and use the camera right away. I came to use this camera because I was looking for something multifunctional and reliable and I got that. Our old wifi camera died and cellular gives you a lot more flexibility. I was impressed with the solar panel and construction of the camera. I received the camera Tuesday night, set it up Wednesday night, caught the foal being born Thursday morning. Also audio is good and decent battery length. You should have a micro SD card to install right away. Overall a great camera, I'd give it five stars if it was easier to find a sim card that worked with it.

review_text_1: I was looking for an alternative to the brand name cameras for the exterior, that wouldn‚Äôt require a subscription service. This holds an SD card so that you don‚Äôt pay a monthly fee. It was easy to setup through the app and the picture quality is great. It‚Äôs night vision is comparable to the Ring doorbells. Highly recommend if you don‚Äôt want to be tied to a subscription but still want security around the house.
review_text_2: Pairing the camera with the app was very easy (just bring up a QR code in the app and point the camera at the image on the phone). I was impressed with the wireless range of the camera -- other cameras that I have tried could not be mounted on my (detached) garage, as their signal would not be picked up by my router. The Conico camera has no issues with the wireless connection. The side of the garage only gets direct sunlight for part of the afternoons, but the battery has had no issues maintaining a full charge. (Today was overcast all day, and the battery is at 94% as of 5pm.) Overall, I am very pleased with this camera.
review_text_3: Very happy overall. Easy setup up. Only one thing brought out the naughty words and that was the screws that were supplied to secure the bases. Let me save you a big headache of stripping them out. Buy or use better screws. I even pre-tapped the holes and they still stripped. I think you‚Äôll be happy and no contract. Download the app CloudEdge on your phone and follow directions. Another simple process. It does connect to Wi-Fi and mine is about 20 feet away with a 97% signal. It will also do a diagnostic test to see if your Wi-Fi will operate the camera at your location prior to screwing it on with the new screws that you just bought.
review_text_4: Great security camera! I was looking for one that was easy to set up and use!The installation was fast, it works great and I finally have a camera over the garage that I like! The image is great and the best part is that it is a solar one! Highly recommend!
review_text_5: Looking for my outdoor camera for long time, but the extension power cord looks so ugly. This camera solves my problem and looks nice. The app is easy to use and picture quality also good. I like this product as recommend to anyone who like to save some time for installation.

review_header_3: Can detect motion from night time visitors
review_header_4: Excellent camera - video audio quality superb
review_text_2: After about a week of owning this camera, I am very happy with it. The camera came very well packaged, with easy to understand, detailed instructions.The startup and installation was very simple.The camera is completely wireless, which means in order to operate it you are required to download the cloudedge app, which is how the camera is controlled. I would prefer the camera to also be functional offline or without an app, but the cloudedge app works great - it has detailed settings for camera sensitivity, video resolution, 2 way audio, direction control, video playback, etc.This is the first security camera I have owned, so I was surprised to see how good the video quality and audio quality actually was. The solar panel seems to be keeping the unit charged good. The 2 way intercom also worked great.Overall, I would recommend this product for anyone looking for an affordable, high quality wireless security camera. It is a great money saving alternative to a monthly subscription doorbell camera.
review_text_3: It is very interesting to watch the night time activities that happen in my driveway, now I look forward to clicking on those wee hours motion detection alerts. I have been enjoying those night time visitors, even ones I would not want to meet in person including coyotes, skunks, raccoons. Since installing the camera, I have had my own wildlife nocturnal animal view-cam watching these animals. I wasn't aware that there is a raccoon family of four living in the storm drain in front of my house until I saw this video and the longer distance that it covers. The lights are not on in the driveway at night.Enough said about nocturnal animals, this camera gives me a great view of my driveway, folks walking along the street as well as anyone approaching the house and using my driveway as a turnaround central, something I am trying to fix. I have been able to identify the parties who used my private driveway as their personal turnaround central and talked to them to stop the practice.I would recommend this camera, the PTZ function is an added bonus as well the solar panel, no need to climb a ladder to adjust the tilt angle or remove the camera to charge the battery.
review_text_4: I have had great experience with Boifun Group's products before, so I thought I'd jump on this deal. I popped in a Micro SD card, charged up the camera, and it connected quickly and easily to my home Wifi. I first desk tested it with some live video. I was very impressed with the quality of the video and audio. Using the CloudEdge app, I was able to maneuver the camera on all axis. I then set it up outside using the provided solar panel to maintain battery charge. Again, with the app, I was able to set the camera to motion detection. The app alerted my phone and allowed me to watch the video segments. This is an excellent product and I highly recommend it!
review_text_5: I am so impress with this camera that I will buy another one for the back of my house. What I like the most is that I will get an alert INSTANTLY via cell phone when it detects a human motion. I also get the alerts on my apple watch. I‚Äôll know when someone is at my front door (postman, delivery man etc) . I can also easily speak to them through the camera intercom and I don‚Äôt need to be at home ! This will be especially helpful when I have to travel.The picture clarity is very clear and can I zoom in and move the lens around to see other directions and again I don‚Äôt need to be at home to do this.With the solar board, I‚Äôm going to be able to install the camera above my fence outside my property with out needing an electrical outlet .The instructions and CloudEdge app was very easy and simple to follow to get the camera started . Overall , this camera is well worth buying. Again Im very impress with the camera.

review_header_4: Security cameras have come a long way!

review_text_1: I'd like to break this review down into 2 parts. One for the product and one for the customer service.Product:This camera has great quality. I've posted some pictures of the camera quality here and I have the camera mounted on my front gate facing the dirt road. In the distance there are mountain views which other camera I've tested had poor quality.Now with the camera mounted about 15ft high it doesn't do a great job with reading license plates but that's to be expected. Don't let it deter you from buying one of these because this has a few features that are really helpful.Before putting this up I had major issues with people on quads riding down the dirt trails and blowing dust everyone which would be all over my vehicles. I live in Arizona so this is to be expected but this is a private road and people should not be speeding down the road on quads.Well I installed this camera as well as a security camera sign(see pictures) and the quad traffic has drastically dropped! Just installing this has made a HUGE difference! I believe the really bright LED lights the come on when an object passes is the biggest reason quad traffic has slowed down. Its clearly known at night now that quadders are being watched!Having the really bright LED lights is just a HUGE plus I can't get over how much this has helped because it makes itself known much better than just a flashing light which this camera does have.The LED light and flashing light can be turned on or off at anytime through the app as well. Meaning of you don't want the lights on because maybe you'd prefer to hide your camera you can completely shut these features off.App:Okay so I have tried a Solium solar panel in the past and the difference between the app is night and day vs the Solium camera.I'd say something that the other camera didn't have which was important to me was the ability to download videos from the app straight to the phone WITHOUT having to pay for cloud service. This is so handy for putting these video files on to your computer to either touchup the lighting or email it to law enforcement or friends/family.The app is very clean and works great. I have not had lagging or bugs with the CTRONICS app as I have with other camera apps.One downfall however is the fact that there is NO ONVIF support or a web portal. This is helpful to me because it would allow me to use TinyCam Pro on phone to see this camera along with my other cameras all in one place. On the flip side though, I am able to see all my ctronic cameras in this one app.I have a portable battery powered ctronics camera that unfortunately has its own app called Cloud Edge that I don't like. Thankfully this camera uses the same CTRONICS app that most of their cameras use.As much as I would love to have ONVIF support I do understand why it's not available. Since this camera goes into sleep mode when there's no motion having a remote connection wouldn't work. Otherwise the camera would be on 24/7.Night Vision:I have not been able to do many tests with night vision because I prefer the LED lights to turn on with motion. With the LED lights I can see in color at night. As soon as you connect to the camera the LED lights come on as well. However playing around a little with the night vision seems to work really well at 15ft high. I have no complaints.Microphone and Speaker:This is another huge plus! The microphone quality is just as good as any other camera I've used in the past but what really amazes me is the speaker on this thing. Using the CTRONICS app I spoke through the app to use the speaker on the camera and WOW! The speaker on this camera is WAY louder than any of the cameras I have INCLUDING other CTRONICS cameras I own. This is awesome because the camera is 15ft high and anyone would be able to clearly hear me speaking through the camera! Major plus for me!Battery Life:I've had this camera up for about 2 weeks now and I can't really so much about how long the battery will last but I can tell you I have a lot of traffic in front of my gate. From cars to quads this camera is constantly waking up and recording. Even at night the battery doesn't drop much at all and the next day the solar panel charges the battery back to full.Surprisingly the battery lasts much longer than the old Solium solar camera I had on the pole before which had 6 batteries.Guys and gals, this camera is well worth the money! It was so easy to setup with the CTRONICS app and I have nothing bad to say about this camera. Buy, buy, and buy more! They are well worth it! I currently have 4 CTRONICS cameras and they have ALL been great.Customer Service:CTRONICS has been awesome! From the very first camera I bought I've kept buying more of these. At one point I recieved a scratch card inside the second box and won a free sd card. I decided I'd email CTRONICS and see if they really would send me one for free. Well I never got the SD card BUT instead they sent me a battery powered camera which I currently have setup now.They have been so helpful with every question I've had that they have become my go to camera. Not only are the products well built but the customer service is amazing!Let me tell you if you have ANY issues with a product you bought from CTRONICS I GUARANTEE they will get you a replacement or help you get setup EVERYTIME. I'm telling you the customer service is just absolutely amazing.Thanks,MikeEdit: 5/6/2021 This camera has still been working amazing on the gate. Even with Arizona's harsh heat it's still holding up amazing. It's been so useful and has helped with a missing FedEx package. I'd also like to say thank you so much for those that have marked this review as helpful!
review_text_2: This camera is very easy to install. Assembly and mounting is intuitive. The camera is a complete system with batteries, solar charging panel, memory card slot...everything. No cables are needed as it connects wirelessly to your phone or tablet. I have installed this on a portable mount next to my motorhome to observe my entry door, my car, and the surrounding area. The motion detection will sound an alarm on the connected phone. The camera works flawlessly at night as well as in the daytime. The camera automatically selects BW at night but you can set it for color at night with a slight degradation in picture quality. This is a quality device. I will probably buy several more as the app will permit multiple cameras to be installed.
review_text_3: I have many ‚Äúwireless‚Äù IP cameras, but up to now they still required power. While power is certainly easier to run than an ethernet cable, there are locations where it is still impossible or certainly unsightly. One of those locations is a fence on my property. It is an ideal location for a camera in that is can view the outside rear of my house, but due to the length of the fence, it is near impossible to run power to it. With the pan and tilt feature, I can remotely move the camera to view the yard as well if needed.Since I have other Ctronics cameras that have performed well, I decided to give this one a try. It is a well built and hefty unit. I charged the batteries with a conventional USB 2-amp charger before installation. This initial charge took almost a whole day, while the camera was on at the same time. I also installed a 16 GB SD which I formatted in the camera.The Ctronics software was easy to install on my android phone and setup was easy using the Wi-Fi option. Alerts are easy to set up as wellFinally, the picture quality, especially on the HD setting, is very good. It remains clear and detail rich even at night. It is also very cool to turn on the bright white light at night should you get an alert. That alone will scare off any intruders.
review_text_4: Another camera added to my security protocol.I've had PTZ security cameras before, and I've had solar powered cameras before, but this is my first camera that combines both.Assembly was easy.Setup took about 30 minutes.I had one error (wasn't reading instructions) on changing the default password.Camera housing feels sturdy and well built, and the solar panel appears well made. The connection from the panel to the housing is micro usb and I'm pretty sure the unit can be powered over usb if required.I'd recommend leaving it to charge in the sun awhile before first use, so the battery has full charge.The app was easy to find and install.There's a whole host of settings that can all be controlled from the app.Camera can be turned on/off from the app.The SD card can be formatted from the app.Camera positioning is moved by swiping your finger on screen. Took me a few minutes to navigate positioning but operation was smooth.Overall, I'm feeling good about this purchase. Really feeling good about the app and functions offered. Hoping to get the FTP settings going so I can record to a local home hard drive.
review_text_5: I recently purchased 2 wired security cameras under the same brand. This solar powered camera is a great addition to the mix, giving me the option of putting a camera were running wires isn't a good option. The video is very good, and as long as you are running the software on your phone, you get alerts when the camera picks up movement. Using the Ctronics software on your phone or tablet, you are able to see full color with timestamped video remotely. This software also works with their other products as well, as in my case, you can see multiple screens at the same time. This camera allows you to pan-tilt and using your phone's zoom feature, makes it a PTZ. The only cons that I found with this unit - you cannot connect to the camera using your computer, unlike their wired security camera ( Outdoor Security Camera with Color Night Vision, Ctronics 1080P PTZ Camera WiFi IP Camera Home Security Camera with 355¬∞Pan 90¬∞Tilt Auto Tracking Human Detection Two-Way Audio). Also, this solar camera does not track targets like the wired version - but I am sure that this is due to having to conserve power since it relies on a battery being charged by the sun. The picture I took using the camera is roughly 30 feet away from the house, so you can see it shows a great deal of detail in a wide angle lens. The camera is also able to use two-way communication - as it has a speaker and microphone should you choose to use it. This camera will be a great addition to compliment the cameras I already have in use.

review_text_2: This camera solved all my problems. Its small and works great. The picture quality is better than I expected and the phone app has everything you need to view and operate the camera. You dont need to run any wires its solar powered and its wifi stays connected This security camera does everything I need and more. I highley recomend this camera if you cannot run power wires or wires from your router. Plus This company (JIDE TECH) stands behind their products,and the CUSTOMER SERVICE is the BEST!!!
review_text_3: So, I bought 2 of the PTZ Camera with solar power about 2 weeks ago just to try it out. I‚Äôve not seen another camera yet to offer PTZ and be truly wireless with the solar camera. I had a few doubts but the quality of the camera for the price amazed me Its well-built and the software is setup so installation is easy. It has very good video quality and the solar panel so far is good to keep the camera charged. Some features that other PTZ camera‚Äôs software may have might be missing but the software was built so the camera can run off just the solar panel so it won‚Äôt go dead on you when you need it the most. The installation instructions are simple and straight forward. They say you need WIFI but I set one up on my phones hotspot and it would connect easily every time I was close and I would have access to the videos that were stored on it. I was able to put one high up in a tree with a man lift and it worked as good as any professional camera. It‚Äôs absolutely worth the money they are selling it for and I really recommend get it.
review_text_4: The camera system is affordable and produces good pictures and video. I'm happy with the overall utility of the camera.
review_text_5: App works well to control camera remotely and see different angles. Can view is SD or HD video modes. Night vision screen shot shown. This has adjustable alarms, recording duration, and alarm intervals. Also adjustable human motion detection.

review_header_2: Top notch product at a great price!
review_text_1: For the price the camera is excellent. Night vision is great, one initial charge and the unit is good to run off solar 100%. Cloud service is great but also has an option for SD internal backup just in case. Detection range seems to be about 25ft out during the day when mounted at 15ft in height. I'd recommend this not only for the device, but also excellent and responsive customer service from the seller/manufacturer.
review_text_2: Ive had security cameras for a long time.I recently moved and decided to go wifi/solar this time around as the biggest pain w/ sec systems is the miles of wire.These are 100% wireless,and ready to roll out of the box-batteries included. Wifi/solar cameras are a somewhat new endeavor,so Ive been waiting for the bugs to be worked out and for them to come down in price.These cameras NAILED IT.I was so happy w/ the first,I bought more.First of all,SUPER easy to setup.Both mounting and the software.NO WIRES except the shortys to the solar panel which U mount by the camera.The software is GREAT.These run off of Cloudedge,so you can run them not only on your phone,but you can get a free Android to PC emulator online (I recommend NOX),and you can use UR PC,laptop,smart TV as a monitor. I was also pleasantly surprised to see the camera also has a 180 degree panning motor built in.The 2 way intercom is great,and night vision is super! Ill be back for more! Thanks!
review_text_3: The camera works great. I had a camera before and had issues with live stream... With this camera img it was easy and fast to connect With live stream. The amazing part was i accidentally bed the charger end from the solar panel and spoke with the seller since was my mistake and he took care of it. So happy now thank for the seller very helpful and vey responsive. Right away he respond you back... I really recomend the camera
review_text_4: I wasn‚Äôt expecting much based on the price, but I am pleasantly pleased. The quality is just as good as my Arlos and Vivint cameras‚Ä¶but I am raking impressed the the solar capability. These are in the side of my house with 8 hours of indirect sun at the most, but they keep the cameras 100% charged. The setup was a not event‚Ä¶and they have not failed or lost connection since the installation
review_text_5: Great price for a security camera! Solar panel has been working great and charging. I check daily if it has charged and each time, it says 100% :) The only thing I think that deceived me was the pan rotation is manual. From the video, it is showing that cam would rotate once motion is detected. But it's not the case. Other than that, it's a good security cam for the price.

review_text_1: Camera very easy to configure in addition to having the possibility of not charging the battery thanks to its very good solar panel, the battery was almost fully charged at the factory but once the solar panel was installed in a few hours the configuration was fully charged with the The application is very easy and compatible with the cameras of the same brand that I have installed in my house, its images are very clear both in video and in photographs that are programmed at a specific time if you want automatically the price-quality ratio and operation are reasonable and satisfactory the highlight that makes me very happy is not worrying about having to be connected the power every time its battery level drops since the solar panel is very practical and effective the application to access the camera is very nice . pets in my yard I recommend to anyone who wants to protect and increase their security this camera for its price and quality I will continue to try it to make an update of its operation and recommendations in general I feel safer with my family and confident in its good operation and as a novelty angles of movement that I can use remotely.
review_text_2: Last yeah, we actually saw moose in our ER for the first time. Since then, because of cobit I believe, many wildlife has been out and about in our area. We also have a birdhouse where we get various animals and luckily we don't have black bear so far but it's very interesting to see different animals with this camera.The installation is very easy and the setup is simple with the app, the camera was up and running within a few minutes. The solar panel seems to be charging the camera even during cloudy days and we have not had any issue with charging the internal battery.It has me several times already and had snow for the first time the other day but camera works beautifully in the PTZ control works amazingly well!
review_text_3: Definitely like these cameras. 3 cameras covered my whole house. Like the pan tilt feature,and the intercom on it. Picture quality is very good night and day. Definitely 5 stars from me.
review_text_4: This is a solar powered camera, the app to download is called CloudEdge and it‚Äôs was an easy set up, the motion sensor picks up everything, the images is clear, you can talk true this as well, a bonus is that the camera can pan and move around so you really don‚Äôt need two cameras to see the front of your house!
review_text_5: The camera was fairly easy to set up. It took several tries to pair it with the Wi-Fi but every device I have ever added like this requires several attempts to pair. Customer service was excellent I used the chat to communicate with customer service. They were very patient and helpful. I had a problem with the wording they used to instruct you to create a password. The technician directed me and sent me a sample password to use to login and from there he checked back with me several times to make sure that the set up was complete and I had no more questions. I do not know what time zone they are in but the customer service rep that I was chatting with was up with me until almost midnight. If you buy as many gadgets as I buy that need technical support I can tell you that the customer support is most definitely excellent. I purchased this camera because I bought a beach house in Mexico and it is made out of concrete. There is nowhere to run cables so this is just perfect there are no cables so all you need is the sun and a Wi-Fi connection and you are good to go

review_header_1: Not bad for first camera system, it gets the job done!
review_header_2: Happy with the camera system, but I'm unhappy with the instructions.
review_header_4: Amazing product by an amazing company!
review_text_1: I am using this product to protect my home and vehicles! I like that this camera system was cheap and gets the job done. I do not like the fact that in 7 days one of my cameras lost complete signal. I am having to get a new on replaced so that is the plus side. The directions were basic and did not explain in depth and we had to call several times to get answers. I did like the fact that someone texted me and walked me through my questions. Had to buy a external hard drive a 2TB, and I do like the app for your phone. You can see it from wherever you are and it has a safety feature that does not allow you to watch it from your car as it thinks you are driving! Overall not bad for first camera system.
review_text_2: I'm really enjoying this security camera system, the only downfall of this security system is I'm trying to connect it to my mobile device I can understand the words because they're so small. I tried to call in for help I couldn't even understand the person that I was talking to, if anybody have good advice about this camera can somebody please help me out with helping me connect this camera to my mobile device. I really would appreciate that. But other than that this is a great security system.
review_text_3: Purchased 2 cameras to replace another brand bought previously. Not only was the price very attractive, but the interface controls of these units are more user friendly and detailed. Quality of the units are far more superior to the last brand I bought. The solar power makes it easy to set up coverage anywhere on the property without worrying about powering the cameras. The Alexa compatibility adds to the value of my home automation as well. Customer service and tech support is available when you need them. As an Amazon endorsed product, you know you're getting quality products and the shipping was quick and painless. I'll be ordering more as my needs grow.
review_text_4: This camera system is absolutely incredible! But what was even more amazing is the customer service! I experienced a issue with the system when I first received it... And literally not even a week later they went above and beyond what they had to do in order to make it right. I now have a 100% fully functioning amazing system and it's completely thanks to this company and their customer service! I would recommend this system and this company to anyone who is in the market for an affordable quality product.
review_text_5: Having this system makes me feel much more protected. It definitely does it's job and it's great for the price. It isn't the easiest to set up but luckily at least you only have to do that once and after that you rest easy!

review_header_1: Exactly what I wanted - no complaints so far!
review_header_2: Hands down, THE BEST camera available!!!
review_header_5: Picture Clarity is incredible, the sound Perfect.
review_text_1: I did a LOT of online research, like over a period of a few months, looking for reasonably-priced, battery-operated, outdoor wifi security cameras that would record and alert without buying a subscription and without using the "cloud." I even looked at trail cameras, used primarily for hunting. So glad I found these! They satisfy all my requirements and more. I have gone through the entire set-up process, the only thing I have yet to do is actually affix them to their permanent locations outside my house (two cameras total: one in front and one in back). Once I do that I will update my review if necessary, but for now, 5 stars!I've set everything up, both an app on my phone and a client on my laptop, all connected to the cameras, everything works. That alone is pretty cool, because I tend to have my shortcomings in dealing with technology. So far I'm really happy!These cameras-- were easy to set up-- run on batteries so no power outlet required (my older home doesn't have outlets outside)-- have solar capability so I don't have to worry about replacing batteries all the time-- have usb recharging capability in case the solar panels don't recharge enough for some reason-- offer a magnetic attachment to their bases so I can just grab them off if I have to charge them (they have a little tether cord to keep them from hitting the ground if something knocks them off base)-- allow remote battery level monitoring-- send alerts to my phone when they detect movement (e-mails, too, if I want)-- require no subscription fees-- require no "cloud" usage (unless I want it)-- allow live viewing, as well as recording video (via micro sd card), and taking still pictures (controlled from pc or phone)-- allow playback of captured videos and pictures on phone/pc, as well as downloading of individual clips/stills-- automatically rewrite over oldest data first when sd card gets full-- include two-way audio communication as well as a siren-- offer plenty of customization of various features-- are reasonably priced compared to many other systems I looked at-- have 1080p resolution, infrared for nighttime, 130-degree view angleSo these things are exactly what I was looking for! Now the only thing to find out is if when I place them outside they are able to connect to wifi adequately, and to see how well they withstand outside weather. I have had no problems with wifi while playing with them inside, but I have seen some complaints about limited range. Even if I have problems in this regard, I don't know if that can be blamed on this product, as it could very well be my own personal wifi set up and limitations. I'm willing to get an extender or whatever to enhance my wifi signal if necessary - we'll see what happens. As for outside durability, they look pretty well sealed up, and they also come with these little rubber jackets to pull over them upon final placement. So again, we'll see how it goes. I'm in Florida and will get my share of inclement weather and high temperatures. I no longer have large trees around my house, so solar charging shouldn't be an issue, but days with no respite from the hot, blazing sun could be a formidable challenge.Update: I have my front camera installed in the front. I found that finding a suitable location was more challenging than I thought it would be, mostly because of the need to screw the camera and solar panel holders into something. My house is mostly stucco, which in my experience has proven to be less than ideal for screws. I have a few wooden pieces near the roof (I don't know house construction terminology), but they are vertical, which means I couldn't use the magnetic ball-joint holder, which was disappointing because that thing is so cool. Unfortunately it doesn't provide a broad adjustment angle and if affixed to a vertical surface it can't be angled up high enough for a good view; it really needs a horizontal surface and I don't really have any outside except the roof itself. But fortunately it comes with the other type of holder, and I actually ended up using the strap around a gutter spout, which means I can easily move it if I want, and I didn't have to drill any holes into my house. I wish the solar panel came with the strap as well. But I just screwed its bracket into the vertical wood piece mentioned earlier.All that said, it's been communicating with my wifi just fine, I've been getting alerts, the solar panel is keeping it charged, the picture is great both day and night and all is well. It even got heavily rained on in a gusty thunderstorm and held up without incident. I did notice, as I was walking around trying to find the place I wanted to put it, that different locations had different levels of wifi connection. Luckily, the place I wanted to put it also had a clear wifi signal. I can see how that could be frustrating, though, if the place you want to put it has a poor signal.Still 5 stars, really happy. So now I just need to put my other one up in the back, and hopefully I'll get a good look at who's been messing around in my catnip! :)
review_text_2: I have friends with various home security cameras that came highly recommended, but we are in a unique situation where ‚Äúregular‚Äù hard wired/broadband internet is not an option. We have a Verizon MiFi hotspot that often exceeds the 24GB unlimited allowance about halfway through our cycle, and we do not have outlets on the exterior of our house, so our options are limited when it comes to home security cameras. Thank goodness for that, because we would have spent 10X more if we had purchased the cameras and cloud services our friends use. This camera was our only option given our rural circumstances and has proven to be the best home security camera available! The solar panel keeps the battery charged 90-100% so it can be placed anywhere within WiFi range, it works without failure even with crappy satellite/cellular WiFi (we have a Verizon MiFi hotspot that goes in and out of service every day), it can handle a micro SD card of 128GB that will last 10-12 months (and deletes the oldest recordings first when full) so we don‚Äôt have to pay a monthly fee for ‚Äúcloud‚Äù storage, and the picture is clear as day on both live feed and Playback mode whether it is midnight, 7am, 2pm, etc. The infrared is amazing and we can see 200+ ft away in the dead of night. We plan to purchase 3 more of these cameras to monitor every angle of our property because they are the most affordable and cannot be beat when compared to clarity and functionality of their competitors. Setup is easy, just be sure to point the QR code in step 3 from your phone to the camera when the app prompts you to ‚Äúverify‚Äù the code. I spent a few hours trying to figure that step out because it isn‚Äôt clear in the instruction manual, and almost gave up and returned the camera. Sooooo glad a google search helped me out with that step because this is literally the best camera ever!!!
review_text_4: I absolutely love the Reolink security camera system. I spent nearly two months researching. The Reolink sold me after watching a youtube video from Lifehackers who compared, Reolink, Arlo and Blink.Why Reolink? in my research it WON.It came in a 5 pack, it had all the pieces (accessories) needed to assemble all outside or all inside or a combination of both 5 strong magnets mounts for inside or outside (wall or table), 5 straps to attach to a gutter, 5 mounts for wall attachment, 5 rechargeable batteries, 5 skins to protect in outside elements, 5 mini solar panels to attach so you don't have to recharge batteries. The directions were easy to read, the wifi was easy to connect. The only "thing" I had to buy were mini sd cards (that would be a nice option to include in future boxes). I purchase the cards for the exterior cameras not the interior. *sd cards only necessary if you want to keep a running record of activity. My indoor cameras didn't need them, but I could insert and turn on or off as I wish.The installation was a breeze taking less that 5 mins per camera and the hard to reach angles you can swap the image vertically or mirror it, if needed (like attaching to a ceiling). The cell phone view allows you to view 1 image, 4 images or 9 images (cameras) at a time. If the camera has the sd card in it you can record, under motion or spontaneously. You can talk to the person you are viewing they can talk back. You can see at day or night, and there is even an alarm to sound at your will.This system allows you to check in on your fur babies and talk to them or drop in and record their actions. You could share with someone a video or a still image using a text, cell fb, IG, etc... Cell notifications are within 5 seconds of activity and the view span is about 180. The first activity I got scared me, in the middle of the morning while I was at work I got a notification there was activity, when I viewed the recording, it was the garbage man, and the distance to record him was about 30ft. Impressive.Lets talk about the comparisons.Arlo had everything except the necessary installation pieces, it looked nice you were able to view, talk 2 way but there packaging was limited for example, if I purchased the 5 pack, it comes with 2 outside mounts and 3 indoor, meaning that I would need to buy accessories just to complete the job.Blink had everything Alro had with the same problem and add one more, if I wanted to save a video recorded, I would have to purchase cloud space.In the end, Reolink had everything I needed for the right price. No monthly subscriptions, no future batteries to buy, no icloud to buy, just set it up, connect to wifi and done.Thank You Reolink...

name: Reolink Argus PT w/ Solar Panel - Wireless Pan Tilt Solar Powered WiFi Security Camera System w/ Rechargeable Battery Outdoor Home Surveillance, 2-Way Talk, Support Alexa/ Cloud
review_header_1: ***Five Star Review?  Buyer Should Have Serious Doubts About Buying From Reolink
review_header_3: The best camera we've bought so far and we have several different brands !
review_header_5: A nice Solar PT cam with excellent push alerts
review_text_1: Leaving five stars because most people only look at the great reviews...so here is a more rounded review that should give everyone pause before they buy.Let me start by saying that I love the cameras. Bought 4 here and 3 more directly from Reolink on their Ebay store. The cameras have great picture quality and if you follow the instructions for setup using the bar codes, it takes about 45 seconds to get them up and running.And I am returning all of them. Further, I would strongly encourage all prospective buyers to strongly consider looking elsewhere for their security camera needs. Reolink is simply INEPT when it comes to backing up their products.A couple of weeks ago I bought 4 of these cameras. At $150 a camera with the solar panel, they are not cheap. As instructed during the setup of one of them, I went to lift up the little 1/2 inch by 3/8 rubber flap that covers the on/off switch and secures it from rain. The flap is held to the camera with a paper clip thick protrusion that goes into the body of the camera. When I pulled at it, that extremely thin piece of rubber holding the flap to the camera, broke. I didn't pull it hard, and I do not have super human strength. It just sort of broke and although I can still place the flap into the camera, it needs to be repaired because if it ever falls off, the entire camera will be ruined.I didn't think this was a big deal.I was wrong.I wrote to the company and explained the situation. I explained that the cover tore and I wanted to know how I could get a replacement cover. I would be happy to cover the costs. No problem. And I made it clear that I only needed the little cover because the camera otherwise worked fine. I just need the cover!Their response was that they wanted me to send them a picture of the camera. Admittedly, I was irritated. So I wrote back that I was surprised that they wanted a picture of this because the camera worked....I just needed the small cover and that I could probably buy it on ebay for a few cents plus shipping. This thing seemed like a no-brainer to me.They wrote back and said...oh, now that we understand that the camera works they will refer it to their techs.Great.Next day (and keep in mind that their turnaround is always a day later) I get an email asking me to send them a copy of the invoice. No problem. I did that within a minute.Next day..we enter the Twilight Zone. Instead of simply writing back to me with something saying that they are shipping out the new cover, I get an email asking me to send them the link of the Ebay listing for the cover I found so that they can tell me if it will fit the camera. HUH? So they have gone from taking responsibility for making a cheaply connected cover to helping me ensure that a third party solution (that did not exist) would fit their camera? This was sort of nutso.I wrote back and said simply that I did not find a cover on ebay.This morning - another 24 hours later - comes the latest response...they want to give me a 5 dollar refund.Now you would expect that a company selling a 150 dollar camera with a rubber cover for the on/off switch would grasp that the cover that they designed for their own camera to protect the switch from rain/snow/etc had an actual purpose for existing...but these folks instead want to refund me five bucks to accomplish what exactly? Am I supposed to tape the five dollar bill over the switch to protect it? I just need a new tiny cover!So I am now a week into this silliness and I have had enough. These cameras are not cheap. So before you buy from these folks, think very seriously about the warranty and support that they give and ask yourself if you should be going for products made by Google or Netgear because there is no doubt that a similar situation with their products would have resulted in a replacement part coming in roughly 2 days.Reolink makes great cameras. But they simply have no ability to back up their products with support that should make people comfortable. I have lost confidence in this company.All of my cameras...a thousand dollars of cameras...are going back because they can't figure out how to send out a tiny rubber cover that cost them a few cents.Pathetic.
review_text_2: My camera just showed up today. Ive been messing with it all day. I hooked up the solar panel and even on a cloudy day in the shade, it still charged a bit. Picture quality is clean 1080. Functionality is very responsive. Night vision is strong and clear. I can also listen with the built in mic and even that is crystal clear. I am very happy with this camera so far. Battery life seems to be pretty great. Its battery only loses about 10% over night and stays at 100% every day it. Very impressive and easy to install. I think i will add more in the future. Motion detection works great. Was a bit sensitive at first, but after tinkering with the settings in the app, i got it to ignore traffic and sense people. Highly recommended.
review_text_3: This is Karen's husband writing this review as I am the "tech guy" in our home.I am VERY pleased with how the camera is performing so far, so the 4.2 out of 5 rating seems well deserved. I admit I had some reservations when I read some of the reviews that were negative, in my opinion some may have been because of an individually defective product and some may have been due to lack of detailed enough directions.When I was first trying to connect the camera to our WIFI it wouldn't connect, then I realized I forgot to type in our WIFI password, DUH ! After I added the password it connected immediately. The camera is roughly about 85 feet from our WIFI router and goes thru 2 walls and still has kept connected very well.Also, we have Amazon Alexa and at first could not get Alexa to recognize the camera, so I did an online search for help and found a page on the Reolink support site with the steps needed to connect to Alexa, after reading that page I saw there was a step I didn't know about, once I followed those steps Alexa connected very well ! We can view the live camera feed from our smartphone app, from our "Echo Shows" via voice command, and even on our tv screens with Amazon Firestick (we have other brands of security cameras we view thru the Firestick also) so I can use a voice command and see different cameras on the screens including the Reolink camera, and I did not have to download anything to the Firestick, simply enable Alexa according to the directions on the help page I mentioned.I already had security cameras looking from our home outward, I wanted a wireless solar PTZ camera I could mount away from the house that I could turn to look at the house as well as turn to view other areas of our property not covered by the cameras we already had.So I mounted the camera on a thick (schedule 40) PVC pipe and mounted the solar panel on the very top of the pole, I used 3 hose clamps to fasten the PVC pipe to a 4 foot metal fence post I hammered into the ground, so far it seems to working very well. I will upload a picture of it.I do a lot of research before buying tech stuff, and it would be difficult to find ANY product that is perfect or that you might wish had more or better features, but for the features you get with this camera (including solar powered, PTZ capability, Alexa connectivity) I really can't complain for the price paid.Note: Remember this is not a commercial grade professional system, but commercial grade features likely cost much higher commercial grade prices, so again, for the price paid I really can't complain, I feel this camera does really pretty good for it's price level !
review_text_4: I placed this camera in my front yard on a tree, I however had to buy a longer WiFi antenna because it was lagging a lot . But the antenna really helped once I replaced the factory one. It is a good quality product thou. Keep it close to your house and your ok with the factory antenna. I would purchase again !
review_text_5: Its been holding up outside in winter weather down to freezing temps. decent quality video and excellent alerts on the cheap, Solar panel works greattoo but needs at least a couple hours of decent sunlight to charge well.

review_header_3: Good camera for the price, setup not difficult, features missing vs expensive cameras
review_header_5: Super easy to set up, great quality
review_text_1: This is by far the best security camera I've had. You can move the camera around from the app which is really cool and if you put it in the right place you can cover a ton of area. The solar panel holds the batteries and there is room inside of 6 18650's which is probably a bit of overkill, it comes with 3 installed and room for 3 more, unless it's dark for days on end the 3 batteries should be plenty, but always good to have options. The motion detection is spot on and starts quickly, works much better than my Ring doorbell. Overall awesome high end security camera.
review_text_2: Amazing üëè technology advanced security camera..Swivel using app is incredible coupled with Zoom feature is outstanding...than on top of that the Solar charging as you can see in my picture is by far one of the best features....Totally wireless and with the WiFi feature...Pictures are only in SD that I took but it has the HD feature by simply tapping in app...Alert settings are amazing as seen in my pics. Without question a bargain for the money! Easy install and connection!
review_text_3: Cameras work as advertised (I have 2). I ordered extra batteries (18650) from Amazon (separately) and added them in to the cameras. As with all cameras, finding a good mounting position is the hardest part. This one needs to have a good wi-fi signal, which means you will likely have to add an outdoor wi-fi extender or outdoor wired LAN antenna, or indoor wi-fi extenders on inside walls closest to outside camera location. I ordered wifi-extenders (TP-Link AC750 WiFi Extender RE230) separately also on AMZN, and setup up the extenders and cameras inside, prior to installing cameras outside. Had to move extenders to various locations inside the house to get best connection to camera and to base wi-fi. SOLIOM+ App seems to work pretty good, and camera stays connected to wi-fi. All wi-fi problems so far have been with my signal & extenders, not the camera as far as I can tell. My camera (and solar panel) are in shade under trees, and we have had several dark stormy days, but after several weeks I have had no battery charging issues, and cameras have stayed online all the time, day and night. I also added memory cards (SD) to each camera before installation. I record all video to SD.I tried to activate the free (7-day?) Trial Cloud video storage via the SOLIOM+ app on my phone, but it just didn't work. I wanted to test that Cloud storage before sending any money for a paid account, but that's on hold until I can try to get the free Trial to work. Camera video quality is great, day and night -- I use the night vision mode by turning off the cameras light and use IR. Pan/Tilt works good, but you should know that is is in 'fixed increments' when you hit the app p/t buttons. There is no optical zoom, but you can 'zoom' in the app with normal phone 2-finger touchscreen operation. Also, there is no way to view video through any other means other than their SOLIOM+ app on the phone. A firmware upgrade would be greatly appreciated that allows standard network access from camera to software like Blue Iris. Most camera makers seem to have proprietary software or apps so this maker is not unusual. 1 drawback is (at maximum movement sensitivity) camera misses some activity (cars and people in driveway). There is also a 'glitch' (I would call it), where motion is activated just fine, but recording stops at your preset time limit, even though motion continues. There will be no added video either on the original clip or on additional clips. All additional motion is just not recorded. On the other camera which is viewing only yard, (versus driveway, cars, people), motion is activated for leaves falling and bugs flying by. None but the most expensive (several times $cost of this one) have great motion control so this isn't a complaint given the price of these cameras, just be aware of some of the limitations of less expensive cameras like this one. So far this camera has operated in weather from 80's down to upper 20's (F) and in lots of rain without any problem. 1 big problem is that when recording to SD card, you can only *view* the saved video on your phone (in the SOLIOM+ app), but you cannot download the video and save it to your phone or anywhere else -- you have to open the camera, take out the SD card, then copy the video clips that way - which is pretty ridiculous. That is probably the only reason NOT to get this camera. I assume, but have not tested it, that video on their cloud service would be downloadable to a PC or something. There are video capture apps for android that may help to capture the video while you play it on your phone, but I have also not tried any of that. SOLIOM+ app should be updated ASAP to allow downloading video from SD to phone storage.
review_text_4: We love the pan, tilt, zoom option and the video quality is great. The setup is extremely easy. You can add 3 extra 18650 batteries for backup power but it's not really needed. You can store/review the files on your micro SD card or the cloud. If you want to use the cloud, they have 3 different price plans as shown in the pics. So far so good, really happy with this purchase.

review_header_2: Very clear, sensitive and, trouble saving
review_header_3: Great Camera for where power is unavailable
review_text_1: I installed this wireless, solar-powered camera on a north-facing wall. Given the insufficient sunlight, my previous installed camera always run out of power. Thanks to the large solar battery panel, power outrage is no longer a problem, even when the camera was set on a high-power consumption mode. Furthermore, the camera comes with a long micro-USB cable, which makes it possible to connect the camera to an electrical and do 24h continuous recording mode.The installation is straightforward. One of the reasons is that unlike most cameras which only provide a fixed angle, this camera is more flexible to obtain a 360-degree view. So not too much adjustment is needed when installing.The app is easy to use. The camera provides a crispy view, even at night or in stormy weather. It is also possible to record colorful picture at night. The motion/humanoid detection is sensitive. The intercom works great, through which I can speak to the deliverers when I am at work.Cons: While the WiFi signaling could be a limitation, this product does work well with a WiFi extender. In contrast, my previous camera does not.
review_text_2: It helps a lot that it does not require wires. There is not much place for me to plug the camera in if it needs to be plugged in. So the being wireless and solar powered saved me from having to find a place to plug in, from constantly having to buy batteries and, from the hassle from dealing with the wires. Not only that, the recording shows up very clearly on my phone and it is very sensitive to human motion. So I know when someone comes close to my door and i can clearly see who it is. I am also able to speak to the person through the camera. It is very convenient if I am on vacation or at work.
review_text_3: I purchased one of these cameras to keep an eye on my off the grid cabin. I was pleasantly surprised with it. The unit was very easy to install. The picture quality is excellent and the app is easy to use. . The night vison is very strong and clear. I have been impressed with the battery life and have yet to run it down. I like the camera so much I purchased two more for my property. I have them set up outside approximately 200' from the cabin and they work great.The best part about these cameras is their customer service. I had a question about a feature on the app. I received a quick response from their rep and a solution to follow.If you are looking for an affordable, easy to use, wireless CCTV solution these cameras are for you.
review_text_4: You'll want a drill for the holes. I started mine with hammer and nail, then drilled. They provide a paper for drilling the holes, which made it easy. You'll need to charge the solar plate for 3 to 5 hours inside, before installing. Also, important, if you use the micro SD card, insert it first. When pairing the camera to your internet, be about 1 1/2 feet from router. The camera "speaks," and is kind of loud. The trickiest part of installing were the bottom holes. I found that doing the right side first, then let camera rotate and hang down for the 2nd bottom screw made it easier, then do top screws. *** The picture quality is very good, day or night. (I can see the bugs flying at night!) Initially, it took several minutes to get it to connect, but once it connects a few times, it goes quite quickly. Camera rotation works great. Whether at home or away, it works great.
review_text_5: I installed this solar camera in front of the garage door. It can monitor the front of my garage door, the front door, and the grass without blind spots. When someone approaches my door. It will also sound an alarm. Makes me feel a lot safer. It is a colorful picture during the day. At night it is a black and white picture. And this solar energy does not need to install wires. Just install it in a sunny place. Don't worry about installation. Will also buy one to install on my back door.
