description: A state-of-the-art & easy to use surveillance system with 4K (or 8 Megapixels, which is 4x better than 1080p Full HD) Ultra High Definition video to see every detail & protect your premises Set & forget by recording from 16 channels for 300 days+ onto a 2TB hard Drive. Surveillance in the palm of your hand with live view and playback on Smartphone & tablets including iPhones, iPads & Android devices using the free HomeSafe View app.Computer Operating System:Windows, Mac OS. Packed with the latest CCTV technology, such as night vision, audio capture and push notifications, this premium security system is Swann‚Äôs most advanced offer in its product line up. An 16-channel security system suits medium-sized properties for outdoor and indoor surveillance. Add up to 16 compatible cameras to cover any blind spots. The True Detect thermal motion sensing auto records and alerts you when it detects warm moving objects near the cameras. See your home on your phone, live or playback, from anywhere. Advanced 4K video analytics, such as Face Detection and others, recognize elements on the image to trigger recording & alerts. Link your NVR to your Dropbox and upload still images to the cloud, so that you have evidence safely stored off-site. Power over Ethernet cabling, PoE, makes installation a lot simpler by having power, audio and video transmitted via a single Ethernet cable per camera. General Dimensions 9.25" x 12.2" x 2" 235mm x 310mm x 53mm What's In the Box. * NVR-8580 8 Channel NVR with 2TB Hard Drive * Cat5e Ethernet Cable x 5 (3ft/1m x 1) * HDMI Cable * Power Adapter * Mouse * Quick Start Guide * Theft Deterrent Stickers Will not work with analog BNC Cameras, and only works with select Swann PoE cameras. If you are unsure of compatibility, please ask before purchasing. As of now here is a list of compatible cameras SWNHD-865MSB SWNHD-885MSFB SWNHD-886MSD SWNHD-885MSB SWNHD-886MSD SWNHD-865MSB

Each camera has a bright LED light that turns on when the camera senses heat and motion, helping deter any potential intruders. Plus, the light enables Color Night Vision! This Swann surveillance system also works with both Google Assistant and Amazon Alexa voice controllers. review_header_4: Excellent quality and good price. Easy to install
review_text_1: I got this camera to find out who was damaging a chain that protects our business parking lot. I caught three different vehicles breaking the chain and lock... one was the local police department!!!...another was a UPS truck and the third was a private citizen. No one would believe it was the police department if I didn‚Äôt have the camera!!! Thanks swann
review_text_2: Good buy if you are looking for a camera system to keep watch over your home or business. The security cameras come with a lot of features. This is a full kit so no hardware required only the tools needed to complete the install. This is was well worth the price
review_text_3: I love this system, was going to buy a 4k system, but I didn‚Äôt want to spend the money and I‚Äôm glad I didn‚Äôt because this one is amazing. It does everything as advertised and more, night vision without the spotlights on is so clear and I have no trouble using either of the apps. The wide view of the camera is also great, it‚Äôs a big upgrade from our old security cameras, we didn‚Äôt even have to run wires we just used our old ones. One piece of advice if your using a gmail email account for this is to disable 2 step verification and allow untrusted applications because it will block it and your test email will fail! It also works with Dropbox, one thing I can‚Äôt figure out is how to get it to work with my google home mini.
review_text_4: The camera system is great. The video quality is crystal clear during the day and at night with night vision. The app works great on the phone, it just needs few improvements. Only thing we couldn't figure out is the audio from the cameras. Please, if you know how to make the audio to work. I will appreciate your help. Thanks
review_text_5: Great system. Even greater customer service. I like the APP. Have had them installed for about 4 months now. Advice: get more channels than you think you need. You will probably find an angle you were not thinking of and it's good to have the option of adding cameras. Also: the cameras work out to be something like $25 each if you buy them in the kit, but $50 if you buy separately. I had to buy 2 more for my 8 channel system that came with four cameras. I Wish I would have bought the 8 channel package with 8 cameras because I ended up buying two anyway which cost me $100, and I would have had two spare cameras as well.

review_text_1: Most reviews that are negative are not substantiated. I see people commenting the video is not 4k. It is if you view it on your TV, the picture is super clear. The mobile app reduces the quality in what is transmitted to you to allow faster transmission. You can select medium or high quality. It is set on default at medium. If you click High quality, the video becomes good quality. What gets recorded on the harddrive is going to be in good 4k quality. The setup was easy, no problems at all. The app is good and responsive, loads instantly. Overall, very intuitive and easy install. The app is actually pretty good as well.
review_text_2: Basic installation, good for the price. My third system from this company and they only get better. Have replaced the others just as upgrades.
review_text_3: I previously had a Swann security system and four cameras that worked well, but they cameras were old (low resolution) video. My primary motivation for buying another Swann system was that I could re-use the existing cabling. Swann uses two cables per camera - a BNC/coax cable for the signal and a second power cable. That was extremely important. Drilling holes and running cable all around your house is about 95% of the work of installing one of these systems. Having the cabling in place was a huge time saver.Once I got the cameras all connected the video quality is just great (4K). The app for your phone (iPhone or Android) is a big improvement over the old app. Easy to to view live cameras or playback any video captured as a result of motion detection. The motion detection is great, you can block out custom areas in each camera that you don't want triggering the motion detection. You can also setup intrusion detection zones and privacy zones (mostly for indoor cameras). Also has a feature to upload video to a Dropbox account.Overall, I would highly recommend this system, especially if you're looking to upgrade your older Swann system.
review_text_4: Once the camera is installed, the pic is great, there should be a light on for night vision. I had use the home safe app to get the pic on the phone. I had to plug the phone into the router for the phone to pick up the connectio
review_text_5: I needed a 4k DVR system for my in law and this fit the budget and the functionalities. The install went pretty straight forward like all CCTV. I like color night vision, LED and siren feature which can be activated by the mobile app. My in laws loves the units and so far no issues.

review_header_2: Excellent cameras...it is all about the heat detection!
review_header_3: Excellent money spent arrived as advertised
review_text_1: I wanted a very simple dvr system for the house and this is working really well so far! The cameras aren‚Äôt crystal clear, but for the price I‚Äôm still pleasantly surprised. Took me a few hours to run wires to get everything set up. If you‚Äôre relatively handy, setting the system up is actually a fun little project!My biggest complaint is that the power supply for the cameras can only power two cameras. I ordered a third camera for the system, and it came with its own power supply. I ended up buying a 4-way splitter to power the 3 cameras... I was definitely running out of room on my power strip.You‚Äôll also have to buy a monitor to display/playback. I additionally purchased some junction/mounting boxes for the cameras. I‚Äôd recommend that if the plugs will be out in the elements.I currently don‚Äôt have the system set up to my internet or have access to live feeds on my phone through the app, so I can‚Äôt speak for how well that function works.All in all, for the price, I was really surprised how easily everything was set up and with how well it‚Äôs worked over the past month or so that it‚Äôs been set up. If I have any issues I‚Äôll update the review, but for now I‚Äôm extremely happy with it!
review_text_2: Excellent product n very easy to install. I had as mother set of cameras n returned them as they gave me an alert with every snowflake that fell! These cameras are best activated n motion detection is excellent! I called customer support a few times with help on the software configuration. Got right thru to a tech n the support was great! Dont waste your time n money on other csmeras....these are well priced n superior to others on the market!
review_text_3: The security system arrived on time, easy to set up. The camera is worth the extra money spent. I had a cheaper camera setup and it just failed after a year. I took additional insurance for the cheaper setup.The setup and search features is excellent actually..... search has thumbnails which is awesome.
review_text_4: this system works good and it is sad that we need this kind of security in todays world.
review_text_5: old SD camera used to have 65degree angle. the new HD recently camera has 85 degree angle. if you put the corner of the room, you can see everything.

review_header_1: High quality product, budget friendly price
review_header_3: The most important thing to know is that it works with Google home.
review_text_1: Works as expected. Cameras were easy to set up and add mobile app to phone and iPad. Highly recommend. This is my second camera system from Swann. I only upgraded for thermal capability. I will continue to use the Swann brand.
review_text_2: Very happy with the system. It performs very well, I xan configure to what I want, and is user friendly. Also easy set up.
review_text_3: I like that fact that it was an easy setup. Cameras show a good quality video, just had to adjust the color on each camera.
review_text_4: We had this same, yet much older version in our business.. got this 8 channel so we could use the other 4 cams with the 4 that come with this new system.. low and behold, the new cams are phenomenal!! The other 4 older ones are unnecessary and we see so much more! These cameras have so much more in their sights! The quality is bar none! Just give them your money already, lol.. but, for real.
review_text_5: I love these cameras. My brother-n-law got them set up in an afternoon. They were pretty easy to figure out and install. The picture is clear. I love the playback option and the several screens that I can look at. I haven't got the phone part set up yet nor have I needed to use technical support. But I did order another camera to add to this package. Great price.

name: Security Camera Outdoor, Solar Powered 360¬∞ PTZ Wireless Outdoor Security Camera, ieGeek WiFi Security Camera with Pan 355¬∞ Tilt 120¬∞, 15000mAh 1080P, PIR Motion Detection, 2-Way Talk, IP65
review_header_1: This solar camera is perfect for my backyard.
review_header_4: Impressively Large Viewing and Panning Area
review_text_2: This camera does not need electricity to operate and function. The camera battery that is rechargeable can sustain a very long time without needing recharged. (6 months)It has held a charge without being connected to electricity OR THE solar panel for over three months, and it is still only 1/2 power on the battery scale. When using it outside, two points of importance, one, the solar panel will keep it constantly charged so electricity will never be needed after the initial charge up. And also the color black is more important to be used on the outside so that in darkness it does not show up as well as if it was white. The camera has PTZ that is accessible from your phone to be able to adjust the camera, and the app allows you to go back in the history and pull up events that occurred usually up to one or two months, depending on the size of the SD card that you put into the camera. Also the camera has a much better picture if HD is pushed on the camera settings. Wifi is necessary if you need to access the camera remotely. You cannot go wrong with the purchase of this camera, the quality of the pictures is excellent and the response time of the camera to record is excellent.
review_text_3: This camera is a HUGE upgrade from the older one that I have from the same company. The video is more clear and the wi-fi extender is EXCELLENT! I have a slower internet and the extender is very nice - no freezing up or slowing down. Being able to move the camera around is an awesome improvement too, keeps me from having to install multiple cameras. It was very easy to connect with their app and set everything up, maybe 10-15 minutes (mainly because after connecting it needs to download a firmware update.) Even installing it outside was super easy, four screws to your base and then put camera on it and tighten down with little screw tabs. If you are looking for a camera but not wanting a huge investment or complicated installation, this one is perfect for that! I highly recommend it!
review_text_4: - Design, build and paint quality is excellent- Since our side patio, yard & walk in area is very narrow and long, the camera can pan the whole side of the house. It also can pan straight down to alleviate any blind spots.- If someone comes to our side entry door we can pan to see who it is and use the speaker (two way speaker) to ask any questions before deciding whether we should open the door. Of course it's also great to see if Amazon or other vendor packages have been delivered. (Panning is done through the use of an icon on your mobile device)- Battery life is very good. In 3 weeks of use the battery is at 85%. (I intentionally left off the solar panel to make sure the battery was good.)- I did encounter one minor problem involving still images not being viewable after the camera detected motion and recorded video. The company was contacted via email and within 24 hours asked for more information. After giving them the info, they responded again within 24 hours with their explanation. (Nothing wrong with the camera ‚Ä¶ a software app update will be upcoming which should fix the issue.) After working in the computer support area all of my life, I am always impressed by companies which actually care about customers and respond quickly. Kudos to their support team!This is a very nice and functional security camera which I would purchase again.
review_text_5: This come with everything you need, except for the optional memory card. Charge it before you install, and with the solar panel set up to face the sun, you never have to worry about it running out of battery. No monthly subscription required which I love. You can add a microSD card to save footage. The pan and tilt functions work nicely from the app which allows you to expand your view. Motion detection works a little too well, so I would get alerts if strong winds move plants/tree shadows. Overall a great value!

Secure your home and business 24/7 with smart motion-triggered alerts. An advanced automatic IR-cut filter helps to capture surroundings at night for up to 100ft. name: REOLINK 4MP 16CH PoE Security Camera System for Home and Business, 8pcs Wired Indoor Outdoor 1440P PoE IP Cameras, 4K 16CH NVR with 3TB HDD for 24-7 Recording, RLK16-410B8
review_header_1: Thinking of video security??  This is the one!
review_header_2: Can't Beat the Quality or Ease of Installation At This Price
review_header_3: Great home system - REALLY Easy Setup!!!
review_header_4: Still love it after 2 years of ownership
review_text_1: If you have need of a security camera system this is the one. I spent hours researching and checking out different systems in person. Overall this system stood out significantly over others.Pros:- higher resolution. This is so extremely important. Higher the resolution means that you can see identifying information from further distances. Most systems stop at HD 1080 or 720. Reolink takes is another step past that.- PoE. Power over Ethernet allows extremely fast install as you only have one cable to run for the signal back to the recorder AND power. It also means that any holes you need to cut in your walls are much smaller.- The quality of the Ethernet cable is very nice, very flexible and easy to pass through tight spaces.- Multiple ways to access the video feed. Bring able to use my laptop/desktop, phone, tablet, or the Reolink recorder to access the interface and recordings is really nice. Especially when it came time to position the cameras. Bring able to see the camera view in my phone made the process a cinch.- The motion tracking system is great for maximising the recording time and minimising unneeded recordings and alerts.- Plenty of other cameras for specific needs that are 100% compatible and just plug.- Lots of extra ports for more camerasCons: ( these are rather minimal)- mounting screws strip very easily. This is a very common problem with screws in general now days. I really suggest not bothering with the included ones and great a pack of number 6 wood screws- Setting the motion sensitivity is a little tricky. Not really a complaint, but it does take a fair amount of tinkering to get it right for your needs. I suggest taking your time and don't expect to get it correct the first time.
review_text_2: This review also applies to these additional Reolink cameras I purchased along with this system:¬†
review_text_3: Received promptly with two extra dome cameras, as ordered. This is my third system - same location, just keep upgrading to new, better technology. My initial reaction is that this is a great system for home surveillance. I haven't disconnected and replaced the existing one yet but it should be easy as I was already using Ethernet cables (but I had to put converter baluns at each end - now I can just remove those and use existing cat5 and cat 6 cables). But I have fired it up on my desk and connected it to internet and all 10 cameras to be sure all was working.I have to say, while I'm pretty techie and have set up two prior systems, I was AMAZED at how simple and fast it was to set this up for access on my home network PC's, and on my iPhone and iPad. I used a DDNS internet setup in the past but did not need it for this system. It basically just set itself up once I downloaded the PC program and the iOS apps. I refuse to buy anything that has to use the manufacturer's website for internet access - with or without a fee. This works purely over internet with no need to go through REOLINK's servers - perfect! Some other popular brands are not so flexible.Cameras appear way more clear and sharp than my existing system. I ordered 2 extra cameras - the RLC-422 dome cameras with zoom. I have zoom cameras now but you have to use a small screwdriver at the camera to change the zoom to suit the location. I was surprised to find that these can be zoomed remotely using the software. Very nice - and focus adjusts automatically when zoom is changed.Came with virtually everything I needed - you'll want to get a small monitor to connect to the NVR (I got a lightweight 21.5" HDMI full HD monitor for about $100 that sits nicely on top of the NVR) as my existing one was ancient technology.I did upgrade the NVR firmware to one released less than a month ago - very easy to do but be aware that it will take around 45 minutes with no indication of progress. I was about to e-mail their support when it beeped that it was done and then re-started. Had to re-enter all of the set-up info. so do this before you get too far into things.So far, I'm very happy with this purchase, especially for the price - a good value compared to other more advertised brands.
review_text_4: Updated: I've had this for 2 years and still love it. It's indispensable for keeping my farm animals safe, seeing what's going on around the property day and night. Our setup is 16 cameras with total 2500 feet of cable; The cameras have been out in the rain, snow, ice, summer heat, dust and still work great.Reolink support has been awesome - only needed them a couple of times over the past 2 years -- first was a mysterious config issue which they diagnosed and solved; the second was last week when the transformer went out. We're out of warranty now but they still helped to diagnose the issue and we're back in action.Just having it out of commission for a few days showed us how much we rely on it. Being able to see that all is well inside the barns at 2am - wonderful. Even have a camera on the homing pigeons (yeah) - so fascinating to see them doing their thing when humans aren't around.We still just sit and watch it. If we have visitors, we all sit and watch it. Ok, that may be weird.Here's my original review --Day 3 and I love it. I started intending to buy 1 camera, bought 8, added 4 more. Now up to 12 and figuring out that I need (ok, want) more. My use is for farm cam to keep an eye on animals, so night vision/audio/POE and being affordable enough for multiple locations were my key purchase requirements. Has already brought invaluable peace of mind, and is just plain fun to watch (yes, we sit watching the security cameras). The color image is very nice; the night vision is great. I have it inside a goat barn, horse barn and pigeon loft and it is very clear even in nighttime low light (when it goes to black & white). I don't know that it would be mug shot level quality, but I do know I can tell which goat is being bad in the dark goat barn now. Also have it on several outdoor areas, where it's color late into the evening.Instructions are simple, but too simple and lacking some detail I would have liked; would have been nice to note somewhere that password needs a number (and special character?). Without any error message, that was just trial and error. Kind of a bummer for first experience with it, but once I was through that bit, everything else was so easy. POE is the way to go. Can't believe I even pondered on that for a day or two like I did. Installing a camera is literally 3 screws, drilling a hole for cable if needed, plugging in the cable on the camera to the ethernet cable, then the ethernet cable to the DVR - done! The DVR defaulted to auto add, so wait a few seconds and the new camera shows up. Maybe I'll put it on the internet sometime (and I can see from other reviewers that can be a project), but for now, straight out of the box and not connected to my network does exactly what I want.Some other notes --1. Another reviewer noted that the trick to audio is to make sure the DVR is set to record audio in addition to the camera being turned on for audio - very helpful.2. I dropped one camera (yes I did) and it wasn't damaged at all. These seem sturdy.3. After figuring out the 3-way articulation, it was easy to set up cameras pointing exactly where I wanted them. Though I went through a phase where things were at various angles (kind of modern art) then realized the barrel rotates too so now everything's level.4. The packaging was hilarious. Did they have a competition to see how much equipment would fit into the smallest box? Everything was well packed and nothing was even out of place. It was just the densest packing job I've seen for a while.5. Really glad I got the 16-channels because now I realize that everything needs to have a camera on it.... meadow, woods, pond....how did we get by without this?6. The night vision gives such a peace of mind; that was one reason I bought this particular camera system. These cameras have 36 IR LEDs, so more than the usual.An added bonus (other than not having to go out to the barn at 2am to check on them) is being able to see the amount of animal stuff that happens when humans aren't around.... fascinating
review_text_5: Had this in place and operational for just under a month now. Upon receipt I tested all the cameras and they all worked, each one was just "plug and play", plugged it in and the system saw it and began recording right away. Was really inpress with how easy it was. Ran the cables thru my attic to where I wanted the cameras, installed the camera and everyone of them worked, once again with no problems. Down loaded the app for my android phone from the google play store, and once I enter the appropriate password (that I had assigned) I was able to view each of the installed cameras with no issues at all. This made adjusting the cameras' direction very easy while I was up on the ladder. The app also let me, while reviewing a recorded segment, to copy it to my phone and then email it. Makes it very nice in case you wish to share something you recorded like say with the police. Over all I am very satified with the cameras and NVR. I have all ready purchased a couple of additional cameras to go with my setup. While I have a monitor hooked up to the NVR, for ease I have purchased a 10" tablet (amazon Fire 10") and am using it as an wall mounted monitor on the wall near the door, makes it nice to see who's there prior to opening it.Now the cameras that come with it are only 4mp, which works fine for my needs, but the supplied NVR can handle up to 5mp camera if you decide to upgrade later. Just another plus for the system.

description: Of the 126 million homes in America, only 20% have home security. At SimpliSafe, we're changing that. Our goal is simple: to make homes safe for everyone, and not with false security, but with real protection. Our frustration-free DIY home surveillance system bundles have precise sensors to know the difference between a family pet and an unwanted intruder, and are designed with long range sensors for entire home protection. SimpliSafe is for homes of all sizes and is built with unprecedented safeguards to keep your home protected against power outages, downed Wi-Fi, cut landlines, and physical attacks from hammers, bats, and more. This easy-to-use wireless system is full of surveillance products small enough to disappear into your home and provide blanket protection. Breathe easy with proper protection at a safe and reasonable price. The 12-piece wireless Security bundle provides 24/7 security with a smash safe keypad that is soft to touch, easy to use during the day and night, and requires no plug (meaning you can place it anywhere), and will alert the police in case of attack. The base station is like your personal security guard: It sends alarm signals to the monitoring center with a built-in cellular connection, 24-hour battery backup, and a 95dB siren. Each entry sensor (5 total) protects your doors and windows and is designed to disappear and blend into the background. The 2 motion sensors are designed for human detection, no pet detection. The key fob lets you arm and disarm your system with The press of a button ‚Äì A fantastic addition for anyone who might forget their pin code. The extra 105dB siren can be placed inside or outside the house to scare off burglars and alert neighbors to a break-in. The simplicity gives you flawless HD video and audio streaming as well as a 120¬∞ field of vision day and night. Enjoy effective, contract-free 24/7 professional monitoring, and make sure your home is the safest place on earth.

review_header_1: Good price, good value. Just buy it and get it over with so you can install it already.
review_header_4: Customer service is a breath of fresh air!
review_text_1: Writing from the perspective of a mother of three from a working class background who lives in a nice area: I think this security system is great. I like the main console becuase it's sleek looking and has a nice light. I like how easy it was to apply the sensors around my home. I like the remote control for activating or deactivating remotely (from your car, for example). I like the keypad too. The system was easy to install and is a far greater value than the commercial stuff you pay goo-gobs of money to have installed. Honestly, I won't waste my money on those other products. Get yourself a home security system you can install yourself, add the Ring doorbell or something else like it, put a camera outside where you need it and monitor your home from your device yourself. This system is nice because it comes with options. Oh, and I almost forgot to mention that it comes with a panic button you can adhere somehwere in your house. My panic button is in the baby's room in case something happens to my youngest.
review_text_2: I currently have Guardian home security which is absolutely worthless.. So I wanted a home security system that I did not require a contract. After reading several reviews from JD Power, US News, and Consumer News and World Report, as well as, customer reviews this was the best choice. I looked at Cove, ADT, Ring and a few others and felt this was best overall for my family. Easy set up, easy to operate. Thougjt I wanted exterior cameras and the reviews were less than favorable I opted to buy and extra indoor camera which I placed in the window and it faces my walkway, front door and driveway I can even see my neighbors door and drive and that works. I've only had it 2 days so i haven't needed tech support. Alarm works well as i have set it off already. I could hear it out in the garage. I will update after I've had it a while.
review_text_3: My partner bought this for our apartment when he was going out of town for a few weeks due to work. I figured we wouldn't need it, because we've never had a problem in our neighborhood, but it's honestly been really nice to have just for peace of mind. Knowing there's a panic button is comforting, the key fob is handy and customer service is quick and reliable. I accidentally set the sensor off when heading out one morning (checked the laundry and forgot there was a sensor on the shed door) and they called right away to check-in. It's a great service they're providing, and I wholly appreciate it.
review_text_4: I‚Äôve had professionally installed security systems in the past and decided to try Simplisafe since it isn‚Äôt so pricey and my daughter likes it. I am really happy with the system, which was indeed simple to install and works like a charm! I had a concern about an incorrect name on the email and the customer service rep was right on it, ensured my privacy and security were honored and he fixed the problem immediately. No waiting on hold or complexities! Monitoring services are reasonable and I‚Äôm so happy I went this route!
review_text_5: It is very easy to install and monitoring cost is reasonable! I'm very satisfied with everything except the camera. It doesn't seem to provide great quality pictures/videos. I can't see clear faces of individuals.

review_header_3: Follow up on my negative review.
review_text_1: I bought a solo cam E40 a few months back and was happy with it except for the battery, which was only going to last about 2 weeks in a low traffic area. Rather than adding on a solar panel, I opted to wait for the S40 to come out.I've only had the S40 for a few days, but the solar panel is keeping the battery at a constant level despite sub-optimal camera placement (only receives direct sunlight in the morning).The camera has been responsive in detecting motion during both the day and night (people, dogs, cars, deer). The alerts arrive within a few seconds of motion and the app is responsive overall.The integrated solar panel is good for aesthetics and makes it much less obtrusive. Recommended so far!Edit: FWIW I use Unifi access points and haven't experienced any of the drop out problems that other users are reporting, but buyer beware.
review_text_2: I have used many of eufy‚Äôs products before and the experience is very good. This time the S40 integrated solar panel cam caught my eyes, OK Forever power, so I decided to purchased one to expand the monitoring range of my home. The setup is just as easy as usual. The design is cool. The picture quality is high and the night vision is also very clear. This camera has certain requirements for the installation position. It is necessary to find an installation point that can illuminate the sun as much as possible, but it‚Äôs actually very easy because you can place it anywhere you want. The solar panel has a good charging effect. My camera has been kept fully charged. This function is very good. Well, avoid the trouble of repeated charging.By the way, I encountered the problem of connection stability at the beginning, and it will appear offline. I tried to look for technical support from eufy. They responded quickly and helped me with my problem. This problem was solve in the latest software version. Great product comes from a responsible team. Good job eufy.
review_text_3: I must apologize for my negative review on this security camera. When I ordered this the FIRST time and tried to connect to my wi-fi, it would not connect. I called Eufy customer support and we tried everything, and I mean everything to make it work. Customer support told me it is defective and to return it. I bought one at BestBuy and guess what, didn‚Äôt work. I tried a third one and didn‚Äôt work. I then took this to a friend‚Äôs house to give it to him to see if it would connect and guess what. It worked!!! I called customer support again (spoke to a very helpful person) and she checked with an Eufy engineer about the problem. We found out that if a wi-fi password has ANY SPACES (even if they are intentionally there) it will not connect. I changed my wi-fi password and it almost immediately connected! I feel awful about the negative review I left. I erased it and I have to say this is one awesome camera!! I highly recommend!!!I‚Äôm sorry Eufy!!!üòî
review_text_4: I purchased this camera a few months ago and happy with this purchase. The video quality and motion detection function great. Network connectivity to this camera works fine and is connected to a mesh WiFi network. I have not had any issues with it disconnecting.Pros:Motion detection consistencyVideo qualityBattery life (documentation says it has a 4 month charge)Built in batteryEasy of installationCons:My house does not get enough sunlight to sufficiently charge it. Luckily it only drains about 1% a day. (Not camera‚Äôs fault)Does not have the ability to insert a SIM card or cloud storage for 24/7 recording.Overall: There is some room for improvement but overall, I am extremely pleased with this purchase. Make sure you get a good bit of sun in your area.
review_text_5: This security camera has been up and running since December 1 and other than the install on the garage eave by an old man on a ladder, there are no issues with its operation. I did survive the ladder install and the camera is securely in place. The solar panel works great and I have a good field of view picture down the driveway and surrounding area. Motion detection and picture quality is good both day and night. I have had no connectivity issues and I am certain my wifi extender plays an important roll in strong wifi connection.Loom wifi extender: I purchased a Loom extender from Amazon and its helps bring a very strong signal with no drop off of signal. Shortly after receipt of the Loom extender I could no longer find the product on Amazon. I am not sure why it is no longer offered but I am certain it plays a major role in the great and stable signal and picture I am able to get on this camera. It is still available from Loom online but the extender has mysteriously disappeared from Amazon web site. Just curious....Why was this product dropped??? I highly recommend it also.Anyway, I am very happy with this camera and extender and I highly recommend both products if your in the market. I previously bought an Arlo and I never could get a good stable picture so I returned and bought the Eufy. I am very satisfied.

features: Connect your Ring camera with Alexa then enable announcements to be alerted when motion is detected. Talk to visitors through compatible Echo devices by saying ‚ÄúAlexa, talk to the front door‚Äù.,Lets you see, hear and speak to visitors from your phone, tablet and PC,Powered by the quick-release rechargeable battery pack.,With a Ring Protect Plan (subscription sold separately), record all your videos, review what you missed for up to 60 days, and share videos and photos.,Monitors your home in 1080HD video with infrared night vision and Live View,Includes built-in LED light strips and a siren,Includes Lifetime Theft Protection: If your Camera gets stolen, we‚Äôll replace it for free
name: Ring Spotlight Cam Battery HD Security Camera with Built Two-Way Talk and a Siren Alarm, White, Works with Alexa
review_header_1: Super Easy to Install, no wires necessary!
review_header_3: Great Camera. Works well for the backyard.
review_text_1: I have a Ring pro on my front door and loved it so much that I wanted something for the back patio since I have contracts (lawn, pool, trees, etc) in my backyard. My challenge however is that all the walls on the patio are either stucco or rock, which makes it near impossible to run a hidden power line. So I opted for this option and so far it works great. The lights are pretty bright and the motion detection works as expected.As for the battery life, it has been in for a couple weeks and it has lost about 10% battery. So I‚Äôm guessing it will last about 3 months before it needs a charge. I just ordered a second battery which should double that battery life.The connection is very quick, it seems to connect much faster than my front door, but in fairness it is closer to the wireless router.As for installation, I installed it using the provided screws into the frame of my patio door. It actually works perfect there because you can‚Äôt really see it and allows me to perfectly position it for motion detection.My only complaint is the motion zone setup. Unlike the ring pro where I can ‚Äúdraw‚Äù motion zones (which significantly helps reduce motion alerts), it only allows you to specify a distance. It really isn‚Äôt very intuitive, so I just leave it at mid-range and it seems to work just fine for now.Beware, in order to have video playback, you do have to subscribe to the ring premium service. And you have to have a subscription per device! I have it for my front door, not sure I‚Äôm gonna pay for the back door. That was kind of a bummer to find out I‚Äôd have to pay more. It should be a household subscription.Overall, I‚Äôm very happy with the device and would recommend it to anyone looking for an easy to install solution without wires.
review_text_3: We have this camera for the backyard and also the ring doorbell for the front door. We got the doorbell first and think it does the job. It is not the best nor is it the worst. Now the camera for the backyard is very nice. We got it as a safety precaution because we felt someone had used the pool while we were away and did not want that to be a safety issue. As you can see in these live pictures I just took that it covers pretty much the whole yard and you can zoom into areas on the app with your finger. Also pictured. We have the sensor set Just right to capture the movement in the backyard. At night when motion is detected the lights fire up to record. There is also an option to push an alarm on the light. It‚Äôs not super loud but loud enough for the neighbors to hear and scare persons away. I have also included a screenshot of the app view of the ring items we have.I would recommend this camera but really recommend using the solar panel with the camera and not have to worry about taking the battery out to charge it.
review_text_4: Love the freedom of wireless, the solar panels work great and only need a couple of hours of sunlight per day to keep the batteries topped off. Video quality is great and I've got eyes on the whole yard now. Just picked up 3 of these beauties. Simply system anyone can install and operate. Thank You Ring!!I bought a camera system a few years ago with a hard drive a 4 wired cameras. Wires all over the house and you need a PHD in programming to get the system to work. It ended up in the trash without ever making a single recording. Ring just makes it all doable for the average Non PHD humans...
review_text_5: Updated Review:Received a new camera from Ring. Setup this past weekend and it has been great so far. A lot different and better results from my first go with Ring.I had upgraded my network devices, modem and router. No more drops or freezing. Worked with Alexis from Ring support and she has been great!!The camera works flawless.

review_text_1: While all the reviews and images look great, these camera HAVE to be plugged in to work and that‚Äôs what you do not see in the advertisement pictures . It‚Äôs frustrating because most outlets are not near high ceilings or places you would put a camera . So although it lives up to the hype and is truly a GOOD PRODUCT these pictures should be reported for false advertising.
review_text_2: So far so good. We've been using Yi products for a while, but have had some issues with them lately. We hooked these up today and they are just as easy to setup as the Yi cameras. The video is crisp and the audio is clean. I give them 5 stars and will be ordering more once these have stood the test of time for a bit longer.Update: 12/12/20I've been using these for a little bit now and they are so much better than the Yi cameras I used to have. One of the biggest perks is that they do not require that you subscribe to their cloud service in order to view multiple cameras on the screen. Only draw back to these is that they don't have a Windows app to view cameras. Only android and iPhone. However, you download the Blue Stack emulator for windows and it's like having an Android on your windows desktop. These cameras are perfect! Everything about them is so much better than the Yi.
review_text_3: We got these with the vague idea that we could monitor our kiddo and babysitters while out on date night. But with Covid, date night is a thing of the past. Let's hope I'll need these more in the future.I installed them already and actually I've really enjoyed being able to monitor different rooms in my house from my phone. It's nice that you can see the feed from every camera on one screen, or just do one at a time so you can see more detail. The picture is pretty good, clear enough that you can tell what's going on. Sometimes I use them to see how my daughter and husband are doing when I'm at the grocery store, or just to see which room my daughter is in and whether she's making a mess, but that's about it so far. Hoping to get more use out of them in the covid-free future. Anyway, for the price, you really can't beat these.
review_text_4: My husband and I just moved to a much larger city than we are accustomed to and bought this for our own practice of mind when our teenager is home alone. I didn‚Äôt expect much since the product was so cheap but let me tell you I was blown away with what I received! The picture quality is much better than expected, the sound quality with speaking through them is great, and the night vision works like a dream! I was expecting them to have cords from reading the reviews and those are the only downside! They are a little short but super easy to hide and extensions aren‚Äôt expensive to purchase! Will recommend.
review_text_5: This is a great product, one of the easiest devices I have ever set up, definitely worth the money

features: 1080P HD indoor, plug-in security camera with motion detection and two way audio that lets you monitor the inside of your home day and night.,Get alerts on your smartphone whenever motion is detected or customize motion detection zones so you can see what matters most.,Store events conveniently and securely in the cloud with a 30-day free trial of the Blink Subscription Plan or locally with the Sync Module 2 and a USB flash drive (USB sold separately).,See, hear, and speak to people and pets in your home on your smartphone with Blink Mini‚Äôs live view and two-way audio features (live view is not continuous).,Sets up in minutes ‚Äì just plug in the camera, connect it to wifi, and add it to your Blink app.,For additional ease of use, pair Blink Mini with a supported Alexa-enabled device to engage live view, and arm and disarm your camera, and more using just your voice.
name: Blink Mini ‚Äì Compact indoor plug-in smart security camera, 1080 HD video, night vision, motion detection, two-way audio, Works with Alexa ‚Äì 2 cameras
review_header_1: Easy set up but app is lacking
review_header_2: Easy to install only took 5 min!
review_header_4: Easy set up and great image quality
review_text_1: I‚Äôm a Blink XT user with three cameras on the exterior of my home. The set up of the mini was FAR EASIER than the outside cams. I had this thing set up in less than 5 minutes. Picture is good. Sound is LOUD which is what I was looking for.The app however needs some work to support this style of camera. The app works decently for the BlinkXT cameras and functionality, which is motion for most users. As in you get a notification that there is motion, it records, and you watch the recording or live as you please. but it is clunky to get into the Blink Mini for the purpose of continuous viewing which is my intention for this camera, like a baby monitor. Like many other Americans now working from home with a full house of kids, I wanted to use this to assist with keeping an eye on the kids as I worked and record those cute moments. I wanted to use this to visualize a blind spot that I can‚Äôt see from the office. I tried mounting it from the ceiling and realized you can‚Äôt rotate the video. Mounting on the wall was a little problematic, I couldn‚Äôt quite get the right angle needed.Another quirk to the app is if you switch to another app and then come back to the Blink app, you have to hit the play button to resume viewing.All in all, these are minor issues specific to my use of the camera which is why I have it five stars anyway.Hey amazon/Blink, it would be an awesome feature if you‚Äôd allow the integration of this camera with Alexa so we can ‚Äúdrop in‚Äù and talk through the Echo Dot. Just saying.
review_text_2: I love this lil camera!! Easy to install! Only took 5 min and it works great!! Highly recommend this!!
review_text_3: Great price and product. Connected very easily to my existing Blink system. I am not happy with having to pay for storage after trial ends.
review_text_4: This is a great little camera monitor. Pros: easy set up, easily managed with your smart phone, clear image quality with motion detection. Can be set up to arm and record at any time. I bought this to use in my master bedroom by my desk where I keep sensitive information.Cons: if you are using it with another Blink product and you arm 24/7 then the other Blink unit also needs to be armed which is an issue because my other unit uses 2 AA batteries. There is no timer on the app to set up a time to arm which would by useful because I sometimes forget to arm at night. It has good night vision quality. It needs to be plugged in so is a problem if you put it in a place (i.e. bedroom closet) if there is no outlet. Because of this, it is difficult to make the camera more hidden (if you are looking for a nanny camera for example).Overall it is easy to use and I would recommend it for a basic home security camera.
review_text_5: SO...I rarely write reviews but was so amazed by this camera I wanted to let others know. I bought the camera after using the Ring indoor camera for twice the price and it made a constant clicking noise with the filter adjustment to light in the room that was a known issue Ring told me and not a defect. I've tried all the other brands out there WYZE, etc and disappointed with all. Then I tried the Blink Mini which I thought was a good price. The setup was a breeze, up and running in 30 seconds. The app is responsive and user friendly. My wifi is sloooow but it still loaded a 1080p HD quality view w hen I accessed it from my mobile app. My favorite feature is the night vision. All my previous cameras just showed a dark room or shadows but this camera shows a clear and crisp picture in pitch black darkness. Very pleased with this and you can't go wrong here. My 2 year indoor camera journey has come to an end here.

description: The LINK-MICRO-LTE VALUE PACK includes a 16g Delkin Micro SD card and a tree mount. The LINK-MICRO from SPYPOINT has completely turned the cellular trail camera market on its head. Just a few years ago cellular trail cameras cost hundreds of dollars, and the average hunter could only imagine what it was like to not have to make the drive to check cards to see what was happening on their hunting property. But in 2019, all that changed. With SPYPOINT always working to make cellular trail camera technology an affordable option for all hunters, the LINK-MICRO debuted as the most affordable cellular game camera ever. This model connects to the USA variable zone network. The LINK-MICRO was designed to give hunters the features that they needed to have an effective cellular camera, but to avoid including a lot of things that just added price and complexity. The camera is managed entirely through the SPYPOINT app. There is no menu screen on the camera itself, which allows it to not only be incredibly affordable, but also one of the smallest cellular camera designs ever produced. Let the LINK-MICRO be your introduction to the mobile scouting solution, and how much better a hunter you can be because of it. Included Accessories ‚Äì Installation strap, Delkin 16g Micro SD card, Tree mount. Sold Separately, Required ‚Äì Eight AA batteries

review_header_3: Excellent camera, solar charging makes it that much wasir
review_header_4: A nice concept- Take that Arlo
review_text_1: I needed something quick and reasonable to take care of my front entryway while I'm gone for some days.Searched a lot of outdoor cameras and found this highly rated reasonably priced camera.Ordered it without any delay on Saturday morning around 10 AM and it was delivered same day at 7 PM. That is quick.Second quick thing was the setup. Had hard time with some previous cameras where you need to switch off your 5G Wifi but thought to give a try and guess what it literally took less than 1 minute to setup.All you need is to Install the APP, turn on the camera, Add the camera and scan the QR code in front of the camera and its up and running. Quickest setup ever for any wifi camera. Installing the camera only took 4-5 mins.Result of the camera is also great for both day and night. I can easily read the license plates. (Street name is omitted in one of the photo).Battery is also very powerful. After all the testing for motion detection it remains the same even on third day.Motion detection is very efficient, It saves the footage on cloud right after it detects any movement. You can adjust the motion detection to high or low.Audio is also crisp and one can easily communicate both ways.
review_text_2: Now I have a total of 6 ZUMIMALL cameras. Since May 2019, I started collecting them. I got hooked on the first camera and I kept finding other places that I wanted to monitor for the occassional human visitor (driving up our long driveway) but mostly for the wildlife, since we live in the country.This latest edition to my collection (received 1 week ago) seems more clearer, the angle wider, the picture clearer and the signal stronger (67% - located over 100 feet from my router extender) . I like how the case extends over the front of the camera and keeps drops of rain off of the lens versus the others I have. I strongly recommend the ZUMIMALL brand and their products. Their customer service is great also. They are quick to respond and very helpful. I misplaced the tiny mounting screw to my ZUMIMALL Doorbell camera and asked how to go about getting a replacement. Soon after I sent the email, I got a positive response that indicated that they would send me a replacement screw (no cost to me). I'm looking forward to see what ZUMIMALL comes out with next. Thank you ZUMIMALL!!!
review_text_3: I bought this after my neighbor had a car window smashed in during the night. I needed to make sure if it happened to me, I was protected. I already had a zumimall camera, so it was a no brainier to buy this one. I've been using the other one for quite a while now - only difference is this one came with a solar charger. Huge benefit. I was able to mount it in an area that is impossible to reach without a ladder. I use an SD card to backup the alarm video that it records. It does not sound the alarm over a passing animal, only vehicles and people. The night vision is awesome. I'll include a daylight screenshot and a nighttime screen shot for reference. I'm very happy with this camera, and excited that I don't even have to pull it off the wall to charge anymore.
review_text_4: This review is for the Zumimall ZS-GX1SI was in the market for a wireless camera to use to investigate employee theft. I needed something that was motion activated and would be able to be hidden in a stockroom and record wrong doings. I came across this item because it seemed like it would do the trick and then I could repurpose it to record vehicles since it was fully wireless I would not need to install a power line to it.Reviewing the owners manual they offer a free 3 year warranty extension if you follow the site they provide. The app required is called CloudEdge App. A microSD card (up to 128GB is required to record videos when the sensor detects movement).Battery- Manual states the camera has a built in 10,400mAh 18650 battery which can be used for 3-6 months assuming the camera wakes up to 15 times a day playing video only 10 minutes. There is a solar panel option for fully wireless charging. I could see this thing being used for a high tech trail camera.I was able to set up the camera while still being connected to a charging cable. So I guess you could use it as a wired camera? The app set up had voice prompts which was nice. It walks you through the setup and you enter your wifi password into the app. The app generates a QR code, you then point the camera towards your phone and the camera will snap a picture of the code to configure itself. MUCH better and faster than having to log into the camera and toggle back and forth. The longest part for me was pulling up my Wi-Fi password since it is long and complex.Video quality is acceptable. App has nice features such as battery life and status. It will also show the signal strength and mac and IP address. You can save to the cloud or use the app to access video files saved on the micro SD card. You can also live stream on demand as well as receive notifications.The box says the camera is "IP weatherproof" but does not list the rating. I would say it would be safe to be outdoors but I would not trust it to be in full rain. I would be more worried about water entering through the antennas as well as the speaker. The buttons, sd card and charging slot are protected by a well fitting rubber cover.

review_header_4: Soliom B10 Goes for the gold!
review_text_2: I‚Äôve had this product for a couple weeks now. I can honestly say this product is easy to install and is of great quality for under $100. I have mounted this camera in my backyard which is mounted to a tree overlooking my back door and and side alley. My camera is mounted up about 15 feet. This camera has great wireless range, excellent battery life, and picture quality is clear.Installation is easy too. Just charge the battery and follow the easy step guide which will guide you through the process. Took less than five minutes to set up. An app need to be downloaded which took a couple minutes.As for installation, just use the easy mounting template then install. The longest time for install is to setup the ladder and then it took me less than 10 min to complete the entire process.All said, I am pleased with the overall ease of installation, quality, and how it performs with the wireless network. I give this product a solid five because it exceeded my expectations.
review_text_3: My first camera. I have seen some from other friends but too pricey. I don‚Äôt want the Ring ones because again, pricey. I went for this one and very impressed may I say. Quality is superb! Took me about 10 minutes to mount and install with the app, not kidding, 10 minutes tops. The only thing I didn‚Äôt like was that it‚Äôs not easy to adjust the position. You have to unscrew little screws and move it, if it was easier to move this would be the PERFECT camera but it‚Äôs a great and I mean GREAT camera. You will not go wrong if you buy this. Imma buy another 2 for my front door and patio. They‚Äôre awesome!
review_text_4: I have been a devoted Soliom user since I bought my first solar wireless security camera several years ago. I had always wanted to have security cameras, but didn't want to get involved with running and concealing wiring and Soliom was the solution with its combination of solar power and rock solid wifi connections.While the S90 and S600 are excellent products and still in use on my property, after multiple summers of 110+ degree days which caused no problem, the B10 takes it to a whole new level. In the first place, the footprint is significantly smaller and the unit less heavy than it's predecessors, yet retains all of the functionality and perfomance is even more enhanced. Because it is small and lightweight, installation is a breeze, and it quickly and easily paired with my router, although it is a fair distance away. As soon as it ws paired, I began to see a brilliant HD picture and a quick test revealed that the 2-way intercom was loud and clear on both ends. Even better, the false alarms often triggered on previous models by tree branches blowing in the wind, were virtually eliminated by the new PIR smart technology. This is enhanced even further by the new ability to program times of operation and a siren that can be set, along with a bright light, to alert the homeowner and to frighten away possible intruders. As with all of my Soliom cameras, it charges fully each day under our bright desert sunlight, and seems to retain its charge even on cloudy days, although I have not had this long enough to use it through the Winter, but based on my experience with my other Soliom cameras it should be more than adequate for a stretch of cloudy days. In the few instances when I have needed some technical support, I found Soliom customer servcie to be both competent, prompt and genuinely concerned with customer satisfaction. For all of the above reasons, I have given the Soliom B10 a five star review and recommend it without hesitation to anyone needing a solar powered wireless security camera, at a very reasonable price.
review_text_5: If your looking for a Solar powered, 1080p, Wifi Security Camera, Spotlight, Color Night Vision, Two-Way Talk, Siren Alarm, and Motion detector camera at an affordable price, this is it!! Soliom added an 10ft extension cable to mount the solar panel away from the camera. You can practically mount the camera anywhere now.. so many possibilities! This is another great product from Soliom. Thank you!!!

review_header_1: 5mp video quality is excellent. Worth it
review_header_5: decent package - Steve from Customer support is great.
review_text_1: I have purchased the 8 channel 5mp POE video surveillance system and I am happy with it.The camera system has an internal storage space of 1tb which is very convenient.I have the cameras recording 24/7 and found that the weekly overwrite on the NVR (due to space limitations) was too quick for my needs.Installed POE via NVR to camera with cat 5e cable and installation is easy. Basically, plug and play.If the cables will be installed outside I recommend using exterior direct burial cat6 cable because the cables that are included are for interior applications. What I really liked was the fact that you are able to view it TV to nvr , and computer and cell phone via cat 5/6 internet connection from nvr to router. There is also live view and playback features.There are no monthly security company fees which is great. There are also lots of settings for motion detection, sensitivity, motion detection zones, email alerts, and app alerts. The night vision is also acceptable it helps a lot to have lighting in the viewing area.Customer service was also top notch. I had a small issue with one of the cameras. Betty helped and replaced it with zero problems. The response time was swift and all in all I cannot complain about the system. It‚Äôs well worth the money and the picture quality, playback and features are excellent.This home security system has met or exceeded nearly all my wishes and expectations.
review_text_2: The whole system is working great. The only issue I had was 2 out of 4 cameras build condensation inside the lens... I tried contacting support I supplied proof a few weeks ago and have yet to hear anything back about it. I am a little upset about it as it was a christmas present for my father...UPDATE: from 3 star to 5 star.Smonet honored their warrenty and replaced both cameras with little hassle... I even got to keep the faulty ones. That is good business right there...
review_text_3: For my money, this SMONET¬†5MP security system is the absolute best in its class. Installation and setup are quick and easy, and the image quality is crisp and sharp day or night.¬†Installation was straightforward. This is a PoE (Power over Ethernet) system, so I pulled¬†the new CAT¬†5e¬†cables. I made up a plywood drill guide to accurately drill the screw and cable holes in my soffits. With the cameras installed and the CAT5 cables in place, all that's left is to hook up the NVR.¬†Since I usually live-view or playback when I'm away from home, the app is a crucial component.¬†The phone app is excellent. The app also supports remote control PTZ (pan/tilt/zoom) cameras if you decide to add one or more to your system. The system comes with 4 PoE cameras, but the NVR supports up to 8, so you have room to upgrade.¬†The playback feature is also excellent. It's quick and easy to navigate to the time period you want to replay. Simply tap the date and then select the time block (the recordings are saved in roughly 1-hour blocks). Drag the slider to find the exact period you want to replay, then tap the camera icon for a still photo or the movie icon to start recording video. I do wish there was a 30 second skip forward/back option, as this would make finding the exact moment of interest a little easier. Photos and videos are saved to local storage, you can playback video from hard drive remotely anytime anywhere.¬†The system also supports push alerts to your phone. You can choose which cameras to send alerts and choose the portions of their fields of view to ignore so as to reduce false alarms. The motion detection is very sensitive, so I'd recommend selecting only the key ares, like your front steps and mailbox lid. Alerts are almost instantaneous.¬†In conclusion, I would recommend this product to friends, family, and co-workers. The ease of installation is incredible, simply plug and play. If you have to through walls, or into the attic, well, that up to the home owner and has nothing to do with plug and play features
review_text_4: I really wanted to like the system. After a really hard, time consuming 4 days labor to run cables through the attic I finally got the system working. 3 weeks in, everything was working great with all 8 cameras. Then, the horror! Suddenly instead of displaying my 8 cameras on the screen like it used to, it started showing me a 9th spot with an ipc disconnect message. It was a bit annoying, but since I could still see all of my 8 cameras, I didn't let that bother me too much. 2 weeks later, aug 1st, 2020, the menu language just change to chinese, out of the blue. Now I only have visual on 6 of my cameras, 2 of them are dead. There's no way to even attempt to fix anything, as everything is in Chinese now on the screen. Very disappointed with this one. Picture quality is very good, but as for as the software running the system, it's a complete nightmare. Don't make the mistake I made buying this one.Update 8/12/2020Support was right on the ball. They reached out to me and got the language fix and the cameras are back working normally. It looks like it takes time to reply, about 24 to 48 hours. That's why I updated my rating.
review_text_5: Decent camera system that allows you to build a better system around the NVR. Cameras are lower end but they get the job done especially if you're not using the motion detection. The cameras appear to not have built in motion sensors. This works ok if you have a background that's mostly static. However, add in a tree and some wind and you're getting 99+ alerts in a few hours time. The Cameras infrared LEDs are faint but still visible attracting bugs at night causing even more false alarms.The NVR is Onvif compatible and *may* support add on cameras. Since purchase I have added a few extra cameras of better quality and the NVR works with them after a little configuration. Also note I was able to capture the camera's RTSP stream from ZoneMinder so you can tweak the motion detection a little further if you like.This is not a bad system especially if you're recording 24/7 and not concerned about motion detection. The NVR works out of the box with the included cameras and mostly stays out of your way when adding 3rd party Onvif Cameras.

review_text_1: This is by far the best security camera I've had. You can move the camera around from the app which is really cool and if you put it in the right place you can cover a ton of area. The solar panel holds the batteries and there is room inside of 6 18650's which is probably a bit of overkill, it comes with 3 installed and room for 3 more, unless it's dark for days on end the 3 batteries should be plenty, but always good to have options. The motion detection is spot on and starts quickly, works much better than my Ring doorbell. Overall awesome high end security camera.
review_text_2: Amazing üëè technology advanced security camera..Swivel using app is incredible coupled with Zoom feature is outstanding...than on top of that the Solar charging as you can see in my picture is by far one of the best features....Totally wireless and with the WiFi feature...Pictures are only in SD that I took but it has the HD feature by simply tapping in app...Alert settings are amazing as seen in my pics. Without question a bargain for the money! Easy install and connection!
review_text_3: Cameras work as advertised (I have 2). I ordered extra batteries (18650) from Amazon (separately) and added them in to the cameras. As with all cameras, finding a good mounting position is the hardest part. This one needs to have a good wi-fi signal, which means you will likely have to add an outdoor wi-fi extender or outdoor wired LAN antenna, or indoor wi-fi extenders on inside walls closest to outside camera location. I ordered wifi-extenders (TP-Link AC750 WiFi Extender RE230) separately also on AMZN, and setup up the extenders and cameras inside, prior to installing cameras outside. Had to move extenders to various locations inside the house to get best connection to camera and to base wi-fi. SOLIOM+ App seems to work pretty good, and camera stays connected to wi-fi. All wi-fi problems so far have been with my signal & extenders, not the camera as far as I can tell. My camera (and solar panel) are in shade under trees, and we have had several dark stormy days, but after several weeks I have had no battery charging issues, and cameras have stayed online all the time, day and night. I also added memory cards (SD) to each camera before installation. I record all video to SD.I tried to activate the free (7-day?) Trial Cloud video storage via the SOLIOM+ app on my phone, but it just didn't work. I wanted to test that Cloud storage before sending any money for a paid account, but that's on hold until I can try to get the free Trial to work. Camera video quality is great, day and night -- I use the night vision mode by turning off the cameras light and use IR. Pan/Tilt works good, but you should know that is is in 'fixed increments' when you hit the app p/t buttons. There is no optical zoom, but you can 'zoom' in the app with normal phone 2-finger touchscreen operation. Also, there is no way to view video through any other means other than their SOLIOM+ app on the phone. A firmware upgrade would be greatly appreciated that allows standard network access from camera to software like Blue Iris. Most camera makers seem to have proprietary software or apps so this maker is not unusual. 1 drawback is (at maximum movement sensitivity) camera misses some activity (cars and people in driveway). There is also a 'glitch' (I would call it), where motion is activated just fine, but recording stops at your preset time limit, even though motion continues. There will be no added video either on the original clip or on additional clips. All additional motion is just not recorded. On the other camera which is viewing only yard, (versus driveway, cars, people), motion is activated for leaves falling and bugs flying by. None but the most expensive (several times $cost of this one) have great motion control so this isn't a complaint given the price of these cameras, just be aware of some of the limitations of less expensive cameras like this one. So far this camera has operated in weather from 80's down to upper 20's (F) and in lots of rain without any problem. 1 big problem is that when recording to SD card, you can only *view* the saved video on your phone (in the SOLIOM+ app), but you cannot download the video and save it to your phone or anywhere else -- you have to open the camera, take out the SD card, then copy the video clips that way - which is pretty ridiculous. That is probably the only reason NOT to get this camera. I assume, but have not tested it, that video on their cloud service would be downloadable to a PC or something. There are video capture apps for android that may help to capture the video while you play it on your phone, but I have also not tried any of that. SOLIOM+ app should be updated ASAP to allow downloading video from SD to phone storage.
review_text_4: We love the pan, tilt, zoom option and the video quality is great. The setup is extremely easy. You can add 3 extra 18650 batteries for backup power but it's not really needed. You can store/review the files on your micro SD card or the cloud. If you want to use the cloud, they have 3 different price plans as shown in the pics. So far so good, really happy with this purchase.

review_header_5: Long time I looked at DVR Camera Systems
review_text_1: Outdid my expectations.I work in IT security. I set up and configure cameras in a facility so I shopped around and decided on this product for my home.These cams have excellent quality and the software is pretty easy to use once you're familiar with the menus and settings.App works flawlessly on wifi although it will sometimes take a bit to connect on 4G data service on your device.I'm into techy things and I totally geeked out on setting this up. It was a lot of fun.(Pretty simple for an average user)My favorite feature is the two way audio. I show it off all the time.
review_text_2: My previous camera system consisted of individual cameras using my existing home WiFi. It was manageable but each camera had it's own IP address which slowed down my network and was not east to use. After spending time reading reviews, I settled on the XMARTO Wireless Security Camera System as a stand alone system that is independent of my home WiFi. I watched a few YouTube videos and had it up and running in an hour. I installed them and am quite pleased with the quality of the equipment and the images. I intend to purchase four more cameras to max out this system.
review_text_3: Best Camera system Period.After spending months of research, weeding out the paid reviews when you search best camera system the information many times does not include the best, it is about money and sponsors and if you have read many of these reviews it doesn't take too long to figure out they are catering to certain companies and many of these websites are ran by the same people,I have came to the conclusion that this is the best Wi-Fi Camera System on the market with the best price. I read what other people say and go by word of mouth.Most people wont read everything but I advise to read if you are in the market, I will sum it up, the expound a bit. All of what Xmarto says is true, take time to read all of their details.Best Price, Best Service, Best Support, Best Night Vision, Best Picture Quality, Best Features, Best WiFi Range. Best Camera Detection. Also works like a security light too (recommended by me) You have night vision mode and can leave flood lights on always or put it in smart mode.Detection good, in fact it is too good, I had to dumb it down a bit because it detected traffic from a different street. Great range, I even have a fantastic signal from out in my detached garage.It has a special repeater system on its own Wi-Fi system that you can connect to your internet wired or by Wi-Fi. You do not have to if you do not want to view it remotely because it stores on its own NVRs large Hard Drive and you can view it from there. Or connect to your Wi-Fi and watch your home from around the world. I have the app on an old iPhone 8 and a 2013 Toshiba laptop. It is also viewable from my wife's iPhone11.The night vision is the best of any camera system that I have owned and Daylight is great. You can set the cameras in Auto mode so when it detects motion the bright led lights light up, like a motion sensor security light and you get full color like it is daylightBecause I am not to tech savvy I had to use there support and they responded very quick with the information that I needed in an understandable format. Than I had a small issue with one of my cameras, perhaps it was damaged in shipping. It was packaged well in an Xmarto box and then packed in an amazon box, but things happen. After contacting their support dept., they had me try a couple of things, then sent me a new camera and I received it in 36 hours. They have 2 way sound and an alarm which can be set to go off on motion or you can push an alarm button like a panic button.They have a cloud feature I am not sure if I am going to use it because my videos are stored local but I may as a layer of protection like my house catches on fire, the cloud would save my video.I can attach some screen shots and pictures but they do not do justice to real life.All photos attached to this review were taken at night. the first 3 photos are pictures taken of a 42 inch TV you can see 4 different cameras, then click and you can enlarge video to full size of TV, second picture is taken with camera night vison, 3rd is camera floodlight (you can see color at night. the last 2 pictures are iPhone screenshots. The camera will show more but the view is blocked partially by deck, but that is the way I want it to see people approaching front door. The cameras also zoom inEasy to set up, easy to operate
review_text_4: My dad and I are running a small business locally but things got really tough nowadays. We were worried about our safety. That's why I bought this XMARTO security camera system for our store. To be honest, this is not one of the cheapest but it has all the features that we need. First it was super easy to install. We only spend about 20 mins mounting and organizing the cables. The NVR box is capable of hosting 8 cameras. This set has 4 cameras which will be more than we need for the store. The video is sharp and smooth. More importantly, it comes with pre-installed hard drive so no need to put the box and put an extra hard. Last but not the least, it has its own app which allows my dad and I check it wirelessly. Also, it can send motion alert!
review_text_5: The only thing I wonder about is long term use .... if that is not a problem a REAL 5 star product/ today I learned you can click on any camera /click on area and zoom in /like a car or persons face wow! WiFi is not perfect but all systems are buggy on wireless BUT this has top quality view and color and night is outstanding. the FPS seems to be slow I think its 30fps divided x4 /still learning how to set motion and other features/already upgraded Firmware on the NVR easy d/l restart solved some distance issues with camera in back of property / for the money ITS GREAT! its not junky /quality cameras dual antennas /we will see as time pass if they hold up/ here comes winter!
