review_header_3: Took my time to test this. 5 üåü pleased
review_text_1: I got this for our front entry so that I would not have to run any power and still be able to have the same functionality and quality camera to watch the that area.Pros:WiFiCordlessRechargeable BatteryWaterproof1080PHDColor Night VisionIR Night VisionSD Card or Cloud CompatibleAppPIR Motion DetectionBuilt-In SirenActivity ZoneSpot Light2-Way AudioWarrantyCons:Does Not Work With 5GHzWhat I received in the package:1 x ZUMIMALL DZEES Security Camera1 x Mounting Bracket1 x Mounting Gasket1 x Solar Panel4 x Screws4 x Anchors1 x microUSB Cable1 x Reset Pin1 x User ManualThis ZUMIMALL DZEES Security Camera product is a wireless WiFi camera that is fit for both outdoor and indoor use. It is IP65 rating, which means it gives protection against low pressure water jets from any direction. As well as condensation and water spray. It is 1080P HD and has both motion detection and night vision. It comes with two storage options, using a MicroSD Card and you can also purchase a subscription to a Cloud Service for storage. The camera also offers 2-Way Audio. The camera has an internal 6700 mAh Lithium-Ion battery that can last up to 5 months depending on usage. It also has a LED light that can be toggled by the app or set to turn on when motion is detected. It also comes with an alarm option with the same features as the light. All controllable/configurable by the app. The camera provide 120 degrees wide angle view.This camera was heavier than I expected and most of that weight is probably the battery. The unit didn‚Äôt come with a charge on it. So I plugged it in and about 8 hours later it was fully charged. That was the only thing that took any time. I installed the round metal mount. I liked the quick removal and replacement for charging purposes. The camera has a dome shaped magnet in the back of it. So it snaps right into place and you just move it to where you want to point it and it stays. The magnet is strong and that camera is not going anywhere. It took about 2 minutes to install. It took about 2 minutes to download the app and register. Once that occurs you can attempt to detect the camera once you turn it on. Pairing and configuration was intuitive and straight forward. I had a working camera and app in less than 5 minutes.The camera resolution is quite nice for a wireless camera and in testing, all features and functions performed as expected. The camera will send a notification to your phone when it detects motion so you can check the app immediately and see what is going on. Also it saves the recordings or photos which are accessible from the app. You are able to listen to an activity near the camera or talk to guests in the back yard. The volume is not very loud .. however, it is clear enough to be heard. The night vision has a 33‚Äô range is relatively clear. The 1080P HD is also impressive for a wireless camera. The view does have a slight fish eye view to it.The battery life of the camera is not that great. So to me able to charge it with the solar panel is a plus. The solar panel trickle charges the unit and is enough to keep it up and running. Without the solar panel I had to take it down after about 3-4 days to recharge if you have all the bells and whistles turned on for this unit.The manufacturer offers a 3-Year Warranty on the product.I appreciate you taking the time to read this. I received this product in exchange for an honest review. All in all, this is my second one of these cameras and it is amazing. I have ordered a third for the back yard. It comes with an excellent quality picture and is absolutely wireless. One of the best remote cameras I have come across. Highly recommend this product for the price point. I have not found a better camera for the money. Unless you require pan and tilt or motion follow, this is one of my top picks. All in all, Hope this information was helpful. [5 Stars]
review_text_2: This is by far the best wireless camera you can purchase on Amazon, It took only a few minutes to Install and and the Solar Panel Works perfect. The App is very easy to use and I can login from anywhere to see around my house. I definitely recommend purchasing this. I have purchased 6 of these camera's with Solar Panels and they are all around my house. Its so good having all this security especially in times like these. So don't hesitate to purchase them, you will not regret it.
review_text_3: Being a fan of Zummimal cameras, I decided to purchase one of their related brands. I've had it 6 weeks and have been surprised with some upgrades not on their other battery cameras.This camera can use AI to classify alerts to person, pet, package, or even differentiate if a vehicle is approaching or departing.It accepted a 128gb card after it formatted. Firmware updates have kept improving the already excellent camera clarity and notification speed.Sound is so good that I had to move it so it wouldn't pick up neighbors conversations so clearly. Having a üö® is a plus, as well as the ability to use the white light spotlight to see in color.The solar panel has kept it consistently charged. I'm still deciding where to permanently place the camera, but I've been able to keep moving it because it has a magnetic mount and a magnetic hold to metal surfaces built in to the camera too.The 3 year warranty is great peace of mind, but they've also reached out via email to see if I needed any technical support. So far, I haven't. The app on this camera is great. I've hated other apps, so that was a surprise. It's very user friendly, just like the setup. The camera basically talks you through 3 minute setup.It's very easy to recommend this camera, app, and the large level of support.
review_text_4: I use the IOS App (iPhone) for the setup and use of the camera. The setup was very easy, installing the App via a QR was done in minutes. The set up included connecting to your WIFI network, again this was easy and trouble free. Your pictures and videos can be stored on a Micro SD Card; however, the card is not included, and you must purchase this separately. The solar panel charging system works well. Connecting to my WIFI network was simple and took only a few minutes. Both pictures and video are easily saved to either the cloud or your Micro SD card. The night vision is exceptional (IR) and the white light setting for short range color viewing was quite good.All the mounting hardware needed for a secure install was included. I installed the camera in my back yard for added security. The camera is easily removed for re-charging (magnetic mount). The 2-way audio is crystal clear. The interface in the app is very clear and concise, super clean, simple, and easy to use.The build quality is solid, it feels like a very durable and well-built device. It has the heft and feel of a quality product. The magnetic mount is very strong and completely adjustable so that you can aim it where you need it.I was able to check the camera while out of the house, clear pictures and the motion alarms work very well.All in all, this is an exceptional camera, I found it to be easy to set up, maintain and use. I have other ZUMIMALL cameras and found the customer service second to none. They have been very responsive, courteous and go above and beyond to improve their products and satisfy customers after the sale. I had lost my camera mounts and ZUMIMALL sent me two new ones without charge.I highly recommend purchasing their products.

review_header_3: Amazing Camera At An Even More Amazing Price
review_header_4: Great camera at a great price!
review_header_5: Fully loaded features at a fraction cost
review_text_1: I ordered 2 of these .. installed them at the edge of a 2nd story window looking down .. they cover the street, driveway, and will "zoom" when I look on the live feed on my phone . I feel like a genius having connected these myself to the wireless router, and then physically put them up .. the little blue lights they emit advise anyone looking around that the place is being watched and this has got to be the EASIEST surveillence Iv ever had .. downloaded the CloudEdge app ( and it connects both cameras to my phone monitoring in Real Time .. ~ ! one of the cams monitors better than the other and I think its because it attaches to the wireless iNet of my location better because of where I installed it .. (thinking abt changing that, but for now one doesnt really respond as well ..) but I still hav the other one fully operational and can be states away and effortlessly monitor the property .. these are supposed to be for exterior but I hav them inside (for now) the easy part is they plug right into a 110 outlet .. but (Im pretty handy) I could simply splice the wire into same, said outlet and install it exerior no problem .. or .. rig it so the wire goes thru the wall to the plug-in and just seal around the hole and unit with some caulk .. either way these are very easy but you hav to hav a Power Source (see my next-to-last paragraph below for comment on the reviewer who complained about that lol ..) I used to hav to subscribe (yes with a Monthly fee !) to a monitoring website online which kept the survellience footage for me for abt 30 days .. even if I wanted to just View any past footage I had to pay a little extra .. and if I needed to "pull" the footage there was an upcharge .. needless to say with these cams (yes yes I know welcome to the 2020s lol) I dont need any of that and at $35/ea I feel like I got a terrific deal . I also purchased the SD card ($12 for 2) which say they are 64gb but they might be less but who cares .. its a flippin DEAL .. ! so glad I bought it .. I havent tried the "record" much .. so IDK how much "memory" the SD cards truly hav, but I recorded a few seconds on my phone, and it stores it in an "album" .. theres only 2 (recordings) there for now .. I sent one to myself and played it so that works too ..the picture on these is not stellar but still very good and enough to make out tag numbers (license plates) and other features plus you can "zoom in" .. the night vision is great for the money, though I hav a mercury vapor (very bright) light illuminating where these are watching so dont need the night as much as some areas which might be darker .. I will tell you that placing a light in and of itself is a high deterrent to crime, cameras are a deterrent also, but the combination of light (inexpensive) with security camera is a win-win and something to seriously consider ..gosh I hope these last .. I read a few reviews that stated these quit working after a few months, so if that happens I will definitely update, but for now I hav to giv a whopping 5 Stars ! Lastly I hav to mention this: one reviewer stated the "wireless" label was "misleading" ... HE THOUGHT YOU COULD GET A POWER SOURCE WIRELESSLY .. !! YOU CANNOT GET POWER FROM ANYTHING WIRELESSLY !! even Solar has to be directed to whatever device you are powering .. I cannot believe the stupidity of such a review ! and then like 12 other people clicked on how "helpful" his review was .. !! (what has happned to common sense ??) think abt it: if you could "wirelessly" get power we would never hav to charge our phones .. the "wireless" is how these cameras interact with the data they can send, store, record, etc .. but these hav a plug-in that you plug into a regular 110 outlet . Simple .OK .. I hoped this helped, if it did for you please show with a "help" click as it lets me know what details are the best to include that you might find useful in my reviews (plus I appreciate the feedback) .. I didnt get any incentive, product, or endorsement for my opinion here today .. just like to relate on decent items I buy .. Id say a solid 4.5 stars for these .. half star off for a lesser defintion in the video quality but all-in-all for $35, you just cant beat the Value of this camera, features, etc so Im rounding up .. 5 stars !
review_text_2: This is a great security camera for the money. I mounted it just above my garage door looking down the driveway. The video quality is excellent in both daylight and during night time. The software is very easy to use once you understand all the controls and features. You can set-up areas of the video that you wish to have motion detection which really works great. I like the blue LED on the camera's face that tells visitors they are being watched and suspect it acts as a further deterrent. I would suggest using at least a 64GB, or better yet a 128GB SD card, for storing videos, although you can store them in "The Cloud" if you wish to pay a small fee. This company's customer service is great and gets back to you quickly with answers to any questions you may have. This was a very good purchase and 5 stars all around! I would definitely buy again and highly recommend this camera...ya can't go wrong!
review_text_4: My camera came in on a Sunday and after getting it configured on my network I mounted it over the garage. What I love about the camera:Solid constructionAbility to move the direction it is pointing via the iPhone app - huge field of view potentialSimple installation and configurationNight visionKeep in mind that this does not use batteries, will need to mount in a position that you can reach an outlet. I ran my power cable in the top corner of the garage and down the internal wall, worked great!Again, this great product at a great price, I would highly recommend if you are interested in another set of eyes outside (or inside) your home.
review_text_5: Considering the price, this camera is 5star. It has all the features even connect to Alexa or Google Home. Supports only 2.4Ghz WiFi with Local SD 128GB. Option to buy cloud storage and keeps motion detection snaps. Intercom from Camera (speaker a bit low), you can even rotate the camera from mobile horizontally. Ya Zoom may be missing but good HD video quality. Only power needed 12Volts.

review_text_1: I put this into my photo studio to be able to keep an eye on things when I'm not there. My space includes a heater for several spaces and I want to be able to keep an eye on things if someone goes in and does maintenance. So far I'm very impressed by the image quality and ease of installation. The only thing I had a problem with was having to mount the camera with the stand down. I thought I could rotate the camera image 90 degrees if I wanted to mount it sideways directly to the wall. Once I figured out that limitation and put the camera on a small shelf it was all good.
review_text_2: I have to say it‚Äôs the most easiest camera to install (once I got my password in correctly)‚Ä¶lolI had to adjust the lighting on my camera because my room is dark with my insulated curtains. But I am still happy with the picture I get. As the main reason I bought this camera was to be able to check on my cats.The camera tilts a little, but wish it tilted more. Otherwise it‚Äôs a great camera.It does come with a magnet wall mount, which is neat. But I don‚Äôt want to hang on my wall right now.But this camera is worth buying. As I have a brother who has this brand of camera inside & outside his home. At least four of this indoor camera & four outdoor EZVIZ camera‚Äôs.
review_text_3: I have had these cameras for over a year now. I have one in my garage, one in my downstairs (can see the walk in of each room with clear view) where my kids rooms, toy room and laundry and 2 bathroom is located. And 1 pointing outside of my front window (it is a corded camera and I didnt feel secure about running a cord outside or pluggin one outside) to show the view of my driveway (which also gives a great and clear view of the business and houses on the street across, as I stay on a busy road). I pay a small fee under $7 dollars a month through the app, which in return keeps the cameras recording and saves the data to its cloud so that i can access the cameras at anytime to playback any video. You do have to have wifi for the cameras to be able to connect.With these cameras I was able to, find out who tried to steal my car and use the video as evidence, find out which one of my kids was last to flood my downstairs toliet.Im sure I will be adding a few more.
review_text_4: Without a doubt this is one of the best buys I've made in a long time. The price was super cheap for the quality of product, ease of setup, quality of the app, etc... I bought this so my father could keep an eye on my bedridden mother without having to be with her all the time (she has Alzheimer's). This simple $25 investment has allowed him the freedom to move about the house and yard without worry. Honestly, this dependable little camera (that also has two way communication!) has changed the quality of his life. I would recommend this product, and have already done so on several occasions, to anyone in need of this type of product and the peace of mind that it brings.
review_text_5: Great picture quality and can set to human detection mode which works most the time. Besides when my cats stand-up like humans and walk around the house when I'm out thereüò±üò±üò±

review_text_1: I am a tough customer but this camera is outstanding in every aspect. It's picture is clear and sharp, not fuzzy or grainy. The night vision is fantastic, I have mine set on color mode. The LED flood lights light up a large area and are very bright, a great feature and can be turned on or off. Day or night, the camera view distance is impressive, I can see all 4 acre's of my property and well beyond that. I am still learning about the motion detection sensitivity, playing with that now to adjust to my liking. The siren is another great bonus along with the voice communication. Each of those can be turned on or off. Don't bother paying hundreds of dollars on other cameras, this camera exceeded my expectations in every way. I hope to add photos and video when I have more time. I highly recommend the BOAVISION PTZ camera. UPDATE 2/2021; this is one tough camera! It fell off mount from second story of my house (my own fault) and still works perfectly
review_text_2: I can't say enough great things about this camera! Great picture night or day. Digital zoom, LED lights for color night vision and lights my way too. It tracks me from the vehicle to the house or anything else that goes past. The App is decent as well. Price was good and it exceded my expectations.
review_text_3: We ordered 2 of these cameras prior to going on our vacation so we could watch and talk to our fur baby while we were gone, as well as a little more security for our son that house sat for us. I was kinda hesitant because they were fairly cheap and didn't think they would work well especially if we were out of state trying to watch but to my surprise THEY WORKED VERY VERY WELL!! We were able to talk to our fur baby "Dezi" shes our dog, and listen to her lol... We are definitely going to be buying a few more now that we know they work so well. We have also told alot of our family and friends how good these cameras work!!! We give these BOA Vision cameras 5 stars!!!!
review_text_5: What will I say it‚Äôs still in the testing stages now and they work fine in the winter weather and it clear at night and I do love the zoom on it and the WiFi connection is also great,I bought a different brand before these and I have been having pure problems with it,these have never cut out or need rebooting etc and I will buy one more to replace the different brand that I bought first because it just not working as it should and there is no support website for that brand,I do hope Amazon work with me to refund me or something

No wiring, no professional installation required.,Works with Alexa ‚Äì use your voice to monitor your home through supported Alexa-enabled devices.,Includes three Blink Indoor cameras and one Sync Module 2.

review_text_1: Very easy install and setup. Video quality doesn‚Äôt seem to be much better than the cheap wyze cam I replaced with this blink, even after adjusting to ‚Äúbest‚Äù quality. Love that it‚Äôs wireless and no longer have a 9 foot cable hanging on my wall. App is pretty intuitive. Alexa integration is great. Had an issue with the first cam, customer service was very helpful.
review_text_2: I just want to say for all the people that crap on these cameras, these cameras are amazing. They do the job. They are sturdy. They last through snow, wind, rain, and sun. They have amazing low light vision. Clear pictures. And a great setup to last two years on double AAs. And for those who need them to last longer buy the adapter to plug them in. It's stupid how these people come and review these as if they were 5000 dollar security set ups. These are worth it and a great value.
review_text_4: We are happy with our blink indoor cameras. It being wireless, light, and battery powered made it easy to install. The motion detection feature allows you to choose sections of the room you want monitored. The night vision is provides good quality captures and we were surprised the battery life is rated for two years. However, please keep in mind that it could change base on how much you use the live view, how often it triggers to record, how long the duration of recording, is set to, and if your wifi signaling is bad.Note: if you have a large area or areas with lots of obstructions (i.e. cement, brick, steel, and aluminum) walls you may want to have a wifi meshed network to extend you wifi network pass these obstructions. We have the Google Nest Wifi system. Also, the blink camera must connect to the sync module via low frequency radio (LFR). Because of this, the camera must be within distance of the sync module. This is separate from your home wifi network. My suggestion is to get another syn-module if you run into issues where your single sync-module cannot cover all camera areas.
review_text_5: The all-new Blink Indoor ‚Äì wireless, HD security camera appears to be a good product at a reasonable price. I bought a set of three that came with a Sync module. I believe up to 10 devices can be connected wirelessly to the Sync module that communicates using your home wifi. I was able to easily set up the camera using the Blink app on an iPhone. in addition, I was able to link to Alexa using my Amazon Prime account. This helped to view the camera on the Echo View screen using Alexa voice command such as, "Alexa, show Living Room."I understand that Lithium AA batteries (supplied with the camera) would last for two years. Also, there is a USB-C port to power the camera, although no cable or USB charging block is provided.The camera comes with a small mountong bracket and screws for wall or ceiling mounting.15 day trial for storing in the cloud is free and after that the subscription is $3/month per camera or $10/month for all cameras. However, the Sync module has an USB post and a low profile USB thumb drive upto 256 GB may be used to store video clips in MP4 format.My only complaint is that a detailed User's Manual explaining all these should be included instead of finding at Blink support website.

review_header_2: Security camera with clear picture, 350o views, and audio
review_header_3: Totes mah goats worth the money
review_text_1: I have to admit I‚Äôm pretty impressed with this camera considering the cheap price. I was looking for a camera to put in my son‚Äôs room so that I don‚Äôt have to follow him upstairs all day long but can still keep an eye on him.The night vision works great. So far the pictures have been very clear. I also really like the fact that you can use this camera live, so you don‚Äôt necessarily need an SD card, unless you want to record and don‚Äôt want to buy the cloud service. I do plan on buying another camera for my living room so I will be inserting a micro SD in that camera.I will admit I had a very difficult time connecting the camera to my router. I have dual band WIFI through XFinity. The first time I tried to connect the camera it didn‚Äôt work. So I did some research and managed to separate my Wi-Fi into the two separate bands: 2.4 GHz and 5 GHz. (I had them together under one name and password.) I attempted to connect the camera to the router several more times after that but it still wouldn‚Äôt connect. I ended up spending an hour trying to connect the camera to no avail.Finally I noticed in the little instruction booklet that it says you can connect your camera directly through the modem (a modem cable is included in the box the camera came in.) Lo and behold I was able to connect the camera within just a few minutes. I then went into the app and changed the setting from modem to WIFI. I sincerely wish I had tried this method within the first few minutes of failing to connect through the Wi-Fi because it would‚Äôve saved me a lot of time and effort. (There was no need to separate the two bands. Ugh!)I hope this helps anyone else who may be having a difficult time connecting their camera.Overall, great little piece of equipment!
review_text_2: I was a little intimidated about setting up this camera. But I followed the directions slowly and calmly, one step at a time, and everything worked with ease. What fun. The picture is really clear. It is cool that you can move your fingers on the camera screen, wherever you are, and the camera head will rotate accordingly. So you can scan the whole room (350o rotation). And the fact that it includes audio is awesome. So it could also be used as a baby monitor or to hear if your dogs are barking, etc. Or you could talk to the baby, dogs, other adults in the room. One drawback is that the camera has to be connected to USB/power. That greatly limits where I can use it. The instructions are very good for setup, but then it is lacking in real directions on how to use it in everyday use. Most things you can figure out for yourself. Although I have an Alexa device, I was not able to use it with Alexa because it requires an Alexa screen device as well. But overall, I like this camera.
review_text_3: Well this little beauty is sweet. It came within 24 hours (thanks Amazon Prime) and in a nice little box and set up was a breeze (iPhone user). Once you download the application via the App Store, the instructions walk you through set up step by step. You do need your WiFi login, and it does not support 5G WiFi. The sound it makes is a little weird during pairing with WiFi/router connecting but it‚Äôs temporary, so you‚Äôll get over it, your sleeping newborn- maybe not so much. Once your set up is complete, you can change the settings for motion detection notification and also sensitivity. I tried stealth mode of moving really slow and also trying to play flash lightening and it caught me on both and sent a notification to my phone of said sloth intruder or lightening McQueen in the house. It has a two way speaker so really nice to be able to yell at the dogs or scare the bejeezus out of your roommate. I‚Äôm shocked at the picture quality. I was going to upload a picture of myself in it, but the quality is good that I needed a filter- maybe on their next update. Also, kind of cool that nightmode has its own settings (and throwing it back to the 40s with no color to set the Friday the 13th ambiance) so just in case you want to catch ghosts on camera, I‚Äôm sure you can set it to Orb sensitivity. Overall, really great quality product and totally worth the money.
review_text_4: Alright so first off, the price. At 30fps and 1080 with all the extra features. It seemed to good to be true. With that being said, I was eager to play with this one. It comes nicely packaged and about the size of a soda can. Has a two hole mount that can be screwed on many surfaces, walls, ceilings. The mount is an easy twist on so the camera can be taken down with ease. The Picture quality honestly blew me away for a 1080. There‚Äôs a lot of 1080s out there that just plain suck. Tethys is true to their word on this one. The night vision is slightly under what they say it can do (32ft I believe) but it‚Äôs still plenty of range for your buck. The camera movement is smooth as well. You just swipe down to go up and left to go right and so on. The set up was a little bit of a pain until I realized the manual said something different than what the app tells you to do. Basically just have the camera and your phone right next to the router and it hooks up in seconds. Took me a few tries to realize this. The interface on the app is Fairly easy and any beginner can figure it out. The cloud service does cost money I‚Äôm not sure how much. All in all this thing is hard to beat for the price and features packed into it. In the photos in my living room there is a sign way back by the kitchen. The next photo is the camera zoomed in on it to show the quality.
review_text_5: Unit was defective when received. Was asked to move to different locations to see if it would help. I did that and after many tries, it still refused to work wihout the irriataing beep,beep either immediately, or after several ours or days.They want me to pay the return shipping. I won't buy from them again!UPDATE:Original Purchase date Nov.30 2019. Today Feb. 24 2020.I finally did get a replacement and this one works very well. Tethys did send the replacement at no cost and sent a prepaid return label to return the defective camera. They are nice cameras. I bought 2 the first time and only one worked, but after several email exchanges, Tethys made good on their warranty and paid the shipping both ways. Tethys truly seemed to wanted to do the right thing after our email conversations, so I am changing my rating to five stars, 4.5 would be more accurate as it did take longer than it should have to resolve the issue. I do belive the product is a quality item, and I just received a defective one the first time. And I would now buy again from them.

review_text_2: First of all, I have to say that these indoor cameras are so easy to set up! I set one up while my 10 year old did the other and they were up and working within minutes. As you can see from my pictures, the picture quality is really great. You can view your cameras with the app and there you can see what you are looking at as well as hear what‚Äôs going on. I am thinking over ordering a couple more of these for the house as I am so pleased with my purchase. Each camera comes with a sd card to insert in camera for memory, so no extra purchase is required.
review_text_3: When I ordered I didn‚Äôt realize that it was a plug in device. Thankfully the areas I needed them placed had outlets and the cord has enough length!The night vision is surprisingly clear. The app is very intuitive, I‚Äôm still playing around with the settings. My husband has fun by talking to me through the device! Good buy for indoor use.
review_text_4: Now I really recommend this cameras the app is awesome it's easy to use you don't have to buy the cloud if you don't want to but if you want to it's available it records for you automatically motion detection and sound detection is awesome picture quality night vision and day vision beautiful I really really love these cameras it has taken me 2 years to be able to find the cameras that I like all other cameras no good really I really recommend this these cameras
review_text_5: We love these cameras! The features of these cameras are great and at low cost! The cameras connect to an app (we have iphones) where you can record, screenshot, talk, playback, change directions, set alarms and build an album of photos taken. The sound and motion sensors have settings for high or low sensitivity. Additional features include night vision and alarm settings. review_text_1: Bought this for my non-tech-savvy wife and here's her review :Perfect for checking on an injured pony on stall rest, day and night!!! (Barn is 25 min away and no wifi.)Video is SMOOTH and picture quality is GREAT (screenshots from my camera)! Two settings : hi or lo - I use lowest resolution here, and can easily see if his wraps are undone. Slight lag time on pan/tilt but it's perfectly fine.Moderately easy to set up (Corrine at Reolink tech support emails helped BIG TIME, as upon doing a "factory reset" on the camera, everything worked as it should!) and shoutout to #HuntingFarmer for recommending the FreedomPop $5 a month 12-Month Prepaid plan (bought it for $43!). I don't have to worry about data for 12 months - Each time I pop in to view, I use up 2 MB - so I figure, with the 1 GB allotted, I can pop in 500 times a month (= 16 times a day, which is more than I actually use!) without going over.I set it at lowest motion setting, so no recording is triggered - with that, the camera uses up about 2-5% battery a day; unfortunately, the barn has no direct sunlight (did not think of that when I purchased with the solar panel)... but I just hooked up the solar panel anyway and we will see if the battery lasts any longer. Luckily, it's easy to take down for a quick charge.All in all, a perfect, self-sustaining barn camera. Exactly what I've been looking for!
review_text_3: I have used the Reolink Go for a few months in a horse stall and its been great. When I needed another camera, I saw that this camera can rotate remotely through the app and has a few more features. It has worked seamlessly in the app and installing the camera was easier than the Reolink go with the guides to drill (I recommend taking a copy of it so just in case you move the camera it is easy to install). I have a tmobile sim card that has worked great.Areas of opportunity:-I do wish it had a removable battery like the reolink go but the other ways to charge it have worked.- If you have more than one reolink camera, you have to update your cloud which is a monthly/annual cost; which I found a bit annoying but the app is great so its been worth it so far.Overall, the picture quality is great and being able to remotely control it through the app has been awesome!
review_text_4: I am extremely happy with this camera / solar panel. I mounted it to the spreader of my sailboat mast using the strap it comes with. I also mounted the solar panel just above it using a zip tie. I did not have to drill any holes in my mast. It has never lost signal, not once! I've been testing it for 2 months now. I can see my boat on the mooring ball using my cell phone anywhere/anytime, I can get alerts if there is an intruder or birds lol, it records when there is motion on the included memory chip. I am blown away at how good it is. I also have another fixed size camera from REOLink inside the boat to see the control panel. That one has been solid as well. I cannot say enough about REOLink!
review_text_5: This is a fantastic camera. The support if awesome too. It took a while to figure things out, but be patient and you may. I found Speedtalk the best sim card provider by far. $8 + $8 per month for 1 GB, which seem to be enough to check camera 2-3 times a day and download some clips here and there. Must have cell reception. GSM, I believe, like T mobile. Do your research please for your situation. Besides catching a thief, I've seen Fox, Coyote and other interesting critters. I like that it has almost 180 sweep and up/down. Solar. Incredible.

review_header_1: Great product; but investigate the different models before you buy !
review_header_2: For those using "mesh" networks like EERO, YOU MUST DO THIS or it will NOT WORK...
review_header_3: High Quality and easy to install / use security cam
review_header_4: Great cam and customer support. See UPDATE
review_text_1: There are four different versions of the Ring Light/Cameras. They are: 1. Ring Spotlight Battery Cam ($160), 2. Ring Spotlight Wired Cam ($160), 3. Ring Spotlight Mount Cam ($249) and 4. Ring Floodlight Cam ($249). I currently have three (3) of the Floodlight Cameras installed in my home. Excellent performance on all three. Never had one single problem and their customer support is always there if assistance was needed. I needed a fourth camera to be installed over my front entryway and I ordered the Spotlight Mount Cam because I wanted a unit that was a little smaller. Plus I didn't want to have to deal with batteries (You know when they're going to fail - just when you need them) and I wanted to mount this to a junction box and have no exposed wires. Well that was MY mistake. The thing that I did not know is that the "Spotlight" cams do not have the same capabilities of the "Floodlight" cams. Here are just a few things that are different with the Spotlight Cam: 1. Reduced light output and coverage, 2. No ability to set it for "automatic dusk to dawn" lighting, 3. The lights should not be left on for more then 30 minutes and 4. Reduced night vision capability and resolution. Why pay the same price ($249 for both the Spotlight Mount and the Floodlight models) and get "less" capability ?????Ring's customer service was very willing to assist me in obtaining a replacement. The Spotlight cam was replaced with another Floodlight Cam. Slightly larger in size, but overall a much more capable light/camera system and is working flawlessly. THANK YOU RING FOR YOUR SUPPORT!
review_text_2: When the Ring Pro camera sees the EERO Pro mesh router (likely at full strength), it will ask for your Wi-Fi password during set up and unfortunately, after you ENTER IT PROPERLY, it does not connect?!? The Ring Pro camera "thinks" you have entered the wrong password, via their app setup, when...THAT IS NOT THE CASE. Then the camera goes from a flashing blue light to a flashing red light...BAD! Ring Tech told me to return the camera because they too thought it was defective.After I got my replacement camera, the same thing happened again. I was pulling my hair out. To verify the Ring Pro camera was working properly, I temporarily hooked the camera to my iPad hot spot and it logged on and worked perfectly! So, I eliminated that the camera was defective itself.What happens is that the EERO Pro mesh system is trying to connect via 5.2 or 5.8 Ghz ONLY!! The Ring Pro camera only operates at 2.4., even though EERO Pro does operate at 2.4 GHz. The mesh system did NOT want to change because the signal strength to the unit was "excellent" as it was less than 25 feet away from one of the EERO pods.This time, I walked my iPhone (with the app) about a good 75-80 feet away from the EERO PRO mesh system to "force" the EERO to switch down to the 2.4 GHz band, before entering my Wi-Fi password...and THEN IT WORKED!Again...take your phone, with the Ring app, and walk a good distance AWAY from the EERO Pro mesh system to FORCE IT to connect at 2.4 GHz!! Ring support did not know about this. EERO support was baffled. But now they both know! Do this or you will want to return this camera. Now it works great!
review_text_3: This is my second Ring Security Cam, I already have a Ring Video Doorbell 2 in use. Installed the new Ring Spotlight Cam Mount HD without any problems, Ring provides everything you need with this cam, instructions, tools and lots of different screws for different install situations. Installation was a breeze, love the fact Ring is now offering this hardwired model. Also setup was a breeze, firmware got updated instantly, everything works as it should, I have a strong Wi-Fi connection to my Asus ROG Rapture GT-AC5300 router. Video is of high quality (HD) with a very wide angle which I appreciate. One reviewer mentioned it would be nice if there were a possibility to permanently turn the spotlight off, I would support this request because I maybe want to install another Ring Cam in the back porch pool area and here I would not want the light going on and off all the time when I am in the pool area. I can highly recommend this cam, looks like it is made of very high quality materials, works great, happy camper here.
review_text_4: Wired to new floodlight as described on page 42 of the manual. Which basically operates external lights up to 150 watts. 2 different cameras did not operate the lights. They do operate before setup. Once firmware is downloaded, they do not work. Going to return and try another set of cameras.UPDATE: Ring support contacted me about the firmware problem. They have corrected the problem with the external lights. Everything works great. The extra lighting using the external lights illuminated a larger area of the yard. The Ring support was great in resolving this issue. I recommend this cam for anyone wanting to incorporate a cam on existing eve mounted lights.
review_text_5: We bought this after using the Ring Doorbell and seeing how great the doorbell was, we figured this would work just as well. IT DOES!! It's very convenient to see who is meandering around my yard when I'm both home and away. One super cool thing about all the Ring products is the integration with my Apple Watch and iPhone. They work seamlessly together which is very convenient if I don't have my phone nearby. I highly recommend all of the Ring products. The customer service is great too. Always available to answer questions or help with any of their products. In fact, we are adding cameras to the back of our house now. It's not very often that a company maintains its integrity after being purchased by a larger company. Usually that is when customer service begins to suffer and product quality diminishes. Not with RING. I have not seen any of that.

review_text_1: I‚Äôm a Blink XT user with three cameras on the exterior of my home. The set up of the mini was FAR EASIER than the outside cams. I had this thing set up in less than 5 minutes. Picture is good. Sound is LOUD which is what I was looking for.The app however needs some work to support this style of camera. The app works decently for the BlinkXT cameras and functionality, which is motion for most users. As in you get a notification that there is motion, it records, and you watch the recording or live as you please. but it is clunky to get into the Blink Mini for the purpose of continuous viewing which is my intention for this camera, like a baby monitor. Like many other Americans now working from home with a full house of kids, I wanted to use this to assist with keeping an eye on the kids as I worked and record those cute moments. I wanted to use this to visualize a blind spot that I can‚Äôt see from the office. I tried mounting it from the ceiling and realized you can‚Äôt rotate the video. Mounting on the wall was a little problematic, I couldn‚Äôt quite get the right angle needed.Another quirk to the app is if you switch to another app and then come back to the Blink app, you have to hit the play button to resume viewing.All in all, these are minor issues specific to my use of the camera which is why I have it five stars anyway.Hey amazon/Blink, it would be an awesome feature if you‚Äôd allow the integration of this camera with Alexa so we can ‚Äúdrop in‚Äù and talk through the Echo Dot. Just saying.
review_text_2: I love this lil camera!! Easy to install! Only took 5 min and it works great!! Highly recommend this!!
review_text_3: Great price and product. Connected very easily to my existing Blink system. I am not happy with having to pay for storage after trial ends.
review_text_4: This is a great little camera monitor. Pros: easy set up, easily managed with your smart phone, clear image quality with motion detection. Can be set up to arm and record at any time. I bought this to use in my master bedroom by my desk where I keep sensitive information.Cons: if you are using it with another Blink product and you arm 24/7 then the other Blink unit also needs to be armed which is an issue because my other unit uses 2 AA batteries. There is no timer on the app to set up a time to arm which would by useful because I sometimes forget to arm at night. It has good night vision quality. It needs to be plugged in so is a problem if you put it in a place (i.e. bedroom closet) if there is no outlet. Because of this, it is difficult to make the camera more hidden (if you are looking for a nanny camera for example).Overall it is easy to use and I would recommend it for a basic home security camera.
review_text_5: SO...I rarely write reviews but was so amazed by this camera I wanted to let others know. I bought the camera after using the Ring indoor camera for twice the price and it made a constant clicking noise with the filter adjustment to light in the room that was a known issue Ring told me and not a defect. I've tried all the other brands out there WYZE, etc and disappointed with all. Then I tried the Blink Mini which I thought was a good price. The setup was a breeze, up and running in 30 seconds. The app is responsive and user friendly. My wifi is sloooow but it still loaded a 1080p HD quality view w hen I accessed it from my mobile app. My favorite feature is the night vision. All my previous cameras just showed a dark room or shadows but this camera shows a clear and crisp picture in pitch black darkness. Very pleased with this and you can't go wrong here. My 2 year indoor camera journey has come to an end here.

review_header_2: Read this if you're having connection or audio/video/notification difficulties  ***UPDATED at end***
review_header_4: Works okay so far but the Windows apps doesn't work at all
review_header_5: Bad Reviews = People not Reading Instructions
review_text_1: I have a much better security camera system for my home's exterior but thought I might try one of these cams indoors since I have the Ring alarm system and a Ring Doorbell already. I made the silly mistake, I guess, of assuming there would be some kind of integration with other Ring products - there isn't. None. Not a single thing.It seems like common sense to me that they'd integrate in a couple of ways. I assumed that I'd be able to tell these cameras to only sense motion if the alarm was armed. Nope.I figured I could at least set it to detect motion when I wasn't in the house. Nope. There isn't even any kind of proximity setting for it to even know if you're home or not. They are not location aware in any way. The Ring alarm system isn't either, so I suppose I should have known better already.I also assumed that if my Ring alarm went off the cameras would automatically come on and start recording. Nope!The only motion option at all is to not alert you to motion during specific hours. Note, this doesn't stop motion detection during these hours, it only stops the alerts.Motion detection/recording is only an on or off thing... absolutely no options whatsoever.Annoyed by the lack of integration I still mounted the camera in my great room. I figured I try it for a few days and see how long the battery would actually last with motion recording on. This is a high traffic area so I wasn't holding my breath... and sure enough, after not even 1 full day the battery is down to 80%. This is with all the 'battery saving options' on. This was only a test as I don't actually want recording of any kind going on in my house while I'm home unless the alarm is armed or going off.With absolutely no options, no integration with Ring alarm and no settings to limit it's recording this thing is really only good for one thing; on demand video with no automatic recording. So, the thing is turned off now, doing nothing. I can still activate it from my phone to occasionally check my house isn't burning down.Hopefully someday Ring will update the software and provide some common sense integration with it's other devices.This is all a shame as the build of the camera is quite good considering the low price as is the video quality. The audio isn't great but it never is on cameras of any kind.***UPDATE***Ring support reached out to me directly almost immediately after I posted my review (Good on them) and told me how to link the Alarm, somewhat, to the camera. You have to go into your Base Station settings, then linked devices, then you can set the cameras to record when the alarm goes off - but only then. Make sure you have the updated app that just came out to do this. I didn't. Again, the setting is in your base station, not in the cameras.This solved probably the biggest issue I had with the camera. The rest of my review is still accurate though per Ring support. Hopefully they'll add the other much needed features in the near future.***ANOTHER UPDATE***From Ring Support: "The Modes feature will be released in November and will allow you to have the option to record motion only if the Ring Alarm System is set to Away Mode". This will be a great update and should have been available on launch. I wonder if they are only just now thinking of it from all the negative feedback and reviews, but glad it's 'coming soon' either way.***ONE MORE UPDATE***Ring provided me early access to the 'Modes Feature' and I've been using it for the past few days. It resolves all the issues I had with the alarm integration. With modes you can set your cameras to only record when your alarm is set. They can all be set independently and act differently depending on if you have your alarm set to off, home, or away. For instance, you can set your exterior cameras to record when your alarm is set to home mode, but have your interior cameras are turned off. You can set your interior cameras to only record while in away mode, etc. etc. Or any combination. The cameras can now be set the same way motion and door sensors can. This is a great improvement. They haven't told me exactly when this feature will be made public but have said it will be released 'by the end of the year'.I've increased the rating from 3 stars to 5. This software update really has resolved every issue I had with the cameras. I've now ordered and installed an additional 6 for my home.***LAST UPDATE***Having the modes features and my cameras set to only pop on and record during an alarm event (which is rare) and be off at all other times, I've had 2 months to evaluate battery life, almost exactly 60 days now. All my cameras were down to below 10% battery level when I checked them last night. Given the rate of battery drain I had expected them to last 3 months - though 2+ still isn't bad. I have two external cameras on my entry gates outside with the solar panel add-on, they stay fully charged at all times even though it's pretty much been non-stop dark and cloudy days here since installation. They are set to record all motion and since they point at a street they record events dozens of times per day... so if you're thinking of getting the solar panels for outdoor use, I highly recommend them.
review_text_2: Before I start my revised review, let me state that there's been a lot of news lately about people hacking into Ring cameras, but this only happens when someone installs a new camera and doesn't update the default username and password (or has an extremely weak password which is easy for a hacker to guess). This is like leaving your front door open while on vacation. Your camera is sending and receiving signals over a wireless network. Anyone within range of the signal can potentially be a threat if you don't have good encryption (username and good password) set up on your camera. There's no logical reason for a Ring owner to not do this. Ring even stresses changing the default settings during the initial setup process. Bottom line, don't blame the car manufacturer if you leave the keys in your car and it gets stolen.----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Recently, I wrote a rather scathing 1 star review about the problems I was having with my new Ring Stick Up Wireless Battery Cam. I'm no stranger to wireless cams, having 10 hooked up and running seamlessly on another network as I write this, but I was totally frustrated with the connection reliability, not only with my two upper end cellphones, but also on my Galaxy Tab and Amazon Show. More times than not, the software wouldn't connect with the camera but when it did, the video was choppy. Notifications were also hit and miss. I have a great wireless mesh router system throughout the house, so after doing all the troubleshooting I could think of, I assumed it was due to faulty hardware or software. I gave up and started the return process through Amazon. It was a new product after all and new products sometimes are really buggy. Plus, I read other negative reviews which seemed to justify my thoughts and actions.Then I got an email from a gentleman from Ring saying he read my review and asked if I'd be willing to let him help troubleshoot my issues with me. Although I had already started the return process, I was willing. It was refreshing to know Ring Customer Service was genuinely interested in troubleshooting possible defects in their newest product.Together, we isolated the issue within about 20 minutes. It turned out it wasn't the camera or software after all.Anyone having connection issues should do what he advised me to do. Open up the Ring app and click on the 3 little dots to the upper right of the camera screenshot, then select settings. From there go to Device Health and check the signal strength. Although I had a good mesh hub (inside) within 10 feet of my camera (mounted outside), my signal strength was RSSI -64. He stated that the signal was so weak it was on the cusp of what is needed for the camera to even minimally operate. This prompted me to reboot my wireless mesh system and reset/reconnect the camera. When it came back online, my signal strength went to -39, a vast improvement.A quick check of all of my devices showed the camera and software working flawlessly. Hat's off to Ring.Anyone who may be having connection or audio/video/notification difficulties, check your signal strength to the camera via the Ring software, even if your router is close by. You just might be surprised.***UPDATE***Camera (and software) is still working flawlessly on all devices.Ring has now updated their Windows 10 desktop app (which previously didn't work with the new wireless battery cams) and it works flawlessly as well.Observations.Notifications on my phone, Tab and Amazon devices (Show, Echo, Dot) are almost instantaneous. Alexa says "Someone is at your front door." Very cool.I bought an extra battery, but it looks like it'll be at least a few months before I need to swap it out, even with the intensive testing I've done on the Stick Up Cam. Battery life seems excellent.I have one zone blocked out and that seems to work fine as well. I also have it mounted a couple of feet above and to the left of my front door, tilting downward at an angle. Even though residential traffic is visible in the field of view, I've not gotten one trigger due to street activity. The motion sensor is triggered by anything coming into the bottom half of it's field of view. From the time someone triggers the motion sensor until the time I'm aware of it is 1-2 seconds. That's about as close to real time as you can get. It's not given me a false alarm even once.Telling my Amazon Show to "(Alexa), show front door cam" takes about 5 seconds to complete.I can also watch triggered video clips and get a live feed while away from home without any extra setup to my network. It's totally automatic.Because of the customer service I received from Ring and the fact the product is much better than I originally thought, I will be expanding my Ring family soon.
review_text_3: Had the camera up and running in less than ten minutes. Excellent quality picture. Hooking up to the solar panel when installing, this way battery is always charged. Received mounting hardware, camera has been installed.
review_text_4: Installed 2 of these outside my house in about 20 minutes. Mounted one above my garage and the other near my front door. The video quality is pretty good. Not facial recognition software good but good enough for a good description of people if needed. I used the mounts that came will the camera and scanned the QR code for setup. Not sure why people couldn't set up zones. It is part of the setup unless you skip over the steps. I do agree with most reviews that the notifications are spotty. Took my trash out and the one by the garage only recorded me going to the side of the house and the one by the front door only recorded me coming back. A neighbor walked by this morning and it started recording after they walked by and were down the street. Pic attached. Went outside again and the both cameras picked me up as I would have expected. I will adjust the camera and reset the zones to see if that helps. They are my first Ring cameras so there may be fine tuning on my part that is needed. Will update this as the days go by.Windows 10 app logs me in but says I don't have any cameras set up. Tried on a PC and 2 laptops. Please fix!!Phone apps are pretty good so far. (Samsung note 9)Updating to 5 Stars.....After adjusting my zones and motion settings I was able to get the results I needed. At one point the wind blew leaves across my driveway and my sensor went off. After fine tuning I see no issues with the camera and its performance. It is by far better than other cameras I have purchase over the years and after comparing subscriptions from other companies $10 a month or $100 is a deal.
review_text_5: Don‚Äôt let any negative reviews influence your decision to buy these cameras. The negative reviews are from people who have not read the instructions or just have no idea how a security camera works. I monitor 16 security cameras where I work so I have a lot of experience with them. I bought the Ring Stick up camera and the solar charger for it as well. They both work great. I bought two more a week later. Now a month later I have no issues with battery power loss of any kind. Just set your zones to cover what you want. Don‚Äôt put motion sensor on full or you will catch bugs and falling leaves. I set my sensitivity in the middle. The image quality day and night is pretty good. You can also look at your cameras from a computer as well as your phone. You don‚Äôt need an Alexa to use these. The microphone works well too. Overall I would highly recommend these if you just read and understand the instructions and how they work which is very simple and easy.MD in SC 1-1-21

review_header_1: great quality camera with annoying defect - updated: now working flawlessly - fantastic Eufy support
review_header_3: Eufy Outdoor Camera Pro: The Perfect Arlo Crushing Outdoor Camera
review_header_4: I like the easy set up and features
review_text_1: Great camera with excellent image quality (better than my commercial grade high quality recent 4MP NVR camera system where each camera costs 4 times as much than this Eufy), night vision, very wide field of view and very easy to mount with a very strong magnet (see the downside of this below) and long USB cable. During night, the spotlight is responsive and provides color night vision throughout my entire drive way. 2 way audio is also a great feature. The camera seems to be well weather sealed. Notifications are instant and it has so far a 100% person detection rate. There is a beta pet detection setting, which does not work for detecting cats in my experience - I do not know about larger pets. The camera worked great for a week or so and then started to behave weird: Every morning it remains stuck in a black and white mode, where it does not trigger any motion recordings and does not send any notifications. I just noticed it as I had people in the drive way, but did not get any notification. The video stream is still real-time, though - just in b/w. It happens sometimes during night and the only work around so far is to restart the camera. This happened now for several consecutive days. It is a camera issue, as I notice the same behavior on 2 iPhones and 2 iPads and none of my Indoor Cam 2k show this issue. Resetting is a strain, as I have to pull out a long ladder to get to the camera and to the reset button, which then requires to re-adjust the camera due to the magnetic mount, which would not be necessary with a fixed mount (this should really be provided in the box). There should also be a software option for resetting it rather than the physical button on the camera, where you also have to open the weather seal for the microSD card, which is not great when done on a frequent basis. I hope this will - and can be fixed soon. Right now it is completely useless for detecting intruders until, this is fixed. Therefore my generous 3 star rating, which I will have to drop to 1 star, if this cannot be fixed. Otherwise this is a solid 5 star device.UPDATE:Eufy technical support was very responsive replying within hours to my inquiry. They asked to send in video for analysis and within days shipped me a new camera for testing. However, this one had the same flaw and technical support pointed to a potential firmware issue and provided a new firmware 1.0.2.6 within 3 days! This one corrected this odd behavior and now the camera works perfectly. They even let me keep the original camera as well. I highly recommend this camera and should you require any technical help, the responsiveness of Eufy is just fantastic!
review_text_2: I recently bought the 2 wireless eufy cameras and they were absolutely horrible. The motion detectors would rarely detect and the battery hit 50% about 2 weeks after. I know Eufy's motion detection isn't bad because I have the indoor wired camera as well so I decided to try out the outdoor wired camera as well and no regrets.The camera detects human motion at a 100% rate!My only qualm is the way the way they manufactured the mount. It's magnetic and the cable is in the way to angle it the way I want..
review_text_3: I've longed for a eufy outdoor camera that was an all-in-one unit to compete with the Arlo Pro 4 and this unit is it! The camera is packaged well and setup is easy. The fact that they include the micro SD card and that the unit works without a base station is genius. The camera works via your wifi and uses AI on the unit to process all data and transfer that to the user via the app. Eliminating the battery for an always plugged in and on system is perfect for those with outdoor outlets. The value for the price is spot on. I am very happy with this product. Anyone interested in easy outdoor security with 24/7 recording, ability to go back in time, and receive motion alerts and recordings, should seriously consider this product.
review_text_4: It was a breeze to set up. A lot of good features in the app. I didn't like that it only has one way of mounting via the magnetic mount. They should had a screw in version so it is more secure. It is overpriced for what you get. It isn't that expensive to get certification for the ip rating. It would probably be a good price around $69.99.Will update on the next weeks.
review_text_5: The camera plugs into an outlet so there is none of the battery nonsense to fool with. The app works seamlessly and pulls both my Eufy doorbell and this camera up on the same screen. Notifications are quick, install was a breeze and it does a perfect job detecting motion. The only negative is the price.

review_header_2: So far every parts works great.
review_text_1: Absolutely the best $250 Ive spent in a long time. Stupid easy to install and setup, including the smartphone app.Picture is razor sharp.Installed my system with a dedicated power supply and custom length rg58 siamesed cables. Did not use any of the supplied wires or power adapters. Only used the DVR and cameras.Put the DVR and power supply in basement and ran all cables to them.Got a long HDMI cable and long USB cable so I can monitor and control everything from my nightstand while laying in bed.Everything works fantastic !!!
review_text_2: First, setup was not too bad, if you‚Äôre handy, it will be easy to install and program. Utilizing existing co-axial cables and stabilized power supply. One thing I really like about it is it comes with everything, so you can set it up directly without make additional trips to store for some cables/cords.* Images: The images displayed on the system are very clear and more remarkably. In a lower light environment they will switches to black and white. So the cameras apparently have very good light sensitivity.* View: These cameras have phenominal quality and the field of view is so much greater than my older cameras.I've only had this system for a couple of weeks, and don't even have all of the camera's connected yet (though I did test them). In a year, once I can speak to longevity, I will return to give an update to the product. So far, however, I'm very pleased.
review_text_3: I do not give out praise often; in fact, this is my first Product Review in 5+ years. But I absolutely had to share my experiences with Annke Tech Support as their level of assistance and patience and accommodation was nothing short of phenomenal. After initially emailing them, they evaluated my request and responded to me within 13 hours (time zone gap included) and said that Tech Support would reach out in 24 hours. They reached out in 2...just excellent. From there, they were extremely responsive to help me troubleshoot my issue and we emailed back and forth a few times. Eventually, THEY determined that email would not resolve the issue so we had a Remote Desktop Sharing session to efficiently find resolution. We lost connection at one point, and Tech Support even CALLED ME to make sure we were still able to proceed. About 30 minutes later, I'm all set and happily keeping their product. As I am sure many of you have experienced poor customer service at some point in your life, you can rest easy that this company cares about their product and customers. If a positive review on their customer service is not enough to convince you to buy....allow me to review their product.Summary ÔÉ® Customer Service is Unparalleled. Price is Excellent. Video Quality is Great. Setup is fairly straight-forward. Some improved/updated instructions would be beneficial, but manageable as is. Interface could be improved to enhance experience, but ok.I spent a decent amount of time reading product descriptions and reviews for Home Video Surveillance and simply could not find anything that matched the price or positive reviews. Sure, there are some eyebrow-raising comments in some of the reviews, but nothing truly concerning. Some folks are expecting too much out of Nightvision, in general. This system performs above its price point. Sure, there are $1,000+ systems out there that will outperform this product, but that's not what you are buying. This system is a great middle ground between buying one/two over-priced Nest or Ring cameras that are merely selling their name and buying a 'high-end' surveillance system, which is probably overkill for you home. If you really need a system like that, then you should probably consider moving to a better area. You are going to get enough product (8 cameras and a DVR and remote access) to satisfy almost everyone‚Äôs surveillance needs.The quick setup guide provided was fairly straight-forward. I was able to connect it to my Smartphone without issue, easy. Adding the SADP Tool to my networked laptop was a bit more effort. The link provided in the guide was not accurate / retired, so a quick search on Annke's website located the software then back to the guide to complete setup. Not the end of the world, just be patient. If you cannot find it, email them. My 'issue', which required Tech Support, was that remote connection via the Web was no longer supported, despite being included in the guide. While this was a bit deceiving and frustrating, Tech Support was able to find a work-around and use Port Forwarding to allow me the type of access I was interested in. Most people will probably not need this, but I prefer laptops over phones and tablets, so it was a deal-breaker for me if no resolution‚Ä¶plus I didn‚Äôt want to have to install the SADP Tool on all of my laptops (again, I may be abnormal as I have 4 laptops in my home, but just sharing my experiences). Thankfully, Annke was able to help.Other than that, just know that the SADP Tool, Web, and DVR (i.e. direct connection between DVR and Monitor) interfaces are not overly user-friendly, but with some tinkering, you get used to the buttons and how to use the system. Again, not that big of a deal when you consider what you are getting for the price.If you are debating between this product and a competitor, give Annke a shot knowing that they will take care of you if you need help.
review_text_4: Only had it up and running for a day but very happy with it. Very clear, night vision is much better then our old system that cost more than this one. The camera's are plastic, but they won't rust. Make sure you know right where you want them incase you need more wire. Our head of security approves also.
review_text_5: I bought this update security camera system for my store month ago after i lost some package. It.comes a few days later after i ordered. Great shipping speed. I installed it right away. It'a very easy to install and set up. The video quality is great. The images of video taken during the day and night are both very cleaer. It comes with 8√ó1080p hd camra heads and i can see every connor of my store when i seating in my office or home. I also installed two heads out front of the store. Don't need to worry about in the rain or snow cause they waterproof. Since i had them around my store i haven't lost any package in past month. As a small business owner i think it works perfect for me. Anywag This system is outstanding. Great price and Amazing product!

features: 1080P HD indoor, plug-in security camera with motion detection and two way audio that lets you monitor the inside of your home day and night.,Get alerts on your smartphone whenever motion is detected or customize motion detection zones so you can see what matters most.,Store events conveniently and securely in the cloud with a 30-day free trial of the Blink Subscription Plan or locally with the Sync Module 2 and a USB flash drive (USB sold separately).,See, hear, and speak to people and pets in your home on your smartphone with Blink Mini‚Äôs live view and two-way audio features (live view is not continuous).,Sets up in minutes ‚Äì just plug in the camera, connect it to wifi, and add it to your Blink app.,For additional ease of use, pair Blink Mini with a supported Alexa-enabled device to engage live view, and arm and disarm your camera, and more using just your voice.
name: Blink Mini ‚Äì Compact indoor plug-in smart security camera, 1080 HD video, night vision, motion detection, two-way audio, Works with Alexa ‚Äì 1 camera
review_header_1: Easy set up but app is lacking
review_header_2: Easy to install only took 5 min!
review_header_4: Easy set up and great image quality
review_text_1: I‚Äôm a Blink XT user with three cameras on the exterior of my home. The set up of the mini was FAR EASIER than the outside cams. I had this thing set up in less than 5 minutes. Picture is good. Sound is LOUD which is what I was looking for.The app however needs some work to support this style of camera. The app works decently for the BlinkXT cameras and functionality, which is motion for most users. As in you get a notification that there is motion, it records, and you watch the recording or live as you please. but it is clunky to get into the Blink Mini for the purpose of continuous viewing which is my intention for this camera, like a baby monitor. Like many other Americans now working from home with a full house of kids, I wanted to use this to assist with keeping an eye on the kids as I worked and record those cute moments. I wanted to use this to visualize a blind spot that I can‚Äôt see from the office. I tried mounting it from the ceiling and realized you can‚Äôt rotate the video. Mounting on the wall was a little problematic, I couldn‚Äôt quite get the right angle needed.Another quirk to the app is if you switch to another app and then come back to the Blink app, you have to hit the play button to resume viewing.All in all, these are minor issues specific to my use of the camera which is why I have it five stars anyway.Hey amazon/Blink, it would be an awesome feature if you‚Äôd allow the integration of this camera with Alexa so we can ‚Äúdrop in‚Äù and talk through the Echo Dot. Just saying.
review_text_2: I love this lil camera!! Easy to install! Only took 5 min and it works great!! Highly recommend this!!
review_text_3: Great price and product. Connected very easily to my existing Blink system. I am not happy with having to pay for storage after trial ends.
review_text_4: This is a great little camera monitor. Pros: easy set up, easily managed with your smart phone, clear image quality with motion detection. Can be set up to arm and record at any time. I bought this to use in my master bedroom by my desk where I keep sensitive information.Cons: if you are using it with another Blink product and you arm 24/7 then the other Blink unit also needs to be armed which is an issue because my other unit uses 2 AA batteries. There is no timer on the app to set up a time to arm which would by useful because I sometimes forget to arm at night. It has good night vision quality. It needs to be plugged in so is a problem if you put it in a place (i.e. bedroom closet) if there is no outlet. Because of this, it is difficult to make the camera more hidden (if you are looking for a nanny camera for example).Overall it is easy to use and I would recommend it for a basic home security camera.
review_text_5: SO...I rarely write reviews but was so amazed by this camera I wanted to let others know. I bought the camera after using the Ring indoor camera for twice the price and it made a constant clicking noise with the filter adjustment to light in the room that was a known issue Ring told me and not a defect. I've tried all the other brands out there WYZE, etc and disappointed with all. Then I tried the Blink Mini which I thought was a good price. The setup was a breeze, up and running in 30 seconds. The app is responsive and user friendly. My wifi is sloooow but it still loaded a 1080p HD quality view w hen I accessed it from my mobile app. My favorite feature is the night vision. All my previous cameras just showed a dark room or shadows but this camera shows a clear and crisp picture in pitch black darkness. Very pleased with this and you can't go wrong here. My 2 year indoor camera journey has come to an end here.

features: Compact plug-in indoor camera that lets you see, hear and speak to people and pets from your phone, tablet, or select Echo device.,Watch over your entire home by connecting one or multiple Indoor Cams to all your Ring devices in the Ring app.,With a Ring Protect Plan (subscription sold separately), record all your videos, review what you missed for up to 60 days, and share videos and photos.,With Live View, you can check in on your home any time through the Ring app.,Easily setup your Indoor Cam by plugging into a standard outlet and connecting to Wi-Fi.,Place on a flat surface or mount to a wall with the versatile mounting bracket.,For added peace of mind, pair with Alexa to help you keep an eye on your home.
name: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
review_header_1: Small size and high quality camera
review_header_4: Excellent addition to the Ring lineup
review_header_5: Had issues but ring support was great!
review_text_2: For a while I have been using Ring cameras for the the exterior and Wyze cams for the interior on my house. With the new indoor cam I can now access all my cams from one app. To me the picture quality is great overall and especially in total darkness. Live view connection is a lot more stable than my Wyze cams. Alexa integration is a big plus, no need for third party hacks to complete routines. Because I already have Ring cameras it‚Äôs worth it to pay a little more over a Wyze cam.
review_text_3: In February, I noticed my ADHD medication ran out early. I‚Äôm very careful about taking it exactly as prescribed so it was strange that I had run out 10 days early. For reasons I won‚Äôt get into for this review, I suspected the property manager of my building was stealing it. Obviously that sounded crazy, but I couldn‚Äôt think of another explanation. A friend suggested a Ring camera, so I bought one never expecting anything to actually come of it. I put some antihistamines in my now empty pill bottle thinking no one would ever take them, set up the camera when it arrived, and felt more secure knowing it was there. Set up was simple so I figured worst case scenario, I was out a bit of money and I spent maybe 10 minutes setting it up.Fast forward a week later when I get a notification via the app that there was motion detected on my camera. I open up the recording and there she is, entering my apartment, going right for my decoy pills, taking them, and leaving. I immediately left work to get back home. I called the police who sent an officer. I showed him the video and he admitted that had I not had the video, he wouldn‚Äôt have believed me. I was able to quickly and easily send the video to the police and to the president of the company that owns my building. I also was able to download the video and get it uploaded so that I have copies of it as I go through the next few months as she (hopefully) gets brought to justice.I cannot emphasize how much this little camera has helped me. I would not have caught my burglar otherwise. Because of it, they were able to look up records of who used their electronic key to access my apartment and she had been in there 7 times over the month prior. This would have gone on for longer and who knows if it would have resulted in harm to myself or my cat had I not caught her. This camera has given some of the sense of security she stole from me back and stopped a nightmare situation from worsening. I will still be recovering from this for long time and I am hoping she is brought to justice, but I cannot thank Ring enough for helping me secure my home from an unexpected source of danger.
review_text_4: This camera for $60 is a solid deal. I have had a Ring Pro and Ring floodlight camera for about a year.This indoor camera can either be put on a surface or mounted on the wall.What's in the box?1. Ring floodlight camera2. Proprietary AC adapter3. Mounting accessories4. Manuals.The included mounting equipment is a nice touch. Although I'm not going to mount mine.1080P video is solid. Covers a wider area.The two way audio is good to check up on Pets, senior citizens,etc. The sound comes through very clear from the mobile app. Two way talk is definitely a nice addition to this camera.The footprint of this camera is small. A blue light comes on when it detects motion.In order to have saved footage for up to 60 days, you have to pay a fee. $3 a month but a little lower if you get the annual subscription.If you have a bunch of ring devices you can have saved footage as well other features for about $10 per month.Case in point, solid camera at the price point. Provides piece of mind for your home.

details: {'Product Dimensions': '2.83 x 4.06 x 2.83 inches', 'Item Weight': '13.1 ounces', 'ASIN': 'B07QKXM2D3', 'Item model number': 'Q5-B', 'Customer Reviews': '', 'Best Sellers Rank': '', 'Date First Available': '2019-04-11', 'Manufacturer': 'wansview'}
