review_header_1: Compact IP Camera! Easy to Install!
review_header_3: No DDNS option, but great customer support
review_text_1: I have plenty of IP cameras in my house. They are a combination of DLink, Wansview, Tenvis etc. I have to say my most durable ones are from Wansview. I've had some for as long as 2010! They simply give you the best bang for your buck. I hate to say it but the reason ALL of these IP cameras have a low rating is because of one thing. User error. I admit, I have an IT background and installing these are really easy for me. The new cloud feature couldn't be more easier to install. Even my mom could do it, (sorry mom LOL). Just download the app, make an account, show the QR code that shows up on your app to the camera. Super easy.This new Q5 is my favorite along with my other Wansview cam (top photo). It is very compact (see bottom right photo). It also has a microUSB port for power (left pic). I hope this review has helped you.
review_text_2: My review is based on the experience of using several IP cameras from different vendors over the past 4 years.Overall, the Wansview Q5 Cloud Camera performs very well and the initial setup / install is super easy and quick. With some of my other cameras, I sometimes spent hours (even days) in setting them up. I like the Q5 new form-factor which is nicer and much smaller than the previous Q3 camera. It feels well-built and I expect it to last for many years. The phone software can use some bells and whistles available from other competing IP cameras. That said, it is very intuitive and easy-to-use. In summary, I would recommend this camera because of its well-built hardware, functionalities, and price. Below are some more details:Pros:+ Setting up the first time is quick (5 min for both software and hardware) with their easy-to-follow instructions.+ Camera hardware is well-built, good-looking, and small in size which I like.+ The wide-angle lens is the best I‚Äôve seen in terms of clarity and coverage.+ Crisp & clear images and videos - day and night (see images attached).+ Excellent audio & mic (considering the small-size factor), definitely better than that on their Q3 and K3 cameras, and other cameras I‚Äôve owned.+ The Wansview cloud android phone app is easy to set up, easy to use and to configure.+ Upon detecting motions, the camera sends me alerts on my phone, and 10-sec video clips in the mobile app. This a new feature. Nicely done Wansview!Cons:- No audio-detection alert capability (only motion-detection).- Viewing saved images, they don‚Äôt auto-rotate along with the phone‚Äôs rotating to a horizontal orientation (from a vertical orientation)- It would be nice if the phone app‚Äôs white background can be manually set to a darker theme like black.- It would be nice if the multi-camera screen can be set to load as default upon logging in. Currently it requires an extra click.
review_text_3: Gave this camera to my dad. Here is his review:"Just got this new Q5 IPCam to add to my other Wansview IPCameras. First thing I noticed was the ease of setup.A couple of items to note:- Setup and operation are ONLY with WiFi. Plugged in LAN is not an option.- Your phone and Q5 will have to be in same 2.4GHz connection frequency. Q5 will only connect to 2.4GHz and your phone may be on a 5GHz spectrum, not gonna work. If your home WiFi shows two separate SSID‚Äôs for each frequency then it should be easy enough for you. I‚Äôve setup my WiFi router to use one SSID only for both frequencies, I had to go into my router setup and temporarily disable the 5GHz radio to force all devices I have to the lower frequency. I turned the 5GHz radio once the Q5 was completely setup.- Like the fact they‚Äôre finally using micro USB connector from DC supply to IPCam and not the old 3.5mm plug in type- The Q5 will not work with the previous Wansview IPCam App but instead you‚Äôll need to download their new Wansview Cloud App which is fine as well.- Image sample looking from my home office window is not that bad. I‚Äôm sure I can clean it up some more later.- No DDNS support. Camera will only work using Wansview Cloud App. I use a third party IPCam viewer App to use on all my other IPCameras (Foscam, Amcrest and Wansview), no luck on this one or at least not yet. Hopefully they will upgrade it for future capability.- The new Wansview Cloud App still need some work to refine minor UI issues particularly on the chat section.- I‚Äôm not a big fan of IPCam paid cloud subscription regardless who the service provider is. I‚Äôll continue using the memory card option on this camera. I could save all recording to my own cloud system if only DDNS is supported on these Q5 IPCamTechnical support either email or chat using the chat option on the App (even on Wechat!) was amazing. These guys are extremely helpful, particularly Simona!Will definitely order more again from them if only they can help on the DDNS option. Otherwise their customer support team‚Äôs ability is what pushed them to 5 stars."
review_text_5: I like it! I don‚Äôt bother with the ‚ÄòCloud Storage‚Äô and just use the short videos! I turn the notifications off because there are too many with me moving around back and forth all the time. But I find it handy to check on my Cat while I‚Äôm out, and when I‚Äôm out of town I‚Äôll turn the notifications back on while he‚Äôs at the pet sitters. Works for me!üëç********************************************UPDATE: TERRIBLY DISAPPOINTED!After a VERY short time, I discovered this camera obviously doesn‚Äôt work! I had a delivery person walk thru my home right in front of the camera, being in the kitchen talking for over a minute and walking back thru. It NEVER showed ANY motion at all!!! WOW! And here I thought I was going to have some security in this low income housing district I live in! Seeing as I‚Äôm on Social Security and don‚Äôt draw much, I have to send it back BEFORE I leave town for Thanksgiving. Bummer. REALLY DISAPPOINTED.ü•≤

review_header_3: Easy to install and works perfect.
review_header_4: Great image quality, value, and easy setup. NV works great as well short range.
review_text_2: This Camera sytem is better than I expetcted.1. This system include almost all your need for a secutity camera system, you just need buy a Hard disk drive.2. All the cameras can be adjusted easily. You can easily get the best angle and fix it.3. App is easily to install.4. The viedos are clear.I also have some issues when I install this system1. I install the App easily, but I can't add the DVR at first. It's status always is "offline". I rebooted the DVR and add DVR again, then it worked.2. When I using the App, I saw the video is not clear enough. After I change the view form Basic to HD, it turned better resolution.Anyway, this system is a good choice for your home security.
review_text_3: I got this product few month ago. I lost the instruction and contacted the seller. They are very professional, sent me a copy by email next day. It‚Äôs very easy to install, you don‚Äôt need a professional worker to help unless you will need to organize the cords inside and outside the house. The instruction is easy to understand. And the camera work perfectly. I took two pics, the first one is with light on, second one is light off. Honestly it works better in the dark compare to dim environments. I haven‚Äôt try the app but so far I‚Äôm very satisfied with everything. Definitely recommend.
review_text_4: I'll be honest, I wasnt expecting much at all with this camera system, but wow am I suprised. Picture quality is as good as our night owl system costing much more, night vision is very clear even in low light or no light situations. This system doesnt come with a hard drive to record, but isnt very much to get one and install. It zooms very well on any frame, and has audio as well, but the audio quality seems a little staticy. Hookup is super easy, if you have a large house, definitely spring for the extra cables, you may need them. Otherwise you definitely wont be upset with this system if you want a security system on a budget. Good stuff
review_text_5: Wow. It's a nice security setup for the money. $90 for 4 cameras and a DVR. The DVR is very responsive and boots up quickly. Put in your own hard drive and you're good to go. The phone application works fine. You have to connect to a router for internet via lan network cable. I posted a photo of the camera on an old PC monitor. And a screenshot of my phone as well. If you want a nice usable cheap solution for security with a little installation work then buy this unit. It even comes with it's own USB mouse.

review_header_2: Saving partial video from recordings is EASY!
review_text_1: After some research I found that Reolink ticked all the boxes and at a reasonable price.The product came well boxed and in quick timeI tested the product before installation and all worked perfectlyInstallation was relatively easy once a bit of planning had been done regarding the placement of the cameras and the runs for the connecting cableOnce connected and setup via the wizard all worked with no problemsThe Client was installed on my windows PC and the app downloaded from the app store ‚Äì again both were easy to install and setup and worked first timeI‚Äôve not had to contact Reolink support directly but have found all the information from their support pages and FAQ sectionAll in all I am impressed with the build quality and the way the system works.
review_text_2: Very good system. I'm sharing steps to save partial video from recordings - Windows Reolink Client:Open Windows Client . . .1. Select 'Playback' Tab.2. Click 'Camera icon' to display all cameras.3. Select a camera, ex: Channel01.4. Select Date of the recordings.5. Select the Cut / Scissor icon, find it in the recording.6. Move Scissor icon to desired Time beginning.7. Move Scissor icon to desired Time ending.8. Click Save icon - it should start saving.
review_text_3: So am I have had this system since 14th of december and I'm pretty excited about it. I pre-ran/planned for this camera system so I didnt have run ethernet.The picture quality of the 4mp cameras is perfect for what I need, and better then what I wad expecting based on reviews (see my attached picture)I love this system it is easy enough to use.My one con is the user interface on the NVR itself kind of sucks, but if connected to a network with a PC using the client software simplifies everythingI highly recommend this if starting out a security camera system.
review_text_4: Great camera system. Cameras can be viewed at the base unit, on a computer app, or a mobile app. Mobile app works remotely - even over cellular data. Most features in the system can be configured from any of those places.Lots of things can be configured - sensitivity, detection zones, schedules, notification types (email, push, etc)The system includes all screws, mounting templates, CAT5e cable. It's ready to go. Nice looking cameras - my wife complains that they don't look menacing enough. lolI have couple minor quibbles.- They send ethernet cables, and waterproof caps for the ethernet cables, but to use them, you have to take the end off the cable and recrimp it.- The cable coming from the camera is split into the ethernet jack, a power jack, and a reset button. You can waterproof the ethernet, but not the rest. It's a lot of cable that has to be put somewhere. It won't fit into the camera base.- The base of the round camera is *almost* the same size as a round utility box used for ceiling fans. Almost. But it's not. The screw holes don't line up.- The camera is in a ball, there's a socket/cover that goes over it. Unfortunately, in some orientations, the microphone hole is covered by the socket.
review_text_5: After a few vehicles break ins recently we decided to invest in a video system. We researched many units and decided on the Reolink.The kit came in packaged nice and tight so the pieces were not rattling around. The system came with four network cables, and two of them were shorter than necessary runs we needed. So we opted to run our own network cables and tip them to network standard 568B. After running all cables we mounted the dome cameras, and installation was easy. We followed the instructions and used the mounting templates and all cables are hidden in the eaves so the mount looks very clean.We installed the application on both our phones and our computers with no problems, and after creating our accounts we were in business. I suggest you play with the options so you can curtail the recording features to your liking.The picture quality at both day and night are clear and pictures can be zoomed in through the app to capture a specific image within the frame. The play back video is broken down into segments so you can search specific times without viewing the entire recording to find your subject. It‚Äôs been a month since installed it and we are extremely satisfied with the Reolink.Pros:Network cables are made for you.Easy to install cameras.Clean looking finished product and network cables are hidden.Easy to program.Application is easy to navigate.Crisp video and pictures.Time frame blocks for easier research.Cons:The network cables maybe too short so you might have to run and tip your own cables, unless you find a central location in your house to place the unit.There is an annoying beeping sound that goes off when the camera picks up motion. This drove us crazy and we had to contact Reolink on how to turn it off. You have to navigate to that field on every camera to disable the beep.

review_header_2: They were good enough to catch a theif.
review_text_1: I installed the Reolink NVR package with eight cameras-- then added six more a la carte, including one WiFi camera for an area where we couldn't run Cat 5e cable.Instead of a home run from each camera back to the NVR, I bought four TP-Link PoE switches (great product) and connected the cameras in clusters of 3, 4 and 6 cameras each. A couple of cameras closest to the NVR are on a home run. Those cameras connect to two of the PoE jacks in the back of the NVR and the rest come in on a single LAN jack, which includes the one WiFi camera. It works great.There is almost no documentation included with the products so I went to the Reolink website. It's unbelievably bad...as if it's been written with Google translate. The system is pretty much plug-and-play, but if you run into any issues you're kind of on your own to figure it out. Suggestion for Reolink: You've created a nice product; spend a few bucks and hire an English-speaking editor to clean up your website. Example: One of your staff contributors said sharing cameras via a switch is a great solution-- another said it's not recommended for more than two cameras. I've got six cameras coming in on one switch at full resolution and they look great.I've revised my original four-star review to five stars because the equipment is so good and everything works well once it's set up properly.
review_text_3: Bought the Reolink 16 channel NVR and its pretty much a plug and play operation. The night vision is more clear than I expected and the daytime 5MP is a very sharp imageMy NVR worked flawlessly for 6 months, then I had a problem cause it wouldn't boot up properly. I was very skeptical cause the only way to contact Customer service is through "e-mail only" So I had very little expectation of getting any help..... But they always responded promptly and there was messages from them the next morning when I checked. After a couple of messages............... They 100% resolved my problems to my full satisfaction.When I expand my security system at my warehouses .For sure Ill purchase Reolink equipment again.............. Its good equipment but what really stands out to me is the "excellent customer service" and their desire to solve my issues (even though the contact is thru email) Its a reliable company and based on my experience I would recommend them 100%As a result of the cameras I was able to catch two men in the act of breaking and entering and stealing. and what satisfaction !!!
review_text_4: We've now had this system on our business for 2 years. Never have we had a problem with any portion of this system... it's quite actually been a plug & play operation for us. The install was the toughest job, and only then because we were building our own cables to accommodate exterior applications (UV/buriable outdoor cable) and very long/difficult cable pulls between stories and rooms of our building. Our cameras have now experienced two very cold winters in snow and ice, but most commonly see rain (in OR. state) with a few short months of good sunshine. They have all worked flawlessly. No complaints. The night vision is quite impressive on even just the RLC410 units. We've also got an RLC423, RLC511, and a few others. Each camera has performed admirably. All thumbs up to the folks at Reolink for producing such an affordable product that is also incredibly well built and versatile.My only ONLY grip is that when/if you wish to speak to a customer support person on the phone and ask direct questions in real time... there doesn't seem to be a way to pull that off. Instead its a string of email Q&A with their support staff that can drag on for days to answer one otherwise simple question.On the plus side... their staff is very helpful, though it's clear that English isn't their native tongue. Some of the replies are kinda cryptic and some of my questions need to be asked in another fashion, in order to be addressed. But I'm not hating. Just wishing I could actually speak to some guy named chuck that sounds just like I do.
review_text_5: The easiest software I have ever had the pleasure of working with. I have installed several systems from different manufacturers. I won't get into the name dropping here but from a system installer perspective, Reolink has very solid and easy to follow software. The hardware is just as impressive. I installed 12 cameras at my house without any issues. The attached picture really does not show the amount of detail these cameras display. The attached picture is a screenshot from my phone. I have had them up and running for 2-weeks now with no problems. As others have mentioned the motion detection is somewhat sensitive, but I would prefer this to be the case. The night viewing is impressive with great black and white clarity. The phone app (Android for me) is just as well thought out as the NVR software. I would not have any problem recommending Reolink to anyone that needs a IP camera system.

review_header_1: Great, Cheap CCTV System. Still don't know if they sell footage to China
review_header_2: Protect what you have worked hard for!
review_header_3: Don't be afraid of the price point! Quality product
review_text_1: I am highly privacy driven both in public and in cyberspace. The system works great. The interface is pretty easy to use. Great 1080p picture. Great night vision. I went with hardwired cameras due to their lack of vulnerability to cyber threats. However, the DVR does have an ethernet connection and there is an app you can use to monitor the system. I will continue exploring the cyber vulnerabilities of this system to ensure it does not sell info or footage to a third party. The only gripe I have is that the motion detection is pretty touchy, even at the lowest sensitivity level. One bug flying in front of it and I'll get a notice. I also noticed that if a car drives fast enough in front of my residence, I still get a motion detection notice even though I have removed that area from my camera's detection grid. For the money, I can't complain. Better than paying ADT $40/month to tell me my dog tripped the alarm. Be prepared for a hard day in the attic or crawl space to install, that's the price you pay for hardwired systems.
review_text_2: Our peaceful safe neighborhood has recently become a target for crime. Houses and cars have been broken into almost daily. So we decided to purchase a security system before we were hit. This was our 1st ever security camera purchase. I did not know anything about how to pick one so I did a lot of research and eventually decided on this one. We got the 8camera and 500gb hard drive.It arrived fast and great packaging.Hookup was a bit challenging and time consuming (maybe because this was our 1st) but took a while to get the cords ran. So patience is a plus for all brands I would assume not just this one. But soon that time consuming part was worth it. The picture is crystal clear even in pitch dark. We. Couldn't believe how good it was in night vision. Daytime is just as clear. We have it hooked up to a computer screen that was not being used and its perfect. We have recommended it to everyone . great system, crystal clear pictures and good customer service.Luckily,we have not caught anyone trying to break in our stuff that we have worked hard for many years to get. But if we do we will be ready.Although we have not caught burglars we have caught wildlife on camera. We live in the country/woods type of area and have seen our daily visit from our neighborhood bear as well as raccoon and opposums. I am attaching a pic of the night vision and one of our bear sightings. We only have up 5 of the cameras right now. The pictures are pictures of the screen with my phone but still pretty good quality.
review_text_3: Better than expected! Received it on 5-17-17 hooked it up and the clarity is more than I need. Also love the night vision , also very clear. Was Leary because of the price point but after reading a majority of the feed back I purchased it. Glad I did!
review_text_4: Absolutely worth the money. I‚Äôve had a different swann system and that hard drive fried after one singular storm... this system has gone through several power surges, storms, and a tornado. It‚Äôs still kicking. I was able to use those 4 swann cameras with this device for a total of 8, just waiting to find the perfect spot for the last camera. It‚Äôs perfect. Easy to set up and use. The app was also easy to set up. Downside is that every time the internet or power goes out you have to reconnect the system to the app, but it is what it is. Not a big deal. I did give the night vision a 4 star because I wish it was just a tad bit clearer. The app has a feature that you can take screen shots and videos of recordings. You can go back almost two weeks. The zoom is incredible. Overall, I‚Äôd recommend this to everyone.
review_text_5: I recently got this set-up after attempting a cheaper IP wireless camera. For my needs, the IP camera was a wash and difficult to set up and use. I decided to bite the bullet and spend a little more for this system. I do not regret it one bit! The set up is relatively easy, although wires are almost always a pain. After testing the system, I installed 3 of the 4 cameras. The included cables are more than generous in length. Although the cameras are waterproof, the connections are not, so for the one camera that isn't under the roof line, I did have to get some marine quality heat shrink wrap and a heat gun. All in all, once installed, the system is a breeze to set up. As it has a built in hard drive, it's so much easier than getting a cheaper system that requires an additional hard drive. I like that I can see, playback, and even record segments from my phone. In addition, the included DVR is easy to use and maneuver through. This is the 1st security system I ever installed, and I now feel like an expert after doing this myself. I would absolutely recommend this system, and I've actually already convinced a few neighbors to get the same system. I have a feeling I will be helping a few neighbors with their installations, now.

name: REOLINK 8CH 5MP Home Security Camera System, 4pcs Wired 5MP Outdoor PoE IP Cameras, 4K 8CH NVR with 2TB HDD for 24-7 Recording, RLK8-410B4-5MP
review_header_1: This Reolink Security System is All About the App
review_header_3: Very Good System with minor issues, hope they can address the issues with next firmware update
review_header_4: A great security system for anyone!
review_text_1: Short Version:For my money, this Reolink 5MP security system is the absolute best in its class. Installation and setup are quick and easy, and the image quality is crisp and sharp day or night. But it's the outstanding phone and tablet apps that separate this system from the rest of the field. Reolink clearly put a lot of thought into app functionality, and it pays off.Long Version:This was actually the second 5MP security system I bought to replace my aging Q-See 720P system. Unfortunately, the first system I bought (ZOSI) was crippled by a really poor phone app. Since I usually live-view or playback when I'm away from home, the app is a crucial component. After returning the ZOSI system, I did a lot more homework, including watching a number of YouTube videos. The Reolink app looked to have the best functionality and ease of use, so that's the system I chose.Installation was straightforward. This is a PoE (Power over Ethernet) system, so I used my existing BNC cables to pull the new CAT5 cables. I made up a plywood drill guide to accurately drill the screw and cable holes in my soffits. This is one improvement I could suggest: I wish Reolink would provide a molded plastic drill template, as this would make camera mounting easier. With the cameras installed and the CAT5 cables in place, all that's left is to hook up the NVR. Initial programming could hardly be easier - far more user-friendly than my old Q-See system.Last step was installing the apps on my phone and tablet, and this too was a snap, with a QR scan taking care of most of the process. There's also a Windows client that lets me view and control the system from my laptop.The phone app is excellent. On opening the app, it automatically goes to your most recent view. This is great, as I most often check the camera at my front door to look for packages when I'm away, or to see who's at the door before deciding whether to answer. To save bandwidth, the phone app view is medium-res, but there's a cool feature called "Clip" that gives you a high-res closeup you can drag and zoom around the overall view. Rotate your phone, and the view instantly switches to full-screen.The playback feature is also excellent. It's quick and easy to navigate to the time period you want to replay. Simply tap the date and then select the time block (the recordings are saved in roughly 1-hour blocks). Drag the slider to find the exact period you want to replay, then tap the camera icon for a still photo or the movie icon to start recording video. I do wish there was a 30 second skip forward/back option, as this would make finding the exact moment of interest a little easier. Photos and videos are saved to local storage, but you can also set up a cloud account and have them upload automatically.The app also supports remote control PTZ (pan/tilt/zoom) cameras if you decide to add one or more to your system. The system comes with 4 cameras, but the NVR supports up to 8, so you have room to upgrade.The system also supports push alerts to your phone. You can choose which cameras to send alerts and choose the portions of their fields of view to ignore so as to reduce false alarms. The motion detection is very sensitive, so I'd recommend selecting only the key ares, like your front steps and mailbox lid. Alerts are almost instantaneous.Finally some comments on the Windows Client: This too is a useful tool, as when working from home I can keep it running in the background and quickly see who's at the door. Because my laptop is on the same router as the NVR, live view is much sharper than on my phone. The client also supports closeup "Clips" for getting a sharper view of some object of interest.I would add that Reolink's website is excellent, with regularly updated setup how-tos and support FAQs, and their tech support staff are fast and efficient in replying to questions.All in all, this security system has met or exceeded nearly all my wishes and expectations.
review_text_2: I've spent months trying to decide on a replacement camera system for my house to replace a 5 year old Zmodo coax system. Whilst the Zmodo has proven reliable, the system has many shortcomings and annoyances which I‚Äôve taken into consideration when choosing a new system. If you are like me and research everything to death before making a decision you'll know that sometimes trying to balance all the good reviews vs the bad ones can leave you more messed up and confused than when you started. So for people wanting to know the pro's and con's of this system I have shared some of my own observations below and I hope they will help you in making informed and educated decisions on your own future system.Likes:- The supplied camera's are 4MP and have built in Microphones. They are POE and only require an Ethernet cable from the NVR to each camera. The audio is also transmitted through the Ethernet cable so no additional cables needed for audio. The cables supplied are 59ft long, if you need longer cables and plan to make your own, the cabling pinout is standard Ethernet wiring - same as any patch cord.- The NVR will record all 8 camera's at 4MP at 30fps, all with audio too. I should warn that this recording method will consume a tremendous amount of HDD space. The 2TB drive in the NVR will begin looping after about 4 days but from what I understand the system is capable of both larger capacity HDD and will support an external E-SATA in tandem.- The NVR's software is very well thought out and easy to navigate. You will initially need a TV or a monitor with an HDMI or VGA to setup a few basic parameters like camera names, network settings etc.. but a wizard guides you through all this and makes it super easy. Once connected to the internet, you can download the Reolink app to your phone and to your desktop mac/pc. If your desktop/phone are connected to the same home network that the NVR is plugged into, the system will automatically be found and will configure itself for live viewing. If for whatever reason this doesn't work you can scan a QR code on the NVR lid. Once you have setup remote access you can unplug your monitor/tv, every setting that you might want to change on the NVR can be done on your phone or desktop.- You do not need to port forward any ports on your router. You can close them all and it will not effect remote capabilities.- The live audio will stream to mobile devices, meaning that whenever you are viewing a particular camera on your phone or desktop, you can hear the live audio.- This feature is what makes this system perfect to me. Like many other camera systems, this system has motion detection and will snap a picture and send it via email. The problem i've found with most systems (Particularly at night) is the number of false alarm events, whenever a fly buzzes by or high humidity, this in turn causes you to be getting emails all night long and in my case waking up to 700 emails, not knowing if any were important without going through all of them. This system however has 4 sensitivity settings that allow you to configure sensitivity based on blocks of time. so for example, between 6am and 12pm you can set a desired sensitivity level, from 12pm to 6pm another.. etc.. the sensitivity scale ranges from 1 to 50 with 1 being the most sensitive and 50 the lowest. It does take a few days to get the sensitivity just right but once you've figured it out you can virtually eliminate all false motion alerts. I have mine set at 25 through the daylight hours and 35 at night, since doing so I get no false alarms from insects or car lights and only pictures and emails when someone is actually there. The motion alert feature supports PUSH notifications in addition to the email alerts.- The phone app and desktop app are very well designed. The app for the phone can be configured with a pin/password lock as an extra security measure.- The bullet camera's have amazing night vision without any IR glare. I've had several dome camera's where the IR glare made the image cloudy and hard to see.Dislikes:- This is really only a minor complaint. I cannot find a way to make it easier to pinpoint motion events on the scrollable time scale during playback. My older Zmodo used to flag a motion event on the time bar irrespective of whether the system was setup to record continuously or motion record. I can just simply look at my phone and note the motion event date and time and then search the time bar to that specific time, I guess it would be nice if it placed a marker indicating an event.- The NVR has a small fan for evacuating heat from inside the case. This little fan is quite noisy and very noticeable if you had an older DVR that had no fan. I have ordered a NOCTUA fan to replace it with to see if it makes a difference.Conclusion:I am very picky when it comes to buying expensive electronic goods. I understand the value of laying out money for decent equipment, particularly when it's something to protect my home and my family. Looking for camera systems can be a pain and wading through the offerings to see which ones are legit and work well can be very frustrating. I took a shot in the dark when I ordered this Reolink system and I can say with certainty that not only did it meet my very stringent requirements, it exceeded them. I might add that I was so pleased with it that I ordered 4 more bullet cams to bring the total to 8.A bit of a long winded review but hopefully it will help people who are still on the fence about buying this system!
review_text_3: Here is my review.System is Ok, not a big deal.I thought 4MP camera makes a big difference but I was kind of wrong.Setup was easy.Day vision good.Night vision ok. If plants or trees nearby then you see nothing beyond that..In my case it's about 15 feet for night vision.. Night vision is good if there is nothing in front of your camera.Computer App is okPhone App does not disable power/screen saver. While you are watching the app, the phone goes to power/screen saver mode in few secondsif you don't touch the screen every few seconds.Price good but if I knew I would purchase US brand system so I can get the support if I needed.System already setup and running so I am too lazy to disconnect, pack and send it back.If you don't care for technical support then go for it.I will update my post again if I get a respond from they support.Update: The support team answered my email the next day. They are helpful.Update 6/22/16> very responsive technical support (Via email) They really follow up on the issue when you contact them.
review_text_5: I am that guy who does more research than most on big purchases with no exception here. My brother-in-law purchased a camera system of a ‚Äúbig‚Äù name brand company. I helped him install it and it was super easy especially given that it was a POE system. That is when I decided that I wanted a POE camera system. After reading reviews and watching videos I found this Reolink system to be the best for what I was looking for. My big threes were; Atleast 1080p, 100ft night vision and POE. This camera ticks all of those and some! Over 1080p, POE and sort of 100ft night vision. Any camera system you read reviews on no matter the brand never really hits the 100ft night vision mark. I would assume in perfect conditions you could get the 100ft. I can see at night probably 50ft clearly and 75ft or so max. Maybe in a scenario where there is no reflective surfaces or any lights to wash out the night vision you could see the 100ft. Anywho, the clarity on these cameras is amazing and the setup was easy. You literally plug and play. Once everything is hooked up, you download the app and scan the QR code on the NVR and bam! I can‚Äôt express how happy I am with this system. Worth every penny!

name: Swann Home Security Camera System, 8 Channel 8 Bullet Cams, 4K Ultra HD DVR, Indoor/Outdoor Wired Surveillance CCTV, Color Night Vision, Motion Sensor Lights, Alexa + Google, 2TB HDD, SWDVK-855808WL
review_header_2: I feel safer in my home now.
review_text_2: When I started to look on the market for a home security camera system this one was not on any of the top 10 list. A coworker told me about it and said they loved it. I looked online and started to look at the base model to save money. After doing hours on hours of research I found out that you can not buy a camera system on a budget. Once I came to that conclusion I went big. I started watching YouTube videos on different types of camera quality like 1080p-light. Its a joke don't buy that. Its less then 720p at 4fps. But I'm not going to get into all that. The 8-4k camera setup is perfect for my property. The cameras have a much wider angle the i anticipated and therefore only needed two in the actual house. The living room and kitchen. I did finally place one in the pantry to catch my teenager from eating all the junk food. Over all the install and set up are pretty easy. I do recommend printing out the 85 page full system user guide for the tips and tricks on picking the location of each camera. I have two that I need to move a few inches due to the inferred reflecting off the eves and washing out the night vision. And the 60 foot cables were plenty long enough to go from the center on my home and out to the edges. I went into the wall and up to the attic and out. One mistake I made was running the cables before attaching them to the camera first. This created two problems. The first: I could reach the cameras that were under the eves on the out side of the house from the very short attic. The second: I ran 6 of the 8 cables the wrong direction. A simple tip, connect the cables to the cameras and fish them in the attic and use a loge pole with a hook at the end to aid in retrieval. A few other problems I had had nothing going to do with product it self. Just not knowing how to do this and not having adequate help was a stresser. For the hub, its about the size of a large Blu-ray player and it is a bit loud. It won't interfere with day to day life but in a quiet room you will notice the hum. The Program: it is at first complicated. So much to see and click on and so many options for your unique situation. Again, I can't stress enough to read the full user manual before you start anything. And a few more things to say before I'm done. The App is good. I wish that I could do a few more system adjustments with the app but for the most part I like it. I can see the live feed just fine and see recordings when ever I need to. The app only plays back recordings in a lower video quality. And the pest part for me is being able to see all 8 cameras at once on 60in TV in 4k quality. Its almost better then actually going outside to see my yard. The photos are screen shots from the app on my phone. I am very pleased with this perches and definitely will recommend it.
review_text_3: Exceptional product. Keep in mind when buying there are two night vision options. This one gives clear picture with red LEDs. The other only senses heat. Some think they will see full night vision with heat sensing. It won‚Äôt.
review_text_4: This was an upgrade from my older Swann system. An upgrade it has been. The views, both day and night are impressive. While I have not yet explored everything it can do, I am well satisfied that it will fill my needs. Based on how I use it, I decided to upgrade to a 6TB hard drive. I'd buy this system again in a heartbeat.
review_text_5: We upgraded from an earlier set of cameras. Definitely worth it.

description: Proudly American, Night Owl is excited to offer our U.S. designed and engineered expandable 4K Ultra HD Wired Security System with Human Detection Technology, Built-In Motion-Activated Spotlights, and Unique Enhanced Security Features. The camera‚Äôs bright spotlight activates when it senses human motion, stopping trespassers in their tracks. Human Detection reduces false alerts to your Smart Device, while Facial Capture takes a snapshot of a person‚Äôs face and sends you a real-time alert. New to video security systems, 2-Step Verification and Single Sign-On prevent unverified access to your system. How about security for your security? This DVR is the first of its kind to use Anti-Theft Technology to send real-time alerts if it's moved, so you're always in the know. There are no fees for storage. Keep everything on the pre-installed hard disk drive (HDD). You own your recordings! The weather-resistant indoor/outdoor cameras use Color Night Vision to continue recording in full-color in low-light settings, only switching to Night Vision if necessary. Night Vision up to 100 ft. and wide-angle viewing provide extreme coverage for your home or business. Night Owl's wired technology uses a secure hardwired connection for real Closed-Circuit Video Security (CCTV). A wired connection delivers uninterrupted viewing and recording with no delays, providing you with true around the clock protection. Our free remote viewing app for iOS and Android Smart Devices keeps you connected and provides easy access to your recordings. NOTE: The cameras are only compatible with this DP8 series. The DVR is compatible with our DP2 and DP8 series cameras. It is not backward compatible with other Night Owl wired products.

review_text_1: We have had Night Owl products in our school for almost 10 years and the products are very helpful and straightforward to use. This product was a replacement for us for our DVR that died. The cameras are very clear and they can be zoomed in on. The remote access feature was easy to set up and has already provided peace of mind for us as a school. The system records and "identifies" objects - such as human in their 30's. This proved helpful for us to review recordings and also provided a laugh for our mid 50's teachers who arrive early.Overall excellent product at a fair price.
review_text_2: We added these to our business. They are easy to install, have plenty of storage and are clearer than real life. I can access my cameras from my cell phone and see anything I want. I was even able to pass on instructions while watching the video to make corrections while I was away. I am impressed and will purchase again if I need more or even for my home.
review_text_3: Very sharp picture
review_text_4: This setup is fast and excellent system for the price point. I chose hardwire so no wifi interruptions.
review_text_5: Exactly what I needed! Works amazing

review_text_1: Works as expected. Cameras were easy to set up and add mobile app to phone and iPad. Highly recommend. This is my second camera system from Swann. I only upgraded for thermal capability. I will continue to use the Swann brand.
review_text_2: Very happy with the system. It performs very well, I xan configure to what I want, and is user friendly. Also easy set up.
review_text_3: I like that fact that it was an easy setup. Cameras show a good quality video, just had to adjust the color on each camera.
review_text_4: We had this same, yet much older version in our business.. got this 8 channel so we could use the other 4 cams with the 4 that come with this new system.. low and behold, the new cams are phenomenal!! The other 4 older ones are unnecessary and we see so much more! These cameras have so much more in their sights! The quality is bar none! Just give them your money already, lol.. but, for real.
review_text_5: I love these cameras. My brother-n-law got them set up in an afternoon. They were pretty easy to figure out and install. The picture is clear. I love the playback option and the several screens that I can look at. I haven't got the phone part set up yet nor have I needed to use technical support. But I did order another camera to add to this package. Great price.

How a product becomes part of Amazon Renewed, your destination for pre-owned, refurbished products: A customer buys a new product and returns it or trades it in for a newer or different model. That product is inspected and tested to work and look like new by Amazon-qualified suppliers. Then, the product is sold as an Amazon Renewed product on Amazon. If not satisfied with the purchase, renewed products are eligible for replacement or refund under the Amazon Renewed Guarantee.

name: Arlo Pro 4 Spotlight Camera - 1 Pack - Wireless Security, 2K Video & HDR, Color Night Vision, 2 Way Audio, Wire-Free, Direct to WiFi No Hub Needed, White - VMC4050P (Renewed)
review_text_1: The price is on the premium side, but I got tired of replacing outdoor cameras every year. I hope this to be more durable than the last 3.Set up was a breeze, although instructions were practically non-existent. You can download the Arlo app and set up an account before you get the camera.Small glitch after installing, the app walks you through some steps and finally shows you a QR code on your phone that you hold up to the camera lens. The camera didn't seem to be working so I unplugged it and plugged it back in and it came on and scanned the code (I have mine wired to eliminate charging the battery). When I first put the battery in, it came on. But by the time I mounted it outside and started the "install" process, I had to reboot it.Super easy to connect to Google Home if you have a Google display. If not, it will still connect but you can't really do anything with it using google voice commands. It really works with the Google Nest Hub display or the Amazon Show, so you can use a command to see what's going on outside.The picture is very clear. It is not in color at night unless you go to the app and tap on the flashlight icon, then it shows in color. Not sure the purpose of that.You can enlarge what you see by pinching the screen. Shows the view in either horizontal or vertical orientation. I was surprised at the price that it's only 160¬∞ instead of 180¬∞ like some other cameras in this price range. But it is still a nice wide view.To use it outside, I recommend ordering the exterior mounting bracket (not included) otherwise a crook can just reach up and pull the camera off the included base as it attaches via a magnet.So far, I am very pleased with the ease of installation and use of the camera. With this model you do not need to have the Arlo WiFi hub as you do with most of Arlo's other cameras. I didn't want to end up with all the extra equipment and this works great with my existing WiFi network.

description: Color:White Security at its Brightest. Zoom in to see and record video in 2K with HDR for a clearer, undistorted picture, day or night. Connects directly to Wi-Fi without the clutter of extra gear. The flood lights outdoor camera illuminates your property with 2000 lumens of brightness or up to 3000 lumens with the outdoor magnetic charging cable. The flood light camera is wire-free and weather-resistant to deliver fast, easy installation and flexibility to get the perfect camera view, year-round. With the floodlight wireless security camera, see important features like faces, licenses plates, and pets in full color, at night with color night vision to make the perfect surveillance camera and pet camera. Get the big picture with 160¬∞ diagonal view. Receive smarter alerts for quicker action. With 3-months of Arlo's Secure plan included, receive notifications for people, vehicles and packages and take quicker action like sound the siren, call a friend or dial emergency services.* Ward off unwanted guests by triggering the siren or floodlight automatically or manually from the Arlo App. Works with Amazon Alexa, Google Assistant, Apple HomeKit*** and Samsung SmartThings. review_header_1: ARLO Experienced User That's Very Pleased
review_header_2: Working well the first week.Excellent video.
review_text_1: I've had my Arlo Pro 3 Floodlight Camera for over a week now ( see picture) and I tested it with the different settings and have to say it's one of the best camera's they developed and with the floodlight I can definitely see a lot better at night time now. But the features I enjoy the most are the automatic "Zoom" in feature that can set the focus on a person that's in your zoned in area while it's recording and the very clear pictures at night. I did purchase the Arlo Accessory - Outdoor Magnetic Charging Cable | 25 ft, Weather Resistant Connector also as this works better for my personnel needs. We also have 6 other Arlo camera's, the Arlo Pro 2, Arlo Pro 3, the Arlo Audio Doorbell, Arlo Q and Arlo Baby we've been extremely happy over the last three years and yes we have a strong Wi-Fi connection.
review_text_2: I‚Äôve had an Arlo Q+ inside my house for a couple of years and it has worked flawlessly. Decided to add the Pro 3 floodlight camera above our garage to replace an older ‚Äòfailed‚Äô wired camera. The camera was easy to install and pair to our home‚Äôs wifi (I have multiple routers to cover the house). It did require I purchase the Arlo SmartHub base station; a device our Arlo Q+ did not need. The video is excellent, although on the default ‚Äòmotion detect‚Äô setting it reacts too much to foliage blowing in the wind. Currently experimenting with the sensitivity settings. I will follow-up with an update if issues develop, but I am seriously considering adding additional Arlo cameras.
review_text_3: bought this to add to my Arlo system and not disappointed. It is really bright and I have a huge backyard. It does a great job of illuminating most of it. It also captures sound and motion like a champ. I‚Äôve got a lot of critters that come and go so it will be nice to see if the camera can capture their activity. Also, it‚Äôs a great deterrent to keep the largest pests away. Set up was a little tricky given our Xfinity network not displaying 2.4ghz network name, but got that to work out by isolating that network separately. Otherwise, it was a smooth install.
review_text_4: This Arlo Pro 3 Floodlight camera is the best out there. I was doing a lot of research for a good floodlight camera and this one has topped all others. Pricing is respectable for everything this camera does. The zoom quality is amazing, the floodlight is very bright and motion sensors are great. To top it all off I am able to talk through and have an alarm sound. A countless sensor triggers and a good amount of floodlight use and the battery is at 70% after a weeks use. Very easy to install and even easier to remove to charge.
review_text_5: this is by far the best camera for my patio. I live in a high crime rate area and am constantly worried about my stuff being stolen, the Arlo Floodlight has put me at ease and i feel 10x more comfortable leaving my patio decor out. the motion detection is surprisingly great and the night vision is awesome and is very clear. tech support was very helpful and helped me throughout the process and catches everything i like that it blends in with my patio and is hard to see but also has a very strong light and you can see very clearly. highly recommended

name: Arlo Essential Wire-Free Video Doorbell - HD Video, 180¬∞ View, Night Vision, 2 Way Audio, Direct to Wi-Fi No Hub Needed, Wire Free or Wired, White - AVD2001
review_text_1: The Video Doorbell in a wireless option is awesome. Easy and quick setup, paired with the Arlo Chime and it is a great addition to my camera system. Only wish there was a way to turn off the phone calling but keep on the chime, so when I'm home it doesn't call my cell phone when someone rings the doorbell.
review_text_2: I put a ring and an Arlo next to each other. The Arlo out performed the Ring by a long shot. I especially like seeing animals at our rural home in Colorado and our home in Arizona. Animals come at night. Arlo picked up ten times the amount of bears, deer, elk, coyote, bobcat, Javelina as the ring set right next to it. That helped me decide to go with Arlo all the way.
review_text_3: I waited for Arlo to offer a wireless option to add to my fantastic Arlo wireless camera system. Pros- Super easy installation and the video feature is much more responsive than The Ring doorbell I replaced. Cons-you need to buy a separate chime if you don‚Äôt connect it with your old doorbell system, Arlo doesn‚Äôt yet offer a separate battery replacement. Although the included battery has only used 7% in 1 week. I like to have a back-up battery for all cameras so the system is fully operational when charging any batteries. Overall, I highly recommend this doorbell.
review_text_4: One of the biggest issues with many doorbell systems (ahem, Ring, et al) is privacy. Many systems by default allow the extension of your wireless network out to the sidewalk and allows other users to access it. Amazon claims they can only access the internet (something like the sidewalk program) but as a network security professional, I can tell you there are major security concerns with this, to include easy access/hacking opportunities for those with malicious intent and identity thieves.Network Security- As a security professional, I‚Äôd never allow a weak link like this to exist. Arlo does not have privacy concerns or ‚Äúdoors‚Äù like others do. As long as your wireless network is secure, your doorbell is secure.Quality- The Arlo system video is extremely clear, you can set the record/motion zones within the frame of the picture, sensitivities, and the detection system knows if it‚Äôs an animal/person/car by using algorithms. The video call is clear and I can easily hear the individual who is speaking at the door. I love to be able to interact with folks at the door while away from the house.Power- The battery lasts 3 months easily, and recharging only takes a couple hours. Of course you can buy a second battery and have it ready, but I didn‚Äôt bother. You also have the option to hard wire it to your existing 12 v doorbell system.Compatibility- I like how the system incorporates itself with my existing arlo cameras, yet it keeps itself separate. They can work together or independently or both.Addons- you can purchase a solar recharge system, extra rechargeable battery, and a physical wireless doorbell ringer to plug into an outlet.Provided in box- unit, 1 battery, connection kit for hard wiring, optional angle/corner bracket.I highly recommend this video doorbell.
review_text_5: I had been waiting for a wire-free doorbell from Arlo and I‚Äôm impressed with the device! Super easy to install and doesn‚Äôt require an Arlo Hub! Nice! All I needed was a few minutes to remove the Ring Scambell 2 and upgrade to the new Arlo doorbell. The battery takes a little while to charge - which I don‚Äôt understand why Arlo doesn‚Äôt support faster charging - but that‚Äôs not a huge deal. I charged the battery before setting up the doorbell in software. 5 minutes later I was up and running!

review_text_2: This little, inexpensive camera is incredible. The picture clarity is impressive and even in low light, you get a very clear picture. It will pan right or left and even somewhat up and down. You can also zoom in on the picture. I am very happy with this purchase.
review_text_4: Ok, so this is my first wireless camera. Set up was fairly simple though the destructions were a little hard to follow but not bad if you read them... The hardest part for me was setting up email notifications. I had to create a new account just for the camera and allowed 3rd party apps... Once I did that, worked like a charm. All my issues really. So far so good. And for 40 bucks, with a micro SD(separately), I'm very pleased. I get notifications to my phone and video to my email. Logging in with the app is a breeze and there are tons of options for this little camera. If you're wondering, I set this up on a router that has 5g, but also has the 2.4 radio. Make sure your phone is connected to that 2.4 when you set it up. Restart both your phone and router once that's done. It should connect in seconds.
review_text_5: This is a great camera. I've bought the outdoor one with solar panel too. I can talk to my son when I want him for anything. I can move the camera with the app, talk to my dog, assign areas for sensor support, move it to different places according to needs. Great price for the quality.

name: Reolink Argus PT w/ Solar Panel - Wireless Pan Tilt Solar Powered WiFi Security Camera System w/ Rechargeable Battery Outdoor Home Surveillance, 2-Way Talk, Support Alexa/ Cloud
review_header_1: ***Five Star Review?  Buyer Should Have Serious Doubts About Buying From Reolink
review_header_3: The best camera we've bought so far and we have several different brands !
review_header_5: A nice Solar PT cam with excellent push alerts
review_text_1: Leaving five stars because most people only look at the great reviews...so here is a more rounded review that should give everyone pause before they buy.Let me start by saying that I love the cameras. Bought 4 here and 3 more directly from Reolink on their Ebay store. The cameras have great picture quality and if you follow the instructions for setup using the bar codes, it takes about 45 seconds to get them up and running.And I am returning all of them. Further, I would strongly encourage all prospective buyers to strongly consider looking elsewhere for their security camera needs. Reolink is simply INEPT when it comes to backing up their products.A couple of weeks ago I bought 4 of these cameras. At $150 a camera with the solar panel, they are not cheap. As instructed during the setup of one of them, I went to lift up the little 1/2 inch by 3/8 rubber flap that covers the on/off switch and secures it from rain. The flap is held to the camera with a paper clip thick protrusion that goes into the body of the camera. When I pulled at it, that extremely thin piece of rubber holding the flap to the camera, broke. I didn't pull it hard, and I do not have super human strength. It just sort of broke and although I can still place the flap into the camera, it needs to be repaired because if it ever falls off, the entire camera will be ruined.I didn't think this was a big deal.I was wrong.I wrote to the company and explained the situation. I explained that the cover tore and I wanted to know how I could get a replacement cover. I would be happy to cover the costs. No problem. And I made it clear that I only needed the little cover because the camera otherwise worked fine. I just need the cover!Their response was that they wanted me to send them a picture of the camera. Admittedly, I was irritated. So I wrote back that I was surprised that they wanted a picture of this because the camera worked....I just needed the small cover and that I could probably buy it on ebay for a few cents plus shipping. This thing seemed like a no-brainer to me.They wrote back and said...oh, now that we understand that the camera works they will refer it to their techs.Great.Next day (and keep in mind that their turnaround is always a day later) I get an email asking me to send them a copy of the invoice. No problem. I did that within a minute.Next day..we enter the Twilight Zone. Instead of simply writing back to me with something saying that they are shipping out the new cover, I get an email asking me to send them the link of the Ebay listing for the cover I found so that they can tell me if it will fit the camera. HUH? So they have gone from taking responsibility for making a cheaply connected cover to helping me ensure that a third party solution (that did not exist) would fit their camera? This was sort of nutso.I wrote back and said simply that I did not find a cover on ebay.This morning - another 24 hours later - comes the latest response...they want to give me a 5 dollar refund.Now you would expect that a company selling a 150 dollar camera with a rubber cover for the on/off switch would grasp that the cover that they designed for their own camera to protect the switch from rain/snow/etc had an actual purpose for existing...but these folks instead want to refund me five bucks to accomplish what exactly? Am I supposed to tape the five dollar bill over the switch to protect it? I just need a new tiny cover!So I am now a week into this silliness and I have had enough. These cameras are not cheap. So before you buy from these folks, think very seriously about the warranty and support that they give and ask yourself if you should be going for products made by Google or Netgear because there is no doubt that a similar situation with their products would have resulted in a replacement part coming in roughly 2 days.Reolink makes great cameras. But they simply have no ability to back up their products with support that should make people comfortable. I have lost confidence in this company.All of my cameras...a thousand dollars of cameras...are going back because they can't figure out how to send out a tiny rubber cover that cost them a few cents.Pathetic.
review_text_2: My camera just showed up today. Ive been messing with it all day. I hooked up the solar panel and even on a cloudy day in the shade, it still charged a bit. Picture quality is clean 1080. Functionality is very responsive. Night vision is strong and clear. I can also listen with the built in mic and even that is crystal clear. I am very happy with this camera so far. Battery life seems to be pretty great. Its battery only loses about 10% over night and stays at 100% every day it. Very impressive and easy to install. I think i will add more in the future. Motion detection works great. Was a bit sensitive at first, but after tinkering with the settings in the app, i got it to ignore traffic and sense people. Highly recommended.
review_text_3: This is Karen's husband writing this review as I am the "tech guy" in our home.I am VERY pleased with how the camera is performing so far, so the 4.2 out of 5 rating seems well deserved. I admit I had some reservations when I read some of the reviews that were negative, in my opinion some may have been because of an individually defective product and some may have been due to lack of detailed enough directions.When I was first trying to connect the camera to our WIFI it wouldn't connect, then I realized I forgot to type in our WIFI password, DUH ! After I added the password it connected immediately. The camera is roughly about 85 feet from our WIFI router and goes thru 2 walls and still has kept connected very well.Also, we have Amazon Alexa and at first could not get Alexa to recognize the camera, so I did an online search for help and found a page on the Reolink support site with the steps needed to connect to Alexa, after reading that page I saw there was a step I didn't know about, once I followed those steps Alexa connected very well ! We can view the live camera feed from our smartphone app, from our "Echo Shows" via voice command, and even on our tv screens with Amazon Firestick (we have other brands of security cameras we view thru the Firestick also) so I can use a voice command and see different cameras on the screens including the Reolink camera, and I did not have to download anything to the Firestick, simply enable Alexa according to the directions on the help page I mentioned.I already had security cameras looking from our home outward, I wanted a wireless solar PTZ camera I could mount away from the house that I could turn to look at the house as well as turn to view other areas of our property not covered by the cameras we already had.So I mounted the camera on a thick (schedule 40) PVC pipe and mounted the solar panel on the very top of the pole, I used 3 hose clamps to fasten the PVC pipe to a 4 foot metal fence post I hammered into the ground, so far it seems to working very well. I will upload a picture of it.I do a lot of research before buying tech stuff, and it would be difficult to find ANY product that is perfect or that you might wish had more or better features, but for the features you get with this camera (including solar powered, PTZ capability, Alexa connectivity) I really can't complain for the price paid.Note: Remember this is not a commercial grade professional system, but commercial grade features likely cost much higher commercial grade prices, so again, for the price paid I really can't complain, I feel this camera does really pretty good for it's price level !
review_text_4: I placed this camera in my front yard on a tree, I however had to buy a longer WiFi antenna because it was lagging a lot . But the antenna really helped once I replaced the factory one. It is a good quality product thou. Keep it close to your house and your ok with the factory antenna. I would purchase again !
review_text_5: Its been holding up outside in winter weather down to freezing temps. decent quality video and excellent alerts on the cheap, Solar panel works greattoo but needs at least a couple hours of decent sunlight to charge well.

review_header_5: I recommend for the quality of the product and support provided
review_text_1: There is nothing, and I mean nothing not to like about this security 4 camera system. Beginning with the well constructed camera bodies, amazing finish. Once I ensured the cameras all connected to my TV, I began to located them around my home. Picked the first location over the pool, next chose a spot overlooking my fruit trees, then moved to the south side of my home camera location I picked connected right away. Forth location was more difficult to pick because of the remote power source. Finally chose near the front door again dead easy. Emailed Johnny (the tech contact) with a question next day answer addressing my needs small tech issue solved. Super, super happy with this purchase I will recommend this highly to my friends who are looking for a security system for their home. Great value so go ahead get this system perfect for any location, home cottage, farm. With the IP PRO app your system is on line anywhere you have your phone. If I could give this product a 6plus it would be done. Thanks HISEEU.Sincerely Ross
review_text_2: this is one of , if not "the" easiest to set up camera system you can purchase.I have also added 2 cameras that are fairly new to this company, has 2 way speaker ..the cameras are good and clear, customer support is top notch.I do recommend the wifi extender, it greatly increased the signal strength for those camerasa bit out of range. the day and night vision is excellent.I highly recommend this system.I have 7 cameras currently in use, I've also am using 2 Wi-Fi repeaters that are working great.I've not had a dropped connection in a long time. These are great, though they can takea bit of learning curve as you add on and use repeaters.
review_text_4: I bought this 8 ch. wireless system and installed it for a friend of mine. I was very impressed with the picture quality and ease of the setup. I have a system at my home and it's a professional quality and name brand and does not have the quality pictures as this Hiseeu system. I posted pictures I took from his monitor. These pictures are without a wifi hookup, just from the outside transmission from the cameras to the main unit. Before I installed this system I tested it at my hose to make sure it worked properly and it passed with flying colors. My home is about 3800 sq. feet and of course the cameras on the first level worked fine as being the closest, and to test it further I placed two other cameras as far as I could on the lower level and closed all the doors. Again all cameras produced sharp detailed pictures. I am not a professional installer, however I did install my 16 camera system and am very glad I suggested the Hiseeu system
review_text_5: I bought the DVR with 4 wifi cameras and I really liked the quality of the product, the excellent support provided by johnny and the support provided. The quality of the images is amazing as is the resolution of the device. It was the best investment for my house and the safety of my family, after all, at any time or I can see the images of my house. Thank you

review_header_5: Capable indoor wifi camera at a reasonable price
review_text_1: Very easy install and setup. Video quality doesn‚Äôt seem to be much better than the cheap wyze cam I replaced with this blink, even after adjusting to ‚Äúbest‚Äù quality. Love that it‚Äôs wireless and no longer have a 9 foot cable hanging on my wall. App is pretty intuitive. Alexa integration is great. Had an issue with the first cam, customer service was very helpful.
review_text_2: I just want to say for all the people that crap on these cameras, these cameras are amazing. They do the job. They are sturdy. They last through snow, wind, rain, and sun. They have amazing low light vision. Clear pictures. And a great setup to last two years on double AAs. And for those who need them to last longer buy the adapter to plug them in. It's stupid how these people come and review these as if they were 5000 dollar security set ups. These are worth it and a great value.
review_text_4: We are happy with our blink indoor cameras. It being wireless, light, and battery powered made it easy to install. The motion detection feature allows you to choose sections of the room you want monitored. The night vision is provides good quality captures and we were surprised the battery life is rated for two years. However, please keep in mind that it could change base on how much you use the live view, how often it triggers to record, how long the duration of recording, is set to, and if your wifi signaling is bad.Note: if you have a large area or areas with lots of obstructions (i.e. cement, brick, steel, and aluminum) walls you may want to have a wifi meshed network to extend you wifi network pass these obstructions. We have the Google Nest Wifi system. Also, the blink camera must connect to the sync module via low frequency radio (LFR). Because of this, the camera must be within distance of the sync module. This is separate from your home wifi network. My suggestion is to get another syn-module if you run into issues where your single sync-module cannot cover all camera areas.
review_text_5: The all-new Blink Indoor ‚Äì wireless, HD security camera appears to be a good product at a reasonable price. I bought a set of three that came with a Sync module. I believe up to 10 devices can be connected wirelessly to the Sync module that communicates using your home wifi. I was able to easily set up the camera using the Blink app on an iPhone. in addition, I was able to link to Alexa using my Amazon Prime account. This helped to view the camera on the Echo View screen using Alexa voice command such as, "Alexa, show Living Room."I understand that Lithium AA batteries (supplied with the camera) would last for two years. Also, there is a USB-C port to power the camera, although no cable or USB charging block is provided.The camera comes with a small mountong bracket and screws for wall or ceiling mounting.15 day trial for storing in the cloud is free and after that the subscription is $3/month per camera or $10/month for all cameras. However, the Sync module has an USB post and a low profile USB thumb drive upto 256 GB may be used to store video clips in MP4 format.My only complaint is that a detailed User's Manual explaining all these should be included instead of finding at Blink support website.

name: Security Camera Outdoor, 1080P HD Wireless Rechargeable Battery Powered WiFi Home Surveillance Camera with Waterproof, Night Vision, Motion Detection, 2-Way Audio and SD Storage
review_header_1: I've tried many security camera systems. This is the one!!
review_header_2: ZEEPORTE has redeemed my confidence in wireless security cameras!
review_header_4: For the price this camera exceeded my expectations.
review_text_1: My criteria for security cameras is as follows:1) Good quality picture2) Triggers at good distances3) Records videos locally (no monthly fee and privacy)4) Low number of false triggers5) A good phone app to control the cameras and view the videos.6) A reasonable priceThe Zeeporte camera checks all of the above boxes.I'll start here by saying that I've tried Eufy 2C, Vava, and Blink X2C systems. They are all more expensive (and sometimes much more expensive) than the Zeeporte. But the Zeeporte is a superior system to all that I've tried so far.The battery life of this camera is decent. I've used it heavily over the past 6+ days with many tests. I've recorded 209 motions and it is at 89%. Since I've used it heavily, I'll estimate 10% per week which means that it'll last 10 weeks (2.5 months) on a charge. In regards to size of the memory card that you'll need, I've used .22GB of the 120 GB card that I bought. At the current rate, it will record for 1.5 years before getting full - and then I'll just reset it. It is easy to transfer clips to your phone storage (online for my iphone).When I did my testing, I set it to the motion detection sensitivity to the highest value (95). What really impresses me with this camera is the low number of false triggers.. Really, I get none. It records people and cars and that is it. And it does not seem to miss any events. The angle of the camera did affect the distance of the triggering so try different angles.The only area of improvement that I can see is the mount. It is fine, but as I noted in my headline, I've tried several brands now including Eufy, Vava, and Blink. All of these brands had superior mounts, but the one that Zeeporte mount is fine. I had to make sure I tightened it well. One note - the other manufacturers that I listed require base stations and do not record on the camera itself. The Zeeporte does. This means if someone steals your camera, then they will get your videos. So, just don't put your camera within reach. A camera should not be mounted low and the instructions tell you to not do so. This is probably another reason that Zeeporte does not have a magnetic mount.. which would make it easy to steal. The mount that it has requires you to screw it off.Oh.. I just remembered another great feature of the Zeeporte. After your day is finished, you can view the events for the day (and all prior days) in a mode that shows you a timeline and lets you quickly sweep to each event based on the time and watch it. This is really nice to have!Overall, I do recommend it 100%
review_text_2: Last night was a disaster for me as I tried to get another brand of security cam to activate, I spent at least 5 + hours agonizing over the instructions, questioning my own intelligence and more 'Is it me?', I kept asking self.Long story short, it wasn't me, it was the product, and so going to return it.But smartly I ordered two security cams by two different companies and I'm here to say that 'ZEEPORT' has redeemed my happiness and joy and confidence in my ability to set up wireless WIFI connected security cameras...Also I timed it, from time I started activation to time it was up and running and it took less than 25 minutes!...I"m sure those more tech savvy than myself could do it in 15 or 10 minutes or less, I kid you not.Yes I'm a bit emotional cause coming off of a bruising night fooling around with that other security 'dome' camera system, which iI will not name, but if seek out my other review, you may stumble upon it...so yes I'm estatic right now cause ZEEPORTE delivered to me what they promised, a product that works right out of the box, a product to where you don't have to be a computer scientist to figure out, and all along the way, through each step, on your phone there's a 'help tab', in case you need help.Their 'help' doesn't hide from you.In closing, to be honest this can't be considered a totally full review, cause I haven't left my home yet and tried viewing camera from afar, until I do that, only consider this a 50% review.But will say WIFI connection was super easy...I mean super easy, compared to lasts night nightmare with other product (actually it was easy also, but after wifi connected to product their 'network' did not function).Anyways, so far so good with this product and will give another review as soon as can test away from home and see how it does then.It's a outdoor camera, but I have it indoors for now since other products failed me, I will order more though, probably from this brand, we shall see.
review_text_3: I love this camera, it gives great night vision even when my yard light is not on. Motion detection is great it alert me on everything it captures including the garbage man waking me up not to miss my trash guy, The birds in the attic, The neighbour talk. Even when it very windy and something is blowing across the street. Picture quality is absolutely awesome and incredible clear as day light. I call see all three of my neighbors home including mine. The voice quality is very good. If you asked me if I would recommend this camera to anyone else I would not hesitate to yes. I would recommend this to everyone. That's one reason. Why I gave this camera a 5 star. Yes it will video when you tap on the screen to see what going on for as long as you wish. The installation is easy all you have to do is charge for how long the instruction says. I have not charge mine since I put it up and it still has a full battery. This is a great gift and if you live alone and travel it's great to have because you can also put on the away button on your camera. . Ank me again and I will tell I am getting ready to purchase a second one for my home. I wish they came in a double pack. It gives me a piece of mind when I sleep at night to know I am safe. If I could give this camera a 10 out of 10 I would. I surely recommend this to anyone who is looking to purchase a camera for their home.
review_text_4: For my first ever security camera I am highly impressed. I needed a battery operated camera with easy installation and this one is perfect. Set up was easy, it was mostly charged when I received it and I easy drilled it to a tree. WiFi connection is excellent, picture quality is pretty good and the night vision is really good. I noticed the picture quality is better on sunny days rather then really cloudy days. You can change the motion detection, watch live, download videos and delete video all from the free app that you download. Honestly for the price I think I that this camera is pretty awesome and far better then I actually expected. You need a microsd card and to download an app. Other then that everything else is a piece of cake. I would recommend this camera.
review_text_5: I was sceptical at first on purchasing this security camera.I was looking for a really good security camera for the outside of my house.I have simplysafe for my home security system and have there camera as well inside but am not impressed with putting one of there security camera outside of the house.after reading the reviews on this camera.I figured that I would take the chance with it and see how it would perform.after unboxing the camera,and going thru the instructions which were very easy to understand.I figured I would just stick the camera temporarily inside the window seal and see how it would perform, before I mount it.and I must say that I was more then pleased with the clarity of the picture.as you can see from the above pictures.shooting thru the window from the distance that I had it was outstanding. Which I plan to install outside which will work great with my motion lights outhere. As far as the motion sensor it picks up motion great .you can adjust in the setting to suit you,it also has a home mode along with an away mode...as far as battery life I will have to up date in a later review.it came fully charged and seems to be holding pretty good.I must say if you are looking for a really good security camera,I believe you will be more then impressed with this one.Hands down it beats my simply safe cam hands down and for alot less priced.
