review_header_5: Easy to set up and great for a medium size house
review_text_1: This is a long review but worth the read if planning on purchasing an OOSSXX WIFI based camera system. The initial setup and function test of the camera system took maybe 15 to 20 mins at the most and everything worked great right out of the box. Before purchase I read all the reviews and came to one strong conclusion that the system is good quality but the people installing it did not quite understand how WIFI works. It seems many just don‚Äôt understand how critical it is to place the NVR in the optimum place that fits your particular home. It literally took me almost a week to play around and find the proper place. This NVR system is 1080P so yeah it needs a good signal connection to the camera to maintain the data rates for that high-quality image. What I have found is that if you don‚Äôt have a minimum of 3 of the 4 signal bars then your connection will not be good enough to prevent the camera to drop off on and off briefly during the day. First step is to place, tie wrap or tape the cameras in the place you would like them to be after doing the initial system setup and test to make sure they are working properly. Make sure to connect them with a bunch of long extension cords so you can move them as necessary for better signal later. Once your cameras are all placed the system is powered up you need to find the best location for your NVR. A couple of hints to finding the proper location. In the software go to System Setup -> Network Setup -> WIFI Setup. Here is where it will make or break your happiness with the system. If you look off to the right side you will see the signal for all your installed cameras. If it is not above 35 on any camera that camera will have issues. It will function and record between 30 and 35 but you will see brief 1 to 2 second drop-offs that are worse at night when night vision is on. So here is how to find the best location for the NVR. I have a WIFI extender for my house WIFI that I plugged the NVR ethernet cable into as I bounced around the house outlet to outlet with a spare monitor and power strip to look for the best spot. As you go spot to spot in your house click on the Adaptive channel button on the bottom of the WIFI page refresh the cameras to check signal and click Apply once you discover the best channel for that location. You would be amazed just by changing the channel it increased the number by +5 or so in the exact same location. Actually, for the final location and the channel with the highest strength in my home one of my cameras would not connect at all. I went to the camera and changed the antenna position just a bit and just like that it came back to life with good signal. In your case you may have one or two cameras that are low while the others are high. Try moving the camera location a bit or try the repeater setup to connect them to a camera with a stronger signal and see if it helps. If still no good contact tech support and/or purchase an oossxx repeater to boost them up a bit and check out YouTube videos that can help you get it setup. For my particular case I did not need a separate repeater but used the built-in repeater function in the system and it worked perfect. I also did not need the NVR constantly attach to a TV or monitor so the NVR ended up on a table in a room. I use the app and remote access for my needs and when I need access to the system, I drag over the spare monitor make my changes and then put it away again. I am very happy with the system and the image quality both day and night. Scrolling through the playback of images is simple. I originally purchased a 4-camera setup and have ordered two additional cameras to complete my needs. Once they are all up and running I will setup the alerts. With all this said there are a few areas OOSSXX could improve on. The mouse cable is ridiculously short and the include 10ft antenna did nothing to improve signal as I was setting up my system. It actually made it worse. These little things are not enough to discourage your purchase but wish list things for improvements for the next revisions. Like any piece of tech equipment, it is easy to blame the equipment. If I had left the NVR in the first place, I put it I would not have been happy at all but with a little patience and setup on my part to match the particular setup of my home I became very pleased and would definitely recommend purchase.
review_text_2: Ill start by saying I have installed several different DVR and NVR systems. This system was by far the easiest install I have had, and the best looking. Wireless systems appear to be hit or miss when it comes to pairing the cameras with the NVR. These camera's came pre-installed, and as soon as I gave them power they popped right up. The picture quality is great and the settings are easy to navigate. I was mainly the IT guy with my camera installs, and was around to port forward and get the cameras online to be viewed anywhere you had internet. The system did it all for me. It just worked. I didn't have to port forward or any other voodoo magic. I was skeptical when I saw that the app "IP PRO3" that they tell you to download had 3.3 stars on Android, and 2 stars on Iphone. Don't worry, it appears 90% of the low ratings are user error, not the app. The app works great and I have had no issues with it.I'm recording 24/7 so I can't grade the motion detection, and nothing broke, or didn't work so I can't grade the tech support either. But the camera's have been on and recording for a week, no problems. With the 2TB system and 4 cameras, you should get about 25-30 days of stored video for each camera.Do yourself a favor and buy the OOSSXX system.UPDATE: The issue I was having with the "Pairing the wireless camera's was due to a faulty camera. It began shutting off and needed to be power cycled, until the day it died completely. I got ahold of OOSSXX who had me complete some trouble shooting steps, and send them pictures. It was pain free and in the end they replaced the camera for me. I have had no other issues with the system, and just ordered a PTZ camera from them to fit to the system.
review_text_3: Cameras works very well, It‚Äôs exactly what we looking for our home security system. We been missing packages to house, so we need to find out what‚Äôs happened. It‚Äôs very easy install, I have to gave credit to the wireless feature. I had wire security system before, it‚Äôs so much work to installed them. And damaged the house wall. This one is perfect. I installed in less an hour. I have to buy monitor separate, but this still great deal with the price. I would like to have more wide range of the sight but it still great. It have great picture quality. We been use it for over last months. After it all install, we felt much more safe. And our packages haven‚Äôt miss since the camera installed. It‚Äôs a great investment.
review_text_4: My bike has been stolen recently from the backyard. When I checked my home security cameras, I was surprised that none of the cameras were recording. Thus, I decided to replace my old surveillance system. OOSSXX seems to meet my needs well. I bought the one which comes with 2TB HDD hard drive and 4 1080p cameras. The installation is quite easy, just need to mount these cameras on the wall and have the power adapter plugged in. Cameras will be able to transfer footage through Wifi. It comes with 10 ft internet cable, but I wish they come with a longer one. So far, I've been using it for days and don't see any issue with the footage or any latency. These cameras seem to be solid. and legit. The system UI is functional but too boring. With the motion detector, I could get an immediate notification through the APP and email. I'm happy with what I paid and got. This is an affordable solution for basic home security.

review_text_1: We have a pretty decent sized property and wanted security cameras for safety. I looked into getting one large system, but it is very expensive and we didn't need every feature for every area. Why pay for something we don't need? So while it may not be conventional, having different systems works well for us. This is the largest system we have bought, because these are for the perimeter of our home.Another reason we opted for this system is that it did not have a hard drive. That may seem strange to specifically look for that, but my BIL is a computer genius. Not exaggerating...dude has patents and can even be found on YouTube. He was able to save us a lot of money by putting together the hard drive himself and it's way more high end.This package includes 4 wireless cameras that offer motion alert, floodlight, color night vision, and audio.Again, these are for the perimeter, so being able to listen is all we needed. No need to actually have to talk back, because there is no point of entry in those areas.I think it's really cool that the night vision is in color and not some harder to see black and white picture.We can view on a smartphone, tablet, computer, laptop or simply a monitor. It is set up to view on hubby's tablet, my phone, and a monitor that BIL set up.Hubby and I physically attached the cameras where we wanted them, but my BIL did the rest of the setup. We spent about 10 minutes per camera and that's primarily because ladders and stuff was involved. BIL was able to do the whole system on his end in like 10 minutes. Not 100% sure how he set it up.I can say our home is well protected with cameras, the picture is super clear, the sound is crisp, and if anything comes near our cameras the lights go off and we get alerted. We live in a good area, but still want to protect our home and family.
review_text_2: Super nice quality security system. Easy to install and operate. Comes with 4 HD quality cameras that all have a clear video feed. Hooked it up to my monitor and can watch all four feeds at once or zone in on just one for a larger view. Comes with a clear easy to understand manual that explains everything as well. Has built in microphones, so you have audio at all times.Best part is the app, you can view from anywhere using this and it has features like photo capture and video saving. Great price for such good equipment, highly recommend this set!

review_header_1: Neighborhood package thief will be CAUGHT and PROSECUTED with this crazy clear video!
review_header_3: I actually purchased the product.  1st time user of Blink.
review_header_5: What an awesome wireless system...buying more!
review_text_2: This new camera is better then the Blink xt2 ! It has been totally re-engineered. Take it from someone who owns all the different cameras Blink had to offer since day one and had to get on a waiting list to get the very first one. So, I should know what iam talking about. This new camera no longer has the push down and pull system to open the back to install batteries. It has a large screw that you simply unscrew with a included tool to open the back of the camera which is really nice. Once you open the back and install the included batteries scan the small QR code inside the camera threw the blink app it will scan to find the camera once that is done it will automatically do a firmware update. After that you are ready to install your new blink camera. Also noticed the sound is much louder and more clear then the other cameras. This is good if two people are talking in a low voice you can hear what they are saying. Has brighter clearer night vision. Nice clear voice communication with two way talk. Alot stronger wifi signal to sink module and from sink module to camera. Sharp, clear, bright, and colorful HD vision during the day. I noticed before I wrote this review that some people only gave this camera 2 or 3 stars. Like the guy who is complaining about software issues. Well if you follow the directions you would not have that problem. Let the camera finish its firmware update. Duh ! Also, if you have been a Blink customer for a while and want to add this camera to your current system. You do not have to pay for cloud storage you are grandfathered in. After you add this camera to your existing system it will actually tell you this ! The front of the camera has a all new face with a very smooth and shinny surface iam sure to help combat the weather and give it a more high tec look. Their is no longer a switch inside the camera to turn on or off the blue recording light located on the front of the camera. It's is all done threw the app which is really nice as well. They really did a good job in re-engineering this camera and listened to customer complaints about their past cameras and went threw and fixed every issue. I would definitely buy this camera again ! UPDATE : 09-25-20 After using this camera for a couple of days. And as other reviewers have noted that this camera only has a 25 foot motion trigger ! Anything further than 25 feet it will NOT record when motion is present. So if you need a camera get the Blink XT2 for the further range. This camera will only be good for specific areas like door or window that are within the 20 to 25 foot range from the camera.
review_text_3: It's super easy. Works great. Setup was simple. It works exactly as advertised. What I didn't know for sure is that the batteries are just high quality AA batteries. So when they die, you can get some rechargeable ones and just rotate them through the thing. I'm going to order a couple more. They are pretty great. *Edit-A nice person took the time to let me know it's best not to replace w/ traditional AA batteries.
review_text_4: So far everything is as advertised. Setup was a breeze and the image quality is great - especially when set to ‚Äúbest.‚Äù I really appreciate the custom activity zones that you can set, as well as the ability the turn off the led light.In terms of improvement, the included mount is pretty basic. For better or worse the mount snaps into the back of the camera module. This makes installing it relatively easy, but also means anyone could detach it with a firm pull. I‚Äôve noticed that there are upgraded mounts that you buy, but haven‚Äôt had a chance to fully check those out yet.Lastly, I noticed another reviewer mentioned subscription pricing, but it‚Äôs a bit misleading. Yes, there is cloud storage that you can pay for, but there are multiple levels, including a free plan, as well as a basic plan for $3/month. Also, the paid plans don‚Äôt start until 2021. More importantly, What this camera has, that the XT2 doesn‚Äôt, is local storage. If you‚Äôre big on privacy, and don't want to store videos on the cloud, you can attach a USB drive to the blink module and save your videos there (see photo which shows the usb drive). There‚Äôs no fee for saving your videos locally - you can still get alerts and watch your video feed live for free.
review_text_5: What an awesome product...total install took 25 minutes. I put 3 camera‚Äôs up outside to monitor my summer home. One of the camera‚Äôs I places on a pole in the yard pointing at the roof so I can monitor snow fall and snow melt roof system. The app was friendly. I shared the app with my wife and she was up and running in 2 minutes with minimal effort. We are so happy with this wireless system.

review_text_3: It's a really nice system, images are clear with great color and good night vision. Camera signal strength is strong through multiple walls. My only issue would be that none of the devices come with a scannable QR code, for the app to work you'll need to manually enter the Cloud ID and some other info. To get this info you need to first connect the system to a monitor (HDMI cable) , right click with the NVR mouse and the setup features will have all the info as you go through setup. To connect the cameras, I had to connect each camera one at a time to the NVR base unit with a network cable then using the setup wizard (on the hardwired monitor) then search for camera IP. This will need to be done for each individual camera. After that everything works quite nicely. May be a bit difficult for the non tech-savvy.

description: Style:3 cam kit eufy Security eufyCam 2C Protects You, Your Family, and Your Privacy Every eufy Security product is engineered to ensure your security data is kept private. Have peace of mind that you will have a secure record of everything that happens around your home. 100% Wire-Free Without cords or wires of any kind, eufyCam 2C installs indoors and out with ease to surveil your home for 180 days on a single charge. Zero Hidden Costs Designed to protect your home as well as your wallet, eufyCam 2C is a one-time purchase that combines security with convenience. You will never be forced into paying to access your security footage. FAQ Can I expand the storage? eufy Security will soon be launching a USB storage dongle that will allow you to expand the storage. What is the eufyCam 2C system compatible with? The eufyCam 2C uses HomeBase 2 as its hub. It is compatible with eufyCam, eufyCam E, and eufy entry sensors. What is the battery life and capacity? From a single 5 hour charge receive 180 days of battery life. The battery capacity is 6700mAh. Is there a mounting stand? 2 screw mounts are included. We will soon release magnetic mounts that will be available for purchase. What‚Äôs Included: eufyCam 2C, HomeBase 2, Mount, Micro USB Charging Cable, AC Power Adapter, Ethernet Cable, User Manual

The 135¬∞ diagonal field of view allows you to see exactly what is happening in and around your home.,Half-Year Security from 1 Charge - Avoid frequent trips to charge the battery and enjoy 180-day battery life from just one charge.,Detailed Night Vision - View recordings or live footage in crisp clarity, even at night, for a clear view of who‚Äôs there.The Alerts That Matter - Human detection technology enables the camera to intelligently detect body shape and face pattern.,Ensuring you are only alerted when a person, and not a stray cat, approaches.,Ready for Any Weather - With an IP67 weatherproof-rating, eufyCam 2C is built to withstand the elements.
name: eufy Security, eufyCam 2C Wireless Home Security Camera System, 180-Day Battery Life, HD 1080p, IP67 Weatherproof, Night Vision, Compatible with Amazon Alexa, 3-Cam Kit, No Monthly Fee
review_header_1: Affordable 2 camera wireless solution, without compromise.
review_header_2: Left Blink for another amazing privacy-focused product from Eufy!
review_header_3: Great setup, preferred over Arlo due to price
review_header_4: Been almost a year now and still happy with the purchase
review_text_2: I travel for work almost every other week. I originally purchased the Blink camera system because I was thrilled with having month long battery life and the tiny profile cameras I could mount in the corner of my room.They served me well for a time, but like many people I began having major privacy concerns when Amazon purchased them. Eufy's camera systems are different. No footage is uploaded to the cloud and instead all of your video lives locally on your device. Eufy claims it is encrypted, but I wish they would specify if their employees have any way to ever access the footage or not. Some clarification on the privacy end of things would help further set them apart from Blink and their other competitions.I decided to take a chance on the Eufy 2C after having an amazing experience with Eufy's video doorbell.I'm so glad I did! The cameras are low profile and blend in easily in corners or even just mounted to walls. The base station is quite small and looks right at home next to my router, and the app works instantly with no headache. The cameras have crisp video and audio and Eufy provides easy-to-follow instructions for mounting. I do wish the mounts were magnetic or had a way to quickly remove the cameras for charging. Thankfully, after several days I haven't gone down a single tick in battery life so I am hopeful charging will be few and far between. Notably missing is Homekit support and expandable storage, but Eufy promises us that both of these features are coming soon. They seem to have a good track-record for customer service so I am hopeful.Below I will provide some pros/cons but to be honest none of the cons are dealbreakers, just things I hope Eufy will consider for their next software updates and product iterations.This is the best security camera system I have ever used and one of the simplest setups as well. I can't recommend this product enough! Go buy it!Pros:-GREAT video quality-Spotlight functionality-Seamless App and great wireless range-Good installation instructions-Battery life/USB charging-RTSP (record to your network or NAS!)-Clear audio & 2/way audio-Good nightvision performance-Recording light-Built-in sirens on each camera and homebase-AI detection means my pets don't set off the cameras (THANK-YOU!)Cons:-No HomeKit Support-No Geofencing (Auto arm on leaving and disarm on arrival)-16GB/ No way to expand storage with USB or SD (yet)-Mounts are cumbersome, magnetic would be a lot easier to remove for charging-No way to re-arrange order of cameras in the app
review_text_3: Overall I got this over the Arlo system. Price of the immediate purchase and since no monthly fee it was a no brainer. I did. I two sets 2c and Eufycam 2. I needed two hubs to reach my backyard and front corner of my house. About the furthest two points from each other. Hub range could be better as it has trouble going through walls.Clarity is goodDetection is about 90%. I think it may require time to ‚Äòsettle‚Äô. For example I setup and kept walking in front of it and it did t go off for a day. Was about to return when it started working. So do give it a chance. Start with all motion and high sensitivity, and go down from there or switch to human mode.The light is triggered manually. If I really cared I would have taken off a star but I don‚Äôt need that feature.Note the 2c has a siren but only for alerts. The Eufycam 2 has a siren for tampering which is nice. Haven‚Äôt tested either siren.Charge it up when you receive. I started at 40% out of the box but it dropped quick. Again almost returned it. But I charged to 100% and it‚Äôs been fine since then.There is only motion and human motion detection. Kept seeing AI mentioned for face detection, neither camera had that (I had hoped the Eufycam 2 had it). Alerts do try and show a face if it caught one, but not the face identification I read about.Eufycam 2 has better battery and that tamper siren, but other than that not much difference (size shape etc). So I‚Äôd suggest buying when there is a good deal and buy two sets while at it for the extra hub.
review_text_4: So I'm updating my previous review from last year from 4 stars to 5. I love Eufy products and have cameras, smart bulbs, vacuums, etc. Was having an issue with these cameras falsely reporting motion when the camera would wake from its sleep mode, that would cause tons of motion alerts 24/7. Worked with their support for a while but didnt seem to have a fix at the time. Now 6 months later their support reached out to me that they pushed new code and to check it now, it does seem they resolved the issue. I recommend Eufy all the time because of their top notch customer support and they have great products at a great price.
review_text_5: My wife bought this as my birthday present. What I really liked this so far is the over box and camera design and user experience. The package seemed really classy from the plastic wrap (tightened) to the unfolding of the corrugated lid.The item I got were HomeBase and the two cameras 2C. The installation was fairly easy and quick. I really liked the use of the app that was downloaded from Google Play Store per the instructions said.The overall camera quality's awesome as I used one for indoor and the other for backyard. The motion detector is great at the sensitivity level (default). I think for a beginner like me, this is a great fit.

name: Security Cameras Wireless Outdoor with Two Way Audio and Night Vision,1080P 8CH NVR 4Pcs Complete Surveillance Systems Cameras for Home Security Outdoor/Indoor,Waterproof,Motion Alert,No Hard Disk.
review_header_3: Very simple, plug and play hook-up. Quick to get started.
review_header_4: Nice NVR that works with Google Assistant and Alexa
review_header_5: Need a security camera setup? Get this one, you won‚Äôt be disappointed!!
review_text_1: I didn't quite know what to expect with this system but I am highly impressed! Prior to this, we just had Blink cameras. We thought those would suffice. Unfortunately, we had some kids in the neighborhood cause some problem. Due to the restrictions of recurring on those the clip was only 15 seconds long and ended up being useless to law enforcement.We ordered this system because it recorded 24/7. After a true plug and play (yes really just plug the cameras in and the system works!) we had all of the cameras installed and the system up in less than an hour. The picture quality on this is outstanding! I have the hard drive hooked up to a tv monitor and I can view all of the cameras at once. I love this as I work from home, yet I know what is going on all around me.There is no limit on recording as it continuously records. I get notifications of human recognition instantly on my phone.Ironically after we installed it there was another issue around the corner from us. Our neighbors knew we had installed cameras and had the police come speak with us. They wanted to know if we had recording of a certain vehicle in the neighborhood at a certain time. We actually did! We sent them the clip and they said this was as good as any system they had seen. That instance was enough to make me thankful we had then system and I think that alone paid for itself!
review_text_2: super easy to set up. just plug everything in, the cameras connect to the NVR automatically, and you're good to go. I added a 500GB hard drive to mine, which was very easy (it comes with screws for a 3.5" drive, but not for the 2.5" drive I used. the case has mounting holes for both).after formatting the drive, the NVR automatically set to record. I flipped either from or to time based instead of motion based. it looks like the system allows for expansion up to 8 cameras.These might be wifi cameras, but they're not on your SSID or anything, they use their own (hidden) network (or aren't wifi). The NVR has an ethernet port, but I couldn't get the web interface to work. I didn't try the app.If you want a standalone system that's easy to set up and have recording constantly (or motion triggered), this is good for that.
review_text_3: This review is for the 4 camera wireless NVR without the hard drive. This system was very easy to setup and get running. Just plug the main unit into power and a monitor or TV via the VGA or HDMI port and plug the cameras into their own power adapters. After a few minutes, they connect to the NVR and display their video. Use the included USB mouse (or your own) to answer a few setup questions such as time/date and location. This system can be used without any network/internet connection if you don't want to or can't connect it to the internet. While the cameras are wireless, they don't connect to your WIFI network, only to the base unit. The network connection is through an ethernet jack on the back using the included cable to your home network. You can then scan a QR code to link the TuyaSmart app (I used the Android version). Your camera feeds then show up in the app where you can also link many other smart devices from other brands. The app is where you can enable the mic on the camera to hear audio or click the mic in the app to talk back through the camera.While the on-screen menus may not be ready for your parents/grandparents to use, anyone that has used technology for a while should be able to click around a figure it out.Everything came very well packed and wrapped in their boxes. The camera mounts can swivel around and rotate to just about any angle and even come with mounting screws/wall anchors.My biggest complaint is that the power cables for the cameras (DC barrel jack) are not very long, less than 4ft. There are extension cables available on the internet/amazon to extend the reach.
review_text_5: First of all the packaging on the system was done very well. I literally installed the 4 cameras and plugged them in to power them on and there was video instantly. The picture quality is amazing! Better than expected!! The night vision is way better than I had expected it to be. I haven‚Äôt played with the app much as of yet, but that is pretty straightforward and simple to use as well. The 2-way audio was easy to use. The motion sensors work extremely well, and with tweaking some settings I‚Äôm not getting any false motion notifications! The notifications make knowing when someone is around simple. The customer service is top notch and I can‚Äôt see having any issues with them at all. And the best part is the insurance savings on my homeowners policy!! Well worth it!!!

review_header_1: My Camera purchase was a good choice
review_text_1: i do like the cameras and the set up was easy, and the cameras are a plug and play and the instruction are easy to follow and understand.
review_text_2: My family just bought a house and we think having a security camera will make our house more secure. This set comes with 4 cameras that we can put front, back and also garage. overall the quality is nice and the night vision is clear and the motion section is very sensitive. Nice product!
review_text_3: The cameras all have great quality! You can access all of them on one monitor and the movement is recorded well and smooth. The day and night views are both very clear! The installation of all four of them was difficult but the installation guide helped a lot. Also equipped with spotlight which turns on with motion and recording! Overall great for the price!
review_text_4: The wireless camera can match itself and take a clear picture. Easy to install. Perfect for home use. Planning to buy a few more.

name: [8CH Expandable, 2K] Hiseeu All-in-one with 8CH 10.1" 1296P Monitor Wireless Security Camera System, 4pcs 3MP Indoor/Outdoor Wireless Home Security Camera System, Remote Access, One-way Audio, 1TB HDD
review_header_1: Very easy to set up and use!
review_header_2: 3+weeks and it's working better then expected!
review_header_3: Caught the guy stealing my tools in one month
review_header_4: Great system and easy to install
review_text_1: This product is great. I ordered the NVR with the built in monitor and four cameras. Everything was packaged very neatly. I am by no means good with electronics typically but this was very easy to set up. I unwrapped everything out of the boxes and was able to set up in a very short amount of time. The instructions were great and the support was great also. I emailed Johnny to receive a manual ahead of time before it shipped so I could get started with reading about it, and he sent one as well as some other detailed instructions that were helpful for my setup. I am very impressed with the entire system. Once I had this set up, I was able to play around with extending the wifi range by setting up one camera as a repeater. That has worked very well with what I need the cameras for. I then set up the app to my phone. I love being alerted when there is motion within one of the cameras! That has been a handy too and kind of fun for monitoring pets while I'm at work :-)
review_text_2: I purchased this system almost 3 weeks ago and am very pleased with it. Currently I have 1 camera located 260 feet from the NVR (signal passing through 2 walls) and it is functioning wonderfully using the standard antenna. I have a second camera 20 feet further from the 1st and this one has spotty reception - due to distance of course - two other cameras showing our front & rear porches/doors. We live in a very rural area, there is nothing (and I do mean nothing) between the cameras and the NVR except the house exterior wall and a room interior wall but I'm still truly surprised that I can get the 260 foot signal - and I'm VERY please with the entire set of equipment. With my old eyes the small screen is a bit of a blur BUT with the 60 inch TV as a monitor it's a fantastic view!!!!!Oh, by the way.... I just placed an Amazon order for another camera and will eventually have all 8 channels filled.
review_text_3: Super easy installation.Physical installation is very intuitive. Look at the parts, and it will be pretty obvious how they go together. Note the cameras were made to be used with cabled or wireless systems, so ignore the cable jack.It WILL work and record WITHOUT Internet access. Until I can run a new cable to the part of the house with the console, it is disconnected from my router. It works fine and records on its hard drive. I just can't use the remote viewing, offsite storage, or phone alerts. They will work when I add it to the network.Directions for operation are adequate. Right-click and start poking around. It will be set to record from the moment you hook it up. But, you'll want to go through the setup process to personalize settings.
review_text_4: This system is easy to install. I installed the camera's where I wanted it, then drilled a hole to run my cords from the camera up into the attic. This was connected to a power connecter that plugged into an outlet. Once that was done, I plugged in the monitor and hard drive and turned it on. Went back and adjusted the camera's and then I was done. To adjust the camera's, there are set screws to loosen and tighten. once I knew where the camera need to be, I had to take off the antenna to tighten the set screws, then re-install the antenna. None of this was hard to do. The night vision is fairly good and daytime was great. It has a lot of memory. There are 2 options on the camera. One is to plug it in and then to a outlet. the other looks like it take a line like a ether line. Not sure since I am not very good with technology. Getting used to the monitor and its system just takes time. There isn't sound as some may thing there is. Also, there is a 1 second delay. I would recommend this for anyone who is looking for a security camera system that isn't going to cost you a lot of money. This system was under $300 for 4 cameras, monitor, and hard drive. Pretty good deal in my book.
review_text_5: There are hundreds of camera systems for sale but this one caught my attention when I saw that it creates its own WIFI network so you don't have to connect it to your own. I was worried about range but the system allows you to use a connected camera as a repeater to extend the WIFI network out to reach cameras further away. This was perfect for our application as we have a sizable warehouse and its 150 feet from the front dock to the back parking lot. The original four cameras were already connected to the systems WIFI which was very convenient for install, simply mount and plugin and they were good to go. One downside to this system is that the power adapter that comes with is definitely not something I would plug into an exposed outside outlet however you can get an extension cable for pretty cheap and run the cable inside to an inside outlet.Set-up of the DVR and camera settings can seem a bit overwhelming at first but if you follow the directions which are pretty clear or use the YouTube tutorial its easy. We set our cameras to record constantly during the operating hours and on motion at night so we can keep more days of recordings on hand. For the motion settings, if you are only intending to record if people are present, then set the motion to the lowest setting or you will basically be recording constantly and if you set up text or email alerts you will have a full inbox very quickly.As far as mobile viewing even though the system uses its own WIFI to connect the cameras to the DVR, it does need an outside internet connection to allow for remote or mobile monitoring and alerts. With this model, you can only achieve this by connecting to your router with a direct Ethernet cable connection, you can't link through WIFI. For us this was not an issue since our building is wired for CAT 5 so finding an open port near where we wanted to set this up wasn't to difficult. If you don't have this option then it may limit the location where you can put your DVR but with the repeater abilities built into the camera, this shouldn't be a large issue and your router is most likely in a central location anyways.The mobile app works really well and give an easy way to review motion detection events and even record and back-up video right on your phone. The web based app is a little more clunky and only works with Internet Explorer so definitely not as useful or feature rich.The last thing that I will mention is that this system is expandable to handle 8 cameras and I have already added one to the system and plan to add more. It was quite easy to connect a new camera to the system and once it was mounted and powered, it popped right up.All and all I am pleased with the system and think it is a great tool for both home and business applications. If I didn't already have a home camera and security system I would seriously consider this one as the price is very reasonable and the set-up a snap.

features: Blink Indoor is a wireless, battery-powered security camera that helps you check in on your home day or night with infrared night vision.,With long-lasting battery life, Indoor runs for up to two years on two AA lithium batteries (included).,Store video clips and photos in the cloud with the Blink Subscription Plan and save events locally to the Blink Sync Module 2 via a USB flash drive (sold separately).,Get customizable motion alerts on your phone through the Blink Home Monitor app so you‚Äôre only alerted when you need to be.,See, hear, and speak to people and pets in your home with live view in real time and two-way audio features in the Blink app.,Designed so you can set up yourself in minutes. No wiring, no professional installation required.,Works with Alexa ‚Äì use your voice to monitor your home through supported Alexa-enabled devices.,Includes five Blink Indoor cameras and one Sync Module 2.
name: Blink Indoor ‚Äì wireless, HD security camera with two-year battery life, motion detection, and two-way audio ‚Äì 5 camera kit
review_header_2: Stop comparing these to professional security set ups
review_header_4: Captures everything, even when you Blink!
review_header_5: Capable indoor wifi camera at a reasonable price
review_text_1: Very easy install and setup. Video quality doesn‚Äôt seem to be much better than the cheap wyze cam I replaced with this blink, even after adjusting to ‚Äúbest‚Äù quality. Love that it‚Äôs wireless and no longer have a 9 foot cable hanging on my wall. App is pretty intuitive. Alexa integration is great. Had an issue with the first cam, customer service was very helpful.
review_text_2: I just want to say for all the people that crap on these cameras, these cameras are amazing. They do the job. They are sturdy. They last through snow, wind, rain, and sun. They have amazing low light vision. Clear pictures. And a great setup to last two years on double AAs. And for those who need them to last longer buy the adapter to plug them in. It's stupid how these people come and review these as if they were 5000 dollar security set ups. These are worth it and a great value.
review_text_4: We are happy with our blink indoor cameras. It being wireless, light, and battery powered made it easy to install. The motion detection feature allows you to choose sections of the room you want monitored. The night vision is provides good quality captures and we were surprised the battery life is rated for two years. However, please keep in mind that it could change base on how much you use the live view, how often it triggers to record, how long the duration of recording, is set to, and if your wifi signaling is bad.Note: if you have a large area or areas with lots of obstructions (i.e. cement, brick, steel, and aluminum) walls you may want to have a wifi meshed network to extend you wifi network pass these obstructions. We have the Google Nest Wifi system. Also, the blink camera must connect to the sync module via low frequency radio (LFR). Because of this, the camera must be within distance of the sync module. This is separate from your home wifi network. My suggestion is to get another syn-module if you run into issues where your single sync-module cannot cover all camera areas.
review_text_5: The all-new Blink Indoor ‚Äì wireless, HD security camera appears to be a good product at a reasonable price. I bought a set of three that came with a Sync module. I believe up to 10 devices can be connected wirelessly to the Sync module that communicates using your home wifi. I was able to easily set up the camera using the Blink app on an iPhone. in addition, I was able to link to Alexa using my Amazon Prime account. This helped to view the camera on the Echo View screen using Alexa voice command such as, "Alexa, show Living Room."I understand that Lithium AA batteries (supplied with the camera) would last for two years. Also, there is a USB-C port to power the camera, although no cable or USB charging block is provided.The camera comes with a small mountong bracket and screws for wall or ceiling mounting.15 day trial for storing in the cloud is free and after that the subscription is $3/month per camera or $10/month for all cameras. However, the Sync module has an USB post and a low profile USB thumb drive upto 256 GB may be used to store video clips in MP4 format.My only complaint is that a detailed User's Manual explaining all these should be included instead of finding at Blink support website.

review_header_4: Excellent Wireless NVR sytem with 5 Star Customer Support
review_text_1: So far, loving it. Now for the install (see picture). Got this far without cracking the manual and everything works (well at first it didn't, will explain). The hard drive arrives "Unformatted" and has to be formated before the NVR will start recording. Also, even after formatting the display was still showing "not formated", but after I exited "System Setup" and came back the drive was showing as formatted. How to format the drive: right click screen, go to system set up, HDD setup, on the far right is a box that says format, check the box and go to the bottom and click format, exit system setup and then go back in and check the HDD "status"..What's in the box: four camera's (two pigtails: one power and one RJ45 network connector, antenna and mounts), one NVR (with 2 TB hard drive), one stiff HDMI cable with a nice braided covering (I'm guessing 5 feet long), optical mouse and manual.OK, fully installed and have had one issue: The IP install hit a snag. Snag solved, the manual says you must have WAN connector, this is poorly written, what they are saying: you must have Internet services for IP to work. I have an Actiontec FiOS router and it has two "IN" ports, coax cable or the WAN connector, those are input connectors and FiOS uses the coax, the WAN port is not used and cannot be used by other devices. I had a spare LAN port, plugged in the NVR and clicked on diagnostics and bingo, I am now connected "Healthy Network". Silly me, I took their description of using a WAN port literally.Update (8/20/2017), asked for and received the CMS software and it arrived right away (awesome support). Got the CMS working, happy I had the manual, the one page setup also sent Grace Hu worked ... but, not at first because I didn't know ... on the preview tab: on that page on the right side-bar you will see: Area & under Area your newly added Cloud ID you have Chanel 1 -4, you need to double-click on the cameras to turn them on for viewing (the camera icon will turn from gray to gold when turned on).
review_text_2: I compared this multi-camera surveillance system with other leading competitors. As a technical person, I reviewed its specifications in detail, and found it to be the best wireless system for protecting small or large homes.After completing its physical installation, I powered up the NVR, then the four cameras.. They paired up within a few minutes and displayed clear pictures on a 4K monitor.The new 13 page user manual (provided later) provides clear instructionsThe 2 TeraByte (TB) storage disk is sufficient for most applications, although larger internal disks can be obtained if extra-ordinary memory is required. For the unit described here, 2 TB was found sufficient to store 14 days of 24/7 operation when the frame rate is set to about 10 frames-per-second (fps), and with a high sensitivity setting. For two weeks of storage, I used about 1.75 TB.Using IP Pro (an Apple app), viewing on my iPhones was flawless, whether watching from the US or from Europe or from the UK.Backing up a time segment to a PC or to a thumb drive was easy.As an advice to fellow users, great care must be exersized in the evaluation of signal losses through building structures (walls, closets, windows,...).Camera output signal power is limited by law, and camera location and orientation are critical for both the NVR and the cameras. Solid brick walls are especially challenging, and some additional amplification may be required for certain installations. Do not allow the cameras to look directly into the sun: it will burn the sensitive optics.Concluding, the technical service and support provided by SMONET is excellent, especially when compared with other products, and the assistance provided by Mrs. Huang has been very helpful.
review_text_3: I bought this system to replace a lower resolution wireless system that I had installed on my house a while back. The DVR for that system became inoperative and the company no longer offers a model that would replace it. So I ordered this SMONET system and I am impressed with it so far. I bought it without the hard drive, as I have a couple of suitable drives handy.I have to say that customer service has been extremely proactive. Crystal from SMONET reached out to me proactively to ensure that I am satisfied with the product and to provide contact information should I ever need it. That is impressive!!!The system is impressive too. Since it is 8 channels where my previous DVR was only 4, I have more options. I was able to connect my existing lower res wireless cameras to this DVR and use those in addition to the 4 new hi-res cameras that came with it. My home has a relatively large footprint being a single story structure of 2700 square feet. All of the cameras manage to connect to the DVR with good signal except for one of the old ones that needed a "repeater" even in the old system. The great news - that repeater also works with the new system once everything is properly "married".I put a 1 Gig hard drive in mine and it could not have been simpler. Four screws to attach it and then a power cable and SATA cable to connect it. A quick format and it was up and running in minutes. I used a Western Digital drive but you can use a variety of drive sizes and manufacturers.Picture quality is noticeably better which I expected by going to full HD. Even the old low res cameras look pretty good. Motion detection is about the same as the previous system which was very good - so good, in fact, that I have to make sure the cameras are free from spiderwebs as their movement will trigger recording. LOL.The system is easy to set up and configure. Installation does require a power source near the camera but I used some power extension cables, that you can also get on Amazon, where I needed them. Night vision is remarkably good too with the IR illuminators on the cameras.For the price, this was an outstanding value when I ordered it. Now that I've got the hard drive installed so easily AND I was able to "marry" my old cameras to this system, it became an even better value.Thanks again, Crystal, for your proactive customer service!!
review_text_4: The selection process in a surveillance system can be challenging and the priorities vary with each user.My highest priority was CUSTOMER SUPPORT, and in an ever changing technological environment, this seller‚Äôs customer support, Betty Huang, exceeded all expectations. All issues were promptly responded to, professionally, courteously and with full transparencies!My next priority was COMPATIBILITY with my current hardware technology (High Def 1080P TV, Samsung Android phone, Windows 10 PC, Tablet and laptop) and this Wireless NVR Kit delivered.Next, HIGH DEFINITION video was a must and the camera‚Äôs delivered stunning auto focus day and night high definition resolutions.The system was for residential use, so I wanted WIRELESS eliminating unsightly cables like a bowl of spaghetti at the main station/monitoring location, which in my case was my office, and the wireless and surprisingly compact NVR system delivered.Last, which we all consider, was PRICE. The unit is competitively priced compared to current competition for all that it delivers and my second choice was less than $50 lower and it was hard wired and unknown customer support.
review_text_5: Back in December 2016, I purchased my first Smonet NVR that was a 4CH only. That thing has rocked every day since then. For the price and features, you couldn't beat it. I now find my self needing to add more cameras. I purchased this system since I had a 4TB HD already and four existing cameras that I wanted to add to this new system giving me 8 channels. The new system worked out of the box and these are 2MP 1080p cameras vs the 1.3 MP 960p cameras I already had. Now, this system I did not have any problem with as it came. The problem that I ran into was when I wanted to move the Cameras from the old system over to the new one via the match code process. I kept getting the invalid module error (-8) and the camera would not add. Now, working with computers for years now, I noticed that the old cameras had the same IP ranges 172.20.14.30 - .34 which the new system had already assigned to the cameras it came with. No matter if I deleted all cameras and added individually, they all seemed to have the wifi connection info and IP hardcoded inside the camera directly. This is where I was stumped. I wasn't sure how to access the cameras to correct this. I reached out to Smonet via email and they sent the steps needed to access the camera directly as well as the application to configure LAN (not wifi) since its plugged into my switch so I could access the web config page of the camera. Once I did that, I followed the steps on updating the WIFI SSID and passcode to the new NVR info as well as changing the IPs of the old cameras to be 172.20.14.35-38. Once I did this and saved, I did the match code process of the NVR system and BOOOOM! All the old 4 cameras connected easily and were up and running. While the support hours of Smonet are China Time Zone based and not really available for me during the day since I am on EST, they always responded to my emails and were very helpful. The person that assisted was named Crystal. Overall, I am a happy customer and will continue to use their products since typically you can't beat the price. This system for 159 was a good deal as it would have cost me that much just for 4 cameras basically at the going rate of ~35$. So it was a no brainer to go with this setup for the cameras and NVR. The only thing is, I wish I could swap out the antennas on the cameras. My old ones you can, but these seem to have the wire running from inside the camera out to the antenna so you would have to open the camera to replace.. I have external, extended antennas on the NVR since the NVR is located within a Computer RACK system. I will be also be attempting the wifi extending features of the cameras since two of them are for a detached garage that is quite a bit from the base station and I want to improve the signal to them. Overall, I am satisfied and do recommend these systems for an easy and quick DIY job.

review_header_3: Easy to use Wifi NVR system
review_text_1: I got this product for my grocery store. The cameras works great. It has long WiFi range, and the night vision is crystal clear. I really love this product!
review_text_2: Best system for your money. Wouldn't work on my Emerson HD TV because its a 4k system. Got a true 1080p monitor and it worked great. Then connected to my 4k TV and it's absolutely beautiful lol the app is amazing and only a 2sec delay from real time. The wireless range is amazing. I have one camera about 200 yards from the receiver outside and the signal is fair and no delay. Absolutely love it and have been recommending it to EVERYONE lol
review_text_3: I bought this product to replace my old wired system. I was a little afraid at first because I am not a tech savvy person. However, the set up for this product is quite simple, it took me no more than half hour to have everything set up. I am very satisfied with this product.
review_text_4: I use the product at home and it works great.Easy to set up , clear picture easy mounting , great for the price.
review_text_5: The cameras were very easy to install, Just locate where you want them, power them up, and you'll all set. I could not re-number them once setup. But that's ok for now, They look and sound great.

review_header_4: The system worked so well, I bought a second one!
review_header_5: Easy to setup but spend time with the software to properly configure it.
review_text_1: I would give it a higher over all rating but, here it is a week later and 4 out of the 5 camera's I am using are cloudy due to moisture getting into the lenses. Had some really heavy rain recently and even thou it says on the product page "waterproof" and "double-layer sealing treatment" water still got into the camera causing it to fog up the lenses when the sun came out and started to dry/heat everything up. I switched out one of them for the camera I wasn't using so at least I have 2 that have clear pictures.*UPDATE 5/13/20*I reached out to Customer Service about the issue's with the camera's I was having. After I provided them pictures of the camera's showing them fogged up and a close up of one of them showing the water in the camera that they requested I send them, they quickly sent me out new camera's to replace the fogged up ones at no charge to me. What started out as a bad experience, they quickly made it right at not cost to me.Because of there great fast service, I increased my rating to 5 stars and recommend this system. It works great, and if you have any issue with it, let them know and they will fix it/make it right fast.
review_text_2: I have only had this system running a few days but I am very impressed. Picture clarity, day or night, is excellent. As others have stated the manual is lacking, but I was able to figure out things enough to get it up and running. Playing with the various settings windows allowed me to dial each channel in to my liking, particularly motion sensing. Truthfully the worse that could happen if you mess up is you would need to reset to factory default and start over. I will most likely add 2 more cameras.I gave tech support 3 stars only because I have yet to require their services, but I am assuming they will be helpful if needed. The build quality appears top notch and the overall product is very attractive. I have not yet downloaded the app to view remotely, but that should work OK.I am very glad I decided to purchase this system. Hopefully it will serve us for years.December 14, 2019 Update: This has been an absolutely great system. It was very easy to add the other 2 cameras and set them up. I downloaded the app to my phone and am able to view remotely from anywhere. I was 1200 miles from home and logged into the app and it worked perfectly. Very nice to check on things while away. I showed this to a neighbor and he was blown away with the picture quality and viewing angles. He intends to purchase one himself. I have yet to need to contact Tech Support.
review_text_3: I have been thinking of buying a surveillance system for 2 years. Finally, I got this one a few days ago. It features easy installation (power on the wifi cameras, wait a little while, then they will be automatically shown on the screen), great picture quality as well as the 2TB pre-installed hard drive, which provide enough space for recording videos for about 30 days. What makes me particularly satisfied is I also got a very good display. Additionally, the system also can be connected directly to my iPhone with the App (IP Pro3). I got what I want and more‚Ä¶‚Ä¶. Really like it and will buy another one if needed !!All in all, this is a great product with satisfactory quality, especially the reasonable price...... just perfect!! highly recommend !!
review_text_4: I purchased the 6 camera system with a monitor and got it up and running within about 45 minutes. Pictures on monitor are very clear and playback can be obtained easily. The phone app is convenient to check what's going on from anywhere. The only negative is that there's no audio, even though on the phone app is a microphone button. Any support I've needed I've gotten thru Facebook - you become "friends" with Verna Jane, and send her messages, which she normally replies within a day or so. A few months after having the system up, I purchased 2 more cameras since the monitor was capable of handling up to 8. About a year later now, I've purchased my second 6 camera/monitor system. My phone app works to see both systems now (14 cameras total). The cameras are considered wireless but does need to be plugged in to an electrical outlet. They come with an NVR recording unit, Monitor, a mouse, a usb flash drive, & network cable. Considering all that's included, the price is very reasonable.
review_text_5: For the money this is a great product. When you receive it you can easily set up several camera's easily but remember you will need to make some configuration changes depending on your situation. Spend some time with the software and go though the online documentation otherwise you may feel lost. The distance the wireless supports is good. I'm pushing the wireless limits with a distance of just over 200 ft and am impressed.Support was responsive within a few hours of sending them an email and offered to assist if I needed it.

name: Hiseeu [8CH Expandable, 2K] All in one with 12" LCD Monitor 3TB Hard Drive, Wireless Security Camera System, Home Business 8CH 1296P NVR Kit 4pcs 3MP Outdoor Bullet IP Cameras Night Vision Waterproof
review_header_5: Hiseeu 8 Channel Expandable w/12" Monitor Wireless Security Camera System
review_text_1: We purchased this to give us security while living in a rural area. This has it's own wifi system that communicates from the monitor to the cameras. So if you have no wifi, it will still work. If you want to view from your phone, then you would need to plug the monitor into the router. It was very easy to set up. We just plugged in the cameras to power, and it communicated with the monitor. The cameras came up on the monitor. We bought a 4 camera system, but will probably add 4 more cameras. It was an excellent choice!
review_text_2: This is my first home video security system. I researched many systems before purchasing it. The features that I insisted upon were good video definition, night vision, significant storage capacity, and wireless connectivity between the cameras and the NVR (network video recorder). A good friend of mine showed me his system which was wireless but the cameras ran on batteries which he had to replace frequently. I knew I did not want a system that ran on batteries; this one requires a physical connection to house wiring for power. It comes with plug-in transformers for each camera and one for the NVR. There is also an antenna with a 10 foot cable for one camera if it is installed in an area that cannot penetrate through too many walls. This antenna allows you to place it in an area that is less obstructed. It works great! I bought the system with the 12 inch monitor which I think is the best combination. It eliminates the need to incorporate a laptop or television to view images from the cameras. (My system came with 4 cameras.) The monitor is a self-contained unit which includes a 3 Terrabyte hard drive and the electronics which run the system. It provides storage for 30 days of high definition video from all 4 cameras. It comes with a two-button mouse which works with the monitor and system just like a desktop or laptop computer system. I purchased 2 Vanxsecctv 10m(30 ft) 2.1x5.5mm CC 12volt Power Extension Cables for CCTV Security Cameras. These let me run power to 2 of my cameras that were not near power supplies. Also, I took advantage of the 8% Hiseeu discount offer just by sending an email to Johnny@hiseeu.com and requesting it. They replied within a few hours with the discount code which I successfully used. I am amazed at the night-vision capability of this system. The specifications say it has a 65 foot limitation but that is not the case. I have one camera aimed straight down our driveway which is about 120 feet long and it "sees" that far in total darkness. The detail is surprising! I bought the 3-year extended warranty (just in case). I can highly recommend this system.Update on June 5, 2020 If I could rate this system with more than 5 stars, I would. I am continuously impressed with the quality of this system. My wife, who is not technically gifted, loves to use the system to keep watch on our outdoor cats. We have observed several night critters meandering around our property that we would not have had any notion of their presence without this system. The company has contacted me by email to ask me how the system is working. If you are unsure of which home security system to buy I don't think you could go wrong with this one!Update on Dec 15, 2020One disappointing aspect of this system that I just found out is that it will only record 4 channels at a time. I added a 5th camera to the system and could view it just fine. I could not figure out how to record the new camera so I contacted the company. They responded within hours and told me it only records 4 channels. You can choose which 4 channels but if you have more than 4 they will not record. I am OK with that but the information in the system description is misleading. I'm sorry if my endorsement of this system has caused anyone else to be mislead too.
review_text_3: After a bit of a learning curve, this security system is a wonderful system. Great picture quality and with the 3TB hard drive, it records continuously for nearly 30 days. We've only had it for a little over a month and have recorded one suspicious person walking around our home while we were at work. We also purchased an audio camera that we have inside our home to keep an eye on our pets while we're away. https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07FVSK6BY?psc=1&ref=ppx_pop_dt_b_asin_imageInstalling the cameras may require some work, depending on where you want them located around your home. I installed one by the garage, drilled a hole through the exterior wall and made sure that an outlet was nearby on the inside. The cameras have a great picture and the night vision is very clear as well. I have not had an issue with bad reception either. Our cameras are all within 30-40 feet of the wifi base unit.
review_text_4: one month ago I bought the 8 channel system than came with 4 cameras and a 3 TB monitor DVR. I added 2 additional Hiseeu cameras. Everything has been working well. The pictures are clear for a long distance in daylight and a good distance even at night. I even saved an accident that happened a half block away to a flash drive for one of the vehicle drivers.
review_text_5: What I like most about this Surveillance System is the upmost quality merchandise you can purchase for your money's worth value.In addition you get top of the line 12" Monitor included, 8 Channel Expandable 3TB Hard drive, 2MB 1080P IP Cut Day/Night Vision Cameras' and all the accessories such as Adapters, etc.Also you have a lifetime technical support team available 24 hours 7 days a week. PS: I would like to personally thank and give a thumb's up to Mr. Johnny with Hiseeu Corporation in Technical Support. I am very pleased with this system and I would strongly Recommend this product for anyone looking for the best investment for your monies worth.

features: ,,Long Charging & Standby Time: This rechargeable camera is equipped with a 5200mAh battery, which can be used for 2-3 months after being fully charged, without the need for continuous charging (hint: fully charge the first time you use it).,Easy to Install and Use: This wireless battery-powered outdoor security camera can be set up in just 5 minutes without the use of any complicated tools. You can equip this outdoor security camera together anywhere in your home. Such as indoor/outdoor, yard, garage, shop, and other places.,Wireless and Cordless: When we say that our indoor/outdoor surveillance cameras are completely wireless, we are serious. There is no need to use wires for viewing streams or installing. Our rechargeable security camera is powered by a built-in rechargeable battery, allowing you to place it indoors and outdoors without worrying about annoying wires. (Only compatible with 2.4G WiFi router),1080P HD Image Quality and Weatherproof: Our wireless security camera adopts 1080P HD camera to provide you with clear and clear recording. You can watch real-time video remotely through zumimall App. It maintains a wide viewing angle of 110 degrees, and provides two-way audio calls, allowing you to easily hold the conversation. When motion is detected, alarms and images can also be forwarded to your smartphone. Our external camera security system is designed to withstand inclement weather.,Two-Way Storage: Equipped with night vision and advanced PIR motion detection, this home security camera system is exactly what you need to protect your home and family. This battery-powered security camera can see and detect movement up to 10 meters (32 feet) in the dark. It is very suitable for night/day use. After detecting the movement, it will start recording to a micro SD card (not included, up to 128GB) or paid cloud storage.
name: Wireless Rechargeable Battery Powered WiFi Camera, Home Security Camera, Night Vision, Indoor/Outdoor, 1080P Video with Motion Detection, 2-Way Audio, Waterproof, compatible with Cloud Storage/SD Slot
review_header_1: Great quality product for the price! After 6 weeks of use the Battery bar still shows full !!!
review_header_2: Best buy, value for money, it has everything
review_header_4: Tough little gem of a camera.
review_text_1: This camera is absolutely wonderful! From when I first opened the box I was very impressed with the packaging and the high quality of materials used to make this product. I could see that much thought and consideration was put into the design. The software installation was a breeze! Once I downloaded the app and turned on the camera, the app immediately recognized the camera and just a few simple steps later my camera was ready to work. I was also very happy to see that I had a few options for mounting the camera and what really made my day was that I was able to mount the camera without having to drill any permanent holes in the walls. (there is also the option to mount it via a screw and hanging it). Once the mount is secure on the wall, attaching the camera to it with the built-in magnet is easy and ball design allows you to adjust the camera angle or remove the camera at any given time.Immediately after I completed the setup and installation, I get real-time notifications when there is any motion detection. As long as I have a stable connection on my phone, I have the option to use the intercom function to speak to whoever is at my door. What I really like about the notification function is that I can go back and view screenshots as well as video. The quality of the picture and video is very good and the night vision function works incredibly well. I attached a picture to this review of my two dogs in a completely blacked out room.The waterproof design is also nice to have although it was not a necessity for me now, it may come in handy some day.I have used the camera indoors at times to check in on my dogs and now mostly use it for the front and rear entry to my house.Now what really surprised me most with this camera is the battery life. I was very skeptic to the claims made in the listing but now after nearly 6 weeks of daily usage and the battery indicator shows full bars! Well, color me impressed!!!Overall it is great for me to be able to see who is at my door, whether I am home or not.One thing I would like to add and I hope the seller can see this comment is that the font on the instruction manual is very very small. I recommend enlarging the font so that it can be easily read by old timers like me.
review_text_2: I recently planned to go out of country for few days and wanted to have a camera to keep an eye on my house while I am away. Once the product was received, my daughter could do the set up in just few minutes using my phone. I installed this in the front porch using the included stickers. Magnetic attachment is super easy to bring in for charging. I didn't want any wiring and any hard installation in the wall. So the set up was really easy. Location of the device is about 40ft from the router. I charged it to 100% though it came pre charged. Picture quality is super clear. Night vision is perfect. Monitored the view from different country for days and the camera still was 100% charged. Very happy with the purchase. Motion activation is perfect, sends a message to my phone. I haven't used the SD card option yet.
review_text_4: I know the saying you get what you paid for, and I found this camera to be a great value. The price and reviews were what sold me. My experience is as follows.......First fast delivery with prime. Received and installed 5/7/2019 ...Then my device was fully charged and undamaged when received. Simple directions. Great pics and night vision, easy installation. Motion detection works well as well as the person to person intercom. The camera is also (in my opinion) of good quality, heavy duty. I would say that especially after I dropped twice with clumsy hands (not on purpose) in stalling memory card. Maybe 4‚Äô.5‚Äù above floor. As far as the app, it works fine , I do wish that you could send videos or pics to email since it is connected to my internet with out taking memory card out... but this is not a deal breaker. I will be going on trip and will test long distance receiving of notifications. One of the neighbors‚Äô kids set it off and I was notified pretty quick. I show that the camera is running at 52% internet signal because of installation distance from router, and still get impressive results. I read somewhere that the battery will or could last to upwards to 120 days in standby operation, .... after trip I plan on making another purchase... I may or may not get a router signal booster, but I am very happy with my decision and experience with this camera. I will post and update on battery performance later when I have to charge again but we all know that the amount of time on live feeds and motion detection will need to be taken into an account... P.S. I will post pics soon.
review_text_5: Surprisingly, this is a pretty good quality camera. I like that it alerts you when theres any movement detected. It recorded and take pictures when theres movement. With that being said you can put an SD card in to save your pictures and videos but theres also a cloud where you can choose to pay monthly or yearly. So you have options to either choose SD or a Cloud monthly/yearly subscription.UPDATE on battery life: I received this item on june 6th but I didnt put it up until june 10th and right now is july 6th. So the battery is at 18% as of right now. So if you use the camera as often as I did(every time theres a notifications due to high sensitivity movements) of course it'll take up the battery. It did however notify me that its 18% and it needs to be charged or it will automatically shut off. Still not bad. Planning on buying another to rotate while the other one is charging. Picture quality is pretty good.On another note, there's a solar for this camera that can be charged without having to take it down to plug in to charge. Less worries about the battery being low and it'll continously charge throughout the day.

description: A smarter way to cover every detail. Zoom in to see and record video in 2K with HDR for a clearer, undistorted picture, day or night. Spend less time recharging with 6 months of battery life. Pro 3 is wire-free and weather-resistant to deliver fast, easy installation and flexibility to get the perfect camera view, year-round. With the integrated spotlight, see important features like faces and licenses plates in full color, at night with color night vision. Get the big picture with 160¬∞ diagonal view. Get smarter alerts for quicker action. Receive notifications for people, vehicles and packages and take quicker action like sound the siren, call a friend or dial emergency services with the included 3-month trial of Arlo Smart. Ward off unwanted guests by triggering the siren or integrated spotlight automatically or manually from the Arlo App. Works with Amazon Alexa, Google Assistant, Apple HomeKit and Samsung SmartThings. 6 month battery life will vary with device settings, use, activity captured and environmental factors. Arlo Smart includes cloud recordings of video clips at 2K or lower resolution for 30 days. Renewal of an Arlo Smart subscription is required to maintain Arlo Smart features, including cloud storage. Arlo Smart service not available in certain countries.
