name: Arlo Pro 3 Spotlight Camera - 2 Camera Security System - Wireless, 2K Video & HDR, Color Night Vision, 2 Way Audio, 160¬∞ View, Wire-Free, Works with Alexa, White - VMS4240P
review_header_2: Good performance for my first security camera
review_text_1: I have 2 Arlo Pro's and 2 Arlo Pro 2 cameras. This Pro3 replaced a Pro2 to cover more area with the wider angle lens and it is definitely a keeper. Not sure about the other reviewer stating you have to have the Smart Premier package to keep your videos because I already had it and the camera integrated perfectly with my already established Arlo ecosystem. There is a slight improvement in video quality over cellular data but a major improvement on you local WiFi with the 2K live preview option over the Pro2. The colors do not seem as saturated with the Pro3 but that is not a deal breaker. All in all if you are coming from the Arlo Pro expect some nice upgrades, coming from the Pro2 you will still see improvement just will not be as impressive.
review_text_2: This is my first security camera setup. I really just wanted a camera for basic alerts and to make the potential thief think twice before stopping at my home. Similar to a yard sign indicating an alarm system, sometimes just the appearance of extra security is enough to make most bad guys move on. Installation, mounting, and charging up the camera was painless and I had everything up and running in no time. It took about 30 minutes to create an account and set up the camera and base station. Charging the camera to full capacity took about 2 to 3 hours. My goal was to set up a security camera for the Thanksgiving holiday since I was planning on going out of town for the week and Arlo did not disappoint. I promptly received alerts from someone leaving flyers on the front door and I even got a few notices of a cat that apparently likes to roam in front of the house late at night. The cat looked surprised by the motion light when it came on as it walked by. Most impressive of all, the camera battery only went down by 3% during the entire week so I can tell that it will easily last for most of the month or longer before I need to recharge it. The only negative that I did notice was a slight delay between the camera recording and the event taking place. It seemed like it may have been a 1 to 3 second delay. This could be a concern to other potential buyers because a lot can happen in a few seconds when you are talking about criminal mischief. I wasn't as concerned about it because as I mentioned earlier I mainly wanted basic event alerts and the appearance of security. That's enough to scare off 99% of most thieves. For that remaining 1% of criminals no security camera or alarm system will deter them so for me the arlo pro 3 met my needs. I am definitely considering a second camera to monitor the back yard or inside of my house in the near future.
review_text_3: Easy to use, app is easily navigated, cameras have good quality pictures. System gives peace of mind.
review_text_4: Bought these for peace of mind after my divorce. The picture quality is amazing during the day and at night. The spotlight is bright too. It was very easy to set up and the magnetic mounts are super strong. I would recommend getting an extra battery as I can tell that the battery life isn‚Äôt that long. I‚Äôve had them for 2 weeks and I‚Äôm already at 50% battery.
review_text_5: The cameras were super easy to install. Pretty much just popped in the batteries, and plugged in the base station, downloaded the app, and followed the easy instructions, and the cameras pretty much found themselves. I had two cameras running on my phone in less than a half hour. Had them up for two days, I already caught a possum at our side gate, and 10 sec clip even said "Animal"

features: Blink Outdoor is a wireless battery-powered HD security camera that helps you monitor your home day or night with infrared night vision.,With long-lasting battery life, Outdoor runs for up to two years on two AA lithium batteries (included).,Store video clips and photos in the cloud with the Blink Subscription Plan and save events locally to the Blink Sync Module 2 via a USB flash drive (sold separately).,Outdoor is built to withstand the elements to help you protect your home inside or out, come rain or shine.,Designed so you can set up yourself in minutes. No wiring, no professional installation required.,Get motion detection alerts on your phone with the option to customize motion zones in the Blink Home Monitor app so you‚Äôre only alerted when you need to be.,See, hear, and speak to visitors with live view in real time and two-way audio features on your Blink app.
name: Blink Outdoor ‚Äì wireless, weather-resistant HD security camera with two-year battery life and motion detection, set up in minutes ‚Äì 5 camera kit
review_header_1: Neighborhood package thief will be CAUGHT and PROSECUTED with this crazy clear video!
review_header_3: I actually purchased the product.  1st time user of Blink.
review_header_5: What an awesome wireless system...buying more!
review_text_2: This new camera is better then the Blink xt2 ! It has been totally re-engineered. Take it from someone who owns all the different cameras Blink had to offer since day one and had to get on a waiting list to get the very first one. So, I should know what iam talking about. This new camera no longer has the push down and pull system to open the back to install batteries. It has a large screw that you simply unscrew with a included tool to open the back of the camera which is really nice. Once you open the back and install the included batteries scan the small QR code inside the camera threw the blink app it will scan to find the camera once that is done it will automatically do a firmware update. After that you are ready to install your new blink camera. Also noticed the sound is much louder and more clear then the other cameras. This is good if two people are talking in a low voice you can hear what they are saying. Has brighter clearer night vision. Nice clear voice communication with two way talk. Alot stronger wifi signal to sink module and from sink module to camera. Sharp, clear, bright, and colorful HD vision during the day. I noticed before I wrote this review that some people only gave this camera 2 or 3 stars. Like the guy who is complaining about software issues. Well if you follow the directions you would not have that problem. Let the camera finish its firmware update. Duh ! Also, if you have been a Blink customer for a while and want to add this camera to your current system. You do not have to pay for cloud storage you are grandfathered in. After you add this camera to your existing system it will actually tell you this ! The front of the camera has a all new face with a very smooth and shinny surface iam sure to help combat the weather and give it a more high tec look. Their is no longer a switch inside the camera to turn on or off the blue recording light located on the front of the camera. It's is all done threw the app which is really nice as well. They really did a good job in re-engineering this camera and listened to customer complaints about their past cameras and went threw and fixed every issue. I would definitely buy this camera again ! UPDATE : 09-25-20 After using this camera for a couple of days. And as other reviewers have noted that this camera only has a 25 foot motion trigger ! Anything further than 25 feet it will NOT record when motion is present. So if you need a camera get the Blink XT2 for the further range. This camera will only be good for specific areas like door or window that are within the 20 to 25 foot range from the camera.
review_text_3: It's super easy. Works great. Setup was simple. It works exactly as advertised. What I didn't know for sure is that the batteries are just high quality AA batteries. So when they die, you can get some rechargeable ones and just rotate them through the thing. I'm going to order a couple more. They are pretty great. *Edit-A nice person took the time to let me know it's best not to replace w/ traditional AA batteries.
review_text_4: So far everything is as advertised. Setup was a breeze and the image quality is great - especially when set to ‚Äúbest.‚Äù I really appreciate the custom activity zones that you can set, as well as the ability the turn off the led light.In terms of improvement, the included mount is pretty basic. For better or worse the mount snaps into the back of the camera module. This makes installing it relatively easy, but also means anyone could detach it with a firm pull. I‚Äôve noticed that there are upgraded mounts that you buy, but haven‚Äôt had a chance to fully check those out yet.Lastly, I noticed another reviewer mentioned subscription pricing, but it‚Äôs a bit misleading. Yes, there is cloud storage that you can pay for, but there are multiple levels, including a free plan, as well as a basic plan for $3/month. Also, the paid plans don‚Äôt start until 2021. More importantly, What this camera has, that the XT2 doesn‚Äôt, is local storage. If you‚Äôre big on privacy, and don't want to store videos on the cloud, you can attach a USB drive to the blink module and save your videos there (see photo which shows the usb drive). There‚Äôs no fee for saving your videos locally - you can still get alerts and watch your video feed live for free.
review_text_5: What an awesome product...total install took 25 minutes. I put 3 camera‚Äôs up outside to monitor my summer home. One of the camera‚Äôs I places on a pole in the yard pointing at the roof so I can monitor snow fall and snow melt roof system. The app was friendly. I shared the app with my wife and she was up and running in 2 minutes with minimal effort. We are so happy with this wireless system.

name: Blink Indoor ‚Äì wireless, HD security camera with two-year battery life, motion detection, and two-way audio ‚Äì 5 camera kit
review_header_2: Stop comparing these to professional security set ups
review_header_4: Captures everything, even when you Blink!
review_header_5: Capable indoor wifi camera at a reasonable price
review_text_1: Very easy install and setup. Video quality doesn‚Äôt seem to be much better than the cheap wyze cam I replaced with this blink, even after adjusting to ‚Äúbest‚Äù quality. Love that it‚Äôs wireless and no longer have a 9 foot cable hanging on my wall. App is pretty intuitive. Alexa integration is great. Had an issue with the first cam, customer service was very helpful.
review_text_2: I just want to say for all the people that crap on these cameras, these cameras are amazing. They do the job. They are sturdy. They last through snow, wind, rain, and sun. They have amazing low light vision. Clear pictures. And a great setup to last two years on double AAs. And for those who need them to last longer buy the adapter to plug them in. It's stupid how these people come and review these as if they were 5000 dollar security set ups. These are worth it and a great value.
review_text_4: We are happy with our blink indoor cameras. It being wireless, light, and battery powered made it easy to install. The motion detection feature allows you to choose sections of the room you want monitored. The night vision is provides good quality captures and we were surprised the battery life is rated for two years. However, please keep in mind that it could change base on how much you use the live view, how often it triggers to record, how long the duration of recording, is set to, and if your wifi signaling is bad.Note: if you have a large area or areas with lots of obstructions (i.e. cement, brick, steel, and aluminum) walls you may want to have a wifi meshed network to extend you wifi network pass these obstructions. We have the Google Nest Wifi system. Also, the blink camera must connect to the sync module via low frequency radio (LFR). Because of this, the camera must be within distance of the sync module. This is separate from your home wifi network. My suggestion is to get another syn-module if you run into issues where your single sync-module cannot cover all camera areas.
review_text_5: The all-new Blink Indoor ‚Äì wireless, HD security camera appears to be a good product at a reasonable price. I bought a set of three that came with a Sync module. I believe up to 10 devices can be connected wirelessly to the Sync module that communicates using your home wifi. I was able to easily set up the camera using the Blink app on an iPhone. in addition, I was able to link to Alexa using my Amazon Prime account. This helped to view the camera on the Echo View screen using Alexa voice command such as, "Alexa, show Living Room."I understand that Lithium AA batteries (supplied with the camera) would last for two years. Also, there is a USB-C port to power the camera, although no cable or USB charging block is provided.The camera comes with a small mountong bracket and screws for wall or ceiling mounting.15 day trial for storing in the cloud is free and after that the subscription is $3/month per camera or $10/month for all cameras. However, the Sync module has an USB post and a low profile USB thumb drive upto 256 GB may be used to store video clips in MP4 format.My only complaint is that a detailed User's Manual explaining all these should be included instead of finding at Blink support website.

review_header_1: Easy to install, high quality video, and accurate motion alerts
review_header_2: Plays well with your existing Arlo stuff, some other brands of smart stuff, and works efficiently.
review_header_5: great quality for the price, impressive
review_text_1: Had the Arlo Essential camera on pre-order and was pleasantly surprised when it arrived and installed it. Installation was simple and quick and setup took just a couple minutes to add it to the app. The video quality is really good both during day and night. The spotlight function turns on anytime someone comes close to my driveway and makes the night time recording clear and with color. I love the people and package detection feature, it cuts out a lot of false alerts. Overall super pleased with it and hope that it deters people from trying to open car doors in my drive way.
review_text_2: I bought this camera as an add-on for my Arlo Pro 2 4-camera system. The cameras for the Pro 2 are difficult to find new and just as expensive as this camera, so I tried this Arlo Essential Spotlight camera. They advertise a longer battery life, a higher-quality night-time color picture, and the spotlight. So far I am very happy with those claims. I'm now at the maximum number (5) of cameras that a free subscription will allow. It added itself to my base unit with no issues at all. The Pro 2 cameras and the Essential Spotlight camera will also work with some other systems, including Samsung Smart Things. I use the Samsung Smart Wi-Fi plug switch to control a light, and I can use its phone app to run my Arlo. An issue: the Samsung App likes to arm and disarm my system at random times. I'm working at figuring out the reason and maybe a fix; meanwhile back to the Arlo phone app for my cameras. The Samsung app also seems to be controlling my phone wi-fi and turning it on and off randomly. Another minor annoyance: the spotlight isn't all that bright nor does it stay on but about 10-15 seconds. There might be controls for that in a paid subscription but none on a free setup. By the way, you get a 30-day subscription trial with the purchase (covering ONLY this new camera). No bright/time controls in it. At night it's bright enough to startle a lurker but that's about it. I WISH IT STILL USED THE MAGNETIC MOUNT SYSTEM THE ARLO PRO 2 USES. I'm still satisfied; if I choose to go with the paid subscription and add a sixth camera, I will buy another Arlo Essential Spotlight camera.
review_text_3: I bought two cameras, one for a high traffic area and one for a lower traffic area. After two months, the front door high traffic camera is at 50% battery life which is better than I expected- this camera can trigger up to 20 times per day for me. The back door triggers about 4 events per day and is still at 90%! There is a slight delay in video- you miss the first few seconds of the ‚Äòevent‚Äô once the camera turns on. But the picture is clear, night vision with or without spotlight is great, the app is easy to use, set up was quick and easy, and I have not experienced the disconnecting problems others refer to. I liked them so much I recently bought another to add. I would recommend
review_text_5: I'm having so much fun with this camera. I'm 73 yrs old and I downloaded manual. Easy to understand. I practiced by setting it outdoors at night to see what I would find. Next morning I had pictures of a mouse, bunny, and coyote. Excellent photos. During daytime I recorded a friend in the yard. My friend was impressed when I shared the video on cell phone. Again excellent quality. I'm so excited for quality at this price. Haven't tried all options yet, but I have no doubt they'll operate as good as the ones I've already tried. I'm ordering another one for other side of house. They can be hand-held, screwed to wall, lay on ground (I did all) and videos are great. You can even take snapshots, talk on it, use spotlight, scare coyotes, share with friends via emails,You Tube, use siren, etc etc etc.

review_header_1: ease of installation, high quality,detailed instructions,as promised
review_header_5: I recommend for the quality of the product and support provided
review_text_1: There is nothing, and I mean nothing not to like about this security 4 camera system. Beginning with the well constructed camera bodies, amazing finish. Once I ensured the cameras all connected to my TV, I began to located them around my home. Picked the first location over the pool, next chose a spot overlooking my fruit trees, then moved to the south side of my home camera location I picked connected right away. Forth location was more difficult to pick because of the remote power source. Finally chose near the front door again dead easy. Emailed Johnny (the tech contact) with a question next day answer addressing my needs small tech issue solved. Super, super happy with this purchase I will recommend this highly to my friends who are looking for a security system for their home. Great value so go ahead get this system perfect for any location, home cottage, farm. With the IP PRO app your system is on line anywhere you have your phone. If I could give this product a 6plus it would be done. Thanks HISEEU.Sincerely Ross
review_text_2: this is one of , if not "the" easiest to set up camera system you can purchase.I have also added 2 cameras that are fairly new to this company, has 2 way speaker ..the cameras are good and clear, customer support is top notch.I do recommend the wifi extender, it greatly increased the signal strength for those camerasa bit out of range. the day and night vision is excellent.I highly recommend this system.I have 7 cameras currently in use, I've also am using 2 Wi-Fi repeaters that are working great.I've not had a dropped connection in a long time. These are great, though they can takea bit of learning curve as you add on and use repeaters.
review_text_4: I bought this 8 ch. wireless system and installed it for a friend of mine. I was very impressed with the picture quality and ease of the setup. I have a system at my home and it's a professional quality and name brand and does not have the quality pictures as this Hiseeu system. I posted pictures I took from his monitor. These pictures are without a wifi hookup, just from the outside transmission from the cameras to the main unit. Before I installed this system I tested it at my hose to make sure it worked properly and it passed with flying colors. My home is about 3800 sq. feet and of course the cameras on the first level worked fine as being the closest, and to test it further I placed two other cameras as far as I could on the lower level and closed all the doors. Again all cameras produced sharp detailed pictures. I am not a professional installer, however I did install my 16 camera system and am very glad I suggested the Hiseeu system
review_text_5: I bought the DVR with 4 wifi cameras and I really liked the quality of the product, the excellent support provided by johnny and the support provided. The quality of the images is amazing as is the resolution of the device. It was the best investment for my house and the safety of my family, after all, at any time or I can see the images of my house. Thank you

description: Setting Up Your Camera With YI Home App 1.Install YI Home App and create a YI Home Account 2.Turn your camera on and select the '+' icon in YI Home App to add your camera 3.Select your Wi-Fi network and enter your Wi-Fi password, then select Connect to Wi-Fi 4.Scan the QR Code shown on the app, then select Next once the QR Code has scanned 5.Select Save, then select Start using to finish pairing 6.If connection failed, please push the Reset button and try again WiFi Settings 1.YI Home cameras will need to connect to a 2.4GHz band network. 5GHz WiFi band is not supported 2.Turning on the location service on the phone if you encounter Unknown SSID issue 3.Encryption mode must be set to WPA/WPA2 (mixed mode) or WPA2 4.Your Wi-Fi password must be 8-20 characters in length If you have any other problem, please contact us via support@yitechnology.com.

review_header_2: EXCELLENT PICTURE (even at night) BUY THESE CAMERAS!
review_header_3: Great security cameras at a great price!
review_header_5: Developed for the Customer Not the Company's Profits
review_text_1: Alright, so I'm a tech guy, love anything electronic! I have had CCTV cameras in my house for years. I've been using Swann wired cameras for the most part with mixed emotions. But running new wires to upgrade the system just didn't excite me.I had been looking at NEST cams since I have the smart Thermostats and Smoke/Carbon-monoxide detectors for a while, but the price is ridiculous! Plus your only option with them is cloud service (an additional cost). Then I spoke with a neighbor who sent me a screen shot from his YI camera. I must say, the quality was pretty impressive.So I bought a four pack for $119.00 with moderate expectations. Let me tell you I'm super impressed with the picture quality of these cameras. Set up is quick and easy. When I purchased them I had no idea they had audio as well. The audio quality is incredible, plus it's a two way speaker. Purchased 32 GB SD cards for all of them so I didn't need to use cloud storage and it's been working great! I have them set to record all motion and I usually have about 7 days of history on each camera.Day and night vision are both spectacular IMO. I have attached several photos so you can see the quality both day and night. Side note, I have a couple "indoor cams" mounted outside. To do this I purchased a rubber sleeve/cover from Amazon to make the drop cam weather resistant for outdoor application. It's been through rain, sleet and snow with out issue so far. Link to cover: https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07FD5XHMP/ref=oh_aui_detailpage_o09_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=1A couple cons, the power cable is sooooooo short. I had to purchased longer cables for a couple of my installs. No biggie, they are only a few dollars here on Amazon. The app for iOS is very functional, but it has no multi camera view which would be a nice option.
review_text_2: So I have been using the Yi 1080p indoor camera system for 2 weeks now and I LOVE IT! The camera's are crystal clear during the day and are just as sharp in night mode. The added features of being able to hide any "lights" such as the blue power light and the typical red IR lights for night vision makes "hiding" these cameras a breeze. The playback function works great and give you the time in hours, minutes & seconds. The 2 way talk feature works great and has 2 modes, 1 is a push to talk feature where when you press the button you cannot hear what the person on the camera is saying and the 2nd is a continuous talk where you and the person on the camera can talk back and forth without pressing any buttons (love this feature) the 32gig on board storage is also a great bonus. Like I said I have been using the cameras for about 2 weeks and have barely used 3 gigs of space. (for an idea of the amount of traffic, it's just me, my wife and our 2 pets) so the cameras don't get a ton of action during the week. But are always recording on any motion. (I do not subscribe to the cloud storage as for I haven't seen a need) Anytime you get an alert it will store it on the app and you can upload it to your mobile device and share it with others. The initial motion detection clip is only 6 seconds, but if you wait till the end of the 6 seconds you will get an option to "view entire motion" which will bring up that camera, rewind to when it first detected the motion and play it back until there is no longer any motion, GREAT feature. All of the features seem to work as expected, you can set times for your camera to alert you when it detects motion and zones so that your dog walking around doesn't keep triggering the alerts. I can say the motion detection is VERY sensitive. You can set the setting to low, medium or high but really I can't tell a difference low to high. I have one camera facing out of my front window and it picks up shadows, car lights, leaves blowing, etc. Not a big deal, but on a windy day I can get a ton of alerts. The app works great, you can set a PIN or use your fingerprint to log into the cameras so in the event your phone is stolen, unless they have your PIN or fingerprint they will not be able to pull up your cameras. Connecting them was very simple and took less than 5 minutes per camera. Plug them in, scan the UR code and they will automatically connect to the network your phone is connected to. The packaging was very nice, didn't feel cheap. All cameras were individually wrapped along with all of the accessories. Comes with instruction booklet for assistance with installing/setup. The camera (black part) can be removed from the white base and mounted in different areas. They also sell (separately) wall mounts for the cameras. (cheap, like $10-$15 for a 4 pack) or you can stand them up anywhere you like (they have a round rubber grip on the bottom to help keep them from sliding around. All 4 cameras come with a USB cord and power brick. The USB cord is about 10-12 feet long so you should be able to place these cameras wherever you'd like. OK so I hope this rant...I mean review was helpful. If you're anything like me, I read all the reviews on a product before I make a purchase. Thanks for reading!***(I am not affiliated with Yi or any of there products, this was simple a consumer review, please purchase these at your own risk)***
review_text_3: I purchased the Yi 4 pk. 1080 Indoor security cameras. I was skeptical but am so glad I took the chance. I placed them in various windows facing outside as it‚Äôs outside I want to observe. They work perfectly during the day and, where the outside area is lit, at night. If the area is not lit, there is a reflection on the glass from the IR light, but they ARE designed to be indoor cameras. They work very well indoors, day and night, as intended. I have observed some sketchy people that have rung my doorbell when I‚Äôm not home (I have a camera in the window next to door), along with the neighbor‚Äôs cat, a family of raccoons, an opossum and numerous squirrels. I had an issue where they stopped alerting me of activity (which I see some others have had, also) and contacted Yi customer service. They promptly replied to my request and worked with me to make sure all my phone settings were correct. Turned out, the problem was with my phone settings, battery saver shutting down the app, NOT with the cameras or their app. I especially love that I can insert my own sd cards to save & view past events and not have to pay for ‚Äòcloud‚Äô subscription. I don‚Äôt know of another security camera that offers this. I couldn‚Äôt be happier with this purchase! In fact, I ordered another set of 4. If you are still in doubt, look up some reviews and comparisons of the Yi cameras on youtube.
review_text_5: Best Security Option for a home because:1. Its a one time charge- no monthly subscription- and all of the features of the camera work with the SD card2. The camera video is excellent especially the Night vision- it can see in almost complete darkness- wow3. The detection system is superb- I especially like that you can select an area within the total viewing area for detection. I use this feature so the cars that pass outside of my house do not trigger the alert only the area literally right in front of my door.4. The intercom is clear and at the appropriate volume5. Install and app use is seriously easy whether your a "techy" or not6. Small form and can be hidden without drawing attention7. Excellent price - for what you get its so worth it!8. Retrieve data on multiple device- My wife and I can both check our home and get the alerts simultaneously.9. Still records video on SD card even when wifi is out10. The option to make the camera stealth (no sound or constant blue light)As long as the camera and app lasts then I would definitely tell you do hesitate, buy it- its worth it and more.

name: „Äê2K,Two Way Audio„ÄëHiseeu Wireless Security Camera System,1TB Hard Drive,12V DC Power Cords,3 Megapixels,8CH Dual WiFi NVR,Mobile&PC Remote,IP66 Waterproof,Motion Alert,Plug&Play,24/7Motion Recording
review_header_1: I like it the way this setup perform, very surprised, love video quality especially a night vision
review_header_2: Honest Review of the Hiseeu  NVR ASIN: B07QM5996S
review_header_3: Very clear 1080p camera system excellent buy
review_header_4: A really nice security system that transmits wirelessly, but needs to be plugged in to work.
review_header_5: Great camera system for the price.
review_text_1: My main concern was how much can I see at night time thru Hiseeu 1080p wireless cameras, I was very surprised with my results. My test was around 70 feet deep. Day video quality is great, phone app working fine but slowing down a bit, too much data going thru. Overall I love it. Wireless connection is great around my house. Customer support and service was great, they working from 5pm-12am pacific time, they helped me a lot and I want to say thank you.
review_text_2: For my purposes, the system worked great. I install them into my workshop and placed the NVR in the house. I did use the one provided antenna extension and that worked well on one of the cameras. The furthest camera away was about 90 feet. It brought my signal from two bars to three which was plenty to receive the video. The rest work with the existing antennas just fine. The 1TB drive is plenty for my use as well since I will have the system reformat itself every 10 days. With 4 Cameras recording full time...I was concerned to it might fill up to quick...however so far, no real concern as it appears the 1TB drive works fine for my needs with plenty of room left after my testing. The NVR was truly plug and play and I experience no issues with any of the cameras coming on line when I plugs them in to the NVR. Great price and ease of use was what I wanted. Good job!
review_text_4: I ordered this security camera system plus an extra camera with two way audio in reaction to a rash of burglaries (one next door!) in our neighborhood. They arrived together and were delivered a day earlier than expected with a follow-up email from Saul at Aomeisi Security making sure we'd set it up successfully. We hadn't yet, but I appreciate the conscientious effort from the seller.This is truly a plug and play system as far as getting the video feeds set up and running wirelessly (the cameras do need to be plugged in to an electrical outlet). The system, when hooked up to a tv or a monitor with speakers, allows you to see video from all of the cameras, but hear audio from only one camera at a time.The extra camera can be added to the system via the supplied cat 5 patch cable very easily and then it will function like the other cameras with the added benefit of two way audio (once again, only one camera at a time.)The video quality is awesome and the motion detection is very sensitive!Since the cameras each need to be plugged into a power source, the actual placement of the cameras is, of course, more involved. Extra 12v 5.5x2.1mm cable is probably necessary for placement far away from an electrical outlet. But, after a bit of trial and error and extra cable, the overlap in the cameras' lines of sight make it difficult if not impossible to sneak by.The NVR system can receive wireless signals from the cameras without plugging in to the router, but it cannot connect to the router wirelessly. You must plug in to the router to view the video feed on your phone (download the free mobile app IP Pro from Google Play and you can also get notifications on your phone) or on a pc or laptop remotely.The manual is a little challenging to read and comprehend, but I think the more you work with it, the better sense it makes .
review_text_5: Really simple to set up, picture is crystal clear. The only thing I don't like is I have to hard wire to my router, would love it if it had a wifi connection.

With free local storage, the home security camera with mobile app allows you to remotely access your locally stored videos from the included Arlo SmartHub (requires MicroSD card, sold separately). Ultra 2 is a wire-free and weather resistant camera to deliver fast, easy installation and flexibility to get the perfect outdoor camera view, year-round. With the integrated spotlight, see important features like faces and licenses plates in full color, at night with color night vision through the home security systems. Get the big picture with the 180¬∞ diagonal view to make this the perfect front door camera. With 3-months of Arlo‚Äôs Secure plan included, receive notifications for people, vehicles and packages and take quicker action like sound the siren, call a friend or dial emergency services via your home cameras with app for phone.* Ward off unwanted guests by triggering the siren or integrated spotlight automatically or manually from the Arlo App. *Arlo Secure includes cloud recordings of video clips at 2K or lower resolution for 30 days. Renewal of an Arlo Secure subscription is required to maintain Arlo Secure features, including cloud storage, advanced object detection, rich notifications, quick responses, cloud activity zones. review_header_4: Easy to set up and works as hoped for
review_text_1: Really easy to set up, but the sensitive setting was a little difficult to find. Instead of being with he camera settings it is hidden in the mode area. However, Arlo has a lot of information online and was easy to resolve.
review_text_2: I upgraded from an Arlo Pro to the Arlo Ultra 2 Spotlight Camera and am quite satisfied. Build quality and image quality are excellent.
review_text_3: I swapped a Pro2 for a new Ultra2. It was easy to setup the new camera in the Arlo app. The camera position tool in the app made it easy to position the cameras view. The video quality is very good with some slight chromatic aberrations at high zoom levels at 20+ feet. The detection algorithm is also very good. It recorded a squirrel and correctly flagged it as an animal. Distance to the hub is probably 30-40 feet with one exterior wall in between.
review_text_4: Unlike my experience with Arlo's wired doorbell and chime, the Ultra 2 cameras work fabulously. The batteries do not last the advertised length of time. Knowing that I ordered two extras and the charger. The main camera battery had to be exchanged every two days and the secondary camera in our carport every five days. I installed a third-party 3 watt solar panel designed for the Arlo for each camera. The solar panels keep both batteries charged at 100 percent. I think it will be a pain to review the recordings on the base station's mini SD card, so there is no question in my mind that customers purchasing the cameras will also need to purchase Arlo's cloud storage service once the free trial period is over. Customers need to have reasonable expectations. I have my camera's set at the best quality settings, but still, don't expect to be able to read license plate numbers, and the "color" in nighttime recordings is very marginal.
review_text_5: I purchased the Ultra 2 to replace an aged system. Once you see the video, you'll declare 4k video is the only way to go. I installed the two cameras outdoors myself, and I am far from being a home improvement guy. You'll love it. I also watch my camera feed at night on my Amazon Echo Show. Be mindful there is an update package for the cameras and the base. Do the quick download before installing. My system uses the 25' constant power supply accessory, too. No pesky battery replacement or charging issues. You'll love this... I do!

review_header_1: Affordable 2 camera wireless solution, without compromise.
review_header_2: Left Blink for another amazing privacy-focused product from Eufy!
review_header_3: Great setup, preferred over Arlo due to price
review_header_4: Been almost a year now and still happy with the purchase
review_text_2: I travel for work almost every other week. I originally purchased the Blink camera system because I was thrilled with having month long battery life and the tiny profile cameras I could mount in the corner of my room.They served me well for a time, but like many people I began having major privacy concerns when Amazon purchased them. Eufy's camera systems are different. No footage is uploaded to the cloud and instead all of your video lives locally on your device. Eufy claims it is encrypted, but I wish they would specify if their employees have any way to ever access the footage or not. Some clarification on the privacy end of things would help further set them apart from Blink and their other competitions.I decided to take a chance on the Eufy 2C after having an amazing experience with Eufy's video doorbell.I'm so glad I did! The cameras are low profile and blend in easily in corners or even just mounted to walls. The base station is quite small and looks right at home next to my router, and the app works instantly with no headache. The cameras have crisp video and audio and Eufy provides easy-to-follow instructions for mounting. I do wish the mounts were magnetic or had a way to quickly remove the cameras for charging. Thankfully, after several days I haven't gone down a single tick in battery life so I am hopeful charging will be few and far between. Notably missing is Homekit support and expandable storage, but Eufy promises us that both of these features are coming soon. They seem to have a good track-record for customer service so I am hopeful.Below I will provide some pros/cons but to be honest none of the cons are dealbreakers, just things I hope Eufy will consider for their next software updates and product iterations.This is the best security camera system I have ever used and one of the simplest setups as well. I can't recommend this product enough! Go buy it!Pros:-GREAT video quality-Spotlight functionality-Seamless App and great wireless range-Good installation instructions-Battery life/USB charging-RTSP (record to your network or NAS!)-Clear audio & 2/way audio-Good nightvision performance-Recording light-Built-in sirens on each camera and homebase-AI detection means my pets don't set off the cameras (THANK-YOU!)Cons:-No HomeKit Support-No Geofencing (Auto arm on leaving and disarm on arrival)-16GB/ No way to expand storage with USB or SD (yet)-Mounts are cumbersome, magnetic would be a lot easier to remove for charging-No way to re-arrange order of cameras in the app
review_text_3: Overall I got this over the Arlo system. Price of the immediate purchase and since no monthly fee it was a no brainer. I did. I two sets 2c and Eufycam 2. I needed two hubs to reach my backyard and front corner of my house. About the furthest two points from each other. Hub range could be better as it has trouble going through walls.Clarity is goodDetection is about 90%. I think it may require time to ‚Äòsettle‚Äô. For example I setup and kept walking in front of it and it did t go off for a day. Was about to return when it started working. So do give it a chance. Start with all motion and high sensitivity, and go down from there or switch to human mode.The light is triggered manually. If I really cared I would have taken off a star but I don‚Äôt need that feature.Note the 2c has a siren but only for alerts. The Eufycam 2 has a siren for tampering which is nice. Haven‚Äôt tested either siren.Charge it up when you receive. I started at 40% out of the box but it dropped quick. Again almost returned it. But I charged to 100% and it‚Äôs been fine since then.There is only motion and human motion detection. Kept seeing AI mentioned for face detection, neither camera had that (I had hoped the Eufycam 2 had it). Alerts do try and show a face if it caught one, but not the face identification I read about.Eufycam 2 has better battery and that tamper siren, but other than that not much difference (size shape etc). So I‚Äôd suggest buying when there is a good deal and buy two sets while at it for the extra hub.
review_text_4: So I'm updating my previous review from last year from 4 stars to 5. I love Eufy products and have cameras, smart bulbs, vacuums, etc. Was having an issue with these cameras falsely reporting motion when the camera would wake from its sleep mode, that would cause tons of motion alerts 24/7. Worked with their support for a while but didnt seem to have a fix at the time. Now 6 months later their support reached out to me that they pushed new code and to check it now, it does seem they resolved the issue. I recommend Eufy all the time because of their top notch customer support and they have great products at a great price.
review_text_5: My wife bought this as my birthday present. What I really liked this so far is the over box and camera design and user experience. The package seemed really classy from the plastic wrap (tightened) to the unfolding of the corrugated lid.The item I got were HomeBase and the two cameras 2C. The installation was fairly easy and quick. I really liked the use of the app that was downloaded from Google Play Store per the instructions said.The overall camera quality's awesome as I used one for indoor and the other for backyard. The motion detector is great at the sensitivity level (default). I think for a beginner like me, this is a great fit.

review_text_1: This camera is great we rent our apartment so we don‚Äôt own the building. We have had a problem with people breaking into our cars so we needed to find a camera that wouldn‚Äôt damage the outside of the building but was also reliable enough to capture images if someone tried to break into our cars again. This camera does all of that and more it‚Äôs weather proof it can be connected by WiFi only or you can run a Ethernet cord to it if you want. There is minimal damage to the building and the pictures are great. If you throw a SIM card in it you can record notifications And videos of movement and the images are not blurry or cloudy at all, even in the rain you still get a pretty decent picture. I would say the night vision is almost better than the regular Image and we have absolutely no lights outside our building so it is dark. It connects easily to the app and the other cameras we have inside our house. For the price you can‚Äôt beat it.
review_text_2: I don't usually like leaving product reviews until the product has exceeded my expectations and I feel like that it was money well spent. This camera is very impressive as it checks off all the bells and whistles that you need from a security camera, the capability to monitor what's going on in the house at the touch of a button from your phone is remarkable. The picture quality is high definition which also helps in making sure you don't miss out on any minor movements that a normal camera might miss. I would highly recommend this product to anyone who is looking to buy a security camera to keep their family and business safe.
review_text_3: The camera has been improved a lot. I‚Äôll update details soon.
review_text_4: Recently moved to a new area and have had some issues with the neighbors, it also works as a perfect cam to keep an eye on the dogs while they're outside! The picture quality is amazing and I love the extras as well. It records audio, I can speak through the camera from the app, the night vision is great and the motion sensors are spot on. Will definitely order again.!
review_text_5: I just got this camera and want to install on in my garage and another on at the backyard. I haven‚Äôt start install it yet. But the instructions is very clear and seems very easy to install. I think it is nice to have them to keep my house safe and monitor my house when I am not at home.

review_text_1: This is what were looking for. The system is really easy to install. The quality was great. Wifi connection to NVR is really great we can see basically no delay at all. The mobile app was a bit difficult to configure but still answer the basic need for remote monitor.The attached photo is from our backyard where anything on the grass is dark and really hard to see but the camera said otherwise. Great Product.
review_text_2: "3TB HDD Pre-Instal - Hiseeu Wireless Security Camera System, 8CH 1080P NVR 4Pcs Outdoor/Indoor WiFi Surveillance Camera with Night Vision, Waterproof, Motion Alert, Remote Access" model WXKIT-8HB611-1T.**I will only try to point out some things not discussed in the description andFirst this is an EIGHT CAMERA system so don't be confused by the "4pcs" in the description.Second, I sent an email question to their customer service and received a response in less then 24hrs - VERY GOOD.Third, this is a Standalone system running Linux which gets rid of the BLOATWARE/SNIFFING of Windows and Chrome, etc. 'nuf said on my opinions of Goggle and Microsoft.Second, BUY the system with ALL the cameras (8 max) so that you have 'Spares" bought cheap as a 'kit.' I have used 6 in my system to date. The Camera Software has display settings for 8 camera windows, 6, 4, and so on.Third, the Cameras housing, adjustment arm and base are 'cast metal' (not plastic) very well made. I specifically chose ones with good 'hoods' as several of my units would be hit by the sun and typically would bleach out the image.Forth, the camera's field of view is very good and clarity range is as far as it shows. There is no flutter in the images after 4 months installed. The automatic 'white balance' is the best I have seen on NUMEROUS systems including Commercial versions. This comes into play when it goes B/W for night vision. On that note, there is a 'electric eye' on the front that actually switches the Camera mode too which does NOT rely on software to make that determination and uses decades old established 'eye' tech for delay - i.e. doesn't switch back & forth and does not get effected by passing headlights etc. This is the BEST manner in my opinion and you can actually HEAR the switch when you cover the eye with your finger!Fifth, the NIGHT VISION of the camera is exceptional for a non-commercial unit. It uses THREE "infra-red illuminator" LEDs (shown in picture) that are very strong (bottom "led" is actually the electric eye). The 65 feet is correctly advertised. However there is a hotspot because the LEDs are not shining 'spread out' as far as camera's field of view. This is an issue with ALL infra-red Iluminators as the Infra-red light is such a small band of light energy - that's why your TV remote does not work from a distance or if you don't point it at the TV when your batteries are low. If you need to see further or wider, you will need to invest in separate ACTUAL Infra-Red Iluminators and place them as needed. Note that I have overlapping cameras and each 'see' the others Infra-Red spots.Sixth, Make a CAMERA MAP and plot locations as well as which camera goes where. The system comes FULLY SET UP however, having done this before, I plugged in the entire system on a table, started it up and determined which cameras were 1-8 and LABELED them. Then made sure to put them in the order I wanted them DISPLAYED so when turned it all on, it was only the matter of alignment. I have three in one location alone giving over 180 degree coverage. Those are 150ft away from the base unit and still have a SOLID 3 of 4 bars wifi.Last, I did not need any internet connections (etc.) so have no input there.PS. the noise is typical of just a Hard Drive head indexing and is not loud but it will transfers through its cabinet to a hard surface and becomes a 'sounding board' making it out to be louder than it actually is, which you can fix by putting some soft 'feet' on it. The intermittent indexing does make sleeping around it a little funny. The best step would be to offer SSD when the prices come down as they are noiseless and have a better longevity in a constant "write" hard derive scenario such as this.
review_text_3: So, let's review, right?Well, when I bought it, of course the price was right, but I was worried that It was on the cheap side, and that it might reflect in the quality. The answer is NO. This was well worth the value. After 2 years, still working just fine.Now, Let's talk about it.Basically, it's pretty easy. Unwrap everything. Grab a network cable, a power strip, and a HDMI or VGA monitor.Once you have those things, plug it all in. DVR to the network, power and HDMI/VGa and a mouse (included but crap), and the cameras all in to the power strip. Turn it all on at once.When everything is on, the cameras should already show up on the screen in a grid. You have to set a password (make it easy, no keyboard). Then walk through the Wizard. Set the time, give it an IP or DHCP (easy instructions included)**. When it says ONLINE, you are done. You can tweak it anyway you want, but honestly, that's about it.There's also a QR code that it displays to download the app for mobile access, and there is one that connects the DVR to your phone. I dowloaded the iPhone app, then clicked 'add DVR' then pointed my phone to the QR code... and in about 5 seconds, the phone showed my cameras.** If you have a router that supports uPNP, use it. It will make things easier.The reason I am posting a review now is because of a recent issue I had. I came home one night to find the DVR had been stuck in a reboot. It would load the startup screen, then reboot. After an EMAIL to their SUPPORT, I was given some options to reset a setting, reboot, and try again. This didn't work, so they sent me a new firmware. That corrected the problem, and I was back online.In many cases, a company would simply tell me that 2 years was over-warranty. I really appreciated that they were able to provide support.I should mention, they do not speak fluent english, so there was a little assumption and muddling I had to go through to understand some of the instructions, but overall. Very impressed.
review_text_4: I ordered this system last year and to my shame it sat in the box till now. I've had a lot of time to do my pet projects and this was one of them. So finally I got it out and after reading reviews of how wireless camera systems were difficult to setup I was dreading the fight. However, no fighting needed. I hooked it up to the tv and plugged it into 120VAC. I plugged in the cameras to 120VAC in different parts of my house in window locations. I then turned on my tv and switched to the HDMI port of the Control Unit of the system. Once again to my surprise I saw my screen divided into squares for each camera powered up. I didn't fight with it at all! Apparently the system is automatically keyed to recognize its cameras and any extra cameras you try connect to the system must be wired. It is still early in my installation and I am trying things out yet. I ran an ethernet cable to the Control Unit and will be trying out accessing from my phone and computer. It looks like you can manually access it over the internet if you know the IP Address and ports of cameras or you can download the software app and use the software to access cameras and schedule recording. I would recommend this system.
review_text_5: I purchased this system recently for my property,At first I was a little hesitant buying a system off Amazon, but then did my due diligence research on the system and Hiseeu as well as tried asking some pre-sale questions to their support to see how efficient support really was. (They did a great job of answering questions)I have been pleasantly surprised with the system as a whole.Setup was very easy as the cameras come preloaded to match the system. (I encourage a new buyer to setup all of the cameras and system in one room first before installing them, This will allow you to identify camera 1 thru 8; although the cameras can be easily reassigned)Once setup, the Admin Menu is pretty easy to understand and work with, so no difficulties there. The viewing ‚ÄúPhone App‚Äô works well, with sharp images that I can now view when I‚Äôm away from the house.All in All, I recently had a 900.00 System that I used, and I have found the Hiseeu system is practically the same and for 1\2 the money,I will say though, that I will come back after a month of operation and either update this review or add a new one so I can comment on the stability and connectivity of the System.Note to Potential Buyers:Read the Product description, Hiseeu offers an additional 8% off if you email them for a code before the sale, To me; that was the final item that had me land on them for a product.

review_text_1: Over the last 8 years I‚Äôve had Nest, Ring camera systems and now Eufy. It‚Äôs been an expensive journey. The high costs of devices and then the yearly subscription. Living in the country a security system brings peace of mind. With Nest and Ring, good cameras, but the time it takes to view a notification is terrible, especially away from home. Eufy has resolved that issue for me. At home the notification is fast and access to view what it‚Äôs about just as fast. Away from home it‚Äôs fast as well and a relief not to get a message ‚Äúactivating device‚Äù any longer. Day time quality of the 2C Pro camera is excellent, nighttime is as well, with one exception not published anywhere. The camera needs background light help. A motion detect security light in the area is a must if you want to record an event and see a good picture. For me not a problem, the barn has one. I like this system so far.
review_text_2: (Updated at the end with a different outcome)So far the motion detection is not good , keeps alerting to vehicles outside the activity zone and missed me walking inside the activity zone and missed UPS also inside the activity zone. I‚Äôm testing the rest of the cameras.Updated May 15 2021 , The camera has missed sending me alerts 3 times while driving in and out of my garage is not alerting to the activity zone. However is alerting to almost every car that drives out of the zone either on people alert only or alert to all movement . I see no difference it keeps missing the important area and alerting to the area I don‚Äôt want .Updated 5/22/21 switched cameras to see if that particular camera was defective and the next one is still missing amazon drivers walking inside my activity zone but alerts to lots and lots of vehicle way far out and away from my activity zone .Eufy needs to work on this issue missing people walking in my property is a BIG deal! I will try another brand half the price and update here so buyers are informed.June 9, 2121 I contacted Eufy and a representative reviewed my videos he or she told me how to fix the problem, for some reason the cameras trigger alerts when they have an obstacle to close to them so I installed longer arms to 3 of them and placed the fourth one in a different position and guess what... Not a single false alert!!! Unbelievable, I even had to apologize to the representative because I tough the recommendation made no sense but it worked. As for the other brand it worked almost the same way buy did not record as long as Eufy so not only I am staying with Eufy but I am buying more of their new products that will be available this year.
review_text_4: Updated:After two calls to text support and a very helpful neighbor, we got the home base set up. Once that hurdle was cleared the rest was easy. The cameras were fast to set up and I encountered no issues. I will say the setup voice could be less loud and more conversational, but not a dealbreaker. I was hoping for a bit more movement to the mounts. I didn‚Äôt get as much clearance from the house, so I‚Äôll probably have to move a few cameras later.The real win here is HomeKit support. It took some time and exploration as you have to do it on each camera, but adding them to our home was fast and easy. Much happier with this setup over our old Arlo cameras.I will say I made a very smart purchase on getting solar panels for each camera. I placed them at 90% and they quickly went to 100%. No need to worry about changing batteries ever again!Original post: What good is a device if you can‚Äôt set it up?I‚Äôm replacing our existing Arlo setup with Eufy for HomeKit support. Got the device and went to set it up today. I‚Äôve tried for about an hour to set it up, but I can only get as far as naming the homebase 2 before it tells me it can‚Äôt be named and it can‚Äôt check for firmware.Ugh.So I call support and we cycle the router, restart the Wi-Fi (standard) and we still can‚Äôt get it to work. So he tells me to wait until later as it could be an issue on their end. Even offered to replace the homebase, but he can‚Äôt guarantee that one won‚Äôt work.The guy was nice. Very helpful. But on Black Friday, this needs to work. I can‚Äôt even troubleshoot the problem and all I know is that it‚Äôs not my setup as the dozen other smart devices are working just fine.So, how useful is a system that you can‚Äôt set up? Not useful at all. I‚Äôll give it a few hours, but as first impressions go, this is a bad one.
review_text_5: I‚Äôve been looking for a wireless security camera system but have been hesitant because most require a monthly subscription. I came across this product and am very happy so far. Clear video, easy to use app and no monthly fees!One of my cameras has had sub par battery life. I just contacted Alexandra from eufy support. She initially was going to send me a replacement camera but since I‚Äôm in Hawaii, it was easier to credit my card the cost for one and I order it from Amazon directly. Excellent customer service!

review_text_2: I spent weeks researching NVR home surveillance systems, including several visits to Home Depot. After reading many reviews, I knew I did not want the yuppie consumer brands - I wanted a real surveillance system, based solely on technical specifications and durability. I finally developed my requirements: wireless, NVR with monitor, 2TB hard-drive local storage, 1080p or better, 8 channel, two-way audio, quality phone app, powered (not battery), H.265 compression, motion detection, PIR cameras, night vision, IP67 weatherproof / pre-paired cameras for easy setup.After setting the bar so high, I landed on the Yeskamo product. Still, I expected problems -- there always with this kind of project. But to my utter amazement, everything went off very smoothly and perfectly. I mounted the cameras, got power to each spot, setup the NVR monitor, and then the first time I turned it on, everything worked. Every camera synchronized to the NVR without a hitch. The user manual, and on-screen navigation, were very intuitive and easy to understand. I was done learning and configuring in less than an hour.For your reference, I live in a 3200 sqft brick house. All cameras are outside on first floor and the NVR is inside, middle of house, second floor. That means the longest signal length is about 60 feet through brick, floor/ceiling, and 2-4 interior walls. I had no problems whatsoever ‚Äì signal strength and visual accuracy, were perfect right from the start. Lastly, I setup the iphone app, and again expected hassles. But again there were none ‚Äì the app setup was as easy as they get, then I put in my system ID, and had visual on my phone in less than 10 minutes. Local storage is great, the floodlights are just the right intensity to not be overwhelming, and the switch from night-vision to color floodlight recordings is very cool.Lastly, I work in IT and I am never impressed with technology products ‚Äì I never write reviews. However, this time, I felt it was important to tell you all ‚Äì there are some products out there that live up to their promise, and Yeskamo has been that for me. I have been so happy with this product and the installation experience that I am already expanding to 8 cameras. One done, 3 more to go, again everything was super smooth. In the end, I would recommend this product to anyone.
review_text_3: We bought these security cameras to protect our home from any intruders when we‚Äôre out or during the night. The cameras and monitor are really impressive. The monitor looks very modern and simple.¬†It also have a HDMI port for even possible to an external monitor.¬†The¬†cameras¬†are great quality builds and have excellent, clear picture quality, even at night (with or without the floodlights on).¬†The 6 leds¬†on the cameras makes a big difference to viewing in the evening, this is only enhanced even more with the floodlight is triggered, it creates a good quality of light and in turn great picture.¬†This kit is a complete set up with everything needed to set up and get going in less than an hour including mounting the cameras outside the home.¬†Connecting the cameras to the monitor is easy and once connection is recognised the system is up and running.¬†The signal between cameras and monitor is strong and reliable even with a fair distance between them.¬†And the phone app works really great. I really like that I can talk to the people in the video and that they can respond too. The system supports up to 8 cameras, which is great and I am planning to get extra 4 more cameras from YESKAMO soon.The package¬†also¬†comes with a detailed user manual which is perfect for me, because I don't really know much about computers, never mind setting up a security system! Overall, this is a fantastic product and I would recommend.
review_text_4: I‚Äôve had this camera system for 5 months now and I‚Äôve been wanting to write a review and always got side tracked on other things. So, better late then never.The NVR is an eight-channel system and is supplied with four cameras. That leaves room for four more cameras in the future. The cameras are 1080P and deliver such a magnificent and crisp view in the recordings.This is one of the few systems that offers an All-In-One design. Having the monitor attached to the NVR makes for a clean looking installation. The NVR can be placed anywhere in the house and look good. The cameras each have a warning siren and spotlights that can selected to use. I prefer not to have an audible alarm with motion (cats do set these off) but when the system is armed I want any notifications sent to me.The camera spot lights work as they should. As I leave the house and head to the driveway spot lights are coming on and following me on the way. One neighbor noticed it and make a comment about how nice it must be to have motion lights setup like that. He didn‚Äôt even suspect they were security cameras with spotlights and I didn‚Äôt tell him any different. The HD black and white night vision is truly clear, and the HD Color day images are just fantastic. The motion detection is easily setup and alerts come fast to our phones.The camera system was a breeze to setup. Turn on the NVR, start powering up the cameras, and since every camera was already paired to the NVR I immediately started getting video displayed. I set everything up inside the house first so the NVR and camera were handy to make changes. I experimented with several of the options offered and finally decided how they would be setup outside.Mounting the cameras went quick, anchors and screws were supplied with each camera. When I ordered the system I also ordered a couple of power extension cables because a couple of cameras weren‚Äôt going to be close to an outlet. I already had the app working on my phone from playing with the cameras inside the house so as we mounted each one I could monitor it on my phone to nail down exactly where to point them, and get them level.I made a list of pros and cons to try to cover all facets entirely. I hope this helps someone to make an informed camera decision and, in my opinion, Yeskamo should be strongly considered.Pros:1. Simple and fast setup. Any question I had about using the NVR software was answered the next day. I asked them several questions at once as I went through the menu‚Äôs and had large emails full of questions that I would send and they would always send me a quick reply and answer each item on my list. I am quite happy with the service I received and rate it second to none.2. The cameras have metal casings instead of plastic. Feels like a well-engineered and manufactured product. Lately we are now having 90+ days and earlier we had the winter freeze. These cameras have operated flawlessly and they have not skipped a beat at all.3. Fast motion alerts to our phones. The alerts show up within seconds to each of our phones. I know this is some what of an issue with many other brands. Poor to no alerts with others, but we have had good reliable alerts with Yeskamo. I have the alerts from the cameras setup with a special notification ring tone so we know when an alert is coming from our security system so it doesn't get ignored like many other notifications do.4. The PC software for WIN 10 installed nicely and works well with the NVR. Just to note, this system does not require an Internet connection to work. The Internet connection is only required for off site monitoring. We have it setup this way and appreciate that we can take a look at our house anytime and anywhere we are (as long as we have an internet connection). Either way, the NVR stores all for us to review locally when back at home.5. Before purchasing I contacted Yeskamo to have the manuals and data sheets sent to me so I could get a look at the documentation they supplied. They answered my email within a day and sent the requested documents immediately. I thought that was very respectable of Yeskamo. They offered their help with any more information I needed or any questions I might have before committing to a purchase.6. If I could rate their customer support on its own it would have to be 10 out 10. They were there to answer my questions before and after buying their product. I had no previous experience with security cameras so I asked about every little thing I didn‚Äôt know (which was plenty) but everything was answered plainly for me. Many times examples were sent to better explain the options / settings I was inquiring about.7. The supplied 2TB hard drive records all 4 cameras 24/7 for about 50 days. Plenty of time to go back and view an event that happened in the past. We have done this too many times to mention.8. In an ordinary setup each camera connects directly to the NVR. In some setups a camera might be too far to connect well to the NVR directly so with Yeskamo it can be connected through a camera that have a good connection back to the NVR. I did not need to use this; all of my cameras have good signal strength to the NVR. Just wanted to mention it if others are having trouble with a camera or two. Yeskamo also sends a strong antenna to use on a camera in place of the one installed on the camera. It allows the antenna to be mounted away from the camera. I did not need this either, but I am sure many people will appreciate having this suppled with the kit.Con:1. OK, I had a camera problem. Had the IR Led‚Äôs on a camera not turning on when the camera switch into night mode. Contacted support and they had a camera shipped right away as a replacement. Yeskamo support is in China but they have a warehouse facility in California and cameras are stocked there. So, the replacement camera was sent priority from California and I received it like two days later. Believe me, when you have a failure in your security system you need a company that responds quickly to resolve it.2. The speaker/microphone works best when the other person is in close proximity of the camera, otherwise don‚Äôt plan to use this for communication. Not a deal breaker for me since my cameras are mounted quite a ways from the entry they are monitoring so the 2-way communication didn‚Äôt work.3. The connectors are located on the bottom of the NVR so not easy to get to. For the USB port that I use to connect my jump drive for saving video clips I added a small 4 port USB breakout box ($3). This way I can leave it connected to the USB port on the NVR all the time and when I need to connect a jump drive for backups / file saving I easily plug into the USB breakout box instead of trying to get to the NVR USB port under it. Also, the HDMI connector is very tight on the bottom. I use the HDMI output from the NVR to display on a large screen TV located close to the NVR. The connector and jacket on my HDMI cable was just too long to bend it to fit under the NVR without force so I bought a couple of HDMI right angle connectors (about $4) that came with 90¬∫ and 270¬∫ angled connectors to be sure the right one is provided. Now my HDMI cable is installed without any force on it or the HDMI connector on the NVR.Overall: This has been a learning curve for me, and I can say I understand a system setup far more than I ever thought I would. Yeskamo has been a partner with me in this journey and I extremely thank them for their help and support.One more thing, a little careful planning up front will save you a lot of grief later. I had mine so messed up I just started over once. But the second time I had a better plan and knew what I wanted to do better than the first time. There is a Restore Factory settings but use it wisely.
review_text_5: I purchased this security system almost a year ago and let me tell you althought I bumped into a few problems, I don't regret my purchase and would not only purchase again but will recommend 100 % to others looking for a complete security system at such affordable price.Pros: First off I'd like to tell people that I live in Puerto Rico and makes it difficult to obtain warranty from alot of companies because of the fact that we are thought of as overseas when we are actually US territory but the Yeskamo authorized seller made sure on various occasions that my issues or concerns were taking care of fully. So know that you are going to ne well taking care of by this seller. They have the best customer service! Moving foward to the system let me tell you that I love it. Once you get a hang of how everything works its easy and if you ever bump into a question contact support and it will be addressed fast. I love the fact that you get a complete system. 4 camaras, monitor, antennas, cables, hardware, all you need to get your home or business protected wireless. The monitor will have to be connected to lan and power and ofcoarse camaras need power also but the monitor and camaras connect wirelessly. What I love most is the floodlights going on at night when it detects motion and the siren it emits to scare off intruders or animals. I get to see movements around my house 24/7 on monitor and cel phone. Not to mention it comes with enough memory to hold off atleast 2 weeks before it resets.Cons: Although you can speak through camaras on cellphone, you can hear person in front of camara clearly but you can't hear person load enough thats on other end. Voice dont sound loud and clear emitting from camara. But thos feature for me is no big deal just part of the extras. 1 camara out of 4 didnt hold rain and it went blurry for months when I decided to contact customer service for repair and it got replaced with a new one without hassle of returning old one. 2 of my camaras kept loosing signal and I got sent partial refund to buy signal boosters.And thats all. The cons are no big deal due to the excellent customer service this company has and trust me when I tell you, they have your back fully 100% no matter what the issue is they always find the best resolution. So don't overthink and submit your purchase now!! I promise you wont regret it =)

review_header_2: Incredible day and night vision and customer service
review_header_5: Works well. Great video quality. Easy to setup.
review_text_1: I bought this system a couple months ago. I originally bought two other systems that arrived with problems, and I had to send them back for a refund. After doing a little more research, I bought this system for my small business. I unpacked the unit and tested it out at home before taking it to the business for installation. Before installation, I chose to purchase a new wifi router, which was quite an upgrade from what was already there, installed wifi extenders where the wifi signals were weak and tested the system and all cameras to be sure everything was working properly and recording. Once I was comfortable with the system, setting it up and installing it in the business was easy. The unit is installed on the second floor, and the cameras on the first floor, all the way to the back of the building, still work with no issues. I did not have to use the extended antennas that came in the box. I did have some questions for the company. The phone number and email are posted here at the bottom of the product description on Amazon, so finding contact information is easy. I chose to email the company, and within 24 hours or less I received a response. I needed assistance getting the system to display on a computer screen. Tech support sent a link to download the software along with instructions on how to set it up. I clicked on the link, downloaded the software, followed the install instructions, and all cameras popped up on our computer screen. The 3TB hard drive gives my business 30 days of recording, which is better than we expected. We have all 8 cameras set to record continuously 24/7. This is a great buy for the money.
review_text_2: I have been in the alarm industry for over 40 years but getting your company to install cameras (even at cost) is ridiculously expensive. I purchased these cameras just prior to our completing a remodel on our home and just started the installation. It was incredibly easy with essentially just plug and play set up. The pictures during the day (and night) are crystal clear and playback is extremely simple. The best issue is that I had some issues with the distance for the wireless reaching and have had incredibly quick response to each and every request for assistance. The system is simple but when there is an issue is is nice to have instant responses to your inquires for help. 5 star customer service and five star system. Really user friendly at all levels and I would recommend to anyone!
review_text_3: I ordered the security system February 1, 2019 but just installed in on April 13th. The system is a Hiseeu with 8 1080P cameras and a 3TB hard drive. The system worked flawlessly right of the box. The video is sharp with great color The night time vision of these cameras is fantastic. This is a very nice system at a good p;rice. I had one question that was answered via email very promptly. If you are looking for a great system at a great price I would highly recommend this one.Jim Davis
review_text_4: Very easy to get up and running. True plug and play, QR code came up on monitor to download the phone app and had it up and running within ,,five minutes of unboxing the unit. Very impressed with nite vision in complete darkness. Its alot better picture quality than other systems iv had. I do have a brick house and having trouble with one of my cameras having a weak signal so sometimes i can see that image.
review_text_5: Good things:1. It's easy to set up. Plug in the power and it works well.2. Easy to connect with Internet and your phone. Fast. Connection is stable.3. Video quality is good.4. Tech support is good. My questions was answered on-time.Bad things:1. sometimes, it delays a little bit. But not a huge issue.2. The range will be affected by walls. But this is normal with wireless system. You may need to my some wireless signal extension device.
