name: ZOSI Home Security Camera System with Audio ,5MP Lite 8 Channel H.265+ CCTV DVR with 2TB Hard Drive,8pcs 1920TVL Indoor Outdoor Surveillance Cameras,120ft Night Vision,Motion Alerts,for 24/7 Recording
review_header_1: Great system for the price - please read
review_header_2: Here is the home security system for you.
review_text_1: I got the Zosi 8-channel 1080p camera system with 2TB DVR. Given the affordable price, I considered this system to be entry level, but likely good enough for surveilling my home. I was right; I‚Äôve had it installed for a few weeks now and I am satisfied with it.I did not want a wifi camera system so I bought this hard-wired system. Wires are more reliable and I don‚Äôt need 8 or 9 more devices on my wifi router. I bench-tested every camera and wire before permanently installing anything. The cameras work well. The resolution is good but since the lens has a very wide angle, the corners of the image are less sharp than the center. But this is acceptable to me because the wide lens covers a lot of area.The BNC cables work acceptably, but I found that 65 feet was not long enough. To get to the four corners of my home‚Äôs exterior (3200 sq ft), I needed to purchase some other-brand 100-ft and 150-ft cables. I found that both the Zosi and the aftermarket cables are susceptible to visible feedback in the images, especially when the wires are bent near the connectors. I got them all to work acceptably, but you get what you pay for.The DVR I initially received was easy to set up and worked well, except that it would reboot itself every couple of hours. Zosi customer service helped me address it and eventually shipped me a new DVR unit at no cost. This has solved the problem. They are helpful and responsive, but they are located in China so emails generally have a 1-day turnaround time. Reviewing recorded footage works but it is not intuitive. There are a lot of unmarked icons to figure out. But it works.The app works but it is a little clunky. Each time I open it when away from the home wifi, I have to tell it to connect to the cameras. At first the app couldn‚Äôt see the cameras away from home. Zosi had to help me tweak settings on the DVR and my router (like disabling the firewall!) to get it to work. It does work reliably now. Again, you get what you pay for.There is also a desktop application for viewing the cameras, but you can only load it via the supplied mini-CD (what is this, 1999?) and it only shows the footage in low resolution. But it works.Overall, for the price I am happy with this system. I can view my house at home live on my TV, away from home on my phone, or later via playback. A high-end professional system would have cost several thousand dollars. This system meets my needs and could be used by any homeowner or small business.
review_text_2: The I purchased this system, was someone broke into my son's new/used car 2 weeks after he bought it, stealing over $500 in electronics; GPS, Radar Detector, and Dash Camera, add in the cost to replace the broken window, and it's a no brainier to figure out I need a camera DVR.First off the instructions to place the DVR on the Internet are nonexistent, however, a duckduckgo.com search will return more then enought help for you. The short answer is you have to open port (37777) on your firewall to allow the DVR to be seen via your cellphone or remote PC. The DVR presets allow for recording out of the box, and its internet settings are set to DHCP by default, so networking is pretty simple, its dealing with your Cable Modem or DSL modem that's hard; more on that later.The camera's have a nice clean, clear picture, and during low light automatically turn on the IR LEDs and the camera switches to Black and White mode; there isn't anyway to see other then B/W using IR illumination, that's just the way the world is. If you try and use a camera at night pointing outside through a window, the IR LEDs will cause the window to act like a mirror and you won't see anything.The cables that come with the unit are 18.3 meters or 60 feet for the rest of us in the free world. They sell additional cables at a very inexpensive price, so there's no need to make your own. The ends on the cables prevent you from plugging into the cameras wrong, so even with the addition of extra cables it's a simple installation; you will have to buy some female to female BNC barrels to use with the extensions.There's a selection under "Networking" that is labeled "WiFi", however, it only works with a WiFi USB adapter sold buy some other vendor. There's 2 USB ports on the back of the DVR, the top port is marked "USB 2.0", I assume for a thumb drive for backing up recorded data, and the bottom is is labeled "USB Mouse", which was included; the optical mouse worked in both ports, so I'm thinking the DVR doesn't support a Keyboard. There is very little need for a keyboard since all the information to be entered is easily accomplished via a mouse and the only time I wanted a keyboard was to enter in the password.There's a setting for allowing the DVR to obtain time off the internet using NTP, however, I still had to manually set the time the very first time, there's support for DST, however, you have to tell the DVR which days to start and stop DST.Power for the DVR comes from a small wall wart, however, there are terminal connections to allow for the use of 2 wires to supply power, the cameras are supplied from a separate power supply, one power supply can support 8 cameras, and an octopus cable is supplied for this.Another nice design feature ZOSI did, was adding a slot in the side of the bottom bracket of the camera. The slot is to allow the cables to be run outside of the mounting plate in the case you're not able to drill a hole behind the mounting plate. If you do drill a hole behind the mounting plate, all your wires will be hidden from view and you'll have a very clean installation.I used the HDMI connection to connect to my TV for use as a display, there's also a VGA port that could be used, however, at the cost of HDMI TV's it's probably the connection most users will use. The display allows you to see up to 9 cameras at once realtime, and double clicking on any one picture will expand it to full screen. I only own a 740p TV, however the cameras output 1080p to it without any problem.Getting on to the internet : after reading the online documentation for getting the DVR to be seen from a device on the internet I found that I had to add a Port Forwarding rule to allow port 37777 to the DVR. This will require you to hard code an IP address into the DVR, which is very easy, its figuring out how to add the Port Forwarding to your DSL/Cable modem that may give you problems. If your modem supports adding a DMZ, you could also add the DVR to the DMZ and not bother with Port Forwarding. Each modem is different so once again duckduckgo.com may be need to find help on this. You'll need to remember to turn WiFi off on your cellphone when trying to test the remote viewing application, since when your cellphone is on the same network as the DVR the firewall rules don't apply.The Android ZOSI viewing application isn't as easy to navigate as I'd expect, I don't own an iPhone so I can't speak to that application. One thing I DID NOT like about the ZOSI's Android application, is it requires you to give it an unreasonable amount of access to your phone's resources; why do they need access to your camera, contacts, and a host of other items? ZOSI, fix this, or at least explain why you need all of this access. The remote display is downgraded to prevent over use of your network data plan on your cell phone, I've played with it a bit, however, I can't say if this is a setting that can be changed. I did figure out that you can remotely capture video from a camera onto your cell phone, and also play back video as well.As I learn more about the system I may post more.I've yet to try and add a WiFi camera to the system, as I still have to install all 8 cameras, but I'll try that next and post the results.
review_text_3: Let me start with saying I went with the 8channel 2T package, and not only is this better than Swann, Blink XT2 and Ring.... But it‚Äôs a fraction of the price!! (I‚Äôve never tried any other companies besides those 3) but I was just like you if your reading this comment right now, and it didn‚Äôt seem there was enough information in the description or you weren‚Äôt sure if this is worth the money because it‚Äôs reasonably priced. I personally took 5 minutes of my time to type this specifically for you to know if your in the market for home security or security for you shop or business, then look no further because this is your best bang for you buck. Plug and play system that isn‚Äôt complicated, full accessibility to each cameras settings such as color, tint, zoom. When you hook the system up it will automatically be in motion detection mode, so anytime there is movement on any camera the system will save that file to your DVR, or You can change it to record 24hrs-7days a week and depending on what size hard drive you get let‚Äôs say that it only holds 1 month of recordings so 30days (each day 24hrs) on the 31st day the dvr will automatically rewrite over day 1 (or the oldest day etc) you can schedule recordings, save recordings and IF YOU HAVE INTERNET at you home you can download the app and be able to see your cameras on your phone, pc, or tablet. Hopefully this helped you decide
review_text_4: We had a Zmodo 8CH HDMI 960H DVR 700TVL Outdoor Indoor Day Night IR-CUT CCTV previously that we purchased in early 2016 and we have since moved and decided to upgrade to newer technology. We had replaced that system with the ZOSI 8 Channel 720P 1080N HD-TVI Security DVR Recorder HD Hybrid Capability 4-in-1 after a lightning strike took out the Zmodo DVR in 2018. The system is very easy to setup and the quality of the product feels better than the previous version as well. The cameras are more sturdy and the quality of the image both day and night are far superior. The motion detection is much better as well. My old unit would have so many different colors on the playback that I didn‚Äôt know what was detected. The app integration is much better than the other system as well. All in all, it‚Äôs a superior upgrade from the old one.
review_text_5: Bought this HD system to replace an older VGA system. It is a great deal! Everything works as advertised. The camera quality is very good in daylight and nightlight. Video image is very clear even after upconverting on a UHD TV. The wider viewing angle is also very good as two cameras can cover 180 degree compared to the old system that required three cameras. Very happy with this purchase and would recommend this product for those looking for a system at this price point.There was a glitch with the first DVR received as it would alarm a failure once every 4-6 days and would try to restart failing to see the hard drive. It was a problem with the motherboard in the DVR and ZOSI promptly replaced the DVR within a few days. Everything has been working very well since the replacement.Update Nov 2019: Discovered recently that the DVR would crash everytime trying to back up a video file. Contacted Zosi and after a series of trouble shooting efforts with "Coco", it was determined that the DVR itself was causing the problem. Coco promptly sent a new replacement DVR and the problem was resolved. Again, great support from Zosi!

H.265+ can further improve compression ratio on the basis of H.265 standard and save about 80% storage compared with H.264, and thus effectively saving storage resources and provides an excellent and smooth viewing experience.,(2). review_header_1: Amazing Customer Service Experience ‚Äì BEST EVER !
review_header_3: Great Quality, Easy Installation and Excellent Support Team
review_header_5: ZOSI surveillance system is worth every penny
review_text_1: We ordered this system on September 10, 2019 and it arrived with 2 days, no issues. However, we got very busy, the holidays came upon us, and we didn‚Äôt even open the box until the beginning of January of 2020 to start installing these. We began by hooking up a couple of the cameras which was easy, and the instructions were clear. Everything was excellent with the cameras, setup, etc. Great quality, the features on the camera were good, everything was fantastic. Except for one thing‚Ä¶ the cameras had a ‚Äúnormal‚Äù field of view and we realized we really needed a ‚Äúwide-angle‚Äù field of view. Don‚Äôt‚Äô get me wrong, this set of cameras provides a good field of view, but we really need to see a much broader angle for our purposes.We emailed Zosi and explained our situation, even though it had been almost 3 months since our purchase. Their response was nothing short of amazing. They asked us to send some photos of what type of wide-angle we needed, etc. I explained we had not installed the cameras, we had just opened two of them to try them out. They then suggested we purchase a different ‚Äúwide-angle‚Äù system, which was literally only $30 more. They accepted back our return and then shipped out the new system. It was perfect.From the very first time we emailed them asking for help and support, they were in constant communication. They respond to emails within half a day EVERY TIME. This was simply one of the best customer service experiences we have had with an organization. It was absolutely apparent they wanted us to be comfortable and happy with their product, and to make sure it suited our needs.I highly recommend reaching out to Zosi with any questions you might have prior to your purchase. But let me tell you, they have your back. I would purchase their products without hesitation. You‚Äôre in good hands with Zosi.
review_text_2: I replaced my 3yr old system with this one after lightning took it out. It is very good quality. Everything came nicely packaged clearly new. Daytime video is awsume compared to my old system. Night vision is very good to. I did my research and decided to buy this system. Glad I did. Bought the WD Purple 1 tb hard disc and installed no problems. Very easy. Used screws from my old system hard drive. Not sure what I've done if didn't have um. Didn't see with new HD or new DVR. Maybe just didn't see them. Don't know. Anyway DVR is quite dispite other reviews of being a noisy fan. This is a good quality system with lots of features. I have not tryed remote view and probably won't so I can't comment on that. For a low cost system it really delivered. With that said.... Your not going to read licence plates in the street especially at night. You'll need to spend thousands for that. I recommend this for low cost piece of mind and as a deturant. I'd be glad to answer any questions. Update: 10 months later still working now.
review_text_4: The picture is fine I'm trying to figure out how to allow it to record the sound from that Jack on the back and I'm not able to get it to record or play sound for me I tested the microphone it works good I need to open up that audio in input on the back in the menu apparently but I can't find the spot to do it
review_text_5: What I like about the system is it cost the ease of installation and product support\ customer service.What I don't like about the product is that it only recordes 8 channels out of 16 that is something to slip through my cracks and for system that Large it didn't come with a hard drive.

review_header_1: 5 stars for now but becoming questionable.
review_header_4: Great Camera and Awesome Customer Service.
review_text_1: UPDATE: Zosi has been in touch and they are really nice. We have a defective HDMI port so they are sending a new DVR!!! Talk about great service!!!! Right now it will stay a 5 star.I‚Äôm giving it five stars right now, but we are now having issues with the system. I think we might have gotten a faulty system, but tech-support is working on it. This screen comes up pink and green when we turn on the TV to view the cameras.When we first started it up it was perfect absolutely perfect the cameras were beautiful crystal clear, needed just a little tweaking. But after a couple of days when we turn the TV on to view the cameras the picture is pink and green. Tech-support hopefully is on it and will let us know what‚Äôs wrong. I will update as time goes on
review_text_2: The camera system took a little more time to get to me than preferred but overall i am now very happy with my purchase. I‚Äôm an electrician that has installed hundreds of cameras over the past 15 years and I can say I‚Äôm impressed with the overall quality of the system. The cameras are by no means cheap, they have crystal clear images during day and clear images in night mode. The cameras themselves are durable and easy to install. The dvr works great. The only downside I see to system is that all cables are 100 foot long, as long as you know how to install your own camera wire you will be fine. I give this product overall a 5 star rating
review_text_3: Bought this to replace a 5-year-old system that started to die one piece at a time. This cost less than the old one and is much better quality. The video is clear and the system is easy to use. The instructions can be a bit confusing but take your time and you will get it done. I never needed to call Tech support.
review_text_4: The Customer Service was excellent I spoke with Jeremy and he helped me every step of the way and I am not used to a windows computer and took me a while to figure it out! He was so patient and we made a team and the system is working great the pictures are clear and plenty of cameras! I am very happy with the service especially! Thank you Jeremy!
review_text_5: This is a very good system. It records 24/7 with motion detection at the same time. The settings takes a little time to get use to though. You will need a 2gb hard drive for every 4 cameras attached to the system. The remote view is very good, it allows you to playback, record, live view, and take a snapshot with zoom capabilities. The customer support is very good too, they answered me (Everytime) I had a question or needed something. That is awesome by itself. This money well spent.

review_header_4: Great quality and customer service Thank you Emma!!!
review_header_5: Perfect wires.  NO adapter needed. Very dark at night.  Daytime is not brght
review_text_1: Got the cameras today and installed them. Wow, what a difference new cameras make. I'm looking at some teenagers walking by, now. These cameras are in "night mode" right now. The best picture I've ever had with cameras! These have LED's also. They are 100% brighter then the "old school" lights that I had on my old cameras. I had no problem installing them, but I have installed a few cameras over the years. These are a real upgrade from what I had. I think I will order a couple more and switch out my other cameras as well.You can really tell these are 1080p HD cameras too. I wasn't to sure of this brand, I have always purchased -Sw-nn- brand in the past. These will be my new go to cameras and what ever else I might need to upgrade my system in the future. Also, I might add, that the shipping was super fast too. One of my old cameras was out completely, and one had the night vision out. So, it was nice to receive these quickly. I hope these new cameras hold up as long as my old did. I think they will, though. You can see the quality and how they have improved over the years. I already have a DVR so I didn't need a whole system. I just purchased two cameras and linked them to my existing DVR. They cameras are plug and play with my current system. One last thing. Thank you again for the quality cameras and fast shipping.
review_text_2: I bought one of the dome style and liked it enough to buy two more domes and two bullet style. They record good quality but you need a recorder that can use that quality. You will only get the resolution your recorder can handle.You will probably have to go through the settings to get the best results, especially at night. One problem I had was the IR LEDs reflected off a white surface and completely washed out the video. I was able to paint the surface dark and ended up with excellent video. If you don't get good results at first, play with the settings and look for other problems like light sources and reflective surface. These are good cameras and one of the good things is the ability to make adjustments.
review_text_3: I have Cobra Surveillance System that came with 4 cameras. It also has room for 4 more. The store where I bought it was offering additional cameras @ $40 each. Instead I ordered two of these and bought two hundred foot cables also. Total bill $35 as opposed to $80. Cameras picture is a bit better than the original cams as well. Winner, winner.
review_text_4: The cameras are well made and good quality. Make sure they work with your DVR before you order ( I didn‚Äôt and had to replace them) Zosi customer support realy rocks, special thanks to Emma, she went extra mile in making sure the cameras will work with my DVR and arranging replacement shipment immediately.Overall great product and support - will buy again and recommend to anyone!
review_text_5: I liked the fact that the wires were what I needed. I am not a computer or camera person. I have not seen the night vision, but seems like this is excellent. The day time is just a little dark, but at night it is very dark. Good for the price.

name: ZOSI Wireless Security Camera System,2K H.265+ 8CH CCTV NVR with 1TB Hard Drive,4pcs 1080P WiFi Surveillance Cameras Indoor Outdoor,Night Vision,Motion Detection,Remote Access,for Home 24-7 Recording
review_header_1: I like it! Works as advertised
review_header_2: I'm impressed with this System.  However one camera seems to be weak.
review_header_4: Excellent Customer Support is the first thing, very good camera system is the second.
review_header_5: Its precisely what you pay for its functional for a mid-range camera system
review_text_1: I bought the 4 channel with the 1 TB HDD. I'm the IT guy at a manufacturing facility and this was purchased to monitor our shipping system. Something simple, well designed, afordable and reliable that could monitor our shipping conveyors, gates, doors and boxes, etc. I purchased it in April of 2016 with very little expectations honestly and it has been solid since day one. Not one issue. The gentlemen that run our shipping dept. are all over 55 yrs old country folks who have little to no tech skills ingeneral and I was worried that this system would prove difficult to teach them how to operate. It was not. Indeed they've learned it well and have adapted nicely. If there is a hangup, thefts, or just odd behavior in general they've been able to revert back to the time frame and see for themselves. We've relied on it and it has delivered.The Shipping dept. is downstairs in a concrete, semi-well lit environment with 8 ft ceilings and this has had no problems with connecting to the cameras. The farthest reach is roughly 80 feet away. All wireless connected cameras. They're all indoors as well, so I have very little experience or information regarding the night vision capabilities.Initial setup was as simple as it could possibly be guys. I merely plugged in the DVR unit, a monitor and a supplied (albiet cheap) small little mouse and began to setup the basic settings (time zone, how I wanted it to record, motion vs. continuous, etc.). It is not on our network at all, so I have it set up as a locally controlled device only. I then plugged in the cameras one by one and they all connected fine. The IT Dept. is upstairs and I was even able to connect wirelessly through the floor. Trust me when I say that is a good test wirelessly. This building was built in 1892 and was built to withstand a nuclear war!! Literally ... there are 3 bomb shelters that were constructed in the 50's inside the facility. Should work nicely for your house. I assure you.I highly recommend it and am here now to purchase another for my house and one more for a friend of mine who has problems with thefts and is interested in this.Feel free to ask questions and I'll do my best to respond and assist as much as possible guys.
review_text_2: Received the 4 Camera System today. Amazon Prime is wonderful. I set up the entire System on a table in my office. I do recommend testing it before the cameras are installed in the final location. The instructions are written in very small print. I'm age 77, and small print is difficult for me. So, I enlarged all of the page with the aid of my Printer. I followed the directions on the first page. Luckily I had an Ethernet cable from my Router that was close enough to reach to the NVR. Also, my PC Monitor was easily connected to the NVR with the same cable from the PC. I plugged in the AC power for all four cameras. Then plugged in the AC power to the NVR. And just as the instructions stated, all four cameras displays appeared on the Monitor. They looked great. I was impressed. I continued follow the instructions in setting up my preferences with the use of the little mouse which came with the System. It was very easy to doNow, I just have to be concerned about the one camera which seems to be weaker and slower to connect.NOTICE: I will update this review, after I have installed the cameras. And hopefully that one camera will work better then.
review_text_3: Zosi is a great product and is very reliable. I would like to give one customer service personnel named Coco an outstanding rating. I had a problem adding a fifth camera which gave me tremendous problems. I contacted Customer service and Coco walked me through the process to get it working. Coco walked me through the process. She was very patient with me because and I am not a tech savvy person. After going through several processes, and sensing that I was frustrated, Coco tried one last attempt and decided that my DVR base needed to be replaced. at that point Coco had me to return the DVR base and shipped out a new one. Coco gets 10 stars from me as a Customer Service Representative, I am very impressed with her knowledge and ability to solve problems. Thank you Coco.
review_text_4: I bought the 4 camera version about 5 months ago. I wish now, I had went with the 8 camera version. And as you will read, their customer support is top notch which is one of the reasons I am now reviewing the unit... one of the camera I thought had failed but as their support was able to help with, in fact it did not and they easily helped get it back working again. I explain more a bit down this review.*NOTE for those wondering if you can hook the NVR wireless to your router, the answer is a yes and no. I had to place the NVR on the other end of the house from the router but did not want to run wiring... so I found a way to do it using wireless extenders which I will explain at the bottom of this review.Regardless, the quality of the camera's is outstanding especially at night. I have attached a video link of the camera catching a bear at dusk coming toward the house as the cameras switched into night vision mode.The reason I am writing the review now after 5 months however, is due to the customer support I got. One of the camera's suddenly failed... or so I thought. In reality, it turned out that I had to simply reset the addressing hardware ID code for that camera. It failed during a storm and my thought is a lightning strike may have just scrambled the brains a bit. BUT it was not until I contacted the company about a replacement camera that I learned the camera was probably fine.. They instructed me how to reset it and sure enough, it is back working perfectly. They were fast, courteous and knowledgeable. So I will definitely recommend this company and brand for those looking for a system.Finally, hooking this to your router. Sadly, the NVR does not allow you to directly do a wifi connection to your router. While the cameras all connect wireless to the NVR, the NVR itself has to be wired somehow to the router. In my case however, that would have meant running line the entire length of my house. Not something I wanted to do.So I thought about it a bit and then came up with a simple solution.. I bought one of those 'wireless extenders' you can simply plug into an outlet to extend wireless around your home. What many don't realize, is those extenders have BUILT IN network plugs! So while they are used to actually extend your wireless range, they can ALSO be used to plug in a WIRED DEVICE to give IT access to your router!So all I did was buy one of those, setup the extender to extend my wifi in my home, run a network cable from the NVR to the plug in the wifi extender and walla, my NVR is now connected to the router wirelessly because it is directly plugged into the extender via network cable.And it works perfectly.. In fact, I wanted to place one of my camera quite a distance from the house... but wireless range, especially for a video signal, is not very far. So what did I do? I bought a SECOND wireless extender, plugged that one into my workshop and then plugged camera 4 into the wireless extender via network cable and it now can be monitored through that connected wireless extender as well! Wireless extenders have a lot more power and range than the camera on its own. Probably double from my testing so this solution allowed me to place a camera where normally I would not be able to reach wirelessly on its own.As I started this review with, my only regret with this purchase... I should have bought the 8 camera version.. I really need it now as we moved into a larger home and a lot of land.. Wish the company would trade me up to the 8 camera from this 4 camera! ;-)
review_text_5: I've been using this Zosi camera system for a little over a year now here is my honest opinion of it.Pros:1) For the price the camera quality is fair during the day and at night the night-vision is even better2) Range on the wifi of the cameras isnt too good BUT if you have them wired no issues3) A few weeks ago one of the cameras stopped working after a bit of troubleshooting knew it was dead, I contacted Zosi support for assistance and after troubleshooting with them, they confirmed its dead and were kind enough to send me a replacementCons: 1) The motion detectors will pick anything and if you have email/alarm notifications it will go off every second well at least with my setup2) My hard-drive would get uncomfortably hot, simple fix for me was mounting 2x80mm fans.3) User interface is simple but could have done well with a few extra options and easier way to back up footage.overall its precisely what you pay for its functional for a mid-range camera system, would i recommend it, yes, and their support team gave me extra confident to their systems. Cathy was great help

name: ZOSI 8CH 2K+ (5MP) Super HD Security Cameras System,H.265+ 8-Channel 2K+(5MP) CCTV DVR Recorder with 2TB Hard Drive,8pcs 2K+ (5MP) Wired Indoor Outdoor CCTV Cameras with 100ft Long Night Vision
review_header_5: Good system and you can view your cameras from anywhere with their app.
review_text_1: I love this new system!I was on the hunt for a security camera system. After doing some research I decided I didn‚Äôt want to use a cloud based service that would cost me a monthly operating fee. I then looked at the big box stores, but I elected to try the ZOSI DVR wired camera system. Best value and cost by far.I installed the system without any problems. One could just hook it up and it automatically starts recording, or you can use many other useful features. My mom probably could have just plugged it in to record without any reading... if you want other features, some degree of technical abilities is needed.Points to know:1. I created a gmail account just for this and set security on my gmail to low so that the ZOSI dvr was able to use the outgoing mail server without any issues. I could then make settings on the DVR to email me alerts when motion is detected.2. I didn‚Äôt use a PC to program, but rather the included mouse. It‚Äôs easy. One can then look at a frame and select where in the frame to look for motion and set the sensitivity. This is useful if a frame has trees blowing and cars going by, but you only want an alert if a gate opens.3. I downloaded the ZOSI app for my iPhone and I initially couldn‚Äôt get it to work. I emailed their tech support and they were fast and helpful. The manual is not well written and the tech support by email required me to think a bit differently. I sent screen shots and they texted back, ‚ÄúPlease use zosi smart app on your phone, your DVR's network is okay,¬†And the e-mail issue, the smtp server is smtp.gmail.com¬†please refer to the below link‚Äù I was initially thinking... ‚Äúdon‚Äôt they see I did use the ZOSI app? But then I thought to look and there is more than one app... and there is one called, ‚ÄúZOSI smart‚Äù I had ZOSI view. So get the right one! And I quickly said to myself... that‚Äôs how I set up the email... but I wrote ‚Äúgoogle‚Äù and not ‚Äúgmail‚Äù. It was easy once I corrected my mistakes. Thank you ZOSI support.4. Lots of options for cameras and DVRs. I have a guest house and a front house. Small city lot, but still further than the 65‚Äô of run for the camera cable. I ended up buying 2 different ZOSI systems. Both are great. The cost is great. The app registers the devices and I can monitor from my iPhone.5. In trying to solve some email issues before contacting their support, I read some posts on setting up port forwarding on your router. Don‚Äôt worry... it wasn‚Äôt needed. This isn‚Äôt as complicated as I was thinking!So in the end, I was able to install 2 systems with 6 cameras and my property is covered! All for much cheaper than a monthly fee based service.
review_text_2: Great system for the price. 1080p cameras and a 1TB DVR for under $200 is pretty good. I have all 4 cameras recording at max resolution and it stores about 30days worth of video before it over writes. Easy installation too.I haven‚Äôt been able to get the email alerts to work. The user interface for the iPhone app could use some work. It will freeze sometimes or lock up my 6S phone. Not too often though. I also have the DVR connected to a HD monitor. The user interface is pretty good, it just takes some time to learn how to use all the features.The cameras work well and the night vision is good. If you are covering a large area I would recommend an additional IR flood light for at night.Update..... After about 1 year I had an issue where the DVR would not boot up. I contacted a person named Slina at ZOSI tech support via email and I received a response within a few hours. I was asked to try several things which didn't fix it. I was then asked to send the broken unit back and I received a warranty replacement in about 4 days.I was very impressed with the quick response, level of customer support and the ease of getting a replacement under warranty. My system is now working again and I am a happy customer!
review_text_3: Good set of cameras for Home security. Gives secured 360 view of my home. 30 day recording is a plus. Went with hard wired because wireless camera reception isnt as clear as hard wired. This system also allows me to view my property on my iphone as long as its hooked to the wifi router. Dont let these wack reviews stop you. If you take time to learn this system it can be beneficial. This system helped me stop some kids from hanging out in my yard when we weren‚Äôt home. When i showed the video to their mother, she laid into them like Madea.
review_text_4: I like the camera quality, it is clear and very easy to see a close up view. The main reason I like the Zosi is the customer service. I am not very knowledgeable as far as setting up the features, but all I have to do is contact the support people and they are on it. The company has helped me with a replacement when it crashed and when I could not remember the password they sent me the instructions that were really easy to follow and I got into my system. I would recommend this system to anyone.
review_text_5: Very light compared to my previous DVR. Also it is very quiet. Using a mouse to navigate the menu makes it very easy to use. Also the menus are very self explanatory and intuitive. I was able to use my old cameras with the system (saved the cameras the system came with for future use or replacement). The only draw back to doing this is that I do not get sound nor can I speak through the camera for my old cameras did not have this capability but I know that if I install the cameras that came with the kit I would have this capability. The quality of the cameras are plastic and feel a bit cheap when compared to my older ones that are forged metal. The recorder works very well and you can even use your app on your phone to review recordings.

review_header_3: Great cameras, but you MUST adjust the settings on OSD
review_header_4: Just go with these. They are great.
review_text_1: I own 13 of these and have them around the property. Some are the older model, some are the C289. They all work with Blue Iris except for the PTZ function with the new C289. I talking to blue iris to find out the setting that allows it. It used to be camtonk 264 would work, but there was a software update recently that wiped that. Waiting to hear back from them. All other other zosi's I have work great with it.The new zosi app is really bad. The old one was meh, this one is terrible, and don't even think about using the window's app they have for it. Ahhh, freezes more than it works.Blue Iris is the way to go with these. I've been using Zosi's for a couple of years. I've had to replace some power supplies, but that's about it. Power supplies for these are 10 bucks, and my problem was not using enough RTV to seal them. Though I used a good amount. Not sure how water got it, but grrr... I just bought a bunch of back up pwr supplies to be safe...rofl :PWhat more do you want for a $45 dollar camera?
review_text_2: The video is clean and clear, the colors are true. Okay, just like other posts the night vision doesn't work and I thaught it was my DVR recorder because it doesn't support smart mode, but after buying two more and accidentally turned on the internal OS system within the camera with its joystick. I was able to turn on the IR sensor and the night vision now works with my DVR.The derections is bad ( Caused me several weeks with out night vision). It shows to push the joystick left, right, up, down for the type of DVR you are using. Mine is up for D1, but the camera is set for smart mode as default. But old DVR's don't have it. Good news is that you can just push down for like 5 to 10 seconds on the joystick for the built-in camera OS system and turn on night vision for non-smart DVR's.Because the quality of their camera, I will be buying their 4k DVR system to future proof it. Mine is a 720p at the moment.
review_text_3: These camera work great and are better then the 1080p cameras that came with my Defender 1080p security system.If you install the cameras it will initially look like crap since the default settings are not optimal for using the cameras out of the box. You have to go through and adjust all of the settings on the on screen display. Once you make the correct adjustments, these cameras out perform the cameras that came with my 1080p Defender system.Very please with my purchase.
review_text_4: Finally after buying the 4 camera DVR system that didn't have 2 way audio, 2 other Zosi wireless rechargeable pod cams with 2 Way intercoms that have terrible range, I love these. Great range, clarity, no need for the DVR just an SD card, the cameras can pan manually or set up to automatically pan across a path, zoom, and have a very clear 2 way intercom.
review_text_5: I didn't know what to expect when I ordered these, they were so inexpensive, but I kinda thought they might be poor quality. Truth is, the picture is better than the ones that came with my system. Well worth the price! My only critical comment is that the night vision infrared LEDs give a spotlight effect making the scene brightly lit in the middle and darkish around the edges.

review_text_1: This video surveillance camera works great in sun or night scenes. You might not get DSLR quality video but you can make out figures okay. There is a joystick-control on the camera cable for setting the various parameters. Left-Right-Up-Down-Press in to Enter the OSD (On Screen Display). The Instruction Booklet indicates how long you must keep pressing(holding) the joystick. When you Press and Hold the Joystick "In", you will enter the OSD. You can then change all types of parameters. Parameters once changed will stay saved even when power is removed. You don't need to turn off power then turn on power to save the parameter(s). You will need a computer monitor or a television set with video inputs to see and use the OSD. The camera sun-shade should be even with the back of the camera as it will interfere with the captured image if the shade is too far forward. I liked this camera so much I purchased a second one.
review_text_2: Works with my security camera. Excellent camera. Pleased with night vision.Update: I experienced a failure on one of my six cameras. I contacted ZOSI and they worked with me via EMAIL providing me instructions on what tests to perform to isolate the problem. After performing these tests and reporting the findings back to ZOSI they determined the camera had failed and authorized replacement. I am quite pleased with their service and support.
review_text_3: Well I have 4 cameras total now. Started with two and now added. For the cameras they work great along with 8 ch dvr I purchased with the first two cameras. Set up is easy . This system works great for my needs not a high priced system and get same results. Anytime I need to I can look back on dvr recording. I would recommend
review_text_4: I have a Defender 8ch DVR that came with 4 cameras. I have decided to add some more cameras but the Defender brand ones were $75.00 a pop. I decided to take a chance on the zosi, and I am sure glad I did. It has an amazing picture with great color and the night mode is great as well. The instructions are straight forward on how to set the mode to work with your particular DVR. I wish I could give this thing more than 5 stars. I will definitely be purchasing more of these.
review_text_5: this camera is nice really good night picture clear as day work better then the one that came with the system worth the money
